reviews.review: Engaging Cape Town Tour. If you are considering travelling to Cape Town then Clive is the person to show you around. His knowledge of the history, culture, geology, politics and environment of Cape Town and South Africa is truly astounding. We spent two days with Clive exploring the city. Included in our tour was a trip up Table Mountain, a walk through the Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve, a visit to the Simons Town African Penguin Colony, a wander around the Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens and much more. My husbands love of photography was nurtured by Clive who knew exactly the right places to get the best shot. He is a genuinely lovely man with a great sense of humour and a passion for his country. We will most definitely return to Cape Town and will certainly be booking Clive again

The very best!. My husband and I spent parts of 3 days with Clive as our Cape Town -- and environs -- tour guide and we couldn't have been more pleased! Clive has tremendous local expertise making the best use of our time, by avoiding traffic jams and anticipating the weather on Table Mountain. His knowledge of his country's history, his insights into politics and his happy and outgoing disposition were impressive. He gets our highest marks!

Topped off our visit to Cape Town!. We spent 2 days with Clive and couldn't have been happier with our adventures! We only had a limited amount of time in Cape Town and had a lot we wanted to see so after reading great reviews about Clive I thought he would be the best way to see everything. I sent him an email with all the top priorities and he made it possible to see all of them within 2 days. He knows exactly where and when to go and is very relaxed and easy going. We couldn't have been happier. The first day he took us to Table mountain and a tour around Cape Town then we had a good lunch and met up with Godfrey who took us through the Langa Township. We enjoyed our tour of the city and couldn't have been more grateful for Godfrey' s tour of his hometown and how welcoming the children and people of Langa were. Our 2nd day we drove down through Chapman's Peak and went to Cape Point. We were able to see some great animals, took a gorgeous hike and enjoyed a great lunch at Harbor House. We ended the day watching the penguins and visiting Kirstenbosch. I couldn't have imagined doing all this without Clive, he was a great guide and we really enjoyed spending our time with him! The best way to see all of Cape Town is to hire Clive!

More than just siteseeing. We loved Cape Town but Clive made it even better with his flexible approach to helping us better understand the sites & more importantly current people & community thinking. He is fun to tour with so give him a go if you are due to visit Cape Town.Bill & Debbie JarmanPerth, Australia

Great guides to show round The Cape. Booked Clive for 3 days, he could only do one and arranged for Jarred for the other two. Both were excellent guides and put forward excellent tour itineries. They kept us entertained with facts and local stories. We would recommend their services to our friends.

Cape Town with an exceptional guide!. We had South African friends recommend Clive, could there be a better recommendation? Clive gave us the very best personal attention and was always pleasant, patient with our endless pictures, and so knowledgeable! He took us to all of Cape Town's famous sites and managed to do it so we encountered few tourists and tour busses. We visited top boutique wineries for tastings (Rust En Vrede, Uva Mira) which we had to ourselves. Had lunch with amazing views off the beaten path (Harbour House, Graff Estate in Stellenbosch), and hiked up Table Mountain on a less traveled path which avoided direct sun, wind and tourists! Clive's collegue Godfrey took us to visit the Langa township. He was like the mayor and known by everyone! We actually went inside some of the homes and saw first hand the harsh life that people have to endure, shared home brewed African beer, and even visited local schools where we could contribute food. An amazing experience! Clive tailors his tour so you get the best experience possible. He was always on time, had a comfortable SUV (with waters and snacks if needed) and he was a great person to get to know. I highly recommend him and Godfrey for a phenomenal experience!
Mr.. Clive was the best tour guide we could have asked for. You're in great hands with Clive, and he's a great person to sit down and talk with as well. Couldn't ask for a better guy

Our Amazing South African Adventure. When we arrived in the Cape Town airport, Clive was waiting for us (very late at night) to pick us up and take us to our hotel. He had an awesome and clean van that we would spend the next couple of days in, going from place to place with Clive narrating the whole way. He knew every answer and more to every silly question that we had! He took us to the top of table mountain, a wonderful lunch by the sea, Cape Point, Stellenbosch and MANY other amazing places! He is the BEST tour guide, hands down! If you are looking to have a memorial visit to Cape Town - CHOOSE CLIVE!

Unforgettable Cape Town & Cape Winelands Tour with a Superb Guide:Clive De Bruyne. Be sure to book Clive for your visit to Cape town. We were sooooo impressed! His historical knowledge of the city is so captivating as he travels through the streets and tells you all the information from beginning to end. He was so attentive to our whole family and made every outing a blast. We did a Tour of the City, Cable ride up Table Mt. for a magnificent 360 views!Then off to Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope & Cape Maclear and walked along trails near the edges with boulders and fantastic vistas! We ended up at Boulders Beach to see the penguins. Clive made all our excursions so smooth and entertaining. We also really loved seeing the Vineyards in Stellenbosh. It made for a relaxing and super fun day tasting delicious wines. Hope you have the pleasure of meeting Clive in Cape Town!

3 days with Clive in the Cape Town area. Cape Town was special because of the time we spent with Clive. So glad we added an extra day. We were especially impressed with how Clive asked us about our interest, then researched options for us and filled the days with surprises. Also important was keeping us safe, like telling us about the best/safest banks for ATM's and neiborhoods to avoid. Clive even introduced us to an artist on the rise where we met at her home and ended up buying a spectacular canvas.Clive st the base and expectations for the rest of our trip

Excellent family trip in and around the Cape!. We spent several days with Clive seeing the sights in and around Cape Town. Fantastic time. Interesting conversations regarding history, culture, economics, politics, etc. Highly recommend!

A brilliant day out with our fabulous tour guide - Clive. Since we were 2 british 'first timers' to the Cape we were recommended Clive as an excellent tour guide. He was better than that, he was informative, fun and really efficient. His goal was to make sure we saw the sights and enjoyed ourselves which we most certainly did. He provided us with memories that will last a long time! We went down to the Cape of Good hope where we enjoyed a short stroll around the coastal path to enjoy beautiful sea views and appreciate the lovely coast line at the tip of the cape. Following that we visited Boulders Beach and the wonderful penguins. It was great to see how they are being conserved and encouraged to breed whilst getting great views of them waddling into the sea and protecting their nests and babies. After that we had a superb lunch at the Harbour House restaurant overlooking the sea at Kalk Bay, with Clive who was good company. I then enjoyed a paddle in the sea whilst watching out for sharks. Time then to pop into another wonderful vineyard Steenberg to sample yet more wine.I can highly recommend a day or more spent with Clive being transported in the comfort of his Land Rover. Book him! You wont regret it.

2 great day tours. I booked two day tours with Clive from Cape Town Tour guide for my group of 10 English speaking adults. We booked a private wine lands tour and the tour to Cape of Good Hope.Both tours Clive picked us up in a great 16 seater air conditioned bus with guide and driver. The winelands tour was fabulous - as my group love their wines Clive selected 3 wineries that reflected a great range of wines - La Motte, Hidden Valley where Clive organised a fun private picnic lunch with our tasting and the amazing Rustenberg who specialise in superb red wines. We also had time to visit the beautiful town of Stellenbosch. Clive is a very informative guide with a great sense of humour - my group were very impressedThe next day we were off to the Cape of Good Hope which included stunning scenery and a great walk then off to Harbour House for a superb lunch. From here we modified our schedule and Clive reorganised the day to take us up Table Mountain. He was very accommodating to our needs.I would highly recommend Clive for any touring you need to do in Cape Town - he is very professional and knowledgable abut above all he makes the tours very enjoyable.Thanks Clive for the fabulous 2 days - Tony is still craving more Rustenberg Reserve!!

Cape Town and Garden Route. My husband and I just had a wonderful week in South Africa, thanks to the Cape Town Tour Guide Co. Clive and Godfrey provided better tours than we could have imagined! (Godfrey provided city and township tours, Clive took us on the Cape Peninsula and along the Garden Route.) We gave Clive our timeframe and examples of our interests, and he created the perfect trip for us. All of the sights, lodging and restaurants he planned were wonderful. They even managed to incorporate some unscheduled activities along the way as they got to know us better. You can tell that Clive was a teacher prior to this career, because he knew so much about the history, flora, fauna, and culture of the area, and happily answered any questions we had. Godfrey knew everyone in Cape Town and helped orient us to the city, local history and people. We appreciated Clive's and Godfrey's expertise, helpfulness and fun conversations. We did not have to worry about a thing, so we could just enjoy our vacation!

Wonderful experience. We spent almost a week with Clive. He is a terrific guide - knowledgeable, flexible, patient, and fun - and he helped make our time in Cape Town and surrounding areas (Hermanus, wine country, Cape Peninsula) a highlight of our South Africa trip.Touring with Clive, whether you are a first time or a repeat visitor to Cape Town, is highly recommended.

Father/Daughter Trip - perfect guide to make the trip even better. My father and i arrived to Cape Town as the second leg of our South African adventures. Having sought out Clive via the internet before our travels, we had discussed our overall travel plans from start to finish. He was excellent in his communication before our arrival, day of arrival and throughout our guiding experience. To note, he is extremely flexible and understanding of the types of activities we were interested in, catering it to fit our desires as well as our individual capabilities (i.e. hiking table top with a 65 yr old and 26 yr old). We had the best of every type of aspect from the hike, to the historical backgrounds, to the recommendation to drive on our own to the cape peninsula and explore towns along it and then wrapping up with a guided tour through the vineyards with one of the most exceptional lunches and views i have ever experienced.Clive catered to our interests with ease and his positive attitude made the entire experience even better. He has a casual attitude with humor and an extensive amount of knowledge that enables you to gain a deeper understanding of all of the places you visit. 100% across the board, would absolutely recommend and book again if i'm lucky enough to find myself there.Thanks, Clive!!

Cape Town and Beyond. Our family had a fantastic week with Clive. We covered Cape Town, the Cape Peninsula, Hermanus, Stellenbosch and the wine country. Clive was extremely pleasant, and very knowledgeable in all subjects - South African history, geography, politics, wine, etc. The trip was great fun, and very well organized. Would highly recommend.

Family Trip. Excellent tour guide. Our week with Clive included Cape Town, wine country, Cape of Good Hope south to Hermanus. Conversations on all topics; history, politics, language, wine, adventure, recreation, nature, food.....all very interesting, knowledgable, and fun. Days well planned. Highly recommended!

vacation of a lifetime. Clive is a wonderful tour guide he has a great personality and always made sure we were happy and enjoying our adventures. Clive always went above and beyond to make our trip very special. He was definitely a pleasure to be with
3 Couples. We have such a wonderful time with Clive and Godfrey. They took us all around Cape Town. showed us a wonderful time... Will use them again!

Week long tour. Clive is an excellent tour guide. Witty and fun and very knowledgable. He has always lived in this area and knows all the best places to visit and the best food available. He picked us up at the airport from London and kept us entertained until he took us back to the airport a week later to begin our safari in the bush. He took us to see penguins, wine tastings, champagne tasting, we spotted a whale even though it was supposed to be to early. We went Great White shark cage diving and then to Table Mountain and the ariel cable. Godfrey took over for the last couple days and took us around Cape Town, Cape of Good Hope, had authentic South African food with a local band (delicious) and into the inner city. It was a beautiful stay and would recommend these men to accompany anyone throughout Cape Town and the surrounding area. Thank you Clive and Godfrey!!!

Magical tour of Stellenbosch . I didn't think I'd return to South Africa in the space of 13 months, but Clive's tour introducing us to the Cape Town region last year played a central role.This time round, we explored Stellenbosch and just as our tour last year, it was utterly perfect. The tour was individualised and provided a wealth of insight into the region, visits to the best farms and a really unexpected surprise involving vintage cars.Clive's relaxed and friendly manner, the flexibility and the wealth of information, picking out the best in the region, all in the comfort of his lovely SUV made it another fabulous experience.

A customized tour that exceeded our needs. Clive arranged 3 1/2 days of great sightseeing! After an overnight flight, we arrived at the Cape Town airport at 7:30 am. We started with a half day tour hosted by Donna, a colleague of Clive, as we knew we could not check into our hotel until later in the day. Donna took us on a tour of Cape Town and area and gave us our tickets to Robben Island for the next day. We were unable to take the gondola ride to Table Mountain because it was in the clouds. On our own, on Sunday, we toured Robben Island (we recommend exploring the harbour area before or after the Robben Island trip).On Monday with Clive we visited many of the sites on the Cape Peninsula (much to see) and enjoyed an excellent lunch. We had let Clive know that we enjoyed sea food and he took us to a great place at a fish market.On Tuesday we visited wineries in the picturesque areas of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. We also explored many points of interest (other than wine). We also had another great meal at a restaurant which Clive recommended. Determining that Table Mountain was clear, Clive took us up. His experience proved valuable as he advised us on where to stand in the gondola for the best view (it rotates) and how to negotiate the line-ups. We highly recommend Clive, as he demonstrated the knowledge to customize a tour to suit our interests. We enjoyed his company!

Book well in advance!. We cannot recommend Clive highly enough. He is a fabulous guide and his expertise truly added to our enjoyment of Cape Town. He went out of his way to ensure that we enjoyed everything and his suggestions from sites to meals were spot on. For a first time visitor to Cape Town or just for having the convenience of someone knowledgeable to drive you around, Clive should be your "go-to"! Professional and personable, he made our visit.

Amazing Tour Guide. This was my first visit of Cape Town and with 4 days of time we wanted a good overview of Cape Town.Clive de Bruyne's company came highly recommended so we booked him.Pros: A very wonderful gentleman who loves his city. Very knowledgeable, gave great recommendations and very flexible with our requests for a tailor made program.He brought us around in style and comfort in his immaculate Land Rover Discovery.Our tour included a good city tour, a Cape Point drive, a strenuous hike up Table Mountain, a township walking tour, a wine country drive and several great lunch spot recommendations.Everything was planned and executed perfectly.He had the assistance of a partner Godfrey who grew up in a township and really knows his way around there. The township tour was a great eye opener and we felt perfectly comfortable and safe with Godfrey.Cons: None that we could find. His prices were very reasonable (cheap) considering the quality of his service and the very personal care we received from him.We left Cape Town with the conviction that it really is the most beautiful city in the world!

Above and beyond. I booked Clive based on recommendations and as it turned out, that was a great choice. I decided to use Clive as our guide in and around Cape Town, for the wine region and for the Garden Route. He was most helpful during the whole planning process and accomodated all my requests. During the actual tour, Clive would not only explain the sights and the story behind the places we visited, but also talk us through the complex history of the country. Friendly, helpful, service minded and knowledgeable, he surpassed our expectations on all levels. We would highly recommend Clive for anyone considering using a guide in South Africa. We will also book him again for our next trip to South Africa.

Great guides for Cape Town and the Cape. Clive and Godfrey are knowledgeable, flexible and confidence-inspiring. This was our second visit to Cape Town, so we had some things that we didn't need to see again and others that we had missed on the previous visit. And our time was limited. They adapted the day-and-a-half programme to suit our priorities and interests, there was no wasted time or hanging around and they made the most of our available time. Also, they brought their frank personal perspectives of their country's strengths and problems, giving us a real insight. Not cheap, but good value.

The best way to visit the Cape Peninsular.. The day trip was definitely the best way to tour the Cape Peninsular. Fantastic scenery. Clive picked us up at our guest house. He's very friendly and told us so much about the area it's history & modern day life in South Africa. The restaurant he chose for lunch was great too. So don't hesitate just contact him!!

Couldn't be better guides!. Clive and Godfrey are very knowledgeable and enjoyable to be with. They both offered us an insight into the areas we were visiting and made our trips great! We did the peninsula tour with Clive and had a fantastic day. He knew how to avoid the tour buses and get the best viewing, and included a stop at a great restaurant on the way home. Godfrey brought us to Langa Township which was quite an eyeopener for us Westerners. He was able to show us the real life there and gave explained the history as well. We would highly recommend both tours!They also were very helpful with out other arrangements in Cape Town. They are truly full service! Thank you so much for making our time in Cape Town fabulous!

Excellent Tour. We arrived early at the airport and had just the day before sailing on a cruise. Clive picked us up at the airport and delivered us to the ship in a comfortable Land Rover! We took a wonderful Cape Peninsula Tour, which gave us a perfect overview. We learned so very much from him and saw some spectacular scenery. He encouraged us to hike up Cape Point itself, which was a highlight for us--and made us understand he really caters to each group's personalities/abilities. We would really recommend a tour rather than driving yourself. You just see so much more with a local.

Cape Town. We had the good fortune to have been recommended to Clive by good friends who spent time with him in 2014. Clive spent two wonderful days with us in Cape Town helping us experience all of its wonders and culture. Clive has a vast knowledge of the history and social aspects of the region. He is delightful in every way and we could not have been more fortunate to spend our time in this wonderful country with him.

Two Private Excellent Tours. We had two tours with Clive de Bruyne, the first was a Cape Tour taking in all we wanted to see and tailored to our needs. The second we took the four passes tour around Paarl, Worcseter and Franshoeck, taking us to places we wanted to visit due to family Boer War connections, we also visited wine growing areas and fruit farms. Clive was great, a mine of information on any aspect or topic you wish to discuss. He put a lot of work into planning and executing the tours to meet our needs. He took us to very special restaurants for lunch on both days. Traveled in the comfort of a highly polished and comfortable Range Rover. The best tour guide!

There's nothing like having a friend who lives there. I emailed Clive as soon as I found that we were going to spend a few days in Cape town and he could not have been more professional and more helpful at every step in our planning our trip. From planning fantastic daily itineraries and then modifying them whenever I found something else that I just could not miss he was so obliging.He also really filled us in on the history of Cape Town and South Africa giving us first hand his own family history. He is a complete fountain of knowledge which he does not hesitate to shareWe hope that someday we will return to the Cape Town area as we loved it and he will definitely be the first one we contact if we do.

Awesomazing!!!. My review deleted before I could post it and I'm doing it ALL over again. That's how awesome these guys were because I'm super lazy. 11 friends and I visited Cape Town for a 30th bday celebration and I gotta say, this was the way to go. We had so much fun and did so many things. Our tour guide, Clive was very knowledgeable and made everything entertaining. He was really down to earth. I even taught him some Jamaican patois. Lol! He was really considerate and helped me when I was having a heights freak out. Our driver, Peter was also great. Knew all the shortcuts and didn't complain once, even when going over shift. These guys really went above and beyond and I'd recommend them to anyone. However, if you happen to be a jerk, then leave them alone because they deserve better than you. That being said, check them out!

Fantastic Tour. We had a full day tour with Clive a few days ago in Cape Town. We had a full tour of the Cape of Good Hope and surrounding region with Clive. He picked us up from our hotel, on time in a lovely Land Rover Discovery - Very comfortable! Clive discussed what he had planned for the day and if there was anything we wanted to change or do in particular. We then headed off and we stopped at some beautiful places on the way to the Cape, he also gave us some recommendations on what we could do on our other days. He recommended a beach, which we went to the next day and it was fab! (Clifton 4th). Clive is a wealth of knowledge on Cape Town and South Africa. We got to the Cape and Clive guided us through a short (30 mins or so) climb, where we saw some fantastic views of the Cape of Good Hope, My partner had to face his fears and Clive was very patient (more than me!). We also visited the Penguins, Clive had made a great Lunch reservation, and then we headed off for the botanical gardens. We probably wouldn't have visited the gardens on our own, but it was great! Its a fantastic example of Fynbos Vegetation, along with the Cape Floral Kingdom. Clive was very knowledgeable about the local vegetation. In Summary:Well Organised, Extremely pleasant and well informed Guide, Very Welcoming, Extremely personal service, Great Car! The Best Private Tour we did during our Holiday in South Africa. Make sure you ask him for some restaurant recommendations, as we tried one of his suggestions in Cape Town and it was a great meal! Nice to get off the tourist route.

Amazing experience! Wonderful trip along the Garden route & visiting Cape Town. My whole trip was planned to perfection! From first contact, until the point that I left Cape Town, I had complete faith in Clive and he was so organized (that's really important to me). I did some volunteering in South Africa and I wanted to visit the Garden Route and Cape Town in a safe way also to reassure my parents. I looked on Tripadvisor and Clive had great reviews, so that's why I contacted him. He reacted quickly on my e-mails and together we made an itinerary completely fine-tuned to what I wanted.And the whole experience really lived up to my expectations! Clive knew so much about the history of the country and could tell me fun little anecdotes during the drives we had to make to get to our destinations, he arranged wonderful accommodations, he (partially) reassured me before doing my bungee jump (of course I was still a bit nervous when I jumped) and I can give so many more great/fun/wonderful examples. What also was really good about Clive, is that when my shark cage dive got cancelled because of the weather when we were already almost there, he immediately suggested three alternatives in the neighborhood that we could do instead. If I would have been on my own, then that would have been a lost day. Clive did not only meet my expectations, he definitely exceeded them! I would recommend him to all my family and friends!

Super Tour Guide!. WOW!! What a way to start your introduction to Cape Town during our first time in Africa. Amazing experience!! Did a initial-day touring by going to South Africa's first "Township" where Blacks were "placed" in the 1920's. Clive had an expert, Godfrey, from this community to share understandings and that unique, sad history. Next it was a wide variety of stops in the Central Business District, then to the scenic overview and finishing with the cable car ride up to the dramatic top of Cable Mountain. Wonderful!! Clive is very skilled, knowing and sharing. Cannot ask for a better experience and such great skills, love of Cape Town!!

Doesn't get better than Clive. If you are currently researching whether it’s worth it to hire a private tour guide for your visit to Cape Town, much like we did prior to our visit, let us assure you that it most definitely is and you will not regret your decision to hire Clive as your guide. As if the 200-something other 5 star reviews aren’t enough, we have created a TripAdvisor account and are writing our first review because we feel so strongly about our experience with Clive and we want to delve into what makes the experience so exceptional. We have broken down what we think are the 3 most important aspects in considering a tour guide, not only in South Africa, but for any trip. These 3 aspects are: Planning, Logistics, and Execution.Planning: Like many, we wanted to have a hassle free and seamless trip to Cape Town as this was a completely foreign country and continent to us. We contacted Clive in March of 2015 for our honeymoon trip in January 2016. This was the proper amount of time for Clive to put together and book a very meaningful and engaging itinerary for us within our cost range. Of course, payments and coordination with someone internationally may be intimidating, but Clive was extremely responsive and transparent when it came time for payments, bookings, itinerary, questions, and other arrangements for our trip. We did some preliminary research on Cape Town and provided Clive with some activities we were interested in doing during our trip and also asked for his input as well. He sent us several very detailed itinerary options and we settled on one that met all of the activities and sights that we wanted to experience. We are not exaggerating when we say that he did not steer us wrong once. The best example of this is that when we built in only 1 day for a local safari trip, he strongly suggested 3 days in a location outside of Cape Town. We deferred to Clive’s discretion and once we arrived at the safari it quickly became apparent how correct he was. Clive handled all of our bookings for the trip, and he was extremely flexible when we had any changes that needed to be made (more on this later).Logistics: Clive had all of our flight information and was at the Cape Town airport as soon as we collected our luggage and took us from the airport to our hotel. Having someone waiting at the airport for us was a welcome relief after a long trip to a new continent, country, and city. But having someone as warm, welcoming, and upbeat as Clive really provided a level of comfort that allowed us to kick back and start enjoying the trip minutes after arrival. Clive reviewed our itinerary with us on the way from the airport to our hotel and was promptly there each morning to greet and guide us for that day’s activities. Clive came ready with water and various supplies that the activities we were participating in that day called for. Whether we needed a taxi, uber, entrance fee, toll fee, dinner recommendations/reservations, or other admission, Clive handled it all for us so that we could have a hassle and stress-free experience. He had purchased all tickets ahead of time, so we spent no time waiting in lines. One of the best examples of the logistics was during our safari trip. Even though Clive did not join us for the safari portion of our trip, he still booked our flights and transfer connections to the safari (Shamwari), checked us in for our flights on each end (and met us at a restaurant our last night to personally bring us our printed boarding passes despite having severe food poisoning/stomach flu!), coordinated directly with Shamwari to make sure that we had our boarding passes for our plane ride, our transfer from the airport to the game reserve, and all of the necessary documentation and logistics back from Shamwari to the airport when we were done with our 3 days.Execution: Clive is extremely good at his job, whether it requires him to be a travel agent, teacher, guide, driver, or friend. The entire trip he was all five. For two people who knew next to nothing about South Africa prior to our arrival and never once picked up a guide book while we were there, we now have a meaningful understanding of the history, economics, geography, and demographics of the country thanks to Clive’s incredible depth of knowledge about everything Cape Town/South Africa. He is so engaging in his explanations that lengthy drives to wine country or other attractions flew by. There was never one time where we doubted Clive’s guiding. He was very open and honest with what would be accomplished each day, and gave us additional options if time allowed for it. Clive was also extremely flexible with the itinerary. If we expressed interest in a particular location or activity he mentioned along the way, he would do everything in his power to accommodate the request. This is one of the biggest advantages to having a private tour as opposed to joining a large tour group. Clive’s ability to pivot and adapt to a new plan was incredible. This was most exemplified when our Shark Cage Dive was cancelled due to unseasonably cold water and a lack of shark sightings. Naturally, we were disappointed to hear this news, but Clive quickly found a new activity for us and arranged the booking without hesitation. Our substitute activity ended up being a horseback ride along a beach with stunning views of the water! Additionally, Clive quickly refunded us the admission for the shark cage dive without us even inquiring. Clive is as good a tour guide as they come. Every single day of our tour he went above and beyond our expectations. One night we got lost walking to dinner (despite Clive giving us detailed directions from our hotel) and ended up in a less-than-desirable area. When Clive heard this the next day, he took the time to personally do a walking “dry-run” from our hotel to the next night’s restaurant to make sure we did not get lost again. Our safety and comfort were very much his priority, always ensuring we were not carrying any valuables outside the hotel, coming with us to withdraw cash from ATMs, and providing guidance about how to avoid tourist traps. Clive provided a level of comfort and security you don’t often find when traveling internationally. He inspires confidence in a very understated way and is very good at reading situations, giving us plenty space and privacy to do our own thing, but was always nearby if we had a question or problem. There was never a time where we felt like there was a chaperone on our honeymoon. The entire trip it felt like a good friend was showing us around. This was especially so when one afternoon Clive surprised us with a bottle of champagne and two glasses to celebrate our recent nuptials. Clive was the difference in taking our South African honeymoon from good to excellent. We really saw this when we encountered other guides later in our trip. Even though those guides were nice and knowledgeable, they were not Clive, a fact that we could not ignore. So, if there is anything negative to say about Clive it’s that he ruins your ability to ever have another tour guide again. We highly recommend Clive to anyone looking to visit Cape Town. It is money very well spent!

Best Tours Ever!. Clive's Capetown is as steeped in historical and cultural learning experiences as it is in breathtaking beauty. Our group of 12 was well cared for on this trip. Clive's team is funny, engaging, incredibly knowledgeable and so very flexible. If I could, I would travel the world with these guys. Hope to be back soon!

Trip of a lifetime!!!! Thanks Clive :). What an amazing trip we had! It's really hard to express the awesome experiences that we had during our 10 day trip to SA. I'm so grateful for the kindness and information that Clive and Peter shared with us. I'll never forget how sincere, funny, knowledgeable and pleasant you were to our group of 12. When I return to SA I will definitely have to get a tour with Clive again. God bless you and thanks for helping me to understanding the real SA and not what we see portrayed in the media.

30th Birthday Trip. I planned a trip for a group of 12 people for my birthday. Clive was an absolute joy to work with. He put together the perfect itinerary based on all of our interests. He always responded to my emails in a timely manner. He was patient with us and accommodating to any changes we needed to make. The restaurants he picked were all excellent. We did a LOT in a little amount of time. i.e. Tour of Old Cape Town, Table Mountain, Cape Pointe, Cape of Good Hope, Robben Island, Aquila Game Drive and Winelands tour in 3.5 days. He is very knowledgeable about his country and he makes it fun and interesting. His team (Godfrey & Peter) were professional as well. Our trip was nothing short of amazing. Thank you very much Clive, we will be back!!

Franschhoek to Cape Point. Clive de Bruyne did an outstanding job guiding us. Our group has been led by guides in many parts of the world so I feel qualified to describe Clive as an engaging ,informative and excellent planer. He looked after our special needs and made sure by his considerate care that the entire party had a superb experience. Should I return to the Cape I would definitely request his services again

Wonderful tour of the winelands. My wife and I have just spent a wonderful day touring Stellenbosch and Paarl with Yolanda. Yolanda was interesting ,knowledgeable and accommodating. She listened to what we wanted and tailored the tour accordingly. The wine, food, conversation, scenery and beautiful weather all combined to give us a truly memorable day. Thank you Yolanda.

Cape Town Tour. We utilized Clive's services as a general tour guide for our four day stay in Cape Town, and for airport pick-up and drop-off as well . He organized a wonderful itinerary customized to our interests. His selections for our winery tours and tastings, and lunch outings, were especially excellent. His knowledge of Cape Town, his personal warmth and humor, and his attention to details all contributed to making our trip most enjoyable and memorable. Clive's primary motivation was always to make our experience the best possible in every way, and he succeeded beyond expectation.

You Can't Improve on Perfection. In September 2015, my husband and I traveled to South Africa to experience one of our best trips ever. In Cape Town, we were met at the airport by Clive of Cape Town Tour Guide Company. From then on, our tour was one “Awww” moment after another. Clive planned a grand tour of Cape Town and its surrounding area for us.  Along the way, he provided tons of information about the history of South Africa to its present day politics. His knowledge knows no end! As I was having mobility issues at the time, Clive was so thoughtful about opening the van door for me and dropping me off or picking me up at the entrance to the places we visited. Cape Town Tour Guide Company excelled at customizing our South African experience. If you are more adventurous, just know that Clive is a dedicated cyclist; he surfs, and has even had lots of experience bungee jumping. Our expectations were exceeded and our stay in South Africa couldn't have been any more perfect.

Fabulous Cape Town Experience. Clive made our Cape Town visit fabulous. From the time I booked his services to the completion of our tour he was extremely attentive and knowledgeable combined with a wonderful sense of humor. He tailored our tour to our special interests which included great restaurants and memorable scenery and sites, he took very good care of us. I highly recommend his services.
Township Tour. Godfrey is very knowledgeable. He is able to mix history with a great sense of humor, making the tour a real delight. I would highly recommend him for a guide

Fantastic Cape Town vacation. Our family of 4 had a fantastic three days touring with Clive in and around Cape Town. Clive was very responsive before our trip asking about our interests and making several different suggestions for excursions and activities. We ended up doing 3 days in town, including a ride to the top of Table Mountain, then a ride to the Cape of Good Hope for some incredible scenery, then a fantastic visit to a few wineries for tasting and a picnic lunch (plus chocolate tasting). Clive was on time every day and good fun to chat with during our travels. Great value for money. We've used a lot of private guides in various cities and Clive is at the top of the list. Thanks again Clive!

Cape Town -- Perfect!. Clive made our visit personalized and special, from the moment we arrived until he delivered us back to the airport. He showed us beautiful sites and places we would never have found on our own and optimized our few days in Cape Town to the utmost. From the vineyards to the Cape, with fabulous restaurants in between, Clive provided the background to tie it all together. He happily answered all our questions about the wildlife, geography and geology, and we talked about everything from early settlement history to current city development. We highly recommend his service.

Top-Notch. After doing quite a bit of research on how best to spend our time in Cape Town, we ultimately relied on the outstanding ratings and reviews posted on Tripadvisor by Clive's previous clients. Admittedly a new strategy for me, this did not disappoint - Clive, and our two-day tour of Cape Town, were simply amazing. From the get-go, Clive was tuned in to our interests. Based on our initial email exchange, as well as a short phone conversation, Clive put together an itinerary that not only covered the essentials, but also took into account the individual interests of each of the four of us in the group - my husband, 2 grown daughters, and myself. He quickly caught on to our personalities, likes and dislikes, and was stellar at tweaking the itinerary to appeal to each of us. At times we ventured off the beaten path, finding craft beer tastings for one of our daughters, artisan chocolates for another daughter, and affording us what seemed like royal treatment at the Ernie Els Winery. Clive's restaurant recommendations were spot-on, and perfectly aligned with our taste and style. In sum, Clive is incredibly knowledgable, personable, and responsible, and we couldn't imagine a better way to experience Cape Town.

First Class service from beginning to end. We were already excited about the Itinerary Clive had planned for our 4 night stay in Cape Town, which as an added bonus included him collecting us from the Airport on arrival and delivering us safely to our Car Rental office when we were leaving to explore the Garden Route. Showing true professionalism and his prioritisation of the customer's experience, Clive took the initiative to amend our Itinerary and take us up Table Mountain as soon as we had dropped our bags at the Hotel as the weather conditions that morning were perfect.From that moment on we were firm fans of Clive and went on to enjoy 2 incredible days of trips, with Clive filling them with his endless knowledge about Cape Town / South Africa - past and present, at the same time injecting lots of fun and personality into the proceedings.Clive also took the time to suggest additional activities we might be interested in during the rest of our trip, and even went to the extra effort to make reservations for us!We (2 couples) had an amazing trip to SA and Clive played a major part in that - I can't recommend Clive and his company enough! We will certainly be in touch with him next time we visit SA!Thanks Clive!

Clive made our Cape Town experience.. We spotted Clive through Tripadvisor and found him to be extremely responsive. He helped us tailor make a two day itinerary - suggesting added extras to make our trip unique and complete. Clive arranged our attraction tickets up front so we could skip queues and see the sights as efficiently as possible. Clive was extremely friendly with a great sense of humour. He also took great photos! He is an exceptionally knowledgeable guide and we were so pleased we found him. He really made our Cape Town experience. His vehicle was really comfortable and he booked lunches at some superb restaurants which we thoroughly enjoyed. He made an effort to understand our tastes so when he arranged the wine tastings they were in amazing locations which suited us perfectly. Next time we visit Cape Town we will be sure to get back in touch.

In Unexpected Turn of Events, Clive Saves Husband's Life (or at least his toe). One of the reasons you might turn to a guide like Clive, as opposed to a big group tour, is for the personalization, the warmth, the ability to roll with the punches and adjust the tour to your needs and desires and to the unexpected events of the day. If this describes any of your criteria, I can attest that Clive possesses all of these abilities and more in spades.On the morning of our much-anticipated tour of the Cape of Good Hope with Clive, my husband broke his toe in the shower. Only, we didn't know that he broke his toe. All we knew was that he was clearly wounded and that I didn't seem to be able to address the wound properly in the hotel room.When Clive showed up promptly at the time we had arranged, I explained the situation and invited him up to the room to take a look and see what he thought we should do. He took one look, said he thought we needed to go to a hospital, and that he knew the one to go to. In less than 10 minutes, we were in an ER being attended to, and Clive was in the waiting room making alternate arrangements for our tours, which we still thought might happen later in the day. Clive continued to make plans B, C, D, and E, while evaluations were made, x-rays were taken, and then, finally, a decision was taken: my husband needed surgery. There would be no afternoon touring. Even then, Clive stuck with us, taking me to a nearby restaurant to pick up lunch to go -- and even as we went, he was trying to fit in a little tour guiding, telling me about the old Dutch city hall and the Boer war.At this point, of course, we let Clive go, but he offered to come back and pick us up if we were released before 6 (which was incredibly sweet, but we left the hospital after then and took a taxi back to the hotel), and then he continued to check in several times via email. The hospital that Clive took us to, by the way, was incredible -- my husband was evaluated, in surgery, in recovery, had physical therapy, and was back in his hotel room, all in about 10.5 hours. We couldn't have gotten that done in the U.S.To top it all off, Clive made reservations for us to take a tour of the Cape the next day with another company, since he was booked. This is clearly a sterling human being, a truly kind and caring person, and a tour guide beyond compare. I would recommend him to anyone, for anything, at any time. Thanks, Clive -- I very much hope we can come back to Cape Town and take one of your more usual tours some time!

Awesome way to see Cape Town and surrounding area!. South Africa was a very new and unique travel experience for us, including our stay in Cape Town. We were advised to use Cape Town Tour Guide Co. to get around. We've always been independent travelers but decided to give it a try. We are so glad we did! Being small, everything about CTTG was personal and very comfortable. From picking us up at the airport, to changing the schedule to take advantage of the cloud lifting over Table Mtn, and changing our city tour to walking not driving (based on our request), we enjoyed Clive's company and his factual info on the area. We spent 3 days with CTTG (in Cape Town and vicinity, touring the Cape of Good Hope and more along the way, and visiting wine country in Stellenbosch region) and it was a great way to get around and have a very unique experience!! Thanks Clive!

Thank Clive, we had a great tour.. We recently went to Cape Town as part of a four week African safari / tour. Clive was our guide in Cape Town. He is a natural guide and clearly loves what he does and his home town. Cape Town is a beautiful place and Clive showed us so much in a short two days. He sets up tours to suit your needs, always interesting and a very pleasant manner.I would highly recommend him.

HIGHLY recommended for University groups: Dynamic, Educational, Engaging and loads of fun!. Clive De Bruyne from Cape Town Tour Guide Co. has been the ideal guide for our history department student group visiting South Africa from East Carolina University from 2011 - 2015. We keep going back for more tours and the student numbers increase every year! In addition to organizing incredibly smooth and high caliber transportation, food and accommodation logistics, innovative site visitations and educational conversations and commentary, Clive is so much fun! He engages the students and faculty alike. He creatively assists us to fit in tons of educational and adventure activities into a two-week slot. I am always so incredibly impressed at his attention to detail, knowledge and humor as we climb Table Mountain, visit Parliament and museums, work on shipwrecks on wild wind swept beach or World War II radar stations on rugged mountain peaks, shark cage dive or walk with lions. Clive takes everything in his stride and makes it an exceptional and informative experience for everyone. ECU will be back next year for sure!

If it wasn't for Clive this trip wouldn't have been as epic as it was!. We went to South Africa on a Summer Study Abroad program with our school to learn about the history of pre and post-apartheid. Clive was absolutely incredible with his knowledge of South Africa. We met Clive as a guide, and said goodbye to a great friend. Clive made this trip epic for everyone on it. I already am trying to schedule a trip for my family to visit. If you're going to South Africa for whatever reason I highly recommend going through Clive. He sets up every aspect of the tour and makes it an incredible experience!

Thanks Clive, we had a great time in Cape Town.. Clive is knowledgeable about Cape Town on so many levels; historical, ecological, biological, political, (gastronomic!), that he makes all tours fascinating. I would love to return.

Excellent Tour. We had one day in Cape Town after flying in from the Eastern Cape. Clive picked us up directly from the airport and adapted the tour to fit our late start. We covered a lot of ground in one day: the Kirstenbosch National Garden, the Boulder Beach penguins, the Cape Point cable car, Chapman's Peak. Clive is very kind and very knowledgeable. We would highly recommend his tours whether you like us would prefer to be driven site to site, or you're more adventurous and would like to go hiking or cycling.

Wanting more of Cape Town. I recently had the beautiful opportunity to experience Cape Town and other areas of South Africa through a historical-maritime lens, thanks to a study abroad program offered at my university and to the never ending knowledge and guidance provided by our tour guide Clive de Bruyne who was there every step of the way. He provided the perfect balance of humor, knowledge, culture, adventure, organization, and security. I found that Clive is undeniably versatile and multicultural, making him the perfect candidate for large groups (like ours). I consider myself a well-traveled individual and found him to be the best tour guide, yet. I highly recommend him to any one looking to experience the unique beauty of South Africa.

Cape Town Day Tour 18th June 2015. We chose Clive after looking at other reviews on tripadvisor and we were definitely not disappointed! All correspondance before the tour was informative and timely, and Clive was able to plan an itinery based on what we wanted to see. I also liked that I could pay using PayPal and only half of the tour price was required in advance. Made me feel more relaxed about booking over the internet. We met Clive in the morning and he was at our hotel on time. The car was lovely. We wanted to change our itinery a little to fit in Table Mountain and Clive was more than accomodating to make sure we could see it. Clive is very knowledgable, friendly and brilliant at showing you the best sites. We had a fantastic time seeing the penguins, having fish and chips, the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point. I personally really wanted to see a seal (or sea lion, technically),so Clive went out of his way to make sure we had the best chance to spot some. He avoided the touristy areas and it was fab. We really, really enjoyed our time on the tour and it was one of our favourite days of our trip (we were on a tour travelling all over South Africa for 3 weeks). We couldn't ask for more from Clive and would definitely recommed him and the company. He was approachable, thoughtful, professional and organised. If you want brilliant service and exceptional knowledge of Cape Town and the area, animals and plants that live there, then Clive is your man! Thank you so much Clive, you made our holiday! Rebecca and Shaun

Understanding South Africa: hope for its future. Clive is deeply informed about every aspect of his beloved South Africa, and he is willing to speak frankly, sensitively and empathetically about its history and its passage from the trauma of Apartheid to a democratically elected government. His passionate commitment to the beauty and achievements of this country, and his balanced yet optimistic belief in its future are infectious and reassuring. Clive willingly addressed a multitude of issues raised, recommended further revelatory reading and was keen to ensure a sympathetic understanding on our part.At all times Clive was flexible in accommodating our many requests and individual needs. He was a charming and friendly host. I have travelled widely and have always enjoyed the benefits of excellent guides, however, Clive was more than a guide and teacher to us. Indubitably, our experience of South Africa was enhanced and intensified because of Clive. Simply the best.

South Africa Illuminated. I recently spent two and a half fascinating weeks in South Africa, on a Leakey Foundation tour, led by Clive De Bruyne. He was exceptional as a tour leader and guide, focused every moment on making the trip educational in the highest degree, as well as extremely pleasant and comfortable. We were all impressed with his knowledge of the country, its history, geology, and archeology. Best of all, he is a delightful person with a great sense of humor and fun. We spent time in Capetown and Johannesburg, with a marvelous stop at a wilderness retreat called Bushmans Kloof in Cedarburg where we explored a number of rock art sites. I cared less for the city Johannesburg, but valued the visits there to the Apartheid Museum and the Evolutionary Sciences Institute at the University of Witwatersrand. We spent a fabulous last day at the cave of Sterkfonein. Be sure not to miss the wine country of the Western Cape, especially Jordan Winery where we had a delightful lunch.Bring cameras, good walking shoes, layering of clothes for change of weather, and, importantly, the appropriate converter and adapter for electric devices.

Superlative experience. Clive De Bruyne was exceptional in every way. He was responsive and sensitive to our requests when we first contacted him, both in terms of organizing the itinerary and making recommendations for accommodations. When we arrived we found him to be personable, warm, professional, organized and thoughtful. He was knowledgeable about the politics and history of this complicated and evolving country. I cannot recommend anyone more highly. When we needed to make a change in our plans, he was immediately on top of it. He followed through on every detail. When the weather did not cooperate, Clive adapted seamlessly. He and his associate Godfrey made our trip extraordinary. Godfrey took us into Langa township, where he grew up, and showed us both the problems and promise of his country in a way we would never have understood without him. We took this trip with our two sons, 18, and 20, and all four us enjoyed our time with Clive and Godfrey. In different ways they both enhanced and enriched our experience in South Africa.

The Best Guide in South Africa!. My sixth trip to Africa was last month and I can honestly say, Clive was the best guide I have ever had while traveling the continent. South Africa, in particular, is a country with so much to offer...so many layers and you need someone who understands the history, the culture, the politics and the environment. Clive was so well versed in all aspects of South Africa...but what was more important for me, was he was fun to travel with. His intellect, humor, lighthearted spirit and joie de vivre made our time together a joy. I saw a new side of South Africa thanks to Clive. You'll miss an authentic experience if you don't book a guide with Clive!

A brilliant few days. We were lucky enough to find Clive via the internet, and we are so pleased we did. He did everything he could to ensure we had a great time in Cape Town and also on our day tour around the Cape and to Boulder beech. Look no further for a tour guide, this is the man you need to ensure your have a well informed and interesting time in Cape Town

A Truly Great Guide. A group of 12 of us from the US spent 3 full days with Clive.Touring was in a 16 passenger Mercedes van with a really good driver, Patrick.Clive is personable, knowledgeable and a great ambassador for Cape Town and South Africa. We took the Cape Town City and cultural township tour, the Cape Point- False Bay- Cape of Good Hope- Fishhoek- Simons Town tour and the Cape Winelands tour. The Winelands tour included a visit to the Ernie Els winery, a highlight for the golfers among us.Clive was definitely a 5 star guide! Highly recommend his tours.

Outstanding Service. My family toured Cape Town, Table Mountain, and Robben Island with Clive and we had an outstanding experience. Clive is very organized and experienced. He was right on-time and had planned our day to maximize our time with minimum time spent standing in lines. I would highly recommend Clive!

Wonderful Expericence!. My husband and I booked South Africa for our honeymoon in March 2015. Our travel agent put us in contact with Clive, and we’re SO grateful she did. From the moment Clive picked us up from our hotel, we knew we were in for an incredible treat!We spent a day and a half touring around Cape Town and Clive, who’s love and passion for his city and country was very apparent. He brought us to all of the major attractions (Table Mountain, Cape of Good Hope, Hout Bay, Signal Hill, etc.) and even arranged for us to have lunch at a spectacular place overlooking the water. We had such a fabulous experience and truly look forward to returning to Cape Town and going out with Clive again. Hands down, he was the best tour guide we’ve ever had!

As good as it gets. My husband and I had a great time with Clive. He was very personable and knowledgeable, and he gave great service. We had three full days in Cape Town with him, plus airport transfers. He made everything easy, researched a unique place we wanted to visit, gave restaurant recommendations, and made sure our trip was as successful as possible. He even sent champagne to our hotel for my birthday. I wouldn't hesistate to recommend him.

Absolute perfection. We had the good fortune of seeing Cape Town and the Peninsula with Clive. Everything about the tour was flawless. Clive's encyclopaedic knowledge of his city and country and his ability to condense a huge amount of beauty, knowledge and hidden gems of the area along with his engaging manner and individual attention made the tour par excellence and added immensely to our vacation.I've done many tours in different countries but this one trumps everything by a mile. I look forward to returning and exploring things further afield with Clive's Company.

The perfect hosts. 2 years ago my brother and his wife used the services of Clive and Godfrey and as it was my first visit to Cape Town, they recommended them to us. From the time of handling of the enquiry, the service was excellent and a non standard tour of the winelands to cover wine tasting for me and art and shopping for my wife was arranged.We spent a Sunday with Godfrey in Cape Town and had great experience including visiting a church service and drinking local beer in the township, where Godfrey was born and still lives.2 days with Clive. 1st day for Cape Point Tour with unbelievable scenery and fantastic seafood lunch. 2nd day to the Winelands with the best table and view at the restaurant of one of the wine producers.The local knowledge and experience of Clive and Godfrey was obvoius from the first meeting.I travel all over the world on business and their service was FIRST CLASS. Every request was handled quickly and very professionally and friendly.Thank you, Clive and Godfrey for the perfect start to our South African Holiday. We shall return. Alan and Jurate

Best Tour Guide In South Africa. We booked a private tour of the Cape peninsula on our last day in South Africa. From the moment Clive picked us up to the end of the day...it was a fantastic trip. Not only is Clive highly knowledgable of the area, but his grasp of South African history and the complex nature of South African demographics added to a highly educational and enjoyable day. We not only saw the wondrous sights of the Cape of Good Hope but we had a fantastic conversation that ranged from the simple and silly to highly interesting. His work with educational groups is obvious through his passion for South Africa, its geography, its animals, and its people. Clive also has a great sense of humor which can be attested to by the way he happily took photos (including a selfie with our camera) and the way he suggested shots of our nephew's Flat Stanley (American book/project that teaches geography). Finally, his desire to learn from his clients (we traded book ideas) makes him one of the best, if not the best, tour guide we ever had. We highly recommend Clive. When we return to South Africa we intend to schedule his services again.

The BEST Tourguide Anywhere. This review is long overdue as we hired Clive as a tour guide during our honeymoon in April 2014. Clive drove us around for two days. The first day we went on The Cape Point Tour: Cape Point, the Cape of Good Hope, an AMAZING seafood lunch, as well as a trip to Boulders Beach to see the Penguin Colony. The second day we did the Cape Winelands tour. We went to both Stellenbosch wine region and the historic and picturesque village of Franschhoek. We visited multiply wineries and had an incredible lunch. Clive was knowledgeable and so much fun - it felt like visiting an old friend in a city you had never seen before, but they knew everything about. We only wish we had had more time in Cape Town to do more of Clive's tours. We absolutely would not go back to Cape Town without hiring Clive again and would recommend him to anyone else who is thinking about making a trip to SA.

Above and beyond. Clive and Godfrey were excellent, and went far above and beyond to meet our needs when we were unexpectedly delayed and a member of our party experienced mobility problems that made it difficult for him keep up with the rest of us. Clive provided loads of useful information and historical context, and Godfrey's personal connection to Langa township made this portion of the tour especially poignant. Many thanks to both for their exceptional service and attention to our needs.

Excellent tour. We booked a private tour of the Cape Point area with this company. We have only positive things to report, a friendly and professional service. Clive, the guide, had a detailed and broad knowledge of the area, geology, history, wildlife and plants. We would not hesitate to us this operation in the future.

Awesome City with a Great Guide. My mum, brother and I spent a couple of days with Clive in town and then down on the Cape. We can't fault the package he put together for us.Clive is really easy going and it felt like we were travelling with a 'mate' - he is obviously very experienced and had done all the organisation behind the scenes so that everything was totally flawless and easy for us. And, we were able to fit in quite a lot in a short amount of time.Not only does Clive know loads about the city etc. he was very discerning in his ability to filter information, picking interesting anecdotes and bits of relevant information that he thought would interest us.Totally recommend his company and will be sure to contact Clive for a tour of the wineries next time we're in town!

Extraordinary!!!! Highly Recommend.. My sister and I booked the Cape Town City Tour and the Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope Tour with Clive in January 2015. We even had him pick us up at the airport upon our arrival to Cape Town and got a quick mini-tour of the city to get our bearings. I have been on many private guided tours all over Europe and the United Kingdom; however, Clive was one of the best I have ever had. He was a fund of knowledge on EVERYTHING and we had great dialogue throughout our entire time with him. He is an extraordinary and kind person who made our first trip to Cape Town much more special and memorable. I would strongly recommend him and would encourage anyone who wants a unique, pleasurable, and insightful tour to book with Clive. He is the BEST.

Top Notch Tour Guide for Cape Peninsula & Cape Town Tours - one of the best. We had the most fortunate experience of booking a full day tour with Clive for a tour of Cape Town as well as a Cape Peninsula Tour. He was absolutely outstanding and made our day with him one of the highlights of the trip. He catered to our every need and personally customized our tour to go to the places that we wanted to go. Clive is truly an expert in the area, a great driver, fun to be with, & a most knowledgeable seasoned tour guide. He knows the ins and out of every spot in the area, including restaurants. We got to see the best views of this spectacularly scenic part of the world, as well as learn about the history, culture, and politics. The vehicle was comfortable & Clive was timely on our transportation, giving us the best door to door transport from our cruise ship to the airport. We highly recommend him & it was one of the best days of our 3 week South African adventure. He is the one of the finest that you can get.

Good day tour, but seemed a little bored. Clive took us on a tour around Cape Town Peninsular. Although the views were incredible and we had a great day out, we struggled to get information out from Clive and it seemed as if we was a little bored and over it. Our pick up was timely and efficient, but once we were in the car, dead silence until I asked what the plan was for the day. I hate to give bad reviews, but after spending so much money - it would have been a little better to have someone who was just as excited as we were.

A great day out. We booked Clive for a day out around the Cape and a couple of hikes. We did a hike at Cape point, a walk through the botanical gardens,and a hike at least half way up the Lions Head. In between Clive showed us the sites and was full of local knowledge. The car was great and comfortable for the whole day. We had a great time and would highly recommend.

Excellent tour guide for Cape Town and Surrounding Area. We booked Clive for a day and a half - and in that time he managed to take us round everything we could have wanted to see. But the whole thing was paced so well, that it felt unrushed and very comfortable. He had clearly taylored the day for our needs - and adapted his initial plans, when he realised that we had changed our minds - or thought of something else that we would prefer to do.He was full of all sorts of interesting information, political, historical and cultural.He even thought of where we shoud stop to eat.At the end of our guided tours, he gave us a plan on how to continue our tour of Western Cape, and booked a lovely restaurant for us in Franschooek, because he realised that by the time we arrived there it would be fully booked.And he was great company.Certainly recommend him.

Knowledgeable and very friendly guide. We did a whole day tour of the Cape Peninsula. Our guide was Clive De Bruyne. We found him very friendly. I had planned the itinerary well in advance and Clive was both helpful and accommodating.Overall an excellent and very happy experience and when we revisit Cape Town one day, we will use Clive's services again.

Private, Personal, and a Wealth of Knowledge for All Ages. My family and I visited Cape Town in January 2015. Clive was our guide and he crafted a full day's adventure from the City Center all the way down to the Cape of Good Hope. All the while, Clive provided insightful information and history about Cape Town, its traditions, people, and culture. We honestly didn't think our 8 and 10 year old could last nine hours, but they were completely enthusiastic with Clive's agenda which he tailored to our suiting. We hiked, we dined on fresh seafood, we saw things that we never would have seen if went self-directed. To truly learn about a place, you need to interact with a local -- Clive was our "local" and gave us a perspective on Cape Town and South Africa unlike any other vacation we've taken. Thank you and we hope to come back and utilize your service again!

Lonely Planet Guide In Person. My friend and I were fortunate enough to have booked 2 1/2 day tours with this great firm. I jokingly said "I don't think therr is 1 thing that you don't know" and in fact, that was the truth. Clive's style of "guiding" was so enjoyable. He was very much in tune with what we wanted to do and was able to adapt to our particualr needs. We were very fortunate to have booked with this stellar company.

Lovely way to end a fabulous trip. Back in 2007 while honeymooning in South Africa, we enjoyed a lovely private cape peninsula tour. This year while visiting the cape yet again, we decided to invoke these fading memories and perhaps reinvigorate them a little by once again embarking on a similar tour. However, second time around I didn’t simply want us to retrace our steps verbatim as having previously experienced the well travelled, popular tourist route, I now had a good understanding of what we had liked about the trip back in 2007, what we hadn’t enjoyed as much and more importantly, how we felt it could have been improved upon. As they say, hindsight is a wonderful thing. Therefore I set about searching for a tour guide who could offer a greater degree of flexibility in designing a more bespoke itinerary that would suit us better second time around. Clive is very much that guy. A very impressive and yet laid back and personable individual who via a serious of back and forth emails prior to our trip commencing, came up with exactly what I asked for in my brief. I decided to arrange the tour to be on our last day of the trip. Our flight home from CPT wasn’t until 6pm that evening and therefore keen to avoid the perennial final day holiday blues where counting the hours is akin to watching the sunset fade into darkness I thought this would take our minds off of the inevitable. That morning Clive picked us up at 8am from our hotel in Camps Bay in his top of the range land rover (nice touch) and we set off on our varied and predetermined route on what was to become a wonderful experience and a fitting way to end to our holiday. As he dropped us at CPT airport we felt we were saying goodbye to a friend rather than simply a tour guide. In my opinion you would be in safe and very capable hands if you chose Clive to make arrangements for your trip. He has certainly cornered a niche in the market with his ability to custom design itineraries as to the clients wants as opposed to simply rolling out the tried and trusted. It’s no surprise that a section of the business relates to him extensively designing whole 1-2 week itineraries for clients perhaps not as confident as we are in doing so independently. However the fact we only booked him for one day didn’t diminish this level of professionalism, focus and/or attention to detail he gave throughout the experience. I can give him and his company no higher praise than to say if we were looking for a guide in the area to take us on a day trip in the future he would be my first choice and if I was looking for an agent to arrange a more extensive itinerary for say, my parents, then Clive would be the first one I contacted.

Lucky Choice for Us!!!. My companion and I were absolutely thrilled with the tour and service provided by Clive, the owner of the Cape Town Tour Guide Company. I booked him after reading about him on Trip Advisor and it was a very lucky choice for us. Clive, a former teacher, has a lovely, easy demeanor and is very knowledgeable on a number of topics. By lunch the first day, we began to test him to see if there was a question we could ask that he could not answer. And there was not.:)I would highly recommend Clive and his company. I hope to come back to S Africa with my entire family and we will certainly book Clive again!

Fab Anniversary Tour. We spent 2 days touring the Cape Town area with Clive and Godfrey. We took the wine land tour which was divine, the countryside is beautiful and Clive took the time to explain the history of the area and show us some lovely small vineyards. I highly recommend a visit to La Motte the restaurant is fantastic. The second day was a tour around the coast to Cape Point, the guys had arranged for some fizz for us on our anniversary which was lovely touch. We were able to include a visit to seal island which was great although the sea was choppy!. The service was fantastic both the guides brought a personal touch and were able to accommodate any changes to the agenda. We would definitely use The Cape Town Tour Guide Co again.

Cape Town Tour Guide Co. -World Class from Beginning to End. The Cape Town Tour Guide Company was the last of our three phenomenal South African experiences using Trip Advisor recommendations. Our over ambitious itinerary wore us down and we were concerned about the length of the Cape Peninsula Tour. Clive was very accommodating, abbreviating the tour, while still exposing us to the beauty of the Cape. Clive gave us a relaxing day, allowing us to enjoy the beauty of Cape Peninsula in luxurious comfort. From Chapman’s Peak Drive to Cape Point, Clive offered the best photo opportunities, taking pictures of us and ensuring our safety when we were a little overzealous in our attempts. Showing up promptly, attired in a great polo shirt, cap and sunglasses, Clive turned out to be the coolest and most interesting geography and history teacher ever. Clive’s affable personality rejuvenated us, making us feel like old friends. His love of Cape Town was evident. He was very knowledge in so many aspects, able to answer our barrage of questions about the economy and different cultures. Listening to his humorous anecdotes and personal perspective, we feel deeper in love with Cape Town. Following the tour, Clive accompanied us shopping, giving us safety tips and returning us back to our hotel afterwards. Clive’s company was World Class from beginning to end.

Customized tour with the best!!. My husband and I found Clive on TripAdvisor. After contacting Clive, via email, we knew we had chosen well. He is very professional, friendly and easy to work with. He will customize your itinerary to your wants and needs and work with your budget. On our two week trip, we spent 4 nights in Cape Town, 2 nights in the wine country, 4 nights on a safari and 2 nights in Zimbabwe at Victoria Falls. Clive arranged it all and was our personal guide while we were in Cape Town and the wine country. He picked us up at the airport and dropped us back off to continue our trip. Even when we were no longer touring with him in Cape Town, he was still checking up on us to make sure the trip was going well. One of our favorite days with Clive was touring Langa township with him and Godfrey. We love seeing the "real" country and not just the tourist spots. We highly recommend using Clive to see the South Africa you want to see. After spending four days with Clive, we were sad to leave him since he had become a friend and was not just our tour guide. We hope you can come to the States one day Clive, and we can be your guide.

Cape Town with Clive is highly recommended. We have just spent two days in and around the wonderful city of Cape Town. It is so important to find the right way to explore the area. We picked wisely, Clive was reliable, very interesting and a friendly guy to spend our time with. He was careful to tailor the trips around our interests, and was a mine of information on history, culture and had a good sense of humour too. We would recommend him very highly.

Great choise - All in one day. My wife and l made a 9-17h Cape Town One Day with Clive. Just being 3 days in town we said we need help to explore the city. Great decision. Clive made an excellent job showing us all we wanted and needed. He picked us up at our B&B in Camps Bay were we also ended. Clive is great to check everything (viewing points, museums, downtown, markets, castle, table mountain....) very time effective inclucing a great lunch at the Biscuit Mill Markets in Woodstock. He also helped us with great activity hints for our further journey. We would do it again - 5 of 5. Thanks again.
An amazing tour. Must do!. Our experience was just amazing. I will recommend him to any one. He was very knowledgeable and friendly.

Fabulous Cape Town. We recently visited Cape Town for the first time and were blown away by the natural beauty of the city and surrounding area. We also had a marvelous time with Clive as our guide for 3 days. His knowledge of the area and history, appreciation of the variety of cultures and love of the city were apparent and made the visit even more valuable and memorable! We cannot wait to go back and visit Clive and his wonderful city!

BETTER THAN HOPED. Four of us spent 3 great days touring with Clive. We spent a day visiting Cape Town, a second to Cape Point and the third in the wine country.We had read many very positive reviews on Clive and so were anticipating well planned and executed tours. However our time with Clive turned out to be far better than expected.As most folks have stated, he is a terrific tour guide. But, he is also very flexible, willing to adjust to our occasional idiosyncrasies while maintaining a very pleasant style (and a super sense of humour).If you are looking for an outstanding tour guide in this area, do your self a favour and contact Clive.

Private Tour of Cape Town. 'You cannot find better'. Clive and his team are absolutely fantastic ! I am a travel professional and recently visited Cape Town with a small group. Clive met us on arrival at the airport and looked after us so perfectly for our entire stay. Clive's team offer the total package - extensive local knowledge, attention to detail, flexibility, professionalism & punctuality - all delivered in a fun relaxed style. We spent a full day touring Cape Peninsula taking in the beautiful Chapman's Peak drive, saw the Penguins and enjoyed some wine tasting. The next day we were blessed with spectacular views from Table Mountain followed by a city Tour and ended with a visit to Robben Island. Everyone loved Cape Town - thanks to Clive and all at The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. We'll definitely be back !!

Wonderful day with a wonderful Guide. We were very fortunate to have had Clive as our guide in Cape Town for a day. He showed us all of the Peninsula in one smooth and well curated loop. He stopped at many points along the way so that we could take scenic photos (and see a whale!) and he shared stories about the various beaches, neighborhoods, and architecture. He managed to get us to the Cape of Good Hope sign before the throngs of tour groups arrived. We had it all to ourselves! Knowing the area well, he suggested we take a short hike up the cliff for the best views instead of heading to the lighthouse with the masses. On the drive back around the other side of the Peninsula, we stopped at Boulders Beach to see the penguins and grab a quick lunch at a local cafe. He offered to take us to a nicer restaurant but since I'm an active foodie back home in New York, I wanted to focus my time and budget in South Africa on the scenery, animals, and local wine (i.e. things I can't get at home). Little did I know he had such excellent restaurant recommendations. He later emailed a list of his picks. My advice is to listen to his advice.
