After Simonstown, we stopped off at Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden. Clive The Professor continued to teach us about South Africa and its history via lessons in flora. All very interesting! He really knows his stuff. To top off the day, we swung by a wine farm in Constantia. I'd already spent 1.5 days in the winelands of Stellenbosch, Paarl, and Franschhoek but I think this was my favorite tasting stop. On the way back to our hotel, Clive took us to the local shopping center so that we could get a few things. He didn't need to do that. His guiding duties were done but he went out of his way just because he's a good guy. We really enjoyed our day with Clive. Seeing Cape Town and the Peninsula through his eyes made us fall in love with the city. It's now my favorite of all the cities I've visited. Clive taught us a lot about Cape Town and was a great person to spend several hours with. Great sense of humor! We had fun getting to know him and hearing his life story while learning about the history and beauty of Cape Town. It's clear that he loves his city and loves sharing his knowledge and time with travelers. He made sure we experienced the best of the Peninsula while avoiding tourist traps. He's a trustworthy expert. He seems to be very busy with several big projects these days so if you're able to grab one of his free days, consider yourself lucky. We were! Thanks, Clive! You're the best.

Outstanding Tour Guide. Clive spent a full day with us touring the Cape Peninsula and another full day taking us to wine country. He also transported us to/from airport. During all that time, Clive provided personalized service, remained flexible (and patient), and allowed us to add an additional stop (his suggestion, Kirstenbosch Gardens, worth the time). Although we struggled with punctuality, he remained pleasant and helpful. Throughout the time with us, Clive demonstrated a wealth & depth of knowledge. On the day we traveled Cape Point, he took us to the less populated Cape Point area, and met us at the other side, allowing us to hike across the point. He stopped for us to see baboons and ostriches along the way. He took us to a terrific seafood place in Kalk Bay (Harbour House). We saw the penguins at Boulders Beach. We saw all the major sights (we'd already gone to Table Mountain the day before - we knew we could get up in cable car because not too windy, if we'd waited, wouldn't have been able to go, but he had planned to take us there). Again, Clive made sure we knew of the wind issues, and suggested we take the cable car ride if available. He correctly guided us on that one. On the day in wine country, he took us to 3 separate wineries for tastings. All were beautiful and scenic. We stopped in Stellenbosch for lunch allowing us time to wander. He even made us our own little Braai in Franschhoek. He drove us in his Land Rover, so accommodations were comfortable and clean. Clive put up with and answered all our "stupid tourist" questions about the land, people, politics, & geography. Highest recommendation for Clive.

The best travel decision you'll make. We returned on September 13th from our two weeks trip to South Africa. We spent 5 nights in Cape Town. From the first inquiry to Clive via email; I knew we were making an excellent travel decision. I knew this was someone we could trust with enhancing our experience. Clive brought our experience over the top, it was spectacular!! The professionalism was obvious before we even met, and wow! Clive is a down to earth, personable individual who is extremely knowledgable and passionate about what he does. He is the best and coolest history professor we've had . Learning about South Africa and having some first hand accounts was priceless. Clive made sure we had the best time ever!! Words are not even enough to describe how very elated we were to have chosen The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. We didn't feel like we were driving with a tour guide, Clive will quickly connected to the personalities, and we were touring with a friend. My husband had left his jacket behind and Clive did not hesitate to offer his. A thoughtful tour guide? Yesss Although Clive was not available for our first few days of tours, he made sure to send a welcome via email upon our arrival to Cape Town. He checked to make sure we were having a great time. Our guide Rudi was an extension of Clive. When Rudi arrived to pick us up in the early mornings; we always had the most pleasant greeting and we just knew it's going to be a great day. There wasn't a question he couldn't answer and we appreciated the vast amount of knowledge imparted to us. We felt very safe with Rudi as we explored all the places we did. I have to point how he seemed to just enjoy us enjoying ourselves. We had so much laughter. From the breathtaking heights of Table Mountain, Cape Point , Light House, to the treasured opportunity to experience Robben Island, Langa Township and District Six Museum we came home "richer". There was never a dull moment. Clive and Rudi thank you so very much for the best vacation ever!! I wrote 2 previous reviews and lost them to computer crashing; I think I'd written a book haha! I realize I don't have to say too much. See for yourself. Clive will go above and beyond to ensure a safe, pleasant and super enjoyable experience. For example, we'd book our shark dive separately ( before booking with Clive) but asked Clive to extend his services to transport us to and from Gansbaai. Clive went further with this request, he liaison with shark dive company and how awesome was that. Indeed, Clive and Rudi completed our South Africa experience.

My favorite part of our trip!. Planning a trip to South Africa, was at times a bit overwhelming but our best decision of the trip by far was hiring Clive and Godfrey for our time in Cape Town. They were so informative and personable. We enjoyed all their interesting stories and appreciated their willingness to share them.The three days we spent with them included, the history of the country, the politics, breathe-taking sites, wonderful food and tasty wine. They were quite attentive to what we wanted to do and we did not have to worry about anything! Thank you Clive and Godfrey for help to make our trip to South Africa wonderful!

Knowledge Is Power. Clive is a highly professional tour guide who is a "walking encyclopedia!" He shared his extensive knowledge of the history and politics of South Africa, the cultures of the people, the identification of the flora and fauna, and the geography of the country. As a former teacher, he has the knack to engage his clients in continuous learning experiences. As a single traveler, I appreciated his ability to focus on my interests and to expand my understanding of this beautiful area. He added extra surprises during the five days that we traveled together: a traditional 10 course lunch on the beach, a traditional African dinner that he prepared for me, and magnificent photo opportunity stops. In addition to the above, he is an accomplished photographer and offered suggestions to improve my photography skills. As a "backseat" driver, I felt safe at all times as he drove hundreds of kilometers taking me on many adventures. One last comment: he is a creative thinker! We were waiting for a sunrise at the Cape Agulhas lighthouse but the cloud cover remained. When I accepted the fact that we would have only a "moonrise," he jumped out of his Land Rover, and used his iPhone light to simulate a "sunrise."

Custom Gems!. We can't say enough good things about the experience we had with Clive and Godfrey. Both were very professional and personable as they toured us around the city they both love. They customized the tours to fit our style and every recommendation they made was spot on! We enjoyed learning about the history of Cape Town and South Africa and the personal experience of both Clive and Godfrey and how it relates to modern South Africa. This was a fabulous way to end our time in South Africa!

The BEST part of Cape Town!!!. We spent 2 of our 4 days in Cape Town with Clive. We did the Cape of Good Hope Tour/Penguin Beach, and Hermanus Whale Tour with a stop off at Creation Vineyard for a delicious tasting and lunch (one of the best meals we had during our 2 week trip in Africa). Clive was AMAZING to say the least. He was easy going and we enjoyed every minute of each tour. In addition to driving us in his SUV to each location along the way he educated us on the history of South Africa and the significance of each stop we made. I would highly recommend him to anyone who wants to experience the best of Cape Town. We've had many private tour guides around the World and Clive was by far the BEST we have experienced. 10 out of 10!!!!!! It doesn't get better than Clive!

A wonderful week in Capetown!. Along with a group of 4, I went to Capetown for a friend's 30th birthday celebration. She found Clive's company and he was able to give us a little taste of the diverse offerings of the city. We went to Table Mountain, hiking, to the wineries, townships, etc. We went to museums to learn about the cities troubled history and their diverse cultures. We ate at wonderful restaurants (5-star and holes-in-the-wall) and all were amazing. Clive and Godfrey were able to answer many questions, suggest books and documentaries. I would choose them all over again and certainly suggest others to use them during their travels.

Clive is the man, what a great time in SA!. Wow, where do I start! First off Clive was a great tour guide, energetic, passionate and enthusiastic about his work and also South Africa. The group I was traveling with took part in many activities around the Cape Town area. Clive knew all the right things to do as well as all the right places to stay, I highly recommend using The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. Godfrey was also another great addition to Clive and his company. They both are very knowledgeable about various different interests around Cape Town, and they catered all of those to us. Thanks so much Clive, you made my trip to Cape Town South Africa very memorable.

Cape Town Tour Guide Co. does it right!!. It being our first trip to Africa, we decided to spend three days in Cape Town before joining friends for a safari in Botswana. To make the most of our limited time in Cape Town, and based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, we contacted Clive at The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. to arrange some guided tours and are thrilled that we did! Clive promptly responded to our initial email inquiry and offered us several options for private all-day tours during our stay. We elected to spend two days touring with Clive and his colleague, Godfrey, and confirmed our arrangements two months before we arrived in Cape Town. On our first day of touring, Godfrey picked us up at our hotel and took us on a “City and Township” tour that included Table Mountain, Signal Hill, the city center, the Jewish Museum, and at our request, a bicycle shop (we’re both cyclists) to pick-up some South African cycling jerseys. After lunch, we visited the District Six Museum and then took a drive out to Langa, a historic Black African township where 50,000 people live in an area of one square mile.Without a doubt, the township tour was the most fascinating part of the day since it exposed us to the reality of what daily life is like for a large number of South Africans – something that you really can’t understand or appreciate by just visiting the city center and the usual tourist sites. In addition to a visit to a local pub for some “home brew” with men from the township, Godfrey also arranged for us to visit the apartments of some of the township residents as well as a local community center that provides classes and employment opportunities, including a pottery workshop. Our time with Godfrey was not only fun and engaging, but informative and eye-opening as he took special pride in sharing with us his extensive knowledge of Cape Town and the township where he grew up, still resides, and is greeted warmly by seemingly everyone.On our second day of touring, Clive met us at our hotel and we set out on a tour of the Cape Peninsula. During our drive down to the Cape of Good Hope along some truly scenic routes, Clive shared with us some of the history of Cape Town and South Africa and we discovered a common interest in cycling. Our trip back included stops in Simon’s Town to visit the penguin colony, Kalk Bay for a tasty seaside lunch, Constantia for a wine tasting at the Groot Constantia winery (South Africa’s oldest), and Bishopscourt for a tour of Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden. Considering that we had opted not to spend a day touring the wine lands near Cape Town, visiting the winery was an unexpected treat.The highlights of the day for us included visiting the penguin colony and encountering other wildlife, including a troop of baboons, in the Cape nature reserve. While our time with Clive was spent visiting somewhat traditional tourist sites, it was no less enjoyable or informative than the time we spent with Godfrey. Clive is a very knowledgeable and personable guide and he did a terrific job of showing us what the Cape Peninsula has to offer and spontaneously adapting the tour to our requests and preferences.Clive and Godfrey are both knowledgeable and personable tour guides. They’re a terrific team and you won’t regret booking your Cape Town tours with them!
Clive, you rock!. Best guide ever!You toke us on a journey we'll never forget. If anyone could control and facinate our 'animated' group, it was you!Thnx 4 T trip!

This is a No Brainer. Clive and Godfrey may not be the only folks you can turn to in order to appreciate Cape Town and its surroundings, but we cannot imagine anyone doing it better. They are an exceptional team. Godfrey gave us great insight into the lives of those who have struggled so long to reach equality, and showed us first-hand the proud way they live their lives today. Clive was a most knowledgeable and friendly guide not only to Cape Town itself, but to so many areas between the city and the Cape of Good Hope. In addition, we were faced with weather that was not the best, and the way they were able to change on the fly and adjust our itinerary in the short two days we had was really remarkable. Anyone going to Cape Town and its environs, whether for the first time or the fifth, will appreciate what these two talented, interesting and enjoyable people can do for you. If we make a visit again, we will use Clive and Godfrey again, this time for a longer time.

Clive De Bruyne--the Best!. I cant imagine a better tour guide than Clive. He greeted us late in the evening after a long flight and treated us like royalty. His knowlegde of the area was exceptional and his tour very comfortable and informative. We highly reccommend Clive to anyone that will be travelling to Capetown and can't wait to return ourselves.

Great experience and lovely guide. Our 10 days stayin Cape Town was a beautiful experience. Clive was great at planning our itinerary, taking into consideration our request and needs. He has made it extra special customising our tours that suited our 5 year old son who bonded so well both with Clive and Godfrey. We enjoyed the tours and their hospitality. We were impressed with Clive as he articulated not just the touristic bits but he helped us understand the geography, the socio-politics, and the people in the cape. This was meaningful to us. We wouldn't have planned it any way better. We have brought home great memories that will remain close to us. Truly enjoyed Clive's professional help as our guide. Tot ons weer ontmoet, Clive!

Fantastic guide!. Clive was brilliant! He put together a great two day itinerary for my wife, myself and our three boys in and around Cape Town. He was incredibly thoughtful, very informative, great with the boys and just a pleasure to spend time with.He was also happy to change arrangements on the fly, including rejigging the itinerary when the weather changed. We could not recommend him highly enough. Thank-you so much Clive for a really great trip.

Wonderful trip, great guide. It was our first time in South Africa. Clive was an excellent guide to show us the best of Cape Town. We had a great time touring the Cape with Clive. He recommended and organized our trip to Sanbona Game Reserve, where we got an excellent 3 nights real safari experience close to Cape Town. All together it was end up to be very memorable trip thanks to Clive.

Just amazing!. Clive is the best gide i ever had! He is funny and makes lots of jokes, the explanations are not to long so you don't get bored. In the evening he always chose nice clean restaurants with exellent food. This trip to cape town was wonderfull. Thanks

Great trip, great guide. It was an amazing trip i enjoyed it. Only the first day was a bit rough because of the fact that we woke up at 4 AM to get on the plane. The guide was especially exquisite, he was fun to be around and he selected the best places to visit.

Wonderful experience in South Africa. We got in touch with Clive as per our friends' recommendation to help us organize a day in Cape Town followed by safari. Clive organised a wonderful trip to Kapama lodge for us, including airport transfer, direct tickets and detailed description of our program. He was very patient helping us make choices and adjusting the program which turned out to be an amazing experience. He has also gave us a wonderful tour of Cape Town. Even though the weather conditions did not allow us to do the initially planned route, Clive was well prepared to suggest us other options and we spent an unforgettable day in Cape Town. Clive and his colleague Godfree are very professional, knowledgeable and friendly people. We have learnt a lot about local history, culture and nature from them. We are very grateful for this amazing trip, thank you!
Best guide in Cape Town. Cape Town came alive in the hands of our guide Clive...I highly recommend him and I highly recommend Cape Town, it is a wonderful city.

The Cape Town Tour Guide Co.. We asked Clive to arrange a garden route tour for a party of four, collecting us from Port Elizabeth and taking us to Cape Town with an additional Cape Peninsula tour later in the week. From start to finish Clive prepared and organised a fantastic trip for us including overnight stops in Knysna and Oudtshoorn. His knowledge of the region's history, geography, flora and fauna were outstanding. He was so easy going, understanding and flexible, tailoring the trip to our every need. Clive has a good sense of humour and a lovely personality. We couldn't have asked for a better guide. We certainly had five star treatment. We have no hesitation in recommending him and his company to anyone wishing to travel in South Africa. Thank you Clive for a holiday of a lifetime.

Wonderful way to experience Cape Town. My husband and I booked a three day tour of cape town with Clive in November 2013 and we are so happy that we did. Clive arranged for us to hit all of the highlights in the three days. On the first day Godfrey was our guide and we spent our day seeing Table Mountain, touring Cape Town and then going to the Township. The Township was such a different experience and I highly recommend it. In the township we went to a school and went to a local pub. These were such memorable experiences that could not have been had without Godfrey who is a resident of the township.Day two was a tour of the Cape with Clive. We were lucky to have a beautiful day and had a wonderful day touring the cape. We saw all of the major attractions of cape point and we had lunch at a lovely restaurant. Clive as a great guide and was very accommodating. On day three we had our vineyard tour. We visited a number of wonderful vineyards and had a terrific day. We also had another fabulous lunch.Clive and Godfrey were both knowledgeable and so easy to talk to. We were lucky that the weather was amazing for all three days. If you go to Cape Town I HIGHLY recommend that you book a three day tour because it gives you the best of all that Cape Town has to offer!

First Class Tour Guides. Where do I begin? My husband and I took a 3 week tour of South Africa and surrounds this summer. We researched private tour guides extensively on TripAdvisor and decided on The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. I sent Clive a long email telling him a little about myself and my husband and detailing our interests. He responded promptly, and told us what was and was not feasible for our very short two day stay in Cape Town. I was impressed because it was very clear to me that he had taken the time to read the email and set up an itinerary based on this. Since we were interested in touring a township, he sent his partner, Godfrey, to take us around. Our tour with Godfrey was by far the best tour that we had in all of South Africa. He and Clive set up a perfect, whirlwind tour for us, and it was quite apparent that they care about what they do. Godfrey was extremely knowledgeable and excited about his city. And he made us feel very comfortable and welcome. He also went out of his way to assist us with some short-notice airline tickets (which we realize that he did not have to do). Before we met Godfrey, we sere worried because we had a late night flight into CapeTown and were concerned that no one would be waiting for us at the airport. To our relief, Godfrey was patiently and prompltly waiting for us in the arrivals hall. He took us to our hotel and got us settled in. And he was waiting in the hotel lobby for us bright and early the following morning. We did an all day City/ Langa Township Tour. We even drove out to the Kalk Bay Fishing Village and had lunch at one of the local restaurants. It was raining all day and too overcast to see or visit Table Mountain; however, the next day when we were on the way to the airport, the sun came out, and we saw Table Mountain in all of its glory. Godfrey was kind enough to pull off the road so that we could take pictures. However, the absolute highlight of the tour was the Langa Township. My husband and I love to interact with local people when we travel, and thanks to Godfrey, we had a splendid time "hanging out" in the Township. Godfrey still lives in the Township, so he took us all around, introducing us to his friends and giving us the history. We went to a pub where the men socialize, and homemade beer is served. A large bucket of the stuff is passed around, and everyone drinks from the bucket. I was a little hesitant, but my husband jumped right in. He entertained the men, and brought the house a round of beer (it only cost about $2 US). This was his favorite part of the tour. He was laughing and joking with the men (and flirting with the barmaid) and having a wonderful time. Thanks to Godfrey, we have such fond memories of that day.Thanks to Godfrey, when it was time to leave, we knew that Cape Town was one city that we would visit again in the future (we travel extensively, and there are very few places that we both agree that we must see again). And in keeping with his great sense of hospitality, Godfrey didn't just drop us off at the airport, he got us checked in and walked us to the security line to make sure we did not lose our way.I cannot say enough good things about The Cape Town Tour Co. Finally, I must add that although we did not meet Clive in person, my husband and I feel like we know him. He is a very honorable person who takes pride in providing excellent service. When we returned to the States, he assisted us with a problem that we were having regarding a transaction that we made with a different vendor while we were in Cape Town. He went out of his way to get the problem solved (although it was not his problem), and he continued to follow up with us until everything was right. How often do you find people like that?If you are ever planning to visit Cape Town, make it your priority to take a tour with Clive and Godfrey. You will not be disappointed!

Minnesota ladies. I and two friends had just completed an exhausting two weeks of mobile camp safari in Botswana and added 3 days in Cape Town before heading back to the cold Minnesota winter. We couldn't have asked for better guides than Clive de Bruyne and his associate Godfrey, to bring the history, culture and natural beauties of the Cape to life for us. Clive was especially wonderful in that he took great care to be helpful to us where the terrain was especially difficult for our physical capabilities. I would not hesitate to recommend his services to anyone interested in visiting Cape Town and the surrounding sights.

What you get when you hire Cape Town Tour Guide?. You get Clive and colleagues and they are committed to you before, during and after your trip, 24/7! You get a team who is very experienced, flexible and enthusiastic. Arrangements were all made by Clive and were nearly perfect. He is determined to get you the best experience as a visitor to South Africa and he did that for our group.

If you want the best tour guide in Capetown...Clive is your man.. Clive de Bruyne was our tour guide in Capetown for our family of five. He was the BEST!!! He accomodated all of our requests and was extremely fun. He was knowledgable, personable, and took care of all of our needs. Our family adored him and we are hoping we can host him in Colorado. By the time we left we felt we were leaving a good friend. He was great with the kids (ages 16-22) and truly made a difference in their lives by sharing his views. His love of South Africa was apparent and he is someone that is making a difference there now. We loved him. Our trip would not have been the same without him.

Kalahari tour. We had a thoroughly enjoyable 10 day tour with Clive - excellent organisation, comfortable vehicle and good cooking in his potjei pot, even for vegetarians! He was very knowledgeable about the geography and geology of the area, as well as wild-life and plants. He planned the itinerary around our requests and this tour was the highlight of our month in South Africa. Every day we had an unexpected "bonus", whether it was seeing the cheetah or African wild cat or sunrise over the Kalahari and the final day's bonus was the cave paintings. Absolutely amazing!He has a very good sense of humour and was very considerate of all our needs. We highly recommend him.

superb tour guide. We are traveling a lot .We had many tour guides in the past.Clive was the best guide we ever had.friendly,knowledgeable,smart and highly professional.To make a long story short, Clive is recommened with no objections to the ones who want the best treatment.

Clive ROCKS !!1. I brought a small group of friends to discover my original homeland of South Africa. Clive de Bruyne was assigned as our personal guide for 5 days while in Cape Town and the wine country. He was loved by all and became more of a member of our group than "our guide". He is personable, funny, super smart and more importantly, just a really, really nice guy. We left a friend when we said goodbye....a friend that hopefully I will keep for many years to come.

Cape Town Tour Guide Company Fantastic!. Just completed a 3 day visit with Clive and and Godfrey at the Cape Town Tour Guide Company.I use private guides wherever I travel and am use to a high level of service. This is why someone uses a private tour guide instead of a group tour.Well, our experience with Clive and Godfrey could not have been any better. In fact in was fantastic! Clive contacted me back very quickly after I initially emailed him. I told him what I wanted to do and he and Godfrey took me to every place on my wish list and more. We learned so much about Cape Town, South Africa and of the people that live there. We also had a wonderful experience visiting the Langa Township. And folks...if you go..bring some school supplies for the kids in the kindergarten. we got to meet a lot of the people and Godfrey took me into a local " bar" run by two women where we had a nice time with the patrons. it was an experience that will never be forgotten.Clive went out of his way to take us to wonderful places, great restaurants and went above and beyond the call of duty as we drove around looking for a specific candy that was requested back home. We also had some great whale watching...they just knew where to "look" and we found them.So, I just wanted to share this experience with all of you since I get so many of my travel ideas from trip advisor.

Clive is the best!. I have just returned from a trip to South Africa with a group of ten friends. We spent 4 or 5 days in Cape Town and had Clive as our tour guide for the entire time. Not only was Clive just a joy to spend time with, he was also incredibly professional, attentive and knowledgeable. And, keeping a group of ten people together, organized, and happy is not an easy task! I can't recommend Clive more highly.

Excelent. Spent two great days in Cape Town had a wonderful time , booking Cape Town Tour Guide made our stay very pleasant and comfortable our trip was scheduled to fit our wishes this two guys are courteos knowledgable and very professional. Highly recommended

Wonderful Experience with Clive De Bruyne at The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. My wife and I and another couple travelled to Cape Town on 31/7/2013 from Australia and experienced the professionalism, humour, knowledge, friendship and personalised service from Clive at The Cape Town Tour Co.We contacted Clive in 2012 and from his prompt and well worded email reply,we were confident Clive would live up to the reviews we had previously read in Trip Advisor. I recommend readers contact Clive well in advance of travel to assure them of his availability as he is in high demand.We had arranged for Clive to meet us at the airport and what a delight to have a smiling reception by Clive and to be driven to our secure accommodation at Lawhill Apartments in the V & A Waterfront.Over the next three days we received personalised tours to the Stellenbosch Wine District with wine tastings at Ernie Els and Hidden Valley Wineries, followed by lunch at Delaire Graff Estate Restaurant, followed by shopping for the ladies and the Franschhoek Motor Museum for the guys.The following day, Clive's business partner, Godfrey took us on private tour of Cape Town, including the District 6 Museum where we learnt about the victims of the apartheid era and the forced removal through the racially divisive Group Areas Act. This was followed by a visit to Langa which was a suburb established and designated for Black Africians before apartheid. Godfrey was born in Langa and was able to show us Community Projects to assist the locals who live in impoverished and cramped 'shacks' and often three and four families in cheap unit dwellings.In saying that just about everyone, especially the children had a smile and seemed happy in their environment.This was followed by a drive to Signal Hill and a pleasant hour or so wandering through the Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens.On the third day , Clive drove us via Chapman's Peak to The Cape of Good Hope where we went on a 4klm but pleasant walk along the cliff coastline before visiting a Penguin Colony followed by lunch at Harbour House Restaurant, Kalk Bay.Clive also collected us in his luxury 4WD on our departure from Cape Town and delivered us to the Rovos Train for our onward journey.A big Thankyou Clive and Godfrey for making our five day Cape Town visit a lasting memory.Sel and Jill HardyGold Coast Australia

A HUGE Thank you Clive for an AMAZING time.. I have just returned from a trip to beautiful Cape Town with mother and teenage daughter.We booked The Cape Town Tour Guide Company for two days and it was the best thing we did.Clive was fabulous, a lovely guy who was not only proffesional but also extremely knowledgeable.He tailored our tours to suit all three different age groups.If you want a tour guide go no further you can't get any better.We will be back!

Spectacular Time with Cape Town Tour Guide Co.. We were two middle aged couples touring Capetown and the wine area with Clive De Bruyne of The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. Most of our time was spent with Clive; our township tour was led by his wonderful colleague, Godfrey. Our visit was fabulous! Clive planned a great tour in Capetown - a mix of beautiful scenery, walks and drives, lush gardens, inspired contemporary art galleries. Lunch spots were well chosen. The township tour was eye-opening and worthwhile. We toured impressive wineries, sampled great wines and cuisine in the wine district, and enjoyed every minute of our entire stay! Clive was attentive, knowledgable, punctual, and fun to be around. At the end of the six days, we all felt as though he had become a good friend, and we will return to see him again in the future.

Cape Town Tour Guide. I just NEED to mention a particular tour guide,his name Greg Couzens; he was our tour guide with a group.Just finished our trip yesterday.This men could not have been more honest,professional and REAL.His know how is great and only surpassed by his personal attention and HONESTY.We had a problem at the end of our trip,he escorted just the two of us to the Airport,help tremendously and refused a tip because we had already tipped with the rest of the group.No one would have known about this had he taken the money.Very few like this men left and if any one needs help touring in Cape Town we can recommend him with NO reservations.You will have FUN,good information and for sure HONESTY.

Thank you Clive! Our tours were wonderful. If you want to deal with one of the most professional tour guiders in Cape Town, then seek out Clive De Bruyne from Cape Town Tour Guide Co. And here is the amazing part: I never did actually MEET Clive. Instead, he organized our entire visit without us actually meeting him. He was unable to lead our tour, so he set up a wonderful guide named Yolanda for our Private Cape Peninsula Tour and our drive to Gondwana, and Godfrey for our Private Cape Town City and Cultural Township Tour. We are planning to use the two of them the next time we return, but I would definitely book my entire tour with Clive. Thank you so much for all of your excellent advise and guidance. We had the most remarkable vacation. See you next year!

Great Cape Town Tour. We recently had the pleasure of spending 5 days in Cape Town , South Africa with The Cape Town Tour Guide Co., owned and operated by Clive De Bruyne. Form our first email "interview" with Clive, we were convinced he would be able to satisfy our requests for our time in Cape Town. There were 3 couples traveling together all arriving at different times (and days). All the arrivals were met at the airport and brought to our hotel (Victoria and Albert) in a comfortable Mercedes van by Godfrey, Clive's associate. We had requested several activities including strenuous hikes up Table Mountain and at the Cape, ocean kayaking to visit the penguin colonies, and bicycle touring in Stellenbosch. Clive arranged and participated in all of these. Other highlights of the time here were a trip to Robben Island, impressive wine tasting (that included chocolate pairings!), and a personal tour of Langa Township with Godfrey. My wife's birthday was the 2nd day of our visit, and Clive arranged a surprise birthday party at a beautiful vista precisely at sunset with wine and unbelievable cupcakes. From beginning to end, pick-up to drop-off, our Cape Town experience was seamless. Thanks to Clive and Godfrey we will have many fond memories of Cape Town.

Active Cape Town. Rick F.Our group of six seniors wanted an active - interactive Cape Town experience. Clive did an outstanding job in arranging this. We hiked Cable Mountain (twice!), biked in wine country, kayaked, toured a township (on foot), visited Robbins Island, hiked the very southern tip of the cape, and toured the city. Clive took care of every detail and was with us every step of the way. All issues were handled with professionalism, understanding, and skill. Clive is highly knowledgable, personable, and fun to be with.We had a fantastic six days and left Cape Town feeling that we had truly experienced the area - all thanks to Clive and his staff.

Cape Town City Tour and Cape Point Tour. We had 4 days in Cape Town with my husband and parents before we went on safari in Botswana. We contacted Clive to take us on tour for 2 days. The first day Clive took us up to Table Mountain on a gorgeous sunny morning and then drove and walked us through the city. He is a knowledgeable and considerate host who made sure everyone was seeing what they wanted and having a good time. Clive's partner Godfrey took us to a neighbouring Township Langa where he lived where we got to see the other side of South Africa, it was a great experience. Got to meet local South Africans and see how they live outside the city. The second day we had a lovely scenic drive along the coast of Cape Point and the Peninsula. Stopped at the Cape of Good Hope, Simon's Beach, had a lovely lunch at a seaside restaurant and headed back to the city. On the way back he took us to Kirstenbosch Gardens because he knew my mother had a interest in plants. He gave us a private tour of the gardens and pointed out many of the area's native and more interesting flora.We have a lovely visit to Cape Town and I would recommend Clive's services. He showed us a lovely time and we got to see all the sights we wanted in the short time we had. I highly recommend a private tour with Clive as he was able to cater to our interests and pace, we never felt rushed and he answered all our questions with great patience. He certainly knows his stuff!
top Tours. Thanks Clive for fantastic trip tour - its a must to do guided tour as one doesn't get full benefit of the Cape without the specialised impute ... highly recommended
Excellent Tours. Clive does an outstanding job giving tours of Cape Town. His expertise of the city is unmatched. I'd highly recommend his services.

Amazing experience!. Clive was amazingly helpful in helping me plan a week-and-a-half long trip through Cape Town, the Garden Route and Kruger. He took everything into account and kept tweaking our plans until they were perfect (including picking out a place to have dinner for my mother's birthday, etc.) He also was able to find last-minute reservations at a BEAUTIFUL safari lodge that we loved. I was living in Cape Town at the time, and he even scheduled a meeting with me before my family arrived to go over the itinerary in person. We weren't able to have Clive as our guide on our trip, but every guide we had - Rian, Yolanda and Godfrey - was so nice, friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. In particular, we loved Yolanda. We were with her for several days and by the end felt like she was part of the family. I would definitely recommend this company to anyone!

Above and beyond expectations. After reading the number of positive reviews, I was quite confident when booking with Clive. Suffice it to say that we were not disappointed. From the outset, Clive's communication over email was great, and he answered all my questions thoughtfully. We spent the first day and a half with Godfrey, getting oriented with the city and then touring the Cape itself. I will credit him for making the sun shine when the rain seemed impossibly imminent ;). It was great to hear his perspectives and he did well to keep us on schedule without making us feel rushed... It is a pretty full day tour, after all!We spent the next day with Clive in the wine country. He selected a couple great vineyards to visit. What I appreciated the most, besides his informative and easy-going nature, was his flexibility. You can tell he really wants the trip to be tailored to your own interests. He truly went above and beyond, however, at the end of our day when he suggested we try to get up Table Mountain on the way back to our hotel, knowing that the weather had spoiled our plans a couple days earlier. After racing up the hill to get us there just before the cable car closed for the day, he patiently waited while we experienced a spectacular sunset from atop the mountain. I can't thank him enough, as this is one of those memories I will always cherish, and the resulting photographs will hang on my wall for years to come. While he could easily have headed home on time, Clive voluntarily extended his day for our benefit. This should speak to the client-centered philosophy that his company has.Book with Clive, you won't be disappointed!

My expectations were exceeded. The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. organized a fabulous three and half day tour of Cape Town for my wife and I. We arrived to Cape Town three hours later than expected but our tour guide, Roelof, kept in contact with us and tracked our flight arrival online and was at the airport when we arrived. I thought we would have to miss out on the first tour due to our delay but that was not the case because Roelof extended his day and gave us a complete city tour. My wife and I had a wonderful time. I think my favorite part was the chocolate tasting. Roelof was outstanding. We could not have asked for a better tour guide. He is very knowledgeable and easy to talk to. After such a long day on our third day I thought for sure Roelof had enough driving and talking and the next thing I knew he was driving us to an area to watch the sunset on the beach.  I am so glad I asked my colleauge for his Cape Town tour guide contact. I highly recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. and I will recommend that anyone going to Cape Town organize their tour with this company and their awesome tour guides. Tony Martinez

The best tour guide in Capetown. This was our first trip to Cape Town and we had read a lot of information about what to do .It seemed to us a good idea to get a private tour guide so we could cover as many attractions as possible .We travelled as a family of 5 including 3 adult children aged 23,20and 15 ,we would never normally do tours on holiday our usual holiday was 2 weeks on the beach so I was a little unsure if the children would enjoy this type of experience .I did not need to worry ,from the first day that Clive picked us up for our Wine Tour he had everyone listening and interested in his amazing knowledge of his country and stories of CapeTown and life there .He took us to a charming boutique vineyard first and then on to the amazing Graff Estate for lunch with a couple of other wine tastings after lunch thrown in for good measure .We then went on to a Cheetah sanctuary to pet Cheetahs ,one of the family's many highlights on our trip .He organised shark cage diving for us at Gansbai which my children will remember for a long time coming up close to great whites !The company that he used were so professional and were clearly the best .We were collected for our next 2 trips by Clives coleage Godfrey he was equally charming and knowledgeable and had a great sense of humour .He took us on a Cape Point Tour keeping us to our schedule but not rushing us so we got to see everything and finally taking us to a fabulous restaurant to finish .Our last tour was to a private game reserve which Godfrey drove us to ,we felt safe and in good hands at all times .On the way home we made an impromptu stop at his Township where he was bought up and still lives and met his adorable son.Although I was very nervous to go there my children wanted to go and it was a very humbling experience for us I am very glad I did ,Godfrey was chatting and waving to friends and family along the way .So if you are thinking shall I take a tour with Clive and The Cape Town Tour Guide Co stop thinking and do it now it is one of the best things I have ever done .There are not enough superlatives to describe these people charming ,friendly ,knowledgeable ,interesting, and so on .Thank you Clive and Godfrey I will recommend you to everyone I meet .The Willis family UK

Clive comes highly recommended. We planned a return trip to South Africa after being away for almost 9 years, with two friends. We arranged for the Cape Point, Cape Town City, Cape Winelands tour and 3 day Garden Route tour with Clive, including a cage diving experience with great whites. We were a little apprehensive at first about spending so much time with Clive, not knowing what to expect. Our seven days spent with Clive was absolutely fantastic! From the moment he picked us up at the hotel, it was evident that he is extremely courteous and professional but also a very easy going and personable guy with a great sense of humor. He is extremely knowledgeable and he educates and entertains along the way in a humorous and friendly manner. His experience and knowledge of the various places, history, nature, politics, economics, restaurants, and other activities; as well as his flexibility and ability to assess the interests of his guests quickly, allows him to customize an experience that exceeds expectations and thoroughly entertains. On many occasions, Clive went out of his way and above and beyond to provide an extremely personalized touring experience.His restaurant selections were on the mark with amazing choices for delicious meals and sunset cocktails. His accommodation choices along the Garden Route were quaint and impeccable with incredible attention to detail and fantastic service. His conversation and sense of humor will be missed! Clive comes highly recommended!

Best Private Tour Guide in South Africa. We 1st used Clive in 2011 (Cape Tour & Winelands Tour) and had such a fantastic time, he inspired us to return, this time with 2 of our children(aged 19 & 24). Having experienced Ernie Els Vinyard on the Winelands tour of 2011, I asked Clive if he could get me a case of "Big Easy" which he had ready for me when we arrived. This time we repeated the Cape Tour and also asked Clive to organise a Great White Shark cage diving trip at nearby Gansbaii, the world famous Shark Allley. This was the highlight of the holiday - the kids are still buzzing about it 2 weeks later! Clive takes the time to understand you and what you want from your trip and never fails to deliver, always exceeding your expectations. His knowledge and his enthusiasm for his country and its history, warts and all, will inspire you to return. Be warned though, he also has a wicked sense of humour. Don't fall for his baboon stunt on the Cape Tour like I did, much to the amusement of my family!! The dive team he used were the best available and the restaurants he selected were excellent. Clive is ably assisted at CTTGC by Godfrey. It was Godfrey who took us cage diving. Godfrey is also excellent, he comes from and still lives in a township just outside Cape Town and he compliments Clive perfectly. The story of when he met Nelson Mandela in his township was truly inspiring. Without a doubt, Clive is the best Private Tour Guide in SA and has left us twice now with unforgettable memories and a burning desire to return yet again for more "Clive Time" Mark, Ruth, Jenny & Matty Gibson

The best guide we've had in a lifetime. It was a 4-day private tour Cape - Oudshoorn - Knysna - Cape. Clive was an absolutely wonderful guide - friendly, highly intelligent, knowledgeable about his country, its nature and history. The choice of hotels and restaurants was excellent. Our guide was also very flexible and considerate: on many occasions he met our wishes to change the pre-arranged tour program. For 4 days, without breaks, he kept us a most interesting company, and we felt like talking to him for ever - so attractive his personality is.As a result, this tour has become a most memorable holiday event.My wife and myself would like to heartily thank Clive for those four unforgettable days in March 2013 and recommend him to others as the best possible choice of a private guide in SA, and probably not only there!Michael & Julia BogdanovMoscow, Russia

Best Private Tour Guide in Cape Town. Our first trip to Cape Town was made most memorable by the excellent itinerary arranged by Clive and his staff. From our arrival to our departure, Clive and his staff were available to help and inform us of how best to enjoy this beautiful city and its environs. We were able to modify and add to our trip because of the flexibility that is available with Clive and his group. He is knowledgeable about all things Cape Town and is happy to share his knowledge with you!! He and his staff are the reason we look forward to returning to Cape Town!

Trip of a lifetime. Our group of wine lovers have traveled all over the world in search of great food, wine and adventure. I can't begin to tell you how we loved the itinerary Clive led us on, from a township day and a visit to a self funded day care center to some of the most beautiful beaches and wineries in the world. Clive has a calling and it is to show visitors the real South Africa and help us all to understand this country, with all its warts, and why it is a must see destination.Our final destination was the Inyati Game reserve and its was just spectacular.We have had some great guides around this planet but Clive's sense of humor and deep understanding of his country made this a trip of a lifetime.

What a terrific man and excellent tour guide!. I just returned from an 18 day trip with 6 friends to South Africa. Five of those days were spent in and around Cape Town. Trans Africa arranged for Clive to be our guide for those days and he was nothing short of perfect. Knowledgable, personable, respectful, adaptable, funny, kind and enthusiastic were just some of his attributes. We had a fantastic time and it was in large part due to Clive. Every detail of our day trips (including: the wine country, Robben Island, Cape of Good Hope, tour of Cape Town and environs, Table Mountain, Kirstenbosch Gardens, District Six Museum...) was covered. We simply showed up and enjoyed every minute. On our last day we had arranged a tour of Gugelethu, and Godfrey joined Clive for the tour. Godfrey's experience and knowledge of the townships provided us with much information about the history, as well as present life, in the townships. I know I speak for our group when I say that we would highly recommend Clive as a tour guide... he loves Cape Town and South Africa and you will too!

Cape of Good Hope. Many thanks to Roelf with The Cape Town Tour Guide Company for a wonderful day in and around the Cape of Good Hope. Roelf was a delightful guide and great fun to be with---not to mention being extremely knowledable about the region, particularly the flora and fauna. He let us set the pace, spending more time at places that interested us, less at places that didn't. Our tour was the day before the 35,000 rider Cape Argus bike race (which Roelf was riding in by the way) so there were literally thousands of riders out on the roads the day of our tour. Thank goodness he was driving--no way I could have done it myself. Anyway, kudos (and a strong recommendation) for Roelf and the Cape Town Tour Company!

excellent tour guide. We took the plunge and booked two days of private tour guiding from Clive and it was excellent.Clive is a superb guide and finds ways to feed in extra viewpoints, extra things. He seems to know every relevant subject inside out and will tailor the tour to suit whatever you are interested in. We intend to use Clive again when we go back.

Top notch service. I just recently returned from my trip to South Africa with fond memories. Many of them were provided by the excellent tour guide services provided by this company. We had Yolanda as our primary guide and Godfrey for the tour of Langa township. Yolanda is very energetic and informative. She took us on the Cape Peninsula tour and then on another day to the wine country. She has a terrific sense of humor and is very adept at dealing with people. I had a blast with her. I am not always the easiest person to please as I have strong opinions but she was absolutely game for the task,.Godrey was hired to take me and my friend through the Langa township. He is a resident of the township which gives him entree that you won't find with other guides. He is serious but fun and managed to give us a full history of the township in a matter of a few hours. We met a few locals and visited a kindergarten class full of the sweetest children you could meet. This is a first class operation.

Fabulous Peninsula tour. Our Peninsula tour was fantastic. Our guide, Yolanda, was great fun and very informative. We never felt rushed and had a great day exploring the beautiful peninsula.Would definitely recommend the company.
Perfect day.. Just finished a day tour. Absolutely perfect! Clive was well organized, knowledgable, and friendly. I've used many tours around the world and he is one of the best.

Fabulous Cape Town. Excellent! Clive is the ideal guide and prepared a flawless itinerary; it was perfect for our needs and wants. Traveling with my 18 year old daughter. 5 day visit to Cape Town included a tour of Robben Island, time on the V&A Waterfront, guided drive around Cape of Good Hope, cage diving with the great whites, mountain biking and wine tasting in Stellenbosch, hike up Table Mountain, time spent in one of the local townships. Clive was excellent, he has incredible knowledge of Cape Town, its history, and surrounding areas. Clive took us to locals spots and treated us wonderfully. Highly recommend!

Luxembourg o.p.v.i.visit. I visited Cape Town with a group of Vintners from Luxembourg in Jan-Feb 2013.Clive was recommended by a friend,and all the correspondance was done by mail.From our arrival to the day of our departure Clive and his team did an outstanding job.The organization was great,and our tour guide(Silke )was outstanding.Always willing to help,and during our many km`s of travelling,a wealth of information about South Africa and its history.a group of 30 tourists is no easy deal,and Clive and his team just did so so well.I would recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide Co any day.Once again,well done Clive and Team to a job well done.Hope we see one another again.Till such time.Andy

Thanks for an amazing time in South Africa!. We travelled as a group of 30 people to South Africa end of January 2013 and Clive welcomed us with a glass of Champaign at the top of the Table Mountain... an breathtaking moment and the start of an amazing tour through this beautiful country. He had organized a very unique and unforgettable travel program, we spent a few days in Cape Town before leaving to the Garden Road until Knysna, everything went so well and in those few days we could not have discovered more. We met so many nice people on beautiful wine estates, they all gave us a very warm welcome, that was really great. A special thanks to Silke, our german tour guide, who also did a fantastic job. Both, Silke and Clive, are very friendly and professional, they took so good care of every single detail and made our trip to South Africa so special. THANK YOU!

Very nice Tour with the Luxembourg Winemakers
Cliff you made a good Job
I wish you all the best
Greatings from Luxembourg. Very nice Cape Town and also Greating to SilkeHope to see you again in Cape Town or perhaps in Luxemburg.All the best for you

Nothing but praise for the Cape Town Tour Guide Company. I traveled to Cape Town for my 40th birthday, Jan 20-27, 2013. I booked the Cape Town Tour Guide Company for two full days of touring for myself and my friend. On the first day, we met with Clive De Bruyne. First, let me say that Clive is just an all around nice guy. He is very pleasant, professional, mannerable, and extremely knowledgeable. Clive knows a lot about Cape Town's history, geography, government, culture and economics. He was eager to share his knowledge with us and we took it all in!In all, we traveled along Chapman’s Peak Drive and came across several groups of wild baboons, visited the Cape Point Ostrich Farm, took a 45 minute hike at Cape Point itself, viewed penguins at Boulders Beach, and toured and walked Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens. In the middle of it all, we even managed to have a quaint lunch with Clive at a superb restaurant with excellent food and a stunning view of the ocean.On the second day, we ventured off with Godfrey to the District 6 Museum and then a guided tour of the Langa township. This tour was intense and enlightening. In Langa, we visited several homes, a local pub, and took fruit to children at a local school. We walked around, while Godfrey gave his insights about township life in general, as he is a resident of Langa. We ended the day with the best meal I had during my entire visit, lunch at the Lelapa Restaurant in Langa. Absolutely delicious food with a huge variety of dishes - while listening to a live marimba band. It was absolutely perfect!Clive and Godfrey get nothing but praise from me. Five star service. Highly recommended!

The Best!. We spent 4 nights in Cape Town and 1.5 days with Clive, plus he arranged our Robben Island trip. He tailored our days to suit our interests. Clive also telephoned restaurants to make reservations for us and suggested places to eat.... He was very efficient in dealing with our initial enquiries and was always polite and prompt. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend him. He is very knowledgable and a very interesting young man.

Excellent Tour Guide!!!. We were on our honeymoon and went to cape town for 4 days we had an amazing time with Clive, our guide.. He showed us the city old and new, suburbs and city, most unbelivable food, views, nice company really a good service!

Great/knowledgeable tour guide. We spent a one-day tour of Cape Town with Clive and it was a great use of our time and money. Clive was very knowledgeable about Cape Town and all the places we visited. We also were pretty much in control the whole day to determine if we wanted to spend more time at any one place or leave early, which is a great pro over the group tours which have strict agendas. He was also very friendly which made the day fun for us! Highly recommended for any tours you are considering. We will definitely explore more with Clive the next time we are in town.

Exceptional service all round - highly recommended. I chose Clive because I was impressed by his Trip Advisor reviews and felt he knew his stuff! Once in email contact, his quick, efficient and informative replies to my queries and demands was exemplary and I felt confident we would be in good hands. I had warned Clive that I am very demanding and my restricted mobility might cause us some difficulties during our tours. During our three full days of tours, Clive anticipated every obstacle for me and tailored every excursion to suit my needs perfectly. Not only is he extremely knowledgable about the history, flora and fauna of the region, he is remarkably intuitive when it comes to his clientele. He found us some lovely restaurants for lunch as well as wonderfully uncrowded locations to stop for photographs along the routes. Best of all, he took us to a charming winery on our wine tasting tour that specialises in matching wines to Belgian handmade chocolates - at this point, I ran out of superlatives to applaud his tour planning skills! The tour of Langa township with Clive's friend Godfrey, whose Mother still lives there, was truly inspirational. I will go back again when we revisit. There is so much there to see and to experience, one visit is never enough. Quite simply - if you want a first class tour guide, Clive and his team are unbeatable. The best compliment I can pay them is to say thank you so much for everything and we'll be back!

The Township Tour made our trip!. I don't know what I was expecting when I booked with Clive, I knew i wanted to get a better understanding of the cultural side of Capetown. As an American i knew a little about apartheid but knew nothing of the lasting impact is has had on South Africa. On the drive in from the airport you will see the townships but unless you book a tour and spend a day you won't really know anything. So after shark diving, table mountain abseil, and a tour of the cape we had a cultural day in the townships, sure I remember the other days but it is this tour that will stick with me for the rest of my life. We met Clive and our guide Godfrey at the hotel and we were excited to set out. You will be immersed in the township, walk the streets, meet the people, see what life is like. At first I was picture happy but soon put the camera to my side and spent my time talking to the people. Handing out candy to the kids (an absolute joy and must bring tons of candy the kids have literally nothing and it was a so rewarding) Also make sure to eat at Mizoil's Meats a gathering point for people from all walks of life.Godfrey thank you so much. This was a day we will never forget. I encourage you to book with Clive and request Godfrey, I encourage you to skip any tour you are thinking about that you can do elsewhere in the world like drinking wine and book this trip. I encourage you to bring stuff to give away to these people. This was an amazing experience and I think you will find it rewarding.

South Africa - Western Cape Tour 2012. Myself and 9 others went on a tour of the South African Westen Cape in October of this year. Clive was our tour guide for the first half of the tour and was an absolute star. Yolanda took over for the 2nd half and was equally as good. He was knowledgeable and went above and beyond what being a tour guide is all about. He was always on time and always had a morning song for us which had a meaning to the trip. Our time touring South Africa was the best holiday i have ever had and clive and The Cape Town Tour Guide Company made sure that this was the case. I would recommend their services to anyone and will stay in touch with them both and use their services again when i return with my family in the not too distant future i hope.

Crazy Saudi Crew. One of, if not the, best holidays that I have ever had. Both Clive and Yolande were very knowledgeable about all the areas that we went to. He knew what we wanted, made sure that there were plenty of refreshments on the bus for the long journeys. Very professional and patient. Would highly recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide to anyone - if you go anywhere in your lifetime, go to Cape Town.

Fantastic Cape Peninsular tour. All of the reviews were spot on. We spent a day with Clive in November 2012 to see as much a possible during our stay in Cape Town and had a fantastic day.We found Clive on trip advisor by chance a couple of week before visiting Cape Town. We wanted to get away from the standard packed tour buses which dash from one tourist spot the next without giving you a real feel for the country and we were not disappointed with the tailored private tour Clive provided. The day with him was very relaxing whilst packing in everything we had requested to see. Clive picked us up from the hotel after an early breakfast to get ahead of the crowds. We took a one day tour of the Cape peninsular taking in Chapman’s peak drive, the Cape Point with a fantastic walk along the cliff tops. We visited the Penguins at Boulders beach and then stopped for a fantastic private lunch at a sea food restaurant with an amazing sea views. We were very impressed with his knowledge of the wildlife, flora and history of all the areas we visited. He was a fountain of knowledge with great tips for things to do and see for the rest of our holiday on a self drive along the garden route.The Range Rover Discovery was a very comfortable, air conditioned and smooth on the steep hills. Clive always positioned us in the right place for the best views along the route ready to stop whenever we wanted to take a photo.Arriving back ahead of schedule toward Cap Town we detoured to visit a Wine estate to sample some of the fine wine available.We would highly recommend his services if you are visiting Cape Town and want to tailor a private tour at a reasonable price.

Best tour guide in Capetown!. My husband and i felt very lucky to have Clive as our tour guide throughout cape town!! He took us EVERYWHERE and can answer all of your questions with a smile and always full of lovely energy and wisdom :) He is also extremely patient and kind. When we come back we will definitely get back in touch with Clive. I highly recommend having Clive give you his exquisite tour of cape town!

Book with Cliive for an awesome tour of Cape Town. I had a wonderful private tour of Cape Town with Clive, and would definitely and enthusiastically recommend him if you want a great, informative, and efficient tour of Cape Town. I only had one day, so Clive made it a very efficient tour. We got up Table Mountain, then a drive to the southern tip (cape of Good Hope), a beautiful hike, then circled back to the city, with a trip to see the penguins as well, and a chance to dip one's feet into the ocean. Outstanding day, in the comforts of his Land Rover. Clive also provides a great narrative of the sites and was very informative. Will definitely call upon him again if back with the family.

Cape point tour. We read about Clive on Trip Advisor and totally agreed with the reviews. He is a highly knowledgable, friendly and fun guide. The trip was as promised in a very comfortable vehicle. Taking a private tour enabled a trip tailored to our interests. He also gave us great tips for things to do and places to visit in Hermanus and Stellenbosch. The Cape Point trip was fabulous and ended in a superb winery. We cannot recommend the company and especially Clive enough. we learnt so much about South Africa. Trev, Corinne, Peter, Morven

Great Tour, Excellent Guide, Comfortable Vehicle - What more could you want??!!. We Have just done a day tour with Clive taking in the Cape Peninsula. Clive is a very friendly, polite and professional guide - but also very amusing at times! He also has an in-depth knowledge of rocks - fascinating stuff :) We did the usual tourist trail to Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope, Boulders Beach and also stopped at an Osterich Farm and got to hear their mating call. As we left slightly earlier we managed to avoid the majority of the crowds at each location which made for a very pleasant day. We also went off the main road for a while on the VERY off chance of seeing a zebra.......no such luck, but we did see ostrich, baboons and a particularly nervous tortoise.We stopped at Kalky's for lunch and I definitely recommend this local cafe, serving fresh fish in many varieties. The calamari was exceptional :)As we were doing a private tour the schedule was flexible, so we certainly didn't feel rushed and had plenty of time to take in the amazing views at every location.We finished our tour with a visit to the Steenbeck Vineyard for a spot of wine tasting. Really pleasant surroundings, and some excellent wines on offer. We couldn't resist bringing some home!If you are looking for a private tour in Cape Town I can highly recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. We also met the other guide Godfrey during the day, and he was really friendly so I would certainly be happy to join in one of his tours too.If you are not looking to do a private tour in Cape Town, I would urge you to change your mind!! The prices are really reasonable and you don't have the stress of being herded around like cattle in one of the many tour coaches.......

Guided tours. The company delivered everything they promised and more. Super service when booking the tours, fast reply and very good guidens in what to do and what to see.We had 2 days guiding with Tony, Cape of Good Hope and winetasting in Stellenboch. A great experience, Tony is an excelent guide, very knowledgable, very easy going and great fun to be around.Godfrey took us for half a day to his township. An experience we are glad we found time for. We visited different projects, and got a good understanding how these villages works.We will definitely recommend this company and there guides.

Above and Beyond. Our two days spent with Clive ended with a display of personal care above and beyond any contracted obligations on his behalf. We modified the City and Hermanus tours to suit our interests and had wonderful input from Clive. We were in Cape Town to attend a surprise birthday party and added an Italian couple, friends of friends, at a late date without issue from Clive. The language barrier was overcome via blackberry, limited second languages and hand guestures.At the end of our tour, on a windy and rainy Friday evening, Clive insisted on waiting while we got ready for the party, returned us to the other couple and ensured we were all dispatched to the correct address and on time.We all choose private tour guides for similar reasons when travelling the world over and Clive does his profession proud.

Wonderful experience!. My boyfriend and I chose a more personal tour instead of a crowded bus with many strangers. Clive gave us a fantastic experience touring Cape Point and the Peninsula. He was very knowledgeable and very easy to get along with. He had a great way of pointing out interesting facts that we would appreciate. We also stopped at a restaurant for lunch at his recommendation & it was one of the best meals of our entire trip. It was VERY windy and cool the day we were out, so we were faster than normal at the various stops, but instead of taking us back early, Clive took us to a wine tasting as well. I would highly recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide Company for anyone looking for a private tour. It was a like a friend of yours was taking you out for the day. Great trip!

"Sensational Tour Guides". My friend and I only had three days in Cape Town and two of those for sightseeing so we wanted to make the most of our time there. I Googled for a guide and selected three, sending off emails with our requirements - Clive from The Cape Town Tour Guide Co replied first and right from the start he stood out from the others and got our booking. From the moment we met Clive we felt at ease with his relaxed but professional manner. He was flexible in fitting in all the little extras we wanted - even sitting on the beach for over 2 hours waiting for the sunset so I could get a special photo and the next day taking us to a jeweller so I could buy a bracelet - both of these were outside the tour itineraries. I was more than a "bit lame" after my climb of Mt Kilimanjaro and Clive always took this into consideration making sure he dropped us off at entrance gates and then going off to park the car. He also carried my heavy camera backpack without being asked and often took photos of us. Clive's knowledge is extensive and he provides a really interesting commentary - laced with bits of humour. His offsider Godfrey gave us a very realistic tour of the Township and, as we were with a "local", we felt very welcome in this community. We have already spread the word by recommending Clive to travellers we met after leaving Cape Town and when we go back there, we will use him again.Ann and Louise, Townsville, Australia

It does not get any better than this!. My husband and I recently travelled to Cape Town for our honeymoon, and our experience was made by Clive and the Cape Town Tour Guide Co.!!! We have been all over the world and were impressed by Clive's, our tour guide, deep knowledge of the area and history of the country. Clive was accomodating, fun, engaging, and informative. We did a Winelands tour and Table Mountain tour with the company. Both days far exceeded our expectations. We were sad to leave Clive and head to our safari. He catered both tours to our unique tastes and was flexible in selecting which vineyards to try. Additionally, the company is well connected in Cape Town so everyone was familiar with Clive at the tastings. Moreover, we were very pleased with Clive's restaurant recommendations during our stay in Cape Town. Without the Cape Town Tour Guide Co., our visit to Cape Town would have been half the fun! We feel so lucky to have found such a wonderful company and tour guide. BOOK NOW!!!!!

Excellent tour company!. We just spent a week in Cape Town ,during which four days were spent touring in the company of Clive de Bruyne.From the minute we landed at Cape Town International Airpot till we were dropped off we were treated like visiting friends from overseas,not clients. We discussed politics,geography,geology,historical events while driving to spectacular sites. Clive is very honest , culturally sensitive and we throughly enjoyed the conversations.Clive prepared an itinerary which included sightseeing,cultural visits,wine tasting and eating at excellent restaurants,all with style.We hope to go back someday to do the Garden Tour with Clive.We highly recommend this tour company.

Cape Town tour. My family of 7 members from Singapore took a safari @Idube Private Game Reserve and a Cape Town tour in Sept 2012. Jenny Herbert of PJ's Tarvel & Tours organised the entire itinerary for us. Our tour guides in Cape Town was Clive De Bruyne of The Cape Town Tour Guide Co and his sub contractor Mario. We are very seasoned travellers. Nonetheless, the entire holiday exceed our expectations! Jenny and Clive are just fantatstic. Safari is out of this world, a once in life time experience. Jenny patiently spent the entire last year packaging the tour for us. We gave her A+. As for Clive, we fully endorsed what a fellow traveller Lindsay S said about Clive. Clive is out of this world and probably the best tour guide we had met. He is a fountain of knowledge, from buildings, rock formations, animals, history, and from flora to fauna. We visited the famous Table Mountain, took a tour of the Peninsula, via Chapman's peak, Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve. We stopped by Ostrichs farm, and said hello to penguins at Boulders Beach. Clive rescued my hat twice which was blown away by "hurricane" winds. He managed to take photos for us with 7 cameras hanging on him at the same time. He is passionate about his job and has a great sense of humour. He is also well organised and has an ever ready recommendations of restaurants that never failed to impress us. The Chinse dinner @ Haihu Restaurant was superb.The next day, Mario took us to Dieu Donne, Franschhoek (French Corner), and Stelanbosch. Mario has a quiet enchanting style. A good listener and very flexible. He adjusted the itinerary to cater for our ad hoc wishes and we had a fabulous day, including a picnic at the park.We will definitely go back to S Africa again, and you bet we will use their services again.Chew Moi Ying & Family,Singapore

Cape Winelands Tour. Our Winelands tour was a great highlight of our stop in the CapeTown area. Our guide was fun and quite knowledgeable. He not only told us about the history of the wineries that we visited but also talked about the cultural as well as everyday life of a South African. We enjoyed the uniqueness of each of the three wineries that we visited---a good mix of old to new. Our lunch stop was lovely with local cuisine. Our only additional expense for the day was our lunch as the winery admissions were part of the tour price. We had a wonderful day seeing the countryside and sampling nice wines!

You have to meet Clive!. I enthusiastically endorse and recommend Clive to anyone interested in traveling in Cape Town. Although my position as a student on a research trip was different from Clive’s usual clientele of tourists, he easily transitioned his detail-oriented skills to optimize my stay in Cape Town. I had a tour every day that I was off and spent the evenings enjoying his recommendations for dinner and nightlife. From burger joints to fancy dinners, low-key bars and dance-all-night clubs, Clive never missed. Everything he does and recommends is perfect for the individual client because he knows his town and genuinely wants to get to know his clients. On the days I was working (shipwreck archaeology) Clive joined me in the field. His eagerness for participating and learning, coupled with his practical suggestions and willingness to get his hands dirty, easily made him the most valuable addition to the team. It also didn’t hurt that he had connections to local museums. Clive has an easy charm that makes people feel comfortable and safe, backed by an intelligent and extensive knowledge of the area, creating a harmony between tourism and hospitality. His love for the area and culture is so obvious in the way he talks about it while giving tours, and actively seeks to learn more for both himself and his clients. I have a deep respect for Clive in that he appreciates not only the swanky parts of Cape Town, but also the Districts and the Townships. He and his partner Godfrey often arrange for clients to tour District 6 and Langa Township, in order to broaden a foreign understanding that often results in benefits for local orphans and the community at large.Clive became more than a tour guide. He was and is my friend. During my stay he far exceeded expectations, going above and beyond any reasonable call of duty to guarantee I had the time of my life. Clive is a fixture in Cape Town, and it would be a shame to travel there without meeting him.

Clive knows all.. Sunny, optimistic and knowledgeable. Nice to find him directly rather than paying double to the top tour operators (I won't name them) for his services. Seafood suggestions were on the money.

Wonderful Experience - Highly Recommended. On our recent trip to Cape Town with a group of 10 people we were met by Clive & Godfrey at the airport and immediately knew we were in expert hands. We spent the next three days touring with them and nothing was too much trouble. The vehicle was modern, comfortable and spotlessly clean. We had a personalised full day tour to the Cape of Good Hope which included a beautiful lunch where we were blown away by a large Southern Right Whale playing with some seals directly out from where we were seated. We then had a lovely stop for wine tasting on our way back to Cape Town. Their in depth knowledge of the local area enabled us to get an up close & personal experience of Cape Town itself, the townships, Table Mountain & Robben Island. They tailored our schedule to include the places & sights we were interested in. They went out of their way to accommodate us and as a travel industry professional I would highly recommend The Cape Town Tour Guide Co to anyone planning a visit to the Cape Town area.

Terrific Tours of Cape Town and surrounding areas. Clive met my wife and myself at airport, took us to our hotel, arrangements made for our tours to the wine regions and to Cape of Good Hope, both full day tours. He checked the local weather information and changed our schedule to give us the best day for our planned cable car ride to Table Mountain. Clive discovered that we had an interest in classic cars so he included a visit to the Franschhoek Motor Museum, fantastic. His knowledge of the Cape Town and surrounding area's was exceptional. We wish this small tour guide company every success in the future and would recommend them to anyone traveling to Cape Town. Allan & Raelene.

Loved Cape Town. Clive made our first trip to Cape Town an amazing life time memory. He was flexible with our plans, and he paid close attention to our needs as we determined the best activities for each day. I had my list; he worked all of my wish list into our schedule. Each day he exceeded my husband and my expectations including a dip in the frigid Atlantic.
