We closed our last day out with Clive with a visit to a local jeweler of his recommendations for a special 10 year anniversary purchase.We also had the pleasure to spend a day in wine country with Yolanda. Her energy and knowledge left us wanting to soak up as much as we could on this tour. We loved our time in Cape Town and can't wait to return.

Brilliant. Clivemet our group of 10 people at the airport and delivered us to our hotel in the centre of Cape Town and arranged to pick us up 15 Minutes early in the morning to beat the large group tours heading to the CapeVictor and Godfrey (god) were our driver and guide for an amazing day, there knowledge and there ability to bounce off each other made our first day so memorable.Day two was overcast but again they shifted the program to accommodate the weather without missing the highlightsThis evening we had a surprise dinner at Big Easy Restaurant at Stochenbosch ,they waited and gave us an informative trip homeThe final day the group was going in different directions with the first to the airport for an early flight and Clive was already there for our fourHe suggested as arranged 10.30 but if we wanted we could visit anything we had missed before we joined the Rovus Rail experience to JohannesburgWe wish this small company every success because you deserve it
Best tour guide ever. Every time i come to Cape Town - Clive is my go to person. Nothing is too much effort and his attention to the smallest detail is amazing.

Awesome stay in Cape Town!!!. Clive is a wonderful tour guide! He arranged everything we needed, so the day was seamless. Clive was born and raised in Cape Town so he knows when and where to go. He is extremely knowledgeable about the history of South Africa. Clive has a great sense of humor and was truly enjoyable to be with for the day. He was flexible to accomodate our interests and provided great information about other aspects of our stay when we weren't on tou with him. We will highly recommend him to friends or family and will reconnect with him when we return!

Clive was the highlight of our visit to Capetown. Clive was our guide while we visited beautiful Capetown and in four days of touring we were able to see every aspect of that city and surrounding area with great efficiency and comfort. HIs friendly personality and knowledge of the history and politics of the country made our tours totally interesting and informative. He knows how to plan your itinerary to give you what you like and is flexible in his planning to make the day as perfect as it can be. We were taken up Table Mountain on the perfect day for stunning views of the city. We hiked the South Cape trail and saw Penguins and Ostriches and ate at a wonderful out of the way restaurant and sampled wines he recommended. He got us over to see Robben Island for a very moving look at the troubled history of South Africa. A tour of wine country to his favourite vinyards was most enjoyable and we found his recommendations helpful. A highlight for us was the arrangement he made with a personal friend who lives in Langa Township. We were able to go into the township with Geoffry and see the way the less fortunate citizens of Africa live today but to understand the optimism they have for a better future. After our touring with Clive we had a far better view of South Africa. His professionalism and personality made our time there truly fascinating. Clive gave us recommendations for dining that were all perfect. If you go to Capetown, Clive, can make your time there memorable.

A fantastic day, one to remember!. Clive handeled everything. We emailed a bit about what we wanted and he took care of the rest. Picked us up in a very nice car, took us where we wanted and provided suggestions... all of which were spot on. His knowlege base about South Aftican history and plant life was very impressive. He literally gave (upon our request) a 2 hour summation of South African history while we were driving between locations. Best tour I have had.

Clive is the best tour guide EVER!!!. Our visit to Cape Town was a million times better than I expected thanks to the expertise of Clive. He became a part of our family as he showed us the many sights of Cape Town. He has an amazing personality; extremely knowledgeable, funny, witty, patient, great with teenage boys!Clive planned active, fun filled days that were made to accommodate everyone in our group, based on what our wants were. He listened to what we wanted to get out of our visit, and planned activities based on that.I would definitely use his services again.

Flexible, Fun, and Informative. My husband and I spent the day with Clive, with the primary goal of going to the Cape of Good Hope. During the week, we had found out about a fellow who has something called a "Blo-Kart" on a beach south of Cape Town. As sailors, we couldn't resist the idea of "sailing" these karts on the beach but did not have the opportunity to get there to do it. Any how, when Clive picked us up that morning, we told him of our desire to try to do these as well--though the Cape was still our priority. He was happy to help us problem-solve how to work it into our day, confirming the availability and location with the fellow who does this. He had no problem in not making a stop to the Ostrich farm, when we mentioned that we were willing to give it up so as to accommodate the other activity. (In other words, there are no pre-determined tourist stops you "have" to make). During our tour, Clive never made us feel pressured, and was adept at finding out what was important to us, and gently reminding us of our time schedule. He was very informative on geographical aspects of the tour, and also provided interesting information about the various animals we saw. We hiked to interesting areas at the Cape of Good Hope, and he hiked half-way with us himself (giving us great information enroute), and then left my husband and I to ourselves. The balance between having a guide, and then some personal time, was perfect. Finally, we did make it to the Blo-karts, as well, and it was a blast! In short, our day with Clive was our best day in the Cape Town area. I highly recommend him to any travelers who are going there. My only regret is that we didn't have more than one day with him --

Cape Town. Clive was the most amazing guide during my two week trip to Cape Town. He organized everything that we did and made sure that we had the best experience possible. When my friend and I were denied a rental car because we did not have a credit card, he even volunteered to put his credit card on file for us. Clive was not just an amazing guide, but became a friend after this awesome trip. I could not imagine a better trip and I attribute that to Clive and his expertise. He is amazingly professional and will do everything he can to make sure that you have the best experience possible in South Africa.

Fantastic in the Rain. It was storming and pouring rain on our tour (it was our only day). We still did everything on the list!!! Our tour guide was a trooper. We saw everything and had a blast!!!!!!!

Cape Town with Clive. Clive was an excellent guide. Myself and 7 of my family members travelled with Clive throughout Cape Town and the surrounding areas in late June. Clive was able to appeal to a multigeneraltional group including grandparents in their 70's, an Aunt (me) in her 30's, and the youngest a 10yr old boy. Clive had a thoughtful selection of activites that allowed us to see Cape Town from all perspectives. Our day in the Winelands was exceptional! Clive arranged a delicious lunch for us at Delaire Graff after a lovely wine tasting at Tacora another local winery. We were introduced to the beauty of Cape Town via a cable car ride up the mountain and a drive out to Haut Bay. All the beuty and indulgence was tempered by our very eye-opening visit to the Township with Clive and Godfrey. We were given a very open and honest view of a community and it's struggles and successes. The Township experience in particular is something that I will never forget.

Clive! Clive! Clive!. Clive was an amazing guide to the fantastic city of Cape Town! Fun, funny, knowledgeable and he took awesome (and flattering!) pics of us. We were only with Clive for a day but we had a great time going to Table Mountain and the botanical gardens. Excellent service!And seriously, his name is Clive--how cool is that?

A week With Cape Town Tour Guide. Clive, Godfrey and Rolif were simply outstanding. From the moving tour of Robben Island to the beauty of Table Mountain, the reality of Langa Township and the contrasting decadence of the wine regions, Cape Town and its surrounding area offer a diverse range of experiences. Clive and his associates met our every expectation. They were timely, knowledgeable, fairly priced, well organized and flexible when our interests varied such as an unscheduled stop at the Botanical Gardens. We are already planning our next trip to South Africa with them.Carl and Charlotte- Florida

Cape Town Township tour with Godfrey Klaas. Our township tour of Langa with Godfrey was fasinating and eye opening for our entire family. Gadfrey, who by choice still lives in Langa, had a excellent perspective of how and why the townships exist and great knowledge about all aspects of the townships. He did a great job of explaining township living for us and our children (14,17). I Highly recommend a township tour with Godfrey Klass as your guide. It was a highlight of our Cape Town experience.

Many thanks for a great tour in Cape Town. A group of 8 spent 2 days with Clive and his associates touring the city and winelands. We were able to customize our tour days since it was just our group. We had a very informative tour of the city went to Robben Island for the afternoon. Unfortunately, it was too windy to travel up Table Mountain but in lieu of that Clive took us up a high point overlooking the city views which were spectacular. Clive introduced us to another tour guide who took us to the Langa Township which added a whole other dimension to our visit to Cape Town. Our final destination was an afternoon wine tasting tour and lunch at Indochine in Stellenbosch. The wimelands are gorgeous and the food was outstanding in terms of taste, presentation and atmosphere. All in all we learned a great deal about South Africa, its history and culture, as well as meeting "the locals". I would highly recommend Clive and the Cape Town Tour company for your visti to SA.

Wonderful eye opening tour!. My wife and I recently did a private tour with Godfrey in Langa Township. It was a wonderful and eye opening tour! SInce Godfrey lives in Langa he has first hand knowledge of the township and really does a great job of diversifying the experience. Visiting Langa or another township is a MUST when in Cape Town. I highly recommend Cape Town Tour Guide, Godfrey, and Clive! Thank you for a wonderful visit!

Higgins & Downes Families Excursion to Capetown. Clive made a four day vacation in Capetown an unforgetable experience. Clive has a wealth of knowledge about so many aspects of Capetown and shared it all enthusiasticallly. He is articulate, witty, charming, well prepared, very organized, and overall just a very nice person. From Tabletop Mountain to shark diving, from the cultural tour to the wineries, there was something to hold the interest of everyone. He knew the best shops, the best restaurants, the best sight-seeing times, the best attractions to hold the interest of all regardless of the age (from ten years old to the grandparents). I would highly recommend Clive to anyone visiting Capetown.

Excellent Family Guide. Clive was a terrific guide for our family. He did a great job managing a multigenerational group. He was terrific with my parents and children. Clive was very good at planning activities which appealed to the kids. In addition, Clive arranged a township tour and a service trip to a local orpghanage which was a highlight of our trip. He was extremely knowledgeable and courteous. His insights into many cultural and political issues were very interesting and he was very easy to talk to. I would highly recommend CLive as your Capetown guide.

Excellent Tour Guide. We engaged Clive for two days of our time in Cape Town and wish we had done more! He made our tour of the peninsula and winelands magical. Clive had this knack to know exactly how much information we wanted to hear and flexibility and imagination to please everyone in our family. As we were driving along, my teenaged son mentioned that he liked cars. The next thing we knew we were pulling into the parking lot of a car museum for my husband and son that also had wine tasting for me and my daughter! He arranged lunch for us at fabulous restaurant spots and was always available to take pictures of our family at the different sites. He welcomed our questions with intellegence and respect. Even though he must visit Cape Point many times a month, he never made us feel like we were getting a standard spiel, everything felt customized to us. Not only is Clive a tour guide, but he can also help with any aspect of South African travel. We highly recommend Clive De Bruyne.

Capetown Tour. Our guide Clive De Bruyne was an awesome guide, it was a pleasure working with him. He waqs extremely knowledgeable courteous and helpful. Could not have had a better time in Capetown. I highly recommend Clive, he is a great asset for your company.

Cape Town Tour. Our tour guide experience was not what we expected! Clive was not only professional, knowledgeable and gracious but seemed more like a friend of the family. He welcomed all kinds of questions about the culture as well as the negative and positive aspects about politics and crime. Incidentally, we never encountered any dangerous scenarios in Cape Town! Clive had a great sense of humor and we loved his sense of humility. What a wonderful ambassador for Cape Town!

book it. Clive was professional, knowledgeable and fun! He was also extremely flexible and accommodating. We fell in love with Cape Town and Clive is partly responsible. I would absolutely recommend his services.

Fantastic private tour guide!. We found Clive through a recommendation and we were not disappointed! Clive is super knowledgeable about the area, including culture, geography, language, etc. Even though we had rain for our entire tour we still felt like we got a great tour and feel for the area. He was great with our 6 year old daughter and made sure to include something just for her on our tour. Highly recommend!

wow!!. i really, really enjoyed the cape town tour with clive! he is a wonderfull person! he speaks very good english! we (st-leo) had a great time! i hope you can do the trip with a lot of other people, they won't be deseponted!
Great guide!!. Clive is great!! He knows a lot of SA, is funny, ask what you want. Don't have any doubt and book Clive, you will not regret it!!! He's a dear friend on the other side of the world....

Best trip ever. The trip to Cape Town is one of the most beautiful tips I ever made!The guide (Clive) was very social, friendly and funny. He also knows a lot.The games about the places we visited were also very nice and good (the rewards too ofcourse :p).Cape Town is just the most beautiful city on earth!It's something I will never forget. And I'm sure it wasn't my last visit to Cape Town!Thank you for everything Clive!

A trip of a life-time. 24 day tour never to forget. Any one travelling to South Africa be sure to book your tour with Clive. You will have an amazing time and see so much. The itineray he did for us was exceptional. We saw everything from Capetown to Shakaland in Durban. An unforgettable time. Clive's knowledge of South Africa is second to none. Thanks a million Clive. The frienship we have established with Clive will keep us in contact for life. Your Aussie mates.

Learned a lot in one day,.. Clive was great! He showed my father , a client and myself around in Capetown and surrounding area.I really learned a lot that day and even managed to impress a few locals the next with my new knowledge !.Clive picked us up in his big Landrover and showed us all the sites and answered all our questions.We were able to stop where ever and when ever on this personal tour.I strongly recommend him.!

high class. I had the pleasure of entertaining suppliers from Holland and decided to use The Cape Town Tour Guide Co. I tagged along for the ride and must say it was an excellent tour (even though the weather was not at its best). Since my suppliers were from Holland, they wanted to know everything about the Dutch colonies and history and Clive was extremely knowledgeable in this regard and my suppliers were in their element.Thank you very much Clive for a world class tour!!!

Great experience and wonderful fun. We have just had four fantastic days with Clive. His knowledge of the country, the people and the geography is fantastic and makes for an incredibly fun and educational holiday. Importantly Clive is witty and entertaining as well and had us laughing non stop during our tours. Clive is also very flexible and adapts his tours to your particular tastes. If your going to Cape town and the Western Cape I can thoroughly recommend Clive as your guide.

Great tour. Eye opening and inspiring. A must see!. We took a township tour with Godfrey and it was a great tour. You really can't understand what the townships are like until you have taken this tour and seen everything up close and person. This was so eye opening and the people were simply amazing. The kindness they showed in opening their homes to us tourists was really moving and I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone. This was one of the biggest highlights of my trip to South Africa and I feel like it was an incredibly enriching experience. I just can't imagine having been to S Africa without seeing a township up close and personal. The only negative is that I thought it was tad expensive for a three hour tour. I also wish we were given a little more historical information. Don't get me wrong, Godfrey was a really great guide, but I wish we learned a little more about the history of district six and the townships, etc. Overall though, it really was one of the best things I did in S. Africa.. and that's saying a lot cause everything in SA was unbelievable!

Six Ladies in Capetown. Engaging, brilliant,and extremely well versed in SA history and culture. More importantly "ourClive" had the maturity, wit and wisdom to respond to the individual needs of six women onindividual missions for five days. We would each have a unique story to tell how Clive enrichedour experience but the group consensus would be that is the" go to" guide for any age groupvisiting Capetown. He is simply extraordinary. Thalia Price- Weston, MA USA

Excellence, Expertise, Graciousness, Humor and Delight. I have just returned from a 10 tour in South Africa, 5 days in the Cape Town Area and 5 days in Limpopo. We were 6 women - friends from the US - traveling together. Our guide and organizer was Clive DeBruyn. Taking great are to consult with us and our interests, Clive planned the perfect itinerary for each day and provided exactly the right amount of support during each activity. His ongoing sensitivity to the needs of each member of the group was remarkable and made our time together harmonious, inspiring and truly delicious. We wish we could have traveled with him forever!!!I give him my very highest recommendation.

Our last days in South Africa. Having spent some days on Safari followed by three days on Rovos Rail, it was a treat to have some down time in Cape Town. Clive provided a fine day touring around, taking in the beautiful scenery of this marvellous part of the world. He knows his stuff, is entertaining and good value for money. If you have limited time it's well worth looking Clive up......and I'm sure his longer tours would be up to scratch too!My photos from the whole trip can be found at http://www.dd1961.com/southafrica

Outstanding Cape Town tour guide. Our group of 2 US couples in our 60s spent 3 days with Clive de Bruyne touring Cape Town and environs and had an outstanding experience, even as he represents a much younger generation than we. Clive was available, prompt, professional and courteous and possesses a keen sense of humor. Moreover, he is energetic, is an excellent teacher (he was formerly a high school history etc teacher), knows his history of Cape Town and South Africa and offers a nuanced and balanced perspective that was every bit as valuable as the beautiful and interesting sites that we visited. We were confident we were in the hands of a real pro and would highly recommend this individual for all aspects of touring Cape Town.

Clive DeBruyne was the ideal person to open our eyes to the history, geography, culture and beauty of Capetown.phy, c. Our guide was informative, intelligent and helpful to enhancing and orchestrating our first exposure to Capetown. Highly recommend Clive to anyone trying to gain an understanding of the area and have fun doing it.

Amazing experience with a fantastic guide!. I visited Cape Town as a part of an exchange program at school in 2006. Our guide was Clive, without a doubt one of the best guides in Cape Town! He has a wide knowledge of Cape town and surroundings, the history,... We visited Stellenbosch with its wines, Cape of good hope with its beautiful nature, Robben Island, Table Mountain, Clifton beach,...He even took us to a township in Cape Town where we had a very intense visit, a real eye-opener and not a place that the average tourist can go to. It was all in all an unforgettable week!

Township tour was an enlightening experience. The township tour we had with Godfrey was a truly enlightening experience. After reading about the disparity of wealth and the townships scattered throughout South Africa I was interested in this particular type of tour. I had my reservations about it exploiting or being voyeuristic to the township residents, however, Godfrey and the Cape Town Tour Co, provided a very educational and informative tour that eased those concerns as the tour progressed. Throughout the tour Godfrey (born and living in the Township of Langa) gives you personal insights and answers any question that you may have about life in the townships and history of developments, both past and present. His perspective and the tour is something very different than what most travelers are used to when visiting the beautiful scenic Cape Town. It shows another side to South Africa. The real side where the majority of people still live. Truly an enlightening experience.

The Township Cultural Tour is a must!. South Africa is a amazing country, and Cape Town has to be one of the most beautiful cities I've ever visited in the world. The natural beauty of the country is evident all around you, however you have to look a bit harder to grasp the cultural beauty. This is why my group chose to do the Township Cultural tour.A group of 29 of us were traveling to South Africa as part of a course we are taking in our MBA studies at Northwestern University in Chicago, IL. We studied the country of South Africa for 9 weeks and then came to visit for 2 weeks. My project group decided to focus our paper on tourism and how it can alleviate poverty in the country. We assessed many aspects of this challenging question, but we also wanted to experience as many types of tourism as we could while in the country (eco tourism with safaris, township tourism, etc.).Taking the township tour was the highlight of my two week trip. The beauty of South Africa truly lies in the people. Our tour guide Godfrey grew up in the township of Langa. He was able to really give us a true insight as to what life is like in the township, the challenges they face, and the opportunities they have to improve. We took an interactive foot tour through the township learning about various aspects of the township. We went to a local 'pub,' (you have to try the beer), we met local entrepreneurs and artists at the community center, saw a typical hostel, learned about how government is trying to revamp the townships, and visited a local school where we interacted with the beautiful children. It's one thing to see a township off the side of the freeway while driving, however its a truly different experience walking through the area and getting the real perspective. As sad as it may make you to see people living in dire circumstances, their positive spirit and joy is undeniable. Being able to have this experience gave me a more realistic view of how much of the country lives and how far South Africa has to go in their reconstruction post apartheid. I understand that many people have limited time when visiting Cape Town, but I implore you to spend the 2-3 hours to do this tour as it will touch your heart and change your perspective on life. I'm glad Clive and Godfrey gave us the opportunity to experience this side of South Africa, and I'd urge any one visiting to do the same.

Look no further for a top notch tour guide. "Having Googled Clive to find him, we were a little nervous about our visit together, although his website was very reassuring. We shouldn’t have worried. From the time he picked us up at the airport after 11PM one night, until he left us 3 days later, nothing could have been better. Clive is charming and knowledgeable, and he was very perceptive in discerning our wants and needs. He designed our time together based on what we had told him in our communications, and was very flexible in making changes as we went along. He directed us to good restaurants, and made reservations for us. Clive’s knowledge of South Africa in general and the Cape Town area in particular is extensive, so we not only saw wonderful things, we also learned a lot. And, in the process, we had a lot of fun. We will recommend him to any of our friends, and hope this recommendation will also be helpful to online readers. We could tell that, regardless of your age or interests, Clive can design an excellent program for you""Having Googled Clive to find him, we were a little nervous about our visit together, although his website was very reassuring. We shouldn’t have worried. From the time he picked us up at the airport after 11PM one night, until he left us 3 days later, nothing could have been better. Brilliant tour-intuitive, informative, quick paced. Yolanda was our tour guide for 2 days. Clive joined us for lunch today just to insure all was well. We were a group of 5 people - the youngest 2 are 22 and 17, the oldest almost 60. All of us were entertained and intrigued. No one was bored; Yolanda had answers to everything. We saved hours of research and tons of wasted time by going with this group.

Clive offers a personalised service with excellent local knowledge - would travel with him again!. Clive was our personal guide while in Cape Town and did a fantastic job. Not only was he informative and interesting with his local knowledge, but he was entertaining and made the touring such a pleasure. I would most definately travel with Clive and the company again. He is also a fantastic photographer and was happy to take photos for me at times :)

Clive is the BEST!. Clive was a first rate guide in all respects. He is prompt, courteous, flexible and has a great storehouse of knowledge about the history of his country. He is not intrusive, but if you want to discuss anything from economics, cultural history or current politics he is available to inform in the most pleasant manner imaginable. In short, he is all good and we have met none better in decades of travel around the world. ----- Original Message -----

Great Experience. My husband and I chose Cape Town as our first stop in South Africa. Our trip had been arrranged through a travel agency in Dallas, and we had a great experience with Clive De Bruyne. He had received the itinerary from the various travel agents. We asked him to alter it to fit in more with what we had read about and really wanted to do and see. He very graciously accommodated our requests. We found Clive to be extremely knowledgable, very gracious and responsive. We loved our experience in Cape Town and the learning experience with Clive.Would certainly ask for him again.Kay and Frank Yeager

Just perfect!!!. Clive was not just the perfect tour guide - absolutely well prepared and experienced. It was a pleasure to be with him as a warm hearted and humorous person. What we really enjoyed: The trip was absolutely taylor-made and at any time he was open for a flexible handling. So one afternoon we decided to do an early morning hike before sunset and the next morning we have been up the hill in absolute darkness to have breakfast at the peak during sunset. An unforgettable experience!!! Clive made also perfect recommendations for restaurants in top quality. We will definitely come back to Capetown and definitely ask Clive for an unforgettable tour guidance again!E. W. and A. Zurhorst from Germany
See the town with Clive. Be sure to use Cape Town Tour Guide Co. Clive made sure we saw all the sights. Table Mountain is well worth the ride to the top.

The BEST Ever. I can only echo the other reviews. My husband and I found Clive very personable and knowledgeable and one of the best guides we have ever had. Unfortunately when I started to book our trip I had not found Clive yet, if I had I would have used him for all of our tours and bookings. He did a Cape Town day tour with us and then a 3 day Garden Route Tour. Not only did Clive give us a history of the area, but he carried on interesting conversations with us. This was more like going around with a friend then just a guide. My husband is in his late 70s so was not up for walking great distances - Clive made it easy for us. He'd take us on the walk, then find a cafe for us and then run back and bring the car around. He took us to Dupio Zero for lunch - they have the best Italian food and the most wonderful ice coffee. Be sure to try it.I can't thank Clive enough for making our tours most enjoyable.

BRILLIANT! A local man, with local knowledge!. This tour was fantastic, and suited my husbands and mine needs perfectly. Clive was sensational, and without his expertise we would have missed out on many opportunities in Cape Town. On arrival he asked if we were up to going to the top of Table Mountain before checking into our hotel. As we were feeling quite fresh we were happy to, and luckily we had Clive to suggest it, as the cable car was closed for the remainder of our stay in Cape Town due to high winds. His expertise was bang on. Clive took us to every part of Cape Town that was a must, and tailored it to our needs. He even managed to squeeze in a short 45min township tour that I was desperate to experience even though it wasn't in our crammed itinerary. We managed to for into 3 days what our friends did on their own steam in a week. And his suggestions for restaurants and bars was spot on as well. We found his knowledge well rounded and detailed not only on the political history but also the wildlife, flora, and fauna. Do yourselves a favour and book with these guys! You won't be disappointed!

Simply the Best!. The experience we anticipated when we booked with The Cape Town Touring Company pales in comparison with the actual adventures we had each day with Clive. We could hardly wait to see what Clive had in store for us each day and to hear his insights on culture, politics and historical events. From his excellent driving, ease of scheduling to his inate ability to discover what peaked the interest of each individual in our group and then very naturally share his wealth of knowledge on that very subject, Clive never ceased to entertain us. His extensive familiarity with and love for Africa, Capetown, the wine country and surrounding areas was evident every step of the way and his delightful, easy manner endeared him to each of us. Not only was Clive our guide but quickly became our new found friend. If you want a beautiful acquaintence with Africa, wonderful memories and and a charming host to guide you, Clive is your man. I highly recommend him. .

A wonderful way to explore the region and city of Cape Town!. Some years ago I explored Cape Town as part of an exchange program between my school in Belgium and a school in South Africa. Clive was the one guiding us around through the region and city of Cape Town. We went from the wine region of Stellenbosch to the top of Table Mountain, from the intense confrontation on Robben Island to the wild nature near Cape of Good Hope. I don't think there was one student who wasn't ecstatic about the background information, tour planning and enthousiasm, offered by Clive! As a personal high point of the trip, Clive arranged a protected tour through the township of Cape Town, following a request of me and some friends. With any other tour guide, 'm sure I would have missed this intense experience.Next time I'm going to Cape Town, I will definitely contact Clive!

The best trip ever!!. We have used many touring companies and private guides on our travels, but, without question, Clive and The Cape Town Touring Company, topped our list as the most pleasant, informative, and engaging. From the moment he met our group of four at the airport with his big, comfy vechicle, to the end of our final tour together, Clive made every day an adventure, full of easy banter, historical information and insight into the city and environs he so obviously knows well and loves. Although we had crafted a three day "itinerary" with him before our arrival, our conversations along the way frequently led us to unplanned destinations, but he never failed to be completly knowledgeable about each new spot, while still managing to keep everything on schedule as though he knew in advance exactly what we wanted to see before we even told him! Handling reservations, satisfying the personal needs of the group, and filling each day with wonder and delight, Clive is HIGHLY recommended for your trip to this beautiful area. Whatever your interests or time constraints, he will organize a special day for you and, in the meantime, charm you with his warm, engaging personality, leaving you with the most wonderful memories of the beautiful Cape area of South Africa.

Just what we wanted!. When you travel all the way around the world, you take a leap of faith that your travel plans will go well and you'll have a great experience. We definately had a great experience with Clive. It was fun and informative traveling with him along the Garden Route. All of the stops along the way were well thought out and we enjoyed the accomodations and meals. Would highly recommend traveling with Clive or one of his associates.

Most fabulous trip ever!!!. Clive planned our 15 day vacation for us from Capetown to Victoria Falls to a Safari. He was spot on. He was the best tour guide ever. Fun, knowlegable, charming. If the weather was too hot, he was able to change the itinerary to put us inside and do the outside activity at a different time. If I said oh I heard from a friend about XYZ place he would add it into our daily activity. He made recommendations for restaurants for dinner.(we loved everyone) When we were in other cities he called us to make sure everything was going smoothly.I have been a Travel Agency Owner and been in the business for 35 years and I can tell you Clive is 5 star. I would certainly recommend him to any of my clients. Can't wait to go back to South Africa and have Clive handle all our plans...

The perfect tour guide, friendly, knows his industry inside out. Highly recommend !. We visited Cape Town & the western Cape in Nov 11. We needed a guide and my wife came across Clive's site just through using google. This was the best stroke of luck we could ever had wished for. Our 1st trip with clive was so good(cape point) that we actually changed our plans and booked Clive for a second tour(Champange tasting in Franschhoek area).Clive is happy to come up with a plan for you, but is quite open to amend at the last second if there is something you want to do or see. So don't be afraid and suggest something as this is why a private tour guide works so well. You will travel in luxury, comfort and with one of the most friendly of people you will ever meet. Clive's knowledge is quite diverse from history, food, wine and just general issues that occur in the world everyday. You will not be disappointed when booking Clive, so if u were unsure if to book or not before reading this review then please don't waste your money on someone else. Book Clive now! We only hope Clive is still in the industry the next time we are the Western Cape region or South Afrcia in general as we we book him without out a seconds thought. Best regards,David & Sarah(London)

Discovering South Africa in a different way. In April 2005 Clive guided us through the beauty of South Africa!Personally I have very good memories about his guide tours, he didn't bore us at any time and learned us about the culture and history of this beautiful country! He could really turn your attention on the visits, what isn't really obvious for youngsters!Besides being our guide, he was also a very interesting and outgoing person! I could really recommand this guide to everyone who wants to discover all the different aspects that this country offers.

Great Experience. My brother, his wife and I took 3 tours with the Cape TownTour Guide Co. For The Cape Peninsula and Stellenbosch Wineland Tours are guide and host was Clive. He is very knowledgeable and made the tours very enjoyable. For the Township Cultural Tour, his associate, Godfrey was our guide . Again, it was done very well and was an eye opening experience.I would highly recommend the Cape Town Tour Guide Co.Andrew Kay

I would highly recommend Clive De Bruyne as a tour guide. I hired Clive De Bruyne as a tour guide when I visited Cape Town last May with my wife and 2 teenage children. We took 2 tours with Clive (Cape of Good Hope & Stellenbosch) and had a fantastic time. He is not only very friendly, but also is extremely knowledgable. We not only enjoyed out tours, but learned quite a bit in the process. I would highly recommend Clive and his company.

Personalized Tour By A Real Professional Who Accommodated All Interests.. Clive was most knowledgeable on what we might want to see and how we should allocate our time. However, he was also most accommodating on the itinerary to include whatever was of interest to members of our party. That included changes en route based upon requests as we traveled. Whether it was about the culture, history, animals, plants, geography, museums, wines, restaurants, shopping or accommodations, Clive had extensive knowledge of all things local. I thought of him as a "renaissance" man since his interests where so varied and more than just a surface knowledge; he had in depth knowledge on a wide variety of subjects. Additionally, he was a cautious and careful driver and his car was impeccably clean and comfortable. I recommend Clive highly to anyone who wants to make the most of their time in South Africa. The value received is well worth the very reasonable cost.

Wonderful, personal and high standard tour-guide!. As a teenager, I had the opportunity to visit Capetown and the Cape-area with a bunch of friends. With Clive as our tour-guide, we had a magnificent week! He took us to all the right spots. He adjusted his program to our demands, had arranged lovely meals, nice visits,... He has a well-prepared tour and gives explanations which are full of information without getting boring. He's very social, knows the Cape and its nice spots by heart!I would highly recommend "The Cape Town Tour Guide Co." to all South Africa visitors!!!

I had a very good tour in Cape Town and would do it again as soon as possible.. I had a great time and Clive's more than a guide. He really is someone who knows how to talk to youngsters and how to amuse them. Most guides I met in the past were boring people who had jokes that were good, for seniors. Thank you very much. I really enjoyed it!

A+: Professional, knowledgeable, empathetic gateway to Cape Town's beauty, diversity, and culture.. Clive De Bruyne and his staff significantly enhanced our academic group's visit to Cape Town and vicinity. We experienced the tragedies and triumphs of pre-and post-apartheid South Africa at government, academic, public, and private levels. South Africa is arguably the most interesting country in the world; Cape Town is the most beautiful city on earth. The Cape Town Tour Guide Company will enhance these facts, organize your visit and adjust to your preferences on the spot. Clive De Bruyne and his empathetic staff will help you experience South Africa's diversity of peoples, economies, and cultures safely and profoundly. They will guarantee that the shadow of Table Mountain will follow you and comfort you forever.

Magnificent. I really enjoyed the trip. You get to know the touristic Cape Town, but also the beauty of the Cape region. I highly recommend this tour to anyone who'd like to visit what I consider one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Could be better. This being my first Safari I was happy just to see the animals for the first time but I don't recommend it for people who have done multiple safaris.The best part of the safari was the Elephant encounter where there were two elephants who started following our bus and it was a great experience since they got so close.The Hippos can be seen half covered in the water but they rarely move or are active The most disappointing experience is the Lion encounter as it seemed the lions were either hypnotized or tranquilized or whatever cause they just lied there sleeping not moving at all the bus didn't even have barriers or protection and we go so close so it seems the reserves knows the lions won't be moving.The giraffes were so far away and could barely be seen and only 2 of them.

Amazing safari! Highly recommended. Had little expectation but was astonished. Was my first safari and we saw all the animals we were promised: lions, zebras, rhinos, hippos, giraffes, elephants, buffalos, wilderbeest, and also cheetah and leopard, the latter two caged as they were not yet ready to be released into the reserve alone. Fab weather, great fun guide Tom! You go in a safari 4x4, and espesh lions were realllyyyyy close up, what an adventure! Was a fanstastic experience, not to mention we had breakfast, lunch (both delicious) and prosecco twice (on arrival and half way in the middle of the reserve). Oh and they have a marvelous swanky outdoor pool, perfect for a drink after lunch. Highly recommend this day trip!

See the Big fives for sure!!. One of the best game reserves near cape Town. Overnight tour is recommended as, you can see lot of activities of the animals late in the evening and early morning. Accommodation is too good and gives a taste of nature!! Food is ok. you will see all big fives for sure, as it a private game reserve spread over acres of land.

Great place to hang out for a day if in Cape Town. Being in Cape Town for a week with family, this is a great escape to the nature and opportunity to see the wild animals in the park!From Big 5 we saw Rhinos, Elephants and Lions (very far). Also other animals there!My son really enjoyed the trip!Great digital booking service! I was browsing yesterday night the website of the park, and got contacted by their Chat. We had a quick conversation, the Agent shared all the prices, possibilities, and got us booked in less than 5 minutes on following morning tour. Was very impressed!We came by our own car, there was a welcome drink and delicious breakfast waiting for us. The drive in the park was fun followed by lunch, and then a nice swim and rest at the pool. Enjoying the experience and this day trip a lot!

Catch the Big 5 experience right here. If you have never been on a safari then you must try this. It may not be Masai Mara but do not get fooled by this small reserve as this drive has a lot to offer. We arrived here after a 2 hr drive from Cape Town and were welcomed by a glass of champagne. Before the drive starts you are greeted by the sight of stallions and some peacocks roaming freely. We opted for only the game drive so they start off first with lunch at 1300 hrs and then off to the drive. The buffet spread was delicious and cater to vegetarians as well. The Malva pudding is to die for :) Our guide Kensington was very informative and stopped wherever he could and gave us enough time to click pictures. If you are heading here during September and October please carry warm clothing as there is a lot of cold air breeze during the drive. We saw hippos, Ostriches, Zebras, a mother Rhino with her cute baby, Springbok, lions (males fighting over a female as always :) ), an Elephant trekking down the hill for some oranges (never saw that coming), cheetahs and some members of the "ugly 5" as Kensington called it..lol We were as close as possible to the animals and a truly one of a kind experience. This is a must do when you visit Cape Town

Nice "Reserve" but beware of food buffet.... Aquila is a small game reserve about, 2 hours northeast of Cape Town. The grounds are very well kept and luxurious. Kensington was a fantastic guide and made seeing the "big 5" a very fun and enjoyable experience. Unfortunately at the beginning of the tour, the symptoms of food poisoning began to take hold. I ate the breakfast buffet, which was nice but also pretty basic for luxury preserve standards. I had several of the breakfast meats and fruits. Within four hours, I was completely symptomatic and got sick on the way back to the hotel in Cape Town. I saw two other reviews that mentioned food poisoning. As with all buffet style food preparation, be careful. Hopefully this was isolated to just me today as I am still currently very under the weather.

Safari Day Tour and Quad Bike Combo. Amazing experience and got to get quite close to the elephants and lions. Couldn't find the buffalo within the allocated time which was all we missed. The Quad bike part after lunch was so much fun and we got to explore much more of the reserve as we could go faster and as such we got to see the giraffe which were not seen in the morning part either. Great lodge and great food too.
Big 5 in small reserve. Nice experience in Touwsrivier. The drives are well organized and guaranteed to find the animals. Good hotel and cosy restaurant.

Two day safari. We arrived on a thursday (drove ourselves) and were greeted with champagne and juice before having lunch. Food: The buffet (breakfast, lunch,dinner) was rich and the food tasty. Coffe and juices were included with breakfast but no drinks were included with lunch or dinner. We were surprised how fresh everything was. Different fruit was always available and some of the meat was prepared on request.Rooms: Our room (two single beds) wasn't spacious but then again you don't plan on being in your room anyway. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean and shampoo, shower gel and conditioner provided for.Safari: we got to see the big 5 up close which was an amazing experience! The animals looked healthy and cared for and it was a pleasure to watch a mommy rhino interact with her baby.But, one should be aware of the fact that this is nothing like kruger (or any other 'real' national park). The animals roam freely within the area that is fenced off and the lions are separated from the other animals (2elephants,3giraffes,some rhinos,8 hippos and many zebras etc). I like the idea that the lions were rescued from trophy hunting but if you expect them to be wild (they are fed) and free (referring to the fences even though the reserve is huge) this is not the place to go. I am not trying to say that they do not have enough space but if one is expecting natural behaviour by (e.g. hunting) they should reconsider this reserve. I want to stress the fact that the lions (and all the animals in the rescue center) were saved from canned hunting and that they grew up in captivity which led to unnatural obese animals and loss of the hunting instinct. All in all the idea behind the project is undeniably good and you'll be rewarded with awesome pictures.The staff was friendly and always helpful!

Stay away unless u want to visit a zoo!!!. After visiting Masai Mara ,, this place was a water of time ,,What's the fun of watching lions and elephants on the backyard of a cottage ,, The lions are in a wired enclosure And So are other animals !!!

Disappointing. About 2 hrs by road from Cape Town,this pvt reserve was rather disappointing as its nothing more than a open air zoo! Most definitely NOT the place to visit for a genuine wild life enthusiast

We had a great time. We booked for two nights.AccommodationThe first night we stayed in a standard lodge room with no view, and a window that looks out onto the passage (privacy!), and carpark. I was rather disappointed with this room. I do see how it could be a useful room for someone who is there for one night only, as you could be ao busy that you do not need to spend any leisure time in the room. As we wanted some peaceful leisure time, we upgraded to a premium lodge room with a balcony and view. The difference was phenominal. We had a lovely time in the afternoon sun drinking wine on our balcony looking for animals. Very relaxing. The room is also much more spacious than the other room.There is a shared entrance which is not the best. You can hear neighbours in both types of rooms. FoodI enjoyed the buffet style food, especially the breakfasts with fruit (and various ther cold bowl items), cooked breakfast, cheese and preserves, flapjacks/crumpets (pancakes) with dulce de leche, coffee tea juice and sparkling wine.I do think that there is room for improvement for the lunch and dinner.Meats were amazing, but the vegetables for bland and boring. One or two unique dishes would be nice. Overall the food was nice but it could be amazing.Game drivesWe loved the game drives. We got to see loads of animals within the first ten minutes- rhino, elephant, hippo and springbuck. And other animals later on. The guide was amazing. I do feel like this is a large zoo without cages, as the animals are supplement fed which makes it feel a bit more unnatural. The karoo does not provide enough food and water for these types of animals so the human hand is needed, although it is still a good experience. The lions are in a separate enclosure, which I understand as they are rescues. I did feel a bit sorry for them, being fat and lazy and having no reason to exercise. It was still great to see the lions closeup and cageless.The break with sparkling wines and snacks was fun. The evening drive was longer (2.5h) than the morning (1.5) with more animals. Landscape and propertyThe landscape is very interesting. Karoo vegetation and fynbos create a red and arid scape. It's nice to see something different. The property is great. The restaurant is perfectly situated facing the reserve with huge glass windows and a pool. Peacocks rule the grounds :) There is a mix of chalets, lodge (think modern apartment block), and cabins. Most of the chalets face the grounds of the property, the cabins face the reserve (on stilts), and the lodge has rooms that face the reserve as well as back rooms with no view. ServiceThe service was good. All in all, 4 stars as we really enjoyed our time but their would be a few things to improve for a rating of 5. Tips:Pay extra for a premium lodge room if staying for a leisurely and relaxing time. If returning to Cape Town, take a drive through Ceres, Tulbagh and the beautiful Bainskloof pass.

Exceeded my expectations. I count on these reviews for future decisions so I always try to be as informative as possible for others like me, here goes; this place was really well done! Although my room had no view at all, it was clean and well maintained. Bathrooms werenice and I loved the old fashioned skeleton key for the rooms. Pool was nice, too cold for us to do anything more than dip our feet but beautiful to sit around and have some drinks.They have stargazing with a high powered telescope every night at 830 and a bonfire where they bring you marshmallows to roast. Drinks were good and cheap, food was good, all buffet style. You do have to pay for water all the time though (about 1 usd)Now for the actual reason you go here... the game drives!! I stayed for 2 nights so went on 3 drives and they were all fantastic. We saw a ton of animals on every trip. Let me be clear this is a game reserve so the animals are used to seeing the jeeps and definitely not afraid to come close to you. This is NOT intended to be a wild safari. The lions are kept in a seperate enclosure from all the others and fed weekly so they really dont care to lounge around while you drive up to them. It was amazing to watch them so close, they stared right at you intrigued by why we were there. We saw giraffe, hippos, rhino, elephants, lions, springbok, water buffalo and baboons. There is a rehab facility they take you to as well which was pretty nice, nothing dramatic but cool.Service here was impeccable, our driver Vino,even let us get out on one of the drives so we could get closer to the giraffes! They provide everyone with blankets for the morning drives as it is very cold in the open jeeps. The scenery was magnificent too! A few things to know, they have a gift shop with some really nice stuff and it does have an atm should you need one (it didnt charge me any fees to take Rands out), not every room has working charging area but some people I met there simply asked for a different converter and they were happy to help. I had no problem withmy european two prong adaptor.Other guests I met while there raved about the spa which gave massages, facials and an indoor pool. Overall amazing experience would highly recommend!

A fantastic experience. We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at Aquila, the game rangers are excellent and very knowledgeable (Hyron in particular was brilliant) and go out of their way to show you as many animals as possible during the game drives. We went on 3 games drives and all were vastly different to the other which is great.The food is fantastic and offered different meals at each sitting.We will definitely be visiting again in the future.One suggestion would be to hold the private drives at different times to the usual game drives, we were disrupted twice during our last drive because of the private safari. Firstly we had to wait for a few minutes right at the beginning of the drive while the private car looked at the elephants (it could have been the car filming with the drone that caused this) and then secondly we couldn't get up on to the lookout point where we had snacks and drinks during the drive the night before because the private vehicle was up there. We ended up having to have our snacks and break right outside the lion enclosure. This was a minor issue however.Overall I couldn't recommend it highly enough!

Family safari weekend. About 2 hours out of Cape Town (more if you get stuck behind huge trucks travelling very slowly in convoy!). Reception was very well organised with welcome drinks followed by a huge buffet lunch. We could only check in to our rooms at 2, after lunch. The rooms were tastefully decorated and had both air-con and heaters. We stayed in the family semi-detached cottages for 2 nights. The room consisted of a four poster on the ground floor and 2 single beds on a mezzanine floor. This was fine with older children, but I wouldn't recommend for younger ones, as the stairs were quite steep. The bathrooms where fine, but hot water wasn't guaranteed. (indoor bath and outdoor shower). The game drives were very good and informative. Do not expect the Kruger! This is a very small reserve, but I think it's great if you want to introduce your kids to the wildlife safari experience. The drives are between 1 and a half and 2 and a half hours long. The morning drives also show you the rescue centre (ARC), which is very interesting. I would say the facilities are better for people travelling with younger children, as teens tend to need more, if it's too cold to swim. Food was great!!!!!! (and so much of it!) Staff were very nice and helpful,

A great Game Reserve to Visit. The Reserve is a 10,000 hectare site and as two swimming pools. We stopped in the Mountain lodge room overlooking the swimming pool and also overlooks the game reserve of which the two Elephants are in view of the rooms in the afternoon. If you go to a game reserve make sure you have plenty of warm clothing it can get very cold out there in the mountains you can always take the extra clothes off but if you haven,t got any to put on you wont enjoy it as much they will supply blankets but don,t get caught out. The Safari was amazing withe all the animals Buffalo, Rhino, Lions, Elephants Hippo, Giraffe,and so on. If you stay the food is first class it,s a running Buffet always something to suit everyone and if you have any food allergies or are vegetarian just ask. the drink is sold separate all except at Breakfast time of which you can have all the drink you want make your own bucks fizz fruit juices tea and coffee. If you buy any drinks its that cheap don,t worry about how much it will cost and they run on a tipping system of which its normally 10% of the total but I always give more as sometime you would be only giving a few pence away but its up to you and the service is great and second to none. You can go Horseback or Quad bike safari as well and the trip by car is only about 2hrs from Capetown by road and I am ashamed to say the roads I drove on are a lot better then ours in Britain and also a lot safer I drove for two weeks for the first time there and its was a pleasure to drive. If you want to visit a fare amount of things like we did a car hire is a must but don,t try to drive to much as you will miss the sun and there,s always time to go back another year.

Disappointing. We weren't expecting the Kruger game variety but we were expecting 4 star service. After booking and re-confirming our massages we arrived to no massage booking. We were told that due to the spa having only been open a couple of months, they were still experiencing teething problems. We were also told that we weren't the first couple to have this problem. Nevertheless, they were able to fit us in then after we showed our frustration. The poor spa assistant was not very well trained in problem solving. The massages were fair.(If you want an awesome massage, be sure to check out Life Day Spa in Crystal Towers Hotel). Just some advice, if you are on the shorter side, like me, ask for a lower locker in the spa locker room. My locker was in the top row, I had to stand on my toes to reach into it. The Spa staff and Manager apologized once again and said they'd organized that biltong and wine would be delivered to our room on check in, at 2pm. When I enquired at the reception at 4pm about the promised goods, a blank look is what I received, I left it in their hands. When we returned to our room after our first game drive, there was champagne and fruit?? This after the Spa Manager asked us whether we'd prefer red or white wine..we had said we would prefer red wine.We had paid extra for a room with a view, the view was nice, just a pity no animals made their way to the watering hole. The decor is tasteful, bed is comfortable, just a pity about the foreign dark hairs on the bed linen...The food is excellent, you cannot find fault with it. Lots of variety, lovely salads and fruit. The downside of the dining experience is having to ask at least 3 times for your slip, even going back after lunch to say that we still haven't received our slip to sign off. We were told the disorganized lunch time was due to staff shortages. At dinner we were given our drinks slip mid meal, before dessert, no pen to sign off. On the game drive, when all 6 viewing trucks are all parked at the elephants, it is very difficult to hear our ranger over the other 5, all talking at the same time. Thank goodness the trucks split up after that but if you want to clearly hear your Rangers commentary, be sure to sit in the front of the truck.Overall, very average. I guess Aquila just needs us all to go visit only once, to make their money. I don't think they are phased about whether we ACTUALLY enjoy the expierence or not.

Awesome!!!!!. Booked late, received warmly and professionally. friendly staff, great food, room with a view to remember forever. our game drive guide Timothy, was both pleasant and knowlegable and able to anwser all questions asked. all in all well done. thank you indeed. will be back. M

Not a Kruger Park experience, but OK. If you are looking for real safari adventure, this is not your choice. But considering it is about an hour 15 mins drive from Cape Town and you want to see Big 5 in a shortened period, this should be your choice. The food was good, considering it is complimentary if you are an overnight guest. The breakfast gets a little crowded when the day tour guest arrive. The rooms seemed a little better in the website; they were a little cheaply decorated and the minibar was actually very dirty. Think of this as a well organized but a two - three hour summed up safari experience. For me it was more than ok. I got what I expected.

Over rated .. It was a full day excursion from Cape Town but it left me disappointed as it was more like a zoo than a safari. Saw all the big animals like lion hippo rhino zebra etc but it appeared by the looks of the animals that they were not wild but kept there as shown pieces. Food was good staff was cooperative but still I felt my time would have been better spent in some of the other activities around Cape Town.

Mother/daughter. Well for a Safari it was very cold, but we were warmed with many blankets, and saw many wonderful animals. We had breakfast and lunch there, and saw some interesting foods. Anthony our driver who picked us up from Blackheath Lodge was amazing! Couldn't of asked for a better driver! Alfonzo who was our tour guide at Aquilla was also amazing! We couldn't of asked for anything better except maybe the giraffes to cooperate! Saw great things and have pictures and videos to cherish forever.

Great Safari experience at a great price. We booked this on line after reading the reviews and expected a great experience. We were not disappointed. Check in quick a breeze and we were assigned to our first of two safari trips. We got on the truck and headed out. The tour guide was great and took us around to see the animals and provided us with details on the animals that we saw. We were able to see a variety of animals and a lot of them. We saw most of the big 5 animals, the buffalo was being elusive but that is ok. Animals do not follow our desires.I have to say my highlight was the lions and seeing them. We got to the lion area and they were hiding up high on the hill. We were taken out of the trucks and walked to close to where they were. Took our time there to see the lions and they showed off for the crowd. I just loved them.The morning safari drive was nice and I enjoyed that. We went to the rehab area and saw some of the animals there.The food for dinner and breakfast was good. It offered a nice selection of local foods. I had the ability try new things.The room was great. Would have been an excellent view if we did not get there so late (arrived in the room after dark). My recommendations would be to get there early to enjoy the facilities. We get there at 4pm just before our first tour and did not get to enjoy all Aquila had to offer.

Ideal game park for family with young kids. An ideal size game reserve that make great viewing of some of South Africa rescued big game. Unlike the Kruger and other game parks, kids will love the safari tours as the essential African animals can be easily seen in close proximity. Its a safe and exciting environment for those who have not seen big game without the early long treks nor the malaria considerations. Its a 2 hour drive from town and you can take the longer scenic route via Ceres.The accommodation and food is also top. Give the horse back Safari, its unreal.
Karoo gem. Awesome food, accommodation, the big five, service of the highest quality, all within 2 hours of Cape Town! We will be back.

Spectacular . Aquila is a place where you are welcomed warmly by all the staff, where you can relax, whilst watching elephants walking in the distance. The restaurant and bar were excellent, as was the accommodation, everything was of a very high standard.Special mention to Granwell, our driver to and from Cape Town, excellent driver and polite and welcoming.Also Anneline in The Spa, where I had a very relaxing facial, she was very skilled and talented. Also Betsie, the Executive Housekeeper Manager, who led a very loyal and honest team, rooms were cleaned to a very high standard. I had unknowingly left my Kindle in the lodge on the day of departure, and her staff found me and returned the Kindle. It was a present from a dear friend, so I was so very grateful.Also Winston, our game driver, who was so informative about the animals, and gave us an unforgettable experience.Thankyou to you all.

Awesome Awesome. I admit it, I'm a hard man to please. I'm picky on just about everything. But I work hard, and I want the finer things in life. I'm in Cape Town on business and had the weekend to kill. My wife who was tagging along wanted to do an overnight safari. I did some research, I wanted something close to Cape Town and that looked nice. I can not express how much my wife and I had such a fun, exciting, and relaxing time at Aquila. I provide my review in bullet points, pros/cons.We avoided the toll roads and took the mountain roads to Aquila, it took about an hour and 55 mins, very little traffic if any. Pros1) We saw wild baboons on the side of the road. Just relaxing, minding their own business, too funny. 2) The Main Entrance was clean, and it screamed safari. 3) Easy parking right up front.4) The entire decor of the main building was nicely decorated. 5) We booked the Luxury Premium Cottage, SO WORTH THE MONEY. It was private, outside shower and jacuzzi. The stone walls, the bed was comfortable, the views overlooking the property, amazing. 6) THE FOOD....I'm an Italian from Brooklyn. I know good food, the food here was A++++. That chicken was delicious. So good I told the lovely waitress I needed to speak to the Chef, delizioso!!7) The staff was helpful and nice. 8) The tour took about 3 hours. We saw lions, hippos, elephants, rhinos, giraffes, and a bunch of little, forgot their name animals. My wife and I got amazing video and pictures. We were 3 feet from the lions, 3 feet. It was amazing! Friend me on Instagram to see the pics and videos, @ "fuscoooo". Cons1) Average wifi. Not the fault really of Aquila. There's no fiber in the area, I think. Plus all those brat kids playing Pokemon Go or something...In closing, I'd recommend Aquila in a heart beat. The Luxury Premium cottage is a slam dunk! I DO NOT give an Excellent review unless I'm blown away. Aquila met my standards.

Amazing time :). Real good experience. Our Mountain view room was just amazing.. Food was good..nice buffet...good for very one.. People working there was also very helpful. It is a nice place where we can meet other people from different countries. I think it was the best part of our holidays in South Africa. The Safari was wonderful, Winston our guide has some funny stories and make the trip more interesting. Will surely recommend this place. Only thing is that you should bring hot clothes when you go there..really freezing!!! :)
Great weekend!. Very good experience! Food was delicious. We enjoyed the game drives and visiting the ARC was an experience. Rooms were clean and the service was exceptional.

Great day out!. A great way to see wildlife close up. Lovely welcome sparkling wine or grapetizer for non alcoholics, and a small but delicious buffet lunch. A beautiful setting while you wait for the tour to start. Our tour guy was great, very friendly and a huge smile while he gave the tour and answered questions. A good 2 hour length, although we were unlucky in getting a roudy bunch of kids. All the animals are close by, although the end of the tour (seeing the lions) was dificult, as its a smaller encloser than they would have in the wild (but better that than being hunted). Free wifi for tourists with no internet. Locals may find it pricy, but considering the amount you see in a short amount of time, its god value for money.

They make good use of what they have. We only had a long weekend in the Cape and my daughter's fiancé - new to South Africa - had his heart set on safari. Aquila was the pick of the bunch researched. We went for the afternoon safari 1.30pm - 3.30pm. Nice complimentary fizz on arrival. Hint: don't drink it there and then: take it through with you to the restaurant and you probably won't need to buy any extra drinks if you eke it out. Buffet lunch was good if somewhat lacking in choice of hot food (chicken, fish or lamb only). If you stay there go for a room as high up as you can and take binoculars, to get the view of the lake (and animals).The safari itself was ok, our ranger Mike cleverly got us close to the elephants - there are only two. But elephants in any numbers are amazing. I loved the white rhino - there are half a dozen of them. Plenty of zebra, gnu and springbok. It was all a bit artificial though, especially the poor old lions locked in their little valley. Rescue centre has lions and a leopard. All in all a very good outing, and at £60 a head pretty decent value for money (NB we drove ourselves there, this was not a Cape Town pick up). My daughter's fiancé loved it.

Thank you!! . Lovely stay..immaculate room (thank you Betsy and your amazing team )...safari guide simply the best (Winston!)..food amazing...look this is A GAME RESERVE soooo there is no wild hunting etc etc...it depends what you want this is a very very good way to see animals closely ...yes some of it is a little "zoo" like but I loved it and everyone was just so kind and helpful.

An expensive day trip. A day trip from Cape Town waterfront cost us approximately $500 Australian per person. This price included transfers to and from our hotel by mini bus which was 2.5 to 3 hour drive each way, entrance to the reserve, 3 hour game drive, buffet lunch and dinner. We were the last picked up and the bus was full with 15 of us keen tourist from all over the world. It was fun speaking to them and swapping safari stories. Our driver was nice and drove safely. We did a quick stop at a service station for coffee and a toilet break. The reason we decided to do this day trip is because we didn't get our safari fix in Chobe and Kruger, we wanted to get a closer look at lions and hippos. The expensive price tag made us think twice but at the end of the day we didn't want to leave Africa without these close encounters. Aquila is a private game reserve, but the animal here are not wild, these poor lions have been rescued from canned hunting. They have separate enclosures for the lions an other vegetarian animals and they feed their animals regularly. They also have nearby a rescued centre, a sanctuary for animals with sad stories attached. After having a nice buffet breakfast we were loaded into safari trucks, they are much bigger then the ones in Chobe and Kruger. The tour guide/driver educated us on the animals but we couldn't hear what he was saying, a microphone was needed. We saw up close hippos, wildebeest, zebra, Impala, lions, giraffe, elephants, ostriches. The lions were beautiful but it was sad seeing them so fat with lack of exercise, from my understanding the injection given to them to stop them from breeding causes them to gain weight. We had a champagne drink break in the middle of our drive with zebras and giraffe in their enclosure. I was a bit disappointed we didn't see rhinos up close and no hyenas, cheetahs or leopards roaming freely. There was cheetahs and a leopard caged in the rescued centre, we were lucky enough see them. The game drive felt really fast and there was not much animals to see, don't expect to see big heard of animals. We had fun as it was different from the wild game drives we have been on and this was the first time we got so close to the lions. I can understand why others would be disappointed coming here, it definitely doesn't give you that excitement of tracking and finding an animal. The reserve is beautiful and it had accommodation on site. The price of the tour compared to what you get is not on par, although we did enjoy this tour I would not come here again on my next visit to Cape Town as it was way over priced.

great day out and so close to city centre. very friendly and welcoming staff - well trained - excellent buffet breakfast hi light was the flap jacks and then lunch was also excellent - game drive managed to see all the game so guess we where lucky and the rehab centre very interesting - hugely recommendable and will be back

Rain, Rain, Go Away. We were highly unfortunate that the weather was really bad when we arrived at the game reserve, we were hoping that the weather wouldn’t have that big an impact on the wildlife however we were wrong.We didn’t get to see any of the big 5 and the only animals we saw were three giraffes hiding behind a rock and a dazzle of zebra, the hippos were hiding under the water, the lions were hiding from the rain and the experience wasn’t that great.They did offer to show us round the conservation centre but i can see animals in cages at the zoo and it wasn’t what I wanted to see on a safari.Overall I know we were unlucky with the weather but for the price you are paying for the trip £100+ I would expect at least to see one of the big 5. Would not recommend going in the rain.

Disappointing to say the least. If it was possible to give a third of a star I would. From booking, to arrival, to our stay there and now the after service once we complained - we are completely disgusted to say the least! I strongly suggest to anyone considering spending your money on this establishment to rather save it and go else where! Our lodge was a hotel room which half of them were not stocked with all items, not turned down and not cleaned properly. Our treatment at the restaurant was utterly disappointing and not deserved. The only highlight / enjoyable time was the Safari we went on and the time we spent together as a family but we could have saved over R20 000 and gone to a MUCH better accommodation and Private Game Reserve! This is NOT a 4 star Game Reserve!

Narrow escape . Visited as Day visitor, excellent impression on arrival, good quality food. Started safari with excitement, watching Hippos, Rhinos, Elephants, Springbok, lions, Zebras etc. All animals were in limited numbers but enjoyed good close view of them. Resort has to improve its vehicles as I had a narrow escape from serious injuries. Door of the vehicle opened while taking a turn and I fell off. On inspection it was found that the door only holds itself without getting latched. I would recommend all visitors to check every thing themselves as staff did not inform about any shortcomings.
enjoyable. Great day out. We managed to see Elephants, Lions, Zebras, Hippos etc.... takes a llittle while to get to from Cape Town then the safari itself is around 2 hours

Great safari to well appointed private game reserve.. Cape town may be in africa, but it isn't the best location for a safari, Kruger style. The nearest you can get to roaming free wildlife is Aquila, which is a beautiful 2 hour drive from cape town CBD. Its a hotel/spa in the middle of the Karoo (semi-desert), carefully designed to fit the setting and yet provide well appointed accomodation. You can go for a day trip (safari drive + meal) or overnight (3 meals, 2 safaris). The buffet style meals are good and with a wide variety of things to try. there is also a great bar with comfy seats and log fires. But this is all a side show - you go there for the safari drives of course. These are in trucks with about 12 others and a local guide. They last 2 hours or so. The guides are fantastic at spotting the animals and getting up close. Herbivores all roam together in a massive 10,000 hectare space with mountains, water holes and valleys. It was fantastic getting so close to rhino, zebra, giraffe, ostrich, hippo, springbok and not so close to buffalo. Lions are in another huge space and leopard and cheetah separate again. Two unforgettable drives. But dress up warm - it was pretty chilly despite the blankets given out. Other reviews have moaned that the animals weren't all there (err - they are free to roam) or that it was basically a zoo (kinda true, but you don't get that feeling. It was us in the cage, not the animals). If free roaming safai is what you want, go to Botswana.Overall, great trip. Strongly recommend. Take lots of warm things if you go in the winter!
Got to see the whole big 5!. The safari was excellent and we saw numerous different animals including the big 5. The actual lodge is stunning and the lunch buffet was great!

Thrilling day out!. My two friends and I were quite excited To try this safari day out and it was well worth the visit!The boring part of driving from Cape Town to the reserve was quickly forgotten by the warm welcome and the breakfast.The visit - well planned, with a very helpful driver guide.We loooooooved it!

Terrible!. We wanted a romantic weekend away and got everything except that.Contacted the manager and two weeks later still no reply.Terrible customer service,overpriced zoo!You will not see us again.

Enjoyable experience . If you are in doubt of going on a safari then go ahead and choose these guys. The experience is amazing. The only setback was the long ride which took about 3 hours but was definitely worth it. You do stop in a rest area for restrooms and quick snacks. The 2 hour safari car drive was also very bumpy i kept sliding and jumping out of chair the whole time but there was a safety belt. The guys there did an amazing job welcoming us with a welcome drink and then a large breakfast buffet and a lunch as well after the safari was over. The safari was amazing as you see animals living naturally in their habitats. We got to see all the animals except the lions because it was very cold and windy. So in July get you scarf and warm jacket with you. The safari car had blankets for everyone.

Great experience close to Cape Town. Got picked up in a mini bus and drove through some spectacular scenery. Price include buffet breakfast. Safari included rescued leopard and lions. Safari park had elephants, hippos, zebras, rhinos, buffalo, giraffes, wildebeest, kudos, ostriches and a separate 'lion country'. Price also included buffet lunch. Explored the lodge afterwards - swimming pool etc

Conference addition. Spectacular views. Food served was incredible. Staff friendly. Animals were beautiful, seemed content and natural. Yannick the guide was amazing. Could tell he cared about the animals and was very knowledgeable.

Bumpy ride. Ok so I went to Cape Town in the winter and naturally it was cold when we got to the reserve- the staff gave us warm blankets and a hot breakfast which made up for the early start as this reserve is about two hours drive from Cape Town...
