The truck that we where in whilst on the reserve was built for endurance not not comfort and I found myself bumping out of my seat with practically every turn. That said we saw all the animals and got up close ... The driver was informative... If recommend this place
Tranquila Spa . World class. Friendly staff with an great treatment menu. Loved the Afri-hot stone massage. Perfect way to end the day after seeing the big 5. Highly recommend a visit.

Best Day Trip. i normally rate a company that offers safaris on a few things, firstly who answers the calls or replies to emails - from the beginning there conduct was professional and friendly - thanks to Tanya Lubbe. The driver was on time and courteous and soon we were on our way to Aquila. on arrival we got welcome drinks, option of either sparkling wine or juice as we were whisked to the lovely warm buffet breakfast (pics on my review) - We set off on the safari with Mike and he explained everything from poisonous plants, to how to cardinal direction and a brief history on the animals we came across. Half way through the safari we stopped by the Giraffes and had more Sparkling wine while we conversed with the other people we were on tour with.we also got a chance to see the great work Aquila does in there Rehabilitation centre (ARC) and then went back to have a superb african themed lunch, all buffet style. We then retired to the poolside with our drinks and enjoyed the sun as it was a pretty chilly day till we were driven back to Cape town.all in all - perfect day safari and only two hours drive from Capetown. its not the Kruger, but for tis part of the country and at the cost its perfect..

Over priced accommodation with good food and open zoo. The accommodation is over pricedThe food here is pretty good. The place setup is also good. The wildlife is good only if you've not seen the animals as it looks more of an open zoo spread across a larger area. You don't get a chance to see the wild animals from upclose. I would rather suggest the lion's park at Jo'burg

Overpriced accommodation but good safari . Stayed overnight with our two kids in the luxury family cottages. Paying just under R 8000 for the one night we were expecting luxurious accommodations and 5 star cuisine.We received instead very mediocre accommodations, had to ask for the blankets, hot water bottles and hair dryer which was supposed to be in our room. No bottled water provided and no dressing gowns.Food was buffet style and although tasty, it was a small variety and very much like any 3 star hotel buffet. They had no decaf coffee though the manager arranged for some the next morning.Our first game drive was less than 90 minutes and we felt the game warden rushed us as she was cold due to light rain. We did see some lions and zebras and giraffes before she hustled us back.The mid morning game drive the next day was wonderful. Our game warden Godfrey took his time and provided a champagne and water break. We saw 4 of the big 5. He ended the game drive by taking us to the lion and cheetah sanctuary which our previous game warden did not bother with.In my opinion this game reserve is way overpriced for what you get. I would advise finding alternative accommodation in Worcester ( about 40 min away) or Touws rivier and just do a day visitor safari trip to Aquila.

Great day out, saw plenty of wildlife.. If you are short on time this is a great place to see the big 5. Breakfast and lunch included and it was good quality and plentiful. The staff are friendly and helpful. We hired a car and drove there, took 1hr 50 mins. No map needed, just a straight rd with beautiful scenery. Great value for money.

Overnight visit. This is a great option if you have a limited amount of time. This is not a safari but you will see most/all of the big animals. This game reserve is more of an animal sanctuary and some of the animals were actually rescued from harsh conditions so could never return to the wild. Our guide, Abreal, was terrific- he was very knowledgeable about the animals and their habits and entertained us with his stories. Our mountain view room was lovely. The food was served buffet style and was quite good.Sine we did not have a car, we paid for transport. Our driver, Jolene, was great and we loved seeing the beautiful countryside. What I found odd was that upon arrival, we were told we couldn't check in until 14:00 and were directed to go have lunch in the dining room. When I asked about what we should do with our luggage, I received blank stares and a half hearted suggestion that they could keep my luggage by the reception area. I was not happy with leaving my stuff unattended so ended up dragging it to lunch. The next day, we were told check out is at 11:00 and our transport will not come until 12-12:30. So we had to sit around with our luggage waiting. Since Aquilla was responsible for the transport too why couldn't the times for check in and check out coincide with the transport times?
Safari time. A great safari park good value for money well informed staff and only 2hour drive from Cape Town.we did the day visit but friends enjoyed the overnight visit

Safari Experience. We had a good time. It was a different experience by going around in a safari vehicle (open vehicle). Spotted the Big 4 except the Cheetah. Was a fantastic 3 hours drive and spotted good number of animals. The Ranger was very good and guided us well. The best part was when the lion passed by our vehicle!!! Was are very good Safari Experience.

Relaxed atmosphere . We stayed at Aquila for our 1year anniversary. It has a very relaxed atmosphere. We went the 1st of May 2016. The evenings was very cold but there was always a romantic fire going in their lounge area. The game drives was fantastic! We did a sundowner drive and a early morning Safari! On the sundowner Safari we received champaign and snacks. The guides are all very friendly and entertaining.

Very disappointing. Despite its name, Aquila is more of a safari park than a game reserve. The reserve is small and only has a very limited number of animals, including 3 giraffes and a couple of elephants. The reserve's lions are kept in a separate, smaller enclosure. The 2 hour "game drive" was very disappointing, and punctuated by a 20 minute stop for drinks.Probable only worth it if you've never seen any animals in the wild before.

4 hours long drive worth it. . 4 hrs long drive back and forth were all worth it from Cape Town. The experience in a safari tour, seeing animals roaming wild instead of struck in cages, are truly awesome!We took the afternoon tour with lunch included.

Big 5 Safari. This really is like visiting Woburn but with the twist of being in a Safari vehicle. Yes, you are almost guaranteed the sightings, but the Lions are caged in. So yes you will see them ;0)

Beautiful Resort - Disappointing Safari. We loved the resort and were so impressed by the room and view.... The staff was generally friendly but not overly in your face or pushy. They seemed to just want you to have a nice visit and would do whatever was necessary to make your stay pleasant....The food was okay. I enjoyed the lunch on the first day. Lots of salads and sides to choose from. Dinner was a little gross and had some strange flavor and seasonings. Breakfast was the same. During dining, it was a buffet/serve yourself and it was really hard to get the attention of a server for anything to drink.The Safari rides were okay. But during the night Safari the guides stopped to have snacks and wine/champagne. People were smoking hand dropped their cigarette butts right on the Safari/game preserve grounds. This was disappointing to see. You also were able (if you a were a man) to pee on the bushes..... What? Just seemed odd. The break was too long and we lost our day light and didn't have enough light to see the lions or giraffes. I was pretty disappointed because this was an expensive portion of our trip.Overall - I liked the experience but would not return. We got lost coming in to the preserve and felt the directions posted were not very good.We would probably try a more well known and experienced Safari next time but did enjoy the resort overall.

Not good so much. This safari is the one of the nearest to cape town and it is the best from them but it's not the best in south africa , there are almost no animals!! When i went there i only saw two elephants , three giraffes and some of Ghazals and many of zebras and three rhinos , there is no lion or tiger , they put them in cage like a zoo!! The place is nice if you want to see nature ، also they served for us breakfast and lunch and the can take you and back from your hotel from almost 5 a.m to 5 p.m . The place is not so bad but i'm not recommend it , only if you don't have things to do or you have a free day you can go there.
Nice day trip,. Pick-up in time, good drive, you have some veg meals options in the buffet for a change! It's a good experience, worth one-time visit!

A great way to get that safari feeling without having to head into the bosch!. My friend and I were visiting Cape Town and wanted to go on a safari-like expedition. Our good friend is actually a game ranger and suggested Aquila since it was within driving distance for us since we couldn't afford to fly up north to the legitimate game reserves you see and hear about when you think "Africa!" The drive from the city was fun, we had to drive under a mountain at one point which was pretty neat. We were greeted with champagne and drank outside by the pool (which we can swim in before or after your safari, wish we had known!) until the buffet was ready. The food was delicious! Afterwards we hopped onto a truck and went off to see the animals! We drove into the main inclosure of the park and saw zebras, ostriches, rhinos, hippos, antelope elephants and giraffes. We also drive through a portion of the reserve which housed the lions as well, for obvious reasons they are kept separately. We got pretty close to a couple of the animals and we got to witness first hand how fast rhinos can run. They are quick! I didn't expect them to be so nimble of their feet for their size! It was a great day trip and www enjoyed every part of it. The staff were very welcoming and friendly as well!

A nice day trip experience. The pick-up: we were picked up at the hotel at the appointed time by a friendly local guy and some other guests, who had also booked the day-trip.Fortunately we had a safe driver who made everyone feel safe.The arrival: at the arrival, we were handed welcoming drinks and were shown to the buffet restaurant. The food was OK, nothing special, but we started the safari satisfied and with full stomaches.The safari: we were driven in a big jeep, which fitted about 10-15 people. The guide was very well experienced and explained a lot about the Reserve and the african wildlife. We managed to see a lot of animals (hippos, rhinos, giraffes, elephants, lions, zebras etc.) and it was a great experience. Although theres a roof on the big jeep, remember to bring enough sunscreen, since it gets quite hot!After the safari we were allowed to visit the center they had for rescued and injured animals. After the safari: after the safari we had some times for drinks and swimming in the pool, overviewing the savannah. Great and relaxing!I really can recommend an all day trip at this Reserve.

Worste Place!. This place is a joke and very deceiving to foreigners as to what a game reserve is all about. Its like a zoo. Caught game drivers drinking on the job, mice in the rooms. Game drivers giving the wrong information to foreigners, telling children that lions aren't dangerous. Staging game viewings by hiding food in the bush to bring the animals out. First time I have ever shortened a stay because of the place.

Amazing day with lions, elephants, rhinos, and more!. I loved this day trip. We left our hotel at 6 am and drove through gorgeous scenery as the sun rose over the mountains. When we arrived at the reserve, we had a drink to greet us and a great buffet breakfast that can be eaten at a leisurely pace. At 10 we started the safari - there weren't many people as it was winter in South Africa, so we only had one truck going out.It had been raining during breakfast, but stopped as soon as we pulled into the reserve. We were given blankets to keep us warm and emergency rain ponchos just in case. Just inside the gates, our guide, John, was radioed and we drove over to see two elephants. They were beautiful. We got close to them and John gave us a lot of information about the elephants, as well as springboks and ostriches, which were also with the elephants. We then saw hippos, flamingoes, rhinos (including two babies!!), baboons (which John did not like - he told us they were awful creatures! I got the impression in South Africa baboons are just a nuisance), a giraffe, and a type of antelope that I forget what it was called. We then went into the lion enclosure (they're enclosed as the other animals in the park build up a sustainable population so the lions can eventually hunt them). We saw all seven of the lions they have in the park, two males and five females. They were right next to the truck and it was AMAZING. At around 1, we went back for the lunch buffet which was delicious - I ate everything. There was a lot of options and some great traditional South African food cooked on wood burning stoves. At around 3 pm, we headed back to Cape Town. This was an excellent day trip that I highly recommend!

A very good safari near to Cape Town. The day trip safari includes a welcome drink, lunch (buffet), a late afternoon safari with champagne, bilton, cape dried fruits and nuts, dinner (buffet), accommoation for the night, an early morning safari to the rescue and conservation center and breakfast. You have to pay the refreshments ordered at the afternoon and evening buffets.The buffets had a lot of various foods like salads, vegies, meats, rice and potatoes etc. including desserts of fresh fruits, puddings and cakes with sauces.Breakfast included fresh fruits, toast, various pastries and bacon, various egg dishes, sausages.The late afternoon safari was sensational. We saw all the wild animal up close, except for the giraffs. Just don't forget to take a jersey, even better a jacket and perhaps a scarf for later in the safari. Starting the safari it is very hot, but suddenly around 17.00h it becomes cold, the safari continues until approx. 18.00-18.30h so you will be happy to have the extra jacket.We were lucky to get the brand new room with ensuite bathroom (all rooms come with an ensuite bathroom) The standard or mountain facing suite has only a shower with toilet and basin, whereas the suite facing over the game reserve has a bath also.The mountain facing suite which we booked is really only to be used for showering and sleeping, plus checking mails. If you want to enjoy the evening outside with a glass of wine or you can't go to bed early, then you should book a suite overlooking the reserve, because it comes with a balcony.The morning safari included a visit to the animal rescue and conservation, and a quick drive through the reserve. All-in-all we could get the best photos of wild animals here in Aquila, we had an excellent guide, the food was plentiful, it was clean enough (a lot of people were visiting), it was a good stay.

A Great Day Trip from Cape Town. When in Africa you have to see the famous animals and if you are ok business or on a short schedule, this is the pace to go!only about 90 mins out if Cape Town, Aquila is a great private reserve that has a great selection of animals, great food options, a full bar and accommodation in luxury bungalows if you decide to stay a bit longer!I have taken stage here every year for the past 5 years!Staff are great if you communicate what you want for the experience. You can tour the park and see all the African animals either by the traditional safari vehicle or be a little more adventurous and see the park by Quad bike or even on horseback!!! It adds such a different experience when you are only meters away from an African Elephant or Rhino and are sitting on a quad bike or on horseback!!Staff are great, food is excellent and the experience is priceless!! Well worth the visit!

An amazing experience!. My husband, my daughter and I visit the Aquila Private Game Reserve and I can asure you that it was worthy the tour , they receive you with sparkling champagne and cold drinks, the buffet was delicious, the safari was such an experience! We saw the big 5, fist the giraffes appear, then the elephants, rhinos, zebras, gacelas, lions from distance, wow.... they look free and wild, but the highlight was when we saw 2 elephants taking a bath peacefully!! The best of all was the outstanding staff that took care of us, they really make us happy, not only the drivers but the receptionist and the manager. All of them together manage to make our day a magical day. With no doubt we would recommend it you to visit.

A little taste of the wild - but not too far from Cape Town. My husband and I, along with our 4 year old were here. What an amazing place! The welcome is warm and the attention to detail is refreshing. We stayed in a beautiful room, overlooking the safari park, and my daughter loved having her own little place in the 'loft' area upstairs. The safari was informative, and the animals were mesmerising, looking content and cared for in their surrounding. And the most memorable bit was waking up in the middle of the night, and stepping out into the open, woken up by the sound of a lion's roaring. It was a magical experience, and one I would recommend!
Wonderful. The day I spent at Aquila Private Game Reserve was amazing, the staff are very kind and knowledgeable about wild animals. I do recommend it.

Big 5 are there. We visited on a day trip from Capetown and thoroughly enjoyed the drive out through some spectacular scenery. We were met with a Champagne reception and whisked through to the dining room for a tremendous buffet lunch. Mounting the purpose built vehicles was easy in the larger ones, but difficult in the smaller. The drivers were very careful over the bumpy tracks, but even so it was wise to hang on. It was no time before we came across Hippo basking in their lake, by which springboks, zebras and elan roamed. Suddenly the rhino appeared.This private game reserve is large enough to give the animals the privacy they need and to give visitors the feel of being on safari. You can try to spot the animals before the guide adding to the authentic feel of the place.There are not huge numbers of animals but those here seem well fed and happy and seem to be living in a fairly natural environment with freedom to roam consistent with visitor safety.

Can I go back???. My friends and I did the overnight safari package which included lunch (which was amazing) on day 1, followed by an evening safari and then dinner. We stayed in a luxury cottage which was very spacious and beautiful. The next day, we went on an early morning safari which was followed by breakfast and then checkout. The safari was an amazing experience. Our guide, Vino, was very experienced and well versed and got us very close to the animals (who were really chill with humans and loud safari trucks hanging out in their territory). We were able to see giraffes, rhinos, lions, ostriches, springboks, zebras, hippos, etc and take a lot of pics. During the evening safari, we stopped at a nice spot on a hill to enjoy some champagne and light snacks (including springbok jerky) and get to know others on the safari. I think it's safe to say that everyone had a great time!

Fantastic day trip - good value for money. Lovely drive out to Aquila. Great breakfast and lunch. The safari was fantastic, saw all the animals easily because it is a small reserve. They do some good conservation work but have been troubled with poachers four years ago.Take your swimming stuff and relax around the pool after lunch. However, the pool was very cold.

Too expensive. It is different experience but people have to pay too much money for this activity. Breakfast, animal visiting(nearly like zoo), lunch its cost nearly 350$. Its cost in thailand 25-30$. If I had a chance I would go again thailand.

Lions are my passion. We actually sat and enjoyed the lions. They took my breath away and brought tears to my eyes. I have pictures worthy of National Geographic. South Africa is absolutely wonderful.

Amazing Africa!!. For those who want a real African sampler but have little time to go to the bigger wild life reserves Aquila is the perfect solution!Approximately two hours scenic drive from Capetown this Resort is beautifully laid out with feel of the real African cottages and friendly staff who welcome you with a cold wine or sparkling juice while you check in if staying overnight, this I highly recommend if you have the time. If not then this can be covering in a day.You can drive down with your own vehicle or shuttles from Aquila will pick you from your hotel and drop you back. On the way you might want to visit the wineries surrounded by beautiful mountains or get fruit from the fruit stalls. The resort offers three kinds of accommodation catering for all budgets and tastes.Breakfast,lunch and dinner are scrumptious buffets sure to please everyone.The safaris run in the morning at 6.30 for those who want to kick off early, then at 1.30 after lunch and at 4.30pm. One can see the big 5 and lots of other animals. We were lucky to see Elephants, ostriches, springboks ,rhinos, hippos, zebra, wilderbeast,giraffe,water buffalos and antelope along with many bird varieties with peacocks strutting around the property. There is a swimming pool and bar and a cozy lounge with a fireplace and television for chilling out. Or if you want a camp experience there is a campfire pit.For the more adventurous, an extra experience of horseback safari or quad bie safari is highly recommended. It is a unique and amazing experience getting you so near the wilderness and experiencing the animals from a totally different aspect. You can also zip in by helicopter which is a scenic half hour from Capetown. A must have experience for all ages. I highly recommend this Resort.

AQUILLA PRIVATE GAME RESERVE. Family from UK visited Aquilla for an overnight on my reccomendation.Amazing, incredible were some words used to describe their stay and game drives. Their guide was highly praised and the 3 generations all had the time of their lives. Dr Van der Poel and Dr Manna say a big thank you to Aquilla's staff for a very memorable experience.

Good experience!. I knew I wanted to go on a Safari while in South Africa but I didn't want to center my entire trip around one since there is just so much to do! Well, this was a good compromise. I got to see the "Big 5," even though some of them were in a cage. It was a nice way to compress a safari into a day so I still had a lot of time to do everything else that South Africa has to offer!

Saw everything we had hoped too............ and more!. We enjoyed the day at Aquila and saw every animal we think they had. Our last viewing was of the majestic giraffes as they walked by our safari vehicle in the tall brush. What memories we have from this visit............. just GREAT.

Amazing nature experience. We did an overnight safari. What a great experience. We saw so many animals during the two game drives. Lions, rhinos, elephants, springboks and many more were all very close and great to watch. A trip highly to recommend.

Overnight safari - good but better to know what to expect. We recommend for people who have never done a safari in the wild before. If you are not too bothered with the rooms not being spotless and can do without nice food for the duration of the trip, the safari tme itself is ok and it is in the end good value for money compared to real safaris. Be aware that transportation during safaris is in trucks of up to 20 people. Leapards and cheatas (or rather singular for each) are also not in the reserve but in cages in a separate area.

Wonderful fun in relaxing surroundings . This place is lovely! From the sparkling wine drinks on arrival to the friendly staff, the magnificent animals (of which we saw all of the big 5) and the pleasant accommodation - we loved it.Yes it isn't a proper Safari but considering we didn't have to spend a fortune or wait days just to see the leg of an exotic animal, it's a fair compromise. Hard core safari goers may frown but hey, they're boring - who needs em. Our 2 nights stay was the highlight or our trip, especially the free horseback Safari we received when we booked for 2 nights. Go and have fun - if you want a real Safari go to Kenya and take a sufficient reading material to pass the time.
Fab day out. Beautiful place amazing experience ..highly recommend. Good for families with young children or teenagers and couples. Buffett lunch was lovely too

Fascinating. Fantastic place 2 hours north of Cape Town. You will be able to see the 3 (Lions, Elephant and Rhino) of the big five.Leopard and Water Buffalo not avail to see.It was a nice experience, not 100% sure about the environment the animals live in. No large trees or any other shadeavailable.

Good food and Accomodation, medium safari experience. Of course, one should know that the karoo cannot be a natural habitat even for moderately sized animals. Therefore, all the animals in the park are fed close to the roads and consequently can be watched at a few meters distance. Impressive had been the number of rhinos ( 5 adults, 3 babies). Rhino-breeding is the most positive aspect. There was only one wildebeest - where in a real safari there are in the thousands and only a couple of antelopes and buffaloes as well as two miserly elephants. Most disappointing was the lonely leopard and the two sickly cheetas in cage-like enclosures. No crocodile could be seen in a swimming-pool like murky basin. In short: It's a zoo with the visitors inside the fence, and good for children watching tame animals at close range. Many "safari parks" in Europe are similar. But it had bee a pleasant visit even for us adults: good food as well as accommodation, friendly and efficient service - and pleasant surroundings, especially in the evening. Value for money - as common in most of South-Africa nowadays - had been excellent (price 300.- Euro for two. one night incl. dinner/breakfast) .
Short and sweet. We wanted to give our daughter an insight into wildlife in South Africa as we had done a private reserve 10 days before. It does what it says on the tin.

Amazing day out!. We had a fantastic time at Aquila. We were booked on a morning safari, this started with a buffet breakfast in the game lodge which was a perfect start to the day - we could even see ostriches out the window! Next, we were taken out on the safari trucks, firstly to see some lions and a leopard outside the main park, before going into the reserve proper. On the safari we saw elephants, zebra, giraffes, springbok and ostrich, before going through the lion enclosure - the lions have their own enclosure, for obvious reasons! We also saw rhinos (including a couple of babies!), hippos and gnu. It was amazing to see all of these animals so close.

ZEEEEEEEBBBBBBRAAAASSSS!. What an experience!If you are looking for the authentic safari experience while in Cape Town, without having to travel many hundreds/thousands of miles to get it, then this is the place to go.The day starts with a great breakfast, then a spectacular guided drive through some of the most amazing scenery I have seen on my years of travel. The beauty of Aquila is that, despite it's huge size, it is relatively small in comparison to the more well known safaris. Not that you would ever know. This means that you are guaranteed to see animals in their natural environment without having to drive for hours and hours on the off chance that - for example - an elephant that was in a particular place the day before, might be there again today.I got speaking to the owner of the reserve and even though we were out for hours and saw many amazing animals, we only scratched the surface of what is there. If we get a chance to go back again, I have no doubt we would see even more of the beauty of this place and STILL be guaranteed to see dozens and dozens of animals.Elephant, ostrich, giraffe, zebra (my wife got particularly excited about the number of zebras that we stumbled across) lion (oh boy! did we get close to the lions) hippo, rhino and baby rhino, springbok, gnu/wildebeest and leopard. (Probably more, but my brain is fried from recalling the day)The fact that many of the animals here are rescued only adds to the beauty of the place.The driver/guide was clearly passionate about his animals and very knowledgeable.To round off the day there was then a fabulous meal once we got back to the lodge.This is a MUST visit to anyone coming to Cape Town - even the drive there goes through some spectacular scenery.

Informative Game Drive, Good Food. I went to Aquila with some Polish friends and we enjoyed it so much. The game drives, though very early, was great. Our guide took time to explain everything to us when we had questions. Also, the food was great. Traditional South African dishes freshly prepared. Will be back!

Quality experience. Absolutely phenomenal! Had a great time with my family over our 2 days. Brilliant experience exploring the reserve - managed to see and get close too Giraffes, Elephants, Rhino, Zebras, Hippos, Lions, Springbok and Wilderbeest. Lastly, great food on return and very friendly staff. Thanks all

Unorganized . Not many animals, very old cars, unorganized front desk and rangers, we were asking about our vehicles and they just looked confused because they made a mistake in the booking which we found out 20 minutes later.

Not a real safari experience . I had read many reviews on trip advisor before going and did realize there would not be a huge variation of animals and that it was not like an actual authentic safari experience, but since are time was limited we decided to go ahead and book it anyway. We got picked up in Capetown and had a stunning 2 hour drive down to the reserve. Greeted with sparkling wine and served lunch. The buffet wasn't spectacular and little choice, we didn't know that drinks cost extra so beware of that. The views from the infinity pool were lovely and we felt very lucky to see two elephants walk by in the distance. Our room was simple but clean and nicely put together with a big bath. No tv, and although thats not something we needed, we were disappointed that the wifi was very very poor. We got ready to leave on are afternoon safari, unfortunately it was not very well arranged and about 100 people had to stand around 1 man with a clipboard telling you what bus to get on. Yes I said bus... No safari jeeps but big open busses that seat about 30 people. Hardly intimate but we didn't really mind as we were so excited to see the animals. We were taken out and saw the same 2 elephants almost straight away and got great pictures, but as the safari went on we noticed that there is hardly any wildlife there at all. You go out in 6 busses at the same time, waiting your turn to be able to take pictures. It's actually a fairly small area where the animals are and it's very rocky and dessert like , no real place for animals to hide so you are guaranteed to see every thing. We saw 1 giraffe, a few springbok, 6 hippos, a few rhinos zebra and wildebeest. No huge hoards of animals, the lions are kept separate and are very fat, so you will never see a lion actually stalking or killing another animal. There was hardly any trees, bushes or anything alive really. We understand that the cape climate is different than up north but it just seemed so barron. We saw no hyena, warthogs, birds of any kind, meerkats , reptiles, porcupine etc etc. They did have a leopard...in a cage, and although we understood that the leopard could not be set free because it had been hand raised, the cage seemed rather small. There was one croc in a very tiny enclosure and two Cheetas. Dinner was once again buffet style and although not bad, you'd expect a bit more refinement from a 4 star hotel and it's not cheap. We hoped the morning safari would be different the next day, it was very cold but we were supplied with blankets and coffee or thee. It was exactly the same as the afternoon tour except very cold and we found it a bit pointless. Overall I personally think that Aquilla game reserve is descent if you've never had a safari before and/or you have kids. Staff were friendly and knowledgable. But we were very disappointed and you would see a much bigger variation of animals visiting a zoo, although I'm not a fan of them. Please save your money and do it right and go on a real safari. We were almost €600 lighter after just a one night stay and regret not saving up and going somewhere for a real safari experience

Safarii. Best safari experience ever!! My friends and I had a cottage that contained 8 beds... it was huge , comfy, relaxing, etc its a must going to. I also recommend horse riding safari its really amazing and soo worth it.

Game Drive at Aquila. The experience was better than expected since it was a private reserve. We have been to several other bigger ones over the years. If your time is limited this is good. We were picked up in Cape Town for a 2+ hr drive. Beautiful drive through the mountains.Got there for breakfast at 9, game drive at 10:15. Back at the lodge at 1:30 for lunch after also visiting the rescue center where a leopard and lion were fenced in. On the drive itself we saw quite a few animals even though some of them not too clearly. The lions (1 male and 2 females) were behind an electric fence but we were able to get right up to it to get some excellent pictures, until they came right up to the fence and roared at us. That's when we were asked to step back.This was the first time we saw a group of maybe 7 hippos out of the water. The paths on the drive were very rocky. And bouncing us around. It would be so nice if they could come in with some heavy equipment and smoothe it out some.Breakfast and lunch were included in the package but not drinks with lunch which was unusual. We had a little time after lunch to enjoy the sun and then headed back to Cape Town at 3.

Great for young children. This was perfect introductory safari experience for our young kids to tag onto a holiday in Cape Town. We saw all the animals apart from the giraffes on the game drives, and the kids loved getting so close to the animals in the trucks. I would recommend an overnight stay to see animals you might miss on just one game drive. The family lodge was delightful (apart from the lack of hot water). The food was excellent, especially the breakfast, after which you will not need to worry about lunch ! The guides very knowledgeable, and most of the restaurant staff welcoming and friendly, though some of the waitresses came across as slightly surly. The reserve is to be commended for its animal rescue program.

Nearest game reserve to Cape Town . Hi allIf you like to experience the big 5 and don't have a coupe of days to spare for Kruger or Serengeti , so Aquila is a nice compromise.You won't see herds that you would see on national geographic :) but you will defiantly see the big 5 Except the leopard (if u are lucky and sleeping over you can )It's 2-3 hours drive from Cape Town , the roads conditions are fine with great views , but I recommend a driver if you won't sleep over.Food and drinks are available there and is very good.Lodge is nice and clean with nice pool. Go there to thrill then relax as its very clam and quite placeCheers T!

Great trip. A very well organised place. The animals were outstanding. Our guide Godfrey was very knowledgable and gave great answers to any question asked. The food was very good. Well worth doing the night stay and two safaris.
Mr Mentor . Very relaxing.Good foods.Rooms are wonderfull and comfy.Trips are existing and so nice to see the wild.It's a adventure not to miss.

Disappointing. The room had just been painted and the paint smell gave me a strong headache, the mini bar was empty and there was no Tv in the room....also we gad a small accodent by the poortly lit pool. The receptionist was remarksble in his indifference, no icepack and no anti inflammatory gel in the first aid box.... Pitiful

A really nice tour. So, if you are in Cape Town and want an authentic like safari all in one day, this is the place to do it. It's not a true safari, but it's pretty good and it won't take up your entire vacation. The preserve is fenced in and houses free roaming elephants, giraffes, zebra, antelope, springbok, rhinos, hippos etc. they have a number of lions that are in another enclosure within the park that you will also drive through and may be able to the big cats from mere feet away, as we did. They also have a couple cheetahs and crocs located in their rehab area.Our trip included a nice breakfast with champagne and also a nice lunch after the roughly 3 hour safari. The preserve has a hotel and bungalows for overnight guests as well that looked nice. There's a gift shop of course too.You can opt to do the tour via big truck carrying up to maybe 30 people, or by horseback or ATV.
The big 5. We had a great nightover. 2 trips in the park and it was amazing. We came so close to the animals. Rangers could give us good information about the animals. Friendly people! Thx!

Pretty Good. Had a great time on Mar11. Our guide Johan was knowledgeable and funny. This review will be a positive one but I do understand how others may come to a lesser opinion. As a first trip to Cape Town I'd say do it to check the "Been there, done that," box. Also, lower expectations as the actual reserve , or the part used for the tour, is not very large and the number of animals are sparse. Also, a bit on the pricey side but hey, you're on vacation. This may not sound as a ringing endorsement but as this is how it was described to me by locals before we went, I knew what to expect and rather enjoyed it.  We saw the Big 5 and especially loved it when one of our group didn't listen to Johan and got too close to the fence to view the lioness up close and she lunged at her. The breakfast was good and the lunch was even better. Staff was friendly and attentive. My son enjoyed the dip in the pool after the tour. I vote on the side of with a try.

Great Experience. Although there isn't an abundance of animals, it's sad to see here people complaining about not getting the real safari experience. This is a reserve that is still growing and although they don't have thousands of animals like Kruger, I still felt it was worth every single penny. To start off they picked us up at the exact time they said they would, the breakfast buffet was great, the welcome wine was delicious, the Game drive was fun with a knowledgable guide and the buffet lunch was amazing. If you're looking to see a million animals roaming around, then go to Kruger, but my family and I got to see 4 of the Big 5, and thought it was all really nice! This is ideally for those who are in Cape Town for a short amount of time but still want to get some sort of safari experience.

Great for a first time safari type experience. Before our visit I thoroughly researched lots of reviews / the official website and had clear expectations. Firstly, this is no actual safari, it's a game reserve safari experience, but it does give you a feel of what a real one would be like. It's not like a zoo either !! There is a lot of land around the reserve and animals tend to be in the area where they were recently given food or where water holes are, except for the elephants (definitely only 2) and giraffe (approx 5), which wonder around the whole reserve. We still enjoyed getting close up to all animals including the giraffe and elephants along with the rhino, hippo's, zebra, elephants, wilderbeast, springbok, ostrich etc. Our only disappointment was the small amount of land given to the lions, which have to be separated to other animals as they would wipe them all out. Despite reviews saying similar about their enclosure, management don't seem to appear to be extending it, but are extending the hotel area - which is a shame. However, we did see the lions up close and enjoyed seeing them groom each other and affectionately play ( they are still wild so keep on your guard - no hands out of the truck )Accommodation, grounds and food were all great and staff were lovely so couldn't fault anything on that score. There is no champagne as stated in other reviews but staff offer complimentary sparkling wine.Overall, we totally enjoyed the experience and remember what you pay is significantly less than a real wild life safari so keep expectations real.I would recommend it.
Half day safari . Fabulous experience and delicious buffet before the safari started. Very knowledgeable ranger gave a great commentary throughout.

Excellent attraction - but too much bureaucracy.. While staying in Cape Town this attraction is about two hours drive away. It is possible to arrange for Aquila's drivers to pick you up from your hotel, and drop you back afterwards. The drive to the reserve is very scenic, and is an experience in itself.When we arrived, we were stopped at the gate in our minibus, and made to fill in our details on a sheet of paper, including our names and where we were from. After completing this task, which took some time with eight people filling in details on just one form, we continued to reception. Before we alighted from the minibus, our driver said we had to book in at reception, which entailed joining a long and slow moving queue. When we arrived at the front of the queue we were told we didn't need to book in. Very odd! And a pointless fifteen minutes queuing.From this stage on our experience was very good.We started off with an excellent breakfast, included in the price, which was a wide ranging buffet, with all the choices we could want. The safari started soon after. There were ten safari vehicles lined up, each seating about 20 people in an elongated land rover type vehicle. I'm not sure whether we struck lucky, or whether all safari trips at Aquila are like ours, but we had a brilliant driver, who was extremely knowledgeable, and very friendly. We were in the first vehicle to leave, and one of the last to come back. The trip took us around a large area, with the driver choosing the route. Our driver chose well, because we must have seen almost every variety of animal on the reserve. The first animals we saw were hippos, almost completely submerged in a pool. Then we went on to what for me was one of the highlights, elephants, about ten yards away. We continued round the reserve, visiting zebras, rhinos and various small deer, as well as some large wildebeest. We stopped half way round for a break, and got out of the vehicle. The driver opened a refrigerated container, and produced several bottles of bubbly, so at about 11:00 in the morning we celebrated with this. People who didn't want bubbly had a choice of beer or non alcoholic drinks.After this we went to see the lions. They were contained in a fenced off area, which we drove into. There were half a dozen lions dozing, and no fence between us and them. They must have been well fed. Obviously the lions need to be separated from the rest of the animals, because to them a wildebeest is a nice meal, and the management would certainly not want their stock eaten. But it seemed to me rather contrived to be viewing the lions in this way.We then found some giraffes, remarkably well camouflaged considering they were out in the open.We made quite a lot of other stops if our driver or one of the passengers spotted something of interest. We got back to the base after about three hours.At this stage, lunch was included, which was also buffet style, and was plentiful. There was also a bar where you paid for your drinks. After this we could enjoy the place for an hour or two, using one of the swimming pools or just lazing. Then, when we were ready, we were driven back to Cape Town.I would have rated this attraction 5 'blobs' instead of four if it hadn't been for the annoying procedure at the beginning of the trip.The whole thing cost just over £100.00. That included everything except drinks. Not a bad price for transport, food, and the chance to view all those animals.

Animals strategically placed. Booked 2-night but only stayed one. Partly due to an awful cough/cold but also because we'd seen it all in one day! A very nice conservation game reserve - they know exactly how many of each animal they have and separate the lions so they do not hunt the others. The animals are very well cared for and their food is supplemented, therefore they were easily found due to the placement of the food. A wonderful experience to get up close and get amazing pictures, especially for children. Our 9-year old boys loved it. A very well organised experience and our guide was very helpful in answering our boys questions. Travelled in covered jeeps. Tip. Take a sweater as the morning outing and the sun downer were chilly.The lodge where we stayed was very comfortable with a double bed on the lower level with a mezzanine level with 2 single beds. Outdoor shower plus indoor bathroom which was very clean. Nice choice of food on the buffet, but pretty much the same for lunch and dinner.Thanks to Baggy for taking the time to go to the chemist for me to get cough mixture.Only real disturbance was a sanitary towel left by the pool area! We reported it and it was cleared away immediately

awesome. stayed over night in "cottage", room was beautiful, comfortable bed nice room with patio. food was great, resort was perfect. seen the big five. definitely go again. went atv riding our guide was very good, can't say enough about this place

average small game reserve, a 2 to 2,5 hour away from Cape Town. A very commercial Private Game Reserve. Accomodation and pool-area were nice. Restaurant is big and not personal, food at buffet restaurant was OK, but nothing special. For a first encounter with African Wildlife and the Big 5 so close to CapeTown it's a nice place, but rather expensive and too commercial. We saw nice small baby rhinos, but very easy to find by the rangers. Some of the animals, cheetah and leopard are in captivity, the lions/lionesses are overfat, never seen this before at an upmarket private game reserve, they are feeded and don't look for a prey themselves knowing they get food from Aquila. The morning drive was a disappointment. Never been at a private game reserve where they do big commercial drives during the day when it's very hot and also the animals prefer to hide from the heath.Although they also care for the animals and do good work I would not recommend this place.

Relaxing and enjoyable day trip. Well-organised experience. The company will arrange pick up for you early in the morning, drive you ~2 hours out of Cape Town. Upon arrival, greeted with a glass of cold champagne/grape juice. Buffet breakfast which should more than satisfy. Some spare time to spend walking around the grounds of the resort, go in the pool etc. Then you're taken in the vehicles to the safari and see animals. The guide will generally try to find the big 5 for you, though not always guaranteed. Upon arrival, buffet lunch is provided, though drinks are not included. Drop off back to accommodation makes this a convenient experience.

Day out from Cape Town. about 2 and a half hours from Cape Town by car, Aquila is a well set out Game reserve. Those looking for huge herds of animals may be disappointed. Whilst Aquila is well set out and does have the big five, numbers are few. The work they are doing is, however, fantastic and I'm sure numbers will increase.The staff were excellent. Guides very knowledgeable, courteous and helpful.The option of either horse riding or quad biking through the bush is an added attraction.Food and drink plentiful and the setting is stunning.

One nights enough, but well worth the investment. My husband and I stayed two nights in one of their five premier luxury chalets privately situated and built into the hillside of the reserve. The decor was of rock elements, wood and stone - creating a back-to-nature ambience. The en suite bathrooms include; twin hand basins, a toilet, bathtub, and outdoor shower and a Jacuzzi. We had our own private patio but wished it had shade on the on hot summer days. The linens and towels were nice, as were the cozy robes provided. What was missing was the "privacy". On three occasions, Aquila staff entered our locked cottage. There are no deadbolts or do not disturb signs. When staying two nights, we chose not to attend every game drive available and they shouldn't assume we were out. On the final morning, a staff member announced himself after letting himself in through the locked door while were enjoying a natural jacuzzi. My husband asked him to come back later while we shielded ourselves under the water - only for him to tell us that he had to "check the mini bar first" and he stayed another five to ten minutes! This is totally unacceptable and an invasion of privacy. The safari game drives were wonderful and we highly recommend choosing the guide Kensington Maringwa if possible. He was knowledgeable, fun and very entertaining. We also took advantage of the complimentary horseback safari because we stayed two nights. Our guide Brandon also was great and did a terrific job getting us up close to the various animal species. The food was underwhelming. Served buffet style and often the same dishes. It's obvious that they push people in and out daily. I recommend bringing your own wine and pay the minimal corkage fee. The pools were pretty, but far too cold to swim and the bartenders didn't know how to make many drinks and frequently didn't have change when paying cash. This is a great place to experience seeing the animals but know that it is a huge "zoo" type of experience rather than a real natural safari. They do a great job and it is worth an overnight in one of the nicer accommodations, but one night is enough. It is close to Cape Town and a beautiful it

Best quad bike ride of my life. We visited Aquila not for the big5 so much and more for the awesome thrilling quad bike trails where you pass buck, zebra and giraffe. In terms of an African Safari it's not a good representation of one. It's small and I recommend if people want that authentic safari to either visit Kruger national park or Masai Mara in Kenya

Quick Stop Safari. My wife and I recently visited this game reserve for two nights during the week. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay after having made a booking directly via their website. We were met by very friendly staff and the check-in procedures were without any hassles. We believe that this game reserve serves those who have limited time and are restricted geographically to the Western Cape. We believe that a day trip from Cape Town or an one night overnight at the venue is sufficient to see the "Big Five". In general the game does not originate in the Klein Karoo and therefore the habitat does not supply sufficient feed; the game therefore has to be fed which means that they congregate in the same place. The experience and expectation of the search is therefore lost; our guide (Adriaan), however, really went out of his way to make this a safari experience. Included in every overnight stay we were entitled to a morning and afternoon game drive. The three buffet meals included would not be classified as "fine dining" but the quality and variety was good. We believe that the cottages could do with a make-over, but found the daily cleaning and service to be good. We liked the relaxed atmosphere and spoke to many overseas visitors who thoroughly enjoyed themselves. Thank you to all the courteous and friendly staff who made our visit a good one.

Perfect for us.... We had our 6 year old son with us and thought anything more than a day trip would have been too much, not to mention we only had a short time to see as much as we could of Cape Town and the surrounding area. Aquila was perfect for us. A 3 hour drive outside of Cape Town, after a very surprising breakfast spread, within 2 hours we saw all the big 5, a good lunch was provided, then back to Cape Town by afternoon. Even had time to do more stuff that night. Beautiful property, very well maintained and helpful staff across the board. A bit "controlled" for those looking for a true safari, but we found Aquila to be the right balance for us and a place where they really care for the animals on property and make a great experience for their guests.

Awesome. A definite must to visit this lodge. Amazing hospitality, great South African food, knowledgeable guides, variety of tasteful accommodation. Vast grounds with variety of animals. Beautiful setting. A definite place to visit.

Great experience, but.... After reviewing all the reviews we weren't sure if Aquila would be the right option for our first safari ever. We decided to go for it and had a great time. We saw the big 5 (leopard in a rescue center) and the guide was really friendly and told interesting things. He stopped close to a group of Zebra's and giraffes and we could get out of the jeep, and enjoy a glass of sparkling wine! Great moments. The park wasn't that big so indeed it indeed did feel a big like a large zoo. It's still very cool, but if you demand top quality you might want to look for an alternative option. The resort was nice and we enjoyed the food a lot! Eployees were friendly and helpful where needed. Other guests were a bit older of age (many 50+) than us. Overall experience was great but we will definitely go for another safari which should bring more adrenaline and wilderness.

Like a big zoo. The staff who check you in were incredibly slow, couldn't get the credit card machine to work, painful to watch,The breakfast was plentiful and loads of choice, the safari was not that good, we see two elephants roaming the guide was very knowledgable and very good, it just that there was a shortage of animals, we see a couple of "dwarf" giraffes, then into the lion enclosure, he said there was seven we found one high up under some rocks, you could just see it's ear move if you was lucky enough, where were the rest ? I haven't a clue, then some zebras and two rhinos, ( it's getting a bit like Noah's ark now) they said there was some hippos in a lake but they could have been anything to be honest, stopped for refreshment and lunch and that was it, it'll been cheaper going to a zoo you would've seen more I think,Not worth the money, vast area, shortage of animals

Day safari. I totally agree with review swish53. Nice staff, nice game driver, but it's a sad place to be for some animals. (Lions)Also hardly any natural shade available for animals. It was 38 degrees on Feb 6.Average for safari 2 stars, en 3 stars for the rest.
Good Experience. Did 2 nights here in January the cottage was quaint and the outdoor shower was different. 1 night would be better, the second day is the same as day one it was a good experience.

South Africa's big 5 in a confined space . Whilst my trip to Aquila and the fantastic service was memorable, be under no illusion this is not kruger national and the animals that you see whilst wild are confined to the fenced of areas. So please don't expect the authentic wild experience of an African Safari or you will end up disappointed . A fellow traveller best described it as a big zoo and I kind of got her point. That aside if you have limited time and want to get a taste of Africa then I recommend the tour . We started with a free breakfast which was pretty good !Watered and fed we were driven through the the first set of Yates to the two elephants that they have. 10 mins later we were witnessing 3 very young giraffe , followed by some young zebra, springbok and wildebeest .  Another gate later into the lion enclosure I have never seen lions look this Drowsy almost sedated.The most spectacular moment was the birth of a baby springbok literally inform of me .. Awesome We then arrived at the watering hole, a few rhino, wildebeest and zebras.The buffalo refused to show itself as we drove past its watering hole but I was glad to get out of the scorching sun and looked forward to seeing the cheetahs. Sadly these cats were in an enclosure so it was not what I expected. Some free fizz and then we were off to a free buffet lunch . The ambience food and service of Aquila is great and cannot be faulted, it is very pricy but it is probably expensive to maintain such a vast zoo.

Expectation. It's best to realise this is a game reserve rather than a safari as some thought it was.Some of the animals are not in their natural habitat, such as the elephants, but overall it's the sense of care the staff have for the animals and the help they offer the injured and displaced that really shines through.It can get busy at lunch time, but the quality of food is good.After lunch it would be good to get back on the road for the two hour trip back to Cape Town, especially as you've been in the heat for a few hours, but everyone has to amble around a find some shade to 15.30 when the pick's arrive. Reception only has three seating areas so it's a race for these unless you want to sit under the sun loungers.

Daily tour. It was perfect for daily tour from cape town. We saw three in big five. It was amazing to see elephants and lions ana baby rhino from a few steps ahead. Tour guide was the best!!! However, other employees hated customer, service was not good.

Average but conveneient. We stayed for 2 nights and were disappointed with our overall experience. If you are considering to stay overnight - make sure it's just 1 night (not 2 as we did) as you really see it all in just 1 day. It's very over-priced for what you get. Staff are friendly, but service is not very good. The safari itself is nice... It's convenient as it's close to CT and easy if you have small kids... but I wouldn't say it was a 'WOW' experience. If it's a luxury safari you are after, this is not it - this is mostly for the 'hurried' tourist that want's to see wildlife...

great for being close to Cape Town. After reading some of the negative reviews we were a bit sceptical...but we decided to book as it was only 2 hours from Cape Town. We got picked up from our hotel at 6.30, and it took fully 2 hours to get to the game reserve. Our driver was driving a bit fast, and had no regard for speed bumps, whci didnt make for the comfiest journey. Anyway, when we arrived we were welcomed with a buffet breakfast which i could not fault. Our game drive started an hour after we arrived. Our guide was Freddie and he was absolutely fantastic. He explained all about the animals, and gave us plenty tof time to photograph animals as we were going along. He got as close as possible and was able to answer all of the many questions he was asked. We were out for over 2 hours, we saw 4 of the big 5, then were taken to the ARC which i did not like as much. Animals are in compounds, but theyre rescued animals so they cant let them out. I would cut this out of the game drive completely, it is a bit of an anti climax at the end. We then came back for a buffet lunch, where you had to pay for your own drinks. They dont even have water at lunch time, if you want water you have to pay for it. They should have juice or water free as part of your lunch, then if you want anything different, fair enough, you pay. Then we had a couple of hours to relax at the pool. We then had over 2 hours drive back to our hotel. 5 star for Freddie and the game drive and breakfast, 2 star for lunch and the ARC. But all in all an enjoyable day.

OMG loved it. I was so excited to discover we could go on safari. After a early start and a 2 HR drive we arrived at the park, breakfast was provided and was substantial. We went out on safari for 2.5 hours. Our guide was superb. We were so close to the animals in a safe environment. An elephant walked right past our veichal. I was within 5 feet of a lion.It was a fantastic experience which I did not want to end. After our safari we had a lovely lunch. Well worth the money.
Great guides and rides. Nice resort. Our room/cabin was comfortable and unique. Food was pretty good for a buffet. Animals are awesome and our guides were all excellent! I highly recommend.

Brilliant. Went to Aquila from Cape Town on an organised tour from our hotel. A very early start and breakfast was served on arrival, a very surprising welcome. Tour starts after breakfast with very knowledgeable guide and driver. We saw all the big five game. A very well worth full day out. Got to give it 10/10.

A Great Day Trip from Cape Town. When in Africa you have to see the famous animals and if you are ok business or on a short schedule, this is the pace to go!only about 90 mins out if Cape Town, Aquila is a great private reserve that has a great selection of animals, great food options, a full bar and accommodation in luxury bungalows if you decide to stay a bit longer!I have taken stage here every year for the past 5 years!Staff are great if you communicate what you want for the experience. You can tour the park and see all the African animals either by the traditional safari vehicle or be a little more adventurous and see the park by Quad bike or even on horseback!!! It adds such a different experience when you are only meters away from an African Elephant or Rhino and are sitting on a quad bike or on horseback!!Staff are great, food is excellent and the experience is priceless!! Well worth the visit!

My very first game reserve - and loving it. Years ago (in 2007) it was my very first game reserve I visited, and it was so amazing and beautiful that it started me to travel Africa a lot that past years, from one Game Reserve to the next National Park.But Aquila will always be in my mind for one of the most amazing days I ever enjoyed. The second time in 2009 wasn't less memorable. :-)

Our only chance of a safari this time in South Africa.. We were in Cape Town for New Year and the cricket test match between South Africa and England, due time and logistics, a game reserve close to Cape Town was our only viable option (this should prevent people thinking "why didn't you do a proper safari in Kruger or Botswana") so after reading reviews of all said options, we opted for Aquila. We left it up to our hotel to book for us while we went out for the day, Robben Island and Table Mountain. When we arrived back, the hotel reception informed us we could only do the later pick, which at least meant we didn't have to get up at the crack of dawn. We were picked up in a minibus, and made the 2 1/2 hour drive to the game reserve. On arrival we sorted out all the payment at the reception and then had a really good lunch (included in booking) before setting off on our little safari. Now, this is a private game reserve, so it's fully enclosed, but for previous reviewers (from the UK too) to compare it to a safari park is a bit much, have they ever been to the West Midlands Safari Park?? The area is quite vast, apart from the Lions (i'll come to that) i'm sure there is plenty of room for the animals to roam about freely, and they're safe from any poaching within the reserve, with medical staff at hand. The sad part for me, was the Lion enclosure, this wasn't the largest area and they did look a bit lethargic to be honest. Well, put it this way, we were right up close to them and they didn't bother ripping our heads off!!! I found the staff perfectly fine, our guide was very knowledgable, but maybe could've been a bit more engaging with everyone, maybe some sort of speaker system in the trucks would be beneficial.Also, with it being a reserve, you are pretty much guaranteed to see everything.All in all, it was an enjoyable day.

A joke..and a rip off,. We booked through the Cape Town Tourist office. Having traveled two hours by taxi from Cape Town to the "Game Reserve"?? We had a really nice breakfast, and were then "treated" to a two hour ride around a "quarry" with a few animals in it. After the two hours drive(With a wine stop) we then had lunch...and then a two hour journey back to Cape town. We had paid £120 each for this...a total rip off in our opinion.We asked for a partial refund but could not get one....There are more wild animals in the average UK zoo..and probably more in your back garden now !,,,do not waste your money.

Great safari experience . Aquila is a fantastic place to go to get a safari experience ably a few hours outside of Cape Town! Ray to book, they even came and fetched me from my accommodation in Sea point. Plenty of delicious food before and after the drive. Staff very knowledgable and friendly. Saw all big 5 animals and a few others. Overall a fantastic experience at Aquila

Sad Safari. Being in Cape Town for Christmas we wanted to treat our UK based daughters to a fun safari. After some research and naively believing misleading advertisements I decided on Aquila. We are a South African family who have visited many private game lodges as well as Kruger Park and Pilanesburg and were so shocked by the time our booked 3 hour (actual 2hrs 15min) had ended. I just cannot recommend this destination from the badly organized reception with hot grape juice and cheap champagne as welcome drinks to the end of the so called safari. Saddest animals in closed off camps being fed by staff. The last straw was when the two elephants were chased to meet our vehicle and we were told we were lucky to spot them. The lions oh the poor lionesses !!!!! King of the animals hot and thirsty ..... Crazy tourist threw a plastic water bottle at them. The vehicles driving around a la convoy ... Too much noise and dust. After a decent buffet the staff lounging around at the tables ........ This was not a good experience.

African Experience. Its not far from Cape Town so a lovely day trip. Saw lots of animals. Guide was lovely. The weather was good Lots of photo opportunities. Pool and restaurant area refreshing. A great visit

Great day ou. We drove from Cape Town through fantastic scenery. The lunch was good and we enjoyed a swim before setting off with our driver. He was very informative and knew where the animals would be. A great experience all round.

Misleading advertising - poor quality park. Safari parks in England give a more realistic experience than this theme park style waste of time. Add the fact that the food is awful and you really want to miss this product. Final disappointment was the swimming pool experience. You could not enjoy the opportunity of two hours by the pool because it was crowded and the pool water was filthy.

Staged and dissapointing . We drove 2 hours from Cape Town to reach this game park and wish we had spent our time more wisely.From arrival it was disorganised and like a cattle market . The jeeps took large quantities of visitors on tour lasting less than 2. It was clear from the start that the tour followed a set path were certain animals were placed and food provided for them in those areas. Although we got to see the Lions up close they were clearly enclosed in what appeared to be a relatively small area for animals of this size ! The pool area was dirty and there was no health and safety standards as people had glasses of drinks in and around the pool .I would not recommend this visit, despite seeing 4 of the big 5

Day trip mini-safari. We were clear that this was not going to be a full blown safari experience but rather a "taster". We chose to drive ourselves from Cape Town and a great drive it is too!Having prepared ourselves for the fact this was not a "Kruger " experience we were not disappointed. We were driven round by an experienced and entertaining guide who took us round a representative sample of wildlife. Lot's of good photographs.Both the breakfast and lunch that we had included were of a good quality with a reasonable selection from the buffet service on both occasions. Access to the pools was an added bonus as it was a very hot day.The only negative was the state of the toilets which were not u to the standard of the rest of the facility. Broken flush and no paper - basic faults that should not happen in a facility like this.

A Big Zoo with an ARC. To be honest, this is not a true Game Reserve. Yes it is a private reserve, but the animals are near the man made dam and the lions penned in to a small area. The Leopard is in the ARC, so yes you may see all of the big 5 if you find the Buffalo (which we did not) but it is not the same as Kruger or Hluhluwe were you really drive to find the animals. Great for a day trip from Cape Town as you will see them live.

Incredible over night stay!. From start to finish, the trip was amazing and brilliant value! We had the most fantastic experience. We drove ourselves from Cape Town, which took just shy of 2 hours. It was the easiest journey ever, through fantastic mountainous countryside. We even saw baboons at the road side! When we arrived we were greeted with a welcome drink, then we had a lovely hot buffet lunch, which was high quality and had plenty of variety. Our room was the cheapest option of room available but it was perfect. The aircon was a god send. Very clean and comfortable! Onto the safari - WOW!! Our tour guide was Johan (sorry not sure on the spelling), he was brilliant. On the first 3 hour safari we saw Hippo, Rhino, Elephants, Giraffes, Springbok, Wildebeast, Ostrich and Lions. The Elephants came right up to the vehicle. Half way through we stopped for a nice snack and a glass of fizz, lovely extra tough. The evening meal was really nice. We spent the evening chilling outside, enjoying the sunset with a cocktail before having a refreshing and comfortable sleep. The morning safari was good too, we saw leopards, cheetahs and crocodiles. We then enjoyed a nice breakfast before heading for home feeling amazed at what we had just experieced. I would recommend waiting until you arrive in SA before booking. We got the trip fro half of what we almost booked it for in England. There was a man stood on the waterfront at the V&A who sorted it all out for us and we paid when we got there. The whole trip was less than £200 for two. Very satisfied customers :)

Lovely location some improvements needed . We arrived for a welcoming drink which was a warm glass of sparkling wine - really!!! The lunch was nice but again warm wine was served - is there a shortage of ice in South Africa?? The safari was fab and the accommodation was so cute - little chalets with a mezzanine floor for kids. Also an outside shower which was so cool!! The ac didn't cool the upper floor as it was badly positioned so we had to bring the mattress downstairs. I think if was slightly misleading as we only saw lions, rhinos and elephants. We did see cheetahs but they were in rehabilitation cages. We also saw zebras and giraffes. The service was pretty poor but overall it was a great experience. Tip there are great fridges in rooms so you can byo - no TVs which I thought was great and only local plug sockets so you need a convertor. The safari on the first day was the best the 2nd day nowhere near as good. There was no BBQ in the evening as promised in the brochure. But give it a go it was the best day of our hols!
Day safari. Booked a day safari and saw almost no animals. Definitely not worth the 2 hour one way drive from Cape Town and certainly not worth the money!

The big 5 in captivity. This place is a tourist trap. Mass produced "safari" gets you to see the Big 5 game but in a very contrived way. Lions are in a caged compound as are the leopard and cheetah. The environment is very dry and dusty (at least when we traveled) and this feels more like Disneyland than a true safari. Food was terrible. Better to take a proper safari somewhere else than do this.

NOT to be recommended. A waste of time and we saw very little.. I went for the half day tour. Was told to be there for 12.00 noon with the safari starting at 1.30 and lasting till 4.30. Obviously the 3 hour safari was why we were there. In the event the safari only lasted 2 hours, and part of that included 30 mins in what they call their Animal Rescue & Conservation Centre, which is a few animals in cages.All in all a complete waste of time. During the 1.5 hour safari we did not see any lions, they were asleep avoiding the hot sun, we could not find the giraffes, all we saw was a couple of elephants, a couple of rhinos lounging in a watering hold, a few gizzelle and zebra. Quite frankly you will see more in an hour in the London Zoo.And it is over a 2 hour drive from Cape Town. We had little traffic and the driver was going quite fast. So over 2 hours on the road each way to see very little.And you are not really on safari in the wild. The whole place is a fenced enclosure where they drive you round on man made dirt tracks, with several man made watering holes and the animals are fed. And beware. When you drive inland it becomes extremely hot. No sea breezes.

Safari. We visited in December and were booked in for the morning drive. We arrived early and enjoyed the breakfast. At about 10.30 we departed for the game drive. We saw hippos in the water and drove closeby to two rhinos. We drove very close to a group of zebras and ostriches. The lions were in an enclosed area and we drove into this area to view them at close range. We came almost head to head with two elephants and had to reverse back and change direction to avoid any clashUnfortunately we did not get to see the giraffes.Within cape town travelling distance Aquila is one of the best but if you want an authentic safari experience then you need to consider places up north like Krueger.We returned back for lunch via the animal sanctuary which houses a cheetah and some more lions for 12.30pm. All in all , it felt like we were visiting a large zoo with some selected animals viewing them from our car.
upclose with the wild animals. I had a very scary and nerve racking experience with the buffalos, hippos , lions and wow , it was loads of fun.

Really lovely hotel which I can't fault but the safari isn't the best. The hotel itself is really lovely. Stunning drive out to it and on arrival we were met with a sparking drink. We got a family room which had a bed upstairs for our son and a bed downstairs for us. Room was HUGE and absolutely perfect. Bathroom was quirky and made of stone and again HUGE.Staff were absolutely fantastic and nothing was ever too much. The food served in the restaurant was buffet style... it was ok... it wasn't amazing but then, to be honest, I wasn't expecting it to be.We stayed during Easter and one of the owners made such a lovely fuss of our son and gave him a lovely Easter present which was just SO kind! They laid on a gorgeous easter egg hunt and got all the children little presents! They really went above and beyond with this and I really want to say thank you!Now the safari. This was our very first safari and being in South Africa I was expecting a lot... perhaps this is my fault as I knew full well it wasn't the Kruger. It was absolutely fine and we saw the big 5 and extra BUT it felt like I was in a bog standard safari park. The lions were in a separate enclosure so they didn't eat all the other animals as obviously its a young game reserve which we totally understood why but it kind of detracted from the "genuine safari" experience. The guides were extremely knowledgable and gave a great tour as well as lots of information. I suppose because it was a smaller game reserve it was very appropriate for a 2.5 year old chid to be on it.I also chose to do a horse back safari which was included in the price and this really was special. I would highly recommend doing this.We stayed for 3 nights and I think this was the perfect amount of time... any longer and we probably would have started to get bored as we'd seen all the animals.All in all, an amazing hotel, amazing staff, good food and wine and an all round alright safari. If you are travelling with children and you want a safe family safari then this is perfect for you. If you are a grown up couple/solo traveller and you want to experience a safari then I'd suggest heading to the Kruger to do the real thing.

Very nice trip to Aquila Safari. We went to Cape Town at the beginning of November for our 'late' honeymoon. As it was our first trip to Africa, and we are not planning to do another one for some time a Safari was a must. We took the Full Day Safari and it was quite expensive, but worth it. Considering the price don't expect to compare it to the Kruger Park.After the cab came and took us to our hotel we had a long 2hr trip to the Reserve. After a very nice buffet breakfast we went on to our safari. The guide was very nice and informative, and it was good to see that he was not in a hurry. We saw the Big 5 and the main 'attraction' was the lion's cage. The cage is easily 2km x 2km! And we got to see them at a distance of 5m. Some were excited and some were afraid but we did it.I'm glad we did it for some very nice memories and perfect photos.

Amazing animals. We went to Aquila during our honeymoon it we really enjoyed it. We did an overnight stay and had two Safaris. Everything was well made and We had an excellent Guide. Beside that the only thing which was disappointing was, that every Meal was Served as a buffet.

Good experience. We visited the safari with a 4 year old. It was a good educational experience but an important point is that this is not a fully authentic safari experience. It is more an elaborated and natural zoo.

Not worth it. Will you see incredible animals? YesWill you see them in an incredibly sanitized setting? YesWill you be packed into a safari bus with 26 people? YesYou don't go to Aquila for a real safari, you go to get a taste. Unfortunately, if you spend the night, as we did, you also spend an incredible amount of money (over $300/person) to do it. Although we really enjoyed our two game drives, the cost (including getting out there) and TERRIBLE food just didn't make it worth it. Note to managers: serving your guests bottled water at the dining tables without telling them that they have to pay for it is poor form. If you want the safari experience, save your money for a real safari and skip this.

Save your Money. If you are looking for a safari experience--this is NOT IT!!. We are on a cruise ship and this day trip was offered to us as a safari experience. We rode on a very uncomfortable 4x4 bus which had 2 flat tires in the middle of our safari tour and we had to wait over 30 minutes for someone to come and fix the tires or replace our vehicle---which they did. But that is not what we are unhappy about.As we were bumping along the rocky road, 2 elephants "popped" up. It was as if someone had pressed a button and and now we saw 2 elephants in the distance. Their ears would move now and them as did their trunks--but they didn't move. We came to an area where there were 4 or 5 zebras eating dry food from a trough. These zebras did not move, except for eating. Our bus was right next to them. Zebras are not friendly animals and they certainly would never have stayed right next to a vehicle with people in it taking their pictures and talking loudly. We wonder if the animals were given some type of sedatives in their foods?If this was advertised as a zoo, then I would not have expected a "safari"--but t isn't advertised as a zoo!!
