An excellent day out to see the Big 5. I was trying to decide between a two day safari with a 6 hour drive each way, or the Aquila Private Game Reserve, which was only a two hour drive - I am glad I plumped for Aquila. After a pleasant drive through the mountains, we were greeted upon arrival with a glass of bubbly and ushered through to enjoy breakfast. When the tour began, we were introduced to Freddy, our Ranger who was so informative and you could see that he absolutely loved his job. We were the fist to go out, but not the first back in as Freddy took his time to drive us round, spotting all of the Big 5, explaining the why they were called the big 5 and even picking up Rhino poop! We did not want it to end, especially by the very close-up lions we drive up to! It was a great experience which we will never forget and although it maybe not be a true safari, we saw all the Big 5 plus more in a homely terrain where they are hopefully safe from poachers. I would recommend this one day safari to all that do not want to travel for hours on end in blazing heat......
A very big zoo. It's a large Zoo, quite overpriced. I wouldn't advise to go there, I would prefer to spend more time in the amazing city rather than going there

Aquila Game Reserve. Won this trip from work and thoroughly enjoyed it..we did the safari and was so relaxing.felt good to commune with nature.I can't really remember what I ate so can't comment on the food at the restaurant but just being here and seeing the big 5 was great.I highly recommend it

What is the definition of private game game reserve?. Animals are kept separated in various enclosed, lets called them enclosures. So you move from the one enclosure with lions to the next with buffalo’s etc…The chance to see the so called wild animals is 100%. For someone that has never seen a lion or a giraffe, elephant, zebra etc… it is the ideal place not to be missed. The ideal spot to, shoot pictures without bars, screen, railings and boundary.Animals are fed and with the drought and the size of the so called “private game reserve”, I do not see why not. We human have interfered with Mother Nature the day we have put fences around wild animals and stopped them to move up and down Africa.My question is; although it is better than a zoo, can we call that a game reserve or would it be better to call it animal sanctuary?

Good to see the big 5, but not a safari. It's good to come here if you wish to see the big 5. There are no herds of animals really, although a lot of springboks and zebra, otherwise the animals are in 2's or 3's. There is a new modern building block which in my opinion doesn't go with a safari. I cannot imagine who designed it as it is very badly designed. The front rooms are ok with lovely views, but the back rooms are terrible with no window that you can look out of! The brochure only shows nice little African style accommodation with thatched roofs, these rooms are lovely. The restaurant caters for huge numbers of visitors and considering the numbers the food is of very high quality, which we couldn't fault. The staff were all lovely and very helpful and proffesional.

Hugely overpriced, poor customer Service...visit only as a last resort!. My girlfriend and I decided to visit Aquila on the last day of our two week trip to Cape Town and the surrounding area. It was supposed to be a nice finale to an incredible trip but unfortunately we were left feeling incredibly underwhelmed!The main plus point of this trip was a fun drive around the reserve led by enthusiastic and knowledgable guide Mike. We saw various different animals, got close enough for some great photos and saw the incredible scenery that accompanies that part of the world. The drive to Aquila is also jaw-dropping!However, a few words of advice:1. Don't less them mess you around! After booking a horseback and game drive combo safari (with Aquila taking payment Details for this) we got an email telling us that actually they were full and we could only do the ride. A phone call followed and after some pressure Aquila found a solution to deliver us what we'd booked! I'd expect them to do this as a matter of course, not only once pressure is applied!2. DO NOT BOOK THE HORSEBACK SAFARI! Despite the sales pitch that it would be 1.5 to 2 hours we actually spent less than 1 hour in the reserve on the horses in which time an encounter with some Zebras was as good as it got. 15-20 minutes of the ride was wasted by the guide taking photos of everyone individually with their cameras - a nice thought but it cut our short experience even shorter! My horse was an aggressive sort who kept biting the horses in front despite my best efforts to restrain him.This eventually resulted in one of the horses kicking out repeatedly with its hind legs, frightening the life out of its rider and only missing my head by inches. No instruction was provided to novice riders and the helmets were cycle helmets rather than proper riding helmets. Compared to a horseback wine tour we did in Franschoek earlier in the week (for a third of the price) this was amateurish!3. Lunch may be included in your package but drinks are not! After returning from our short horse ride we had plenty of time to kill until lunch finally came about. It was boiling hot so we were desperate for a drink with our lunch. However we were promptly told that no drinks were included in our lunch. After a request for a simple jug of tap water the waitress came back saying no, we had to buy drinks. When I asked to speak to the manager she returned to tell me the manager had said we have to buy drinks and he was not interested in speaking to me! If I did that in my job I wouldn't be a manager for much longer!4. Don't expect a proper Game Reserve! This is an animal park at best. Most animals roam fairly freely but the poor lions sit in a very small enclosure and look miserable (and hugely overfed). There is no leopard in the game reserve but in order to be a able to claim they have the "Big 5" they keep one locked in a "rescue centre" which they take you to at the end for some photos.Final verdict: if you want to go on safari then try to do it in one of the proper game reserves. If you don't want to stray too far from Cape Town then do something different as there's so many fantastic options. If you want to see animals in enclosures then go to a Zoo. And if you feel that despite all this you simply have to go to Aquila then go with very low expectations or be prepared to be underwhelmed! If you want to do a tour on horseback then I strongly recommend the Wine Tour from Paradise Stables in Franschoek which was a hugely fun afternoon for us and it much cheaper and closer to Cape Town!This place is hugely overpriced for what it delivers and once they've taken your money you are more of an inconvenience to them than a customer they wish to delight!

AN AMAZING OVERNIGHT STAY. This is one not to miss. We stayed overnight. Had an evening safari and saw lots of animals. Then did the early morning one. Saw a mother hippo with her baby. Our guide was very knowledgeable and could answer any questions. Rooms were a bit dark. But the showers were stone built outside attached to the room and worked well - had the birds taking a shower with you. Food was just ok but a bit canteen like. The views from the terrace were magnificent. Bumpy ride because of the terrain but well worth it. We forgot to empty the safe but the park were very good and had our belongings sent on to the office in Cape Town to save us driving back.

Good, but not great.. The surroundings and the facilities are top notch. The food is okay. The guide, Daniel, was knowledgeable about the animals and their behaviour (he gets the place its 4th star.) The journey around the reserve was just long enough and Daniel was honest about how many animals the reserve had and that it was quite new and still growing. The only sour note came when we were told that the lions had several hundred hectares in which to roam but it was painfully obvious that they were surrounded by 7' high electric fences, with no means of exit or entrance, in an area of precisely one hectare.So a good day spoiled by one piece of disinformation.

Highly recommended, stunning scenery reserve!. I loved it! I would give this reserve 10 stars if I could! The reserve is about 2 hours drive from cape town and I stayed there for 2 days and really loved it! Got to see the big 5 animals 3 times a day as they offer early morning , mid-day and evening drives in the safari. Truly memorable and recommend it to anyone!

Very disappointing ... Spare your time and money. As many of the reviews already mentioned , its a large Zoo, so it charges too much for it offers, we were unlucky with the weather so we got to see like only 4 types of animals (outside cages) in a 2 hour boring drive. The only interesting thing is the drive to reach there.

Amazing backdrop, OK "Safari". Firstly the location of this Safari is just incredible. Even the drive from Cape Town to Aquila was mind blowing. Eating breakfast against the mountains was really lovely. Driving around the park was also just stunning as the scenery is some of the best I have ever seen. The "safari" wasn't so much a safari as it was a drive round to see the animals. Similar to that of a safari park in the UK just much larger and in a better location. Yes you see all the big 5 but it's very obviously constructed. I was prepared since reading the reviews so wasn't expecting a true safari experience, so in all I was pretty happy and we had a really great day. Would recommend if you are very tight for time while in Cape Town which I was. Also I wouldn't recommend going for more than one game drive as you see everything in the first drive.

Good Experience. We went for the afternoon trip. Aquila it is off course diferent from major game areas where you can see animals in their true and wild habitat, As a private reserve it does the job of presenting (amost) all of the published animals, in good conditions and with very good guides. In other game areas like Masai Mara for example we only managed to spot all the animals we saw in 2 hours in three days.The area is not huge but for the amount of animals they have it seems suitable, while trying to maintain the feel of the wild and acting as conservation agents. You can see the animals real close, specially the lions.Good option if you are staying in cape town area.

a bit too touristy for me.... It is nicely run, made for quick turn over of guests. I cant imagine staying there - as there is a constant come and go... the game drives conducted in TRUCKS (vs. the commonly used jeep) - hauling up to 30 people at once! Crying toddler, loudly chatting groups... not my coup of tea - but eh... if this is your only chance to do a game drive - enjoy.

Excellent . Very interesting trip around Aquila with informative guide. Great to see some of the animals brought back to the western cape. Highlight included seeing a baby white rhino. Lovely drive there and back an easy day trip from Cape Town

A great time-conscious option near Cape Town. Since we have not had the experience of the longer, more in-depth safaris available in other parts of the country we have nothing to compare. That said, if you are in Cape Town and do not have time in your planning to drive almost 20 hours to Johannesburg or fly 3 hours and drive more, Aquila offers a wonderful option to give tourists a taste of the more extensive experience. We were picked up timely in Cape Town and enjoyed the 2+ hour drive through wine country to the reserve. We were greeted with wine upon arrival at what first appeared to be a non-descript lodge. We soon realized that the lodge was not oriented to the parking lot but to the reserve. It opened out as we entered through the reception building to beautiful views of the reserve and low traditional buildings along with a lovely lodge and very pretty pool area with fire pits and a very large bar and entertainment building. All are constructed from hand-hewn logs, white stucco and thatch. Very appealing. We had booked 2 of the private villas - one for our son and daughter and one for us. We were all quite taken by the villas. Each was unique, built from rocks and natural woods right into the side of the hill. They each had balconies, great beds, fireplaces, a small kitchenette and were light filled and air conditioned. The kids' lodge had a private out door shower that my son loved. Ours also had a jacuzzi surrounded by rocks and sky. Just great. We gathered back at the reception area for our afternoon game drive. Our guide was Daniel -Great guy! He has been at the resort for 8 years. Very knowledgeable and funny. Went to great lengths to make sure we saw absolutely everything possible. Our drive lasted somewhere between 2.5 and 3 hours. We took a break in the middle to have a lovely picnic of champagne in flutes and snacks served by Daniel overlooking the valley. Quite the memory. Gave us time to mingle with the other folks on the trek. Nice touch, I thought, and great photo ops too. Got back to the lodge for supper which was really nice. I quite disagree with a previous reviewer who referred to the food as a poor buffet in an area with a canteen feel. The lodge has at least two-story ceilings, heavy log beams, huge chandeliers and walls of windows overlooking the reserve and the sunset. The service was polite and prompts. The food was ample and tasty. The salad bar was approx 12ft long and included a large variety of fresh starters. The main dishes included BBQ chicken, roast, fried prawns, peel and eat prawns along with a variety of sides. There were soups and at least 4 desserts. There was a bottle of wine in each lodge and wine at dinner. Absolutely something for everyone. We enjoyed our lodges that night and my son enjoyed time spent watching rugby in the bar area. For the morning game drive, which convenes quite early at 6:30, they have ready hot coffee, tea and rusk. The morning drive is shorter and there is a visit to the rescue center the reserve runs. There are not huge numbers of animals in the reserve but the number is appropriate for the size of the reserve and the time allotted for the game drives. The work the rescue center does in promoting the welfare of these animals is also compelling. We came back to the lodge for another ample buffet, this time for brunch. Again, a large variety of options hot and well prepared including a smiling lady fixing your eggs however you like. After your bellies are full, you are driven back to your hotel in Cape Town through the lovely vineyards and gorgeous mountain vistas. While the meals were not 4 star quality and there are not thousands of animals, the offerings at Aquilla are, nevertheless, quite a bargain. For all I just described at the present exchange rate in USD for a family of 4 adults we paid right at $950. You would be hard pressed to gather that much entertainment, information, food, lodging, transportation and memory material for that amount of money.I can't imagine what else we could have done for the overnight we spent at Aquilla to give us a better Arican memory in the time we had to spend.

Okay to "see" the Big 5 animals, but not the real safari "experience". We did the one night stay option which came with 2 "game drives" which we booked with a GroupOn voucher (50% off). Overall for what we paid it was good, but at full price it would be poor value. Accommodation was nice, and the buffet for lunch, dinner and breakfast okay. Drinks are extra , but the prices are very reasonable. The whole "Big 5" thing is a bit like a glorified zoo though, and nothing like a proper safari experience you get in Kruger or the like of. Yes you do get close up to the animals and you do get to "tick" that box (seen the Big 5) and come away with great photos, but it does feel a little staged. When we went into the "park" area, we never had to drive far to see the animals - they all hang around the feeding areas. Yes, even though they claim to have "reintroduced" these animals to their natural environment , they still need to supplement their diet so that the animals can survive ....Like I said, at the price we paid I felt it was okay. One thing that this did make me realise was that next time I come to SA I definitely want to do a real safari.If you are short on time , or cant get to Kruger or one of the other safari areas then this is a "box ticker"

Day Safari. Although promised advice of when we would be collected in the morning, this did not happen. The journey either way was a little tiring as the seats in the 23 seater minibus felt quite hard after about 2 hours (there was a break on the journey to the Reserve). At no time did I feel unsafe with the driving; the traffic on return to Cape Town was frustratingly slow.The welcome with sparkling wine or fruit juice was good. The breakfast was very good with a very wide & plentiful selection; coffee & tea were provided. Lunch was quite good but any drinks (incl coffee & tea had to be purchased). The toilet facilities could do with considerable improvement - those staying would have had their own facilities in their chalet.The game drive was well conducted and nearly all the animals advertised were seen

A good option from Cape Town. I think any review for this place needs to be considered in context. It is clearly not located in Kruger National Park and is only two hours from Cape Town. It therefore attracts many tourists both for day visits and overnight stays.If you want to see the big 5 (unlikely to see a Leopard) in their semi-natural environment (this is a fenced in relatively small game reserve) and are tight on time and budget then this is a good option. It is a well-run commercial venture in a pleasant setting outside of Cape Town. We stayed overnight in a lodge which has nice views over the park and good facilities considering the remote location. The bath and outside shower overlooking the reserve are unique features.The game drives are well run with reasonably knowledgeable guides. I was however slightly disappointed to learn that the reserve only has two elephants, seven lions (kept in a separate sectioned off part of the reserve) and two giraffes. The park does have rhinos but understandably the guides are not permitted to divulge the number. There are many other animals including zebra, hippos, buffalo and springboks.I would advise not staying the night and just coming for the day because the food is very average (a poor buffet) in a dining area with a canteen feel. In addition, the morning game drive is short and half the time is spent viewing rescued animals in a zoo (with more space) like area.If you are staying in the Western Cape area I would recommend a visit. However, I would not travel from far solely to visit the reserve.

Party animals. If you are looking for an authentic experience of the African bush and its game, with some peace and quiet and where you are made to feel like a valued customer, I would suggest you avoid Aquila. Our 1 night experience was completely destroyed by a large corporate group who were allowed to have their massive party at the expense of all the private guests. The music was so loud that we could not sleep and there were drunk people shouting and screaming in the early hours of the morning. My complaint to the front desk in the evening was ignored by the manager who clearly was unwilling or unable to control the situation. But the most shocking part was his attitude when we checked out. He offered no apology, despite the fact that there were a number of us complaining very vocally and strongly about it (including Dutch and American visitors) and told us casually that...the music normally stops at 11pm!What became clear to me is that Aquila is driven by maximising profit in a highly commercialised operation where the guest is no more than a number. The personal touch is completely lacking and staff are trained to efficiently clear away plates and smile, but could not offer me a cold beer and there was no beer on tap. A steady flow of international tourists are lured into paying relatively high prices for the chance of seeing the "Big 5". "Big 5" is not exactly true now, is it? Perhaps "Big 3" is more realistic. You definitely won't see a Leopard in the wild in that area on a game drive (unless it's in a cage, like the poor specimen that they have rescued which has no claws and will never hunt again) and we didn't see the few Buffalo that they have somewhere in the relatively small reserve, either on our evening or morning game drives (about 5 hours in total). It amazed me that with so many vehicles constantly driving around a limited area and being in touch via radio, they couldn't 'find' the buffalo...So yes, you may see a couple of Rhino and a couple of elephant and you would have to be blind not to see the grossly obese lions in the relatively small, fenced off enclosure who are fed and don't hunt naturally. I believe that the elephants are also fed as they would not be able to get enough to eat by foraging for themselves in that area.Overall, the accommodation was pretty basic for what one is paying (we were in a chalet near the entrance to the reserve); only 1 side of the 2 single beds had a bedside table and lamp and our toilet seemed to leak when we drained the bath. To top things off, we also had the smell of sewerage in the vicinity of our accommodation. And there are loads of mosquitos, so be prepared.I would recommend visiting one of the many good South African National Parks, including the Kruger National Park. At least they don’t allow music and their parks are very efficiently run and a lot better value for money. I would rather be somewhere more authentic where at least I have the chance of seeing a wild, free-roaming lion and sitting quietly under the stars at night listening to them roar.

Big 5 within 2 hours of Cape Town. Not the Kruger park but if you're in Cape Town and do not wish to spend few days flying to Kruger than this is the best other option. Take at least an overnight package for both evening and morning safari.

Amazing Safari. First Safari I have ever been on, but the grounds of the park are incredible, and we got to see all the main animals. Our guide was also very knowledgeable. You got to see a lot of the animals very close up too. A buffet lunch was also included which was delicious.

Aquila Private Game Reserve - Overnight Stay. This was my very first time at a Game Reserve - Have had this on my bucket list for many years, and now finally did it. It was worth the long wait. What an amazing place. Everything is well looked after, from the animals (including the Big 5), the accommodation even the staff seem happy - they were wonderful and attentive at all times. The new hotel where we stayed was superb, spotless and extremely comfortable with the most amazing view from the patio. The game drive was exceptional we saw everything and by that I mean all the Big 5 and more. Our guide was Vino and he was assisted by Shannon - both were well informed and gave us very interesting factual information about the animals. The meals were excellent, some of the best potjies I have ever had. Well done to the management and especially the staff for a wonderful overnight stay at your resort ! ! !

Awesome blast. Aquila Game Reserve is really beautiful when you have been picked up as the trip going there from Cape Town coukd be very tiring. Especially after you have had breakfast and lunch and two game drives. I would highly recommend you sleep over or have someone drive you back. It was really an enjoyable experience and i would highly recommend this place to all my friends, family and guests :) the part that broke me was hearing the story how they CAN lions :( however i am glad they are rescued and are safe. Thank Aquila for your great service, friendly staff and the good job you do. Keep it up.

Fake promises about Big 5!. Okay, I have to admit that two weeks before I went to Aquila I had visited Kruger National Park. As I already had read on Tripadvisor, Aquila is just a zoo. They have two buffalo's, ten zebra's, seven hippo's, two elephants, three minuscule giraffes... The lions are separated from the rest. There are no leopards in Aquila, only in there "rescue camp". This camp is similar to a zoo: animals are kept in separate cages... All animals are fed in Aquila, also that are in the "wildpark"!!Overall Aquila was in terms of spotting animals a very disappointing experience and I would recommend most people to skip this park! Go to Kruger where you can drive your own car and spot real wildlife instead of animals that get fed!

Disappointment. Arrived to check in, staff didn't seem interested at all at receiving guests - basically felt like another number. Room wasn't ready when we arrived so we had our lunch first before going to drop off bags for the sunset game drive. Arrived at room where we had 2 single beds, specifically asked for a double bed so had to call for them to change it. The staff member who assisted us with our bags to the room didn't show us how to make the fire (would have been nice as it was winter and freezing). The game drive was an absolute disappointment.. This is NOT a game reserve, it is more like an animal sanctuary/big zoo without the cages; they supplement all the animals food (I understand the land does not permit for them to feed off naturally but this should then be clearly mentioned on the website so tourists know before hand)! The lions are kept in a gated area and are always near the entry/exit gates as they are familiar with humans as they are feed by Aquila every week and don't hunt. Saw the elephants for 5 minutes before they retreated to their huts for feeding where they remained (didn't see them in the morning drive the next day either as they were still feeding).Big 5... As it is advertised is a joke.. The leopard hasn't been seen by one of the rangers who has worked there for years!! We all heard of the load shedding in South Africa so it was expected when the lights went out and the lodge wasn't to blame however no one offered us a torch to get back to our room so we had to walk in the dark; candles were provided in the room but no candle holders??!!The food was average; some nice dishes and some not so nice but this is just to personal taste I guess. Would not recommend Aquila to anyone (our UK and Dubai friends were quite pleased we tried it before they booked) and didn't waste their time or money.

Horseback safari an added bonus. This is a great intro safari experience. It is accesible from Capetown via their transport or your own. Be aware of wild baboon crossings if you drive yourself. You will be escorted through the preserve in an all-terrain vehicle with a knowledgeable guide. Options include horseback riding for a more intimate view of the wildlife. This was a spectacular experience because we got really close to many species and also rode through some terrific topography. You will go around lakes and see elephants playing, track giraffes and ride up right next to rhinos and many other species on the preserve. The guide allows time for picture taking. Dress appropriately for the weather with peel away layers and sun and mosquito protection. The lodge is very rustic with a modern flair. The food in the on-site restaurant was varied and offered a reasonably tasty exposure to local cuisine. I highly recomend Aqulia for a day trip or a 2 dy package with an overnight stay.

Overnight is a MUST !. My second visit this time with an international group.Booked on line and everything went according to plan.Rooms are good, restaurant, "Don't at for a week before you come", the buffet selection for breakfast lunch and dinner superb local dishes.But the game drives are what we went for and both evening and early morning were superlative. Saw animals up close, lions, elephant, hippo and buffalo so close you could hear them breathing.Must eturn again.

game drive without animals. First impressions were rather of surprise and shock. We All expected to arrive at a forest type location, not just a wide open plain, with very few animals. Yes you can get up close to the 4 lions, 2 giraffe, 6 zebra, 4 Rhino, 4 hip if lucky, and a few Ostrich, antelope, springbok, but really it felt like a tourist trap area. Rooms basic, with hardly any water, and cold, spiders, and small bed, but yes we understand it is a game reserve not a hotel. Staff were great and the food perfect , but can do in one day if needed.

One night and a wedding. I booked the lodge accommodating 8 people. 2 double rooms with on suite and 4 single beds upstairs. We had a verandah with a view, allowing smoking. The lodge itself was comfortable and warm, the water was hot and the shower good pressure. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had sparkling wine on arrival, there was some confusion with our luggage on arrival however all ended well.We had booked a wedding ceremony with a private drive, and were pleasantly surprised with the effort that the staff put into providing a spectacular venue on a hill, providing seating, table laden with sparkling wine, grape juice, water and snacks. All positioned on a beautiful Persian like carpet. Our view included two rhino during the ceremony, which we had passed on our way up the hill.The buffet style meals were somewhat disappointing, the chicken was not cooked but there was plenty of choice and no one went hungry.I think the management would do well to consider offering al a carte menu. The recreation area was spacious bearing in mind that we visited out of season. There Is a pool and what I think is a fire pit outside a large bar, which had comfortable seating and a large fire place.The safari drive was bumpy but satisfying as we got up close to all the big guys. The giraffe are shorter than any others I have seen, as explained by driver Sam, they have adapted to living in an area without trees.The rescue centre and hydroponic area was very interesting and I wish the management every success. As there is building work being done which will increase the occupancy by 45% - I think they are on their way.

Fantastic experience, A must when visiting South Africa!!!. Wow is all i can say. The set up and professionalism is outstanding. The accommodation is very well done and very cozy and when we woke up in the morning as we looked out our bungalow we saw a buffalo standing right there, how cool is that! The game drive is well set up and the guides extremely knowledgable. On the late afternoon drive you stop half way through as the sun starting to set and have drinkies and snacks..The buffet meals are truly yummy!!Highly recommend Aquila to locals and overseas visitors.

Great in a pinch!. if you don't have time, money or good foward planning skills (like me) this is awesome. I planned a 5 day trip to South Africa at the last minute - not a lot of time for things like well thought out safari trips - but this tour did the trick. This place is sort of a glorified zoo (albeit enormous. I think they said 10,000 acres), and kind of has a Jurassic Park feel to it. However, I got to live out all my safari dreams in a single day. It's a bit of a cheat, but totally worth the relatively inexpensive price.

Great safari, but could do without the rest. I wish I could just rate the actual "safari" part of this day trip. Because that part was phenomenal. The park was very big (bigger than I expected based on some of the other reviews here), and we saw plenty of animals including elephants, lions, hippos, buffalo, rhinos and zebras. The comments about it being zoo like are exaggerated for sure. The park is great and our guide, Kensington, was terrific! It's too bad that's not all this experience includes. I'd have been happy just driving in to see that then leaving. The breakfast and the lunch were not very good, and the little pool break you have after is just a waste of time. Our entire group was just itching to go since the little rest area feels incredibly touristy. I'd have much rather spent that time in Cape Town instead.That said though, if you're looking for a good day trip safari to see some cool animals while you're in Cape Town for a shorter visit, this could be the perfect way for you to do that. Just don't expect much from the food and bring a good book while you lounge around after. The safari part of the day was well worth it!

Great Fun African Safari.Just do it !. It's classic Cape Karoo with the big 5 in a huge reserve.i liked it for a little adventure with an African twist. Huge open spaces & the safari tour in open air bus was great, the tour guide was friendly & did a good job.Animals were in good condition.When the sun goes down it gets chilly take a jacket or a sweater as the safari tour is 3 hours plus.Dinner & breakfast was delicious large Buffett in African restaurant area which has a Pool which looks over the reserve.they keep adding on more rooms Great experience & closeto Cape Town / one nighter is a must. Cheers!

Go for the Overnight Option. Visited in early October and picked the overnight Safari. Arrived on day one at 12pm. Welcome drink on arrival and lunch available before check in at 2pm. Saw a Elephant walk past our accommodation before we went on our first tour. First tour was at 4pm and we were lead by our guide Roland. Roland knew his job and had a real passion for it. We were lucky that we managed to get one of the smaller trucks and there were only 6 of us which added to the experience. Staying overnight was a very cool experience with the added bonus over the 'outside' shower in the morning. Second tour is at 7am with a different route around the Reserve. We got to see all of the big 5 plus a host of other animals. Bit worrying when the Lion started walking to the truck but really added to the excitement!! If you are in Cape Town I would recommend you check this place out.

Free the giraffes. Safari was fine. Great to see the animals free like this. However giraffes should not be kept there since they do not have proper vegetation for them. They aren't supposed to bend their necks to eat. They die after a while due to they large hearts. They die often at this resort.
great experience. we had a brilliant day ....wonderful location and amazing setup.we had a beautiful lunch and then went on safarisaw lots of animals

Worth getting up at 5.30 am for. We had limited time so chose to do a mini safari at Aquila. The trip included breakfast and lunch and a 3 hour drive around the private game reserve. We got up close to the animals and overall had a great time although it's not quite the 'wild' experience.

Touristy Safari but Enjoyable Day Outing. My friends and I drove to the Game Park but coach/bus trips from Cape Town are available. There are a number of types of safari on offer, and we selected the simple day trip safari. On arrival we had a welcome drink followed by breakfast from a well-stocked buffet to suit all tastes. We then went in a landrover around the reserve for about a three hour safari. The game park is probably more touristy than a true safari in that the animals are fairly immune to the presence of people - which of course has the advantage of allowing you to get up quite close to some of them – and you certainly won’t see any kills in the wild. But we did see lots of different types of animals, including elephants, buffalo, rhinos, hippos, giraffes, zebras, crocodiles, ostrich and different types of deer, although not in great numbers, while the cheetahs, lions and leopard were in confined areas rather than in the wild. The driver/guide was friendly and informative and there were several stops for photo opportunities. On return to the lodge, we were served lunch, again a well stocked and varied buffet. We then spent an hour or so relaxing by the pool with a glass or two of South African wine before returning home.

Group team building stay. We had an overnight stay as a large group and from the time of arrival to departure, we experienced wonderful service from each and every staff member.The rooms are comfortably decorated and fitted, with added comforts like heaters in the rooms and bathroom.The bathroom feels a bit exposed as the window doors are not covered. There is an outside shower for those who really want to get into the wild feel and a lovely indoor bath for the less adventurous.Our meals were buffet and can be described as hearty comfort food. The selection was quite large and consisted of everything from starters to desserts and cheeses.The waiting staff are attentive and polite.We also went on an early evening game drive (it was also available for the following morning, which we skipped). The driver / guide, Randall, was well informed about the animals that he showed us and welcomed questions from guests. The drive was not rushed and he made ample time for us to take pictures.All in all, this was a very enjoyable stay.
Very peaceful... Staff very friendly and helpful. Food excellent with plenty of variety. Bus tours around park very good with large variety of animals but not large quantity of them.

Nice experience. Breakfast and lunch were served. The food was delicious. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. We saw several animals roaming freely and some were contained but in vastly open spaces. Others in much smaller spaces. The giraffes were beautiful

For me a truly WOW experience. We chose this reserve in part because it was recommended by our hosts. Glad we went indeed. Our guide, Randall, was most informative and we really did see lions, hippos, rhinos, giraffs, springboks, water buffalo, zebras and elephants. Although we thought we'd be out there for a couple of hours it was nearly 3 and every minute was great. We stayed overnight and the lodge was spacious and comfortable, with the exception of the outdoor shower! It would be good on a hot day, though. The food was - well - amazing - buffets for all 3 meals. Loved it!

Halfway between a zoo and a safari (yet somewhat closer to the zoo). As other contributors indicated: it's somewhat halfway between a zoo and a safari. The herbivores (elephants, buffalos, rhinos,...) are sharing a few thousands hectares of land, yet it's clear most of them have their preferred spot (where they most probably receive some extra feeding) hence are not too difficult to find... Lions and other carnivores are kept separately. Yet we enjoyed the tour: the guide was very knowledgeable and friendly with lots of humor. Make sure, though, to be sitting near the front of the vehicle, since at the back of the larger vehicles it's almost impossible to hear what the guide is saying.You can order transfer from/to your hotel in Cape Town for a one day tour; pick-up time is quite early (ca. 5.45-6.45AM). Upon arrival (after ca. 2 hours drive) they serve you breakfast before you leave for the tour. The tour takes ca. 3 hours; afterwards you receive a buffet lunch. Food is OK. However, buses back only left at 3.00-3.30PM, which left us with too much wasted time (there is an outdoor swimming pool, yet is was raining...). Most people were ready to return by 2PM, yet even though they had two buses returning to Cape Town, none of both left before 3PM.Anyhow, when spending some time in Cape Town and you are compiling a diversified programme (particularly with children), Aquila game reserve is certainly a nice attraction to put on your list.

Day Safari..Average. Day Safari with family was the idea. Its over 2 hours drive from Cape Town. On arrival we had a welcome drink followed by lunch which was average. As it was month of August, it was quite cold. We then got into a pick-up which was modified with seats. The driver who was also our guide seem to be knowledgeable about the private reserve but then he does those tours multiple times a day. He did not have any kind of safety precautions like a gun, etc..We did have a chance to see Rhino, Giraffe, Elephants, Zebra, Lion, etc.. The lions are kept in a separate area. We spotted lioness and lion behind a net, more like a big cage which was a disappointment. On the flip side, they take care of animals which are sick or rescued on the other side of the reserve. You pay approx 350-400$US for the drive and back. Also 100$ for the safari per person when they are running a special offer. I think it is commercialised too. It can be fun for kids. I would recommend people to do a proper safari but if you are short of time and with kids then you can do this Aquila safari. I wont do this again. I wouldn't rate it as outstanding experience.

Family safari. Oh what an amazing experience! We went as a family & thoroughly enjoyed it.Our tour guide was a tiny ball of fun... with his funny anecdotes! He made our tour amazing. Just an overall great experience.

The perfect day trip from Cape Town. This was such a delight! I took a day trip from the Westin Cape Town and was amazed by what a gorgeous drive our driver took us on via the N1, right through wine country, the Huguenot Tunnel and the breathtaking Du Toit's Kloof Pass, with waterfalls and granite mountians. Once there, champagne and food was lovely. Please request our guide Kensington. He made the whole safari wonderful and warm and was so knowledgeable. He is a wonderful guide with such enthusiasm and care for the animals at Aquila. It looked like a fun place to stay, but was very pleased with the single safari. We saw elephants, rhinos, zebras, springbok, hippos, eland, giraffes, and lions. The rehabilitation center was nice though we were concerned about a different tour group of teenagers who were hollering at the animals and one who tried to throw a rock at a caged lion. (One of our tour group told them to stop and reported them.) The staff and facilities were wonderful and compassionate with the animals and the whole property seemed very socially conscious. Even were it not for the amazing animals, the drive around the property was just breathtakingly beautiful. Lunch was good and we were back to Cape town by 17:00, equally enjoying the drive back. (Our driver was with M.K. Exotic.) I highly recommend Aquila to anyone visiting Cape Town to enjoy the natural beauty and amazing animals!

A Very pleasant stay. I went with my two sons ,and family for an overnight stay,on a winter special,which comprised all meals,two game drives and accommodation for a very reasonable rate.The accommodation was very comfortable,and even the winter morning did not detract from the interesting outdoor shower.The food provided was in the form of a buffet and was very good if not exceptional.The service was polite efficient and attentive.The reserve being quite small,guaranteed that we would see all the animals,and the rescue centre was of great interest.Our guide made the trip interesting,despite being quite new in that role.All in all a great way to spend a couple of days,and no doubt in the heat of summer the large pool would be very welcome.

Excellent game reserve.. We a family of 3 - my wife, my 3 yr old daughter and myself had gone for a safari at the Aquila game reserve. Aquila allows even babies to accompany at game drives which is such a relief.We were picked at 6:30 am sharp as mentioned to us and reached the game reserve at 8:30. Waiting for us was sumptuous breakfast and let me tell you it was the best breakfast I had while I was in cape town. We were then taken for the game drive. Our game drive guide was highly knowledgeable about the animals and the wildlife. We were able to see most of the animals and it was truly a very good experience not only for me and my wife but also the little one. After the game drive we were left to feast in on lunch which was again a good one. there is also option of horse riding after lunch though we weren't part of it I reckon people who had gone for it enjoyed it thoroughly. If you are in Cape town I would highly recommend Aquila.

Great way to take in a safari without a lot of time. This was a wonderful day trip. We went in April 2014. It's a great way to get the full scope of a safari without extended days. There is lunch served which is a great buffet and then a full ride to see the animals. We booked via viator.com.

glad I made the time. my time is SA was short but I happened to find myself with a day free after a mix-up. I enjoyed the experience and seeing the animals so close up I fell completely in love with the leopard and the peacock.

Worth visit of Aquila Private Game Reserve. I had amazing hours of drive through Aquila was fantastic . The critiques about lions in small enclosures were exaggerated. I saw four of five of the big five and .I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, who is looking to explore South African

Commercialisation at it's worst. We booked a horse riding safari here and we're terribly disappointed. Having been promised the big 5, no one mentioned the lions, cheetah's and leopards were enclosed in small cages.On the ride we saw 5 zebra, 2 elephants and 3 giraffe all of whom looked as if they'd been strategically placed in order to call the horse ride a "Safari"Whilst my horse was reasonable my partner had a horse that spent much of the 2 hours trying to buck him and run away. My parter is an excellent rider but meant that he spent most of his time trying to control a horse that should not be used for riding with the general public. The riding tack and saddles were old and not well cared for. Food at the lodge was as good as could be expected from mass catering. Breakfast was cold and unappetizing. The lodge was also freezing cold. This place caters for up to 700 people per day in Summer, it was dreadful in winter with approx 150 guests.It was terribly expensive and appeared to be about profit taking not animal welfare!

Exceeded Expectations. We arrived at Aquila after a 45 minute drive through the mountains, me and my friend from America. The winter weather was perfect and so was the rest of the day. After being checked in by very professional staff, our champagne was poured and we relaxed on lounge chairs until our lunch was ready. The traditional South African buffet was excellent. Afterwards we left for the "journey through the wild," which our guide explained is what safari means. Our two hour drive through Aquila was amazing. The critiques on here about the lions in small enclosures were exaggerated. We saw four of five of the big five and even drove behind elephants on the return trip. We would definitely recommend this trip to anyone, whether South Africans for a day trip or those from another country for a weekend stay. An experience to remember.

A magical experience, highly reocmmend.. We have done 'real' safaris in various countries and we highly recommend this place. Although a private reserve, it is fab - do not let this put you off! We saw the big 5 and loads of others. Not loads the same animals, its more a select few of each, but you expect this. Seeing hippos, lions and rhinos up close was an unforgettable experience. All animals look well and healthy. You are not guaranteed to see animals, like on any safari - we were so lucky we came face to face with the lions, as other groups did not see them at all. The guides are fab - we had hot water bottles and blankets in the morning trip, sherry and snacks at a stop off point in the eve which was so lovely. The cabins are lovely too! We stayed here for one night which included the 2 safaris, dinner and breaky - was superb value! Ignore the negative people on here, it is what it is, but I would highly recommend this place to anyone. Don't forget...all safaris are in enclosures of some sort, this one is just the same, but a bit smaller. (No animal on these excursions are truly 'wild' but are all amazing and worth seeing whilst they are still here!)

Amazing Safari Experience!. If you can only go for a Safari in CapeTown, this is a great choice. Otherwise, Kruger is the place to go. As for Aquila, the game drives were great (we went for an Overnight stay and was offered two game drives- which was definitely needed. One game drive was 3 hours long, and the morning one is 1 hour long only). They should change the 1 hour long game drive to longer. Food was amazing, staff were excellent. The rooms were great as well. Only issue was the outdoor shower (it was a freezing night and going outside to shower wasn't ideal). But we still enjoyed it!!

Excellent service in a magical, natural environment. Being at the Aquila Private Game Reserve has been my most memorable and intimate experience with nature. The staff were so friendly and took pride in their work, and it was evident that the animals were loved and protected. The rooms were clean, beautifully renovated and it was clear that the staff took time to pay attention to detail. The facilities were very enjoyable. I'll definately return!

Beautiful property, wish the animals lived together. Let me start by saying that the Aquila property is amazing. It was unique, beautiful, and makes for really great photos! The rooms are fantastic as well. The photos on the website don't do them justice. We had a great patio and an outdoor shower (as well as a huge bathtub inside). Our favorite activity that we did there was horseback riding, where we had the best guide! I think his name was Shedrick. My only disappointment is that the carnivores are kept in a separate area. The lions have their own fenced in area away from the other animals, which you could still drive through, and the leopard was on the other side of the road in its own exhibit. And we totally get it- they can't risk the lions eating the other animals as I'm sure they're quite expensive. It wasn't as natural as we had thought. We were expecting a mini version of Kruger Park. Although they had all of the Big 5 animals, we feel that we can't exactly count it as such as it felt more like a drive through zoo. That being said, it was a great getaway and a really easy drive from Cape Town.
Aquila. Although it was very nice the neatness of the place need some attention specially the outside part at the pool area & gardens and the roads to the chalets.

Guest Review. Overall a wonderful experience, great game drives, friendly staff and very informative people too.The rooms were nicely done, like you would find at any decent hotel etc, fully stocked with all the needs you could want.However, I would recommend a few touches just to take it to another level. 1. Have small foot carpets on either side of the bed, the concrete gets very cold, even in summer, no one likes to come out of a hot bath or shower and get dressed on a cold floor next to the bed.2. Even though using an old style wood fired stove is a novel idea for a fireplace in the rooms, it is not practical and would recommend a proper fireplace in the room. 3. The food was great and the roasts were absolutely lovely, however I would possibly look at having a secondary side dish with the roasts, as both lunch and dinner had roasts (it gets a bit much after a few days), so in essence if lots of guests like the roasts then keep them but also look at having another dish, like a pasta dish or a stew/curry etc so there is a little more "mains" variety.4. The use of WiFi repeaters would be a much better option than having multiple WiFi hotspots as the signal was also very poor in certain areas, this I believe is quite an important point here as there is very little Cellular (Mobile) phone coverage as you are quite deep in the wilderness.

Disappointed & Disheartened. Thank you for remembering to send us an email to request "Would you mind reviewing your stay with us? Our guests often tell us how helpful it is to read past guests' comments before booking their own visits. And we're always eager to hear what you liked"Where to start... I'll bullet our experience below:1. Your website is not working pending a ICAN verification? So Im unable to comment on the "promises which it leads you into believing you will experience"2. On our arrival, our room which we paid +-R12k/night for was not ready. This following a call from my wife confirming that we could check-in at 12pm - our room was ready at 3:453. Our 4yr old daughter requested to bath, their was no bath plug4. When we switched the bed side lamps on, the fan was wired with the bed lamps so in the freezing cold of winter we had to either read in the dark or accept that a fan would blow the freezing air. When inspected closer, there were 3 different appliances wired to the same 15amp plug (fan, heater, and 2 bedside lamps), I believe this is illegal and an insurance claim on your thatch roofed building would be declined4. The first night it rained in through the roof and flooded the room5. The hot shower tap only worked if you opened and closed it several times. A little banging on the wall also helped to get the water flow going. Took us about 10min to work out. Would be useful if instructions were provided6. The peacock jumped onto my 4yr olds head (I have no problem with that, it is a wild animal and we understand that) but when I requested a plaster and dettol to clean her wound your first aid kit was not stocked and the staff could not find a plaster or Dettol7. In general the room was tired, blinds looked like something my great grand mother would have made herself, it was missing hooks & rods & hanging skew and did not function properly8. The rooms were not 100% clean and the shower glass in all rooms was horribly stained9. The chimney cowl was seized in a direction opposite to the wind direction, as a result our room was filled with smoke10. The game drives were fantastic, Daniel was great and took the time to explain everything to all the guests. We truly enjoyed hearing his knowledge of the area and that of the animals. 10 out of 10 to Daniel For 12k/night excl drinks, etc I would rather spend my money in Mauritius. PLEASE IMPROVE THE IMAGE OF CT AS A DESTINATION, WE NEED REPETITIVE TOURISM. IM ASHAMED.

Feedback. While we had a good time at Aquila, we had a few concerns. The first was that the dinner on the evening was the left overs from the lunch that day. The access around the main area on the paths was not great due to them being wet. They could be looked after better. The roads inside the reserve are also not that great and while you do have vehicles equipped for them, a bit of attention to the roads would make the experience much better. Our guide on the game drives was excellent and informative.

Good First time safari. Aquila is close to Cape Town, so this makes it appealing. The food is buffet style and pretty good (drinks are not included) but there is plenty to chose from. Our cabin was basic but comfortable and the out door shower was fun. Spend extra and stay in the cottages, they looked great.The Safari itself was wonderful! We had a great driver, we saw the big five and he was very informative. It was a treat to stop and have drinks and snacks and watch the animals.The early morning ride was great as well.Dress warm in winter!! Seeing these fabulous animals is mystical.

Deflated experience. The dining facilities were ok, we were disappointed with our experience based on the simple things which could've been avoided by management of Aquilla!The weather was bad so we expected a indoors experience, however the ESA no entertainment available for our children and we were told that wifi would be available, rooms had no entertainment, TV or wifi.We were not informed of the construction happening at Aquilla so the path ways and roads Muddy, Slippery and no precaution was taken to prepare you for that! All in all the game drive experience was terrible and weather conditions were unbearably cold for those on the drive, with little preparation to improve the drive experience having at least a second ranger with the driver to be part of the experience. It felt like a minibus taxi experience, stop and go! The drinks and snacks prepared for the drive was a bottle of old brown sherry ( classy stuff) and nuts and droe word bits slapped on a tray as a snack! Little things could've been done to improve the overall experience. Please understand that I'm not saying that we didn't have a good time, however Aquilla could've without entering into additional cost made the experience more special by taking care of the little gestures of good preparation and execution.

Convenient to Cape Town, accessible safari. I took the day trip safari while I was staying in Cape Town and found it to be a delightful use of my morning. Our safari guide was accessible, friendly, and understandable. I got great photographs of the animals and we saw almost everything clearly except the lions -- who were already retreating to cooler places for nap time. The mid-safari wine stop was a great treat! The breakfast in the restaurant and lunch time was tasty and a great way to connect with folks in my safari group with conversation. It's definitely on my list of things to do again should I find myself back in that part of the world, particularly with an overnight stay at the park!

Lovely location, friendly staff, good game viewing.. I booked one nights accomodation for a special occasion, ( my wifes ??? birthday ). Altho the booking was made 2 months in advance and paid in full, we were disappointed with our accomadation. The chalet in my opinion was not 4 star standard as advertised, ie the heating pad fell off the wall as i brushed against it ! Candles are supplied in case of power cuts ( which occourred ) but no matches to light them ! The resturant was good, and the staff running it were top notch and very friendly, but the buffet meals were lukewarm. The game drives were good. Perhaps i should mention it was a july visit ( winter in the cape ) and there was snow on the mountaines, and frost on the ground. Aquila would

Exciting Winter Break for the family. We wanted to view the Big 5 without traveling too far. Aquila was conveniently close. The service was excellent - friendly, helpful and most professional. The accommodation was clean and comfortable (and nice and warm with the panel heaters and little fireplace). The food was fantastic, with friendly down to earth staff assisting all round.

Overnight stay at the Aquila Private Game Reserve. We had an fantastic stay and memorable experience. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was amazing and clean. Food was delicious and well prepared. The Safari itself was awesome, educational and almost surreal. We saw the entire Big5. I would highly recommend Aquila to anyone who has never been there before. It is so close to Cape Town and so well priced! Thank you so much Aquila!!!
Very good for children. If you have young children and wish to expose them to a safari experience as a 1st time experience I would recommend Aquila.
A great experience!. Accommodation and service was wonderful. The tours were great and the guides very professional and informative. A 10 out of 10 stay!

Highly recommended. The room was well appointed and cosy. The food was sublime! We saw many animals on the game drives and the guide was very knowledgeable. The ambience and setting are great. All this within easy driving distance from Cape Town.

Friendly staff but disappointing overall. Renovations under way, so not peaceful. Too many people put on the game drive trucks, not comfortable. Friendly helpful staff, but everything not in great working order. Wildlife in good condition.

Most disappointing holiday destination . I made a booking for 2 days (15&16 July 2015). When we arrived at the reserve we did not receive any form of welcome. No one informed us of where to go and what to expect as the day unfolded. We had to go up to reception every time we needed information only to find out that the reception staff was clueless. You would get information from one person and when you arrive for your activity the next person will inform you of something different. The accommodation was not up to standard we were their during winter and the fireplace in the one room was out of order (we were not informed we had to ask arround). No towels in the room. No phone to call reception one has to use your cellphone to call reception or the manager on duty. Rooms are very standard I expected the rooms to be luxury like they advised it ( and for the rate per person).We immidately decided that we are not staying for two night and we checked out the next morning. The manager did not even bother to come and ask us why we have decided to shorten our stay.The staff needs training and management should be visible.We will never go back!!!

Zoo without cages...but less animals. For anyone who wishes to experience real game viewing I DO NOT recommend Aquila. If all you want are photos and to say "I saw the big 5", but don't care much for the experience, then it is perfect for you. Breakfast: Good selectionsLunch: Same buffet was served 2 days in a rowDinner: Same buffet was served 2 days in a row (nothing exotic or really interesting. 1st night the ranger made a fire in our room and completely smoked us out. Had to sleep with the windows open in the middle of winter. Next day had to request twice for them to look into it, but to no avail. "Safari" was terribly uncomfortable as cargo trucks are used as safari vehicles. Also they recently had floods and nave not bothered to repair the roads.

Weekend stay at Aquila disappoints. Our weekend away Aquila Private Game Reserve which was memorable for the wrong reasons. There was an open storm water / sewage cover immediately in front of the accomodation we stayed in - not ideal when you have young children. When booking no mention was made of the construction of additional units adjoining the restaurant which meant we were greeted with the sound of drilling, grinding, hammering and yelling from 8:00am to 7:00pm every day we were there. Drain clearing equipment was left lying around in the area imeediately in front of our chalet. Again - not ideal when you have young children with you. Finally the fence that is meant to enclose the childs play area is in serious disrepair - I could fit through that gap so certainly less than child friendly.
Sanelda beets. Our game drive was disappointed as our game ranger was not very knowledgeable. The food was good and room very well prepared and clean.

More Knowsley Safari Park than Daktari. Picked up from hotel for a 2 hour drive to the game reserve. Lovely driver and we saw the Springboks at the service station! The breakfast is really good and the facilities super. We went 'on Safari' in a kind of WW2 army vehicle, very bumpy! It was actually really lovely to see the animals in a more 'natural' environment; it felt very real. The disappointment was the lions, behind fencing and miserable - you would get nearer to them in a UK safari park. Lunch was good and the ride home fine. Very entertaining to see the wild baboons at the side of the roads and the 'Danger! Baboons!' signs.

Fantastic Family Experience. As a family of 4 we had a most enjoyable stay and experience and would recommend any family wanting to view the Big 5 to visit Aquila Private Game Reserve. The food was delicious and plentiful, the scenery breathtaking. The fact that we were able to get up close to the Big 5 on the Game Drives and Quad Bikes was an amazing experience and one that will be treasured for many years to come.
A very nice Safari. We spent the night and it was very nice. Beautiful room, very good food, nice safari, we saw the big 5.A very nice place for a romantic date.

Brillant overnight safari. We visited in July and stayed for the overnight safari. We stayed in one of the superior chalets and it was awesome with amazing views in the morning of the elephants and what a cool bathroom. Our safari guide Daniel was extremely knowledgeable and very friendly and he gave us a experience never to forget.
AQUILA. fantastic staff, accommodation very good, game drives superb, far too much food!!!! should introduce a guided walk as well.
Definitely going back. This is the perfect place to go to if you want to switch off from the rest of the world. Absolutely amazing. Friendly people and excellent service.

our 1 year anniversary. We booked a Groupon package deal which included meals, accom and activities.We were welcomed with champagne and it was welcoming seeing that they were expecting us.The food was amazing - buffet style and really gives you an authentic taste of South Africa. The dining area has a massive fireplace that gives you that cozy feeling during meals.Our room was very standard and our fireplace was broken, however once we addressed it with Dan the manager...he made sure that our stay was really memorable.The safaris with nothing less than amazing as we got really close and personal with most animals - the quad bike safari is a must!! The ranger and guides were very informative - just ask for Tim or Vino!Thanks Aquila for a awesome holiday!Jason & Erin
Great one day trip. This day safari was great, seeing the animals on there natural habitat was lovely. The buffet was very good . Next time, I would like to do the same but on a dirt bike .

Aquila Game Reserve review. We had a most enjoyable one night visit to Aquila and found both the food and accommodation very good. Our game ranger, Freddie made our safaris very interesting with his knowledge of the terrain and wildlife and we would highly recommend it to tourists wishing to get a taste of the big 5. Hopefully once the construction work at the lodge is completed it will truly embrace its 5 star status.

Very good value for what you see, where you stay and what you eat:). Friendly and patient guide and staff. Well-kept reserve where the Big 5 are sighted. Helpful and accommodating driver. Wonderful buffet spread - fresh and generous. Beautiful and luxurious lodge.
Daytrip vs Overnight. We enjoyed the restaurant and game drives, but the accommodation was disappointing. I would recommend a daytrip rather than an overnight stay.

Excellent break-away from the city live. Arriving was very pleasant with friendly staff. The room was in clean condition, with room service everyday.The camera was used overboard due to the nice scenery. The wild-life is calm and close up so that's a bonus. Definitely a must.

Good weekend breakaway. What a nice surprise, normally when booking these all in weekends you are not sure of what to expect. After a nice drive through the Hexriver Valley we were welcomed with a nice glass of sparkling wine and taken through for a lunch buffet. Food was good, and the staff very friendly. Which was sure to be a very cold weekend, was made up for by nice panel heaters, air conditioner and a little fireplace in the room. Thank you, we really enjoyed the food, the games drives and the horseback riding.

Aquila Experience. whilst the game drive was good especially with the knowledge of the ranger of truck 5, all the animal including the lions were just to tame and over fed.
The room was tidy but full of sand even the bed and we were billed for an item not consumed or signed for in the restaurant

Beautiful but very organized. Accomodation is perfect and we, my sister and I, had the cheapest one. With great view over the park were we allready saw elephants and a rhino. Only thing we missed were chairs and a table on our terrace. Food is delicious and so many choice on the buffets. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. Safaris are nice, guides know a lot, but a bit to organized because the guides know were to go bevause of the extra feeding. But we saw a lot and that is what people want and the horsebacksafari was an amazing experience. Two things I less liked; that the lions are seperate, having a lot of space but thry are lying in the cage. I wish there were other animals around them too. The cheetahproject that you want to start to walk with cheeta's for the tourists. Please don't They are not dogs and not meant to walk with. What is happening with them when they get to old and cheeky (so to dangerous) to walk with?

Enjoyable Adventure. I had a wonderful time at Aquila. The room was very nice. It did get a little cold the next morning, but hey it was winter when I visited. The food was good, and the safari was so much fun. If you don't have time to go up to Kruger this is the next best place to go.

Wildlife great! rooms and service not quite at the same level.. I visited your establishment as a belated anniversary present for myself and partner. Coming from a 5 star hospitality background i wasn't expecting fine dining nor was i expecting luxury high end accomodation. I was dissapointed with the cleanliness of my cottage (cottage 8, dead insects on the bed and on the floor, a VERY dirty toilet and fireplace that still had the previous guests burnt wood in it). Service at reception was non existent, staff didnt have sense of urgency at all and i was ignored for a few minutes when we arrived (i had to call a receptionist because they were standing chatting in the back office area) and every time i asked for something i was told to get it myself. (told to go to the restaurant to get a multi plug, i was asked to pay R100 for the multi plug, when i said add it to my room i was told that wasnt possible and only cash would be accepted (makes me think the staff are wanting to pocket the R100), told to go to the bar to get more blitz for my fireplace and so on). Shadrack took us to our room, he pointed out himself that there was no complimentary water in the room. This was never replaced nor were there any amenties in the bathroom. There was only 1 bathrobe in the room and the fridge wasnt even on. Just a few niggles that really got to me during the stay. I am not one to complain as i work in the industry and know how it can be but after receiving this feedback email i felt that i should say something. As the duty manager at of a 5 star wine estate I will find it difficult recommending Aquila to our guests who enquire about safari's. I will gladly point out more issues should you want that, after all we are here to blow the guest away and if my constructive feedback will be received in a good light i am more than willing to help assist. Your animals make the experience, pity your staff are not able to do the same.

Like a big-area zoo. I may hav ahd wrong expectations, but it felt as the animals at Aquila were not in their natural habitat. Still, it was a beautiful tour, lovely surroundings, excellent breakfast and lunch. But the "safari" park was a bit too zoo-like. Enjoyable, but not extraordinary.

Excellent. I had a wonderful time. The place, treatment by staff members, decorations, my birthday cake and wild-life at Aquila- all exceeded my expectations. I am grateful that I celebrated my birthday at your place. Thank you very much.

Lions, elephants and rhinos — oh my!. On my recent trip to Cape Town, I was lucky enough to squeeze in an overnight safari at Aquila Private Game Reserve. Shortly after arriving at the reserve, I spotted elephants roaming near the waterhole not far from the lodges. Then, within moments of setting off for my first game drive, I crossed paths with two of Aquila’s white rhinos. I also spotted springbok, zebra, giraffe, buffalo, wildebeest, ostrich and hippos. The dawn game drive the next morning was no less memorable — our open truck was chased by one of the lionesses in the lion enclosure!

Great experience!. The overall experience was great! From reservation to departure, all went very smoothly. Definitely recommend this place for anyone who has 2 days to spare when visiting Cape Town. Almost guaranteed to see the big 5...

Amazing day trip from Cape Town. I was in a group of 10. We were picked up on time at our hotel. After a 2-ish hour ride through beautiful mountains, we had an amazing buffet breakfast. Then we went for a 3 hour drive around the reserve. We saw so many animals. Elephants, giraffes, lions, zebras, spring boks, water buffalo, rhinos, ostrich and more. When we were done, we had a tour of the rescue center and then a great buffet lunch. The driver got us back to our hotel after that. A great trip - well worth the cost. I would absolutely go there again - next time I would stay in one of the villas over night.

Nice reserve. My husband and I booked in with the mid-winter special for two nights. Our unit was nice, but unfortunately positioned right under the towering eucalyptus trees, affording us absolutely no sunlight at all. As I am solar powered, I found this to be rather depressing, and resulted in us having to leave the heaters on full during the day. The unit itself was nice, and we loved the outdoor shower (even in the cold!). What I did find a little bit odd though was that there was no electrical outlet on the counter, meaning that when you wanted to boil the jug for a cuppa you had to put the jug on the floor and unplug either the heater or the fridge. The lighting in the unit was really good, so even though it was dark, there was still sufficient lighting that you could read. The bed and pillows were all super-comfie. We partook of the four game drives through the spectacular scenery. We had two different guides and while they were fine, I actually would have liked to have heard more about each animal and their habits. Both guides seemed to assume that the tourists they had with them had prior experience with the animals, and in many cases this wasn't the case. It would have also have been great to have heard a little bit about the geology of this spectacular area, and also about the fynbos etc etc. All our meals were included in our price and they were good. It was buffet style, with a nice selection. Breakfast was by far and away the best with a variety of hot and cold items. The only thing I can add is that it would have been nice if the dishes at lunch and dinner were labelled as a lot of the time I had no idea what I was putting on my plate.

What a great getaway. My wife and I were really treated like royalty by your manager Anton. He upgraded our room and gave us a bottle of champagne since we went on our honeymoon. Our room could have been cleaner but that is the only negative thing I can say

Aquila stay was excellent. Very nice, friendly staff,good food,game trips great
We will most definitely return before yearend,bringing Adul kids with us

Kim Steven. I really loved this park for its proximity and closeness to Cape Town. We were able to introduce our 4 year old son to wild animals in their own habitat and that was really exciting for him. It was a pity that our accommodation booking was messed up. We were put in a "family cottage" but there were 4 adults and 1 child. While I was happy to share our bed with our son (and I had stipulated this) i was disappointed that we didnt have separate rooms. However the MD was gracious and made a plan for my inlaw parents to stay in his private cottage.

WEEKEND GETAWAY. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Accommodation and meals were good. Delighted at the folding of towels to resemble an elephant. We felt that the game drives could have been more informative and that they were "tame". Perhaps because of having visited many SAN parks? Other visitors were also friendly. The floors and bottom of legs of chairs and tables need a deep cleaning. String mops do not do the job. A weekend away for something different reasonably near home recommended.This email was received at "5" IN THE MORNING. Need to do from 7 onwards.

The little night in the big Karoo. Aquila Private Game Reserve was a fantastic one night away.Aquila is tucked away in the Karoo surrounded by breath taking mountain ranges and unique vegetation. The Big 5 opportunity just two hours from Cape Town makes it all the better.The drive from Cape Town is not a boring one at all, amazing mountains, Farmlands and well conditioned roads.3 of us only spent one night at at Aquila. We arrived at 12:00pm and had a fantastic welcoming from the staff. we received a welcome drink of either sparkling wine or hot chocolate upon arrival. The sparkling wine was not to my taste but the two aldies loved the hot chocolate on a rainy cold day.We went through for lunch. All meals we had there were buffet style, Breakfast,Lunch and Supper. Normally with buffet, you never know what you might get, but Aquila did a wonderful job with a wide variety of options even for vegetarians. The food over all was very good as well as the restaurants service.They offer two game drives a day, morning and afternoon drives. We were met by our guide Marko, who was very well prepared with blankets to keep us warm. Marko overall was a very knowledgeable guide, he was very well informed on both the fauna and flora. Also very funny and looked after all his guests with both safety of the guests and respect for the animals.The Fauna side of things is what they state. They definitely have the big 5 but don't go there expecting to see huge herds of elephants etc. The park has the right amount of game that it needs too at the moment. You still get fantastic opportunity to view the big 5 in a safe environment. Plus a variety of different antelopes, hippos, giraffes etc. you get the opportunity to view the rehabilitating center which is very interesting and amazing to see what they are currently doing.The accommodation was very comfortable and warm (being winter).We stayed in the family luxury accommodation, had one big double bed and two single beds up stairs. Real African interior design which suits the surroundings. Beautiful stone work design bathroom to add. Only one small problem we did experience problems with the WIFI. We could not connect throughout our stay there. We were told that it was working but none of us could connect. In an environment with stunning views this was not much of a concern with us.For us, one night was great as we got to go on the two drives both evening and morning and saw the big5. There is however lots of other onsite activities to do there like quad biking horse riding etc. I am sure in summer it wouldn't be to hard to sit in one of the beautiful pools with a cold beer. For that reason I am sure we will be back in summer for a couple of nights!
Week well spent. Stayed for 4 nights. We enjoyed every minute of our visit - even the flood during our stay. We will keep on recommending Aquila.

the entire two days were great.. food excellent,good accommodation,excellent game drives with good knowledgeable driver,Only weakness the lighting in the cabins at night was very poor for reading.Please improve for our next visit!!

Great Activities, good food, disappointing accommodation.... I booked through groupon, so paid a fairly good price. The activities were great, with friendly facilitators. The food was nice, like good sunday lunch type of food. The staff was in average, professional.The manager was very present and polite. The standard accommodations are nothing like in the pictures and are rather disappointing, really NOT 4 stars! more like 2 stars... If I had paid the full price, I would have been quite disappointed, half price it was okay.. Aquila could improve on some details: like dirty windows in dining room(or rather you could see where the cleaner couldn't reach) and hose in middle of passages (quite hazardous) which for me doesn't really go with a 4 star facility... Anyways.. I would still recommend Aquila with the groupon offer... full price for a standard room is definitely too pricy and disappointing!

Lovely Stay. Had a lovely one night stay at Aquilla Game Reserve!!!Rooms are beautiful, Food was great and overall friendliness of staff was good. Will visit again.Only recommendation is for a telephone in the room to contact the reception desk. Overall a great memorable trip. :-)
