Good for the money. It felt more like the San Diego zoo, we saw the water buffalo being fed and the rescue center was a total zoo. Food was excellent and service was great as well. We appreciate the accommodations, but won't be back to visit.
Weekend break. Was an excellent stay with knowledgeable game rangers. Food was great and plentiful. I have nothing bad to say

Best ever Overnight stay safari experience. We left Cape Town early and took the very nice scenic drive to Aquila, we were 4 people, all very (super) excited and ready for our overnight stay. Upon arrival we were greeted by staff, friendly and big smiles. We had our arrival and program presentation explained by front desk staff - excellent staff. Received a orientation walk through the Lodge and met Pieter the Peacock who is famous at Aquila. Lunch was absolutely out of the books with a spread to pick and choose from and excellently prepared and presented. Lunch staff, friendly and helpful. We were checked into our Premier Room and wow, what a nice style full, elegant, rustic African feeling. Super clean, comfortable and everything one needs. Game drive was great, information great, driver/ranger extremely knowledgeable, funny and made sure everyone has a good time. Dinner - once again, it's 5 star service!!! Like to thank all at Aquila for a wonderfull experience and a stay over is a definite MUST. If there is anything that will stuck by us, it will be the staff and the 5 star service that was given at a 4 star establishment. Well done!!

AQUILA IN THE KAROO DURING WINTER. Aquila advertised a Father's day lunch and game drive special at a very good price. We arrived at 12h30 and after welcome drinks we sat down to enjoy the Buffet lunch. The food was nice and plentiful and they kept checking and replenishing. I prefer desserts to food and even there I had choices. After lunch we went on a game drive which my family thoroughly enjoyed. My son who usually prefers to selfdrive remarked this was nice and relaxing to have someone else drive you whilst you look our for animals. There were water puddles everywhere, evidence of the recent rains and vegetation looked lush (remember they are in the Karoo). I was enthralled because this time around I got to see the Hippos (last time I was on the other side of the vehicle). We saw Giraffes, Eland, black and blue Wildebeest, Springbokkies, Zebra, Rhinos, Ostrich and Elephant. The Lions are in their own enclosure because they would wipe out the population, however I feel to keep them in their "natural hunt instinct mode" a Springbokkie (shame) should be let loose in their enclosure periodically. Aquila has a number of different vehicles - although one looks like a truck it still has the openness to enjoy your viewing. You can also go horseback or quadbike riding. Our guide Anwar was very knowledgeable and we thank him. My son said when we go again we must ask for him. My grandson who is two calls everything on four legs a dog, even he was surprised by the many different "dogs". At the end of the drive when you said Hippo or Giraffe - he responded Hippodog, Raffdog

Great first safari experience. Only a two hour drive from Cape Town lies the private game reserve of Aquila. Make sure you watch out for the big sign by the road otherwise you might miss the turn! The reserve is amazing! It is huge and a great place for the wild animals to roam. There is also a small sanctuary for hurt and old animals nearby, which can be visited. You can find a couple of lions, cheetah and leopard there. But if you're lucky you can see more lions in the reserve on your safari drive, which I highly recommend! I can promise you will will easily see the Big 5 and halfway through you can even have a glass of champagne to freshen up.And even if being all excited did not consume your energy, you will want to stuff yourself with the lunch buffet! And did I mention the breakfast buffet​? I think it was one of the best ones I've had! Great food, enough variety and plenty of it, too! If a morning safari drive is not enough, you can also do a horseback or quad bike tour through the game reserve for another great experience.One last thing, I didn't sleep at the reserve but the rooms looked just splendid. No matter if you go all luxury with your own little hut overlooking the reserve and a classy stone bathroom or in one of the big family houses, it is all uber stylish and looks very comfortable.

Overnight stay. We were very disappointed with the overnight safari. The times had changed for the safaris due to the winter months and this was not taken into account when we booked. Our room was upgraded but it was not taken into account the we required single beds, then they needed to change us again. The room we ended up with was nice but internet was not very good, and we had no power in the morning and still not repaired when we got back from the morning safari. The Safaris are more like going to a zoo they do supplement feeding so the animals would all come up for feeding. The lions are in a separate enclosure. This would be good for kids as they are able to see the animals up close without really having to find them. Information was not given out about the animals. The food was ok but at times not sure what you were eating. Overall we were glad to be leaving missing the lunch to have an early departure

Not worth the money. We have been to Aquila 3 times now in the past 11 years and feel that this place has gradually lost its charm. it has become very commercial and the visitors are now even transported in converted truck instead of romantic safari vehicles. to make matters worse there is a lot of building activity going on to add more units to the already large lodge. the animal population is too dense for the area and the animals have to be fed daily. it is more like a zoo then a wild life experience. it is worth a visit if you have small kids who have never seen African animals but i would not recommend it for anyone else. food is average but staff was very friendly and efficient..

SERVICE VERY BAD. Hi, I enjoyed the game drive very much...the tour guide was very professional and entertaining. When we returned from the game drive, we were so cold and really wanted something to drink at the bar. When I asked the bar lady for a bottle of wine, she looked at me funny and said she will have to look if there is still in stock. I waited for almost 45 minutes for a bottle of wine..when we asked for coins for the cigarette machine, I was not being accommodated either. The bar lady really made me feel that she was doing me a huge favour in serving me. Only after I had to beg the lady at reception for an arrangement, I was given coins for the cigarette machine...we obviously had it charged to the room (and that was the initial agreement)...the service at the reception desk upon arrival was also very poor. We never received any welcome drinks and when I paid, the lady said my cheque card didn't let the transaction go through at first, but in fact it did. Im a successful attorney and I know exactly how much is in my account. This already made me feel unwelcome....and dissatisfied. I must say (except for the game drive) Im not impressed with the service at Aquilla at all, and don't think that I will come again. There was another gentleman who also complained about the bad service in your lounge-you really need to get more bar staff inthere! Thanx

Fantastic place. This was our first visit to Aquila with a 2 year old. Fantastic place for Families with young kids. They have an awesome kids area with absolutely everything you can think of, even a Microwave. Just wasn't impressed at how this kids area was maintained. We booked the Family Luxury Chalet on Full Board for a long weekend. We had mixed feelings about the Room. It's designed as a Loft room, but the kids beds are upstairs with these very steep stairs that can give you a glimpse into the future of accidents about to happen. Room has no TV, so we didn't know what to do with ourselves at night, unless you happy to go sleep at 8pm with your kids. If you're not the bathing type like us, There's only an Outdoor Shower which was quite a problem in Winter as the temperature is on average 0 degrees at night/morning. However, we did brave the cold and I have to say it was quite refreshing. Same like the kids area, they can do more with maintaining the rooms. Floors are absolutely filthy.The Restaurant was cozy and food was good. They could have had a bigger variety of food & desserts, but not much to complain about. The selection was boring. Same food every day. There was no curries, just one portion of seafood, limited desserts and no ice cream for my kid. The bar area was cozy and the only place with TVs. Conveniently linked to the kids area, so you can grab yourself a drink while you watch your kid go crazy.Probably the highlight of our visit was the Game Drive. Lots of fun watching your kid getting excited to see the Big Five and all the questions that follow. You won't just get to see the Big Five, there's also Hippos, Giraffes, Springbok, Wildebeest and Zebras running around, to name a few. Other entertainment we noticed includes Horse rides and Quad biking. Overall, we had a fantastic first time at Aquila and would love to return in the summer when we sure will enjoy the Outdoor shower in the heat.

Out of this world. One of the most enjoyable experiences in our travels!Everything about Aquila is stunning - the accommodation is excellent - even in winter the rooms are warm and cosy. The staff friendly and attentive. Management brilliant and the curio shop worth a visit - for locals as well. Game viewing fantastic and guides were knowledgeable and very happy.Thank you to everybody at Aquila for making our outing awesome
Something for your bucketlist.... Wonderful stay. Appreciate all the effort for warm temperature in room.Really enjoy the game drives with Randall. Like the outside shower :)

Wonderful weekend spend at Aquila.. This was an amazing relaxing weekend. The highlight for us was the game drives. The restaurant and its lovely food was great, and the chalet was very cosy.
Thank you.

Accomodation and Food not great, Staff Friendly. Once we were able to open our door (it was jammed a bit) we ended up staying on the reserve as the GM’s guests due to the room we were assigned smelling terribly of smoke.It was a bit disappointing that we came to relax before the arrival of our 2nd child but it was anything but relaxing. The food is unfortunately not 4 star at all. Lunch and dinner seemed the same.One plus is that the staff were always very friendly and they made the weekend not a complete waste.I am pretty disappointed in Aquila overall. I don’t think it was close to the 4 stars it has. Anton did refund us half what we paid which is appreciated. He also mentioned I should email him so he can arrange a future visit when our child is born. I did email Anton however haven’t received a reply.

Fantastic Rangers. All in all the service we received was of an excellent calibre. The staff were attentive and willing to help. Breakfast and lunch was delicious but I found that dinner fell a bit short. Daniel, our ranger was the highlight of the trip. He was fantastic. What an incredible experience. Will definitely be back.

Amazing visit to Aquila. On arrival we were greeted by the friendly staff, and that excellent service continued throughout the two days that we were there.The manager Anton was very present and gave us a lot of attention. Shadrack who took us on a horse safari was so caring. Jackson escorted us on a quad bike safari and helped so much as we had not done this before. We had a brilliant and informative game drive with Randal, and he handled the flooded roads with care and saftely for all. The food was wonderful, and the accommodation was cosy and clean. All in all a big recommendation to anyone who wants one of the best weekends away. Wendy Scher

Trip was average for the amount of money spent.. The music in the dining room was irritating, cause there was no variety of music.Stayed in the standard accommodation and the room smelled like smoke when we arrived and I can see why. The coal stove just smoked the whole room out when we lit a fire. It was not up to the standard of a four star accommodation.The game drive was enjoyable for the first time. Second game drive was boring as we knew what to expect. There was no buffulo either.

Two awesome nights at Aquila Game Reserve. Food was excellent. Game drive was also very good and we saw all the animals up close without disturbing them in any way.. I recommend a foot rest at the back seats of the truck especially for women and children who have short legs. Accommodation was very good and very clean. Turn down of the second evening was done poorly. Staff is very friendly and the service in general was excellent. The General Manager was very hands on and always visible, friendly and helpful. A most enjoyable weekend!

Just a zoo. Aquila was very disappointing. It was more of a big zoo than a game reserve. The lions are fed, this creates fat, unhealthy animals. Some animals are in very small cages; very sad to see such beautiful animals locked up.
Great Stay!. The room was really great with a huge bed :) The food was good and a lot. The animals were good to see on the safaris, what was great. We especially enjoyed the horseback safari!

Absolutely stunning trip!. Amazing visit, extremely well informed safari leader who was able to answer any and all questions in multiple languages. The resort was very comfortable, staff were attentive. Created so many once in a lifetime memories!!! Thank you to all of the staff for their hard work!!!

Alittle dissapointed. Location good, accommodation not too good, electricity kept tripping. The safari was okay bt to do it twice and jus see the same animals especially waking up at 6am for that was abit like aaaarrrggghhh... Food was not up to scratch... No no no... Was alittle dissapointed.

Not a 4 Star - Standard Room. I was very disappointed in the accommodation as it was not up to a 4 star. It was very basic and very old fashion.We could have been informed that there was a flood and made a decision is we would like to still go on the day we booked. As we did not get to use the maid dinning area and the pools were un construction.The chair that were move to where we were having our meals were dirty as they did not wipe them where the leave of the water was on the feet of the chairs.Server was not available in the restaurant for cater for the amount of people that were present. On waitrose on due. I had to arrange my own tea at the bar with took forever to get to me.I was really expecting more from a 4 star.Thank you

Overnight Safari. The overnight package included two game drives, late afternoon and early morning the next day. Marvelled at the number and range of game we saw, and was impressed with the tour guide, 'Daniel', whose knowledge knew no bounds. Thoroughly recommended if you can get a special package.
very good overall. all was great, may be a few more elephant, hipos, lions would be better..rooms were good, buffet also complete..

Overrated. Thank goodness we did not pay the full price for our two night stay having made use of a special offer. The standard chalet (no 20) is depressing. Dark and no floor mats, for example. The chimney to the "aga stove" does not seal. We would have been overcome with smoke had we lit it! No telephone connection to the front desk. What do you do if you have a medical emergency in the middle of the night? No comfortable seating in the room. Stoep with rustic furniture in summer might be fine, but NOT in winter!One safari is enough to view the limited number of animals. Depressing to see them being fed because of the inadequite local vegetation. Dishes on the buffet are not labelled and no staff to inform international tourists of what is on offer. Do not expect fine dining - not at all. "Tired" looking scrambled eggs and no toast at breakfast. The "plug was still wet" after a flash flood, but surely a few pop-up toasters could have been purchased?Management staff friendly, but housekeeping staff disappointing. We were actually asked by them whether we wanted our room serviced for the second night...Hot water bottles in the evenings a nice touch.Safari break with sherry / wine and snacks enjoyable.Knowledgeable safari guide, Godfrey.Overpriced curio shop.Desserts scrumptous. Baked puds in winter is a must.Recommend: Do not go in winterTake playing cards etc with. (No radio or TV in rooms and lighting too poor to read in your room, AND no comfortable seating in chalet.)

Good if you don't go with high expectations, but they do show the big 5!. Another day of sleeping in late, missing yoga and almost missing the trip, repeat of Day 3, pretty much. I was excited as today we had discovered that we could experience wildlife safari close to Cape Town. Since we were visiting South Africa without kids, we had taken a conscious decision of not doing and safari on this trip and we would come back to Kruger or Sabi Sabi later in life with kids. But when we found out about Aquila Safari which is just two hours away from Cape Town, we couldn’t resist and headed there.Now I must clarify, this safari is only good or people who have or are not planning to visit the bigger safaris of the world like Kruger and the one in Tanzania. The number of animals in the safari are few. When we visited there were 2 elephants, 5 lions,2 rhinos , 2-3 zebras and we got to see 2 buffalos (then there are quite a few ostriches and springboks).You are driven around in an open van by the guide. The guides coordinate amongst themselves and follow the trails of the animals and guarantee you a visual of all the big five.There is also a quad bike tour, helicopter tour and you could stay overnight in the reserve’s cottages. Also, although they’ll say that you get to see the big five, truth is that the only leopard you see is caged at the Rescue Centre.You could go to the extent of saying that it is like a glorified zoo. However we had a great time as we did manage to see many animals up close and personal. It was fun to watch elephants fight for food and scary to see the lions so close. Interestingly there were two lions in one pride, which as you know is unusual. Before the safari we were served lunch which had an interesting mix of game meat and vegetarian food. The whole experience along with the two and fro drive takes more than half a day , four hours for the drive and 1.5 hours of safari and some time for lunch. We headed back much happy and satisfied with the experience.

Not really 'real' Africa'. The hospitality at Aquila is excellent the buffet meals are sumptous and as a leisure complex it is a superb venue, but if you are looking for a true Africa adventure forget it!On the day trip Safari I never for one moment thought we could be in any danger, we drove around this fenced off area hardly ever being out of sight of the complex buildings, of course the guides knew where to find the animals just as I know where to find a certain suit in my wardrobe they're all confined to certain areas! So you will never see the lions hunting for instance as they have nothing to hunt, the whole thing is a santised view of African wildlife set in beautiful suroundings, I was very disappointed with my visit.

Wonderful time at Aquila. We totally enjoyed our stay at Aquila for 3 days. Morning and evening safaris were great, the guides knew where to find the animals and positioned us for good photos. Listening to lions roaring at night was quite an experience. All meals were fresh and delicious, some of it grown right on the property in the aquaponic garden. Service was excellent. Overall rating A+.
EXCELLENCE. Thank you for an excellent visit. We enjoyed the 2 x game drives tremendously and the 3 buffet meals were fantastic.

Paradise...beautiful landscapes and saw the big 5.. Went for an overnight safari.Was warmly welcomed by staff with a glass of sparkling wine/grape juice.Booked in and shown around our chalet.Had the most amazing game drive sighting all the big 5 and taking in the beautiful landscape.Dinner was buffet style and the most delicious food was on offer.Will definitely go back again. Loved every minute.
See It All. Aquila was so much fun! We saw lions, giraffes, rhinos, zebra, elephants, water buffalo, wildebeests, and a peacock! Daniel was our tour guide and he was amazing! Awesome experience.

Lovely family visit. We had a lovely family visit with our 2 young boys aged 3 and 5. The food was consistently fabulous and the rooms were perfectly cozy and warm for winter. Tip for winter - dress very warmly for the game drives as they are icey cold. Our boys loved the game drives. Aquila really makes the effort to cater for young families and adults alike. They have a kids area with mini golf and bikes - we never had the time to play there, but would have had we stayed for 2 nights.
Overnight stay at Aquila. Staff okFood exceptionalLimited animalsCurio shop overpricedNot much other entertainment Paint on stoep were liftingRoom needs renovation and floors were dirty

Aquila. Game drives and rangers are excellent. Very well trained and friendly. The staff in the restaurants and bar is extremely unhelpfull and not trained properly. Phones needed in the rooms. No coffee in room on arrival and very little milk. Food is average. Reception staff like Gertrude very friendly and helpful. Overall I think for the price you pay th eservice in general can improve. GM walks around and never interacts with guests. When I wanted to see him I was passed onto the 2nd in charge. Overall I will not go again. The best part was to see the animals and enjoy the game drives.
Excellent. We had an excellent stay at Aquila.The staff were very pleasant and attentiveThe accommodation first class and thebuffet meals very good. Service wasvery good too.

AQUILA OVERNIGHT SAFARI. We were visiting Cape Town and decided a trip to Aquila (a 2-hour drive) might be a good alternative to flying to Kruger for a real widerness safari. We didn't really know what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. The facilities are first class and the food and service were very good. We were travelling as a group of four adults and a one year old baby, so we reserved a family chalet. It was large, clean and very comfortable. They even supplied a playpen that we could use as the baby's bed. With the baby, it was difficult to follow the scheduled safari tours, so we booked a private safari in a smaller vehicle. This was not a huge extra expense and it gave us the flexibility to set our own departure and return times. Our guide, Mike, was friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating. While the animals are fenced into the reserve, the area is huge, so you really do get the impression that they are roaming free. We saw all kinds of animals and thoroughly enjoyed our tours. If you want to see the "BIG FIVE" game animals, but either can't or don't want to travel far enough to go on a "real" safari, then I would highly recommend Aquila. We are already planning a return visit to Cape Town, and it will definitely include a return visit to Aquila.

beautiful place... not that many animals. If you have never seen 'free roaming' animals before, Aquila is a good place... but be aware that the number of animals is rather small. When we visited there were 3 giraffes, 2 elephants, 7 lions, 7 rhinos and we got to see 2 buffalos (then there are quite a few zebras, ostriches and springboks). Also, although they'll say that you get to see the big five... truth is that the only leopard you see is caged at the Rescue Centre. If you keep all these in mind and decide to go... then you'll have a good time. The Reserve is huge, nicely kept and the guides for the drives are knowledgeable. If you happen to go when there is a large group of visitors (when we went there was a conference of some sort) the place looks a bit overcrowded, but that happens pretty much anywhere else. Overall, good deal if you visit in winter (almost 50% discount) but if you have the chance, try any other National Park in South Africa. They might not have the 'big five' but you'll also get to see a lot.
Fantastic safari experience. Excellent guides, friendly staffSuper amenities, rooms are great with fantastic (and very hot water) outdoor shower, nice pool, viewsSaw all the animals we wanted to see

Very enjoyable experience. We really enjoyed the overnight visit. Because we own Grys Paleis Self Catering Apartments in Hermanus, we have sent many of our visitors to Aquila before, and therefore enjoyed to experience first hand the excellent facilities, the outstnding meals as well as the very comfortable accommocation

Most Disappointed in the Restaurant :(. We did an overnight stay...Upon arrival there were no drinks as indicated and they were not ready for us to check in. We then sat down to lunch and even though there were lots to eat, it was definitely not 4 star quality... the cheese tasted off, the salads looked and tasted like it was just put in the bowl, the fish was bland. Supper was just as bad, the meat was not succulent at all and the desert, well lets just say the custard had lumps. Breakfast was ok...not like you can mess it up much. Then the issue with the bad service. We were greeted as if they had better things to do:( then when passing management we received no welcome either! I really feel like never recommending this place unless only for a game drive. The only upside was our game drive with Ranger Daniel...He was truly amazing. ..loves his job and so knowledgeable about nature in general. DANIEL, you truly were the only positive - C Anthony

Overnight Getaway. Positives: We found the staff (reception, dining room and game drive rangers) very friendly and helpful. Our ranger (Freddie) is relatively new to Aquila, but was generally well-informed and the game drives were enjoyable. The food overall was above average, home cooked style food. The calmness, and crisp air of the southern Karoo is always refreshing, and Aquila's 7500 ha's is beautiful.Negatives: the title "private", coupled with the 4-star price, suggests a degree of exclusivity. It was obvious immediately we arrived that, in fact, Aquila targets the mass market, and there's very little "exclusive" about it. The dining room is in real need of a re-decoration - it's not rustic, but rather tacky. Our room (Sunbird) was clean and comfortable, but definitely not 4-star. (I would suggest 3-star at most - finishes like big gaps between door-frames and walls, a bathroom light that is a converted parafin lamp but without any glass, and a toilet that I had to manually fill with water because the ballcock wasn't working, highlight the lack of attention to detail that a 4-star establishment would get right). I was also surprised that there were only 2 elephant (not free roaming), and only 2 or 3 very aggressive (apparantly) buffalo, which I was wanting to photograph but never got the chance! Lions in an enclosure didn't appeal either. As far as the game was concerned, I was expecting a lot more from our visit, and we were very disappointed, no doubt because we have spent much time in lowveld reserves with completely free-roaming game. However, I can see why it appeals to foreigners, and thats good for the economy! In summary, it was a nice overnight stay, and I got a couple of decent photo's (esp of the rhino, actually).

Amazing Game Safari. We did an overnight visit to Aquila and I have to compliment our ranger Elroy on a most informative, exciting and fantastic game drive and animal interaction. The champagne and snacks mid way was a lovely touch and most appreciated.

Definitely worth the drive from Cape Town. While staying in Cape Town, my friend and I decided to take a day and drive out to the game reserve. Aquila is small, but it's the best way to see the big 5 if your staying just in Cape Town and not traveling the rest of South Africa. It is a 2 hr drive to Aquila, but it is through some of South Africa's most beautiful wine country. We followed a truck loaded with grapes to a vineyard and went right to the office and bought a few bottles of what they served us at the reserve.

Very Disappointing. I would not recommend this safari to anyone. We left early and did not even go on our last safari. This place offers a glorified zoo. None of the animals are native to the area and they are fed by Aquila and all hang out in same area. It was so depressing to see the animals caged into this area - especially the lions. It really should not be legal.
Aquila Game Reserve. This is a small private reserve but you can see the big five there if you can't afford a safari park. it is about a 2 hour drive from Cape Town but is well worth it.

Aquila good and bad. We stayed for 2 nights, the drink on arrival was a nice gesture, lunch good selection but the first night evening meal was roughly the same as lunch not a lot of thought had gone into it The second day was a lot better in the evening.The rooms were comfortable and the outdoor shower novel, but there was no room service. We made our own bed and washed up cups etc.The game drive p.m. was o.k. driver informative.

One day/night special in May 2015. Accommodation was fine, we were in room 14 and enjoyed being close to fence and the two old buffaloes. Food was very good, no complaints. We have lunch, supper and breakfast and ate too much.The actual nature reserve was somewhat disappointing as it is extremely small and literally all animals are being feed. The lions look pretty fat and although exciting to be close, it was somewhat less exciting than expected. The private game reserve (even with the big five!) doesn't compare to yourself driving around in like the Karoo National park, where you have a circular drive of 40 odd km. The general experience was okay. but rather expensive even on a special! Wouldn't return. Rather drive the extra 270 km to Beaufort West!

Great staff, beautiful place and fascinating operation. Situated a few hours outside of Cape Town the Aquila Safari Park is in a word magnificent. The chalets are rustic, comfortable and have great touches for want of a better word like an outside shower and sit down bath tubs. (I didn’t use the bath I would have felt bad about using all that water for myself). We arrived after a long journey in the car on one of the hottest days of the year and as soon as we arrived the staff were nothing but helpful. Having booked us all into our rooms they said if you hurry you can still grab lunch before the kitchens close and what a lunch it was too. Arranged in a rather splendid buffet there was a huge selection on offer which was just what we needed after a diet of crisps and sweets in the car. With plenty of time to spare we relaxed by the pool before heading off on our first safari which to be fair was amazing. Besides attending my sister’s wedding I really wanted to go on safari when I went to South Africa and the Aquila Safari more than surpassed my expectations. With fantastic views of the elephants, my personal favourite, as well as hippo’s, giraffes, lions, buffalo, white rhino, zebra and many more, the guide’s knowledge and friendliness shined throughout the experience. After 3 hours out in the field we headed back overwhelmed by what we had seen and eager to jump in the Olympic sized, or thereabouts, pool before a relaxed dinner. Again the evening meal was a real treat and it was nice to sit on the veranda and listen to the animals in the distance. We had another safari lined up in the morning which again was great and we got to find out about the park’s irrigation process for growing their own vegetables and their plans for the future, which I found all very fascinating. Overall I would whole-heartedly recommend the Aquila Safari Park. The staff are excellent, food’s amazing and you do really get close enough to the animals to capture some wonderful pictures and memories. It is also really good value for money.

A fair compromise. If there's no time to visit one of the major national game parks in S.A.this is a good Chance to see some of the big five in a rather naturalHabitat and at Close range. Rangers are very knowledgeable and professional, as are all other staff members. Some very good work in the Rehabilitation ofendangered wild animals,too. A very enjoyable experience.

Avoid. I visited Aquila first time when they just started this operation and had a lovely time, meet the owner and his family and all was very intimate and personal, had the best time and looked realy forward to revisit 12 years later.No it is just a big upersonal tourist machine with ignorant and staff that gives effort about service and total lack off entusiasm no service, totaly missing from the transport service to the guide that drives you around, the all where so totaly uninterested and just wanted time to pass quickly so they could get home.Food just average and only a few animals to encounter, all in a hurry and almost impossible to understand a word said by the lazy tour guide.Rhinos just been shot by pochers and only a few animal to see totaly.The location is nice but thats it.A long transfere fra CT for nothing, did not even bother to show us all the animals in the reserve, and just drove off when they feelt it was time to go.Crowded and totaly focused on Asians and mainly Chinese clients in big groups....noisy and not easy to mix with.Avoid at all costs and find a better place, will not recomned and wast of time and money.

Nice break, food to improve. Comfortable, Zoo Safari: so there is certainty to see all animals in a short period of time. And safety for children under 5 y.o.. Near Cape Town, nice for a break out of Town, food was unfortunately not great would prefer less but better quality. Our Rooms was very basic, would expect more for the price.

Excellent. I took my Mom through for Mother's day - everything was excellent, from the time that we arrived, the friendly staff, knowledgeable game guide, fantastic food, comfortable accommodation - it was awesome and we had a wonderful time. If you want to see the Big 5 and be assured of seeing them in a short space of time, if time is limited, this is the way to go. It may be a bit commercial (for those of us who are used to the bigger game parks in Africa and self drives), however, this is a little piece of heaven and special time away. It is a good idea for those wanting a bit of peace and quiet to take accommodation away from the main hub. Thank you to everyone who made the stay as memorable as it was.

Aquila Game Preserve is Tops!. This private game preserve has an impressive collection of wild animals that includes all of the big five and a full complement of other animals. The animals are somewhat "managed" by the regular feeding from the handlers, but you get to see them in their natural habitat and it is fascinating to see them interact and to see the sense of community that they have at their common water pool. The Rhinos were the most fascinating for me personally and we saw five of them up very close. Also, I really leaned to appreciate the tremendous natural camouflage of a lion's coat in this environment. These animals are wild and one of the buffalo charged one of the game ride vehicles and a young lady dropped her cell phone outside of the vehicle when the buffalo struck their vehicle--it was later recovered! The evening game ride included a stop for champagne and snacks! The normal package here is to arrive around noon, have lunch--meals here are actually very good--in the large dinning facility. All meals are buffet style and you pay for drinks but they are reasonably priced. You get your room key at 2 pm and the first game ride is in the afternoon. You return for dinner, there are club facilities if you want to continue to socialize. We chose to go back to our cabin which was a delightful, rustic and well out-fitted facility with a fireplace with fresh wood and fire starter. I built us a nice and essential fire as it was pretty cold at night in May (the late Fall here). We sat out on our deck and listened to the lions growling in the distance--how cool is that? There are hair dryers in the room, large tubs, double sink and an outdoor shower! All the rooms vary from each other so don't be surprised if you don't have an outside shower. I used the shower after the morning game ride the next day. You awake early and meet around 0630 for a 0700 departure on the morning game ride. After the game ride, you have breakfast and then clear rooms in preparation for departure from the facility. This was a wonderful two day break out into the countryside. Of interest is the fact that the majority of guests during our stay were locals from the Cape Town area--if they are coming here, this facility clearly has a good value proposition for them as well. We really enjoyed our visit here. The staff, kitchen, facility and game rides were all top notch!

Like watching captive animals. The rooms at this resort were very basic..no dustbins ,so I had to use an empty shopping bag for throwing dry trash. But the beds were amazingly comfortable, we all had the best nights sleep ever!The food was good, lots of salads, cold and warm food,many desserts, wholesome,and satisfying.The safari into the reserve was a bit of a damp squib in that, there was no thrill as such. It was wonderful to see the animals, no doubt, but it felt more like a visit to a zoo than a safari in the wild. Added to which we had two girls from Europe,in the front seats of our bus in the skimpiest of clothes, who kept jumping from one side of the bus to the other,taking pictures of each other in assorted provocative poses, which further distracted us from the few animals there were to see! However,our guide gave us some interesting insights into animal behavior, and was informative and cordial, so no complaints on that front at all.

Tranquility just outside Cape Town. During the two day visit I enjoyed the safaris. Please remember to dress warmly for the early morning safari! Bring your best cameras :). The safari guides are are quite knowledgeable and I learnt a great deal about the animals. I also enjoyed the food and much needed R&R.

wonderful scenery. The buildings are very beautiful and totally fit within the environment.The service was very friendly and the food was way too much :)The game drives were very interesting, and although/because it is a tiny reserve, you definitely get to see game! Our ranger gave excellent explanations and was very friendly and helpful towards the small kids. We loved it that our 2year old was allowed to go on a game drive, and she loved it as well!!:)
Overnight Safari. Only 2 hours from Cape Town, great accommodation, great food, scenic safari and plenty of animals close up. A terrific experience!

A great place to stay, relax and see wildlife. This game lodge has a friendly staff, very nice lodge and good overnight accommodation with an eye for detail. The lunch-, dinner- and breakfast buffets are good with enough variety in food. The game drives are relaxing with in the late afternoon a sundowner in the field. All in all a great place to stay for a reasonable price, especially with the discounts during the winter months.

Aquila Feedback. Overall the entire two day experience was really great to such extent that we definitely want to return soon. The only challenge / negative is that we don't think kids are well catered for when it comes to the game drives - There should be a separate drive for parents with kids with a ranger that has proven patience with kids on such an excursion.

lovely retreat from city life. I found everything to my liking, can't complain, except one thing I don't understand: why don't you give every one booking in the winter months the discount that you advertise in the papers? And do South Africans pay the same as foreigners? A better price for locals supporting you would only be fair.

Excellent value. Excellent service and value. Our Scottish friends travelling with us were extremely happy with the service they received and wowed by the animals. Thanks again for making our stay such a superb experience.

Excellent staff. I was collected on time from my hotel,and although we had to go to other hotels in Cape Town,our driver Jason was polite and efficient. It can seem a long drive to the reserve,but the views more than make up for this. A short comfort stop was made on route. On arrival we were given a welcome drink,and then booked in. All the staff seemed to be smiling and were very pleasant. A buffett style breakfast is then offered,it was excellent.Once we were on the drive,our guide Tyler was brilliant at getting as close as possible,and although animals can sometimes be elusive,he managed to find them all. He gave us lots of info and always answered any questions. A true professional. The reserve itself is set in outstanding countryside,and one can get the feeling of really being in the wild,miles from anywhere. Also a big thumbs up to the conservation work they are trying to achieve. On return we were given a very good hearty choice of hot and cold food,followed by relaxation time. Overall a great day out.

Two night package . Have just returned from two nights at Aquila. Fabulous accommodation and the general manager, Aton Perold went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable . Food was fantastic. As a South African was a little disappointed in the game facilities and amount of game on the farm. For foreigners here for a short trip to the Cape I can highly recommend it!
The best experience ever. Aquila is just awesome! Nice people, delicious food, very nice safaris and the ambiente is beautiful!

aquila overnight stay. very good over all experience.I took a friend from Italy that had limited time but wanted to see the big 5.Aquila is perfect for that.well organized , good guide,excellent facilities and splendid setting.Staff friendly and helpful too.

A great day out! Not to be missed.. Went for a one day safari - not to be missed. It was an early pick up from my hotel at the Waterfront in Cape Town followed by a roughly two hour drive to the Reserve, with a comfort break en-route. We were welcomed with sparkling wine and a buffet breakfast and then a chance to relax for about an hour before the three our drive through the Reserve with our guide. The guide was extremely knowledgeable about the animals and got very close to several of them allowing us to get some great shots on our cameras. We were out in the reserve for around 3 hours. When we got back there was a lunch with a great selection of dishes. At 3 o'clock we started our drive back to the city, arriving back at our hotel at 5pm. I can't recommend this as a day out highly enough - a must do!
wonderful experience. stayed for the overnight safari. It is a great place to visit. Staff were excellent. Would definitely recommend to others.

First Rate. We had looked at this safari before we arrived in Cape Town as we knew that it was too far for a "proper" safari (Kruger) but still able to see the "Big 5" within driving distance of central Cape Town (approx. 2 hours). We actually booked it with one of the Aquila representatives set up at the V&A Waterfront. You booked here but didn't pay until arriving at the reception. The drive out from Cape Town is easy and beautiful. We had to be there for a 1:30pm safari and arrived well before noon and enjoyed the facilities around the pool and also lunch which was included in the price. After lunch we went out in a truck with our guide (Tyler ? who was great and knowledgeable) and around 10 people on board. We were out for c.3.5 hours and saw a variety of wild African animals up close and personal including elephants, buffalo, giraffe, ostrich, springbok, eland, zebra, rhino and lurking in the water hippos. The lions are in a separate enclosure (which other than the gates in and out is so big you wouldn't notice it's an enclosure) with their own supply of springbok (apparently if they were in the main reserve there wouldn't be much left) !! Our only regret was not having gone overnight which would have included an early AM and late PM safari. Superb.

A very poor start to what would have been a great trip. Having planned the safari overnight trip from the UK, we opted to be picked up from Cape Town for an extra £50 per person to save the hassle of driving and having a relaxed few days away from busy Cape Town. Unfortunately this was a huge mistake. Despite contacting Aquila prior to our trip for a pick up time, we received no phone call informing us when we would be collected. We contacted Aquila on the day of pick up to find out our driver was 10 mins away. Luckily we were ready and got on board the bus. This was to be our position for the next 2 hours however as our driver proceeded to collect the other guests. Whilst I accept that some waiting is involved, we went to several hotels collecting nobody. Our driver was apologetic and appeared to be taking a huge amount of phone calls with new destinations. We took 2 hours, collecting 3 other couples, but going to 6 different hotels within a 5 mile radius of our pick up point. By the time we had arrived at Acquila we had been on the bus for almost 4 hours. Whilst we were aware we had to wait another 2 hours after arrival to check into our room, this was not ideal given the start to our trip. Having said this the rest of the time spent at Aquila was great, it's just such a shame it started so poorly. I would highly recommend Aquila, but don't bother paying the extra money for transfers. We could have driven there in 2 hours and seen wonderful scenery for far less than £100.

A total joy. The whole experience of Aquila from the booking on line months before, to arriving, was AMAZINGLY.Transport from Cape Town was great and Faaheim the driver was such a super guy. Friendly greetings, wonderful food, the cabin we stayed in was beautiful, including an outside shower! The safaris were incredible and our driver and guide Yannis was so much fun and knowledgable. HIGHLY recommended.

Fun for Kids. I wish we had time to make it to Kruger while we were in South Africa but our schedule didn't allow it. Since we wanted to see some animals outside of a zoo setting, we chose Aquila as a nice day trip. Our driver picked us up at our hotel on time and from Cape Town it's about 2.5 hrs away. It's a nice drive and goes by quickly. Once there they offer a lovely buffet breakfast and everything is very organized. We had a beautiful day for our visit. The only downfall is that there are no trees on this reserve so it's bit desolate. There's nothing to eat because of this so the animals are fed. Also, the cheetahs and leopard are kept in a small compound instead of roaming on reserve which was sad. The resort is beautiful and if I had little kids or was over 75 yrs old it would have been perfect. Our teens were a bit bored.

guarenteed Big 5 Viewing. This private reserve is conveniently located 2 hours outside of Cape town, and for ZAR 1000 , they can collect and drop you off in CT. Do book the 2 day/overnight option- it allows for afternoon and early am game drive. I am sure you will be guaranteed to see all the animals. Keep in mind the Karoo region isn't these animals native habitat; ;it is sparse land, no natural bush grass or terrain you have in northern SA. However due to the sparseness, you can easily see the animals as they are not camoflouged. The herbivores are fed with grain/hay; it is easy to see large groups of grazing animals. Both the white and black Rhino is here. A treat to see up close. The animals are clearly used to vehicles, they are not fussed about them. The lions live in a separate area fenced off. there were 2 males and 4 females. We saw them up close during the early am drive; it was an amazing experience! At the end of the morning drive, the Ranger takes you to the rehab centre where there are rescued cheetahs and a leopard. the resort itself is comfortable, African décor inspired, and great buffet meals. There is also a fire pit and a cosy African style lounge bar. there is a large pool , and you can sometimes see grazing wild animals in the nearly bush. Internet was weak and the hot water and water pressure in our room was not so good though. This is not an authentic bush safari like in Kruger Park up North, but if one is short on time, and holidaying in the Cape, this is a great way to also get to see Africas famous animals.

Magical place within easy reach of Cape Town. Staying for a day and night at Aquila Game Reserve was a treat - from the warm hospitality to the amazing setting and last, but not least the opportunity to see the Big Five and so much more in the glorious setting of a natural habitat with experienced guides. I cannot wait to return with my family soon!

Off the beaten path safari with comfortable stay. Outstanding service and incredible effort to work through a flash flood of rain with max occupancy. We were truly impressed that the hotel was able to clean the rooms the next morning and still have events and meals on time. Job well done under those circumstances.

One off my Bucket List. My wife and I loved this place. It was one of the key activities on our to-do list whilst in Cape Town. We're glad we selected Aquila, as we were more than happy with our experience. Stayed overnight in a premium chalet overlooking the game reserve. From our room, we could see, buffalo, zebra, ostriches, springbok and elephants! The safari drives (1. afternoon and 2. morning) were amazing. Seeing the animals up close (really close - including the lions!) was quite the experience. Our driver/guide, Klaas was the best. Great explanations and did his best to give us all the best possible experience. For the price, inclusive of 2 meals, accommodation, 2 safari drives (and I think transfers are included - we drove ourselves), it was well worth it.

Absolute treat...a great 2 day/overnight adventure.. An awesome trip to Aqila!We were picked up from our Cape Town hotel...quite a bit later than scheduled and the drive was slightly longer that we were told...but that's about it..on the negative side. We passed through stunning and changing scenery on the way.Our package included a welcome drink on arrival (nice), three buffet style meals (all very good)....two safari drives of 2-3 hours each(EXCELLENT) and accommodation (sort of safari lodge/resort.... EXCELLENT). Such a beautiful, 'wide open space'. environment. Loved it!! A day trip from Cape Town might be a bit much to comfortably enjoy in as it is a 2-3 drive from Victoria Wharf (city), but I was very happy with my overnight stay and would love to return. It was fantastic to see so many animals and even could hear the lion roar at night from our room! The drive back was fine...left on time and took less than 2 hours to return to our Cape Town hotel.Great value for money when converted from Rand to Aussie Dollar.

Nice Safari trip to Aquila. Friday morning we headed from Westin hotel Cape Town to Aquila private game reserve a bit late though I will recommend for others to go there at early morning so as to reach in the early morning like 8 am so as to catch the animals in their feeding and drinking time when they are active most. We were a big group nice food and very friendly staff one in particular Shaolin the food was do nice and huge varieties too in food and drinks .a little short in w.c rooms not that much but everything went well . I respected that they had a section for us Muslims to pray . Then after having lunch we took the trucks and went to see the animals from elephants, rhino , deers, ostrich, zebras , giraffes and lions overwhelming experience to whom lives vast virgin landscapes . Everything was nice but the distance from Cape Town to Aquila was a bit long due to traffic jams .

Fab Safari Experience. For a first or cost effective experience, Aquilla is brilliant. Highly recommend the overnight, morning & afternoon safari package. Food lovely and whole atmosphere good.Would ban the "selfie" sticks though!

World Class Adventure. We were an group of tour-operators staying at the fantastic Aquila Private Game Lodge, only 1,5 hrs. drive from Capetown. Aquila is the perfect alternativ to Kruger Nationalpark, being sure to see the big 5 without worries of the Malaria flies. Upon arrival guests are welcome with an glass good sparkling wine, followed by an well organized game drive with an very kowledgabe Rancher. If you overnight (recommended) the Lodge provides an good dinner. Enjoy also the pool. We´ll certainly come back with customers. Regards from Denmark - Klaus Prüfer - www.gourmet-rejser.dk

marvellous stay in safari lodge. fantastic staff, location like a dream, beatiful animals, saw all big 5 staying there is like a big present! aspeccialy the deluxe houses,amazing view over the landscape. go there and enjoy it aswell, breakfast and dinner really rich, good quality, great buffet!
View from Russia. Good accommodation, good food, good wine, excellent guides, very beautiful landscape, a real possibility to see animals.

Good excursion from Cape Town. I'm so glad I made the last minute decision to visit Aquila during my trip to Cape Town! I hesitated to book it because I thought it seemed slightly overpriced, but decided to take the risk. Though I still think it's a bit expensive, it was definitely worth it. The room (I went for the standard double) was beautiful, the game drives were amazing, and staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend Aquila to anyone looking for a safari experience without the means to travel to one of the huge parks like Kruger.

Efficient and Fun. Everyone in SA will tell you game parks are a northern activity...and they are probably right. However, if you are making the smart choice and spending some time in Cape town but don't have time to get to the northern parks then Aquila is a great option. My wife and I were pushed for time after visiting family for over a week in Natal. We were desperate to have some holiday time in Cape Town for our 3 year anniversary. We spent 1 night out at Aquila and were very satisfied with the experience. Great scenery on the drive out, good food, lovely setting and very friendly staff. Our game driver, Daniel, was exceptional and very knowledgeable. Because it is a relatively small park, we got to see all the animals we came for in two game drives. When I say small, 10,000 hectares still feels like plenty of space for the animals to feel and behave as they would in the wild. For a game drive experience that is affordable and efficient I would definitely go back to Aquila.

Beautiful, I wish we could have stayed longer. Our guide Romeo was informative and fun. Had a great time seeing the animals and he tried his best to make sure we saw everything. thank you Romeo. I was a little sad the Giraffe was keeping its distance, but this is the point of the safari, you can not guarantee you will see everything and you cannot make the animals come to you. We did however see Elephants, Hippos, Rhino, Zebra, Lions, Buffalo, Springbok and many more.The facilities were also great. We stayed in the premier lodge which I fully recommend if you have the budget. Our own private lodge with a massive bed, huge en suit (with bath built into the rocks) and private out side shower so you can see the reserve. All staff were friendly and helpful. The only downside is we only stayed 1 night.Thank you to Aquilla

enjoyable but clearly more to come. Our first visit to South Africa and with limited time available we decided on Aquila to dip our toes in the safari experience for its relative proximity to our Cape Town base. Yes it IS a little ersatz in as much as the space on the reserve seems to limit the capacity of animals, and the rangers all seem to know them individually, but that did not detract from our enjoyment and simply encouraged us to look at the possibilities for a more comprehensive experience next time. Anyone who has looked into the eyes of a couple of lions basking in the sun just a few feet from them will in any event always treasure the experience, as will my wife and myself. The overnight accommodation was very comfortable and the all you can eat buffet dining tremendously good quality. Various ongoing construction indicates there is more improvement to come.
Family overnight stay at Aquila on a family Chalet for 8. Everything was well organised from start to finish, well done for a exellent service to the Aquila teamWe will come back.

Aquila Game Reserve feedback. There was 17 in our group (adults and children) all booked for an overnight stay, arriving at lunchtime and incorporating 2 game drives, an evening meal and breakfast. We had 5 sets of accommodation ranging from the family lodges to couples. The experience was very good, the staff extremely friendly and the safari driver of vehicle 10 (during our stay 08/09 April 2015) was brilliant, very knowledgeable about the animals and their behaviours etc. The initial booking in at reception was a little disjointed but this may have been due to the number of people in the party. The food at the reserve was excellent, of a wide variety, very well presented and extremely tasty. The game drives were excellent, and we saw the Big 5 during our stay. The Reserve is still relatively young and it was explained that the programme will eventually allow for a larger number of animals in the future and for the lions to be roaming free, but this did not detract from getting "up close" with some of the animals, particularly the large cats, so although there were not a large number of certain species we were not disappointed in what we saw. there were great opportunities to take close up pictures on the camera and video. The morning drive was a bit chilly and it would be advisable to wear warmer clothing certainly until the sun has risen. The game reserve did however provide blankets. The accommodation was excellent, very comfortable well furnished and spacious.

best mini safari close to Cape Town. This was my 4th stay at Aquila and it just gets better. I was born in Cape Town and moved away 32 years ago. I have brought 4 groups of american friends to show them my home town and each time i have included an overnight stay or two in Aquila to have them experience a safari close by. They and I have always been impressed by the wonderful accommodations to the fabulous variety of food to the knowledgeable rangers like Klaus and Abriel. The new gm Anton could not have been more accommodating and helpful. He is now in charge of the expansion of a new restaurant, hotel rooms and spa and I am looking forward to going back when it is finished in summer. Thanks again for a great time.

Mrs. Not an enjoyable experience. Very few variety and numbers of animals and the tour truck was ok but not the tracks on which it drove. Very tough and got thrown around way too much.Felt very much like someone's big barren back yard. Very expensive experience.

Lovely stay at Aquila. 2 Grandparents with 1 grandchild, good choice of a game reserve close to Cape Town. Kid friendly, parents friendly and assured of seeing the big 5. Delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner, catering for everyone's needs. Big smile for a shower under the stars!!

family visit to Aquila. My wife and I , along my nephew and his young family stayed on night in Aquila. The facilities were excellent , spacious dining , very good food with a great choice of menus, comfortable bar and good attentive staff. The swim up pool bar was a nice additionThe accomodation was really nice. Michael showed us our rooms and made sure all was just right for our stay. The rooms themselves were lovely with a delightful outside shower which allowed us look at the Southern Stars as we bathed. The safari trip was very informative and the animals were so lovely to see in the Karoo landscape. The kids were delighted to see Rhino, Giraffe, Lions, Zebra, amongst others. All in all an excellent venue for a young family

Awesome - So worth an overnight stay. We are a family of 4 and had two bungalows for one night. This experience was so worth it, it was the cherry on our cake for the 3 weeks we spent touring the garden route & Cape Town.

More a zoo than a safari. The place is about 2-2.5 hours from cape town. We were welcomed with champagne and juice followed by a nice well spread breakfast. The infrastructure for rooms, etc seemed great though we didnt stay there overnight.The actual safari part was a bit of a disappointment though. The animals were far too less and were quite inactive. Didnt get a feel of the wild. The animals which we saw were very very close, but still we were left unsatisfied with the safari.The post safari lunch was great as well.

Zoo Safari Fun!. Confortable. Almost luxurious. Zoo Safari: so there is certainty to see all animals in a short period of time. And safety for children under 5 y.o.. Great service. Great room. Good buffet options. Near Cape Town.

Superb. Visited Aquila for the one night stayover option with family and friends, total of 20 people,5 children among us.It was a great experience and we were satisfied in all respects including food drink and accomodation. The Game Drives offered in afternoon and morning of following day were the highlight for all and we saw big 5 plus hippo at amazingly close distance, much information new and of interest was provided during game drive. Quad ride through the reserve was a highlight for the men as was the horseriding to the ladies. All in all an extremly great offer for anyone wanting to view ZA wildlife close to Cape Town area ,to get there via N1 very easy and the drive back to CT via Ceres and Tulbagh offers a very scenic alternative route( stop at Tulbagh the better option of the 2, Rijks one of the prime Vineyards there producing great Pinotage. As it can get cold in Karoo bring warm jacket and long trousers for game drive, though blankets are provided! We stayed at the best available premier luxury cottages, the younger folks at the 8sleeper and 4sleeper cottages the former premier luxury best option for couples w/o children.

Perfect trip worth staying. Absolutely fantastic great people so helpful and full of advice of where to go and what to do. We decided not to do the evening safari as was really exhausted after the drive and a quad bike safari we met Anton the general manager and he was full of knowledge and passion for the park. The food was amazing and the range was huge so everyone was happy with something. The park itself was spectacular we had gone to Inverdoorn in Ceres and Aquila I think if you have time go to both as they are both good in their own right but if you want more animals to see and more to do ie small children then I would recommend Aquila as they pretty much have everything and do everything. I loved Aquila but since we went to both parks I loved how quiet and how the game rangers had more time to talk to us in Inverdoorn but other from that they are both good value for money and such an experience so if you have time and the money DO BOTH!!!!!The quad biking safari was incredible it was loads of fun as well as seeing loads of animals the guide was brilliant and saw everything!! We went in March and the weather was brilliant not too hot and was so clear just a perfect experience and I am so glad me and my family decided to visit it was worth staying it makes it so much better an experience than 1 day.
Safari. Excellent service Nice room Buffet food very goodNice location Sunbathing while the elephants walked by in the distance is cool

Great day experience. Wife, teenage daughter and myself did this trip in April. Having read some of the previous reviews stating that this is a glorified zoo or safari park - have to completely disagree. This may not be the Maasai Mara or Kruger national park, but for a day experience it is actually first class. You get to see animals in their natural habitat and the reserve is pretty large, over 7500 acres. We got to see the big 5 - the buffalo being the most dangerous as it charged our truck! The ranger explained right at the start of the tour what Aquila was all about - animal conservation - so full credit to them for that. The ranger was very knowledgeable and kept us well informed about all of the animals. Overall well worth a visit if you are staying around the Cape Town area - we thoroughly enjoyed it and it was a memorable day that will stay with us forever.

NOT BY FAR A SAFARI. we, Europeans, when we sea safari we have some expectations.this here was not the case. is better said a ...big zoo....nothing else...the animals had almost all pierced ears for the chip,also they have only 2 elefants...and they send them to the visitors...so is exactly like a ZOO!the safari is not a word that has to be here.is much over priced for the offer.and they include food but NO DRINKS...come on ....and they are the only one selling the drinks....strange way of doing business...for africa...for over 200 euros....to visit a zoo????? NOT WORTH IT!!!!

Absolutley Amazing. Just a short hop from Cape Town (2hrs) you are able to experience the Africa's big five. Staff are super friendly and the facilities are outstanding for a 2x night stay. The head ranger Timothy was a pleasure to deal with and extremely experienced, this all came apparent when we were caught out in a huge thunderstorm whilst out on a game drive. We were soaked and on arriving back at the Lodge it was almost all washed out! The Lodge manager had his staff work through the night resolving the water damage and as a apology it was free drinks the whole night on top of superb cuisine. Had a fantastic time and would recommend this to anyone who want's a tiny slice of Africa on the Capes doorstep.

Amazing stay with excellent service. We had the most amazing stay whiles visiting Cape Town. The staff were friendly and helpful and the accommodation was clean and comfortable.The honeymoon suite had a Jacuzzi that we thoroughly enjoyed with some bubbly! The food was to die for!

Aquila Ups +Downs. We booked an overnight stay which included 2 gamedrives.Arrival and checkin were profesionally done . Rooms are adequate but with no "frills" which you would expect from an expensive/upmarket establishment. Game drives are good with reasonably experienced rangers. BUT, the food was terrible.One would expect more for the rates you pay . Very basic buffet meals with no class at all. Why not employ a half decent chef....the rates are high enough to afford one! Overall a dissapointing experience.

Fun day trip. Being picked up at 630am was not fun, but it was uphill from there. Breakfast was a buffet and was more than satisfactory, as was lunch. The two hour safari ride was worthwhile, as we was close-up, lions, elephants, leopards, springbok, elands, hippos and rhinos. Guide was knowledgable, although sometimes hard to understand. Pool is nice touch, although we did not partake.

Game Good. Game good but service, food and accomodation sub standard. Lots of room for improvement. Accomodation tired and needs update. hot water not working in outside shower. Food very basic could improve a lot.

Excellent Experience!. My boyfriend and I were in South Africa for two weeks. Aquila was recommended to us by friends, and turned out to be the best experience pssible!The luxury accommodation of buffet meals, a peacock toting around, and infinity pool made the experience on site amazing. Me being vegan and my boyfriend being an eat-anything we found the options great for both of us. Bottles of wine were available to buy and take back to our room to keep the relaxing going.As for the Game Reserve we were enamored with the guaranteed sighting of animals without it being too unnatural. We saw *almost* all of the big 5 without having to look too hard. With our overnight trip we were given two lengthy drives for optimal chances of seeing the wild animals.After looking at the other options available in the Karoo for Game Preserves I'm happy wwe chose Aquila. While others allow you to get hands on, we loved that these are still wild animals and are kept happy and natural as best as possible. If you're going to South Africa for a true safari experience you truly cannot get better than Aquila!
Great Experience!. Fun way to experience a safari! I Would highly recommend Aquila if you need close proximity to Cape Town.

Unorganised/Unhappy Staff. We had looked for a good game reserved near to Cape Town while we were in South Africa and Aquila seemed to tick all the right boxes.We opted for the Combo Safari which included transfers from Cape Town, Morning Game drive then an afternoon Horseback/Quad bike.The driver that collected us from out hotel in the morning was friendly and after collecting other guests a round Cape Town he explained the itinerary for our day. He then let everyone know that the bus would be ready to board for the return trip to Cape Town at 15:00 however they would have to wait around till 15:30 as we were doing the combo. With all eyes looking at us it wasn't a comfortable situation but dismissed it and looked forward to the day ahead.On arrival we were met with sparkling wine and juice and staff that didn't look the happiest or most welcoming, this was confirmed when who I can only presume as the manager told the staff that they should smile more when greeting guests!We sat down to the complimentary breakfast which was interrupted by a hungry Peacock who whilst was amusing at first did become annoying and 'pecky' after a while. The game drive started shortly after and the the ranger that took us out was quite knowledgeable of the animals and the surroundings. On the first stop we did see quite a few animals, Elephants, Zebras, Springbok, Rhinos and Gazelles. Unfortunately we only got to see one Lioness who looked a bit hot and was hiding in the bush from the blazing sun. So was disappointed not to see a few more. We stopped for a quick break and was offered water and sparkling wine which also gave us opportunity to chat to other guest and the ranger etc.On our way back to the reception the driver/ranger explained that due to time issues we wouldn't be able to join the others on the visit to the ARC and see the Leopard and Hippos. We did offer to forgo having lunch and remain with the group as quite honestly to see these animals close up was worth skipping a meal, however he seemed insistent that we had to get off as our next tour would begin at 13:30. So we reluctantly left the tour and went to grab lunch. 13:30 came and we stood out by the pick up point awaiting the next ranger to take us out on the next safari. 13:30 came and went. We kept asking staff if we were stood in the right place which they said we were and left it at that. 14:00 came fast approaching and with me and my partner already feeling guilty about making our transfer wait 30mins for us we began to worry that they'd be waiting evening longer. I went back to reception and asked again about when we would start and where to stand to be met with a blank stare and a shrug of the shoulders. It's appeared that no-one knew about who would be running the safari.At 14:10 a ranger came over who asked us to wait a while as not enough Quad bikes had been brought around. At this point I asked him how long this would last as we were concious that a 40-45min late start would mean our transfer bus would be sat waiting with everyone on it for over an hour! He said it'd be about 1.30mins but couldn't guarantee when we'd be back. This left us feeling a bit uncomfortable so took the decision to stay back and not go so we wouldn't make the bus wait longer for us.So ended up spending the afternoon sat looking at hills waiting for 15:00 for the transfer back to Cape Town. While sitting there we looked at the website to check how much we had wasted in cost against the standard morning safari and the combo day safari which worked out to R2200 (About £125.00 between the 2 of us). Whilst on the website we checked the itinerary details of the day safari against out own. As it turned out the guys on our transfer bus who opted to just do the morning Safari were not due to return to Cape Town until 15:30 and NOT 15:00, so there was no need for that driver to make out that we would have made them wait an extra 30 mins!So we ended up paying more than the guys on the bus who just did the day safari and saw less due to not getting to go to the ARC and instead of seeing the Big 5 only got to see the Big 4.....We did try and speak to a guy there to have a word but he kept brushing us off that he was busy and would get to us when he had a chance but never did. At the end of it feel more upset than angry as we'd travel a long way and that was the highlight we were looking forward to while visiting South Africa

special. Thank you so much for alovely stay in your game reserve. right from the start of our visit through to the magical morning trips out to see the reserve, everything was lovely. The selection of food for the buffet throughout the day was excellent and we found the guides very well informed and it shows that they are very experienced. The only reservation was the noise of the renovations, which spoiled the visits to the pool and loungers. but when you were out on the reserve then you could really feel the peace. thank you again from my sister Debbie and iAnn

Wonderful Place to visit. This was the last stop on my two week trip to cape town and Im glad I saved the best for last. I had a great time here as this is a beautiful place and a great experience. The safari guide were extremely nice and knowledgeable about the animals. I saw many wild animals up close and it was thrilling. I highly recommend a visit

Very few animals . The place is big and nice. We had a welcome drink-sparkling juice or wine then a buffet lunch which was average. It is quite far from the city but the trip was nice because of the wine vineyards to see along the way. We got disappointed with the safari because there were very few animals to see. The giraffe and lions were far. Not a good value for money tour.

Be careful with food quality.. Saw the big 5, but food horrendous.Served the same chicken we had for lunch for dinner with a different sauce after sitting out all day, same with fish.Next day had cantaloupe for breakfast and very sick with food poisoning.Bring your own food if you can.
Very good experience!. Day Trip Safari ,accommodations, and meals were very good. The guide was very good at his job in every aspect.

Big 5!. From the moment we got there, till the minute we left we had the most amazing time. We were lucky enough to see all of the big 5. The food was delicious and the rooms were beautiful. The buffalo was standing almost outside of our door the morning we woke up(on the other side of the fence) but wow! What an experience. The staff were all very friendly. Can't wait to go visit again! Thank you everybody at Aquila! <3 Hope you can keep the Rino's safe xoxo

Cooks tour of Africa. With limited time and a need to steer clear of any Malaria prone areas, Aquila offered the perfect solution to give my elderly parents a Taste of African wild life . Our guide , Mike was knowledgeable and he imparted this knowledge with humour and friendliness. He was a real pro ! Aquila though of every "creature " comfort from blankets to rain poncho's drinks and snacks. The Family luxury unit served our purposes well with comfortable beds, crisp quality linen and a bath to die for . Come hungry for knowledge and food- the buffet meals were superb . You will not be disappointed

Not As Advertised.... I have trouble deciding how to rate this...First of all, we had been booked with a confirmed reservation with Inverndoorn. The night before we were supposed to go on the Inverndoorn day safari, I discovered (at 20:00) they had emailed me (after we left the states), that my reservation was no good due to a system error and that they had no room for us. We were to drive ourselves; what if we found this out after the 2.5 hr drive there?!?We got in touch with Aquila as an alternate and had less than an hour to make our decision, but they did have room in the afternoon tour. It was more expensive than Inverndoorn, but they had room, so we booked it after hours.We did the beautiful, easy drive ourselves from Cape Town to Aquila, and it took almost 2.5 hours due to traffic and back ups from road construction. Glad we allowed extra time!Upon arrival, we were greeted with a glass of sparkling wine, juice or water...nice!They did not show my reservation at any of the check ins, but I paid and they accommodated us. Lunch buffet was served before we left for safari drive. Other than being warm in the food room (I was a bit concerned with mayonaise based foods!), the selections were varied and we all had plenty to eat and new dishes to try. I loved the beaded animal heads as decorations throughout the lodge.When it came time for the safari, we were the first in line, were directed to a specific truck, and found our seats. The second truck available, did not fill, but left before us by about 10 mins. with about 6 passengers...not sure what the story was there, since we had arrived first.Upon entering the reserve, we noticed 2 giraffe not far off (close enough for a picture!), but our driver flew past them as if they weren't there. He briefly slowed near some mostly hidden buffalo, but didn't venture to get a better view of them. We sped on to where 2 elephants roamed, and we started snapping pictures from afar figuring that might be all we get of them, the way the tour is going so far! We DID get a better, very upclose view of them, as another little truck was carting a bale of hay to entice them closer. When the little truck left, the elephants came right up to ours to look for the hay and when they realized it wasn't there, they left to follow the other truck with the hay. Not quite the "wild" experience I was looking for.We got a good view and photo opp of the lions within their pen area; stopped for a 20 min. sparkling wine stop with no working toilets; saw rhino, springbok, ?kudu?. Some of us noticed ostrich and some hippos, but neither were stopped for. Cheetah were in a relatively small pen across the road. Never saw leopard or zebra.Our driver raced back and was parked at least 5 mins before that other truck. Everything on our tour seemed rushed except the 20 min. champagne break that could have been offered at the end of the tour or not at all. We came to see animals in their relatively natural surrounds, not to have a wine break.On the other hand, at least we got to see some of the animals, and our kids enjoyed the experience. Even though this wasn't cheap, we didn't have time or money to do a "real" safari so, Better something than nothing?

Overnight Safari. Accommodation . room was clean, no shower cap supplied,bed pillow was very flat. Meals were very disappointing, poor quality food and definitely no African dinner experienced (Boma not used). Don't understand why buffet meals at dinner for app 20 diners? Dinning staff seemed very unhappy, and were not attentive to guests. Curio Shop: I was not able to purchase Panado for my husband whom arrived with a headache?Game drives were excellent and our ranger was fantastic (Marco).

Wonderful experience. We took our children who live in Germany, who have a three year old. What a wonderful way to experience the Big Five. To see this through the eyes of a child was wonderful.
