Our game ranger was fantastic, making a special fuss of my grandchild. We will always treasure these special memories.

Absolutely amazing trip. I stayed at Aquila for 1 night on the 20th March. We arranged for Aquilas transport from our hotel in Cape Town, when we arrived at the game reserve I was blown away. The whole reserve is beautiful the staff were fantastic. We managed to see all the animals on both our game drives. The champagne and snack stop was a night added treat. Would defiantly visit again and recommend to all my friends and family.

Amazing Safari stay close to CapeTown. Only a 2 hour trip away from Cape Town, this is a must visit attraction. We stayed one night and had 2 safari trips. We got to see all of the Big Five in one visit. The safari guides were amazing. Such a amazing relaxed atmosphere - can't wait to go back
Family holiday. This was a great place to go when time is limited and you want children and youth to see African animals. I especially liked the rescue area for cheetahs and leopards!

A nice break from the hectic world. Very nice lodge, friendly people, helpful, good lunch, dinner and breakfast, very nice setting, great swimming pool. Safari late afternoon was great, but the short safari next morning was a bit disappointing. The reserve needs more animals. The pick up service was very good.

Aquila Private Game Reserve. Thank you for a fantastic time. The staff were excellent and the accommodation was outstanding. I could and would have loved to have stayed for a week and will recommond your reserve to everyone possible. I would like to say Thank You for an amazing night stay and wish you all the best.

Champagne breakfast!!!. went from Cape Town, picked up from the hotel,it was quite a way, so early start, tour stated no breakfast, so I had a packed one arranged,we had a bathroom stop on the way, when we arrived I was mega amazed, we were treated with chanoagne(and orange juice for those who didn't drink), on top of that there was a huge self service buffet provided!5 star, for that alone!We were then take. Round the park by jeep, great if your only there ew days, and wanted a day safari, as you coulnt get to any others, well worth a visit,and for the kids if all ages

Wonderful place to be. This was a magical way to start my trip in SA. Never been to Africa so seeing this place was quite an experience. You arrive at this place which is quite far away from the main city of Capetown and you immediately feel that the long drive was worthy. The infrastructure is interesting. Little huts all around with views to the reserve. Extremely peaceful and really very well done. A little bit run down but it looks intentional to keep in with nature. The rooms are very cute wooden huts with double bed equipped, a wardrobe and a counter. Please note there are no phones in the room to call reception (naturesque I guess - tad annoying if you notice you need something). The rooms have both aircons and fire place to accommodate the time of year you are here and its temperatures. Every huts also has a small front yard with a low table and chairs which is lovely in the morning or night to just relax and soak up the environment. The bathroom has a tub indoor with the usual sink and toilet. There is also an outdoor standing shower which you may enjoy if its not too cold. Really cool! I did two game drives: one in the evening, and one the following morning at sunrise. Great experience. As it is a reserve you feel safe but you dont actually see the enclosure that much. It doesnt feel like a zoo and thus feels almost like a real safari experience without the fear. The guy we had who took us out was extremely friendly and very keen to show us as much as possible. He will talk to you about the animals and their history on how they got here and their individual story. But he is not overly chatty either which means you can also just be in the moment. The animals look healthy and well treated. They seem looked after and protected. They aren't posing for you like in a zoo. In fact some of them are hard to find and see. They have everything: spring bok, hippos, giraffes, rhinos, zebras, elephants, plenty more but those are the highlights I can think of right now. The food in the restaurant is good and service decent. One down side is that at night (after 9pm) there is no more receptionist so you can only get in touch with them after midnight. Also, the little shop they have does not sell what most 'hotels' would have. Don't forget your toothbrush or snacks as they don't provide any! The staff did their best to help though and that made up for it by a mile. All in all an amazing experience which I highly recommend.

Safari with overnight stay good value. We felt this was good value and appeared to be an ethical company with no frills but the accommodation was lovely for the price, I would say 4-star and there is a beautiful bar area with interesting books. It's difficult for Safaris not to be a bit 'contrived' especially being so close to Capetown but this was a good taster and overall we had a very enjoyable time. Lovely staff. Food was fine. Lovely relaxed pool, shame about building work overhead but guess it has to be done some time!

Nice horseback ride only. We took the horseback day trip safari..and that was the only highlight. Unfortunately we never saw the elephants and giraffes ..and we were at a safe distance away from the animals we did manage to see, compared to the game drive ,which got close up to the animals. So I would definitely suggest a game drive if you want to get close and taking pics will also be much better. I thoroughly enjoyed the horseride but I think Kruger would be a better bet for a real safari experience.

Guide dependant. As a complete package Aquila Game Reserve is rather good. The rooms are well kept, the dining area and food are really good and I lightheartedly asked for Bobotie for dinner and it was served to me. Can't fault that. Reception was excellent.Our let down however was the drive. At the time of our visit only two vehicles were needed and so only two guides. We were unfortunate to have the same guide for our afternoon and morning guide. We firstly were driven past obvious animals and not able to take photos as he rushed. When another member of the vehicle asked him to stop for photos of an animal that he didn't even see he ignored the request. I was very disappointed for my in laws as I had painted such a glorious picture for them based on my previous visit in 2009. Even the gift shop had a poor offering of stock. Farie Glenn next time.

Aquila Game Reserve Visit. It was pretty good. It was what we expected.....hardly the Kruger, but we enjoyed it. Got very close to the lions & Rhinos & the guide was excellent. Food was OK & staff helpful.

a wild life adventure. We very much enjoyed our stay at Aquila and our trips into the reservation to see the wild life that is there. The guides are extremely helpful and accommodating, particularly as we were interested in seeing some of the bird life that lives in or visits the reserve. also seeing the animals feeding early in the morning and before sunset was thrilling. We highly recommend a stay at Aquila

Aquila game reserve. Had a very enjoyable overnight stay. Luxury lodge was just that although the very creaky floorboard were a little off putting in the night. Showering outside was an unusual experience - but in a good way. We did see The Big Five up close and were able to take wonderful photos. All the staff were attentive for the most part although one of the waitresses appeared undertrained. All in all a good experience.

well worth a visit. We did the overnight stay which included an afternoon and early morning game drive ,lunch, dinner and breakfast. We thought the whole experience was first class, the food was very good and plentiful drinks fairly priced but most importantly the drives were great fun. Our guide Michael was really informative and we got to see all the animals. Yes it is a little manufactured but it made for two really good drives. Overall it was a great experience and we felt it was excellent value.

Great experience. Totally worth the money. The Safari Guides do their utmost to ensure you see as many animals as possible. We did the overnight stay and were totally happy with our experience. The food was great and staff friendly and helpful. We thought the accommodation was tops and would highly recommend this experience.

Adequate at best. even with the exchange rate this is far over priced. It's really a drive thru zoo with less animals. And no u do not see the animals in their natural habitat. This is not the plains of Africa, it's a man made pen. But u do get to see the big 5 and to some that is all that matters. If u can't get to Kruger or Kenya this will do but it should be cheaper.

Had a great time here.. Had a great lunch here overlooking the pool and safari area. Sure its a bit like a massive zoo with the animals fairly easy to locate but you do get the safari experience. The routine was well organised and arrival was easy. I drove from Cape Town for an afternoon Safari without too much trouble however some roadworks added about 30 mins to the drive. There was spectacular scenery on the way there also.
Excellent big 5 safari. Great safari, great accomodation, ok food and average bar service. Well worth the visit. One meter from 7 lions...

Great day out. Me and a friend went to Aquila on a day trip. We were greeted with a welcome drink and a buffet breakfast. We really enjoyed the food and were pleased with the variety. The drive itself lasted for just over 2 and a half hours. We had a great view of some of the animals, unfortunately the lions were just too far away but you could make them out. Our guide had loads of information and was very humerous as well, unfortunately forgot his name. If you go in expecting a wild safari you are going to be disappointed. Reading some of the reviews on here it sounds like some people had set their expectations too high. We knew it was a game reserve, there would be visible fences and you'd see cars driving about outside. But it was still a great experience. Ive seen some reviews from people saying the animals didn't do much, its hot and they generally do just sit around most of the day. So we were pleased with what we saw.We were really impressed with the breakfast buffet but unfortunately the lunch buffet wasn't as great but still okay. You also have to pay for drinks.You have access to the pool and other areas which was nice. The shop was nice but quite small and pricey.Overall great day.
2 days in the Karoo. A great location for a short stay, very welcoming staff and sufficient variation in game drives to keep the interest going.Also a good place with nice facilties to relax
Relaxation!. Had a lovely overnight stay taking in two game drives. The driver was friendly and fun. Food was good and accommodation comfortable. Enjoyed our stay and will come again!
Fabulous Aquila. The game reserve and quality of service were beyond my every expectation. I had an amazing time and the managers Anton and Linet were fabulous! Cannot recommend enough!

Very special occasion. I wanted something special to celebrate my 50th birthday, and after much research, decided on Aquila. From check-in with complimentary drinks on arrival, our stay was enjoyed with lots of special attention to detail. The most awesome safari trips in the afternoon and again early next morning, was met with up-close and personal attention from Klaas, our guide, as well as the animals encountered. Great treat stopping for a glass of bubbly and snacks on the afternoon safari - in the company of two great giraffes. Meals were superb and accommodation was great. Some of the waitresses could do with a bit more training, but nothing to spoil the all-inclusive meals. Overall - a memorable occasion I won't forget.

No no no........ OK, we knew it's not going to be a REAL, wild safari trip. As we didn't have the time for a week out there in real African safari, we went for what we thought - based on Tripadvisor's feedback - a decent look-alike mini safari day. Well, we were wrong.So, easily the best part of the day was happening 5 seconds before the 'safari' trip ended, as we were about to cross the gate back into the lodge territory - at this very moment a somewhat sleepy African Buffalo (I think...) got pissed off and was a bit stressed as our truck stopped behind him, got on his feet and ran straight away toward the side of the vehicle and rammed it twice before our driver managed to accelerate. Again, despite the screams of some overly exited people, this was the VERY best of the show on that day...Until that minute, we've seen approximately 2 elephants, 5 exhausted rhinos, 5 sleepy lions looking for a piece of shade, 2 giraffes on the horizon, a bunch of zebras, 4 ostriches, even less monkeys and a few other animals. It was a very hot day, so maybe this added to the drabness of all the animals we've seen that day, but I've visited several zoo locations in the past AND in even hotter days, animals looked a bit 'happier' compared to those in Aquila. A suggestion to Aquila Private Game Reserve managers: ask your driver's to be more engaging on the 2.5h drive from/to Cape Town - the only explanation we (all tourists!) got on the way was that's we're passing next to a shopping mall on the outskirts of the city...!?! hello?? maybe some more useful/informative/interesting information, please?

Big Five (rather four) safari. My brother and I recently visited Aquila Safari and weren't impressed. Having been to one of the other nearby safari game reserves, I thought I knew what to expect. Sadly my expectations weren't met and we felt the park failed on more parametres.We weren't greeted by the staff and generally it all seemed a bit superficial. The Reserve is situated less than 1 km away from a busy highway (N1) which makes the remoteness-feeling disappear right away.The safaris are carried out in busses rather than jeeps/4x4's and the guide should slow down a bit. Too few proper explanations about the individual animals and it was generally too brief. We did like seeing the rhinos and elephants though, which were nicely responsive and lively. The elephants were in fact very affectionate with oneanother. Biggest disappointment (and read this well now) we did not see the lions! Basically the lions enclosure is a rather small,hilly, mountain terrain "cage" where there is only one main path to drive at. This means that the likelyhood of getting close up with the lions in this reserve is really small. The lions hid on the mountain side and the guide did his best to persuade us, the we could actually see the head of the lion male in between the rocks, but neither of us had eyes that good. I'm guessing we were 150-200 metres away (as opposed to my prev experience with a closeup encounter of 5-10 m)I would not recommend this game safari and I can guarantee there are better alternatives close by. Oh and yes, Aquila say there are less than 2 hours away from. Cape Town. Good luck to reach there in less than 2.5-3 hours.

A Great Experience . Two and half hour coach tripfrom central Cape Town . Aquila Private Game Reserve sits in the edge of the southern Karoo. Lovely location with a very nice main house/lodge serving very good food. There are individual lodges available to rent for overnight stays . You can go horse riding or take a quad bike trip. But the highlight is a Game Drive in 12 seater open sided buses . Rhino, elephants, giraffes, rhino , ostrich, Impala ,lions can be seen wandering about . Great photo opportunities for everyone. Highly recommend a visit .

One big Feast. We stayed 2 days, because of the birthday of my cousin. Aquila did a great job: a very nice birthday present, a birthday cake and a beautiful birthday song from the staff. Top!The safari was OK, the horse ride was perfect. One thing was not OK. They were building a new building and a drain. This makes very much noise and made our stay around the swimming pool impossible. I will write this also to the Marketing manager, because of this a discount of 15 to 20% should be appropriate...

What a treat. Firstly I have to say that after booking Aquila and then reading some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor I was mildly concerned. Please, please, please if you read this understand this is not the Masi Mara or Kruger. What you get is a taste of a safari experience within easy travelling of Cape Town that delivers on all levels. We booked a one night stay and transfers and had an exceptional time and I would have no quams recommending this venue to anyone. Transfers were seamless and trouble free, the staff friendly and attentive and the lodge we stayed in was clean with everything you would want in a stay at an isolated reserve area. And that's the point, it's not 5 star hotel luxury, it's a chance to stay close to the animals and in the calming isolation that comes with its location. If you want animals, a casino and every facility known to man then visit Las Vegas !! Aquila gave us everything we hoped for in a game safari experience, lions, elephants, hippo's, rhino's and many more. Our guide Yanni was informative and did everything he could to ensure everyone saw what they wanted on our two drives. His passion for the wildlife was clear to see and no question was unanswered. The facilities in the evening and when you are not out in the reserve are excellent, a great pool, good bars, very tasty and varied food and a night sky unblemished by light pollution that I will always remember. Thank you Aquila, we had a great time and I wanted to try to put the record straight. Please visit if you want a wildlife experience that I guarantee you will always remember. It does what it says in the brochure so understand that before you book and you will not be disappointed.

Can be Better. For a private safari lodge and considerably high price, I would have expected more animals and not just 2 elephants, 3 girrafes and about 10 lions. Although they do have quite a few rhinocerous and hippos, springboks, handful of buffaloes.Becuase they are also accepting day tours for tourists coming from capetown, arriving at about 1pm - 2pm is a mad house at the reception counter. Too crowded and the game drive which was about 2.5 hours included a surprise stop with champagne and snacks. it was a nice gesture although we think its becuase there isnt too much to see over there.Staff were helpful and polite which is the positive side of the safari. Meals are buffet-style and were ok. The lodges are great, the swimming pool is a bonus

Aquila. We found Aquila very beautiful and relaxing. We loved seeing the Big Five and the fact that there are rescue and community projects. The staff were quite attentive and friendly but could be be more clued up on technology. The roads were bad and, although the food was good, it could do with more variety from day to day. One needs walking shoes, a camera, suntan lotion and a hat, if you wear hats. We were there on Friday and Saturday night and enjoyed four game drives. It was very peaceful and relaxing.

Enjoyable, but disorganised..... Our stay was lovely and my family did enjoy it, however I have to point out some failures sadly. I was coming to Aquila with my 3 year old daughter and family from England. I specifically checked the schedule with your staff on numerous times, even arranging for dinner to be made available at 5pm for my daughter. I was told repeatedly this wasn't a problem, that my daughter could eat dinner early after our game drive (which was scheduled for 3-5pm) and that a note was made on my booking and reception would be aware. Upon our arrival reception had no idea what I was talking about, no note had been made of my request as promised. Reception then informed me that i'd been repeatedly sent the WRONG schedule, and that the game drive wasn't until 4pm and we would only return at 7pm, this obviously was quite a concern as not only was it considerably past my daughters meal time, but also her routined bed time. The person dealing with our check in wasn't overly helpful, couldn't suggest an alternative and had to ask a colleague for help, I then asked if a food parcel could perhaps be made up for my daughter, I was told to just take extra "bits" from lunch! Not ideal, how on earth can you take a meal on a 2-3 hours game drive in 30 degrees temperatures. It seemed nothing else could be done so I had no other alternative than to do this...thankfully someone gave me a plastic, albeit broken, container to put some items in. This wasn't the start I had wanted for our stay and was one I had tried to avoid by various emails and phone calls checking and rechecking everything, it was hugely disappointing I have to say.On a separate point, we were sitting at the back of the truck and sadly could hardly hear our guide, perhaps moving forward Aquila need to look at getting your rangers mics/speakers in the trucks to rectify this... I also feel it was rather poor that on the second early (6am) game drive no blankets were provided/offered. Someone brought them out just before we left but never handed them out or placed any on the truck....everyone was absolutely freezing, even being dressed warmly. Finally my parents were staying in lodge 25, the 2 person cottage, and whilst they thought the cottage was kitted out lovely and was pleasant the lighting walking back to their lodge in the evening was almost non existent and rather dangerous, I don't know whether this was an issue purely that evening or whether there simply isn't enough lighting but either way was quite dangerous.

Very disappointing bordering on fraud.. We booked a day game drive to give our visitors a taste of an African safari. It was expensive and very very poor value. The welcoming drink was a dreadful cheap glass of luke warm carbonated white wine - undrinkable. The inclusive buffet lunch was acceptable food but the restaurant was grubby and very tired. The game drive was pathetic. We were herded onto a clapped-out truck and driven around in circles in an attempt to make us think it was a large reserve. The animals were few and far between but clearly used to the poor tourists dragged around their enclosure to photograph them. The drive was about 30 minutes worth squeezed into 2 and a half hours. The ranger did his best to inject some interest but even he seemed to lose the will to live by the time we thankfully lumbered our way out of the park. We did not see lions or leopards apart from a few sick ones kept in a small enclosure near the BOMA.Overall, it was a poor experience and left us feeling cheated. Save your money and go to the zoo or save up your money and go on a real safari!

Excellent experience and value for money. Aquila private game reserve was a great experience. My wife and I were visiting Cape Town and had a day spare. We were able to drive to the reserve (check the location as it's not in Ceres) and we were welcomed with a drink upon arrival. The food was ample and the lodge has a lovely clean swimming pool located right in front. The safari experience was excellent and the ranger went to the effort to ensure we saw four of "The Big Five". He was knowledgeable and entertaining and we would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a safari.

Great fun. As long as your expectations are set right, this place is great. This place recommended by my cousin (a CT native) with children. For us, it was about showing the children (7 & 9) some animals on a trip which was entirely based around Capetown. Essentially it's a massive safari park with a few giraffes, a couple of elephants, hippos, ostriches, zebra galore, eland, springbok, gnu, cape buffalo, white rhino.... There's even a pride of lions kept safely separate from the rest. I was amazed at just how much wildlife they have here and the significant space in which they roam. You can focus on the negative (occasional sight of trucks charging down the road alongside the park rather shatters the otherwise complete illusion of remoteness) but why bother? Aquila does a great job efficiently processing a large volume of people. Stay overnight so you have a game drive evening and early morning. I heard them talk to day visitors who turn up for lunch then have a 1.30pm game drive. I get the feeling that if you came all this way for a just 'OK' lunch and then a game drive in the baking hot middle of the day when the animals are all hiding would be a bit of a disappointment. And to be honest, the impression of the clientele I had after lunch (people baking themselves in 1pm 30+ degree heat with beer in hand) was the least favourable and was gradually replaced by my more positive impressions of the place/the experience and the staff during the quieter late afternoon/evening and early morning. Meals are buffet style. Lunch was a very busy affair what with many day visitors and the quality of the food I think lower but still decent. Dinner also buffet but for perhaps a fifth the number of people and much better quality - very nice beef, couple of decent cheeses, etc. Wines good & inexpensive. Breakfast first rate.
Aquilla. Great safari, loved the tour guides. The accommodation was excellent, and for the most part the food was great. Staff were also very friendly.

Day Trip . Really great drive from Cape Town with superb scenery which added to the day .Aquila itself has a lovely pool and public areas that are great relaxing .Food was fine and typical buffet food .I have mixed feelings about the safari .Our guide was poor but maybe we were unlucky .It is true ,there are a few animals in pens .More like a large zoo than a safari .It was nice to see the elephant ,rhino ,giraffe ,hippo etc. We didn't get to see any lions .It is an opportunity to see animals in Africa but not sure it should be described as a safari .On that basis think it is over priced .For a family of 4 paid over £400.It is what it is but I understand why people are disappointed

Perfect for family. We loved our stay at Aquila. Beautiful reserve and lovely, comfortable accomodations. The kids were in heaven! Loved how close and easy this Safari experience was. Only annoying part was that it was crowded and the buses felt like buses. After experiencing reserves in PE and Kruger this felt fake or Disney World ish. Wish It wasn't so overcrowded but all in all we lived our time there.

Fabulous. My partner and I stayed here for two nights and we had one of the luxury/premier cottages set on the hill on there own. Firstly the welcome that we received was very warm. The cottage was beautiful - it was quirky and fun, the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was gorgeous - very special and we both loved the outdoor shower!! The game drive was good and we got to see all the animals - we decided to do the quad bike safari the next day and this was absolutely fabulous!! You also get three meals a day ..all I can say is I was counting down the time until meal times. What a selection of food and desserts!!!! This really is a special place and a great taster into what a real safari is like! We both can't wait to go back in a few years time!!

Aquila Overnight Stay. We had a wonderful time at Aquila. We wanted somewhere near Capetown and only had time for an overnight stay. The place and facilities were great with a fantastic swimming pool and delicious buffet lunch dinner and breakfast. We had two outings to see animals. We were very happy with our stay and would recommend. this is for people who want the feel of a safari without spending 3 nights at Kruger or similar.

Aquila 21 Feb 2015. Always an enjoyable experience, this being my second visit.Our tour guide on the game drives, Marco, was very knowledgeable and also went the extra mile. When my white jacket got stained with wet varnish from railings at the Rehab centre, Marco took it to laundry and they returned it in a couple of hours looking like new.Only item of concern - no generator. We were rushed out of the dining room by staff after dinner on Sat.night, due to a pending power outage (which did not happen). A 4 star establishment such as yours should definitely have a back up generator at least for your dining room and bar.
Review. Reception good, accommodation comfortable and clean, food average, game drives - ranger did not speak good English but very amenable, too few animals and could not find the giraffe.

Terrible. Poor communication while booking with reception, so our party was late. Very Bad service in general, average buffet, poor looking animals, lions have no shade just a small rock , not recommended at all! Very sad!

An Excellent Day Out. Recommended by our hotel we booked with Aquila and were asked to be in reception for pick up at 5.45am as it is over two hour drive - over an hour later we were still waiting - no phone call - we had to chase the park. Once there champagne is offered on arrival and after check in breakfast -Wefelt like we were on a conveyor belt ! For the Game drive we were with just five others which was great for moving about to take photos - the guide was very informative and we saw all the animals (despite being told we may not we had the destinct impression that that the guide know exactly where to look as the trucks follow each other round the tracks) After a buffet lunch which does not include a drink, in large characterless hall we were given an hour to relax by pool or wander grounds before being driven back to City. Did we enjoy it - yes - would we do it again - probably not.

Safari ok but that's about it!. You'll see the animals which is the main thing. It's more like a safari park than safari itself, but you'll expect that if you booked it. 2 hours away from Cape Town and a nice drive - you may see Baboons along the way. Food leaves a lot to be desired. I've read the reviews saying food was good, but I can't see what on their extensive buffet was good - maybe the toast in the morning! We stayed overnight and the room was nothing like what we expected or as they described. They provide repellent which is nice of them as its needed! I'm sure their lunch or dinner caused me a stomach ache and when I went to ask for some medicine, the lady said I wasn't the first to have asked that morning. Overall, I'd do the day safari without staying there.

Benidorm Safari. Never again. We went with guests from the UK and were told this would be convenient safari option and an experience to remember. It was for all the wrong reasons and our guests made the decision to cut their stay short. The game drives were the best part of the stay, but even then the game was limited. The rest was below average - accommodation to the food - rack stack and pack with the day visitor swarms from morning to night. We have done many safari's and this rates as the worst.

wrong reservation info. since we had various safaris / game drives at other place in South Africa we have to clearly state that the experience was negative for us; we booked four private game drives, but we did not receive during booking the info that this is too much, as with a two hour drive the entire game reserve has been covered

First taste of a family safari. Was handed a flyer down at the waterfront and it looked interesting.We were aware that staying around Cape Town you are no where near where real full on safaris take place.But we thought it would be a good day out and as close as we could get to it on our holiday .It is a good two hour drive from Cape Town but we believe well worth it.It was my wifes highlight with many good experiences over a holiday we really enjoyed.It is worth the expense and a great way to see an excellent range of animals from lions to hippos.The guide was friendly,funny and very knoweldgeable and did his very best to get us as close as possible to all the animals.You have to respect that there are no guarantees what you will see on any given day but we saw everything we were hoping to see.I am no expert but i would imagine it is as close as you can get to a proper safari you can get without the major expense.I would definatly recommend to anybody that his sort of day out appeals to.Very good day out VERY ENJOYABLEBreakfast and lunch is provided with sparkling wine on the safari !

Amazing. I really appreciated to be in Aquila Safari.I was there an overnight event. Although the summer, it was important to bring a jacket, because in the evening, the temperature is little bit cold. Besides cameras and Iphones, you can't forget the plug for your devices, because the switch is totaly different from other countries. Enjoy it.

Disappointed. I have to say i was pretty much disappointed with this experience and i cannot understand all of the raving reviews. Maybe i was unlucky to have a bad day there. The facilities are really pretty but the game reserve was the same as the visit to the zoo for me, just much, much more expensive. We booked the horse riding tour that suppose to last something like 2 hours. We were waiting for our horses to be ready for more than 1h and then rode after our guide into the reserve. We made one circle around the reserve, not even stopping properly to make pictures and finished our ride in about 30 min, without seeing most of the animals - we only passed few giraffes, zebras and rhinos from a distance. Afterwards we were taken in some kind of 'zoo' to see one cheetah and 2 crocodiles. Not impressed at all with this experience, i felt kind of tricked. The reserve is small and it's obvious this is not a real wilderness, it's more like a zoo where all the animals are behind the same fence. The good aspects are the little hotel is really lovely, with very nice outdoor swimming pools and grass to lay around, and the food served was very good.

Aquila. Average accommodation. Stayed after this trip at a 3 star hotel in Stellenbosch with more in the room and more luxury than at Aquila. The price does not justify the accommodation. Food was fantastic. Game drives were good, but not all drivers were wearing the correct clothes - some were wearing torn t-shirts. Does not look professional. Jannie, our ranger were excellent.

Breathtaking. I am an animal lover so the number one thing on my list to do in South Africa was a safari. Cape Town is not the best place for safaris but after doing our research we found Aquila to be our best bet. It was fantastic. Our guide Tyler might be the best tour guide I have ever had. He was so knowledgeable about the animals and the reserve. He shared information about the animals behavior, diet, environment. It was fascinating. I was interested the entire drive. One our first drive we saw Buffalo, Hippos, Elephants, Springbok, Antelope, White Rhino, Giraffe, Lions...Tyler was great about getting close to the animals so that you could get great pictures but still respecting the animals and their habitats. As far as the hotel goes, the cottages were very cute. Mine wasn't very clean but my friends place was. The food was a delicious buffet with lots of options. You were greater with a welcome drink and refreshments on the first game drive. Nice pool...cold but refreshing when the sun is out. My only complaint would have to be the transport. It is quite expensive and the first van was a very right fit. They were very late picking us up and I was headed to the airport which made for a stressful end of the trip. I did however make it to the airport on time and the reception staff was very kind.
Great trip. Not done any safaris before but this was a brilliant little taster close to Cape town.saw loads of animals.great food.great vibe.definitely recommended

Must-Do in CPT. This was my first safari experience and was great for a first timer. We saw pretty much all of the animals except for the lions. The food (hot buffet for both breakfast and lunch) was also unexpectedly very good. Highly recommend this day trip activity. I wouldn't spend more than one day here though as i have heard that Chobe National Park in Botswana is better for 2-3 day trips.

Family Safari at Aquila Private Game Reserve. From start to finish the staff, communication and operation of the trip was first class. The accommodation was clean, fresh and fulfilled our budgetary needs.

Excellent time as always at Aquila Private Game Reserve. Thank you Aquila for an awesome experience. You guys went over and above to make our stay wonderful and enjoyable. Not only was it Valentines day but my 40th birthday also and I couldn't have spent my birthday and a better place. This was our 3rd time at Aquila and we'll definatley be back again.
perfect for a day-trip for close encounters with the big 5!. very nice wildlife experience and close encounters on a quite large terrain with wild animals, perfect for a daytrip

Amazing adventure - Johann was an excellent ranger. This was my first safari experience and won't be my last.
Outside shower was first for me too - so refreshing.
Wonderful drives both in the evening and the morning, lots of beautiful scenery and to get that close to all the animals, especially lions was just 'wow'.

Great safari and accommodation. Very nice reserve and accommodation. Stunning view and sounds at night!! Very nice staff and passionated guide! It worths it to stay overnight to do the early morning safari. For parents with young children there is a babysitter available (not included in the fee) and a very nice children playground as the safari can be a bit long for babies and toddlers.

dream safari. warm welcome by staff / the location is a dream, we loved our cottage and the shower outside. Lunch, Dinner and Breakfast riche and delight. Staff very friendly and helpfull. Our guide on both safaris told us so many things of interest about the big five and he gave us enough time to take pictures. Next morning we could watch the elephants from the restaurant. Our comment. WAW

Aquila. Aquila is a fantastic private reserve not far from Cape Town. In fact one of the few places near to Cape Town where one can see wild animals in nature. A lovely resort with good facilities, game drives etc. Very expensive for South Africans though but for those with foreign currency less of anissue unless you are on a tight budget. Worth a visit.

Game reserve visit. The staff were very helpful.The chalet was a splendid experience Showering in the open air ! very clean Our guide was excellent Food was average this is however a zoo not what I expezted from a game reserve One day and night was sufficient

A FEW UNPLEASANT EXPERIENCES. We decided to take our visiting Australian family to Aquila. We booked 2 rooms for 24th & 25th January 2015, Only one room was available at check-in time (14H00) and we were made to wait in the one room until 15h30 before the other room became available. At no stage did anyone communicate to us that the other room was ready, we had to discover that ourselvesShower water supply stopped midway during a shower at 22h30 in one of our rooms.We found soiled linen sheets on the king size bed in one of our rooms. It appeared to be faeces marks and blood stains. this was at about 23h30 and there was no one from housekeeping to attend to the problem.We reported our experiences to the Front of House Manager the next morning and was advised to send an email to the relevant person at the Aquila H/O. We were informed that an investigation would be done and feedback would be provided the following week. Three weeks have now passed and we have still not received the promised feedback nor any apology.We were able to see the big 5.Descent facilities for the kids.Staff at reception and in the restaurant were friendly.Food was enjoyable.

Aquila Game Reserve. We were extremely fortunate to spend a day/night at Aquila. The friendly staff, wonderful food, good accommodation and our very knowledgeable and entertaining tour guide, made our stay very special.Lindsay - Cape Town
Great park but amenities lacked. Loved the quadbike tour through the gamepark however didn't love the food and the accommodations were mediocre. Still worth the trip.

rating of our stay. Overall it was very pleasant.Staff were friendly and helpfull.Our chalet needs a little attention eg tap at basin loose,outside bathroom door,room not serviced with coffee etc everyday,outside ground light broken etc

Wonderful weekend at Aquilla. Myself and 2 friends went to Aquilla on the overnight safari and wasn't disappointed, the views were breath taking, our guide Daniel was amazing and very knowledgeable, we saw all the Big Five plus more and we came so close the lion pride it was at times scary!! the food is amazing also! Well worth it x
Fantastic. Thank you Aquila for a unforgettable visit. We would highly recommend it to anyone who would like to do a safari. The service was great as well as the food & accommodation.

Overpriced!!. Pros* Saw the big 5, and other animals - bonus! * Game drive ranger was friendly and knowledgable * We stopped for an unexpected glass of sparkling wine during the game drive - nice touch! * Nice swimming pool areaCons* Unfriendly and unhelpful staff* To describe the accommodation as luxury is a real stretch* Rooms are very dark and lack basic amenities * The buffet food is horrendous (breakfast, lunch & dinner)* Even in the height of summer the pools were freezing* Pool bar was never open

Aquila Lodge. Beautiful Setting , lovely pool and authentic lodges. This was perfect for us, who wanted to see the big five in a natural setting close to Cape Town. The drive up is amazing and only takes just over 2 hours. You get right up close to the animals so you get nice photos to take back home even with a Smart Phone.

great stay at Aquila. We had booked overnight stay at the Game park with an afternoon drive then an early morning drive We where welcomed to the park by a lovely lady offering us a glass of Fizz as soon as we arrived Then after a nice buffet lunch shown to our little cottage which was lovely Clean and looked out over the reserve where we could see buffalo and 2 elephants Great start The Drive was taken by a great driver who was very talkative and informative about all the animals we saw He took the time to go back and see things that we didn't see straight away . The grounds where very well laid out with a nice pool to sit round Only one problem They where having some building work done and that did get a bit loud when we sat there But overall a very good trip

Great way to see the Big 5. The location of Aquila is stunning and the guide who's name escapes me was so knowledgeable and had a real passion for the animals. It was amazing to see the animals and also know that Aquila are helping with Rhino conservation and sheltering poor animals that have been bred for canned hunting. The only downside for me would be the food that was served in the large canteen style restaurant. We had a problem with our shower in our lodge and they moved us immediately and the staff were so apologetic they couldn't do enough for us.

Much better than expected. After having been to safaris in large national parks, I must admit I was a bit hesitant to these day trip safaris promising the big 5 on a plate. But I can highly recommend Aquila for you who don't have so much time or don't fancy bouncing around in a jeep for several days.The staff was very professional and the Rangers knowledge about the animals made it very interesting.And also, halfway through the game drive we made a pit stop where sparkling wine was served. Quite an amazing feeling to have some bubbly while watching zebras, rhinos and springboks in the middle of nowhere.

Unforgettable experience .... They're no words to describe the staying at Aquila: breathtaking location, great staff: always friendly and polite. Amazing cottages, great food ... and two absolutely great game rides!!! One of the best experience in my life!!!
Defo worth the short trip. Great way to break up a Cape Town holiday and see the big 5. Accommodation is great and the drives compact and fun. Food good also.

Big 5 swindle. Together with a group 10 USA visitors I visited this resort on 2 January 2015 . As a South African I feel that showing the big 5 in the hospital recovery section is NOT really seeing wildlife. I concede that once in the main park you could potentially see lion but you really needed imagination to see them in their caves !The rangers spoke very softly and could not be heard ! On their way back to the starting point the drivers had a race and we kicked up dust at about 50km per hour !The restaurant was excellent and the buildings attractive. But this does not justify the huge sum of money charged . R1500.00 per person . Shame on you for fleecing the overseas visitors like this !!

Excellent experience. W stayed here for 2 nights and did three of the four game drives. A really warm welcome and helpful staff. The first game drive was incredible and the much robe same the next morning. If booking again, I would probably only stay 1 night. Accommodation and facilities were excellent and the buffet restaurant had varied and good food.

Great Experience. My parents and I had a great time. It exceeded expectations, we were able to see and learn about all sorts of wildlife, relax at the pool, had great food, and a relaxing atmosphere at the bar. Would 100% recommend to any of my friends travelling to Cape Town. Our guide (I think his name was Marco) was extremely accommodating, knowledgable, and made the experience all the more enjoyable.

worth the price. The price might seem a bit steep at first but it is definitely worth it. My boyfriend and I did the combo tour - on the safari we saw all the animals up close and heard all the interesting stuff and then on the quad bikes we got to drive ourselves and have fun. These places are often geared towards tourists but as a local I still enjoyed it. Just a tip, wear old clothes on the quad bikes, it gets sandy. Also, remember to take a swim suit so you can wash off afterwards in the pool

I've been to better zoos!. Honestly, there are better zoos and Safari parks in the UK than this!When you arrive, the restaurant and surroundings are lovely, so you think it's going to be a brilliant day. But, the day gets worse from there.You're taken around in an open sided truck. We first came across two elephants and we did learn a few facts. As we were sitting by the elephants, a few springbok came by and everyone started taking photos. The guide told us not to bother taking photos because we would see loads of springbok during the day...we didn't see any for the rest of the day!We were then driven about 30 seconds to where one single giraffe was eating from a box of hay hidden behind a rock. This is when we realised this was not what we had expected. Stupidly I thought it would be a free roaming game reserve like the pilanesburg but it really wasn't.The fun bit about a game reserve is when you drive around and everyone is trying to spot the animals. None of that excitement was there because it was like the animals were fed in a specific place, and then we were just driven to where they were standing. The lions were in a cage in the middle of the reserve and they were not particularly happy to see us. There was a small boy in our group and the lions saw him as prey and were stalking and growling at him. The poor boy was terrified...I was terrified even though they were behind bars.I wouldn't recommend this game reserve. I have had better days out at The Knysna Elephant Park or Monkeyland.If you are expecting a natural environment and to go to try and spot the animals then go for a day pass at one of the big game reserves. This was a wasted day out for us!

AQUILA - far from the mdding crowd. What a refreshing experience this was for me.Although I had seen the brochure many times and thought that it was only geared toward overseas tourist, I was glad to find a very good mixture of South Africans and overseas tourists.Families with children were not distracting at all, due to the function room and pool facilities which kept everyone happy.The food was plentiful and varied.The BEST experience, I can record was with the staff - ALL THE STAFF - were exceptionally friendly and helpful and their service and attitude was not just "put on" for the customer.They had a pleasant and friendly disposition and it was a feeling of "belonging to the family " which added to the peacefulness of the establishment.I had forgotten my BINOCULARS --- please do bring your binoculars, as you can sit on the terrace, or the balcony and watch the movement of the game and of the birds. Your camera is a MUST!It was great that there were several times offered for the game drives.The weekend stay from Friday till Sunday was exceptionally good regarding driving times and activities at the Reserve.The least appealing - which did not spoil the overall visit experience - , could be mentioned as our game warden. He was jovial, and knew a lot about nature, but he seemed to be 'rattling off' the information which he was giving as though he had learnt it off by heart and was in a hurry to get to the next lot of tourists and his next game drive.The best, was the tranquillity of Nature itself, where the animals (other than the capture area) roamed quietly and naturally as though they were in the wild veld, unobserved :-)

A Well worth visit to SA's most precious asset. Visiting Aquila Game Reserve from Cape Town is really worth what one experiences there in terms of seeing South Africa's game up close, the fabulous cousiine and comfortable stay; the staff also are friendly and professional.

Great cabin - food OK. Loved our cabin/lodging, little house by itself. Missing a mirror in bathroom and bedroom. Only one in the spare room, which we were not using. Great pool.Saw all big 5, very interested and motivated guide - top mark there. The stop with sparkling wine was a nice surprise! Restaurant: The food was OK, but only OK. Staff in the restaurant a bit uninterested. Maybe because everything is paid for in advance and they have no need to make an extra effort? Summary: I will recommend Aquila, but I think you can improve.

GAME RESERVE IN THE KAROO. The Lunch was good before we went off on the Game DriveI did not think the Game Reserve was all that they advertised because I did not see any giraffes or buffalo. Although I was disappointed, I did not say anything because of the American and Dutch tourists who enjoyed the first sighting of Hippos. We saw a new born Hippo (well only his tiny head from a safe distance) and his mum (at a separate waterhole from the other hippos). I have been to many reserves in the Western Cape and most of them have Lions in enclosures because they would kill off the rest of the game. The Lions at Aquila were lying in the shade and they looked healthy. I identified an Orynx (from a distance) and we saw lots of Zebras, some Rhino and elephant/s.I am only doing this review now because:On Saturday 17 January 2015 we passed a "field" of solar panels. My son wanted to go up close but the gate was locked. He then enquired at Aquila (entrance) across the road and as it turned out it was part of their electricity project. I told him to tell them at reception that I had been on a game drive on 22 March 2014. Without confirmation of my being there, a guide was assigned to take him across (to the solar project) by vehicle at no charge. When I went to reception the gentleman said I looked familiar (because I always talk a lot?) and it was confirmed that he had attended to me on 22 March 2014.

More a zoo than a safari.. Accommodation pretty modest.It's defently no real safari. Animals are fed, otherwise it won't be possible to keep such numbers and certain species in quite a small reserve. Most species don't even belong to the Karoo region.Through the zoo atmosphere you're having a guaranteed sighting.Mass tourism with lots of of traffic and way to many guests at one. In the reserve is almost at much traffic as on the N1!Food wasn't good at all. Standard rooms a no go. Hygienic improvement mandatory.Might be good for people that stay in Cape Town and don't have experience with safarin and little stay. Otherwise I wouldn't go. If you want to have a true safari feeling try Gondwana game reserve near mossel bay!

A private initiative against nature. Being in Cape Town we felt that we should go and see some wild life.And we did. In the Aquila private game reserve.We started off seeing a half dead leopard in a cage, then 2 lions that were not suitable to be released into the " reserve" and that seemed to be convicted to prison for life. After that 2 crocodiles in a pond three times their length. It was aweful seeing all these animals suffer in the heat without any chance of parole.Then the real "reserve". A 300 hectare small animal park in a desert like environment without shade. All animals seem to rest at the same place all the time all day as we found the big five in a juffy. 6 lions, 2 elephants, 3 giraffes and 3 rhino's. And some antilopes and zebras near an artificial "lake". Thats it. Do the owners have no shame? Looking at the Aquila website you would expect some more but what we have seen there is beyond any respect for the animals. Maybe children can be fooled as they are without criticism. To please the adults, halfway the game drive ( thats how they call this farce) a glass of bubbles is served as if the owners want to prove beyond doubt that we are dealing with a fake.If you have any self respect and respect for animals then do not go there. It will save you 200 euros a couple as well.

Aquila Experience. Although a "couple" we are both in our 70s, maybe there should be a box to tick for us?.The experience was very good as we were very lucky with perfect weather. We saw most animals, except leopards. The cottage was comfortable and food excellent. Perhaps there should be an option on the website to book an extra night without game drives.

Loved our stay. We had an amazing stay The staff on the activities were fantastic so knowledgable The bar staff were extremely slow lol The food although delicious was served by staff who could beds little more friendly All that aside we would come back again Loved the place
You see it all. Good rooms for overnight, fine service, all the animals you can expect. What more do you need? Perfect visit.

Great opportunity to see the big 5. Aquila is a lovely spot approximately 2.5 hours outside Cape Town. The lodges and reserve are well maintained and the staff are very friendly. We had a buffet breakfast on arrival and headed out for a 2.5 hour trip around the reserve. The tour is a safari park approach with the animals relatively easy to spot in the lovely landscape of the reserve. This was a great opportunity for us as we had a short trip to South Africa but if you have more time available I would definitely recommend Kruger as the authentic safari experience. A good experience overall with a delicious lunch following the drive into the park.

Great option so close to Cape Town. I had been before and on safaris in Kruger but I took my boyfriend and he said it was his favourite experience on our holiday. Nice lunch too and pools are awesome- just need to have staff in the pool bar at peak times coz it's pretty awesome to have a pool bar!Wish I had done the horse riding option. We saw all the animals coz its setup in a way to do so, more than Kruger ones as in Kruger it is proper natural environment where as this is more set up for it.Our driver/ guide was excellent too

Don't be mis-guided ! Not a safari but an outdoor zoo... Ok , it was the next best thing to a safari . For those who don't want to get all kinds of shots for a proper safari . We did not see lions , and they were kept in an enclosure surrounded with electrical fence . They were fed , actually all animals were fed . Staff were very nice and the resort itself set up nicely .

Yorkshire couples. Better than expected. Staff were very helpful and attentive. Accomodation fine and comfortable. Timothy, our game ranger, made the game drive a pleasure.If you have never been to a game farm, and you are in Cape Town, Aquila is well worth a visit

Great idea for short safari near Cape Town. An amazing day and night in Aquila! Great service, rooms are very clean, food is tasty and there's a lot of choice. Nice swiming pool and lounge. I think it is not expensive for all that. You can see big five for sure. Our guide Daniel was the best - funny and professional

Aquila Game Reserve cruelty to animals. The animals are subjected to inhumane intense daytime heat with no tree cover no shaded areas. Maybe plant some trees or build a pavilion. The animals are the main attraction but it seems the reserve does not seem to concerned for their welfare. It was very hot in the afternoon and animals are in open sun all day motionless because of the heat on the dry arid open plain. The captive animals in the so called rescue shelter seem to be there only so the game reserve can claim that they have 2 crocs, 1 cheetah and 1 leopard. The captivity pens are so small it was depressing to look at. Food , accommodations, swimming pool and overall facilities are good, although paying for drinking water seemed unfair. Attraction rating would be higher if greater concern for animal welfare. I get the sense these animals are not necessarily native to this region and were transplanted for tourism, so arrangements should be made to give them some shaded shelter considering its all about the animals as to why we and other tourists were there.

definately going back. I needed some R&R and that's exactly what I got . I was went alone but there was never a dull moment. The day had enough activities to keep me entertained . The food was great , the room was clean and comfortable . the views were post card worthy I'm definately coming back with a friend next time around .

Staff still has a lot to learn. We have visited Aquila early January '15. The reception was rather unfriendly. No concrete information was given by the people at the reception despite the fact that I assume that they receive similar questions day after day. Why not a simple handout about programm and times? This would really be helpful for Aquila's customers and give the employees the opportunity to give friendly service (especially at the front desk). And friendlyness is something they really should teach the entire team, as this is mostly lacking. With exception of the team this gives the safari tours. this was really good and informative! Thank you Tyler.
Beautiful stay, great food, relaxing.. Great place to guarantee seeing the big 5. Food was excellent. Pool and relaxation area was very nice! Rooms were great, clean, beautiful, comfortable.

Fantastic overnight experience!. Having read the previous reviews, I was a little scared of what we would be experiencing. I have done the big safari parks in Kenya, Tanzania, Zambia and Zimbabwe so am aware of the difference between Aquila and those; however, I thought Aquila do what they do very well. We did the one night stay which, in my opinion, is more than enough.I was brining my boyfriend along who had never had a proper African Safari experience and had never seen wild animals up close before and he absolutely loved it. For some of the people who have no previous experience of the true game parks (where you could go for 6 nights and never see a single one of the big cats) this at least ensures you will see every single one of the big 5 albeit in smaller quantity and not necessarily together. If your aim is to see them roaming around the bush and hunting, this is probably not the experience for you and you would be better off spending a little extra and stopping off at Kruger or Maasai Mara or even Nakuru.Onto the main review now! The food was absolutely excellent! The buffet was great, tons of variety which was lovely. The lodges (we stayed in 15 & 16) were great with a lovely outdoor shower and a separate bathtub in each room. Be aware they do have ACs but I was able to use ours as such and it acted more as a fan. Still, as the weather was great, it was not really needed. The two pools were also very well maintained and we had a great time inbetween activities having a dip in them so make sure you bring your bathing suit!The game drives were fantastic, with our super guide Tyler. The jeeps/trucks were well maintained and great to drive in. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. The animals are, indeed, used to seeing humans driving around so will not run away the moment you spot them and you are able to get very close to them which some will love and some will not. I am part of the former category. Yes, some of the cats are in enclosures (the cheetahs and the leopard) but look well taken care of. I reserve my judgement about this for now and will see in a few years whether they have in fact gone through with it and brought them out into the main area of the park.All in all, a great time for those who don't have the time to stop off at the larger parks.Downside: for people without children, the rides can be a little annoying if you have to do them with other people's children. We had one child with us rides on both who kept swinging on the poles of the roof of the car and kept kicking me, my boyfriend or the people sitting next to him because he was horribly bored. He was also quite loud, shouting at the animals, etc which definitely takes the edge off, especially when you're trying to hear what the guide is saying. I really think people with children would probably do better riding with other families who have more tolerance for this. Although I have to say that as children we were often taken on safaris with my parents and we never behaved like this.

Perfect for those new to big animals. Aquila does what it does well, and that is to offer access to the Big 5 within 2.5 hours of Cape Town in a safe and not too spoilt environment. But bear in mind this is not the romantic safari you might have dreamed about - for that you will need to pay a lot more and travel much further, but that is not a criticism of Aquila. So expect lots of people at first. The lunch hall had 150 people eating and we thought we'd hate the place. But once the game drive started the 5 trucks cleverly went in different directions and kept out of each other's way. The guide Abrial was fantastic and deserves some kudos. They don't have much game as the park is 7500 hectares, but they have enough: elephants, 5 rhino, 7 lions, lots of kudu etc, 2 recovering cheetahs, zebra, quite a few hippo. Because the animals are so used to the trucks, and because the area is sealed off with electric fencing, you can get very close to the animals in a place which seems to care about the animals a lot. We stayed the night but lots of people were on day trips. I'd recommend staying the night but not 2 nights. The food was good, and the rooms were fine. So this is perfect for those in Cape Town who haven't been on safari much and it is very child-friendly.

Fantastic family stay. We had a brilliant time at Aquilla. We have four boys aged 6-12 and it was without doubt our favourite bit of our 2 week stay in SA. We saw every animal we could have hoped for. We had a really lovely guide and we really enjoyed our drink stop looking out over the incredible landscape. Our house was perfect with a lovely outside seating area where we could play cards. The pools were lovely and the food was great. The children made lots of friends. I cannot recommend it enough. Book it now if you are heading that way. Worth every penny.

aquila. Good bits: accomodation was superb. Wildlife safari was excellent-and the guide was really really brilliantpoor bits: lots of families and we were put with families with small children (we were a couple) there were other adults without children enough to fill a truck. Nobody likes other people's children, and they were noisy, and bounced around bored on the safari which took the edge off our experiencerestaurant-there should be a menu for the buffet so you know what you are eating. I would return but only if it could be guaranteed not to be with other peoples children
Very good. Saw all the animals, good accomodation and foodIt was difficult to understand our drivers, not clear allocution and not loud enough,

Glorified Zoo. If you're in Cape Town for a bit and can't get away to a real safari, this might suffice. However, realize that you're just driving through an oversized zoo. Sure, you'll see the "Big 5", but the big leopard is in a one-acre cage as are the lions you are most likely to see. In my mind, the reason this is not a true safari is that these animals are not existing in their natural ecosystem. The lions are completely separate from all the other animals in the "reserve". I asked our guide how they ate and he responded, "we feed them twice a week". Meaning they never hunt their prey because there is no prey within their (albeit large) cage.All that said, if you're looking for a quick day trip where you wake up early and are home by mid-afternoon with a hundred pictures of pretty animals, this is a great option.

Awesome African Experience. The overall experience was incredible ... as a South African myself this was the best game drive I have been on! We saw the Big 5 up close which was amazing, and I loved the accomodation with the rock shower that really gave you the feeling of being outdoors, you also have the option of having a fire lit in your room for the night. The food however could have been better with possibly more options but overall a great experience!

Great Family Outing, Go with the Right Expectations. Spent two nights and enjoyed three days on the private game reserve. Went with expectation of showing my kids African game in a controlled environment and got exactly that. This is not Krueger, so set your expectations. The Rangers know the terrain, environment, and really enjoy their work. The kids have lots to do and the lodge has a great facility to entertain them. When they played, my wife and I enjoyed time at the infinity pool, the lounge, and the live band on New Year's Eve.Biggest issues: food was a bit limited but not bad.

Great day out. I was apprehensive about booking this as some reviews on here weren't very positive but I went ahead and, I'm glad that I did. A long day ( when travelling from Cape Town but so worth it. Saw all the big five as wel a some other animals;our ranger Abrielmwas knowledgable and engaging. Food was ok too as I'd forgotten it was included. Definitely recommend.n

Not quite 4* facilities/service.. Aquila is a great place to go! It has much to offer and deserves the support it receives but some of the facilities are a little tired, even by "bush" get away standards, where one tends to accept more rustic conditions/facilities. Service in the restaurant and bar areas is slow and often misunderstood. Simple finishing touches like labelling the food on the buffet table, etc are lacking.

Overnight stay.. Everywhere beautifully presented. Staff polite and helpful. Accomodation lovely especially outside jacuzzi which overlooked part of reserve where the two elephants roamed! The tour ranger, Johan, was very knowledgable about the animals. Overall a good insight into a safari and a chance to see the big 5 up close, which we thoroughly enjoyed.

not exclusive - to many people. While there is great game viewing, the Game Reserve has to many day visitors and the restaurant is crowded. Many kids and families. It is too expensive.I would not recommend it.

Great place ESP with kids. We went on New Year's Eve and stayed overnight. Rooms are great with an outdoor shower and thatched roofs. The pool is excellent and the food is ample. The drives are good with lots of animal spotting. Be aware that the lions are in a separate enclosure but we got v close to them!! You can see the big five but the cheetahs are in the recovery centre opposite which protects animals that cannot be released back in the wild. Overall great fun!!

Great Safari!. This trip was definitely worth it. When arriving we had a great breakfast/brunch and then went on the safari. We managed to see zebra, ostrich, rhinos, elephants, giraffes, and hippos. We did not see any lions but the experience was still amazing. Then we had dinner and went in the pool. If you're in Cape Town this is a must do!

Amazing experience with Nature. Our stay at Aquila was amazing. We were in one of the private chalets which had a very earthy and rustic feel to it because of the way it was set up. The 2 safaris around the reserve were great and we got to see the Big 5. In the morning, the antelopes were grazing a few feet from our chalet and it was a great feeling to be in such close proximity with wild animals. The meals that were offered were great and so were the amenities. I would definitely recommend Aquila.

Happy children. beautiful setting and surroundings. family room was beautiful and tranquil, beds very comfortable and the outdoor shower a huge iti took my children (9 and 7yrs) for an overnight safari experience at Aquila during a whistle-stop stay in Capetownwhile the park was small and the number of animals limited the guide (marco) was really knowledgable and entertaining the and kids were awestruck by the whole experiencethey loved being served sparkling grape juice in proper glasses so they were drinking fizz like mummy and all the meals were excellenta great warm up for the real thing one day....?!

overnight safari. It is a great experience even for people who have been on safaris before. The ranger was very knowledgable. The chalet we had was perfect. The stay might be a bit touristic with many people. Food was ok. Altogether a good alternative to see wild life when staying in Cape Town.

too expensive for a big zoo and 2 starts quality hotel and food. we were 17 days in cape town area on holidays and honestly the only place we didnt like of our whole trip was Aquila, it doesnt value what you charge for it...too much money for going to a very basic hotel room, with no really good food and not a top service, to see a big zoo, not a safari....2 elephants, 4 rhynos and 7 lions doesnt make a safari...just a big zoo...that should have cost no more than half of what you charged me for it being the cheapest option!

Sad to watch such a bad decline in customer service. We visited with the hope that we could recommend the venue to New Zealanders and Aussie guests coming over on mass to a wedding in March 2016. The food was shocking, lunch evening and breakfast, "some staff" were disinterested.We were informed by a lady chef that she only served eggs that were fried or the scrambled egg, an omlette or poached was out of the question, the bacon was taseless and like rubberOur bedroom No 13 had aircon but no lights, the second chalet No 14 had sand between the sheets.We waited for security to fix the lights for over an hour and eventually just went to bed in the dark Our morning game drive was rushed (Johann) & the guide had such a strong bray the only words we understood were the continuous use of "Guys".We have been there 3 times before and had good experiances but not this time. We complained in person and via e-mail to no response and no avail.Very disappionting not to mention the noise factor (hotel buildiing) which we could understand
Excellent facilities. Excellent accommodation facilities and friendly staff. All big 5 included, nice game drives. Perfect for those who stays Cape Town and wants to experience the wildlife.

Seeing The Big 5. The setting was stunning and the staff were friendly & knowledgeable.We save all of the big 5 and many more.The lodge was comfortable and clean, the outdoor shower was a great!The food was good and plentiful although we stayed 2 nights and the menu was very similar each night. I was disappointed that there was not a BBQ and would have paid a small premium for this.Overall well worth a visit.
Top hospitality, very kids friendly. Amazing view of the animals, wonderful accommodation, and the wildlife guide was friendly, knowledgeable and approachable. Highly recommended

Stay at Aquila. We liked the safaris and the guide Vino, that was our reason to go. At the arrival and the restaurant most people not so friendly, make us feel they are not paid enough! The houses we stayed in simple but good location. Only water in the minibar. They can earn money with filling the minibar!

Canned view of the big 5. We did not find the guides as informative as other game drives we went on. It lacked a bit of personal touch for the price. It was much more expensive than others, but included a buffet lunch. However, we did get to see hippos and the lions were very close and impressive.

Don't bother!. I recently booked a day safari with transport from Cape Town. We arrived at the Reserve at 8.15am after a very early start...breakfast was provided on arrival which was fine...then a long wait until the safari started at 10.15am. The safari itself lasted for 1.75 hrs...we saw the big 5 but the animals looked so docile & used to the trucks & people that nothing about it felt very natural. We got back to the main area at 12.45pm for a buffet lunch (which was average) & had to wait about until,3.30pm until we could leave for Cape Town. Basically a lot of waiting around for a very average safari.

Exceeded Expectations. In short, Good job Aquila. I wanted to give my young family a taster of what a game park is all about on a recent visit to Cape Town. The only problem is the Western Cape is not exactly the best place to see "the big five" or indeed many of the other animals that are better known to live in Natal or the Kruger area in the north. I had fairly low expectations but I have to say Aquila exceeded them. On arrival at 9am, (2 hours drive from CT), we were greeted with a morning drink and then a full buffet breakfast. The camp is clean, tidy and picturesque and the hotel rooms look good, some of which over look a watering hole. There are 2 swimming pools, one has a bar/infinity pool and there is also a play area for children including a crazy golf course - 9 holes, although not in the best condition.At 10.15 we were put into a 20 seater truck with a drive/guide called David, who was very knowledgeable and passionate about the park. We were able to see many animals including all the big 5. I might add, the lions are in a separate part at this time and the leopard is in the rehabilitation centre, but this does not detract from the experience and the work Aquila are putting in place. After the drive, there was a buffet lunch (drinks not included) and some time to use the pool and relax. The children enjoyed playing in the kids area and the golf too. Overall, it was a great taster to viewing wildlife and I would recommend it. I would say that 1 drive would be enough unless you switch to the riding or quad bike for a different experience. It might not be the place to go if you are an experienced game park goer though.

marvellous stay. we spent one night 24/25 Dec 2014 which gave us a lot of satisfaction. Well comfortable accommodation - excellent driver (Daniel) who gave a lot of own experiences - fantastic place to go and stay. Thanks a lot.

Our overnight stay at Aquila. We had a wonderful time at Aquila. We enjoyed the afternoon safari with Godfrey, and especially enjoyed our early morning trip with Timothy where we got up close with the Lions. You are doing a terrific job with the reserve.The only criticism we had out of our stay was the food. We didn't particularly enjoy the buffet selection but really enjoyed everything else.Thank you again.

Excellent. We booked a safari, and was met by a buffet breakfast - that was great! Afterwards we went on the safari ride; and we saw the big five and even more. We got really close with the animals. The only problem was that the guide only talked to the people on the front rows in the car – so we in the back didn’t hear a thing… At the end we enjoyed a buffet lunch.

The Big Five to be viewed within a stones throw of the Western Cape Winelands. Wasn't sure what to expect having visit Kruger and Addo plus private game reserves over the past 30 years.However this holiday break saw us being guest to our son and his partner, the break only to be 2 weeks.Naturally Capetown South Africa being associated with Table Mountain and Cape Winelands, how do try to fit all of what SA has to offer in such a short space when never having been to Africa before.Aquila came to the rescue, having tasted wine and climbed a mountain where else could you see the big 5 all within 24 hours, or even less.Us the host being that bit older preferred the overnight option which turned out to be the best way.Summarising the game drive Warden us plenty to see and learn even with our own SA experience, two great drives from Daniel. A great pool with a freshen up swim with a Karoo mountain view to sip a glass or two. The welcome Buffet lunch, the evening meal and then the great breakfast after the early morning drive, all thought to be great. I haven't had chance to mention the accommodation as this worked out also to be top draw.Thanks once again Aquila excellent job we will return soon.

BIG 5 EXPERIENCE, BUT IN VERY SMALL QUANTITIES. At £85 per person, I was expecting a bit more that your average safari park/zoo experience, but unfortunately I left feeling a bit ripped off.Yes, I knew that it wouldn't be anywhere on a par with a true safari experience, but since I was in the Cape Town area I thought I'd take the 2 hour drive to Aquila, which, as it happens, was an incredible drive.Upon arrival you have breakfast in a large dining room with hundreds of other people who are doing exactly the same as you.You then pile onto a bus with about 30 other people, to go round the 10,000 hectare "park". The park is a decent size, and you will see the big 5 (actually we saw 4), however, in reality, this is what Aquila has:7 lions 2 elephants4 giraffes5 rhinosSpringbokBuffalo (our driver couldn't find any the day we were there...)Terribly disappointing. I knew I would see the same number of animals that you would in Kruger, but I thought they'd have more animals than the above.After the drive, you are taken back to the same restaurant, given a buffet lunch (average quality), then sent on your way.If you really want to see the Big 5 in the wild, wait until you can do a proper safari.
Swedes. Its was an ok place. A bit arranged but I guess that's the only way to get a safari in South africa. Rooms are excellent. The food a bit boring.
Disappointing. For the price, I had expected Aquila to be a bit more up market. Whilst there was plenty of food, it was very average. Wouldn't recommend it.

Family vacation. We had a great time at Aquila. It was our first time in a game reserve and we enjoyed it. The only regret was that we had one room too many. Our three girls slept together in one room for the whole stay, so we could have saved a little money just getting two rooms. Overall: great experience

Boxing Day safari. Being unable to visit Kruger due to time restraint during our trip to South Africa, Aquila seemed like the next best thing. They picked us up from our hotel at 6.20am and it was a two hour drive to the reserve. The journey was long but the views were breathtaking. When we arrived at Aquila we were really impressed- it's in a beautiful setting. We were told to have breakfast and then given free time before the safari started. I felt there was too much waiting time and although it was a beautiful setting we just wanted to get on with the safari. The safari was great and we got to see four of the big five.
