The one animal we didn't get to see was the leopard, and there was no explanation from our guide as to why we didn't get to see it or if they are even at the reserve. After our safari we were taken to a conservation area which I thought was quite poor really. It seemed unfinished and we weren't given a great deal of information about it.Following this we went for lunch which I thought was superb. It was buffet style with lots of choice, very tasty and good quality.After lunch we had more free time (around 1hr30) to go for a swim, chill out etc. although it was a beautiful setting and the lodge was stunning, the pool area was packed out with people doing the safari and as a result there were no free sun loungers and the pool was full of kids. We ended up sitting on hard picnic benches literally waiting to get back on the bus to go home.Although I enjoyed the safari and loved seeing the animals I just felt there was a lot of 'dead' time hanging around. It annoyed me that we had to be picked up at 6.20am and then wait for 2 hours at the reserve for the safari to start. It just felt like time wasted that I could have spent longer in bed! And I could have quite happily headed back after lunch. It was a beautiful place and I couldn't knock the food, that was superb but overall I think they drew out a full day into something that could have been done in half the time.

Aquila game reserve. Close to cape town, excellent accommodation, good pool although water was a bit cold in mid December. The food was excellent and clean.My only criticism would be that perhaps the reserve needs to have a few more animals, although the game Rangers were very knowledgeable.

The Big Five Close to Cape Town. The drive to Aquila is breathtaking, especially travelling through the verdant Hex River Valley. The Reserve caters for the mass market but having said that, the food is very good as is the restaurant service and staff. I did not like the big vehicle (23 seater) as this was uncomfortable on rutted roads. The standard accommodation is basic but acceptable even though the ceiling fan was problematic and the outside shower floor had to be swept before use due to small thorn like droppings from surrounding trees. This area was never cleaned and on one day our chalet was not serviced by housekeeping either. The horse ride through the reserve was stunning and is highly recommended. The pool is awkwardly designed as the steps are at the restaurant side rather than on the lawn side where the recliners are positioned. Generally, the staff are friendly and appear to have a passion for what they do. This Reserve is worth a visit.

Expectations. We came here for a day trip particularly hoping to see the different flora/fauna of the fynbos region as this was the first time we visited the Cape Town area. Please note that our expectations were somewhat high having been on various other safaris within South Africa and Kenya, not as high as those locations could offer, but still for a "Big 5" reserve, we did expect something different. First of all, upon arrival we saw the large "people mover" game vehicles which immediately gave us pause as we did expect more of a normal 10 seater vehicle. I immediately enquired regarding a private vehicle, and after lunch, was told yes it was available. It wasn't very expensive considering the difference it should offer in the experience, so whew, thankful for that. Lunch for the day visitor is buffet, food is ok (drinks not included in the price, not even water), but we're not going for the food, are we? Enough said probably about that.The game drive started out ok as the flora is much different. I will mention we did see 4 of the Big 5. But when you see two buffalo just to be told that those are the only two buffalo or when you see elephants to be told they are the only two elephants, same with two giraffe (young giraffe) whom they are hoping will survive as their natural diet of acacia is still being grown, not to mention that the lions are in their own enclosure and fed by the reserve, then yes, it was disappointing.I know now that the lions were rescued from canned hunting farms and for that, it's a noble cause. But they aren't really "wild" animals then if they are being fed inside their own (albeit large 500 hectare) enclosure, and I think the marketing should not slant it as such, it should be called an "animal park", not a game reserve. And due to the small size of the "reserve", I know that there can't be a huge load on the natural vegetation (so they do provide supplemental feeding). But expectations were high, and reality did not quite deliver. It did have more of the feeling of a drive-through animal park, than a true "game reserve". I'd like to consider the motives of this park as being for conservation and that all tourism fees are used for such. So hopefully one day they will be able to have a fully functioning "wild" reserve where supplemental feeding is not needed and enclosures will be opened. Until then, just understand it for what it is, and if you have the proper expectations, then enjoy!

Great experience. As this was our third trip to Cape Town we fancied doing something different without travelling too far from our base with friends in Hout Bay.Aquila met the brief perfectly. While maybe not an truly authentic safari it was pretty close. The Rangers were extremely knowledgeable and the setting is spectacular. The lodge is comfortable and the design is sympathetic to the landscape. Hopefully the building extension currently underway will not spoil this.The food is plentiful and tasty rather than 'haute cuisine' but after building up a huge appetite the buffet was just perfect. Drinks are cheap - our bar bill was less than £30 including wine, soft drinks and cocktails over a day and a half.Particularly enjoyed the additional horseback safari and the offer to go back out for a canter after we had returned to base with the non riders - thank you!My only suggestion for improvement would be the pre-arrival information. Since we made our own way to the lodge and were held up by roadworks the journey took longer than the "2 hours from CT" advertised (closer to 3) and we were slightly stressing to get there by 12 thinking we would miss out on the afternoon safari - only to find it didn't leave till 4pm and we had plenty of time for lunch, check in and lounging by the pool. As we were only there for 1 night we chose the most basic of the rooms which was perfectly comfortable and clean. Didn't use the fire but I imagine it would be very cosy.Highly recommended and great value for money. Our friends in Hout Bay have booked on our recommendation.

Aquila day trip. My husband and I were very pleased with our Safari! We got to see the Big 5 and we were incredibly close to them. The tour guide was very knowledgeable. The food was delicious as well. Totally worth it!

Worth the trip. I was very skeptical that this would be a good trip and only went for my kids. But, it was really much better than expected. We took a day trip out, and the drive was through beautiful mountains. On arrival, it was very much a safari lodge atmosphere with good food and friendly staff. Going to see the animals was great. While it is not a proper safari, the animals have a lot of room to roam around, and we were able to get within a few feet of a pride of lions in the vehicle. It does not take much suspension of disbelief to feel like you are seeing the animals in the wild. Very much enjoyed the day there.

Safari!! . So we went for a safari trip me and my husband there we paid for 2,750 per person for a private transportation from the hotel till the location which took 2 hours also thats include lunch and the game. For lunch it was open lunch, i mostly liked there desert was the Malva pudding it was really amazing. The drinks we had to pay for cause it wasn't included in the package. Then we started the game . We so few zebra's and hippo's then some deers. After than we entered the lion and tiger area but they were so far we couldn't see them clearly. After that we entered another area an saw only one giraffe. From there they took us another area where are the elephants but we got stuck there cause the truck was so heavy and it was so sandy . We waited almost 30 minutes to help us . After that we went back and the took us to the animal rescue and we saw 1 tiger and some cheetahs after that they just took us back to our cars . The trip started at 1:30 and finished at almost 4 something.

Great day out. Amazing experience to be up close to so many amazing animals. We managed to see Hippos, Rhinos, Lions, Elephants, Giraffes, Zebras and so many more smaller animals. Our guide Godfrey was excellent and answered all our questions. My only criticism is that after lunch if you didn't want to go horse riding or quad biking you were stuck for an hour and a half waiting to be taken back to Cape Town.

aquilla stay. We spent 2 nights at the reserve and enjoyed our stay. Staff were very efficient and helpfull - even Eskom power outage did not spoil our dinner by candlelight. Did not manage to see Leopards but that common to most game parks - saw everything else

Overnight stay in 2 Standard Cottages. Family Cottage was fully booked so we had to get 2 Standard cottages for family of 4.The 2 Game rides (afternoon and morning) were excellent. The guide gave us time to take pictures. It was very relaxing and enjoyable. He explained and answered our questions clearly.The food was very nice and lots of choices too. There was power failure on our first day. It came back by the time we returned from the afternoon Game ride.Water heater was not working in one room and air-condition remote control was not working in the other room. These were fixed within an hour after we informed them. However, I would like to suggest to improve on the bathroom floor. My husband slipped and fell when he stepped out of the bath tube. The surface of the step stone was too slippery and it was a slope. It would be better if anti-slip mat or tape was on it and level it.

Great day at a reasonable price. OK, this is not a 3-day safari at Kruger National Park, but it is an easy day trip from Cape Town. Two-hour van ride, then a very nice buffet breakfast, and then out on the truck to see animals. It is a private game preserve, so it is likely that you will see a wide assortment as you are driven through (but not guaranteed). Our guide was very personable, and we got great pictures of rhinos, zebra, ostriches, and farther-off shots of everything else. Make sure you use the facilities before you head out, for there are no restrooms while you are out with the truck. Then back to the home base for a delicious lunch; you have to pay for beverages at lunch, but the prices were very reasonable. Another 2-hour ride and you are back in Cape Town. Remarkably convenient, and very much worth the money.

Once in a Lifetime Experience. From the moment we arrived, the magic began. The staff were all friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough to make our visit memorable. Our accommodation was, for us, unique in a wonderful setting. The animals were the icing on the cake.
Must see. Amazing day with great guide. Took loads of photos and fell in love with the real Africa. Is a whole day but you can stay the night if you would like in lovely cottages. Take a good camera.

Friends in Safari. Not only met but exceeded our expectations! Splurged and stayed in chalets built into the side of the mountain. Food was excellent - plenty of vegetarian options! Really cannot say enough good things about all of the folks who put this experience together from front desk to guides to cooks and room attendants! Thank you Aquila Reserve!

Excellent Staff - Wonderful Place. We´ve had a wonderful overnight stay at the reserve. Staff, Food and Accommodation were really great. A place I would definitely recommend to my friends.
The jeep tours were also really nice. Our ranger did a perfect job, telling us all the nice stories about the animals and the place.

Aquilla Private Game Reserve. Some may say its not a proper Safari but you wont be disappointed. There is plenty of space for the game. How could you have the Lions in the same enclosure of a reserve without them eating all the Zebra. We saw all we wanted to and dared to step outside the vehicle and have a sherry until a Rhino came too close for comfort. To be in an open vehicle next to animals I have only seen behind cages or relatively small enclosures like Longleat was an amazing experience. To have a private suit or villa with an open air shower was liberating. Good food and friendly staff. We even enjoyed the picturesque drive from Capetown. One minor criticism of Room 17, dont start the fire in the cabin. The smoke doesn't extract very well and everything will smell like a bonfire for a day. I think it because the log burner has plates for cooking on the top which allows smoke into the room. We had to leave the windows open all nights to avoid too much smoke inhalation. Otherwise a very enjoyable experience.
Fantastic experience!. Fantastic experience and really appreciated how flexible the staff were to our travel plans. Well worth a visit on so many levels!

An awesome honeymoon breakaway. arrived at 12 noon, friendly staff at check inn and in the restuarant, enjoyed scrumptious buffet lunch, checked in and relaxed at pool, went on game drive at 4pm, the guide was absolutely in his element and the tour group was fun and very engaging. saw the big 5 in very close proximity of one another, one good thing of this safari is you don't have to go and look far for the animals. we arrived back at the camp site around 19:30pm and was off to a buffet supper at 20:30pm.. quite tired we went to our honeymoon suite where we settled for the night. the next morning around 7am it was already 25 degrees outside, the outdoor shower was quite fantastic. Well worth the money, highly recommended, will return with the kids hopefully soon...
visit with friends. I really enjoyed my stay at your resort. Game drive and room very good. staff very friendly. Food was average.

an amazing experience. We were so pleased that we visited Aquilla. To see the wild animals in their natural habitat and closely was wonderful. A never to be forgotten experience.Also to see the animal rehabilitation centre was good.our accommodation was excellent and the food plentiful and lovely. Excellent facilities with very good swimming pool which we enjoyed as well! Thank you!

Excellent experience. watched the animals interact with each other. |Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and entertaining. He answered my 9 years old daughter's million and one questions:) Watched a rhino and elephant play and interact with other which was amazing. Our tour guide said it was the first time he had since two animals of a different species interact so happily and playfully. My entire family Loved the whole experience. This included my 60 plus year old parents, my husband and I (late thirties) and my 9 yr old daughter. Highly recommended. Oh and the buffet breakfast and lunch were excellent and a variety to choose from.

unforgettable Adventure. By arriving we get a warm welcome from the staff. We stay with our friends for 1 night. Our bungalow was really beautiful and the view on the Game Reserve amazing. We saw the Elephants from our bedroom. But our absolutely highlight was the safari and our special thanks goes to our guide Romeo Muller. He show us all the animals and he speaks with them like a "wild animal whisperer". It was for us an unforgettable experience and adventure! Thanks for all and we wish you good luck with your Cheetas and all the other animals! Katalin and Francis from Switzerland

More like a Zoo than a Safari. The key points coming out of our one day visit:1. The price was astronomical and did not represent any level of value for money;2. The pick up driver made no effort to introduce himself or speak to his passengers for the entire two and a half hours each way to and from Cape Town;3. Breakfast buffet on arrival was adequate but nothing special. Staff were slow to refill empty platters;4. The Safari itself was quite good, but one got the feeling that there were very few animals to be seen. The Ranger's knowledge was very good, and his enthusiasm probably saved the day from disaster. He won the second star in our rating;5. Buffet lunch was not very appetising and for such a high price, it was surprising that drinks were not included;6. After lunch, we had to kill time for almost 2 hours before our bus departed. With nothing to do, we just sat around. Boring.I wouldn't recommend this Day Trip Safari.

Fenced Reserve: glorified zooo. Sadly we felt the brochures and hype promised more. Seemed a factory experience to view the 2 elephants, seven steak fed lions and other animals. Good setting but two star buffet meals with staff who seemed uninterested. The animal guide was a genuinely lovely nice guy but no where near an expert when we did our own google search to cross reference his "facts".

Great place to see the 5 close to cape town. This is a ggod place to see all the animals, it would have been nice to have some time to enjoy the pools that they had, but our itineray (overnight with two game drives didn't allow), wouldn't recommend the chalets thou.

Amazing experience. We had a great experience! During the first game drive we saw lions, but they were all sitting on a mountain so we couldn't see him properely. The next morning we went to that side of the park to see the lions again. This time they were sitting nearby the path. We could almost touch them!

Enjoyed our stay. Wonderful stay. Everything perfectly arranged for and we were very well accomodated while travelling with baby. Guide also very good and pleasantly informed us on the animals as well as the habitat. Again, perfect stay.

Poor excuse for a Safari. The drive there is the best part of the trip. Most theme parks etc would be a better place to see animals. It is not even close to being a subject for a true safari.Because of a lack of animals the big five are separated into separate enclosures and you are driven to see two elephants, four giraffe, a number of rhinos (these were good) and a pride of lions who happened to be in a small enclosure sitting on their shed looking thoroughly bored as another lorry load of tourists queued up to have a look.Saying that, if you haven't been anywhere similar, and you want a day out from Capetown it is not bad value, but don't expect much when you get there.

Perfect Game Reserve. Everything was perfectly organized and our guide Romeo gave very good information about the animals. The meals and the lodge were very good and very clean. It was nice being at AquilaCheersFrank Patty and Anouk
The Big Five. Aquila is a nice place to stay at to see the Big Five. I recommend the Premier Cottages (room 9 is the best)
Nice Safari initiation. Nice accomodation, good rangers, fair food quality.More communication and responsiveness would have been welcome.

Animals amazing... Guide fabulous, but not much to do otherwise.. I pre arranged this tour via Viator from Australia. Not cheap at about 250 AUD... But I'm really pleased I did. Coming to Africa without seeing the animals up close would be a shame.The tour collection is early... My pick up was 0620... The mini van was already 3/4 full so some picked up 0545 onwards.The driver was courteous and efficient. Most of the drive I slept which was a blessing as the roads into the hills were quite perilous. We stopped for a snack, toilet break at a service station on the way about 1 hour in to the journey.. Good timing. The reserve itself was pretty disorganised. On arrival you sign a waiver have breakfast which whilst welcome was quite average food wise. Then there is a wait until the game drive start at 1015. I had a look at the curios shop... Prices were outrageous. The game drive however was EXCELLENT. Our guide was fabulous... Chatty and knowledgeable about the animals. We saw wilder east, hippos, rhino, zebra, giraffe, elephants, lions in the distance, springboks, no cheetahs ( nocturnal). It was awesome! On return we had lunch but had to pay for drinks which felt like gouging given the price already paid and after the drive hot and thirsty... Not even water provided:(...... Then not much to do until collection at 330. There is a pool , not enough seats around for the guests outside of the dining area.Luckily our driver returned early and all of our 10 guests were happy to leave early to get back to Cape town. Would I recommend it... Yes to see the animals was amazing.... I think it would be better if shorter... Early return straight after lunch with mid afternoon back into Cape Town would be way better.

great overall experience. I recently went on the overnight Safari @ Aquila game reserve. It was great value for money for everything you got, food was of a good standard and buffet items fresh. Roome were clean and comfortable with lots of warm bedding as it was quite cold at night (mid Nov) game drives were great - guides really made the effort to get you as close to the animals as possible and were knowledgable with what they were talking about. Game drive on first day also included a stop with some sparkling wine and nibbles which was a nice touch.
Excellent. My second time already. We will be back!!!!! Next time we will bring some family. Food was good. Staff very friendly.
Stunning break away on our doorstep!. We had a stunning weekend. We were spoiled rotten. Please take enough warm clothes on the game drive(s)! Nevertehless, really worthwhile.

Unforgettable memories!. We arrived around lunch time, had a drink, lunch & swim before our afternoon safari (which was put back an hour, but that was fine). Our guide/driver was friendly & informative & we saw most of the animals we wanted to see & photograph, and fairly close up too. As there was a convention that night, we were required to eat in the lounge, which was fine. Unfortunately we were given no choice on the food and some of it was cold, and the waitress couldn't even tell us what some courses actually were when asked. We complained and were compensated by the helpful lady in charge. I stress that this didn't detracted from the whole experience of our 2 day safari, as it was fantastic overall. We stayed in a family lodge which had a real fire & was great. We rose very early the next morning for our next safari, which we paid a bit extra to upgrade to the quad bikes, which I highly recommend! Again our guide was brilliant & we managed to see the animals we didn't see the day before, up close and personal!! Some unforgettable memories from this magnificent trip. Thank you Aquila.

Great safari experience. In a perfect ambiance you het to see the Big Five and the overall hospitality of all personel involved is just fine. The lodge has a genuine safari atmosphere. Buffet dinner and breakfast are abundant and of very good quality and there is a great variety of items to choose from. Perhaps if Aquila could work on a better audibility of the ranger during the safari also for passengers in the backseats of the truck it would be great. And when constructing new lodging some more emphasis on soundproofing would be a good thing.

Thank you. I took my son for his 6th birthday to Aquila Private Game Reserve. We had a wonderful time. All the staff were friendly and went beyond to make our stay and my son birthday special. I request a cupcake at dinner for my son but the manager on duty arranged a CAKE with birthday candles for my son. Thank you so much for making our stay so special.

Disappointment and empty promises. I had a very disappointing expience during my visit at Aquila in early October. I raised it via email and twitter but got no feedback. My message on Facebook was deleted. Eventualy Michelle got hold of me and since then it has been excuse on excuse and that they will get back to me and that this and and that that one is not avaialble. I wrote her her on 14 October, requested for feeback on 17 October, again on 24 October and 29 Oktober and again op 17 November with still no feedback, not even when I will get feedback.Below puts my experience in perspective.I want to put our Aquila visit into perspective. It was meant to be the highlight of our honeymoon. We have been dreaming visiting Aquila for many years and finally made the booking. From the outright we were disappointed. I can elaborate on each point but these are the items in summary.• Only Semi-Sweet drinks on arrival and on game drive. No dry drinks like Sauvignon Blanc.• Very rude receptionist, told us to go and wait outside till its lunch time.• No shade outside for the amount of people that were waiting there. Eventually we went to the bar (nobody told us about it) • Ordered two cocktails and the barman told us to wait. 30 min later he brought us the wrong drinks (1 of the 2) and insisted that we must take it.• Lunch for a 4 star game reserve reminded me of hostel food.• We finally got to the room and tried to close the curtains as there is no shade in the front. The curtain rails fell from the wall with multiple holes in the wall.• After our game drive it was back in the wall but it was clear that a piece of firewood was used to hammer it back into the wall that was thrown underneath the outside table.• Room is clean but nothing to write home about. There were candles but no candle holders to use them.• The game drive animal sightings is very good. What I don’t understand is why the driver would drive up to 5m away from rhino’s lying down until they get nervous and jump up. Surely 15m or more away would not disturb the animal? The game drive vehicle is poorly maintained, the fan belts where screeching and chirping away all the time. This could be fix quickly and for cheap.• There was not enough water during this hot day on the game drive. Several children was complaining of being thirsty.• The evening meal was a great disappoint with the same food (90% of the lunch) being served again. There was not even ice-cream.• Nobody was around to take our drink order and we had to run after people to help us.• We cancelled the morning game drive but the receptionist just put our room number down and never even checked.I can go on for long but this should get the message across. Aquila was the most expensive part of our honeymoon (compared to other game lodges and hotels) and it was the biggest disappointment. Poor service, poor experience and with no attempts to make it better. It was our honeymoon and not for one moment did we feel special despite the high prices. We left before 8 the next morning after we cancelled the game drive and we informed the gate that we are not having breakfast. Nobody seem to care nor did anyone bother to contact us about the Samsung charger and our own two point plug that we forgot (yes, there were no two pin plugs in the room)I feel that I was robbed from that was supposed to be an exceptional experience. I will give you the opportunity to advise if have the wrong perception of Aquila before I post this on Trip Advisor as per the mail I got from Aquila.
to much like a zoo. we were a Little bit disappointed because Aquila is rather a zoo than a Game Reserve. They even feed the lions...But the people were nice

We enjoyed it very much. We booked an overnight in Aquila with the four of us, two parents, son 24 and daughter 21. The two game drives that came along with it where good, we got to see the big five, only pity was that the cheetah was in a cage and that made the experience to see them in the wild not complete.Accommodation and food was very good, room and park were very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful.All in a two hour drive from Cape Town.
Our trip to Aquila. Very well organised trips. Authentic lodges. Take a good camera. We stayed over night. All brilliant.

A wonderful visit which will live long in the memory!. We were recommended to visit Aqila and were very pleased with the standard of accommodation, the friendliness of the staff, the quality of the food and the game drives (which were led by Timothy of whom we cannot speak highly enough). Overall a truly amazing visit which, as per the title of this review, will live long in the memory!

AQUILA GAME LODGE. I bid for a voucher at an auction for a fund raising event.To be honest I would never had paid R 7000.00 for an overnight stay.What you offer to tourists is very good and I feel that they are getting their moneys worth.The chalets very comfortable. The dressing gowns far too small.The buffets had a nice variety and quantity. Bar service could be more professional and quicker.
Amazing experience. Cocktails on arrival, full board included, check in to a beautiful cottage & the most amazing game drives. A one-off experience that is total value for money, simply amazing :0)

the perfect anniversary weekend. My wife and I had a perfect weekend stay at the resort. Very peaceful, quiet and relaxing. Great tasting food at the buffet for all meals. All the staff are very friendly, welcoming and always ready to help. The game drive was an awesome experience with very knowledgeable rangers

Simply Brilliant. From the moment I contacted Aquila to book our trip to the moment we left after our stay we were continuously impressed. I had made a few special requests like accommodating us with single beds and organizing a special cooler box on the game drive etc, everything was taken care off just as requested and with such professionalism and care. The only thing that we were not accommodated on is I had wanted to by Aquila caps for everyone for their arrival, but the shop was out of stock.Out of the 12 people in our group, 8 had never been to a game reserve before so for them to have a life changing experience in such luxury was very special. We had dressed up as a group for Halloween and we so enjoyed the interaction with the staff etc. Our game ranger Timothy was brilliant! The reception staff were welcoming and pleasant. The kitchen staff and waitrons were efficient and helpful. Our rooms were spotless and very comfortable.A very successful Team Gilded Edge evening away, Thank you Aquila!

À very Nice experience. We booked an overnight with two game drives in Aquila. The reserve is fantastic ad the drives were too. We saw the big four, only pitty was that the cheetah as the number five was in a cage. Cabins, staff and food was great.

Most amazing experience. My husband and i only stayed over one night. We were organized two game drives and had lunch, supper and breakfast..it felt like a whole weekend trip. it was definitely 5 star to us. thanks you Aquila!!!

Birthday Safari. We went to Aquila in October to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday and had the best time. Friendly and professional staff. Delicious food and such a big variety. Beautiful and peaceful environment. The animals were amazing. And our guide, Daniel was superb. He is really passionate about his work. ABSOLUTELY AWESOME TIME!

Not impressed at all!. Visited Aquila on a day trip from Cape Town. Pick-up (organized for us by Aquila directly) in Cape Town happens between 6 and 6:30 am depending on which hotel you are staying at. Leaving Cape Town at 6:30 we arrived in Aquila at 8:45 with a 10 minutes stop on the way. We arrived and were served breakfast but safari did not start before 10:15 which is a total waste of time (90 minutes!!!) and makes such an early pick-up totally unnecessary. I would have been happy to leave town later and have a quick breakfast on arrival or even have breakfast at home and arrive on site at 10:00, just before safari time. Now when I say safari, is only because they call it like that but for me it is nothing more than a "wild zoo group excursion". I say that because 1) we were 19 in the vehicle (can accommodate 22) and 2) the few animals they have are surely to be found every day at the exact same place. 2 elephants in total, found by a water hole (surprise surprise); 4 giraffes in total, only one we saw, right by the tree where they feed them of grass and carrots (surprise, surprise); etc... In addition of the 2 elephants and 4 giraffes, they have 3 cape buffaloes, a few zebras, wildebeests, elands and other general game. The lions, our driver said we were "very lucky" finding and he did insist on the "very luck". But actually they were by a water hole inside a fenced (and electrified) area which itself is inside a bigger fenced area which itself is inside the main reserve which of course is also fenced so it takes a total of 3 gates to get to the lions. With that, probabilities that they escape the morning tour bus are low, if not non existant. After the tour, our ranger took us to the ARC (Aquila Rescue and Conservation) area where they keep, within fenced "cages" 2 cheetah, 1 lion, 1 lioness and 1 leopard. You are welcome to take pictures with metallic fences in the foreground as well as in the background. Around 1:30 we were back to the main lodge for lunch. My friend and I had booked a quad bike tour at 2pm and was great fun but we only came back at 4pm while our departure time was scheduled at 3:30. We did not mind it at all but I am not sure the other passengers of the mini-bus we were travelling with were very happy about the wait, especially knowing they had not been doing any afternoon activity (the standard day tour at Aquila finishes with lunch, followed by departure at 3:30 and I was the one at booking who pro-actively requested an afternoon occupation... so a lot of wasted time here again for most visitors). So overall a big disappointment and an attraction I will not recommend to anyone around me. My friend was happy because she saw lions for the very first time but seriously, this was by no means a safari and unless they work on their schedule, it is a total waste of time. There is way too much to do around Cape Town to afford spending 4 hours waiting for the sake of waiting.

Great family getaway. What a place my 6 year old daughter had the time of her life she still ask me when are we going back the staff are very friendly and helpful and it really caters for the whole family

Nice time at safari. We enjoyed our stay at aquila private game reserve. We could see a lot of animals and the tourguide gave some more information about the animals and how they live. The food was good and the appartments were nice.

Perfect setting. Wevspent two nights and it was superb,Gamedrives with very good gamedrivers, who had real nice info.Lodges were nice, meals oke, and everybody was in a very good mood,We can advise this to everybody!
Whats not to like!. Excellent trip, Saw all the animals we wanted lead by very informative and friendly driver.Early check out of room meant that pool couldn't be used as couldn't get changed after.
Unbelievable experience. The accommodation was wonderful and the food was of high quality.The game drives and the rangers was the best.

Wonderful facilities.. First, I will start off by saying this is not a real safari. They know where all of the animals are and it's not "exhilirating" at all. Having said that, the crew and lodging accomdations are great. Outdoor shower, large bathtubs, great food. This place is worth it even without the animals.

nice safari. Bad room. Aquila is a beautiful gamepark. The drives were nice. We saw a lot of animals.The meals were good. The only problem for us was the house. We were with 2 friends and had a house for 8 persons. Our friends took the best room [we said them that they should do so]. The other room was dark, very small. No chair to sit. For me [I am ill] a terrible room. We payed the same price as our friends.

A Lovely game viewing experience. We were able to view all the big 5 as well as other game. While it may not be the natural habitation of some of the animals it is lovely to experience this viewing so close to Cape Town. The staff and guides were very well informed and friendly.

Exceptional. My wife and I could not speak highly enough about Aquila. The room was beautiful, comfortable, clean and perfect for relaxing. The food was so good I believe I may have had too much, and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Daniel, our ranger was informative, funny and clearly loves his job, which made our tours all the more fascinating and enjoyable. During our three weeks in South Africa Aquila was one of the major highlights, and we would urge anyone considering a visit to do so.
Awesome Birthday. I have celebrated my birthday in Aquila.The hospitality, the nature and the animals were so nice!It was really the best birthday I ever had!

mr and ,mrs Theron. the facility was great. dining room was 4 star, excpet all the birds that were making way on to food.food was good quality in general. cold bacon and burnt scrambled eggs only fault .otherwise very good food.cigar lounge and poo area all good. drives were great . knoweledgable rangers. good animal. problem was it was a bit too commercialised. great for day trippers, and seems to be geared that way.stayed in room 25. this was not 4 star.seems very dated, no tv in room etc.matress was very old not at the quality i woudl have expected.overall a good experience, but rooms really need some work

Aquilla Game reserve overnight Safari. Excellent location. Beautiful setting. Knowledgeable tour guides. Food was great with an excellent spread on offer. Accommodation was clean and welcoming. Definitely an overnight stay. Day trip will be too short to see and experience everything. A must see and definitely a place to visit again

Great game drives & food. I found the food, game drives and your new trainee game driver superb! The only drawback was the accommodation. Too basic for a 4 star - seriously needs an upgrade. One thing I noticed was that the curtains were dirty as well.

Just one of those dreams. Fantastic overnight stay in one of the premier lodges, woke up to see elephants walking by. The staff couldn't do enough, and the rangers (one in particular can't remember his name Jo??) who had been there 10 years was really really good, could have listened to him for hours, in fact we did. Food good, saw all the animals as well, only slight criticism was the wood fire was insufficient heating and needed a back up electric heating, ok we did go when it was uncharacteristically cold for one night, but we were cold! Well worth the trip even the drive down is part of the experience
review pary van Rijswijk. very good guide, family suite was als very good (comfortable). number of animals (variety) was a bit disappointing

Great way to see variety of African game. A great visit! The drive though the reserve was very enjoyable-- seeing a wide variety of game in the 2 hour drive. The guide was careful to arrange stops to encourage a view of a variety of African wildlife. We chose to sit in the back of the van in order to get a 360 degree view for photos--which we got--but be aware, if you follow our lead, that you will have very limited to no ability to hear the guide, as the amplification system is basically nonexistent and sound doesn't reach to the back of the van. Sit in the front if you want to have any idea of what the guide is saying.

The Watson's Visit. A great & relaxing experience, food good but could be warmer (especially at breakfast - bacon!!). Staff great and knowledgeable but Lounge Bar Service needs to be improved to service Dining Room and Lounge Guests, Multiple visits questionable and costs for RSA residents considered on the high side
Day in the wild. Great way to spot the big 5 in the Western Cape and very good chalets to stay overnight. Really loved it.

Living among the big 5.... The staff were friendly and the game drives were excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed the horse riding safari. Breakfast was outstanding, the only downside was the lack of television in our room.

Very Good. Was very impressed with the staff and Daniel our Ranger was very good.The food was delicious.Was really impressive seeing the big five,the weather was in our favour that also played a huge part in our visit.
Mouse and bird problem. Mice in my room and in the bar area.Birds sitting and eating off buffet.understand but can be fixed.

Aquila Private Game Reserve. Overall a very enjoyable visit. The game drive was lovely seeing a wide variety of game in the 2-3 hour game drive. All the animals are in great condition and accustomed to the vehicles so don't run away. The restaurant (great buffet and variety of options) and cigar lounge was lovely with bar and log fires and friendly staff. The accommodation (for 2) was very basic for the price and had we not made use of a Groupon 50% week day discount on the normal R5000 per night package, we tolerated it, but at full price it was a bit disappointing, Perhaps the thatched family units are better? Overall a lovely break.

The amazing experience of my life!. Me and my partner had 2 days in Aquila Game Reserve and it was amazing. The room was clean and very comfortable as well as the restaurant and the bar.Food was good but I think it can be better!As for the Safari...OMG excellent!!!Although it was cold we enjoyed it very much....!At last but not least, the Horse Riding Safari was extremely nice. Great work Aquila people...I recommend to everyone who wants to relax away from the city near nature and animals to go there!!!

Good Game Drive - food let down. Stayed for one night and in premium accommodation which was lovely, game drives good and saw big 5 but not warned that very cold in morning and would have dressed warmer if known. Overall very good but let down by food, all mass buffet and both my husband and I, as well as friend were ill for following days with suspected food poisoning. Shame after experiencing so much amazing food in SA overall.

Ideal short breakaway. What a great way to feel spoilt in nature and enter a head-clearing space where you can unwind. We enjoyed the stay thoroughly. We would have loved to see more animal species on the game drive, but what we did see, was quite amazing. The establishment is well kept and the food is to die for!

Touch of Africa. I spent a day at this resort and was pleasantly surprised at the detail staff went to make the experience enjoyable. The game drive itself was informative, but would have loved to see more animals. The restaurant itself was a treat - the food was tasty and plentiful. Lazing around the infinity pool and relaxing in the sun made the trip worthwhile.

Magical Aquila. Aquila Private Game Reserve is a definite must!! We had an unforgettable stay there. From the welcome drinks, the friendly reception staff, the most comfortable rooms and attention to detail! The food is unbelievable and service is great! The game drives was so special and the drivers are so friendly and give so much useful information! The kids area is so well thought out and cater for all ages, our daughter had a blast! Her highlight was her towel that was made into an elephant! Beautiful place...definite must!!!

Our Aquila experience. We had a fantastic stay at Aquila. The game rides were very exciting, we saw lots of animals and our guide was very knowledgeable. We went on a slow horse ride around the reserve and got to see many animals on this trip too.The Aquila staff were all very helpful and friendly. The food was top class and the accommodation was great. All in all a fantastic stay and I would recommend Aquila Private Game Reserve to all families.
Overnight Aquila. The overnight stay was worth. The accommodation standard very good and well mantained. Staff very friendly and welcoming. Food was great. Very Knowledgeable guide.

Great first game experience. Whilst we can not compare to any other game reserves as this was our first experience, we really enjoyed this trip. Within easy reach of Cape Town, from the moment we arrived at the entrance to the time we left we received very friendly, genuine service from all the staff. The guy who took us on both our game drives, was very patient and was constantly on the look out so that we could see as many animals as possible. At no time did the drive feel rushed and we had plenty of time for photos. Rooms were great and we particularly enjoyed our outdoor shower at 6am. Could not fault the variety and range of food available. Would highly recommend this if you want to see a wide variety of wildlife, at a very reasonable cost in very comfortable surroundings with staff who made us feel at home.

Aquila Game Reserve. We spent a lovely weekend at this resort. The staff were all well trained and friendly, nothing seemed to much trouble. The General Manager was a pleasure to meet with his passion for the future of the reserve and the community projects. The ability to observe the animals in such close proximity was humbling and falling asleep listening to the lions roar was just incredible. Really puts life into perspective.

Real touch if Africa so close to Cape Town. I treated my hubby to a surprise night away in Aquilla for his birthday. We thoroughly enjoyed the game drive and were delighted with the the plate of treats and drinks we were received during the adventure. The food was tasty and accomodation beautiful. We had lovely weather which I was grateful for but part of me also hoped for a cold night so that we ould make use of our fire place in our room but I can imagine that would have been cosy and romantic. It seems like Aquilla Private Game reserve is a well thought out establishment. The only suggestion I wud perhaps make is building a stand for guests to climb on and off the horses as that was quite a challenge for beginners. Lol. Thank you for the treat, even though it was only one night, my hubby and I came back relaxed and appreciative of our beautiful country again.

Aquila. Very nice welcome , the Room and Game Drives ! The Buffet's very good except for Evening Buffet , due to a Matric do ;Not enough tables and rather cramped upstairs . This the only blemish , otherwise a lovely stay .

Great family friendly safari. We were impressed with the family and young child features at Aquila. In addition while otherwise the smaller reserve area with animals can feel a little contrived it was genuine enough to be a great experience for those with kids that don't have the patience to drive all day with the risk of not seeing an animal. On the negative side the food was not that good and we noticed what looked like reusing of food from previous meals (presumably to cut costs).

Big 5 adventure in my own backyard. From arrival to departure the staff at Aquila made us feel so welcome. The Safari tours was well organized and tour operator was well informed and entertaining.. Tops all around.. Well done!! Just a pity the weather was conducive for swimming, that pool looked so inviting.. Highly recommended for locals and foreigners..
Visit. Staff unfriendly, tariffs way to high for what is offered, not a real game reserve, animals are given food in certain areas so rangers know where to take tourists.

LOVELY GETAWAY. A beautiful retreat away from the bustle of the city, Aquila offers excellent service in a peaceful wild life environment. The game drives are informative and was awesome to spend time around the animals
Game plus. They must get more game. The, bar chairs were not stable. The variety of the buffet lunch and dinner was excellent however some dishes were not well done. The room had a wood smoke smell.

Animal sightings guaranteed!!. We Stayed at Aquila Game Reserve from 10/1/14 - 10/2/14. Everything about Aquila was amazing. The Chalet we had was very nice, clean and comfortable. We saw elephants and springbok from our balcony the morning we checked out and tons of animals on the afternoon and morning game drives which made for incredible photo opportunities. I have been to Kruger National Park as well and barely saw any animals, I overheard other people on the tour that said the same thing. Of course Kruger Park is enormous so animal sightings can be rare. The great thing about Aquila being a smaller reserve is you will see animals and that's the whole point. The staff was very friendly and courteous and the food was great. There is also a very nice lounge/bar area with fire places inside. The drive to the park itself is exquisite. If you plan on visiting Cape Town Aquila Game Reserve is a must do activity and it's only 2 hours from the city! Highly recommend. Thanks for creating a memory that will last a lifetime.

An ok stay. I did the combo overnight - 2 game drives and a horseback safari.I had an enjoyable time, but I enjoy myself anywhere - within reason.This is not so much a safari as an outdoor zoo, and it feels like one too. The lions are fat and sleepy looking. Still that said, you get to see all the animals - so it's worth it in that regard. The horseback safari is lovely - but the website is misleading unfortunately. "A slow walk across the plains or cantering at full throttle is at the guest’s discretion". I'm a rider and was looking forward to cantering. This is NOT allowed and so a rather chilly slow pace walk ensued. The food is fantastic and the service fine. The whole place could do with a bit of an interior uplift. And change the music in the restaurant! Overall - average.
Great Midweek Break. We won this getaway, and were very pleased with the overall experience the staff were fantastic and we really enjoyed ourselves.
Great place to visit. Everything about our trip was well done... from the reception to the meals and everything in between, we were very pleased with our trip to Aquila.

Excellent stay!. My husband and I had the best time at Aquilla! The chalets were so cozy and romantic for our honeymoon stay and the safari was very exciting. Our guide Timothy was funny and very knowledgable. Fantastic!!

If there were 10 stars I'd give them! ***********. Four of us went for a whole day, which began with a glass of champagne to greet us; a superb buffet breakfast in a gorgeous restaurant, and time to wander round the grounds before we took to our safari vehicle (seating about 12) for a guided drive out into the reserve. Our wonderful guide knew everything about everything there! Imagine being almost within touching distance of lions, rhinos, zebras, giraffes, hippos, elephants, ostriches, springbok and various other creatures in the most spectacular landscape. We even had a stop half way round for a glass of chilled champagne in the sunshine! We went back for an excellent buffet lunch and as much time as we wanted afterwards to chill.There is the opportunity to go out on an escorted safari either on horseback or quadbike, or a day combining these. Tours finish up in the ARC rescue centre where we saw cheetah and leopard.There is accommodation there, some in thatched cottages where you might find elephants in your garden, and they will organise transport - which I think is complimentary - from Cape Town hotels. There are two swimming pools, too!Unforgettable. Memorable. There just aren't enough superlatives.

Aquila Lodge. Myself and my family stayed for 2 nights at the Aquila and it was fantastic we were well looked after and the safaris were excellent and very well organised, with excellent guides we saw the BIG 5 and the whole experience I will never forget. I had booked 2 lodges and they were great with a log fire fridge and bathroom with here we go an outside shower (when I say outside its an open roof) which when I saw it I was taken aback but it was great as the water was nice and warm and this was in itself an experience. The lodge had a fantastic swimming pool but when we were there it was a bit too cold to use the lounge bar was good with log fires burning which kept it nice and warm.And now to the food it was simply the best. The hot Breakfast Lunch and Dinner was so good and Lamb and Beef stew was to die for the women who cooked and served the food were so nice and could not do enough so much so when I had the stew the portion over ran the plate. There was also a number of staff serving drinks and removing plates. Drinks were not expensive and the staff was always on hand to clear the tables.The only thing I would say is wrap up well if you are on the early safari as in September it’s still a bit cold around 07:00am in September but get down to this place at least for a day.

Best Birthday. My husband and I went to Aquila Private Game Reserve for a treat for my 40th birthday. We enjoyed it so much! It was a wonderful experience to see the big 5 in their natural habitat. The food was delicious and everyone was so friendly! With our next visit we are bringing our children along.

Annual Holiday. First time visitors to SA from the UK we wanted to go on safari and since we were holidaying in Cape Town it made sense to visit Aquilla. We had two nights here and done three safaris. One word describes this place and that's "fabulous". Fabulous for the animals, the Rangers, the food, the accommodation, the staff and the most beautiful surroundings. Truly a magical experience and a wonderful part of our fantastic holiday in South Africa. We will definitely be back. Love Aquilla Game Reserve ❤️

One night at Aquila. We had a great one night stay at Aquila .Of special mention the person who assisted us in making this booking , Katooma , who went out of her way to accommodate us . Suggestions : As there were many foreign visistors who perhaps are not familiar with the delicious traditional meals which were served , I would suggest that a simple sign is placed at each dish describing the contents such as " beef stew" , etc.Also a good idea for the premier rooms are slippers and gowns .
we had a fantastic time!!. My hubs and I enjoyed our one night stay with two game drives! Everything is amazing about this place!

Safari. My family and I were extremely pleased with the Aquila safari place. The facilities were very clean, the food quality and quantity was perfect. The management and the service provided by the staff was excellent. I would 100% recommend this place and by far exceeded our expectations.

Aquila Facebook Competition. Aquila Game Reserve would be the perfect getaway before the crazy festive season begins. The reserve serves as a backdrop to what Africa really is, how the rest of the world sees us. I've only ever dreamt about going on a Game Drive to see the big five, even though it is right on our door steps. I would love to go to Aquila! And share this amazing place and memories with my best friend!

Make every moment count. It is no secret that I am a huge animal fan. I reside in an apartment and therefore can't even have a dog.I work online and am stuck behind a PC on the internet day in and day out. Nothing is better in this entire world than being around wildlife. I would LOVE nothing more than to experience the best private game reserve in SA. This is quality as its best , anyone who has been there raves about it=true story.Friends who have been here say that it is an experience in a million. It makes all the stress of day to day life in Cape Town worth it. This is an experience you are not going to want to end. The prices are VERY economical and it is an experience like no other. Best of all is it is situated near CAPE TOWN what more can you ask for? One moment you are in the hussle and bustle of daily life in the city and the next you are on your own private adventure....filled with all the best that south africa has to offer. THIS WOULD BE A DREAM COME TRUE xxx over and over and over and over again.It is places like these that make life worth living. It makes the stress fade away. A getaway to a magical destination filled with wildlife. True story last year I went to a little place near Cape Town and saw a giraffe for the first time at the age of 30 I fell in love and no jokes when I tell you that since then I have bought a huge giraffe carpet for my lounge, a giraffe necklace , anything giraffe I can find. There was only 1 giraffe and I was sad that it had no friends. I would love to experience nature at its best where wildlife has friends....I will fall in love with the animals and be in my happy place. Never been to a game reserve and after the year my boyfriend and I have had, this would be the ultimate.....should we love it which there is no doubt we will. we will return yearly. We are looking for a special place not to far from the cbd to be "our place"....this reserve could be it....P.S I have been dying to see elephants......especially baby ones

Great Safari. Great accommodations and food. The rangers were knowledgeable and got close to the animals. Amazing scenery and location. Would definitely go back. Also, saw Aaron Paul from Breaking Bad there!

Would love to experience Aquila Private Game Reserve. I have read only good things about this reserve and would love to experience it myself. Being close to nature, viewing the Big 5 on horseback and staying in their luxury accommodation, all only 2 hours from home sounds like an amazing weekend getaway.

Why I want to go to Aquila!!. I want to go to Aquila so badly - everyone I have spoken to raves about the place!!! My parents just came back from an over night stay and they said it was truly a magical experience. The game drives were fantastic and the food was out of this world they said!I would love to share this experience with my boyfriend!

Great complete getaway!. For the 2 nights we were there it was an incredible get away from the stresses of day to day life! Meals were delicious and service was great! Beautiful surroundings and friendly staff. Definitely a place I would seriously consider making a yearly visit to for a refreshing break!

Two days of blizz!!!. It was a wonderful weekend with delicious food, very friendly staff and great safari." A Wonderful experience. We went on an afternoon safari where the Rhinos gave us a wonderful, exciting show at the waterhole. The guide was so friendly and very patient while we all took photos. We had sun-downers on top of the hill. After the safari an elephant made out of towels welcomed us in our room. The buffet was superb.Worth visiting.
Magical place!. From start to finished we felt catered for. The reserve and accommodation is just magical. I would highly recommend Aquila. See you again soon!

A Great Experience. We were on holiday in South Africa and staying in Cape Town for a week. Because we wanted the safari experience but were unable to visit the more well known Kruger Park, we booked ourselves on the day trip safari to Aquila Private Game Reserve. It was an early morning pick up from our hotel, but watching the sun come up as we drove through the Hex River Valley was a treat. There was a degree of confusion on arrival as our group was not given any indication as to what to do. So we helped ourselves to a glass of welcome drink and went on through to the dining room where we enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast. After breakfast we were divided into groups and boarded our safari vehicle. Daniel was our ranger/guide/driver and he proved to be very experienced and knowledgeable with a great sense of humour (his imitation of a big cat had me going). Upon entering the reserve we stopped to watch the water buffalo while Daniel told us how dangerous and unpredictable they were. Mid sentence he stopped, and recognising a change in the stance of the animal leapt into the driver’s seat and took off while the water buffalo charged and hit the vehicle. WOAH that was scary! The rest of the trip was not quite as eventful but definitely awesome as we were treated to sightings of springbok, gnu, zebras, hippos, rhinos (in and out of the water), elephants, giraffes, a lioness and of course the water buffalo. We also visited the Aquila Rehabilitation and Conservation Centre where I was particularly impressed by the work being done there. (In residence at the time was a cheetah and leopard). The location of the reserve was stunning and their philosophy of responsible tourism sat well with me.
GREAT really enjoyed and all so friendly. We were kept on the go with game drives and quad bikes and great food -going back again -take cameras and warm clothes for the cool evenings

The Big 5 on my doorstep. We've been fortunate to visit Aquila a number of times. As a freelance journalist, I have always revelled in the fact that I get to visit these amazingly beautiful places and write about it afterwards. My other love is photography and photographing the elephants. lions, hippos, giraffe and all the other animals on the reserve bring me so much joy. It would be great to visit Aquila and just be able to take in the surroundings, enjoy the stunning Karoo vistas and not have to worry afterwards about meeting a deadline. I can tell you that Aquila is a wonderful place to visit. I love how the accommodation blends in with the natural elements of the landscape. The animals are a sight to behold and seeing them up close and personal is always a treat. The staff really go the extra mile and one is always welcomed back with a friendly smile and a 'nice to see you again'. What impresses me the most about Aquila is their Saving Private Rhino initiative, to ensure that these magical creatures live on and don't become extinct. I would love to visit again, even just for the day. But don't take my word for it. Try it yourself!

A must visit for families with kids.. Besides the magnificent facilities and natural splendour of Aquila. The memories and the knowledge taken from our visit will live with our kids forever. I highly recommend that families with young kids pay a visit and experience nature at its best - Big Five, Starlit Skies, Great Food, Relaxation ........

Getting back to Nature. From the time we arrived the staff were amazing. The bungalow with wood fire inside, corner bath and outside shower was great. Walking up to have a drink at the pool we were "greeted" by a Buffalo at the fence (even as a South African who has been to a quite few of our game parks, this is still a thrill). Trying to enter the area to do a game drive was a treat as some of the animals stand at the gate waiting by the looks of it for the "big escape!!" The guides were knowledgable and informative. We got to stop under a tree and enjoy a glass of bubbly with snacks while enjoying the surrounds. We saw lions up close and walking along a "koppie" looking majestically down on us, hippos bobbing in the dam, Zebra, various buck species and elephants up so close, you could see their beautiful eyes. Sun started to sink and we sat watching how the Hippo's, Rhino's and buck stood together eating Lucern (it was dry so extra food is provided for animals). Food was great and a nice variety to choose from. I braved doing a Horse back Safari (little bit wary of a horse) but had so much fun with my riding companions and guide. Perfect end to a beautiful stay and would recomend Aquila to anyone.

New experience to share with my daughter. I have never been, but I have seen the pictures and I am always having a look at the guests reviews . This is enough for me to decide that I have to go visit Aquila Private Game Reserve. To be amongst the wild life and to experience nature.

You Have to Visit Aquila. It's been a year since our visit and I still remember how great it was. We took a tour bus from our hotel in Cape Town to the reserve for a day trip. The ride out was worth it. The scenery on the way is breathtaking. Have your camera ready. The bus stopped for a break at a service station which gave us a chance to buy some snacks. We arrived a couple hours before noon and began our excursion. There is no bad place on the jeep née. If you are the photographer be near a window seat. The driver was wonderful about turning the bus so both sides could get pics. We had a champagne break before lunch. And the Buffett lunch was fantastic. Save room for desert because their sweets are yummy.

Aquila's brilliant reputation preceeds it. As a travel agent, I have sent many of my clients to Aquila Game Reserve and everyone of them have had raving reviews. I will continue to sell Aquila with peace of mind and great guest satisfaction

BEST SAFARI. WE DID BOOK 4 ADULTS THIS SATURATED TO DO THE HORSE BACK SAFARI AT AQUILA AND THEY HAD THE BEST TIME EVERY THE GUIDE WAS VERY GOOD AND I DON'T EVENS WANT TO TALK HOW GOOD THE FOOD WAS SO I PLEASE BOOK KNOW AND THEY HAVE A SEPTEMBER SPECIAL ALSO.he staff was really nice and they were really trying to give a quite unique experience and comfort us.But on the next day some animals were somewhere completely else, some we did not even see anymore and especially the lions on the second day were stunning and so interesting! When we left they moved up the mountains and all the animals seemed really wild and healthy

Worst service ever!!!. My parents and I went to Aquila for a break and had a terrible, terrible experience. The worst part of it all was that I emailed Aquila describing what went wrong. I emailed Aquila to ensure that I used the correct email, but no reply from them. I would of thought that they would just take the time in letting me know that they received my mail and will investigate - but nothing. This just proofs that they do not care about service - 4 stars??? I don't think so!!!!

GREAT EXPERIENCE. I visited Aquila private game reserve during September 2014. Everything was well organized and the game drive started on time. Food was amazing and more than enough! We got to see most of the wild on the farm. the only problem was that the Bar was not staffed and we had to wait occasionally for a staff member to attend to the bar. the rooms were clean and i loved the outside shower!

fantastic visit. We arrived on Monday 8/9/2014 were met by very friendly staff,after a welcome drink we were escorted to our beautiful well furnished chalet.At 3pm we were taken on a safari by ranger Johan who was very informative friendly funny and interacted vey well with all the guest's.The food supplied in form of a buffet was very well prepared and presented for breakfast , lunch & supper.We can really recommend Aquila although a small deserve it is very well run and is better than any of the bigger reserves/parks we have visited.

A really nice place with a variety of activities in the game reserve. We booked a two night stay with 2 game drives and 2 horseback safaris through Groupon. We did not expect too much because of some bad reviews. When we arrived we were welcomed warmly and everything was organized really smoothly without any problems. The staff was really nice and they were really trying to give a quite unique experience and comfort us. The accommodation was also really cosy, with a fireplace and what I especially liked was the stone-look shower which was outside and you could see the sky and it felt like showering in nature. If you have done many safaris and game drives you will probably be bored at this reserve because the routes are not too long and you see animals on really every game drive you do. At the first game drive we were a little bit disappointed because it looked like the animals would always be at the same spots so we did not really feel the wild life. But on the next day some animals were somewhere completely else, some we did not even see anymore and especially the lions on the second day were stunning and so interesting! When we left they moved up the mountains and all the animals seemed really wild and healthy. The buffet was also above average and the surroundings were just beautiful. If you are in Capetown for a short period of time then I would definitely recommend a stay at aquila. If you are on the other hand staying longer and can afford a trip to Kruger Park that would be for those who really can go on a full day safari where you are lucky if you see any animals.

Highlight of the trip. The scenery was stunning; I was in awe of the wildlife including the rhino within 10 feet of the Land Rover. The highlight for me was petting the cheetah and having it lick my arm. A little unnerving but what a thrill.
I visited in 2008.

A Real must if you are at the Western Cape. Great fun and loved every minute, very close to the animals and plenty of time to take pictures from the Guidewe received a lot of information about the animals, the food was delicious (African), after the for me too short-long safari ((3 hours) time past quick if you have fun) great to talk about the day at the pool, This is really something that you should do if you are at the Western Cape. Compliments to the staff, Guide and administrators of Aquila

One of the best horseback rides. I stayed at Aquila for 2,5 days and 2 nights and enjoyed every moment of it. From the start, I was very impressed with the professionalism of the booking department – in spite of the time difference, they replied to all e-mail questions and requests within a few hours, were efficient and accommodating. The driver arrived to pick us up from the hotel exactly at the scheduled time. Staff at the preserve itself is knowledgeable, accommodating, and efficient. This was my first experience with an Organized safari and I was not sure what exactly to expect, but I found the accommodations and food at Aquila beyond reproach. Guides at Aquila deserve a special mention. Not only all of them are very knowledgeable in biology and behavior of wild animals, but also highly dedicated to their work, to animal conservation, and educating of visitors. I highly recommend booking a horseback ride through the preserve. Mine was one of the best horse rides I had.
Big five. Hugely impressed with the condition of your animals AND of course how tame they are .AMAZING VIEWING for photography

The Sallie Family's review. My family enjoyed theie experience and the staff is very friendly, however the Ranger that we drove with was not involved.What I mean is, he did not interact, speak, explain, exchange information, not socialable and this is vital when dealing with people. This was disappointing for me, as previously I had a fantastic experience with a very educated Ranger who knew alot about the animals and shared his knowledge.The childrens play area was fantastic and my kids didn't want to leave.Thank you

Overnight and game drive. Hi,Value for money = good in terms of price for a 4 star accomodationBuffet food was disappointing - given a game park, would expect more than just chicken on offer. Could add more meat varieties. Deserts were not great in terms of choice. Game drives were long enough to see all the animals but guides were very shy. Guides did not educate visitors about animals and environment. Only basic comments. No excitement shown or not very enthusiastic.ARC centre too small for leopards and cheetahs. Felt sorry for these great cats. Accommodation facilities was excellent - however no warning about yellow/brown water coming out of tap - my bath was yellow and brown. No drainage in showers - or bad drainage of water if shower used.Mid afternoon- there was no staff behind the bar for over 2 hours - waited and waited for someone.The itinerary was wrong on our morning game drive. Email said 6am however game drive was only 7:30am - we got up earlier for no reason whatsoever.
Fantastic luxury game reserve. Great game drive, saw big 5 & more, great accommodation, lovely food and staff. Perfect for Kids age 10 & 14
Beautiful and relaxing. The staff were nice and friendly. Tours was very good . The game Reserve is need and clean and beautiful area.
Great resort, wonderful staff!. A wonderful break in quiet surroundings, game drives are exciting, staff friendly, food great. Overall a great stay!

What an amazing experience!. We did the overnight safari stay, driving up in a hire car from Cape Town. The drive was straightforward and safe. We were greeted with a glass of bubbly and then had a great buffet lunch. Our evening meal and breakfast were also lovely. The dining room was stunning - a large straw roof and wood African building with log fires ( they were needed in winter!). As there were 3 of us we had a bungalow - it was gorgeous. Our own log fire, a gallery second sleeping area, corner bath, patio looking out over the reserve. Nice attention to detail eg when we got back from the game drive the turn down service had been in and turned on our heating and put hot water bottles in our beds. That brings me on to the game drive - don't expect the Serengeti but prepare to be overwhelmed by the beauty of these animals in a natural environment. It is a huge reserve and the animals wander freely within this area (except for the lions who have their own area, but that's understandable). It was a struggle to get up at 0630 for the morning drive but it was well worth it. Our guide was so nice and very knowledgable. To summarise, we loved this experience. Try and stay, rather than just doing the day trip, so you get the overall experience.

Amazing Aquila Experience. Top class for this visit. It was so good from start to finish on an overnight safari. They squeezed in an extra game drive as well. Food, Guides, Accommodation was all first rate. The animals were fantastic and saw the big 5 on the first drive. lots more to see too. would definitely go back. Bonus meeting Penelope Cruz, Javier Bartem and family and seeing them out in the Park with us. excellent experience.

Too small feels like a zoo. What a disappointment. Not very luxery and the game reserve is too small, the safari feels like a visit to the zoo. The lions are behind a gate and they feed the animals. Much too expensive.

Pleasant, but far from mindblowing (***+). Very friendly staff, but the accomodation feels more like a backpacker's than anything else. We also enjoyed how easily you get in touch with others.We didn't expect a "real" safari, so the game drive was pretty much as expected and it was nice to get so close to the animals.

A good starter safari. A great starter safari suitable to take children on. It was very cold but we loved the little touches like providing blankets and hot water bottles on the safari drive. Staff were very attentive at the hotel and our guide, Timothy was very knowledgeable, making the game drive very interesting and fun for the children. Food was great, plenty of it and delicious.Accomodation was warm and very comfortable.The only down side was the booking process. Our booking seemed to be dealt with by a few different people who didn't know what each other was doing and so when we arrived we weren't sure what we had paid, how much we still had to pay or even what sort of accomodation we were in which slightly marred the experience. It was all finally sorted out by the efficient reception staff.Overall, though a great place and would recommend it to other families who are looking for a safari experience close to Cape Town.

Excellent Value For Money. Our 1 nights stay was excellent, the staff were friendly and helpful the accommodation was very comfortable that was in the cheaper lodges, the food was out of this world, game drives were excellent, a camera is a must. We enjoyed everything about Aquila. Can thoroughly recommend at least one nights stay, we liked everything about our stay. Have already told friends how good it was, will go back again on our next visit to Cape Town

Superb experience close to Cape Town. My wife and I had been here before, and we were in Cape Town with our young children at a later time - and Aquila was a perfect way for the children to get to see a safari close to town and in a more manageable way than "safari proper". Thoroughly recommend on all fronts - overnight well worth it if you have the time
A fantastic return.. Just as enjoyable as the first time. A knowledgeable driver made the visit a lasting memory. Good accommodation & excellent choice of food. Certainly value for money.

Big 5 ? - more like big SCAM. As a South African staying in Aquila - I can say nothing less than this place being an absolute waste of time, money and interest. This so called Big 5 park, keeps all its animals in enclosures, the same Game drives occur every day with herds of tourists being piled into massive trucks every lunch timer, the Game Drivers are useless making up nonsense, and the animals - well, they are sad - they have 1 Giraffe, about 2 buffalo, and the wild cats are all kept in cages.as for the accommadation, the stilt house that you see on the picture, well, there is only one of those, the basic rooms describing outside showers, are actually the only showers, no bath with the showers facing the parking. the houses are tiny with dirt tracks, no wireless and surrounding by the parking. the restaurant was buffet every meal, but the same meal, all the time, what was supper the night before, become the lunch the next datwe booked for 5 days, and we left after 2.5 - mainly because the Game driver told us that we were to do the same drive every morning and evening - BORING!!!!this is nothing more than a tourist gold mine - but please foreigners, i know that you are next to cape town, and perhaps its easy for you, but this is not a reflection on our beautiful country - this reserve is nothing more than a cash cow
Amazing. We were there early morning .They met us with a big smile, a non-alkholic drink, a big breakfast. A very amazing round through the safari, ended with lunch and rest.

Superb stay. A friendly greeting on arrival with refreshments. Despite a burst water main which caused significant difficulties for the hotel, everything was done to make us as comfortable as possible. When we still had no water in our room at bedtime, we were immediately offered alternative rooms and upgraded the following day for our inconvenience. The Manager and his staff went out of their way to look after us. The game drives were excellent with very well informed guides who provided us with a wealth of information about the animals and the Reserve. The rooms were spotless and designed to reflect an African theme, and the food was outstanding. We would recommend Aquila for a short stay safari to anyone visiting Cape Town.
Breathtaking. Thank you for having us! We had an unforgettable time. Food was delicious and staff was very friendly. We were very impressed with our game drives. Thanks again!

Closest to Cape Town. With limited time,but a desire to be able to experience a game park /safari setting with our family we were luckily sent information on Aquila which is within a couple of hours (scenic) drive from Cape Town. We spent one night, with a wonderful game drive on the day of arrival and a second one the following morning. It was a highlight of our visit to South Africa. Tim, our drive guide was great - informative and answered many questions, stopped and turned around when we spotted giraffe in the distance, let us follow spoor in the morning, we never felt rushed/moving along to a timetable. While it is not the biggest game park, we were still able to see the big 5 and it is a beautiful setting.Food and accommodation were wonderful.

alternative to see game without travelling too much. We liked the accomodation, but the welcome drink was crap. The food was average, buffet all the way. the hot water bottles in our beds were nice, as it was a bit of a cold day and evening, so this was a welcome surprise. the safari was lovely, all animals we hoped to see where there. And only a 2 hour drive from cape town, so it saved us a long trip to Kruger park. But don't expect to see lions hunting a zebra or something spectaculair. That you'll find in Kruger not in Aquila, as the animals are fed and separated, to survive.Price / quality, I Would say average. It is a 4 star accomodation price, but not a 4 star experience.
