I'd probably describe it as 'rustic luxury' - the furniture etc is slightly old fashioned and I don't think it would compare with a city luxury but it was clean and tidy and more than adequate for a night stay.Our only disappointment was that the beautiful pool isn't heated, so is absolutely freezing (we'd have been happy with 'refreshing'!) so it wasn't great for our little ones, we could only stay in it for a few minutes and it would have been fun to spend longer in it....

A Never to Forget Experience. The staff were friendly and professional and went out of their way to pamper us and make sure that everything was perfect. The facilities, game drives, accommodation and food were exceptional. What a wonderful and truly memorable experience!
Safari in a zoo. We were very disappointed since we expected something closer to a real safari. This was like driving in a zoo and the lions were a zoo in a zoo. The food was horrible.
Absolutely Wonderful. Great tour, helpful staff, saw all the animals we could hope for and stayed in a luxury cabin! Would highly recommend it.

Disappointing. Our hearts sank on arrival to see coach loads of people. Despite the impressive surroundings, the facilities were low-quality, there were coach loads of people and the food was awful. The staff serving in the reserve itself seemed disinterested; the standard of cleanliness in the chalet wasn't great and the outside paths and gardens were a shambles. However, the game drives were great and we saw lots of animals and the game rangers were very knowledgeable. If you go with very low expectations, you may end up being pleased but not vice versa.
Aquila Safari. The visit was good, accommodation and buffet food selections also good. need to improve on value for money.

Animal RESERVE. I think the RESERVE serves this place as a better description. Don't expect a very "African" safari tour. This is basically an area where the big five animals (very few numbers) are kept in captivity to be viewed by tourists. The staff members are great though, very informative and worth tipping! The buffet was a slight disappointment as all the foods are very normal. Remember to bring your swim wear as their pools are great for sun bathing. Make sure to bring durable wear and sufficient sun block as it a dusty, bumpy ride!

Aquila Reserve. We went to Aquila 2 years ago with some English visitors and recently in early March 2014. In that short period the pride of lions who inhabit 400 sq hectare's of land have almost doubled in size. They look fat and unhealthly, rather disturbing a sight for those of us who know how lean and dangerous these animals should be.The overall experience for tourists is undoubtedly memorable, but the question around captive animals hits home when you see what has happened to them. Are they better off in a park being fed to death or dead from poachers?Food was hearty, but not 5 star.

Been there done that. Game seemed orchestrated and not enough. Large viewing vehicles very impersonal. Good for overseas visitors who have never seen game or had safari atmosphere before. Accommodation good and catering too.

Beautiful spot. Picturesque landscape, amazing accommodation (like a cabin out of a movie set- fireplace and all), great service and got to see all the animals I was hoping to...you can tell they really care about their animals and work hard to conserving wildlife.

Perfect trip out to see big 5 and more. I travelled to the reserve with another 2 and it was great. The food was very good and it was a lovely, clean, large seating area overlooking the swimming pools and reserve.I loved that the workers seemed to really care about animals and it was amazing to see them in their natural environment. We saw all the big 5 and more with great information and facts along the way from our guide. The horse was a great experience getting very close to the animals in the reserve, seeing the rhinos was something I will never forget.

Fantastic Stay.. My husband and I stayed here for one night on my 40th Birthday whilst touring around South Africa. We had a blast... it was an amazing experience and would certainly recommend this game reserve.We stayed in a lovely cottage where insect cream and repellent was provided in case was required, We went to sleep and woke up hearing the wildlife and the roar of the lions. The weather was very warm but cooled nicely by air conditioning in our property and a nice outdoor shower. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room, a fridge and a safe which was useful.A nice terrace outside the property where we sat and relaxed watching the Buffalos'We arrived by midday, easy to park the car up under shades and then were greeted with a welcome drink and made our way to the restaurant for lunch, plenty of choice and was fine.- Lunch was included in the overnight package but drinks extra - drinks are very cheap to purchase.At 2pm we were able to get our key for our property and then shortly after joined our afternoon game drive.Our driver was called Abrial and was amazing, he explained so much about the animals and the land, including flowers, trees, a real insight into how the animals behave and their natural instincts.- Very friendly and informative. We had a couple of hours on the Game drive and stopped for champagne, nibbles close to the rhinos, a great setting and the views in the park are fantastic.We saw Rhinos, Buffalo's, Zebra, Spring Bok, Hippos although as so warm they were dancing under water with their little legs and then popping up for photos... We also saw the Giraffe, Elephants and the lions which are in a separate enclosure but you can get up close.The leopard was in a separate area by the game reserve.Also crocodiles.Dinner was included at the restaurant and again plenty of choice.We sat outside of the restaurant and enjoyed the view by the pool and the horizon. Every where is very clean and staff are all friendly and helpful. A very relaxed feel whilst you are there We had fabulous sunshine too.The following morning we were up early for the morning game drive, we left around 630am and saw again the animals by the watering holes, we had the same driver meeting him and our group after coffee and rusks. Abrial was such a lovely guy.The game drive was an hour or so and great fun.We then returned and had a nice breakfast sat outside in the sunshine and then checked out later that morningWe had a truly brilliant time.

Great Game Park Near Cape Town. Easy drive from Cape Town so can be visited as a day trip. Accommodation excellent especially the luxury rooms. Game a bit thin but all big 5 visible. Only disappointment was the food which was a bit cafeteria style and catered towards European and American tastes. The guides were very good and horse riding was fun. Very good place for an introduction to all the variety of game you can see in other parts of SA.

return visit a must. everything was just great except........there were no toilet facilities for the ladies while out on the 3hr game drive (specifically at the rest stop). I strongly suggest that u address this oversight.Thank you.

Overnight Safari. This was a great weekend break. Our stay was just what we needed to recharge our batteries. There was plenty of delicious food, attentive service and lots to see on the safari. Do remember to take your camera!

Staff excellent !. Our comments would have to be food, staff very good.Our accommodation was very nice, mezzanine floor was dusty .. our kids noticed !!!Animals, for kids 10 years old, fine but for us a bit sad, elephants look totally out of place need more trees etc .....finding the 1 giraffe um ! bit of a sad environment for certain animals. What huge lazy lions ! they need to find and run for their food ...... But our guide Tyler what a nice guy, does his job well and very considerate driver 10/10 Tyler !!!!Oh kids loved the pool, very nice this restaurant pool area ..... so good points and points to be considered.

Very good. I spent one night at Aquila private game reserve along with my wife and my son , it was realy nice , the reserve were very beutiful , the safari were perfect and we have seen many animals but the room were dusty with no TV The Food was good and i can rate overall stay as very good

Aquilla Fri 14th 1 day overnighter. Lovely atmosphere - rooms clean and great game drives. Establishment lacks public relations person or management on duty to oversee clients requests/complaints; ie; a special request of an anniversary cake was ordered from Aquila Head Office well in advance (and followed up with 2 phone calls prior to visit) which disappointedly wasn't executed. This I believe was due to no communication between lodge and head office. No senior management at busy front desk when vacating either. Little disappointing :-(

Stunning. Met every expectation and only a few hours from Cape Town. If we could have had a la carte on the evening stopover then it would be 6 Stars. Daniel, our guide was terrific, accommodation excellent and location superb. Honestly, there was nothing to really fault. We will repeat this trip the next time we visit the Winelands.

Great overnight stay at Aquila. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our stay at Aquila. We were picked up in a modern mini bus with 4 other guests from Cape Town and in 90 mins were at the game reserve drinking a welcome glass of champagne. We saw all of the big 5 on our 2 game drives, our guide was extremely knowledgeable. I disagree with people calling Aquila a ‘glorified zoo’, for our first Safari we loved it and really felt like we had a real safari experience. It was great to see the leopard and cheetah up close in the ARC. We woke up in the morning to see a buffalo metres from our door which was exciting. We stayed in a standard room which was nice, the outdoor shower being a highlight. The food was pretty good considering the amount of people being catered for. I’d definitely recommend Aquila!

Great experience.. We had a great time. The biggest complaint I have is that the Internet access was not very good. It kept dropping the connection. Everything else was great. The game drives were interesting and informative and the quad bike tour was great fun. We saw all the available animals except for the leopard running wild. The leopard and cheetahs in the enclosure across the road was very exciting.
Aquila. Lots of game to see, with knowledgeable and friendly guides. Nice rooms, the open air shower was a novelty.
WHAT A TREAT. A fantastic place to visit and stay, great staff/guides,excellent food, superb chalets -try it J&K DK
Aquila Private Game Reserve Review. Conveniently close to Cape Town. Boutique rooms are charming. Menu is buffet for all meals ! Unfortunately service is poor / basic.

Well worth a visit.. We booked for eight of us to do the afternoon safari tour. We arrived in time for a buffet lunch; all inclusive of the price. This was well worth it, we had a long drive to the Aquila game reserve and arrived in time to enjoy a lovely lunch, it was a varied selection of hot and cold buffet food with desserts. We had a quick look around the small shop (I do think they could make more of this with drinks/snacks and more momento's of the game reserve) we were shown to a large open jeep with enough room for us all to have a 'window' seat. Our tour guide/driver was very knowledgeable, he introduced himself and told us a little about the game reserve, the animals we would hopefully see and that we would stop for drinks half way round. We were able to see Zebra's, Rhino's, Ostrich, Hippo's and elephant's amongst other animals we were able to get quite close up to see the animals and were told some information on each animal as we were able to stop near each 'area'. The mountain Lions were in a separate part of the reserve at the moment; our tour guide explained that it is because it is quite a new reserve - only a few years old and they are building up on the animals before the lions can mix with all of the animals.At the end of the tour we were taken around their conservation area where they have rescued ill or hurt animals. This was followed by a much needed swim in a lovely pool in beautiful surroundings. I would recommend this game reserve to anyone wanting to spend a few hours seeing the Big 5 of South Africa without having to part with hundreds of pounds.FYI: The trip cost us around £85.00 each, it took us about 2hrs 15mins to drive there ourselves from Fish Hoek, lunch was 12:30 and we then waited outside to be collected at 1:30ish for a drive around until about 3:30pm.

Miranda. We were here on a special offer otherwise I think Aquila is expensive for locals (we are from Cape Town), but for overseas visitors, its a fantastic opportunity to see the big 5 so close to Cape Town. Food was good but not gourmet, service was excellent and the game drives good. Its great to be able to get so close to the animals, we got some great photos.
A lovely stay. Aquila PGR is a nice resort to get the feeling of really going on a safari. Food was good, drives were beautiful and our little cottage was just fine!

Three Day Trip. After having arrived at 15:40 and having done all the checkIn stuff I grabbed the camera gear and I went straight to my first safari.I thought, that the next five Safaris will not beat the first; I was wrong!All six of my Aquilasafaris were different and had their unique moments!Every ranger filled the space between the driving with their knowledge in their own special way.The breaks were very nice: beverages, Biltong, saussage, dried fruits, ... . More than enough.The foodsupply was owesome.Scenery, hilarious.Thumbs up and keep on, Aquila!!!!So I will keep up telling everybody about my experiences at AQUILA!!!!

An African Experience. Accomodation is very good, employees friendly and competent. During the game drives we saw many interesting animals. Recommendation: Conditions for the animals in ARC need to be improved.
Very nice visit.. Our room was ready at 3.00 pm. That was very late! But we had a free wine and a great gameviewing! Breakfast was again very late the next morning, but the food was very good.

Horse ride at Aquila Game Reserve. Wonderful horse ride through the Reserve - we had a great guide and it was the best way to enjoy the reserve and be close to wild life. Obviously we didn't go into the lion's reserve on horseback. The horses were healthy and responded more to word commands than any English horses would have. Also, they were not jaded by guest riders.

Game drives. The facilities at the Aquila are very good.I expected more of the game drives, very limited amount of animals.The visit to the park across the road to see the leopard (as part of the big 5) is below average. It is more like a zoo. You can even stroke them.

We had a great time at Aquila. Fantastic experience, great staff and especially efficient maintenance team that fixed the jaquzzi in unit 9 literally within in 10 minutes of my notifying reception.Please heap much praise upon them on my behalf.Lovely chalet and good food and the impromptu Emu entertainment iro fighting to keep my potatoes on my plate. Aquila will definately be a l memory to last a lifetime .Hope to vist again in the near future.Once again many many thanks .

more like a zoo. The room was great, the view of the Karoo was nice, the pool fantastic, the buffet was mediocre, the staff very friendly, the waiters untrained. The "safari" was not really a safari having been on a few--very few animals and caged in overweight lions, just two elephants, two water buffalo, a few lions, some zebra and some springbok. Within the first 5 minutes of leaving the hotel you saw 80 percent of the animals since it is all planned out that way. Really just an assembly line of jeeps. The last part of the tour you were out of sight of the hotel so it felt slightly more like a real safari. Meant for foreign day trippers who have never seen animals outside of a zoo and don't know any better. It could be MUCH better but obviously they don't feel that they need to improve the conditions of the animals because the place is PACKED with hordes of bus groups! It only gets nice and quiet at about 4pm when all the day people leave. So overall a disappointment but fine if you have little expectations.

2 dutch girls had an amazig time. We had a two day safari, it was an overnight safari. We slept in a standard room, all you needed was there! It was our first safari experience and we loved it. Everything was well organized and we had plenty of time to take pictures, we could really enjoy the animals. Our guide Daniel was great!, he had a lot to say and had a lot of humor! We have really enjoyed our safari, we like to come back one more time!Amber en Miriam

DISAPPOINTING VALENTINE'S EXPERIENCE. Aquila Game Reserve near Touws River in the Western Cape may offer a good experience to day trippers but don't go there if you want exclusivity, pampering or even real luxury. We made use of a special offer in a magazine and booked one of the Premier Luxury Chalets for two days to celebrate Valentine's Day. The bedroom in the Premier Chalet is small - two chairs and a small table is chucked in a corner and not very inviting. The bathroom is quite spectacular and carved in the rock but that space could have been better used in the bedroom. The verandah does not have adequate shading and therefore cannot be used on a summer afternoon. One of the bed lamps's bulbs was not working and there is no desk which means that you have to sit on the bed to use the Wifi connection. There is no dressing table in the bedroom and you have to run between the hair dryer in the bedroom and the mirror in the bathroom to style your hair. The cupboard is very small and not sufficient for dresses. Don't expect gourmet food - everything is mass produced and the only way of eating is buffet style - morning, noon and night. The restaurant is unbearably hot and you have to specially request to sit outside. Our monring game drive was rushed with little information given but the afternoon drive was better and longer and guests were given dried fruit, nuts and biltong snacks as well as water and sparkling wine. No night chocolates or bed preparation though and don't expect clean laundry on the second day of your stay. We had to ask twice for replacement coffee and milk as well as tissues in the bathroom. We had to ask for a glass of sparkling wine on Valentine's night and was told it has run out but after complaining, the head waitress, a gem called Anastasia brought us two glasses of sparkling wine - and that was the resort's only Valentine touch. The overall impression is that this resort focusses on day trippers while overnight guests are neglected. Don't go if you have visited game lodges in the same price range in other parts of South Africa such as the Kruger Game Park in Mpumalanga, game lodges in Limpopo or Kwa-Zulu Natal because you will be disappointed. Overseas guests with limited time will enjoy the day trip though as they will be able to see the Big 5 (although the only leopard and lone cheetah are kept in a sanctuary). The staff are friendly though and liquor prices in the quite beautiful lounge are very reasonable.

safari at aquila. This is a great day out from Cape Town with a flavour of what wild Africa is like. The guides and staff are charming and enthusiastic and it is great to see animals roaming freely in an open setting. The elephants and the hippos put on a real show for us at the watering hole. the accommodation is lovely - even the cheap option- and the food wholesome and copious. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Fantastic experience. We stayed overnight at Aquila on Feb 6th and absolutely loved it! The facility is VERY nice, the staff is great, and we had the BEST tour guide in Daniel (although the Cape Buffalo don't particularly like him!). I highly recommend it if you are staying in the Cape Town area, it is worth it, even if you day trip it and catch the afternoon game drive.

Just okay. Being the first pick-up on the minibus, it took 3 and a half hours each way to get here.On arrival, we were handed a glass of champagne or grape juice, and then into the restaurant for a gorgeous buffet breakfast.We then went to our jeep, which should have left at 10.15, but we didn't leave until 10.35, as we were waiting for other guests to arrive, which was a bit annoying.We drove around the park and the first part was the fenced off area where the cheetahs live. They didn't come out, so we just stared at the barbed wire for a few minutes until the ranger asked if we wanted to continue around the park. Luckily, this was the only caged area, as if I wanted to see animals locked up, I could have gone to the zoo!The next stop we saw some zebra, which was nice, and the ranger gave us some facts about them which was interesting. We then saw antelope, a rhino mum and her baby (awwwww!), elephants, buffalo, lions (they are fenced off from the other animals to stop them from eating them all) and ostriches. We also saw the hippos poking their noses up from the watering hole, but they didn't come out. The giraffes were elsewhere, and it was a shame not to see them.Annoyingly, we were then returned to the restaurant for an early lunch, as they had a large party arriving shortly - so not only were we late to leave, but also early to return! It would have been nice to have spend more time, and maybe spotted the elusive giraffes.Lunch was delicious - a hot buffet with a good choice. Drinks were extra. After lunch I lay by the pleasant swimming pool (bring your towel and swimsuit) and sunbathed until 3pm when it was time to get back on the bus to return to Cape Town.This trip cost £140, and I did it because I didn't want to come all the way to Africa and not see animals in their natural habitat. However, I'd have seen more animals if I'd gone to a zoo or safari park, albeit they wouldn't have been roaming free.The plus points were the food, the nice swimming pool, and seeing a few beautiful creatures up close and personal. The bad points was the extremely long drive, late start and early finish. Would I recommend it? For £140, no, I wouldn't come again.

Feedback after overnight stay. We have just returned from our holiday in the Western Cape to Perth in Australia on Queen Mary 2. Our overnight stay at Aquila was certainly a highlight among the wonderful experiences we have had since mid January when we left Perth. The visit to Aquila exceeded our expectations in every respect, and we will remember it for many years to come, thank you.

Worth visiting. Excellent combination of game experience and sunbathing by the sizable pool! Truly enjoyed it! Great service, tasty and good variety of food, very comfortable rooms and beautiful nature. Game is a bit limited, but with an excellent ranger (Daniel we had was perfect) still lots of excitement, learning and fun :)

Game viewing up close. We took a Woman & Home promo 2 stay for the price of 1. This was really worth it as it included all our meals and 2 game drives. We only stayed 1 night - so took the Standard Rooms. The Premier Luxury would be lovely if you are staying for longer than 1 night. The Standard rooms don't have a view but we woke to see Buffalo just outside our chalet. Our guide Daniel van Wyk was very knowledgeable. Some excitement for us was when the Buffalo rammed our truck. There arent a lot of game but because it is small you do get to see a lot in a short space of time. It is wonderful that Aquila help in rehabilitation of beautiful animals that have been abused by humans. The staff are friendly. Buffet at the restaurant served great food. We did find out last day very rushed because the game drive is about 2 - 3 hours long starting at 6:30am but you have to check out by 10 am, so we rushed through our breakfast which ends at 10 am as well. All in all, beautiful sunset, lovely pool area, great food, great game. A wonderful place for a getaway from Cape Town especially as it is only 2 hrs away and an easy drive.
Wonderful. Excellent for people who like to see wildlife up close. A good introduction to safari on a small scale.

PERFECT GETAWAY. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the reserve, room, food and staff excellent. just thought the checkout time was to early as I had to rush from my morning game drive, breakfast to pack and leave the room. Should you at least let you stay till 12pm. Also I found that the Quad bikes and horse back riding to expensive. R950.00 per person. Should have family discounts or packages.My daughter of 2 had a great time looking at the animals. Maybe could have sime tame animals for children to interact with. Otherwise what a great and beautiful place for a weekend or day getaway.

Beautiful Landscape. First time to Cape Town and SA, didn't realize the beauty of the scenery. it was spectacular. Aquila was perfect. lovely chalet, excellent food. small private reserve with beautiful wild animals. never been so close to a lion before. Thoroughly recommend.

Well worth a visit. Don't expect to be out in the open wilderness with animals coming and going as they please. This is a very good fenced-in game park with separate enclosures for the lions and their would be dinner. You probably have seen the same animals in your own country in animal parks but there is nothing like seeing them in their own habitat. The lodge area is lovely and well worth doing the overnight stay if you can. Having a beer outside as the sun goes down behind the hills is amazing. The rooms are clean and ours had an outside shower which was fantastic. Breakfast was excellent but dinner and lunch not quite as good with tough meat. Shame they didn't do a BBQ in the fire pit outside. The tour trucks were very comfortable considering what they had to put up with and the guide / driver we had was excellent. If you do the overnight you get the evening safari and the early morning one. Definitely the best way to do it.
Superior. Excellent stay. Excellent rangers! However , please train waiters to be more focused on tables and service. Rooms gorgous,

A great Weekend Break. Having read a few reviews, I was a little worried before I arrived, but Aquila is a really lovely place! You cannot expect a Kruger National Park experience, but for a game reserve only two and a half hours from Cape Town, it is a great experience. The game drives were lovely and the guides were very knowledgeable. You get two game drives a day (as a resident guest), and even by the time we had our fourth one, we were not bored. We also did a horse riding safari, which was very nice, lovely well kept happy horses. The food was good, some thing for every one. The rooms were lovely, we stayed in two different types, both were well decorated, and I loved showering out doors, with the stars shining down. The young adults we were with did the quad biking and just loved it, Well worth the trip.

Aquila. Very nice experience. Great game drives - saw all main animals etc. Nice sundowners on game drive in the reserve. Provided a babysitter for me at last minute which I appreciated so I could have adult dinner and drinks in peace.Not so great: the 4 start family guest house - only 1 room had air-con. the other 2 did not and it was very hot at night. I expect that at least for 4 star. beds were comfy though.Food - loved the breakfast buffet the most - the lunch one was okay. dinner not so great - only option of meat was some chicken on the bone and cold fish. Dinner - would be nice to have a steak option or something.I had kids with me - so was a bit disappointed that play area/jungle gym/putt putt etc was all not operational - being worked on and cordoned off. But just bad timing I guess.

What a treat. Well we were pleasantly surprised - we hoped it would be good but it was much better than good. We were lucky enough to stay in one of the stone villas with a great view over the plain and an outside shower. But everything was really good - the safaris, the breakfasts, lunches, dinner, everything. We even saw two elephants walking across the plain from our bathroom window and you don't see that too often in Britain! We saw 4 of the big 5 plus lots of other animals as well. D & J.

Overnight 'safari' Aquila Game Reserve. Excellent welcome and service by the staff. Accommodations were clean and very comfortable. Food was really good. Keeping the food warm meant that the food serving area is exceptionally hot compared to the dining room. The safari was interesting and enjoyable. We would have been interested in learning more about how the reserve takes care of the animals e.g. feeding, veterinary care etc. We would recommend Aquila to visitors looking for a mini-vacation 'safari' a short distance from Cape Town. We believe we received good value for money.

Not worth time. When we arrived according to Google Maps we couldn't find the game reserve. It appears the GPS coordinates we got from the confirmation email was incorrect. When we got the correct ones we found out we were 90km off. So we missed the morning day tour and managed by phone re-book ourselves to the afternoon day tour instead. When we finally arrived, we had to argue with them for an hour at least before they gave us back the difference because they sent us the wrong GPS coordinates and brought us to a wrong place. The price of Morning and Afternoon day tour are not the same. We saw just 2 elephants, 2 rhinos, springboks, zebras, ostriches and 1 hippo which was mostly under the dust water. Everyone in the truck (we were 24) could barely see the one lion and one tiger in a very far distant up in the rock. The guide told us the animals usually hide in the afternoon because of the heat. The people in the game reserve are doing a terrific job to preserve the wildlife and protect the animals.However, it was a bit expensive for what you get and certainly not worth the time if you drive all the way from Cape Town. Expect the drive time from Cape Town is around 3hours one way.

weekend. Little too commercial and got very busy on the Saturday, would be better if they seperate day visitors from guests staying overnight.Overall great experience if want to get up close to the big five.Rangers very knowlegeable.Quad safari a very unique experience
Excellent. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and experience at Aquila. We have recommended the Game Reserve to family and Friends and intend returning to Aquila on our next visit to South Africa.

Wonderful. First class game preserve, arrived to a champagne welcome, then had an excellent buffet breakfast. The lodge and grounds are beautiful. We then went off to see the preserve. Unfortunately our guide was pretty useless, and only explained what we were seeing when we asked. We stopped for champagne during the tour, and the tour guide even imbibed! A little disconcerting since he is responsible for our safety. The animals appeared healthy and they also have a rehab/rescue for animals saved from "canned hunts". We returned to the lodge for a wonderful buffet lunch with very good selection of foods. (Even for a vegetarian like myself who does not normally like buffets) the friend I was with had been there a couple times before and they noted their tour guides were excellent, so I guess this guy was atypical. They also said the food was a lot better quality this visit with a much more expensive selection than previous. only other disappointment was there were no giraffes.

Great safari experience. Rooms nicely set out and the actual safaris were great - guides are knowledgable. Staff at the restaurant however were not always responsive and had to ask repeatedly for things.

A little disappointing. The reserve isn't under 2 hours from Cape Town, more like 3 hours.The lions are kept inside a fence inside the main reserve as we were told there are not enough other animals to support the lions hunting so the lions are separated and fed by the park rangers. There are just 2 elephants and 1 giraffe in the reserve, along with an unspecified number of rhino's (we saw 2) and zebra, springboks, ostriches etc. The crocodiles, and leopards are outside of the reserve across the road in the rehabilitation centre. The accommodation isn't luxury.... We were first put in a room with a tin roof until we showed the (very unhelpful) receptionist that we had booked different accommodation at which point she threw new keys at a ranger and told us to follow him.The booking process is difficult, at one point we had two bookings, then none, then the reserve tried to charge us more for the trip than the booking stated because 'the agent who made the booking had left the company' Overall it was expensive for what it is.Good points were the rangers, we had Tyler and he was excellent; very knowledgeable and clearly loved his job which made the game drives a pleasure

Big 5 Not Quite!. We visited Aquila on Tuesday 21/01/14 for a half day Big 5 morning Safari. We arrived to be greeted with a welcome refreshment and were checked into the resort. Earlier reviews are very fair, Aquila is a resort and a lovely one at that. The setting, facilities and food were excellent however the Big 5 Safari experience was a little disappointing. Having not seen the Big 5 together in one place this was an exciting trip for us. The safari trucks made for a comfortable journey out on to the reserve, however the guide was very inexperienced and lacked knowledge. By his own admission he had only been doing the job 4 a few months. We first saw the white rhino; 4 females. These are the only remaining Aquila rhino, as poachers have claimed the lives of the 2 males the resort previously owned. We were lucky 2 see these rhino as they are habitually very shy, however as other reviews accurately state this is not quite the authentic Big 5 experience you bargain on. The 2 male elephants were our next sighting and we watched them play in the mud at the watering hole. Again no sign of a heard, neither of any females! Not what you would expect in a natural habitat. The Buffalo once again were only 2 in number and the setting not as authentic as hoped. Whilst the Lion reviews are accurate and these magnificent animals are caged, their roaming area is large. We. enjoyed the lion interaction and the opportunity to get very close to these beautiful creatures. Again not at all authentic in real Big 5 terms, but enjoyable none the less. The Leopard was a beautiful creature but once again, previous reviews are 100% accurate. This animal is in captivity in the rescue centre, as it cannot be released back in to the wild as poachers have claimed her claws. This for us was a cheat on the Big 5 as the leopard was completely captive and will not be released. Aquila is a lovely resort and we really enjoyed our trip. More time and money has been spent on the resort and not the animals which is a shame. Big 5- not quite!

Not really a safari. I had never heard the term - Big 5 before so I felt ok about booking and going. We booked through our guest relations team at Nox Rentals in Camps Bay. We decided to go with the collect service as opposed to driving ourselves as the trip was 2 hours there and back. So between the four of us we paid about £130 each, had we driven ourselves it would have been about £75 per person. We were collected on the morning of the trip by a minibus and whilst I don't have problem with a minibus, it certainly wasn't worth over £200 for four of us to share with another 6 people. As for the safari, it was good and we did see the big 5 and we were able to get very close and I took some great picks. The ranger was very knowledgeable and made the trip around the park interesting. The welcome drink was nice as was the breakfast and lunch.

No repeat visit. We enjoyed the tranquility and seeing the animals. Guides were good. Staff very kind and helpful, yet under-trained for an expensive resort. Accomodation was shockingly under-whelming at the price. A few more big animals will give more credibility. Suggest big waterhole close to and in full sight of main building. Can't recommend to friends and family without a 'warning'

All lies and very disappointing! Do Not Support this reserve please!!. I visited this reserve in November '13, all the advertisement in Cape Town pointed to this Reserve to be the best, and closest to Cape Town, offering the Big 5. So being an animal lover I thought it would be great! I was disappointed and saddened at what it actually was. We turned up after a two hour drive to a gorgeous resort, but that was it, it was a resort. On commencing the drive needless to say I was giddy, but all that stopped when it actually dawned on me that this is pretty much a zoo. It is good for the ignorant, who thinks wherever you turn in Africa you are going to see a lion or elephant, but if you are an animal lover you will be disappointed!!It started with only seeing 2 of each animal, two wildebeest, two elephants and two water buffalo, all of which like to be in herds. Then on to the lions which I'm pretty sure aren't meant to be contained behind barbed wire and fencing and pretty certain a brick hut with a tin roof is not their natural habitat!! A part of the big 5 is the leopard, this was my sole reason for this trip, there was no sign of any leopard or any trees in which a leopard would hide, it was only when visiting the 'ARC' the Aquila rehabilitation and conservation area we saw a leopard in a cage on a tin roof. We were informed that it had been rescued and was due to be released, yet this was the only leopard they had, and they had advertised the big 5. They have no intention of releasing that leopard.I would definitely not visit this RESORT again instead I would pay a little extra and go to Addo Elephant Park or further more to Kruger, where they show interest in conservation!!Please DO NOT support this Reserve!!

Good time at Aquila. Excellent game drives with a knowledgeble guide who had a great sense of humour. Very friendly and efficient staff, however the food is potjiekos, which is not to everyone's taste, and for the price I would have liked an a la carte option. We stayed in the standard chalets, which were clean and functional, the bed was fantastic and we loved the outdoor shower and listening to the lions at night. Good idea by Aquila to provide insect repelent. Pity there was no fire pit the night we were there as I was looking forward to the experience. Aquila is very involved with the Saving Private Rhino project, I would have liked to see more awareness around it, such as an exhibition or photographs, and have the Guide tell us about it, particularly as Aquila lost two rhinos to poaching.

Great time !. Aquila Game Reserve is not a national park like the Kruger but we had read up & choose this reserve as they do not allow hunting on their land ! We were not disappointed it was great our guide Godfrey did a fantastic job telling us about the reserve & the animals there , he also told us about saving private rhino ! You maybe could go to bigger reserves but most have of them have / allow hunting ! The accommodation & food were great to , the scenery stunning , next time I go I will do 2 nights instead of 1 ! Happy Memories thank you Aquila !

Big 5?. After our stay at River Manor stellenbosch and the wedding we stayed overnight at Aquila. We chose here as we did not fancy a long distance to a game reserve further north. We felt it would be similar to doing Euro Disney first before Disney Florida. This proved to be right an ideal taster for the bigger game reserves such as Kruger etc. it was a great experience though as in our first four days in South Africa the most we had seen was a Grey Squirrel! Would recommend just an overnight stay and two drives. The welcome, food and service was good with the best swimming pool which we did not use! The drive to see the animals were excellent with Michael our driver providing a good tour. We got very close to the animals with great pictures. Main disappointment due to the habitat no trees was only two elephants and one very lonely giraffe. The drive and other animals were a good compensation especially the bubbles stop in the middle of the park with the hippo's, rhino and zebra. The accommodation was good as well, clean and tidy, large bed and outside shower. We were in an end cottage near the park gate so lovely to wake up with the animals so close. You could go on horses and quad bikes but we preferred the lorries which were comfortable enough and plenty of space and views to take pictures. Overall cost for the overnight stay with all food included was around £260 so fantastic value with the current rand situation.

Aquilla -the most beautiful resort with fantastic hospitality and total beauty. The most beautiful resort with wonderful game drives where I saw and photographed the big five and have since blown up these photos to use as wall hangings ,the weather allows for very professional looking artworks. The hospitality of staff is wonderful with very high standards in food ,residance as well as all extra game drives and wonderful veiws of the rehabilition centre where one can see how animals not respected by other people are going through rehabilitation ,A wonderful sight to see . This resort is" worth it's weight in gold " with everything to have been of a wonderful five star standard

Poor communication. While the stay at Aquila was nice, the miss-communication between the booking office and the reserve is pretty terrible. I tried to confirm my stay a total of 5 times and still when I arrived at the reserve after a 8 hour drive, they were still unsure whether my booking was confirmed or not. I found the booking office team pretty uninformed about the reserve and got the feeling that they were just 'handling the money' and had no real interest in the guests questions. I would have expected the team to be a bit more organised given that I was a paying close to R7000 for 1 night!

A New Year's Eve & New Year's Day To Remember!. I dont think that there would be any place else that we would want to bring in the New Year other than at the Aquila Private Game Reserve. Our holiday to South Africa was wonderfully planned by Blaze Tours & Travels Pvt. Ltd., Mumbai, India [www.facebook.com/blazetravels], who made sure that we spent New Year's eve & New Year's day at this beautiful property! Right from the service, to the food, to the room, to the safaris and the animals on view, everything was top notch! How could we ever forget the beautiful peacock that danced for us every morning at breakfast time and the playful wild elephants who tried their best to sneak into the Game Reserve at every given opportunity! My senior citizen mum was so well looked after, that she too thoroughly enjoyed her experience here. I recommend Aquila Private Game Reserve to even families with children, as this is a getaway where there is something for everyone to enjoy! Kudos to Blaze Tours & Travels Pvt. Ltd. for introducing us to this slice of heaven! - Jamshed & Silloo Variava, Mumbai, India
Perfect stay!. We had a great time,Food was excellent.We went with 2 small kids and than Aquila is a great place to be and not to far from cape town. We will come back soon!

Perfect in all ways. We had a magnificent time, The buffet offered for Breakfast, lunch and dinner was varied enough to cover any taste buds. The game drives were comfortable (walking shoes not necessary). The quad bike drive was phenomenal, it feels like you are REALLY there. The luxury cottage was very clean and styled perfectly for the location (also, the bed is so big it could probably sleep 4!). We had breakfast at the restaurant, with the infinity pool running into the reserve's grounds with elephants just wandering around! Majestic. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

The good and the not quite so good things about Aquila. Overall a good experience with the animals being the stars. Stayed overnight and had 2 "safaris" one afternoon and one early morning. Our guide on these was excellent. Great opportunity to see Lions, Rhinos, Elephants, Hippos and many other animals in a "natural" environment. Room was great (mezzanine so good for a family with teenagers). The main centre of Aquila is nicely laid out with a large restaurant, separate indoor bar and long pool with "swim up" outside bar. Pool towels are available free of charge to borrow. The negatives were the overall welcome and food. The reception staff, unlike the safari guides came across as sullen and lacking in interest. They could do with some training in how to welcome guests as individuals and not treat you with disinterest. The food was also disappointing. All meals are buffet style. This is OK for lunch (very busy due to day visitors) and breakfast. But for the evening meal when numbers are lower (no day trippers then) it was poor. The food is basic catering and could have been so much better. A proper restaurant service evening meal would really improve the experience here. Overall therefore - good - as the experience of the safari is excellent. But be prepared for overall poor service, especially at reception, and don't expect anything much better than school style catering.

Fantastic. We are a large family and really enjoyed the overnight safari. Lovely food with lots of choice. Stayed in the standard chalets, very nice with air conditioning and insect repellant and bug spray provided which helped. Safaris were great and rangers very friendly and informative. Pool was amazing and great for the kids. Very nice staff. Definitely going again.

very pleasant stay. great option if you don't want to fly to Kruger. the overnight stay made it very comfortable indeed.only negative perhaps was the fact that the guide/ranger was very softly spoken and didn't seem very interested.great location and animals. the kids loved it!

Big Five "yes" but Safari "no". This is really not a place for doing a safari. It is more like a zoo were you can see the Big Five.Just a few animals inside (2 elephants, 1 giraffe, 1 leopard, some lions, 2 buffalo etc.)Animals are mostly on the same places so the so called rangers know exactly where to go.Did two safari tours and we saw exactly the same things twice.As the food is also very bad it is really not worth the money. Safe it and fly to Botswana or somewhere else.

GLORIFIED ZOO!!!. This is NOT a true safari... having been to numerous private game reserves in the Kruger National Park vicinity I can assure you this is merely a glorified zoo! Despicable to charge these exorbitant prices for what you offer! VERY few animals and the 'rangers' (or tour guides should I say) knew EXACTLY where to take you to see them (for example the ONE giraffe and TWO elephant) and the most offensive thing: having the Lions in a separate enclosure... I am convinced these animals are all fed as opposed to being in 'natural' surroundings and hunting for their survival... DISGUSTED!

The big five in a nutshell. The reserve is about 2, 5 hours drive from Cape Town making it very convenient as the roads are good. We did the "day" option. We were not based in Cape Town so did not benefit from the transport included in the price.However the drive was was through scenic countryside and a pleasure . We arrived too early for the welcoming drink but were able to do breakfast from 8 am. There was a fair selection of food, though the hot foods were lukewarm. Our game drive at 10.15am was efficiently organised and left promptly. there were about 15- 20 people in our viewing vehicle which needed a bit of maintenance. Jannie , our guide and driver was friendly and relatively knowledgeable. We saw buffalo and rhino in the first camp which all looked in reasonable condition and unstressed. If anything a bit on the fat side, It would have been better to make the drive a bit longer before seeing the animals,as the reserve was large.Taking pictures with pantechnikons in the background calls for skillful cropping. Then into the lion's den, again the feeding point was right at the entrance gate, but we saw a big lioness dragging a leg of something off to a shady place and two big black maned Cape Mountain lions. There giraffe and other animals like springbok, eland, zebra and buffalo. The elephants were great as they wandered close to the lodge and clearly enjoyed a mud bath in full view. Again a good selection of dishes for the self service lunch, Staff were friendly and coped well with the large cross section of tourists. Pros - you will see the animals, Cons - too many people

Aquila Private Game Reserve. A great facility with excellent accommodations in "hut-style 'hotel room. A small park that makes it possible to see the wild animals in a short time, yet in its real environment. However, getting a little zoo feeling with predators fenced separately.
good experience. We really had a great time here. The place was amazing and we did see many animals in this reserve. We would like to visit here again.

Safari. We were very impressed with our guide, who was very informative and clearly dedicated to the animals. We were disappointed at the lack of animals, and although our guide gave us good reasons for this, we feel that nothing is being done to solve the problems. It has been over 2 years since the elephants destroyed the trees which has caused a lack of food for the 1 remaining giraffe. the others died. Why not buy another giraffe to give some companionship to the remaining giraffe?. We did see the big 5 but if you want to see more than a couple of them in the wild. we suggest you visit Kruger or something similar

Well worth a visit. We were told by several friend to visit Aquilla whilst visiting Capetown as a couple of hours drive and worth the trip. We stayed in a cottage with our two boys aged 6 and 9 overlooking the park. In a nutshell i would say it was great although the quality of food let it down! Everywhere we were lucky to eat whilst in South Africa was first class and this was pretty low standard. The service was also rather slow! Our guide Daniel for the 2 safaris was outstanding...the most informative guide, friendly and answered every question asked. I would say to anyone who wants to see African wildlife up close, to make the visit but don't expect first class food!

Close to the animals!. This is not like a safari in a big national park, it is a reserve! Which means you're more likely to see a lot of animals in a short time, and as the animals are used to cars you will get pretty close to them. Very cool experience! We got to see all of The big 5, if we include the leopard at the rescue centre. The lodge was luxurious with african interior! The top one experience for us was actually just chilling at The large pool and watching elepanths and buffalos walking past by a houndred meters away. Perfect place for romance also. Good food and nice service also. Recommended!

Very disappointing. It’s like a bad zoo, poor animals are treated without respect, rooms were smelly, dirty and didn’t look at all like the website. It was all very massive, loads of people and no service at all for a sky high price. Really regret our visit!

Aquila Reserve. We has a great time at Aquila. It was good to see the animals and we saw them all. Accomodations however, we not particularly luxurious. We had a leak in our unit and workmen in the room most of the day. They kept saying it would be fixed but never was.
Good but a bit overpriced. If you have nver been to a lodhge up north you wouldn't notice but it was a bit 'fake'.Lovely get away though

2 nights at Aquila. We stayed at Aquila from 28/12-30/12 and overall, their food was good & service excellent.However, for what we paid, I expected more - certainly on the morning game drives. The afternoon game drives were fantastic.The rooms were not what I expected & the pictures on the website are quite misleading. We were given a room with an upstairs gallery, simply not suitable for a 2yr old child. On a whole - overpriced.

Fantastic. What an amazing place! We had a great time. Everything and more. The 2 games drives were really good. Just less time at the ARC centre would have been better and more time on the reserve. Great experience with our game driver and saw plenty of animals. Would recommend staying here

1st time safari. I was extremely impressed with the whole experience! Whilst the accommodation was quite basic it was very comfortable and we had everything we needed. The driver for the game drive was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and did everything possible to ensure we saw a large variety of animals. So glad we included safari into our 1st trip to Cape Town S.A. Truely an awesome experience not to be missed.

Enjoyable day safari. Have been on a day safari today and thoroughly enjoyed it. From arrival drinks to breakfast, lunch and the safari itself was all very organised and relaxed. The grounds are lovely with 2 pools which you can have a swim in if you fancy. We saw a lot of animals and even though the guides knew pretty much where they would be it was still a great when you did. Would definitely recommend if you haven't got time to do a full safari.
awesome. Just the right place to relax and chill.Thanks to everyone for the awesome timeWe will definitely be back

Ok option to see the big five . Went on high season and they were not able to cope with the amount of tourists. Too many jeeps, animals seemed distressed, buffet food quality and service weren't up to par with other things we did in Cape Town. Friends had a much better experience on low season. Our guide didnt have the best English and we were all lost on his comments so I didn't learn as much as I hoped. Nice views and beautiful animals. Service was the problem. Good 3 hour drive each direction with provided transfer

Very good resort. Perfect resort, eccellent wllcome. Ideal pool. Rooms very good and very ok safari!
Very fitting for 1st time visitors fir safari.
Will recommend fir sure!

Aquila rip-off. Our stay at Aquilla can only be catorgrised as a complete rip off. We had booked this resort early on in 2013 paid a 50%deposit. On arrival the reception took my credit card to complete the reservation payment and without notification added aprox R10000.00 to the bill saying that the rates had changed since I booked ( and had written confirmation.) After an ugly fight without even as much as an apology the money was refunded and the " good news " broadcasted that they would honor my quoted amount- not a way to start your vacation. Beside mice in our room and there was still quite a bit of mice droppings we had to clean, no nightly turn down service being shuttled in like cattle for a monotonous meal the weather was good. Anthony - South Africa.

taken for a ride. I found Aquila very disappointing. It is sold as a big 5 game park. The Leopard was in rehabilitation and the lions were caged. They have very few animals (2 elephants, 2 buffalo, 1 giraffe). Very very disappointed with our time there. Accommodation was good and food nice although seem to have picked up a bug there (as did quite a few of our guests). I would not got back and would definitely not recommend.
enjoyment. It was almost perfect - The secret for me was not to expect too much from a small game park and it fullfilled all our needs

Great experience. It's a shame some people don't look at what they're booking before going somewhere like Aquila and then complaining about it being something that it isn't.As the private game reserve that it is it's a great place and a good experience if you have time to visit. They're doing good work to help protect various species and allow people the chance to get close to them and learn about them. I only went on the day safari but the facilities were excellent and the food was wonderful. The game drive itself was great, with a knowledgeable guide who did his best to give everyone a good view of as many animals as possible.It's somewhere between a very large safari park and a traditional safari, but if you're short on time or want to get up close to animals in a good environment without having to head out in to the wilderness and all the expense that involves, then Aquila is a good choice.

Treasured Memories. I have just returned from the beautiful South Africa, and whilst there, was lucky enough to visit to Aquila Private Game Reserve. We arrived to an amazing thunderstorm, complete with forked lightening! The greeting was warm and friendly, and the first impressions were excellent. What better way to be greeted after a two hour transfer than with ice cold bubbles?! We had lunch before we checked in and everything was delicious and very fresh. There was a great selection, no matter your tastes. We then checked into our room and I was very impressed! We were staying in the honeymoon suite with an outdoor jacuzzi- perfect for a glass of wine, weather permitting! The room was very comfortable, with a large double bed and beautiful bathroom, complete with sunken bath. We were then taken out of the first of our safaris and were lucky enough to see the Big Five. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and spent time answering many questions. Our dinner that evening was again of a very good standard, and the service was excellent. The next morning we were up early for another safari, which was again great, other than a run in with a rhino who is clearly not a 'morning person'! The most special part of the trip however was the horseback safari. It was incredible to get up close with the animals, and we were lucky enough to get very close to a very friendly giraffe. Our guide for the horses was very friendly, and very funny and it was an amazing two hours. We also did the quad bike safari- not so great for seeing the animals but great for a bit of an adrenaline rush and blowing away the cobwebs! All in all, the stay was brilliant. The staff were excellent, the food great and the accomodation very special. We even came back to our room at night to find an elephant inside (albeit one made from a towel!). It is worth bearing in mind that this is a private game reserve and not a National Park, so they are limited in the number of animals that they have, but I would wholeheartedly recommend it as a very special place to see some beautiful animals in wonderful surroundings. Thank you Aquila. Suzi x

Very special experience. Beautiful accomodation, nice friendly staff, game drives very well organized, you see the animals real close. When we come back to South Afica we definitely will visit Aquila again. Thank you!!

Perfect game reserve. Excellent game reserve close to Cape Town, where you can find lots of animals. If you look for the real safari, you should go to Kruger. This is a game reserve, but still enjoyable. If you want to have a romantic overnight stay, ask for room number 10 when you book. It has perfect view over the reserve and it is quite intimate. The staff was great, the food as well. If you have time, stay overnight. It gives you plenty of time to enjoy the room, swimming pool and several available activities (horse back safari, quad bike safari, etc.).

Good safari experience for a young family. We took our 1.5 year old and 3 year old. After the reserve cancelled on us due to overbooking management stepped up and offered us a private car safari at no cost. I thought this was very good of them after cancelling the day before.This is a perfect safari for a young family. This is not the Masai Mara or Krueger so don't go and be disappointed. The reserve has some wonderful animals and scenery and should take about 2 to 3 hours. It is malaria free and is an easy 2 hour drive from Cape Town, 1.5 hours if staying in Stellnbosch. We found the food for breakfast and lunch to be good and the service was very friendly.They also have a small pony ride for the kiddos and you can do a horse back or quad safari if you book ahead.I would recommend for young families and those that don't have the time to get to Krueger or the Eastern Cape.They guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Are children had a very good time.

A safari experience easily accessible from Cape Town!. My family and I recently visited Aquila Game Reserve and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The food, accommodation and wild life experience was good. I would highly recommend Aquila for locals and for tourists with have limited time in SA.

AQUILA GAME RESERVE. Good Staff and good Restaurant.Accommmodation is looking tired on the outside of the standard lodges.Safari Guide was very knowledgeable. Giraffe couldnt be located but we saw the rest.Gift Shop very limited on stock,really needs a professional merchandiser hopeless selection and dark lighting.No literature available to take away for prospective visitors.BIG OVERSIGHT by the Management. Very Complacent attitude.

Very disappointing . My husband and went here during our honeymoon for a day safari... What a scam!!! It was 440 US.. The guide was terribly inappropriate speaking of what he would do to a poacher... Which I agree are terrible cruel people but what he said was completely obscene with children on the tour!!! The vehicles are awful!! And we couldn't get any good pictures since every animal we saw he would only pull up on the left side...I feel really bad for people that stay at the lodging it seems like they are trying to herd sheep rather than provide a quality experience!! Save your money and some other tour there are much better options than this!!!

pleasantly surprised. I brought some overseas friends for the overnight stay and was pleasantly surprised. They had never seen any wild animals , so it was great to get up close and experience some of Africa's big 5. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the chalet also has a good African vibe. Thanks I will bring more guest as it it a good chance to see game close to Cape Town.

Aquile Private Game Reserve review. -great welcoming, wonderful service and beautiful rooms-beautiful animal close-up! please do more to save the rhino, poachers should not be able to get to your rhinos. -what I did not like too much is that some of the safari cars were almost racing through the park, it should not be about getting to the animals as quickly as possible, but about enjoying nature and not disturbing the animals-what I did like was that our guide explained everything nicely and that he took his time with us to observe the animals- the buffets were nice-overall it was a beautiful stay

Good, but lacking in some places. . Pros-buffet food was good and plentiful. Outdoor shower was cool!Comfy HUGE bed and NO TV!!Loved the artwork in the rooms. Our driver Mike was very kind and knew a lot!Cons-no wifi in the back of the resort. Need more animals on the reserve (1giraffe). No front desk staff overnight. Small pool was dirty. No bonfire the night we stayed :-(Gift shop prices are OUTRAGEOUS $20 for a SMALL bottle of sunscreen. I opted to burn rather than be dooped).

1st Safari. The accommodations were excellent, pool was beautiful, food was outstanding. It was amazing to see all of the big 5, with such a knowledgeable staff (Alvin), and all so close to Cape Town. I have never done a true safari, and for those that have, this may seem a bit canned. . . But it was perfect for us.
bad service and bad food and almost no animals. only 1 giraffe! too much money, no luxury at all. Really too expensive for this. Service and food was bad!
Excellent facilities and knowledgeable game rangers. The staff are so friendly and the game lodge excellent.Complimentary arrival drink could be colder.

Thank you for a very lovely time. i enjoyed our time at Aquila very much. 1. Food excellent. Complements to the chefs.2. Service excellent3. Thank you for employing local people from Touwsrivier. Job creation on the country towns is very important.4. Employees are very well trained and they are very friendly and good at what they do.5. Drives were very good and good information given.6. The lions are very beautiful, but too fat. You need to sometimes feed them somewhere else than at the dam. They must get some excercise. I know you want to make sure that they are there to be seen by your guests, but they are unhealthy fat and lazy. If they can walk that hill a few times to get to their food, it will surely help them, because they will need to come down for water.6. Bungalow 21 had a lot of mice. I at least counted 3 which I could see at the same time, but there was quite a lot. They will attrack snakes which can be very dangerous to your guests.7. You need to plant more trees. Everybody knows that elephants are very big destroyers of trees. But they need tree bark as part of their diet and you need to get new trees planted. Most of the eucalyptus trees are dying and there are nothing else to replace them. Obviously you will need to protect the new trees against the elephants while it is very young, but you need more trees!!!

Amazing. My friend and i went to the Aquila Nature reserve and opted for the quad bike experience. It was a brilliant way to get up close and see the animals whilst having an adventure on the quad bikes.We got picked up from Cape town and had a 2 hour bus ride to the reserve. When we arrived there was a breakfast on offer which was included in the price of the ticket and it had a great variety of cold and hot options. Plenty to eat.From finishing breakfast we then had an introduction to the quad bikes and started on with our adventure. I won't spoil the surprise but it was an amazing trip. The tour guide was brilliant had lots of time for questions and was very knowledgeable. Also had a lot of fun on the quad bikes but was perfectly safe all the way throughout the trip. There is also an option for the less adventurous where a land rover will drive you around from talking to the people who opted for that option i didn't hear any negative words said.Couldn't rate the trip any less than 12 out of 10!! Brilliant life experience!

Disappointed. What a huge anticlimax... The resort has a "four start " rating and not once did I feel like I had a four star experience. The price you pay is just not great value for money at all. There is no private facilities for guests, so when the day visitors arrive they take over everything. The staff at the resort are not professional or friendly at all. When we left we paid our bill and didn't even get a friendly good bye or drive safely.The lounge area was dead and to get a drink was almost impossible. The only savior toothed trip was Janny our game driver... He was amazing and had loads of knowledge that he shared with us regarding the animals. The rest was a huge disappointment and I will not go back or recommend the resort.

Aquila stay. I live in Cape town and was very keen to see and stay at Aquila. My thinking was that price and the marketing indicated that this was a five star establishment. I was very disappointed with the value for money. The equivalent price in the sabi sands it would be five star. The staff were friendly. We were kicked out of the lounge/ club house at 11 because the staff had to go back to Touws river. This meant going back to the lodge which is not ideal for socialising. The food was very average and again value for money poor. If this resort was 3 star i would have had different expectations.Still wouldn't pay the price for the same experience

Attractive place near Cape Town. Small sized game reserve where you can see all animals, elephants, rhino, hippo, lions, antilopes,... in limited numbers.Very good service, professional organization, nice and well equipped cottages, lovely placeA little bit expensive

Disney meets safari!... Having done an overnight safari last time we visited SA we decided to try a slightly cheaper option. It was very Disney and all felt a bit forced. The staff seemed disinterested (except the game driver who was great) and the whole thing felt a bit processed. You are told to be there for 12 and then given a buffet lunch but not your room key until 2 and no game drive until 4. All a bit annoying as you just seem to waste a day just sitting about. If Safari is what you want maybe check out some of smaller places which are better value despite costing more

Unrath Group. We all had a good experience, our guide was very informative. We were disappointed we were unable to see the Water Buffalo. Accommodations were nice and the food was very good. I would recommend your Safari to anyone wishing to visit Cape Town, .

Taste of Safari. Magnificent setting, only a two hour drive from Capetown. We really enjoyed our time at Aquila, arriving in the afternoon, just in time for lunch, we then were able to relax around the pool with the Karoo as the backdrop. Then we had our first game drive. Although all these animals once did roam this area, because of lack of habitat, they are all imported, so if you wanted 'Real Safari,' you may have to try somewhere like the Kruger National Park but for us this was more than adequate and excellent value for money. All the 'Big Five' are there though the lions are kept separately to stop them eating the rest of the stock and the leopard is unfortunately of the rescue variety and she cannot be let loose because somebody removed her claws.We were brought back for dinner which was not quite up to the standard of the rest of the place but the accommodation was really good and had an open shower where you could look at the sun or the stars, depending on the time of day.We went out first thing and once again saw the giraffe, wildebeests, zebras, rhinos, ostriches,hippos and a very close encounter with the Cape buffalo but our luck seemed to be out with the elephants. As we were returning for breakfast, one of our party caught a glimpse of them and our excellent guide spent an extra 45 minutes taking us around them so we could have a great view without spooking them.We could easily have stayed for a second night. Marvellous place.

Excellent Aquilla Game Reserve. A delightful game reserve within a couple of hours from Capetown. The scenery is mountains with open prairie in between that is similar to sagebrush areas of the American west. We stayed two nights in a comfortable cabin and did 3 game drives. We were glad we did three as each time the lighting was different for photos and the animals doing different things. This is not an extremely wild/exotic place but fun for all ages. You travel bumpy roads in big safari jeeps. The eye-catching lodge serves super food buffet style while outside is a beautiful pool and lounge area. I would imagine that this area will get VERY hot in summer (Dec-Feb) so be aware when you book your trip. There was limited WIFI in our cabin but better in the lodge. The area is also malaria-free, a big plus. If you are in the SW Cape area of South Africa and have never done a safari this is the place for you.

A great experience. We decided to do the overnight tour with transfers and what a great experience it was too, from start to finish. The collection from Cape Town was great and its a beautiful drive out to the reserve. The setting and facilities are first class and the staff are friendly and helpful. Mani, our driver for the safari's had a wealth of knowledge on all animals and a real passion for his work which made the game drives extra interesting.

Pleasant stay. More info provided on itinerary for game drives and visiting the rehabilitated animals.Daily to ensure coffee and tea sachets in roomsFood was great and the environment fantastic.Overall a good experienceManagement were fantastic, friendly staff

Beautiful setting. Loved our stay there. The chalet was amazing, with a stunning view. Although this does not have the natural feel of a large game park, it is a very good introduction to seeing animals in the wild. I like the fact that it has rescued some of the big cat's from a cruel fate, which makes up for the fact that they were all fenced off. Helping the economy of the local town by only employing from there is also to be admired. Only minor gripes are that the food was not of the standard I would have expected, and on the game drive, no mention was made of any birds, and some animals were also missed, or ignored. Staff were very good and welcoming..

Stunning... Was disappointed by the amount of animals there are at Aquila, does not have the feel of safari as promoted. Other than that, it was charming, views were amazing, the feel was relaxing, food was divine. Staff were polite and helpful, any question we had they were answered.
Thank you all at Aquila.

exceptional stay. We visited Aquila as my sister from the UK was visiting and wanted o do something different so we decided on a visit to a game park and after much research chose Aquila.From the time of making reservations (Peter Nell) until the time we left It was a great decision.The food ,the accommodation .the staff, the game drive (a very well informed ranger Mike ) everything was incredible.I and the rest of my party highly recommend The Aquila game reserve.

Aquila game reserve. A great experience. Lodges were lovely, rangers knowledgable, facilities excellent. A good variety of animals on the reserve. Saw elephants, rhino, lions, zebra, springbok, ostrich and the single giraffe. Unfortunately we didn't t see the leopards or hippos due to the weather. We were very well looked after.

Spontanious Dismount. As I prepare for another trip to Capetown I realized that I didn't get a response to a letter I had written to Aquila regarding our stay in February 2013. As a side trip to our trip to SA for the Indaba Mining Convention we extended our trip to include a luxurious night in one of the chalets, which we found to be really charming and were quite excited to have this Safari experience. Upon arrival we were a little disappointed that we were made to wait by the pool before we could check into our room, and was even more disappointed when there wasn't even a bar open. However after lunch we were escorted to our room and then proceeded to a guided jeep tour of the Big 5. Our guide was very informative and gave us a great deal of insight into the poaching situation all over Africa. We then returned to our room and had a fabulous meal, with many wonderful flavours. I do have to say however the kitchen staff were much more friendlier than the serving staff.  The following day we were booked on a horseback tour, and when we had arrived to the site there was a bit of a mix up and our horses were given to another couple, and the guides had to go back to the corral and bring out more horses. Not a problem but they were super frisky and trotted out on their back legs. We mounted and the horses didn't want to go in the "safari compound" ( should have listened to them) anyway we did have a lovely ride until the elephant decided to chase us. We got bucked off and our horses ran away. In retrospect, with the weather changing and the animals agitated the ride probably should have been called off. My husband was hurt and here was the problem. I asked for medical attention for him and we were told to wait as they were dealing with an angry customer, who by the way was at the desk the night before about the same issue. I then asked for someplace for us to get cleaned up and look at his leg and were told a bathroom down the hall would be available. I insisted we have a room, and asked for ice at least. By this time he was shocky. I got him cleaned up and he was able to hobble back to the reception area, and our driver was trying to get the manager to at least speak with us as he did require medical attention and she told him we would have to wait until she had finished dealing with angry man about his transportation problem. So long and short, we headed back to Capetown for some care.  Lovely facility, great kitchen staff, but as for the horseback tour I would strongly recommend going by jeep. The horses were ill trained, and I felt the guide was not prepared for that situation. It could have been worse. And did I mention I am a trained equestrian, bucking horses are an occurance in my job.  Considering the amount of money we paid for the premium service, Im afraid it fell very short of that. But it was a nice place to visit.

A gem for South African tourism. Steel serving tongs in a hot cast iron dish is a no no, a finger burning experience.The game drive is the obvious highlight and the ranger Mathew was brilliant. He went out of his way to make it the best he could.The buildings are fantastic , so much thought and design went into the final product. The outdoor shower was great. Pity the gas heaters made our dining experience unpleasant - it was way too hot and a request to turn it down was ignored.
fantastic experience. the title said it all, good food, we have seen the big 5 and the giraff.location was OK. The staff was very kindly
GREAT. It was a nice experience not too far away from Cape Town, an overnight stay is recommended. The buffet and wines were good as well!
benign. The premium room was not worth the price, no TV, telephone and poor facilities, the dinner was mediocre. We left after one night whilst booked for two!Tte game drive was enjoyable.

A definite MUST!. Book at least one overnight to enjoy the star filled evening on your porch and the afternoon at the pool watching the elephants walk by. The rooms were just perfect. Take the safari in the afternoon and then the next morning and you won't be sorry. Our Ranger, Timothy, was very knowledgeable about the area, the animals and the people. This was one of our best vacations!

Beautiful. The park is amazing. Being so close and in awe of such beautiful animals was an experience not to be missed. The guides were knowledgeable and well mannered. And the rooms! They were stunning and very comfortable. Thank you for an unforgetable experience.

All right for one night. Nice scenic place, the accommodation was ok, I enjoyed the outside shower. under the stars. The safari guide was excellent and made the visit an adventure. The only drawbacks are the food, we only had to meal but the buffets were quite the same, and the size of the park is small.

Great photo opportunities. It may not be the Addo or Kruger park with respect to the number of animals or scenery, but it provided about the best photo opportunities I ever had. An excellent short trip from the Cape!

Wonderful Safari & Visit to the Karoo!. It was my first trip to the Karoo, and my fiancé's first safari and first time in South Africa, so we were very excited for the experience and were not let down. We stayed for 3 days and 2 nights. We were able to see the Big Five in the first 2 games drives and had wonderful guides telling us all about the animals as we saw them. The food was absolutely scrumptious - had a hard time pacing ourselves :) We stayed in a standard bush cottage and were pleased with the room and all the amenities, including the outdoor shower and Jacuzzi bath! The staff were all very hospitable and friendly. I recommend Aquila for anyone who wants a wonderful safari getaway without having to travel long distances from Cape Town/the Western Cape!

Excellent game reserve. We visited for one night with our two small children (3 and a half and 2 years old). It was perfect for what we wanted, to see all the animals in a short space of time. The buffet food was good too with a wide variety of dishes. Pool looked beautiful but isn't heated so we didn't get in.It's not a "real safari" but if you go knowing it's a game lodge then you'll have a fantastic time.

Thank you!. After leaving Cape Town 10yrs ago it was great to discover on our return holiday that Aquila had opened. Finally the big 5 close to Cape Town.
