My husband and I spent the night at Aquila for my husbands 40th birthday. The accommodation was comfortable and the addition of a log fire in our room was very welcomed. I cannot say enough about how professional and welcoming the staff were. The service and food was impeccable and our tour guides Daniel and Mathew were knowledgable, enthusiastic and constantly made an effort to check everyone was happy. I look forward to returning and seeing even more in the future as the reserve grows. Thank you again

A whistlestop stay with a visiting relative from Australia. Our nephew came for a short visit and being pensioners, we decided to treat him and ourselves and make use of your special winter offer. We were NOT disappointed. We enjoyed every minute of our stay from the moment of arrival.The accommodation was excellent and the food was out of this world. You must be complimented on the friendliness of each and every member of your staff. We loved the game drives (wear something warm!) and the cherry on the top was the folded towels giving us a welcoming elephant after our game drive.. We would LOVE to stay longer and soak it all in. Thank you Aquila

Pleasant surprise. Being used to bush holidays and living in cape town we were very sceptical about this "private game farm with the big 5" in the middle of the Karoo! We decided to take a chance and what a great time we had! Look.......it's not the Kruger or Timbavati but we did not expect that either. You have to compare apples with apples and for the price we paid it was great value for money. Yes, the animals are few and far between but our guide (Mbeki) was great and very knowledgable. I will recommend Aquila to anyone who wants a nice break but don't expect a bush holiday. The food was average (but nice), my only gripe was that the restaurant staff wasn't trained properly and the staff uniforms needs to be upgraded. Our room was fabulous and all in all we can't wait to take our friends to see it!Nadine Jacobs
Wonderful!. Just as perfect as a honeymoon deserves! The room, the people, the hotel and, of course, the game! Loved!

Aquila - I saw the Big 5 :). Ok so, to say I saw the Big 5, albeit true, is not true in the safari sense...let me explain...Firstly, I have to point out that this was the second game drive in the space of 2 weeks (the first at an alternative Nature Reserve further up the coast) so by that time I had come to accept the fact that sometimes, you just don't see all of the animals...at the first Reserve the guide explained that you hardly ever see leopards, they hide/camouflage...it's just what they do.We got to see tons of animals on our drive...including Hippo's and Rhino's (1/5)...so excited!!! (I hadn't seen them before). Since they do not have sufficient prey for the Lions (2/5), they are kept separately. I'm still on the fence as to how I feel about that, but at least you get to see the lions, at my first Safari we couldn't find the lions any ware...and we drove for hours. Unlike a previous comment, the lions actually weren't that lazy, they came down from a hill while we were there and started playing with one another, I guess it didn't hurt that it was mating season!So after seeing the elephant's (3/5) zebra's, their one giraffe (2 others died in a climbing accident), a few rather large buffalo (4/5) and countless deer, I was once again left hoping for a Leopard.I had altogether given up on it when they completed the drive, but then, we didn’t go back to the lodge.Aquila has a rehabilitation area, where they keep animals that are recovering, they has a couple of lions, cheetahs...and a LEOPARD!!!! Score!! 5/5I didn't the service at the Lodge, the guide was obviously my favourite, as the drive was the highlight of the stay, but the staff were friendly...either that or I was enjoying myself with my family too much to complain.The only thing that I would note and that was a bit of a letdown was the Food Temperature. All 3 meals we had there were cold, though the range was lovely and the staff happily warmed the food when requested.I would happily take tourists back; my only hope is that they incorporate more animals into the park as at times it did seem a little sparse.

Good alternative for a rainy day in Cape Town.. It was raining so hard at Cape Town that we did a last minute arrangement to visit this Safari Park. The 3 hours drive went through beautiful scenery. Aquila is not the real Game reserve, but if you lack of time and you want to avoid the rain in Cape Town, then you will be guaranteed to see all Big 5 in 2 hours "Safari" ride. All animals are staged appropriately. The rooms and Villas looks nice. Overall is was a OK for a "quick fix" to see the "Wild Animals" near Cape Town.

Grubby accomodation. We found our bedroom and bathroom very grubby. The shower floor was not even swept. My bed had broken base boards and was very uncomfortable. The toilet handle did not work but that was promptly fixed.The food was average but if you arrive promptly for the dinner buffet the food was still cold. We enjoyed the game drive. The staff are very friendly.

The big five + so much more. Had a great over night stay at this great but small game reserve. Welcomed with sparkling wine then enjoyed buffet lunch. We had a luxury family cottage which sleeps eight in three bedrooms all en suite. The master bedroom had a wonderful log fire which glowed and kept us cosy as the night temperature plummeted. Two very informative game drives where we saw all of the big five. The driver was very knowledgable and clearly showed a great passion for his work, the animals and also the conservation work they are involved with. Dinner and breakfast were Aldo buffet style and a good range to suit all diets. Our sons went on a two hour quad bike safari which they really enjoyed and managed to see even more animals than us, they said that they felt very safe and was a great fun way to experience the wild of South Africa. Would have stayed longer had we realised the facilities were so good. Two outside swimming pools one with a bar and plenty of sun beds to get a tan whilst watching elephants wander in the distance. Many happy memories of this place.
What was to be fantastic turned out not to be. Our chalet was dirty, linen and curtains torn and not fresh. Bed was broken, staff looked really untidy

Aquila. Aquila Private Game Reserve exceeded all my expectations. I thought I would see just a few animals and stay in a minimalist campsite.The animals were plentiful. On the first afternoon trip, I saw 2 elephants, 7 lions, cape buffalo and rhinos. And I saw them up very close.The place I stayed overnight was 4 star.
we enjoyed oue stay with you was diff to our normal hotels. The only problem we realy experienced was the food was cold everything else was to our satisfaction.
Thank You. I had a great stay at Aquila Private Game Reserve. Staff was all friendly and informative. Highly recommendable.

Awesome experience. An amazing experience. The staff at the front desk and restaurant were extremely helpful and friendly. The food was excellent. Our guide on the Game drive, Jannie, was the best. He was extremely knowledgeable and very funny. I cannot wait to return to Aquila. THANK YOU to all for making it a memorable experience.

Book direct..dint use agent. We went to Aquila and it was a great day out. Lots of animals in what was wild enough for us. Stayed 1 night in brilliant hut with giant bed and outdoor shower. Smashing food. Even saw Riannah there with her family. Only thing...booked through an agent so all. Ollection times were wrong, not picked up at correct time....so ring direct and safe yourself trouble. Otherwise an unbeatable visit and a great drive to it on the johansburg road.

A great experince. I brought a friend of mine who's from Colorado, USA to the reserve and we had a great time. The food was great, the accommodation was great and the staff members were awesome. I recommended a stay at the reserve to my family in Australia as well who will be visiting your reserve sometime next year and I hope they get to experience what we have experienced...great job Aquilla Staff!
Love it. It was a great two days in this reserve. We love everything. Our room, the breakfast, the lunch, the dinner, and of course the Safari with great ranger and a wonderful atmosphere.
Aquila Stay. We had a lovely stay! Beautiful suite and awesome views. The safari trip was also very fun and enjoyable!

overnight trip. we did an overnight trip. accommodation was great, staff friendly and helpful. you get to see the animials up really close and personal and the Rhino are spectacular. Just a pity that the number of animals are so limited. Be aware that they have a wide variety but limited numbers of each species. Daniel our guide was knowledgeable and kept us entertained. Food was OK, all buffet style which is not my favourite. It must be lovely in the swimming pools in the summer. you can also do quad bike or horseback safari trips.

Over night stay. Welcome was greart with the welcome drink. On checking in, I felt the receptionist could have been more friendly or smiled. Chalet was beautiful, only small attention to detail was overlooked: Hand towels had dirty marks on and hairs in the bath. Game drive was excellent.Buffet Lunch and Dinner was enjoyed, however need to find alternative for dishing up spoons, as I burnt myself when dishing up for the potjie pot as the spoon gets very hot. The chef replaced it with a new dishing up spoon.We will definatly be back again,

What a weekend!!. I had the time of my life. Great food, great game drive and the best tour guide we could have ask for. Thanks to Daniel, we really had a good time in the field. Even experience a springbok giving birth!! I would recommend Aquila for anyone. Do not even think twice!!! JUST GO!!!

All the wildlife you could want to see in half a day. It's a two amd a half hour drive from Cape Town....but worth it. See the Big Five, We say an ostrich family with new chicks and oryx too. Going into the lion enclosure was very exciting, then seeing the leopard in the rescue centre before stroking a Cheetah. When did you last stroke a wild Cheetah. Aquilla is Not Kruger or Hwange. But it does provide an unforgetable trip. Guides and staff were great too. the quad bilkes and horse safaris looked fun.

Very enjoyable. Such friendly staff, with comfortable accommodation, enjoyed lovely food and a 5 star to our tour guide Jannie, he gave us much appreciated information about the beautiful fauna & flora of Aquila Game Park. Will definitely recommend.

Brought a friend. I'm afraid, we were very disappointed. We felt the few Game were not in their natural habitats and the whole experience was geared towards tourists who wanted to see game. The only giraffe we saw in your reserve looked lonely and miserable especially since he was having to eat his food off the ground as there were no trees around, natural for them. Too expensive for what we experienced!

Wonderful Experience. From our arrival at 12:00 to our departure 24 hrs later, the service and attention from all resort staff was excellent.The Buffet food for Lunch and dinner was of a great choice, hot and varied. the Wines were excellent.The Chalet was warm , clean comfortable and the Elephant Towel on the bed fun. The Game Drives were exciting, including the breakdown of the Truck( Thank Goodness it was not in the Lion Enclosure, but the problem was soon sorted and it was part of our adventure.The Guide was well informed, the scenery stunning and the Animals were great to see, the Big 5 and More. We thoroughly recommend Aquilla ,will return when next in Cape town, an easy 2 hour drive through wonderful scenery Thank You all

Service excellence. From the moment we drove in throught the gates we were blown away by the service we received. We were greeted at our car with refreshment cloths, served a refreshing drink and then escorted to the reception area. The people were friendly and helpful and we were told what to expect from our stay. The restaurant was good and the food well prepared. We were taken to our room after lunch and everything was explained. The only thing I could complain about is the bedding which was on the old side but that could be overseen. The view from our cottage was beautiful. The game drives were amazing.

An Introduction to SA big game and a Game park.. Aquila and its staff are very good at what Aquila is targeted to do --- provide a genuine introductory/short exposure to African game and an RSA Game Park.The game is limited but of sufficient variety and in a small, but natural, environment allowing a realistic experience.Facilities, accommodation and dining all of a very good standard, while the staff are knowledgable, professional, and at all times interested in providing the "Aquila Experience". They handle the relatively large number of visitors with ease and according to their specific needs.Thank you, well done and our seven year-old grandson had a great time, Harry.

an overnight experience of a life-time. Great excitement and expectations were generated by the booking office in Cape Town. I received a prompt email with directions, booking instructions and procedures. I liked the full itinerary - the programme for the day was jam packed and thoroughly exciting. There was so much to see, eat and do that we did not even get the opportunity to do all the extra activities offered. We have to return to experience everything the reserve has to offer. All my expectations were met beyond all my wildest dreams. Thank you for the recommendation and booking Priscilla!

Aquila Safari. This is a safari park, not a game park on the levels of Kruger Park or Addo Park but it does have its own merits. We arrived at 12.30 and were welcomed and went stgraight to lunch as the room is only allocated at 2pm. We had a permiere room overlooking the reserve and it was very comfortable although the outdoor shower was a bit cold this time of year, even with a hot tap. It must be really nice in the summer. There is also a big bath. The room also had a fridge and a fireplace which was nice and the wood was stacked at the door. At 4pm we went on a "game drive" and we did see animals up close and personal. they do have a load of restriction on the number of animals they are allowed on the reserve so you have to understand their predicament. We saw hippos,elephant, zebra, buck of various kinds, rhino (spectacular), giraffe in the main reserve and the in the separate reserve lions who looked very lazy. At the end of the drive we went past the hippos again and they suddenly became active and put on a quick show. The guide we had (Daniel), was very good and knowledegable about the animals and the reserve. This type of place is for people who can't get to the real parks though. It has 2 swimming pools and a lounge bar for times when not out in the bush. You can also do a game drive on a quad bike or horse. It is quite expensive for what it is although it must cost a huge amount to run. They do offer specials in the off season. The food is OK, nothing great or special.

Overnight safari. Insufficientv number of animals much less than a zoo but in the open lions so tame almost like house pets food good and hot guide very friendly and knowledgable only 1 but understand more comimg again need more animals to make more like a safari accommodation good but basic probably what expected liked open fire as was very cold and soon mad room nice hot water bottle nice extra thanks for memory

A cold Happy Birthday. Since unfortunately we had to cancel our planned trip to the Kruger park, my daughter still insisted that she wanted to see the BIG 5 for her 13th birthday. Hearing a teenager say she wants to be out in nature with the family rather than shopping in mall is like having your tummy sprinkled with fairy dust .. ALL GOOD!So, the hunt began and 15 mins later we opted for Aquila based on our budget, travel time and amenities for the Mrs' wheelchair. Initially we had some trouble with the online/email booking process with responses from staff taking longer than what felt comfortable. I raised my email voice a bit and after receiving a phonecall, the booking was sorted out within a few mins. Only downside was that the family suite I wanted was no longer available - I really wanted to chill in the jacuzzi :(Anyways, bags packed and off we did trot to the land of Karoo bossies. Arrived early, but the team was friendly and showed us to the lounge area for a fire and some drinks. The weather was a bit chilly this late in September.Lunch was buffet and once we got into the smaller-than-expected-but-well-equipped room, and the food settled a bit we clambered aboard the viewing truck and set off into the wilderness. Our guide proving interesting and funny little anecdotes about the animals and the reserve. The 3 hours spent in the chilly September afternoon air (for which we were a little ill prepared for) rushed past and after hearing the final lion roar we headed back to base for a much deserved buffet dinner. Yep, we're eating again!Up early morning for a quick cup o' java, onto the truck for the morning drive. This time were a little better prepared with warmer jackets and multiple layers of clothing!Once again our guide made sure that we have enough time to take a multitude of photos. (note to self .. I'm so gonna make a powerpoint slide for the neighbours!) Also, where we had limited viewing time the day before, we were allowed to spend some extra time to oooh-and-aaah at mother nature's handiwork.Final stop was the ARC where spotted some Cheetah and a Leopard (see what I did there?) before heading back for breakfast. Yes. Feeding time for the tourist.Last trip to the rooms to pack our bags, pay the final drinks bill, clamber back into the car and take a leisurely trip back to the world beyond the mountains.All in all a good experience. A birthday wish granted and my photo count upped by a few 100!
An unforgettable experience!. I loved every minute of the trip! The place, staff, animals and food were amazing and I'll definitely be back.Thanks to every one at Aquila for making this possible

Amazing experience!. My daughter and I spent one night here and went for two game drives. It was our first safari/game reserve experience and we absolutely loved it! The staff were so lovely and our driver Daniel was brilliant and great at getting close to the animals, especially the lions! We also had a great stay, the accommodation was lovely with great extra touches such as hot water bottles in our beds as it was a really cold night! The food was great too. Overall an amazing experience and one we definitely want to repeat...we can't wait to return!

Accessible tame game experience - 3.5 stars. We enjoyed our stay at Aquila, though it isn't what you'd call a 'real' African safari experience. Loved the horse-back safari with our knowledgeable guide, and this was the highlight of our stay, especially as we saw zebra, elephants and hippos at close range. On our game drive however, we didn't really like the fact that we were led to believe we 'might' see the lions, as they are 'difficult to find'... only to be driven into a very small enclosure where 7 beautiful but bored-looking lions were languishing beside a little watering hole, almost like actors in a safari-themed play! They are gorgeous but it made us sad that they're in such a small enclosure, and that there's nothing safari-like about 'tracking down' a pride of lions kept in captivity. Our room was comfy and despite how cold it was, the blankets were thick and warm. Liked the outdoor shower - very unique - and the lovely big bath! The food was good, but nothing special - buffets for lunch and dinner, and we actually skipped breakfast as we didn't think we could expect anything more exciting than... another buffet. The bar fridge in our room hadn't been cleaned and there was a container of milk going sour inside, which meant that the bottles of water we were given (left inside the fridge for us) smelt of sour milk, which was quite off-putting.In all, we'd go again, but only if we got a really good special deal. It's not going to blow you away, but it is fun, enjoyable, accessible and a nice break from the regular.

average. My husband and I had a wonderful,relaxing time. It was beautiful and pure bliss! Staff very friendly and helpful and we will defnitely visit again! Our only dissapointment was dinner as we expected a "African feast" as advertised and fgot average food I make @ home on a daily basis....nothing was"african"..

Underwhelming. This place has so much more potential.I was staying with friends in Cape Town and wanted to get to see some of the game without going too far out of town.Aquila is worth visiting but not staying at overnight. You arrive to a very limp welcome drink having had to be ready at a very early hour in the morning for pickup - it takes 2.5 hours in a ropey minibus to get there. You then have a buffet breakfast on a 3 star level and have to wait until 4pm before you go on your game drive - this is very frustrating as there is little to do at the resort, particularly if you are on your own as I was and paying a supplement for that privilege too! Lunch is another 3 star buffet.The afternoon game drive was lovely. But it is really no more than a very big safari park. It is a vey bumpy ride, so be prepared. I saw the animals I was expecting to see.Then dinner - you guessed it - another 3 star buffet.There is a lovely bar/lounge with open fires, but was deserted when I had a very reasonable glass of wine.The chalets are fine and the bed was large and comfortable.Upe early for the morning drive - not many animals about, but the scenery was bathed in morning light and we watched the lions descend from the rocky hills to their enclosure.The bus was late to take us back and the driver more interested in his mobile than safe travel in pouring rain.So, do if you are close by do a day visit, but be aware that you will not have much to do whilst waiting to see the animals.The staff were pleasant, but not very interested in guests or creating any kind of atmosphere.

A slice of Paradise. The most beautiful weekend getaway on our doorstep. Delivered even more than I was expecting. Wonderful staff, lovely meals, very comfortable lodgings. The highlight for me was the game ride on horseback.

Aquilla - Good memories. Was an overnight stay. The game Tours were absolutely fantastic. My Grandson 14 was very impressed with our Guide Jannie. So many animals to see and a lot of information from the Guide. Definately a camera and walking shoes. The occomadation was very nice (standard cottage) and had all the ameneties required. As for the food and service, could not ask for more. Was great!!!! Aquilla is an absolutely beautiful place and I will definately (hopefully) in the near future visit again. So much to see and do.

Aquila review. We enjoyed the Game Drives, our guide was very knowledgeable. Take warm clothes as it gets very cold early evening and early morning (September). The food was good, we would have enjoyed the eating experience more if waiters addressed us in Afrikaans - obviously their home language but they insisted on speaking English only. The rooms were not 4 star in our opinion. Overall a very pleasant visit.

Vast improvement. I had the benefit of visiting Aquila for a second time in four years and I am happy to report that the service and accommodation was excellent, the facilities were wonderful and child-friendly and we had a awesome time overall. It was a definite improvement on our previous visit where the facilities were being renovated and the accommodation facilities were a disappointment. Well done, Aquila!

one night visit. very disappointing. not as good an experience as a previous one 6 years ago. escorted to room - room still being prepared, waited outside. game ranger terrible - much knowledge but couldn't string a sentence together 'guys'. meals ok. choice of wine unavailable. hot water bottle leaked and wet the bed!
Beautiful Reserve, Dirty room. Our room was dirty.After turn down,bath & toilet were filled with bugs & dirty cups were not replaced.

Great weekend at Aquila. Recently took advantage of a 'winter special' and it really was special! Very well organised. Great food, reasonably priced drinks, great accommodation and well organised game drives. I advise any visitor to the Cape who does not have time to visit the KNP to go to Aquila to have a 'safari'.

Aquilla experience. More birdwatching , photography opportunities and walking/cycling. Cullinary experience very boring. Animal rehab centre not well kept with lots of building rubble. Will I visit again ? Answer = yes but whope suggestions will be applied
Aquila Review. We had a great experience.The towels on arrival and the drinks were a very nice, welcoming touch. The safari was amazing and the food was great.
Wild Life time. had great time at the Reserve accept for when i couldnt sleep at night because of a mouse that was in our room. was very unpleasant and distractful but other than that it was okay.

overnight safari. I was impressed with the service from the time I made the enquiry until I left the lodge. Upon arrival at the lodge the staff were extremely friendly same atmosphere and mannerism in the restaurant. Not forgetting to say thank you to the housekeeping department for a warm cozy room and it was amazing and a wonderful surprise to find hot water bottles placed in the beds. The game drive with Alvin was fabulous, very informative and he had a phenominal way of interacting with us. Thank you Aquila for a great overnight safari

One of the best safari resorts around. Living in South Africa and having been to many reserves, this is still one of my favourites. The premier cottages are great, sitting in a private outdoor jacuzzi watching elephants meters away was spectacular.

Beautiful!!. We loved our brief visit here. The grounds and lodge buildings were gorgeous. The staff was delightful. The buffet food was very good and steaming hot. The game drives were good. We saw animals, not a lot but this is not Kruger or Masai Mara ! The water passed in front of rooms so we saw elephant and buffalo from lanai and dining room. If you are here when warm the pool is enormous . If it is cool, the rooms are heated. For a getaway from the city this is great. A short drive for great scenery.
The Taylor Family Visit. Excellent facilities, food, and the game drive with Daniel was superb. Lots of game, excellent guide

Nice safari with scanty animals. The set up/building was great, with an african architecture with a little modernisation. The safari/tour was meal inclusived, so we have a breakfast and after the tour,a lunch. The buffet (breakfast & lunch) was really great. Adequate choice and quite tasty. And really convenience for muslim traveller, all the meat were halal.The safari was great, and our guide really friendly and informative. The place was quite enormous. We could see variety of animals and we manage to encounter (rather closely) all 'the big five'. However the animals were rather sparse, there was only 2 buffaloes, 2 elephants, 1 giraffe, 2 rhinos ,among other thing/animals.However, it was really nice that after 1 hour or so of the tour, we have a stop/rest and the guide provided us with a cold drink, really a nice gesture.

Very few animals but lovely. I enjoyed visiting Aquila game reserve but didn't have as much fun as I expected. I got very close to the lions - yes that was magical and only highlight of my trip there! However, it's a fantastic place being as young as it is and especially being private. Our guide was very informative and friendly. Hopefully, they'll be able to multiply their population soon for a more fun visit.

Fun. Lions were a superb experience - my wife had never seen any Big Cats so seeing all up close was great.Only 1 complaint. You need a plate warming stand at your hot food plate point for the buffets/meals. Hot food gets cold very quickly on a cold plate.

The BEST Safari close to Cape Town!. We had an amazing time in Aquila Game reserve, with overnight stay in Premier Luxury Chalet (book it!) which was "heaven on earth" :-). By far one of the best Safari experience so far, incl. excellent Guide and of course the fantastic Big5! Will come back for sure!

Excellent service and breath taking stay. We had an exquisite time!I felt like I was in another world, the tranquility and breath taking aura of being around nature was fantastic! I wish I can revisit soon! My boyfriends and I had a romantic stay and we will forever remember our time there!

Visit by 3 couples spoiled by lack of attention to detail. We enjoyed the venue and the people but were very disappointed in the food being cold at EVERY meal. Our first night accommodation was great but second night we had no hot water bottle, bed not made up properly, bath products not refilled & generally poor room service. We entertained a couple with a 60th Birthday and a lady from Australia and hoped for a special weekend. Game drives were interesting and staff generally good Sadly a lack of attention to food quality and 2nd night room service spoiled the weekend for us

A Special place. This has been a great experience for myself and my wife. This is a very special place where people who would like to find a a quiet place to rest a bit from all the hustle of ordinary life can find food for the soul. Staff was very good and the food and wine excellent. We really enjoyed our stay.

Quick big five. Pros: Beautiful Game Reserve, large family chalet, fine food
Cons: Not so many animals there (2 Elephant, 4 Rhino, 2 Buffalo, 6 Lion, 1
Lepard (in a separate cage outside the Game Reserve))
Too many birds in the dining room
Family visit. My family and I had a fantastic time, accommodation was very good, general staff, game drives, etc. was excellent.

Peacefull stay at Aquila. Excellent service, everybody make you feel so welcome, especially the extra effort that went into treating the little ones. Thanks for my baboon. I get a fright everytime I see him, but had to have him.
Aquila Overnight Package. Excellent family break. Great Food. Great service. Definitely delivered more than we expected. Highly recommended.

Family getaway. The game drive on horse back was the awesome!!! Best experience ever! We took our kid on the game drive on the vehicle. That was horrible, cause all the families with kids were cramped into one vehicle - we had to sit on top of each other at the back and couldnt appreciate the views of the animals. And knowing kids, they need room to move and breath. My daughter was annoyed and frustrated most of th ride. Food was excellent at restaurant! Couldnt have asked for better. Accomodation was good. Service overall was awesome. Thanks xx

Aquila Game Reserve. Our stay at Aquila was brilliant, we stayed in a standard cottage which apart from the bedding having a few holes in was lovely. Turn down was a lovely surprise with our towels in the shape of an elephant & especially the hot water bottles we found in bed :) Our 2yr old daughter loved it - being able to see all the animals including the Big 5 was a big treat for her. We'll definitely be returning!

My Aquila Weekend. The staff were fantastic, the food delicious, and our driver well informed. We really enjoyed our stay there and made some friends. Had lots of laughs and throughly enjoyed it. We appreciated it that the young people with their children all went in one game truck. Us oldies love our grandchildren but not ona constant basis. We would love to come again inthe future. If i only have one negative to state it would be the state of the roads. They really shake you up, in spite of the drivers care you occasionally get shaken right out of you seat!
Brilliant Experience. Brilliant experience and even when there seemed to be a hiccup with our 3pm game drive, the staff sorted it out

Amazing Aquila. The visit was brilliant. Helpful staff, cozy yet impressive lodge and first rate viewing. The service provided was exactly what we hoped for. We had a wonderful time and can't rate the visit highly enough.

Great Game Reserve. Stayed for the overnight safari at the Aquila Game Reserve. We were met straight from our car with a hot towel to refresh ourselves and was shown to the welcome drinks bar. We were a little early to be able to check in but we had the lounge bar to ourselves, and with a roaring fire and our books we were happy. At check in time, we were shown to our lodge by one of the rangers, we did have to call another one back as the fire wouldn't light in our room. Timothy came back with some fire-lighters and we soon had a good fire going. He was also our safari guide, and I can honestly say we could not have asked for a better guide. We saw everything, we had a little boy on our trip who asked very intelligent questions, and we all enjoyed him asking the questions and Timothy answering them :-)The food was a hot buffet, and there was plenty of it at all sittings, and delicious food it was too!I would highly recommend this game reserve to everyone, and hopefully you will get Timothy as a guide! It was very thought-provoking, informative, interesting trip.

Recent visit to Aquila through British Airways. Very disappointing visit. Not much better than a zoo or UK Safari Park and trip was exorbitantly priced with British Airways. OK if you only have one day and want to see big 5 at all costs. If you have visited proper wildlife reserves or parks in Africa this one will definitely disappoint. Carnivores all seperately caged in small compounds to stop them eating the other animals, herbivores grouped together and fed with bales of straw. Only two worse for weae elephants. Give it a miss.
Aquila Private Game Reserve. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay despite the cold and rainy weather. The lodge ensured more than enough warm places to sit and eat.

Amazing staff goes above and beyond!. Very good Game Farm and very well organised for tourists that has a limited amount of time in which to see the big 5. The staff at Aquila is absolutely amazing and helpful beyond call of duty. I won't recommend visiting for more than 2 or 3 days cos of limited activities which include game drives and a swimming pool.
Best game drives in ages!!!. We had a fantastic time and saw so much. Daniel was the best game driver I've met in a long time. Great food!!!

Extremely happy.. My husband and I got given a night away at Aquila, and really loved it. From the minute we got there, we were spoilt. The service was great, and the food excellent. I have told my friends and family all about the Reserve, and I am sure that you are going to get some of them enquiring about visiting. I think that your staff are all brilliant, from the people at reception, the waiters and especially your rangers! They were all helpful, and very informing. I would really like to come again.

long weekend. We spent 3 nights at aquila at the end of august. Other than the game drives there isn't much to do or we weren't told about other activities. The was a lack if communication about facilities and activities. We had to ask at reception about times of drives and meals. This information should be available in rooms or when you arrive. The room wasn't ready when we arrived and there was a level of professionalism missing from the place. Not worth the money spent.

Surpassed expectations. Fantastic food, fabulous cosy accommodation - we loved the cabins especially game viewing from our balcony, friendly staff - service with a smile, informative game drives - our guide's knowledge was wonderful. Attention to detail was a big plus - right down to the fleecy blankets and hot water bottles on our drives not to mention the bubbly and nibbles for our sundowners, the bottle of wine in our room, turn down service and hot water bottles in our bed! I could go on and on. What a lovely experience and totally unexpected. We felt spoilt and so well cared for. We had no fixed plans on our holiday to Cape Town and were not even sure of where game reserves were located or if they could be booked at short notice. It was such a bonus, easy to locate and I would recommend to any visitor wanting to head out of town for some luxury with a lovely rustic difference and to get up close to some of the amazing African wildlife.
So lovely.. We did the winter special was such a brilliant idea. The food, the people, the safari. I honestly loved it and would highly recommend it. Keep on with the specials :)

Birthday celebration. We had a great time,the room was very nice. We saw and photographed all the animals except the Buffalo. The animals looked well looked after and our ranger was very knowledgeable. Only thing missing,- as it is a 4 star,- was gowns in the bedroom and something in the bar fridge specially as there was no where to buy snacks etc. Thank you

Holiday. Overall very good.Amazing food and very helpful staff.Unfortunately for us the electricity went off as I got out of the bath.I had to search in the dark to get clothes to go to reception as there is no telephones in the chalets.At reception I called the night ranger.After 60 min of trying to fix electricity we had to change chalets.Very inconvenient and icy cold without adequite lights/lanterns we moved.Told reception next morning and filled in questionaire,but haven't heard from them till now.We stayed over 20/08/2013.

Poor state of beds spoils visit to 5 star game park. Aquila exceeded all our expectations until we went to sleep. Both beds (unit 18) squeaked and creaked with any movement on top of which they were hollow/concave. The feedback is given with the hope that the beds will be replaced to comply with the high standards of the rest of the park. Otherwise an unforgettable experience!

First safari but no worthy,,,,,I rather party in Cape Town than to take this safari,,,,my birthday cake was one day late. I am sorry,,,to say this,,, but this safari,,overnight,,,, is not worthy to get up this early,,,,the food is the same every day,,,, what you get for breakfast the morning you arrived if its over night ,,,you will get the same for the next and so for,,,the animals are not so different for what you will see in any zoo! Therefore, no recommend at all,,,,plus do not order any cake for your birthday it will come,,, from the store,,,the next day,,,with the slicker in placed ,,,,,,lol,,,,very nice early for breakfast,,,will be placed in your room just before you returned from having the same breakfast ,,,,,upon arrived,,,,enjoy,,,,if I am wrong ,,,,correct me,,, Los Angeles California ,,,,August 21,2013'

Go safari. The chance to see the animals up close and personal was awesome. The lions's roar was a highlight!!! Accommodation beautiful, food was ok, evening buffet was disappointing (especially as a vegetarian). Overall, fantastic experience.

Aquila Game Reserve. We had an absolutely brilliant day. We arrived at Aquila at around 10-30am. We were greeted with a glass of champagne, then we got in to our jeeps and drove into the game reserve. We immediately saw buffaloes and springbok, then we saw hippopotamus, white rhinoceros, ostrich, zebra, giraffe, elephants and finally lions. It was amazing. We were able to edge our way closer and closer to the animals and we have got some wonderful photos. During another champagne break, the elephants walked even closer towards us, it was great. We had a lovely lunch. The restaurant was stunning, with high beams and beautiful views. You can stay there on a safari holiday. We're not sure exactly how much a holiday would cost. It's certainly a place I would recommend. After we had eaten, we went and saw a leopard and a cheetah. They had been rescued, and were in isolation, until they can fend for themselves again in the wild.

Perfect for those new to safaris. Aquilla was a two-hour drive from Cape Town through the beautiful winemaking region of South Africa. This is a game reserve and a great place for those who've never been on a safari before. All the animals are in a large enclosed area so you are sure to see all the animals. We did the overnight stay which included lunch, dinner, overnight accommodation, breakfast and two game drives which was excellent value for money. The accommodation and facilities are superb and all tastefully decorated. Our guide Daniel was excellent and showed a true passion caring for these wild animals and I felt he went above and beyond his normal duties. If you want to see wild animals hunting i.e. Lions hunting Springbok this is not the place for you. The Lions are kept separately as this is as I mentioned a game reserve and not the large national parks you see on TV. It's a great first time taster.

Overnight stay at aquila. Fantastic experience. Staff were great. Got very close to all the animals, thanks to our guide daniel. Comfortable cabins with everything you need. Would sugest hireing a private transfer as we had to wait 4+ hours for other groups that were on our shuttle bus. Overall it was great, a must do when in cape town. We will go again.

Aquila PGR Aug 9-11 2013. Amazing views, great food a plenty, awesome wild life. An amazing experience. Just a little cold that time of year. Wouldn't mind another trip in a few years when its much warmer to enjoy the pool & pool bar. We saw the big 5 which was a great experience as I have been on a few safaris and know that you don't always get to see everything. The staff was friendly and Daniel (driver of our safari vehicle) was great. The manager is fantastic. Very friendly and even taking the time to take us up to see the Leopard as we were unable to see him in the morning, and all the guides were busy. Thanks for a great time to allRegardsMichael & Kerri de Kock

Review of Borton Family say 17/18 August 2013. Fireplace not working in cottage, food selection not great have more selection of meat at dinner, not just chicken drumsticks and chops, and why charge corkage for when a paying quest wants to bring his bottle of wine to dinner, come on! we paid such a lot for the weekend now you charge corkage

Good option for tourists. Aquila is only two hours from Cape Town and you do get to see the Big Five. It is a bit canned though. However if you are a tourist to SA and only have a day to see game, it is a great option.We stayed overnight so we had a bit more time to look around. The welcome is great with hot towels and sparkling wine. The main reception area and main lounge are great and accommodating. We had lunch, dinner and breakfast in the dining room. The welcome and service is great. The food is buffet style and ranges from great to average as these things tend to be. However a common problem was that most of the 'hot' food is cold apart from one or two dishes that are on stove tops. But as the plates are cold, the whole meal is cold by the time you get back to your table. Not a problem if you only eat salads though :)The game drives were well organized and you were taken right up to the game. The lions are still in a separate enclosure which means there is no chance of seeing a kill. They will be released once the buck population has increased. We got blankets, but no hot water bottles. The sherry and snacks were welcome though.The accommodation is good, but looking a bit tired these days. The main light was tripping the power supply and the wiring of the plugs very amateurish. The response of the maintenance crew was good. Although they could not fix the problem, they gave us a workaround.I do not think I would like to stay more than one night, but it was a great mid-winter outing and ideal for day-trippers from Cape Town.
excellent. The stay in Aquila was the highlight of our visit to Cape Town. the staff friendly, the drives were amazing, we saw more animals than in the Kruger Park.

Excellent experience. Enjoyed our stay at Aquila especially the game drives. It was winter and cold so the hot water bottles were appreciated. The food was varied but unfortunately the plates were cold and the food became cold very quickly.

A True Highlight of any trip. Aquilla was truly the key to our stay in South Africa. The staff there is great and very helpful. The location and what they have to offer was amazing. The food was great. It is definitely a must see if you get in the area. Lisa at Beach Bum Vacation organized this for us...and we're so glad she did. Everything was planned for us an we didn't have to think about anything...we just sat back and enjoyed everything they had to offer!

Luxury all the way. This safari was absolutely amazing. I stayed in a luxury premier cottage and it was just that. Beautiful room with fascinating views! I went during the winter season and even thought it was freezing, it was still one of the most amazing experiences I have had. The staff is extremely knowledgable and accommodating.
AQUILA. I stayed 2 days at Aquila Private Game Reserve.It is a very good place to stay if you do not want to go too far to relax from CAPE TOWN!!! Horse safari is very attractive!!!

Made our vacation!. I took my husband here, as a gift on out trip to South Africa. The staff were amazing, food great and the accommodation outstanding! We booked the luxuary cottage with the hot tub, and loved lying in the hot outdoor tub, in the cold looking at the amazing skies. PLEASE look up at night! We did the horseback safari, and the games drives but the QUAD bikes were our favorite by far!
Family fun. A wonderful family environment with great wildlife viewing. A must for those coming for holiday to the cape and for those living in the cape. What a treasure...

Be warned this is not a game reserve it is a Safari park. Our biggest disappointment whilst on holiday in South africa. about 3 hours drive from Cape Town. We went out into the park to find that the big cats "Lions" are caged. A big cage but caged all the same. The other animals roam freely and I would have no problem if this is what you are sold but it isnt.The animals consist of 2 Elephant, 1 Giraffe and 2 Male Buffalo's, lots of other roaming grazing species but the distance from Cape Town and the money is not value and a waste of your holiday time.You will see Cheetahs (caged) Lions (caged) Leopard (caged) although to be fair the guide did state that 2 Leopards are free but are rarely spotted. I would doubt that. If you want to see free roaming zebras, beest, hippo etc in a very small reserve then go for it but it was not for me.

Very good service. I visited your Reserve with my husband and both of us remained satisfied. The quality of the food was really high. The room was really nice and all the personnel kind and eager to respond to every request. We faced 2 problems. the first was during the evening in our room. we had 3-4 times blackouts so my husband went twice outside to check.and the second problem was the morning. As per the schedule we had 1,5 hour to have breakfast and check out, but we returned from our morning safari at 09:30 instead of 08:30 and we had only 15 minutes. So because we wanted to be punctual for the next game, we did not take breakfast.

What a Beautiful Location and a Great Visit!. We were here for an overnight safari. Our guide, Godfrey, was very knowledgeable and just wonderful. The accommodations were fantastic and the food was amazing! We would love to visit again in the future.

Groupon Winter Special 10/8 - Premier Lodge. Booked a Premier Lodge (best room available) and there was not even an indoor shower, There was an outdoor shower but on a frosty winter morning, this wasn't an option! Charming lodge with a log fire and lovely views, but not really worth the money and really could do with an upgrade.Game viewing very good for the Western Cape - compact area and able to see the big 5.Food a little "canteen style" - plentiful, but not the best quality.
family adventure. our 13 year old son is an aspiring Zoologist and this was the perfect outing for him and the rest of us.

Aquila Winter special - one night stay. The accomodation was good. Warm room, except the wind kept coming in through the cracks in the entrance door (room 11). The only criticsim was the food. It was outdated (yellow rice is from the 80's), lasagne had raw vegetables in it and the puddings were very stodgy. Salads were very boring.

We love Aquila!. We take a tour group to South Africa every summer. This was our 2nd time visiting Aquila. We love the accommodations and the knowledge of the game drivers! We're excited to have found a place to take our tour group where we can see lots of animals and learn lots about them.

BEST Game Reserve. The best stay i've ever had! Great comfortable accomodation, warm and friendly service, best price guarantee, amazing breakfast/lunch/dinner and of course the BEST safaridrive ever!!!!! thumbs up!

Perfect Day Trip. My husband and I were in Cape Town, South Africa for our honeymoon and of course we wanted to experience an "African Safari." Knowing Krueger was too far for this vacation we settled on Aquila as a day trip destination. The reviews we read were mixed and while this is no means comparable to Krueger, it was still an unforgettable experience. Being up close to all of those animals is not something you can easily do in the US! We did not see all of the animals, no hippos for example. The animals were clearly used to the vehicles and people, most hardly moved at the sight of us. When we started our journey it looked like they were herding the elephants in so we could get to see them. It was still a wonderful experience though! We were greeted with a welcome drink and breakfast. Easy check-in and friendly staff. A lunch followed our tour as well. The food was average. There were two vehicles that went out the morning we were there. Try to get in the first seat - best views in my opinion! Our tour guide was also extremely knowledgeable and made our experience even better. We stopped off for some water and wine with incredible views and picture moments near the zebras. This is truly a memorable experience and I highly recommend this to anyone that would like to experience a safari near Cape Town; it was the perfect day trip!

Always wanted to see the BIG 5 in their natural environment?. We arrived at Aquila amidst a rainstorm - feeling wet and cold. Before we even entered Reception, we were welcomed with a choice of drinks - amongst which a fine glass of Port. Nothing to chase the cold fast and furious! Check in was a bit slow due to a large number of guests arriving simultaneously, but the friendly staff managed this fast and efficient. After a hot cup of coffee we were whisked away to our room with the personal assistance of one of the many game rangers.We were pleasantly surprised by the room. All rooms are fitted with air conditioners and fireplaces. We only had time to warm up and unpack when we had to rush for our game drive. I had reservations regarding the bitter cold and wind, but warmed quickly to the cold when they issued all passengers with warm blankets and hot water bottles!The game drive was the best. We saw all of the BIG 5 except the leopard. Other than the lions we got within touching distance of them all. We took the most beautiful photos! After a visit to the lions we stopped for drinks and snacks before heading back. Had a good smile when a cranky buffalo chased after us near the gate :-). Overall it was a five star visit. The food was outstanding and the service impeccable. A large variety of dishes were available at every meal with staff always available to assist in any matter. Checkout was fast and efficient - leaving you planning the next visit.Thank you Aquila - you made us feel at home and will definitely see us soon!

REINKE COUPLE. Good welcome, although it rains the vehicle was open on the game drive and we all got wet. maybe get something to cover the sides. it was very cold, no hot coffee or hot chocolate on the game drive, only Gluwine! We missed the morning game drive, no communication or time was given to us for the morning trip. Maybe put something on a notice board for ervery one to view with departure times etc.

Awesome. I had a amazing weekend in Aquila, with a overnight safari. The people were nice, the food was great and the safari was awesome. I did a safari before in the come lodge safari of the gardenroute. It was nice, but not that nice as in Aquila. This because of the fact that a saw a lot of fences, the animals were kept seperated and not together and in Aquila is that different. The animals are walking together in one place, just like in the real nature. That was really nice. Plus I saw the whole big five in Aquila and I had a safari with a snack, wine and beer during the safari. So yeah it was great!Thank you

Convenient out-of-town break.. Winter Special good value. Game Drives the highlight - thanks, Alvin. Thanks to management for upgrading us when we asked for newspaper to mop up muddy, wet entrance to room. Why no shower in bathrooms. The outside shower, though, was quite exhilarating on a cold, July morning!
Amaxing Experience at Aquila. We had an amazing experience at Aquila and we are already planning our next visit to do a horse back safari!
Review by the Thomas family July 2013. The service and facility was excellent, as well as the experience of seeing the Big 5. It was a great family holiday.

Beautiful Place!. Aquila is a beautiful place! The accommodations were lovely! The Safari drivers were very knowledgeable! The special touches, such as hot water bottles on the safari, were sweet surprises! The food was amazing! The people were friendly! It was a delight to stay there!

Team Deco Lodge Backpackers. We had a great safari trip with Aquila, as the drive that pick us up early in the morning he was so great to us. When we arrive we were welcomed by drive and then we went for a breakfast which was great, after that we started the safari and the tour guide was good as he knows what he was doing. We saw the big five as everyone when they went on the safari they would like to see the big five. The is one thing that you someone should know is that there are not much animals around the place but it is good to do it. We would recommend Aquila to the guest that would like to do the safari which is two hour drive from Cape Town.

Pleasant surprise. Very good service and food - mildly disappointed that we didn't see leopard in the wild and that the lions were in a separate enclosure.Otherwise and very very good experience with great photo opportunities all around. Will try again.

No Mangement & Training!. Game experience was what you would expect from Western Cape "bush experience" ... Tick off the sightingsRanger very good and well informed BUT...Staff generally completely unmotivated/undertrained/invisibleSourness of receptionist on check-out was a very good way of ensuring we never returnAll good and well to give jobs to the unemployed of the area BUT... Dignify them with some training and how about some visible management?Having waiters who cannot serve wine and "operate" a corkscrew....not good enoughPity for the tourists who think this is what it"s like Definitely not for locals

Very disappointed!!. I was in room 34, the fireplace smoked the whole room out and we couldn't sleep I would suggest that a staff member light the fires for the guests properly. There wasn't any vent to let out the smoke. Secondly, the wash basin in the bathroom was blocked from the time we arrived and no one did anything about it...very disappointed for the price we pay

A wonderful awesome getaway. We felt special, were treated well, the food was great, the accommodation nice and warm and cosy and the Safari very educational and of course the highlight was the Quadbiking in the reserve with a very experienced Ranger. The GM Niel also gave us the time of day by showing us some nice clips on his computer of a leopard. Everything at Aquila was of a high standard and we have already given referrals to friends and acquaintances.

In dire need of an upgrade. The hot food was served cold, the red wine lukewarm, and the variety and quality of food not at all which was expected from a 4 star establishment, attracting multiple foreign guests. The duvet cover had a gaping hole in it, with extensive wear and tear, the dover stove in the cottage emitted so much smoke that we had to leave the room early, the view from the cottage is of a Blue gum tree which is not associated with a game lode, completely distracting from the bush experience in Africa, smack in the middle of the patio. Besides, how do you promote the concept of sustainable development with invasive vegetation being allowed to grow on the property? Protruding cement slabs and objects appear in the driveways, with very poor lighting at night creating a major risk of damage to your vehicle or hazard for injury. Worst lodge ever visited.

Remember it's not a safari.... This was just a one day trip from Cape Town for us (it was about a two hour drive) and the landscape that we saw getting there is magnificent. The arrival experience is pleasant and well organised, the costs per person in the winter is ZAR 1404.- and in the end well worth it. The inclusive breakfast and lunch buffets are adequate with a wide choice of hot and cold items.We were lucky to be selected for a small vehicle build up for ten passengers and the feeling of mass-transport that I would have gotten on the twenty seater open vehicle didn't come up. Our chatty guide, Daniel, was well trained to take care of us for about two and a half hours. Naming the animals by their various names including latin and finding the longest most winding route to somehow fill the time. In the end we did get to see the two resident elephants, two resident rhinos, one stunted giraffe, a couple of ostriches, fenced in predators, a couple of zebra's, hippo's in a pond and some other assorted "wildlife" one generally associates with Africa. Alas, if we would have had the time we would have prefered a real safari.
review of game reserve. excellent especially for families with children Beki the giude was excellent. Would suggest covering water tanks with acacia thorn trees.

Aquila Safari. We've enjoyed the one night stay at Aquila very much! Friendly staff; game rangers were informative. Lovely decor in restaurant, lounge bar and rooms. We felt relaxed and comfortable. Variety and quality of food excellent. Game drives and duration thereof well scheduled. Warm water bottles on game drives were a surprise treat for the chilly evening and morning hours of the winter. We would have preferred an afternoon nap after the lunch before going on the game drive. The visit to the ARC was a wonderful experience. Thank you.
Wonderful. This was a wonderful experience, hospirtality is 100%, will be visiting again with the whole family.
Aquila Private Game Reserve stay. This was truly a wonderful experience. The accommodation was excellent and the experience was truly five star.

Beautiful but cold!. The Karoo is beautiful and it was great to get up close to the animals.However, if you take advantage of their winter special, as I did, wrap up warm! they have blankets and hot water bottles, but my feet were still cold!

Aquila sate - June 2013. HiI found Aquila to be a nice tourist destination for tourists in SA who don't have the time to make it to game reserves such as Kruger etc. Unfortunately being an avid game viewer it lacked some of the excitement of these bigger game reserves and I hope that it can grow in size over time (the one ranger said that this was in the plans in the furute).Unfortunately the weather did not play its part when we were there but we still managed to have an enjoyable time in the lounge area by the fireplaces. It is a pity as it is really set up for being outside but bad weather is expected in Cape Town over winter.All in all a good trip!

Incredible Excursion. My husband and I visited this Game Reserve for one night. We were in Cape Town for a wedding and I, having never been to South Africa, wanted some sort of 'safari' experience. My husband, having grown up in SA knew nothing near Cape Town could compare to Kruger National, but this was an awesome place. The private bungalow we reserved was incredible (we could see RHINOS from our balcony!!!) and the staff was awesome. The two safari rides were a great way for me to experience African animals, and the safaris were made even greater by our tour guide, Andrew. For one night and two safaris, it was awesome. Don't be mistaken, there are only a handful of the Big 5... There was a family also from the US that were there for several days, experiencing the same thing day after day and they seemed bored, but for 2 days, 1 night, it was PERFECT.
Waste of time!. In my opinion this safari is waste of time and money. It is more than 2 hour's drive and what you see is nothing. Couple of amimals and lots of filling material.

Surprise weekend for Family. We had a very good time, something that I noticed is that every single staff member is friendly....and makes you feel like a king...this is really a huge winner.I would like to focus your attention on room 33, the top floor electric cable for the bed side lamp(left) needs attention-could be a safety concern for kids...other than this...a perfect stay

My visit to Aquila. I've been at Aquila 4 times and I have enjoyed every time. Just been so close to the animals was just amazing!! I am a photographer and the amazing photos you can take of the animal because of the rangers getting so close to the animals is breathtaking.

Short safari. We decided, with not advanced notice to the lodge, to go on a short safari.The Aquila staff went out of their way to find us a spot and did not charge extra.They were very welcoming but the biggest plus was their Professionalism and their care for the wild life. Their guide was without doubt, very knowledgeable and caring for the animals and also for his clients welfare and safety. Aquila management are not into the Safari Business for a quick buck but instead are there to safe guard the local environment and their wild life.Thank you good luck to Neil Basson and all of his staff.Arthur & Pauline. UK Tourists.

Absolutely stunning visit!. One would think 'cold, wet, winter day in the Cape...nothing to do!' WRONG! The majesty of nature never disappears, no matter the weather. We donned our warm clothes, coats and scarves and left Cape Town for a day visit to Aquila Private Game Reserve.The snow capped mountains, after going through the Hugenot tunnel, were a beautiful picture.On our arrival, we were greeted with warm cloths for cold hands and even warmer smiles. A delicious breakfast, which had something for even the fussiest of eaters, filled the grumbly tummys and then for our game drive.Welcome aboard the landy, with blankets and hot waterbottles provided to keep us toasty. The guide was knowledgable and determined to find as much game as possible, even though they were hiding from the cold wind. We saw and photographed most of the animals including the most adorable baby hippo, giraffe, rhinos, elephants and many buck. The lions were too clever for us and kept their hiding place a complete secret.After a wonderful, exciting drive, lunch. Mmmmm, again a spread to feed any taste. All supurbly presented, with the service to compliment. The pool looked very inviting, but rather chilly, so we decided to go to the lounge, sit at the fire, a glass of wine and family chats.Then it was time to leave. Sad goodbyes and the promise to return soon. A memorable, happy day!

Gerber visit. This was one of our best trips. The staff was friendly and was so accommodating with my 2 year old. The accommodation was of high quality and so beautiful. We will return for sure in the future. We had an amazing time with the game drives and learned a lot from the rangers. Thank you for making our stay so memorable. We will see you soon.
fantastic. It was our first time at a game reserve and we thought it was fantastic, we thoroughly enjoyed the experience on the quad bikes

Disappointed!. There are not many places to have a nice meal on the N1 from Cape Town, after you have passed Franschoek. I regret deciding to stop over at this Game Reserve. There are far better game parks in the Western Cape. Nothing to recommend about Aquila - accommodation and food dismal.

Aquila Game Farm. The amount of Game was disappointing, there were only a few of each species. Also Animals that were not suited for the environment should not be there. Hippo and Giraffe?? The children's outside activity centre was disappointing. The service, accommodation and food was very good on the other hand.

What a treat. Aquila really look after every detail from A to Z, they truly go the extra mile. There staff are friendly, the ranger are excited about their job. The food great and the accommodation very comfortable. What a magic place!

wonderful experience. i highly recommend this experience. the quality of the accommodation and service par excellence!!. Immediately on arrival one feels truly spoilt right from the complimentary welcome champagne and sherry. the rooms are luxurious and one feels to have entered a special realm. the game rangers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable and we were privileged not only to have seen each of the big 5 but a wide variety of other species. words can do little to describe the mighty roar of a lion on an early morning game drive!!. the food is wonderful in Aquila's restaurant, thoroughly enjoyed buffet and we had worked up quite an appetite. Well done Aquila management...the visit well exceeded expectations.

Great family break. We had a wonderful stay at Aquila short but memorable, it wasn't too far from Cape Town to drive with the young kids. The faciliteis were great and th service was excellent. The game drives were perfect for al of us too not too long and we still got to see all the wild life. We really enjoyed out stay and definitely will go back and pass the good word on.

Big mistake. When you turn up the first impressions are good, don't be fooled! The buffet was good but that's where it ended. Animal wise any zoo would be better than this and for the prices they are charging you just cannot justify it. The accommodation is fine if you like just staring at a wall. Save your money, that way you won't massively disappointed! Avoid!

My very first safari. I took the overnight safari. Aquila had the big five (and other animals) on its reserve. The reserve is also malaria free. The tour guide was knowledgable about the animals and had great stories to tell. During a break, the guide provided jerky, champagne, and dried fruit treats. It was awesome to see the animals in their "semi" natural habit roaming freely. None of the animals came near us. I was able to take great pictures. Not all of the animals were roaming- the leopard had its own large "caged" area and I was not able to take a picture of it. The lions were also separated from the other animals, so they would not eat them. But overall, the experience was far better than going to a zoo. The price of the safari included all meals (lunch, dinner and breakfast buffet and the food was delicious. Just be mindful the birds came in a sat on the containers and some areas of the buffet), the safari, and lodging. The rooms were tidy and felt like cabins. There were showers outside and inside the residences. It is a must see and a must do while in South Africa.

The Lion King. We took a 2.5 hour drive on very smooth roads from Cape Town to Aquila Game Reserve. We had a great guide in the open air trucks his name was Johan. He was very informative and friendly. We saw elephants, rhinos, ostriches, hippos, zebras, water buffalo, mule deer and spring buck. Our favorite were the lions! We got so close and got wonderful photos. The food was okay, the staff were very helpful and kind. 2.5 hours back to hotel with great memories and photos in hand.

Safari or large wildlife park?. The guide / driver was exceptionally knowledgeable however... it really isn't a safari.The animals are largely bought in (purchased from other estates and parks) so aren't really in their natural environment - so more a wildlife park than a true safari.The food, staff, facilities are all very good - a nice day out but not quite what was expected.

great place. my experience at this place was extremely gr8 .the amount of animals i saw here were a lot n the tour guide was also very nice and kind he explained everything well. we also managed to c a rhino and an elephant fight luckily no one got hurt the food served here was delicious and the most wonderful experience as i got to see all the big 5 .the only thing bad about it is the price as it is very high i t was about 2000 rand per person

Excellent animals, food a let-down. My husband and I took advantage of a winter special last week. I am not sure what half the bad reviews are on about - the animals are fantastic. No, this isn't a zoo and it's also not Kruger National Park. You will see 4 out of the Big 5 in the reserve and the other (plus a few more animals) is in the ARC (animal rehabilitation centre) opposite the reserve, which you have access to on your last game drive as well. We had the same guide for both drives, and he was very informative and had a great sense of humour. He made sure that everyone on the truck had great photo opportunities and nobody was left out. We were even served champagne on the first game drive as the sun set. A great experience.We spent the night in the basic accommodation. The room was actually totally adequate (even had a stunning outdoor shower!). The only problem is the food - buffet for all 3 meals. The reason is that the food is supposed to be served hot but it is luke-warm at best. Bring your wallet - I was unaware that we would have to pay for all drinks (except coffee with breakfast), so I wish this had been communicated upfront. One can understand paying additional for alcohol, but not for soft drinks, water and tea/coffee.All-in-all this was a great experience and I would not hesitate to go again (but please sort out that buffet!)

What an experience!. My partner and I were both very excited for our visit to Aquila. From the moment we arrived, it was like a magical experience. The accommodation was out of this world, sitting in the hot tub watching the stars, and the park itself, getting to see all of the big 5 was something else, much preferred doing it this way rather than roaming the plains for days looking for wildlife. As much as it was a shame to see the lions in there own enclosure, it makes perfect sense keeping them there until the reserve has a good stock of animal for us to see and enjoy as well as food for the cats.

Get up close to the animals. For a birthday treat I was taken on a day-trip to Aquila Private Game Reserve. The day started early with a 2-hour drive from Cape Town on a rainy autumn morning.The reserve is easy to find and we presented ourselves at reception. Included in the package is a scrumptious buffet breakfast, after which we mustered for the game drive. We were surrounded by retired tourists from around the world, swaddled in their complimentary rain ponchos. We donned ours too and settled in. For the first hour or so it actually rained on us, as the vehicle is open-sided. But the rain ponchos protected our clothing. I had to hang on for dear life as the ride was very bumpy. For a moment I thought I might get motion sick!We saw all the animals and to my mind they were very tame. Elephant, rhino, hippo, zebra, giraffe, buffalo, wildebeest, eland, springbok. Plus some crocodiles, cheetahs and a shy leopard at the rescue enclosures. Having been to Etosha, the Kruger and the Addo, where you drive around for hours and if you’re lucky get to see some animals, I could immediately tell this was a whole different setup. Rather more like a large, free-roaming zoo. But enjoyable nonetheless, as you get much closer to the animals and still see their natural behaviour. After the 3-hour game viewing we were deposited back at the dining hall and treated to a good buffet lunch. After a stroll around the grounds to take a few photographs, we headed back home.Amazing to see these majestic animals up close.

Good for kids and people who haven't seen many animals. Kids loved it. Liked it too, this is something in between a zoo and a safari. If you travel to The Cape area and want to see animals this is a good place to go, but if you also travel to a big safari area drop this park. Comfortable and excellent lodges. Good buffets, and a wonderful game guide.

Amazing day out!. There are some bad reviews of Aquila on trip advisor but myself and my sister and parents spent the day at Aquila and had a great time! After 6 days in Cape Town we all agreed that our day spent at Aquila was our best.It was a few hours from the centre of Cape Town so we weren't expecting a large game reserve but it exceeded our expectations! We were greeted by friendly staff with a champagne reception and then had a breakfast buffet that had a lot of variety and there was something for us all. We then headed off on our game drive with a very friendly and knowledgable ranger. We immediately saw 2 elephants who we were able to get very close to, a lot closer than at a zoo as some of the others reviews have said. And after this saw many other animals; rhinos, lions, springbok, buffalo, wilder beast, zebras, ostrich. And the most of these animals we were able to get extremely close to. Including the cheetahs,leopard, lions and crocodiles in the rescue centre. Despite being in enclosed spaces, all the animals were there for their own safety and well being.Many complaints say that the enclosed area of the game reserve makes it more like a zoo than a safari. However, I feel as though the animals still have plenty of natural roaming room and wild land and if it was a non enclosed area, you have much less chance of seeing any animals at all! During our game drive we were pleasantly surprised when we were able to get out of the car and be closer to the animals as well as having the chance to have another glass of champagne!The lunch buffet was just as great as breakfast had been and we were all able to have as much of the varied food as we wanted! All in all, we all thoroughly enjoyed our day and it was a great place to visit! Would definitely recommend and go again.

Aqillla. This was without doubt the most pathetic place to visit, the accommodation was average , the food poor. The game viewing is non existent as there is nothing. Their advertising must be very good as there were hundreds of foreign tourists visiting daily who could snap photos in a half an hour the little game they have. The most expensive , poor service, without doubt the worst venue I have ever been to in 50 years. A total disgrace all round.

Overnight Safari. from the moment we got there to when we left the experience was great.Food was buffet style and adequate drinks not overpriced.A fantstic infinity pool overlooking game reserve.We did 2 safari one in the afternoon and one early morning. Got some fantastic pictures.Animals roam free although they kept the lions seperate they had a large area to roam.Got realy close to Elephants, Zebra, Rhino, Buffalo Ostrich, Wilderbeast, Impalla, springbok and surprisingly close to lions.well appointed basic room with air con and fridge.Well worth a visit.

Aquila safari Cape Town. After our holiday in Kenia last year we were very disappointed about this safari. This is not realy a safari at all. İt's a trip through an open zoo. There are 2 elephants, 4 rhinos and one giraffe. The lions are separated from the other animals by fences. Also the crocodiles, leopards and cheetahs are kept behind fences. There are no buffaloes or hippos. Too expensive for what they offer. The organisation however was good. We went with a small group and with a good, nice minibus. Upon arrival we were offered champagne and a very nice breakfast. After the safari there was a very nice open buffet.

Expensive zoo. Nothing to do with a game reserve. A zoo, and a very expensive one, that's all it is. Buffet in the morning, buffet for lunch and buffet for diner... Big 5? Yeah right, in cages. Someone should attack them for false advertising, robbery.

A very nice zoo... Yes it's a very big zoo.... But we knew that when we booked. If you want a proper safari you need to go to a national park, this is a private game reserve. I think they are over doing it when they advertise it as a big 5 safari but at the end of the day you still get to see the animals in a better environment then a cage. We stayed overnight, the rooms were very nice and the pool was lovely. The food was good and our guide was experienced so even though it pretty much consisted of a drive through a giant enclosure to see the animals, and a smaller one to see the lions, he told us heaps of interesting stuff. Some staff were not the friendliest, we got a particularly dirty look because we dared suggest that they should play some happier african music rather than Christmas carols. So yes it's pretty much a big zoo and its pretty pricey but you would have to go quite a bit further north to be able to see all those animals. And even in the Kruger there is no guarantee you will, at least this way you get to see animals living in a natural environment. Just don't expect to be chased by lions or witness a cheetah bringing down a springbok, it is what it is...

Game Dive!. Do not waste your time or money! This is a tourist trap and is ceratinly not a safari but a zoo! The lions are caged and there are a handful of animals to view. Having lived in Africa for 5 years this is shameful and should not to be called a safari. In addition staff were not bothered, room was grubby, mice and birds in the dining room with droppings falling from on high! The swimming pool was dirty and murky. I will not go on. The only good thing was the driver who was polite and knowledgeable. I could not wait to get out of there. Do your research and go on a real safari!

I have been twice!. My husband, my baby and I first went to this park two years ago. We had a great time and returned recently with my family of 8. We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit but second time around was even better!We went off peak and took advantage of special offers. It was freezing but still great.Good:Lots of variety at meal times.Great space in room with out door showers (in warm weather!)Personable and approachable staff. (Particularly helpful with the children and hungry pregnant mummy!)Go on both safari drives to get the most out of your experience.Great children's play area with pony and quad bikes second time around.Room for improvement:Not all the rangers are as informative and friendly.

Aquila Game Reserve. Very dissapointed having driven for 2 hours from Cape Town. Reception and dining facilities were good but the 'drive' experiance was limited for the size and lack of wildlife. You should not expect a Kruger Park experiance - quite the opposite. Not good value for money

Should call it nature drive!. The location is brilliant for a game reserve, but to be called game reserve you should have more than this 20 plus animals on a stretch of 3 hour drive! We went there on a day trip to have a nice nature experience with a safari ...
