Otherwise it would have been another boring day.Certainly a very interesting place but not for an overnight stay. if you do this - take a large book with you.

Terribly Managed and a total fraud. I stayed here for a night in early September and unfortunately we were hit with freak weather conditions and it snowed. The African style huts and the restaraunt had no facility to keep them warm and as a result we spent the night shivering and miserable!On requesting a percentage of our money to be refunded guests were conned that the Finance Manager was off site and would call them another day to arrange money to be refunded. This has never happened.The whole facility is a shambles and totally mismanaged. There's no entertainment in the evening and guests are to be seen everywhere wondering round wandering what on earth they're supposed to be doing. Don't waste your money!!!

Overpriced Aquila Zoo. Please know that your safari game drive is ultimately a rough ride around a large animal farm. Their Big 5 consists of 2 male elephants 2 rhinos 3 male buffalo 2 giraffes and a few lions. The lions are kept separate from the other animals and the chances of seeing them are very slim given the arid mountainous terrain. Aquila pretty much purchased a large plot of cheap land which is largely unsuitable for most animals, seasonally very cold and hot, with desert like shrubs and little tree cover. It is no wonder why many of the animals cannot breed successfully in captivity. Many animals are fed each day much like a farm feeds its animals. The food was very tasty at least....

Over-rated Tourist Trap. We organised a group of four of us to visit Aquila as it was recommended by a friend. It was a very disappointing experience and a real tourist trap without the quality or customer service.I was already wary before I arrived, due to issues with payment for the day safari. I had paid upfront, but had to send numerous emails to get confirmation from Aquila that payment had been received. Eventually I got a rude email back, berating me for not being clearer with my details as it had caused the person dealing with my query to spend lots of time trying to find my details.Another member of our party had problems with her payment, as she had been charged a deposit and had received a receipt from Aquila stating that the deposit had been charged and what the balance was. However on the day we arrived, she was told she had to ‘prove’ that the deposit had been taken by Aquila.As she pointed out to the receptionist – Aquila had issued the receipt saying that the deposit had been taken.Eventually this was sorted out and we headed to our breakfast. There was a lot of food on offer, including a full cooked English breakfast, continental meats, toast and cereals. The meats though were on a big table and not refrigerated and the breakfast area was not air-conditioned, so I wasn’t game to try it.Aquila’s marketing is very good – there were a lot of people there for day trips. This meant that when we headed out on our day safari, that there were four vehicles packed with people. The vehicles have bench seats, and this means that they try to pack in as many people as possible. We had four to a bench, which leaves you very cramped for a three hour game drive!We headed out ‘convoy’ style with the other vehicles, so you don’t really get to feel like you’re on a safari, more a Jurassic Park style ride. There aren’t that many animals on offer and the guide tries to fill the time (it is a three hour safari after all) with details of the birds on the lagoon, beetles (15mins on a black beetle!) and analysis of poop.The landscape at Aquila is quite flat in parts, and so isn’t that interesting, but they take the convoy up to the highest point of the reserve and you have sparkling wine or grape juice. They have giraffe’s, which are the smaller southern giraffe and they like to stick to the hills. A couple of juvenile (10 & 11 yr) old elephants, a family of Rhino (good photo opportunities, as they put out lucerne near the lake and this entices them out), lions in a caged area (bored looking), buffalo, zebra, hippo, springboks plus other various antelopes.For the cost, Aquila does not represent value for money. I know that some posters have said that it’s closest to Cape Town (2 ¼ hrs from CT along the N1 & R46 to Ceres if you drive) but having been to other game reserves slightly further out (1/2 hr further) they represented better value for money and you get to see more game.I cannot stress enough just how packed this place was with day trippers! It was like Butlins.I suggest you save your money and do more research for a better place to stay/visit which might be a little bit further out or visit a game lodge along the N2 Garden Route.

It's no Kruger, but still worthwhile. We just got back from spending a week in Cape Town and as part of our holiday we spent 2 nights at Aquila. I had read a lot of articles about Aquila so I knew exactly what to expect. Realistically, it probably would never compare to Kruger, but if you have limited time and want to experience wildlife near Cape Town, it can't be beaten. We found the staff at Aquila excellent. The Park rangers/guides were very knowledgeable, friendly and good fun. They gave us lots of interesting facts and kept the game drives fun and interesting, even when some of the animals were hiding from the cold mornings. Bar and restaurant staff were also very friendly, and we were pleasantly surprised by the excellent service we received. The food was to a pretty good standard, and due to the fact that all meals were buffets, we had a chance to try various different local dishes each day. We had the standard accommodation, which didn't look great from the outside, but inside it was cosy, clean and pretty much what we expected. My wife was concerned about creepy crawlies, but apart from 1 or 2 small flies, it was fine. On the game drives, you are obviously aware that there isn't a vast amount of animals, but we got very close to rhino's, elephants, and all of the animals (except the illusive leopard).Overall I would say it was a very enjoyable stay, as long as you do enough research so that you know what to expect, you'll enjoy it too. It seems obvious to me that anyone who has given this place a bad review did not research before hand and obviously wanted to sleep in luxury but have a "real" safari experience, which is not possible close to Cape Town. Also, Aquila is a relatively new reserve, and I think in 10 or 15 years when it has had chance to mature and add more animals, it will be an amazing experience.I would recommend the Quad Bike and Horse-back safari's, they were great fun, and a chance to get even closer to the animals than you do on the standard game drive.

Expectations met. We stayed at Aquila for one night in February. The reason for the visit was for our four year old grandson to see animals in the 'wild' and not caged in a zoo. We were aware before we went that this would be a 'canned' safari and touristy. This met our expectations. The annoying aspect (which we complained about vocally and in writing) was that the garden and swimming pool was taken over by a film crew and not accessible to hotel guests - as the temperature was in the mid 30's this was not appreciated.The accommodation was acceptable but a good maintenance programme is needed (again the written complaint). Food very similar to a four star package holiday hotel.If you have young children or have a very limited time in South Africa then this is the place to visit - bearing in mind this is NOT the real experience. Our grandson loved the stay!

poor organisation and not a good experience. I stayed for 2 nights here and wish I had spent my time (and money) elsewhere.We arrived in the late afternoon after the 5pm safari drive and were taken to our chalet which was more Mexican looking than African by the manager , the door was hanging off the hinges and required you to lift the door to open/close and lock it- we were assured it would be fixed the next day - it never was and as the paint on the floor had been rubbed off it showed the door had been like this for a long time. Looking around the room it was ok on initial inspection but a closer look revealed quite a few problems. The bath had a tide mark from the last occupants, the string curtains were stained and un ravelling and the string trail had just been wound into a ball , old used toiletries left in the bath and shower area and no toilet brush.NOTE: there is not a picture of the normal chalets on the aquila website and all you see are the luxury chalets that are located just outside the restaurant /main area.We went for dinner ( self service) and the food was traditional Afrikaans which is fine, they had a wide selection of items to suit most people. I noted one of the desserts was ice cream but it was just on a plate so after about 45 minutes it had turned to liquid - tough luck if you like ice cream! We ordered a large bottle of water but that turned out to be R25 very expensive and all drinks are extra at highly inflated prices. We did note however a fruit juice machine on the main table and this was free. We went to our chalet but were woken up by the game rangers parking outside our chalet , slamming the doors etc and making lots of noise - it seems they also sleep in the chalets, I didn't need to bother setting my alarm as I was woken again in the morning by the same rangers beeping the horn of the vehicle and lots of door slamming.Before the 6am "safari drive" we asked at reception where shall we meet and were told at the front of the reception, and to just join any vehicle, this we did and people dispersed onto various vehicles, it then appeared there were not enough seats for all the people so instead of just taking another vehicle we waited for about 15 mins whilst they came up with a plan - a lady decided not to go on the game drive and went back to her chalet as there was not enough room for her. We found out the guests are allocated into groups for the vehicles and we were meant to be on another vehicle but that was also full so the problem would have still existed!The drive in the morning was about 2.5 hours but over a small area, we saw a lot of animals but I noticed most were waiting in feeding areas - the animals are fed at specific areas along the game drive route so it ensures you will see them. Our game ranger/guide appeared very bored and gave some very limited info throughout the drive.The lions are in a separate area, not a cage as some reviews suggest but in a fenced off area so you will see them.We returned to the reception area after the game drive feeling quite disappointed , we had a look at the various facilities the main area had to offer and were not impressed by any means - leaking toilets and quite a few were dirty due to the lack of toilet brushes but this was about 0830 in the morning so I can only assume the toilets had not been cleaned.When back at the chalet I found lots of old cigarette butts and old milk packets in the chalet seating area and the 1 chair we had was falling apart. There is not much to do during the day time unless you pay extra to go on a quad bike or horse drive but you just follow the same sort of pattern as the normal game drives and see the same animals so its nothing new really.We went on the 5pm game drive and this time asked where we were meant to be, having found our group we went for the drive, this time the ranger/guide was really good, appeared to have a genuine interest and had lots of info, but again the drive was in the same small area and we saw all the same animals, 2 elephants, 2 giraffes, few ostriches, few rhinos, buffalo etc get a bit boring after seeing them a few times on the same drive. We stopped for a while and were given cheap sparkling wine and grape juice along with a selection of some fruit and a packet of marshmallows????!! The evening meal was different from the night before but this time the service was very bad, we had to clear our own table between courses, the fruit juice machine was not there and after asking the waitress she said it was broken ( this appeared to to be the standard answer to most questions if something was missing) but nothing was offered as an alternative which was very bad, not even cold tap water was available - warm tap water was!During our meal we overheard many another couples complaining about various items and none were impressed with the facilities or the service.we decided to skip the 6am game drive as we had seen all the animals the park had to offer and the drive was along the same routes we had already been on.I filled out the "guest satisfaction" survey in the welcome pack with similar comments and gave it to the receptionist and mentioned we were not happy, she wasnt listening or looking at us and just said "ok thanks." I didnt bother saying any more as it was obvious it was a waste of timeIf you are on holiday, have the extra cash to spend and have never seen any wild animals before then I suppose it is ok , you can also do a day visit from CT but read other reviews on that!!! I would not spend more than 1 night there as the routine is the same each day. Based on my personal observations Aquila is in reality a 3* resort and no where near the 4* plaque from the tourist board The concept at Aquila is a good one but the facilities and organisation needs to be greatly improved.For similar costs visit Shamwari near Port Elizbeth and go to a real game reserve that has received many awards.

Fake overpriced safari experience. Beware - this is a game FARM / ZOO and not a reserve. If you are truly interested in seeing wild animals in their natural environment then you're better off elsewhere. Aquila offer a canned experience as they feed their "wild" animals and it's a marketing ploy that the service offered is great or that the accomodation is luxurious. It is very expensive for what is on offer. Since they market specifically to young families note that child minders (ie housekeeping staff) will take your (crying) toddlers to watch them fold linen in a hot dingy laundry when you use their services!We are seasoned luxury game lodge visitors so know what to expect. This is where Aquila fell short:1) we did not get what we booked for, nor could it be rectified both before the time or once we arrived2) the accommodation was so cramped we could barely move around and furnishings were extremely basic (some was actually removed to seat day trippers leaving us without chairs)3) game drive offerings are mean - dodgy cheap sparkling wine is the best thing on offer4) food is okay, but choices are very limited and all drinks etc are extra's so it's expensive 5) babysitting services offered are a joke (see above)On the plus side, it is close to Cape Town (therefore obviously convenient and malaria free) and their guides are knowledgeable (wouldn't you be about 2 giraffe, lions in an enclosure, 2 elephants, 3 rhino's, a few hippo etc?). You can be pretty sure you'll see some big game (as the reserve area is small, and animals come to be fed before drives!!!!!!!) so taking kids is viable (they won't get bored) but you will be left feeling ripped off. I'd only recommend this place to those not interested in a real safari experience, or those with limited options. Rather pay a bit more and go to Bushmanskloof, Shamwari or elsewhere for the REAL THING.

Beware. IMy husband and i were fortunate enough to spend the month of november in wonderful South Africa. We were keen to go to a game reserve and as we were in the Western Cape Aquila Game Reserve was near and sounded very appealing, luxurious even, so we went ahead and booked it.Aquila is only just set off a farily busy road, so the 'ideal view' of animals was infact a road with lorries passing by. Our welcome was less than friendly and as we discovered on our arrival not as luxurious as we had expected for an expensive overnight stay and safari. I did forget to mention by the way, we booked our safari before we left the uk. Luckily we were able to check our email and were shocked to discover that Aquilia had double booked our accommodation, had we not been in south africa for a month we would not have been able to reschedule. Also the web site was out of date for the season, so double check arrival times and times of the safaries.Our first safari was at 6pm, make sure you go to the loo before you leave as its a three hour drive. We were very unlucky as the weather was dreadful, very cold, wet and windy. Our guide drove us around and we saw quite a few of the animals, we stopped for the luxury break, and were served hot chocolate, sparkling wine and the lovely snacks we were expecting were a packet of marshmellows, sweets and some billtong. NOT luxurious in any way! The lions are kept in fenced enclosures and do not run free, but we did see giaraffe up very close.The food was also very ordinary, again it was advertised as top quality and all wine was charged on top so beware it was expensive.We had torrential rain during the night and in the morning we had water running down our not so luxury accommodation, when we reported it we were just told 'the couple next door had the same problem'!!After our return to cape town we wrote a long letter to Aquila, hoping for a reply we waited and waited and waited. Absolutely nothing. If i were to describle Aquila, i would say it is an over rated tourist trap, you are taken advantage of as most people go for only a day or over night stay so most people would probably not bother to complain. I would save your cash and spend it on a proper safari, just do a lot of research.

Beautiful tourist trap. We made a visit to Aquila last week after conducting all Internet-based research, including on Trip Advisor. Now that I have reread the reviews I can say that in conclusion that they are very reliable!I would like to add that the marketing of Aquila as Cape Town's only Big 5 safari is misleading! This is a man-made safari and as such I think it was overpriced for what we got. But like others who made the trip to Aquila, I was visiting only the Cape Town area and had my heart set on an African safari and was willing to compromise because we had limited time and were also traveling with children. The grounds were indeed beautiful as was the drive to the location. Lunch in the beautiful African-designed dining room was great, but dinner and breakfast were mediocre.The guide Claire was terrific, and the vehicles were very safe. We went looking for the many animals on the reserve which turned out to be a few of each type: two giraffe, 5 buffalo, 2 rhinos, 3 hippos, 14 zebra and 7 lions and one elephant. This being the case I don't think this should have been marketed as a safari! The animals were beautiful when viewed up close and in a natural African landscape.My main qualm was with the accommodations. It was marketed as family luxury. At the price we paid I did not think we would be roughing it. There was no AC and no screens on the windows. That meant a night with little air to breath and lots of bugs that had crawled in. The children's loft was totally suffocated so we ended up sharing a 140 cm bed with him after he threw up in the middle of the night. We were so ready to leave in the morning that we didn't bother trying to complain. In conclusion, I would recommend going for the cheaper day trip to Aquila and skipping the overnight.

aquila, November 2007. Aquila is a newish reserve so doesn't have many animals as such. the lions are kept seperate in a cage because they would kill all other animals. the cheetahs are hand reared so they are tame and u can pet them. The accommodation is clean and a bit rough and ready but overall not bad. Thought the food was great and the 2 bars are also fine. The tour guide, Colin, was a gentleman and seemed very knowledgable.Our main problem was that we had no car so had to use the transfer service. We were collected from our hotel in cape Town at 6am and arrived in Aquila at 8am to be told our first game drive of 2 would be at 5pm. We were then told that our accommodation was not ready and it didn't become available until 11.30am, so we were left sitting with our bags for 3 and a half hours. It was a long day waiting until 5pm for the drive. The next day we had an early start (6am) and saw more animals and had a fine breakfast, but all this was over by 9am and the transfer back to the city doesn't leave until 2pm so again there is more waiting around with bags.The reserve has a bit of an artificial feel about it but is a good way to get up close with the animals.

Disappointing!. My family & I were terribly disappointed with Aquila Game Reserve. For a start it was very expensive for what you got. When we arrived we had breakfast which was very poor - not a lot on offer and cold. (Lunch was included but after the breakfast decided not to have lunch). There was not a lot of game to see and they warned us at the start we may not see anything! However we saw springbok, wildebeast, lions (caged) a hippo in the distance (could have been plastic) and two elephants. We did enjoy the guide who was knowledgeable and entertaining.

Lots of fun. Okay, so this is not a safari-safari, out in the wild with tons of animals, but as a private game reserve, Aquila was nonetheless a lot of fun. They have about 100 zebras, a few lions, two elephants, two giraffe, a few hippos and a few rhinos, among other types of animals. Since we were going with a very young child, it felt like a good alternative to a longer, "proper" safari. You can see all that's relevant at Aquila in their two hour tour. The tour guide was knowledgeable and told us that she could stop the jeep whenever we wanted to take photos. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Aquila also had scrumptious Western-style breakfast and lunch buffets (go hungry!), which were included with the price of the safari (except drinks aren't included at lunch). The only thing about the safari (we went in August, during South Africa's winter) was that it was very chilly -- so wear a sweatshirt and jeans if you go during that time. There is one portion of the safari where you hike for a minute uphill to see a bushman painting on a rock, so sneakers or flat shoes would also be advisable. If you want to bring a bag, there is plenty of room on the jeep floor. At the end of the safari, they bring you to the cheetah enclosure and you can pet them!

Grrreat trip from Cape Town!. My partner and I actually stayed here in Feb 06, but as I was browsing through trip advisor, I noticed that there are not many reviews of this property and as we had such an enjoyable time I thought I would share my comments!During a 10 day holiday to Cape Town we came across a brochure on Aquila. As there is so much to see and do in Cape Town we had not pre planned any outside trips but decided on the spur of the moment to call and book a 1 night stay. Neither of us had ever been on a Safari and it was not feasable for us to link our Cape Town trip with somewhere like Kruger, partly due to time, (We were visiting family), and partly due to cost. So this seemed like a good alternative and a good oppurtunity to see more of the Western Cape.I called to check availability literally the day before we wanted to go. Initially I was advised that they were fully booked but would check if there was anything they could do. We were coming to the end of our holiday, so didn't have a lot of flexibility, especially as we wanted to celebrate valentines day in Cobbs, (our favourite restaurant in Scarborough).As promised we received a call back later that day to say that they would be able to squeeze us in, we were delighted!After a very scenic 2 hour drive we arrived at Aquila, were warmly greeted with welcome drinks and shown around the grounds which were very well kept. We drove our car to the door of our room, which was very nicely furnished, spotlessly clean, with an indoor bathroom and outdoor shower.While bringing our luggage in, we were followed by an over friendly osterich who decided to set up camp on our terrace and wait for us to come out!. I had never been so close to one before and didn't actually realise how big they are! We went on a sunset safari trip to get our first glimpse of the animals! The staff are fantastic, very knowledgeable and have a wonderful sense of humour. They really had a personal touch in making sure everyone was well looked after and really explained in depth the history behind Aquila and the areas of the grounds that we passed through.Considering that we were well aware that this was a very new reserve, we were pleasantly surprised at how natural the animals looked in their new found habitat. It was explained to us that all the different types of animals that had been brought to the reserve would years ago have been there naturally anyway.We paused for a sparkling wine and nibbles break at sunset, which was very enjoyable and a great oppurtunity to take some pictures and admire the stunning scenery.All meals are served buffet style here and they were fantastic. Very fresh, excellent variety, mainly with Cape Malay influence, all very tasty and a nice selection of desserts.After a very comfortable nights sleep, we were up before sunrise to go on our next safari tour. This really was a wonderful experience and I have included as many pictures as possible. Unfortunately we did not have a great camera at the time, as you will see :)After a delicious breakfast we lounged around the swimming pool, which also has a nice little bar nearby. We had photos taken with the Cheetah Cubs and admired the fake looking but very real crocs pretending to be asleep in their own pool (near the restaurant).We stayed for lunch (also included in the package) relaxed a bit more and then took a leisurely drive back to Cape Town.All in all a very enjoyable stay and we felt a value for money worthwhile experience! I probably would not recommend this for people who have been on Safaris before as I'm sure this is not "the real thing" but as a short trip from Cape Town it is well worth doing!

Wonderful/Maleria Free. VISITED CAPE TOWN IN MAY.No time for kruger but this was really good.Stay overnight if poss daytrippers did not seem to get best of it.Rooms A1 food vg drink not expensive cheaper than cape town.weather for us was better than cape town(dont get me wrong capetowns good even when it rains).Best way to get there hire car and add a night on route also(you can be picked up via mini bus extra charge)we saw big five had safari truck to ourselves.Go in cheeta enclosure vg.ROMEO our ranger was the best. It may not be kruger but if you want maleria free plus be near western cape give it a go you wont be disapointed.
Safari Day Tour. Well arranged ahead of time. Took reviews from Tripadvisor prior to my trip. Though pricing alittle bit of difference from direct booking, its still negligible.

4 days visit with Cape Town. We are group of 8 peoples and first time in Cape Town, our tour guide was Gavin for four days in Cape Town, Gavin was very professional and knowledgeable for his city. Gavin always on times to pick us up from hotel, our first day was scheduled to take cable car to Table Mountain, but it was too windy and the cable car got cancelled. Gavin told us he would keep trying for tomorrow and he gave checking the weather forecast on the second day, on the second day in the afternoon, Gavin told us it would be good time to go for the cable car to Table Mountain. We are very please for his hard work. All of us are very happy to had him as our tour guide. Also I am very please to deal with Sofie Otto in PG TOPS Travel & Tours, Sofie always replied my email in timely matter. We had a wonderful 4 days tours in Cape Town.

Good company. I had to coordinate via email, and it took awhile, but Sofie was very patient. My actual guide Ryan was awesome and very knowledgeable. I only had few places that I had to go (Cheetah reserve, shark cage diving) and he filled in the rest. Additionally, it was reasonably priced to have my own personal tour guide.

Spectacular Peninsula Tour. We loved our full day peninsula tour! Gavin was a wonderful guide, very courteous and extremely congenial and made sure we saw all the top spots on the peninsula. He gave us lots of information and enriched our visit with his knowledge. The views were fantastic and Gavin made sure we had plenty photo opportunities! Of course, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and the Boulder Penguins were highlights. If we ever get to return to Cape Town, PG Tours will be our guides of choice!

The Vineyards. We had a one day tour with Jared to the vineyards to do some wine tasting. We had a brief stop in Stellenbosch where we did some shopping plus we had lunch at Ernie Els' vineyard which had fabulous views. Jared was a very good guide. He gave us lots of information about the history of South Africa and he is very knowledgeable about wine. He is also extremely easy company.

Cape Town 1/2 day & Winelands full day private tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tours with Jurie Brandt on our two PG Tops tours. This was a perfect introduction to a first visit to Cape Town & Paarl, Franshhoek & Stellenbosch. From trip planning to execution, we were very happy with all services provided. Jurie is very personable, knowledgeable, congenial, attentive and provides great insights for visitors to this very beautiful part of South Africa. We made it to the top of Table Mountain, despite some early morning rain due to his flexibility & persistent checking to learn when the cable car re-opened.Thanks also go to Madelaine Kinsman for organizing all our day tours including a tour to Robben Island. We were in very capable hands. I would highly recommend PG Tops & Jurie Brand to travellers coming to the Cape.Well done.John Cosgrove Calgary, Canada

Amazing and informative tours!. What a fantastic 5 days we spent with Jarred in August. We did Cape Point, wine tasting, sky diving, zip lining, Table Mountain and Robben Island. We were a mixed group, ranging in age from 13 to 60 and every one of us had the most fantastic time. Jarred was an excellent guide, always friendly, always on time and a fountain of knowledge. Madelaine arranged all our tours so efficiently. Thank you PG Tops, you made our holiday in Cape Town memorable - we will be back!

Superb Service & Highly Knowledgeable Staff. I was really impressed with this company. From the initial enquiry whilst in the UK right through to the actual trips we booked in SASpecial thanks to Bianca who managed our enquiry and was our first point of contact and the first impression of the business - superb service, really friendly and helpful on every levelAlso to Jarred our Guide for Cape Town and Table Mountain. How he stores all that knowledge I will never know. Great experience all round and the samosas were fab!Anne Marie - our guide for the Winelands Trip. Again superb knowledge, paying great attention to our likes/dislkes and the choice of where we tasted, enjoyed food and also art.We will definitely book again - Well Done Guys for some great experiences!

Amazing Tours! Cape Point, Cape Winelands and Horseback Riding. From the first email to the end of the last tour, PG Tops and its staff was professional, attentive and on top of it all, even when our scheduled kayaking with the penguins excursion was cancelled. I worked with Madelaine for weeks ahead of my visit to make sure we would make the most of our trip! She selected the perfect tour guides for each of our days, give us a well rounded and amazing experience! Cape Point TourOur group of three had Richard for the Cape Point Tour, he was extremely knowledgeable and gave us the background. He was flexible with our schedule and was able to get us to all the stops. He even humored us when we wanted to stop to see the wildlife. Cape Winelands TourGavin was an awesome guide for our Winelands Tour, he selected wineries catering to our party of two's extremely polar opposite palettes! Despite a rainy day, we enjoyed everything the Cape Winelands had to offer and had an amazing delectable day! Horseback Riding/Kayaking Even though our excursion to kayak with the penguins was cancelled, Carl took us horseback riding on the beach. Like both Richard and Gavin, he gave us educational commentary of Cape Town and made suggestions on how to best make the most of the remaining time on our holiday. All three of our tour guides were AWESOME They each provided a unique perspective and gave us a well rounded view of the wonderful things Cape Town has to offer as well as a sneak peek at life in the Mother City. I highly recommend PG Tops and their guides - they are a must when traveling to Cape Town. I will be sure to use them again if I am ever back in Cape Town!!

Helpful Guide and well planned trip. We had a Garden Route private tour for two. It was very well planned after communication with Ingrid, especially considering that we wanted to do and see as many things as possible. Our guide was Jurie - he was very helpful and informative. Due to weather conditions, our shark dive was cancelled on its scheduled date. We wanted to visit Cape Aghulas as an alternative and Jurie was happy to drive us there. I would also like to thank Jurie, Ingrid and Yolanda who helped us book the shark dive on another day, after our Garden Route tour was over. The accommodation guesthouses chosen were also very beautiful and had good service, however they were a bit far from the centre so it might be a bit uncomfortable to stay out late at night, however Jurie always offered to drive us and come pick us up whenever we went out in the evening.

Great private tour!. Went on a fantastic private tour to the cape of good hope and boulders beach with my girlfriend and Gavin (tour guide) it was a fantastic day out.Gavin picked us up at 8:30am and we first discussed what we wanted from the day, my girlfriend likes a photo or two and he knew all the best spots, he was very flexible with the itinerary and we were never rushed. We went all round the cape of good hope and Hout Bay. We had lunch at the Harbour House restaurant (review to follow) then on to the penguins at boulders beach.Gavin was very knowledgeable and friendly, he is a credit to the company and we will book again.

Great tours!. We spent 2 full days out of our 5 day trip to Cape Town with Provia and she was the best! She was professional, fun, knowledgeable and gave us great input to make the best of our short visit. We did a full day Cape Point tour, which was fantastic. Provia even squeezed in a visit to an Ostrich farm that my mom wanted to visit. Provia was wonderful on our 2nd day when we last minute switched from the Hermanus day trip to a Wine tour. This trip was on the last day of our trip, and was the first time in 4 days that Table Mountain was open, so she stopped at Table Mountain for us on the way to wine country. Her flexibility was amazing! We would definitely recommend Provia and PG Tops for any Cape Town tours!

Excellent Cape Point tour. We were a group of three on a one week visit to Cape Town. We took a Cape Point and Penguins tour with Richard who was very open and knowledgeable about not only the sites that we visited but about life in Cape Town. We saw Hout Bay and the Duiker island seals, took a drive on Chapmans Peak Drive, visited the penguins at Boulders Beach, and of course, took in the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point where we climbed up to the lighthouse and back. On the way back we stopped at some craft stalls and took a drive through some seaside hamlets. We really enjoyed our day out and would recommend Richard as a guide.

Luxury Safari. I'm still here in Cape Town and heading out tomorrow for the safari portion of my tour. I'm so excited with Luxury Safaris, (sister company of PG Tops), that I didn't want to wait until I got back. First of all, Sofie Otto put together a private tour for me that was exactly what I wanted. It covered all the important sites and a lot of fun sites. She was aware of my mobility issues and took that.into consideration. She assigned a guide named Jamie, who is truly amazing. We are getting along like long lost family. She is so patient with me because of my walking problems and my use of a walker. She is extremely knowledgable and personable. One day they asked if I would mind them sending a trainee with us to the vineyards. It was fine with me ( the more the merrier ). Imogen came along. She was previously a ranger and decided to become a tour guide. She was also extremely knowledgable and personable. She will be an awesome tour guide when her training is finished. I would highly recommend PG Tops because they do care about their clients

Great Experience with PG Tops and Ryan. Cape Town and surrounds were fantastic. We had a grand time in Cape Town and the nearby places we visited and our experience going around were made even more wonderful by PG Tops and the guide assigned to us, Ryan.Ryan is fun, informative, engaging and is very patient. He managed the changes in weather really well and got us to see, visit and experience the places we wanted to visit and more. He conducted his work professionally. It is easy for him to be your friend also as he is friendly and engaging.I strongly recommend PG Tops for travel and tours in SA.

Top place to visit . We spent three days with Sarina touring the Cape and the Winelands. A knowledge, friendly disposition and willingness to adjust plans to suit us made our time touring Cape Town very great. She get to our interests and planned accordingly, museum and an amazing historic house. for a delicious meal at a restaurant once again chosen to suit our tastes. We have used many private guides during our travels and Sarina has been one of the best, highly recommend and will definitely come back... If any one interested in such kind of!!! Choose them they are the best

Great highlight tours outside of Cape Town. Our family began our 2 week vacation in South Africa with 3 full days in Cape Town. Since we had never been there before, we felt that using a tour company to ensure that we made the best use of our time was a good idea. Yes it was! We booked 2 full days with PG Tops and one half day, to the Langa Township, which I will review separately. Our guide for the two full days was Provia. On our first full day we traveled to Cape Point. On the second day, she took us to the wineries. The drive to Cape Point was beautiful as we drove along the coast. Even though we had a few showers as we drove, every time we got out of the van the skies cleared and the views were amazing. We visited Cape Point, the Lighthouse and on the way back to Cape Town stopped at Boulders Beach to see the Penguin colony and passed through Simon's Town. On our second day with Provia, she helped us customize our tour. I had been encouraged to visit Franschoeck and we wanted to have something other than only wineries for our kids, ages 17 & 11. Provia organized a day where we visited a Lion Refuge, stopped to tour Franschoek and visited two wineries. The Lion Rescue Park has rescued lions from zoos and the circus and cares for the mistreated and injured animals. The pens for the lions were huge, each lion's history was posted so that we could understand how they came to the refuge. Franschoek was a quaint town with a lot of arts, restaurants and beautiful architecture. We visited our first winery in Paarl, Fairview Winery, and then traveled to Stellenbosch for lunch. After lunch we visited Ernie Els Winery in Stellenbosh Central. It was a beautiful 2 days of touring the Cape Town countryside. Having a tour company that was willing to customize and accommodate our interests as well as provide suggestions we were not aware of, greatly enhanced our appreciation and enjoyment of our visit.

Langa Township tour and Robben Island tour. Amazing tour of Cape Town with a personalized tour of the Langa township. Our tour guide Godfrey was absolutely incredible! He grew up in Langa, so it was very personal to him. We learned so much about Cape Town and South Africa through him. Very personable and extremely knowledgeable. He then took us to the ferry to Robben Island, which was awe inspiring all on its own. I highly recommend this tour to anyone touring Cape Town and wanting a very first hand experience of this beautiful city and its people. You will NOT be disappointed!

Fantastic wine tour with Jared. My father and I visited Cape Town August 2016. It was a last minute trip and as such arranged very hastily. But with the help of PG Tops, and specifically Lauren-Lee, we were able to arrange for a half-day winelands tours. Our tour guide, Jared, showed up early. He proved to be a great fount of knowledge, briefing us on everything from Cape Town history to wine making to present day politics. The wine was delicious and the views were incredible -- this tour was 100% worth the cost. I would highly recommend to anyone.

Great Tour!. The tour staff was wonderful to work with. I want to thank Bianca and Rich for making this tour great. Bianca assisted me with tour schedule changes due to a MAJOR flight delay. She was a wonderful person to work with.I took the one day Cape Point and Penguin tours with Rich; he was an excellent guide. He gave me insight into life in South Africa as well as useful tourist information regarding the sites. I usually do not like tours because of the tight schedule to see the main sites; however, Rich gave us sufficient time to check out the sites. He was also very flexible.I highly recommend taking a day tour with PG Tops. In fact, if I make it back to Cape Town, I will certain book another tour with them.

Fantastic!. We spent two fantastic days with Sarina touring the Cape and the Winelands. Her expert knowledge, friendly disposition and willingness to adjust plans to suit us made our time touring Cape Town very enjoyable. She listened to our interests and planned accordingly, even to the extent of dropping my husband at the motor museum and taking myself nearby to an amazing historic house for a wine tasting before joining back up for a lovely meal at a restaurant once again chosen to suit our tastes. We have used many private guides during our travels and Sarina has been one of the best, I would highly recommend her and her team.

A tour guide that trumps the tour!. Being discerning travellers, we often have high expectations of our trips and know for a fact that one thing that makes or breaks your tours/holidays is having the right guide. Witty, patient and accommodating Merryl made our customised trip through various parts of Cape Town a very informative and entertaining experience. It felt more like a trip with a relative who packed in facts and anecdotes as she guided us on the best routes to take while going up to see the lighthouse at the Cape of Good, ways to beat the crowd to view the penguin colony at Boulders Beach and the patience to stop at the right places to get the best view and shots along Chapman's Peak Drive, even accommodating our quirky request for 'animal-crossing' signs! It takes a lot to impress us but Merryl won us over her with her passion and vast knowledge of practically every topic that we spoke of, not just the places that we visited/passed by.At the end of the day, we came away with not only memories of gorgeous sights and places but made a lovely, new friend :)

Great Cape Town tour company. We, along with another couple, arranged 2 full day and 1 half day tour with PG Tops. The full days were the Cape Peninsula and Wine land. The half day was a township tour. There were the four of us plus our guide in a mini van. The tour guides were outstanding, especially the township and peninsula tours. The wine land guide did arrange stops and tastings at three outstanding wineries with one having a great lunch available. All three guides picked us up at our guest house. We would certainly engage them again and highly recommend them.

Simply Brilliant!. Here is a shout out to Merryl, our guide for the past 4 days, who has been absolutely fabulous!I had liaised with Sarina, who had been prompt and efficient in answering all our questions and organising the tour. We did the Cape Town City tour, wine land tour, whale watching tour as well as the Cape Peninsula tour with PG Tops- we had no regrets choosing them.At the airport, Merryl was there waiting patiently for us and brought us promptly to the hotel to get our holiday started.As my dad could get a little grumpy, Merryl had been absolutely patient and kind throughout the trip and was really thoughtful. Apart from being a totally safe driver, she is also very knowledgable on the different subjects including geography, history, botany as well as wines! She just has so many ideas and thoughts!If you are looking for just a driver, you could probably get one easily. BUT to get a safe driver AND a guide who could talk about almost any subject with confidence, it would be a rarity. Merryl is one such gem in the hospitality industry in Cape Town.Indeed, I find most organised tours to be rushed, and not attentive to needs of less abled passengers, and in most cases, boring to say the least. I find my private tour to be totally relaxing, flexible, and thoroughly interesting. I would give a high recommendation for PG Tops and Merryl if you are planning your trip to Cape Town.

First Rate Service. We were celebrating a small wedding in Cape Town. The bride's parents wanted to treat all the guests who flew in from all over the world to a day trip to Cape Peninsula. We had a bus and a guide. They were phenomenal! We absolutely loved Sarina! She was very warm, patient and knowledgeable. She also took great photos of us! Thank you Oriane from PG Tops for the professionalism and always being so accommodating. Thank you!

Peninsula tour around Cape. We did this PG tops tour with our guide Andrew. Really friendly guy and extremely knowledgeable. He picked us up on time and we spent a day going around the cape peninsula with him. Saw penguins on boulders beach, seals in one of the bays as well as many other sites as we went around. He gave us a lot of history of the area and knew a lot of the wildlife. Thanks Andrew we really enjoyed your tour.

PH tops tours. Just completed 3 days with PG tops. This company was incredible and if I'm ever blessed enough to return to this beautiful city I wouldn't hesitate to book with them again. Sophie was very flexible along the way with our itinerary and easily accessible when we wanted to make changes due to weather or preferences. Richard, our first guide, took us to townships which was an eye awakening experience and took us to eat some if their local food and homemade beer! Jarred was our guide the next 2 days. We were incredibly impressed by his knowledge in all areas: history, culture, flora and fauna, and wine to mention just a few!! Thank you PG tops! We had an Awesome time in Capetown.

A Fun few Days in Cape Town. We spent two great days touring Cape Town with Carel, a guide with PG Tops. Carel was knowledgable about both the flora and fauna of Cape Town, and guided us through the Peninsula and the Wine Region. He was able to assess our interests and plan the days accordingly, accommodating both the teenagers and adults in our group. The communication with the organization from first point of contact was friendly, helpful and efficient. I would highly recommend PG Tops.

Great tour with Pierre!. We booked a day and a half tour with PG Tops, to make the best of our free weekend in Cape Town. Pierre was a great guide, very knowledgeable, very friendly and he really gave us a personalized tour. We were able to see the Capes, penguins, the Table mountain and taste some wine. Would highly recommend the agency, and of course, Pierre!

Two great days with PG Tops!. Late in our trip planning, we decided we didn't want to rent a car in Cape Town and opted instead to hire PG Tops to get us out and about. It was a good decision, much more relaxing and with the added value of the historical and cultural perspective the guides could provide. Oriane in the PG Tops office was super to work with - very helpful and responsive.Our first day out with PG Tops was a private tour of the Cape Peninsula with Carel. Carel was great - very knowledgeable and personable. He managed to side-step any potential crowds, affording us largely unobstructed views and overall a more personal experience. He also has eagle eyes and was able to show us wildlife along the way, including shy eland camouflaged in the bush. He is also an avid scuba diver and shared a lot of his local knowledge re: dive sights, etc. Since we are not divers ourselves, this was only of passing interest.Our second day out with PG Tops was a trip to Cape Winelands with Sarina and Mike. Both were lovely and set a nice pace for the day (Sarina as the guide and Mike in training). Since we were planning to be dropped off in Franschhoek at the end of the tour, our goal was to get an overview of Cape Winelands enroute. We made stops in Stellenbosch (The Spice Route), Paarl (Lanzerac), and Franschhoek (Boschendall and Grande Provence). We had a tasty and beautiful lunch at Boschendall Winery overlooking the kitchen gardens. Our only regret is that it really was a large, heavy meal, and we would've been happier doing something less formal.Overall, we would highly recommend PG Tops. They are very professional and friendly, their automobiles are comfortable and well maintained, and they have put great thought into their itineraries.

PG Tops and Jarred Vosges, you are stars!. We had a 6-day private escorted tour organised by Bianca at PG Tops for our family of two adults and three teenage children, taking us from Cape Town to Addo Elephant Park. It was our first visit to South Africa and Jarred Vosges our PG Tops tour guide was extremely knowledgeable about everything South Africa, and I mean everything! He made the whole trip and we are forever grateful. We could not have asked for more! As first time visitors we were a little apprehensive but we really had no need to be. South Africa is a beautiful country and so are the people. I won’t bore you with the finer details of our holiday, but all I will say is 'visit South Africa!' You will not be disappointed.Chris SmithChristchurch, UK.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We had an awesome tour of the Cape Peninsula with Pierre June 3, 2016. Pierre was so knowledgeable about the entire area, he was a wealth of info. We had a private tour for 4, the vehicle was really nice , clean, and comfortable. Thanks so much it was 5******

1. Full-day tour to Cape of Good Hope & 2. Full day tour of Wine Country and Cape Town city.. Our guide for both days was Jarred Vosges. Jarred was fantastic! He is extremely knowledgable, but just as important, was a delight to spend two days with: flexible, great sense of humor, provided tons of info but never seemed to be lecturing us; gave us plenty of time to visit, relax and learn. We all (2 couples traveling together) encouraged Jarrod to come visit us in California if he ever can; we'd love to see him again and repay his hospitality. And the folks at PG Tops (Sarina in particular) were easy to deal with and made no mistakes in our arrangements at all.Highest possible recommendation for PG Tops and Jarrod!

Leslie was an excellent tour guide!. We had the most wonderful day in Cape Town with our tour guide, Leslie. He was friendly, informative, flexible and just fun to be around. We did a ton of things; Cape Point, Richmond Peak drive, Cape of Good Hope, Houts Bay, Boulder's Beach, Table Mountain, Imhoff Farms...it was just amazing. Thanks again for a wonderful time, Leslie!

Great Help from Bianca !!. I was dealing with Bianca to plan a trip for a large group and from the moment I e-mailed her, I received excellent help. She always replied within the day and changed and modified the trip as we needed. She had great suggestions and offered an excellent package ,competitively priced. Unfortunately we couldn't go ahead with the 4 day garden route tour but I felt her hard work and many e-mails deserved some recognition and I would definitely recommend PG tops .

Insightful.... We had a 3 day trip arranged for us at Cape Town with PG Tops. From the moment we contacted them until we left the Cape, everything was done very efficiently. Madelaine at the office was quick to respond to all emails, listened attentively to our requirements and put together a package which met all our needs. On the first 2 days, Johan took us to Table Mountain, ensured that we were on our way safely to Robben Island and showed us the best that the Cape Peninsula had to offer. On our last day, we had a township tour of Langa and Richard took us through the place in a sensitive way. We would not hesitate to engage PG Tops again on our next South African trip. Thank you, team.

A great day at The Cape!. We booked a full day private tour of the Cape and Boulders Beach. Our guide Deon picked us up at our hotel exactly at 8:30 am as promised. He started off by asking us what we specifically wanted out of the day and if there was anything in particular that we wanted to see. In addition to the Cape of Good Hope and the Penguins we wanted to stop at Haut Bay and see the seals. He was very informative and made several stops along our drive to the Cape to let us take pictures. We saw and learned so much that day. I would highly recommend a private tour. It was tailored specifically to us and what we wanted to do and see. Deon was the perfect guide! We enjoyed our day with him!

Great service, fantastic team. We booked 3 days of guide/driver with PG Tops for our group of 8. I worked with Sarina to book. She was highly responsive to emails and even scheduled a Skype call so she could better understand our group's desired experience. She booked us with Leslie, since we are a younger group, and he was awesome! He was so flexible, personable and a delight. He really catered to our every need as we dove with sharks, visited Table Mountain & Cape Point (even going to "rescue" the 5 in our group who thought hiking up Table Mountain was a good idea) and went touring in the Winelands. He totally understood us and took us to great, local spots for meals and showed us more than we would have thought to ask for. He somehow managed to corral the 8 of us rambunctious ladies so we didn't miss anything we wanted to do, which was definitely a challenge. We wouldn't have had nearly as fantastic or fun a time without him. Highly recommend!

Cape and Penguins Tour - Wonderful!. We booked a private tour with Pieter from PG Tops tours and had a fabulous experience. It felt very personalized - a lovely stop to a local farm house that sells artisan crafts (brought beautiful pieces of animal art back with us!), a drive to the Cape of Good Hope paired with an awesome climb for surreal views, a wine tasting, Boulders Beach penguin watching, and an awesome stop to a hidden food market to fill up on delicious goodies! We had an awesome day out and truly enjoyed our Cape Town experience.Cheers!Jessica and Eric Maney

Amazing full-day Cape of Good Hope tour. Our guide, Jaret, was great, very knowledgeable, interesting and helpful in every way to make sure my partner and I get the most from Cape Town. Jaret arrived at our hotel on time and the tour carried out very smoothly. Overall we can't said a bad thing about this tour other than the weather. Cape Town is a great place to be and having found a right tour company with the right guide really makes a big difference. Hope to come back again for their shark cage diving tour!

The highlight of my trip to SA!. I am so glad I booked PG TOPS and got Jarred as my guide. I had the pleasure of having Jarred for two days as we did the Cape area and winelands. Jarred is a native and very knowledgeable and was excellent at customizing my tour to my interests. He seemed to have connections everywhere we went and got me into some amazing places. The only regret I have is that I did not hire Jarred for the Cape Town city tour as I had already done that on my old. I highly recommend PG TOPS and Jarred.

Private Tour. I dealt with Sofie at PG Tops to make arrangements for our private wine and peninsula tour. She was quick to respond and very helpful!Jarred was our guide for both tours. He was friendly, knowledgeable, funny and punctual. We enjoyed both tours with him immensely!

Langa Township Tour, Morning city and Table Mountain Tour & Robben Island. We had the most amazing time with PG Tops (April 29, April 30th and May 3rd). I was in South Africa for 2 weeks with my friends. We stayed in Cape Town for 4 days. Prior coming to CPT, I arranged our trip with Sofie and she was so amazing and easy to communicate with. When we arrived to the airport, we were a little late, but our tour guide Richard was waiting for us patiently. He had such beautiful and sincere smile. Richard was so friendly and very informative. He gave us the full history about Langa Township and told us about what to expect when were in town- drove us around the town and even made us walk around the town and interact with the locals/residents. That was the best part of the trip- the best way to understand the culture and the lives of some of South Africans!! The next day, we went Geoffrey. Geoffrey was funny and pleasant to be around. He was full of personality, we ran around the city with him on our way to the boat ride to Robben Island (it was a good exercise, we needed it haha). But before that he also took us around the city (we saw beautiful colorful houses/mosques). Table Mountain was closed that day so we were not able to make it with him, but Jarred who also worked PG Tops took us few days later. Jarred was also as amazing as Richard and Geoffrey. He was so flexible. We told him that we did not want to go to Wineland tour and instead we asked him to around the city and market. He did it without any hesitation. Honestly, PG Tops and its staff couldn’t be better.

Professional and curteous travel agency!. I was in CPT for a family vacation and had hired services of PGTOPS for three days. PGTOPS arranged guided private tour to Citiy attractions, Cape Peninsula and Aquilla private game reserves for us. I found their services highly professional and as per expectations. We also had very nice personal experiences with our agent(Sarina) and guides (Jarred, Gavin). Our guides made sure we enjoyed the tours, learnt about the city/places, had perfect food and remain engaged. Overall, I highly recommend PGTOPS to other travellers to CPT.

Recommended by a mutual friend and completely satisfied. Arranged our itinerary in advance with Yolanda and was pleased to see her at the airport when we arrived. Our first day included a Table Mountain tour and then a city tour, all accompanied by Yolanda's great knowledge of the history of Cape Town and the country. We parted company after about 6 hours, in time to catch the ferry to Robben Island.The following day, as Yolanda was away, we had a different guide, Leslie, a very personable and knowledgeable young man who drove us to Cape Point, and all the points in between such at Simonstown, Camps Bay , Kalk Bay, the penguin colony etc., all the while keeping us informed about the history of the area. Leslie also accompanied us on a tour of the Winelands the following day, with stops at three wineries, each of which had a distinct personality. That, plus Leslie's knowledge of the wines, made the trip very interesting. We had lunch in Franschoek and then made our way back to Cape Town.All in all, the arrangements we made with PG Tops worked out extremely well, and were flexible enough to allow for changes if there was something we preferred to eliminate or add.

Cape point tour and wine regions etc.etc.. Our tour guide Rudi was superb and an extremely good and safe driver. He was very passionate about South Africa and shared his considerable knowledge with us as we drove around this spectacular country.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!!!

Let PG Tours show you Cape Town and surrounding areas! . We took our 9 & 12 year old boys to S Africa and were referred to PG Tours to use as a private tour guide for our family. They are fabulous. We were not settled on an itinerary and they made some great recommendations. Jared led us around the Cape, Stellebach, and Franschhouk. We took our boys along to a couple wineries and while they were not ecstatic about it, iPads helped keep them entertained while the adults thoroughly enjoyed. Jared also took us to Simons Town and Camps Town, along with Table Bay National Park. He gave us much history about all the areas we visited. It was a truly fabulous way to explore and learn about the area. I highly recommend.

Reliable and Interesting Tours. We booked based on recommendations and were extremely pleased; 1. Had a private tour with Godfrey. Fantastic guide!!! Interesting and made the full day tour very fun. We had a very nice vehicle and the service was excellent. We spent the day visiting many different locations around Capetown, Cape of Good Hope, Cape point, Boulders, small ostrich farm etc. Price was reasonable and felt safe. Very interesting conversations and comments from Godfrey. Highly recommend him2. We did a 3 day private tour with Sarina. Lots of driving and the simple things like a really nice vehicle make the difference. We went to wine country and did some wine tours and then spent the night in Franschhoek. Next day drove to Cango Caves and a large Ostrich farm including riding an ostrich. Then onward to Plettenberg Bay. Next day some local tours plus Zip lining. Final day a long drive back to Capetown. All the time Sarina was wonderful. She was interesting and knowledgeable, but it really became more than that. Started feeling more like a friendship and we wish her all the best

Different Facets of Cape Town. We were able to enjoy the sights of Cape Town from 2 very different perspectives as we had different tour guides on our visit. This was great because we were able to get a balanced view of this wonderful area. Guides were attentive, flexible, knowledge and passionate - what more could you ask for. Thanks again PG.

Fabulous trips. Sarina, was a delightful person to spend two and half days with on trips in and around Cape Town. She made it a very interesting, pleasurable experience and we missed not having her with us on our last day in Cape Town. Thanks for making such a perfect start to our holiday.

Excellent Service and Tours. Had a lot of fun with our tours organized by them.
Knowledgeable guides and quick response to emails and requests.

Brilliant. Bianca picked us up at the cruise terminal for our day trip to the Cape Peninsula and Constantia wine route. I highly recommend this tour; Bianca was an excellent guide and driver. We had a very enjoyable and informative trip to the Cape, including Chapmans Peak. We stopped for coffee and lunch and spent a very pleasant day. This was our first visit to Cape Town and we feel we now have a good understanding of the area. A visit to the penguins is essential. We ended the day wine tasting which was most enjoyable, in part thanks to Bianca's local knowledge. If you are on a cruise ship docking in Cape Town, book this trip. Don't go to anyone else!

An amazing and fuss-free experience!. We had a three-day tour with Paula and it was an amazing experience. Paula was warm, friendly and incredibly informative. We learnt so many interesting things about Cape town, its history and the daily life of capetonians. She was also very accommodating and flexible. Our first day was spent visiting the scenic Table Mountain and Signal Hill. We then proceeded to Robben Island in the afternoon which was led by ex political prisoners; it was amazing and we got to see the prison cell where Nelson Mandela lived in for 18 years. On the second day we toured the Cape Peninsula where we were greeted with incredible scenery, fur seals and penguins. On our last day we visited the Aquila safari after a 2 hour drive from Cape town and returned to Cape town by around 4pm in the afternoon. All in all, our experience was wonderful, with huge thanks to PG Tops, Yolanda (for coordinating everything before we headed to Cape town), and Paula, our tour guide.

Tours made trip worry and hassle free!. To Start: Yolanda assisted us in planning what we needed and and wanted to see while in Cape Town. She did an excellent job! We had transportation from the airport to the hotel included in 3 of the days that we used their services.We had transportation from the airport to the hotel included on our first night arrival. We were to be greeted at the airport by a representative of the company with our name on a sign. He was there on time and assisted our travel companions to the hotel, it was perfect. My husband and I had a problem, our flight from the US was 3 hours late and did not make our connection in JNB and did not arrive in Cape Town until the next morning. This was extremely frustrating and disappointing to us because our tour of the Peninsula was to start 45 minutes before we ever landed. This is where I give a BIG THANK YOU to PAUL our guide from PG Tops. He picked up the other couple at the hotel and was at the airport to greet us when we landed. Paul made sure that we realized that this unexpected delay was not going to ruin our vacation.Paul was with us for 2 full day tours ( the second day was a City Tour) and we did not miss anything that we had planned to see with their help. He was knowledgeable about the history, the people, the landscape and the animals. He was fun and considerate. He was so in tuned to the slightest thing that he thought we would want. He made sure we had a complete and enjoyable time. He had our tickets and entrances fees to the sight already purchased and he knew all the ins and outs to expedite our valuable time.Paul was a true Professional and I would highly recommend him and PG Tops Travel in Cape Town. Our travel dates was April 9 - 12, 2016.

Sensational. We had a wonderful day tour with Sarina, including mountains, beaches and wine! Sarina was a fantastic host: informative, flexible and great company. Sarina catered for adults as well our young daughter: patiently picking up acorns, exploring magic trees etc. Thank you for a fabulous day :)

Bad weather, good experience. We got picked up by Gavin in a slick BMW and toured the Cape Peninsula. The weather was really bad that day, but we still had an enjoyable day. Gavin shared lots of information, had great viewing points, and all was very relaxed.

Thank you Jared for an AMAZING Wine Tour!!. We utilized PG Tops for a half day winery tour in South Africa... and it was amazingly perfect! Jared picked us up from our hotel and the entire drive to Stellenbosch and Franshhoek we chatted. He was so nice, outgoing, personable and gave us an entire history lesson of South Africa and its origins. Was amazing. Our day included lunch at La Petite Ferma in Frashhoek--- OMG gorgeous views, great food. A must do. Then we followed his motto of one new, one old, and one with a view. We checked out Ernie Els winery as well as Meerlust... tasting fabulous wines along the way, enjoying a nice car ride with Jared, and really taking in all that South Africa has to offer. Thank you PG Tops for arranging such a wonderful day... would DEFINITELY recommend this company for all travel and tours, they were great to work with!!!!

Cape Town Tour Company. PG Tops was great. Very organized and on time every day. Our guides local knowledge was great and we got to see parts of Cape Town that the average tourist doesn't see. I would recommend PG Tops for your trip to Cape Town.

THE BEST...look/read no further....this is it!. This company was amazing...they helped me to fit everything in for the 5 days and took all the hassle out of my life! 6 of us from Ja - private driver/guide and we did it all and more. Working with Madeleine and Sarina on the email to fine tune it all with Jared and Ryan were both FANTASTIC and we had our dream holiday....from picking us up at the airport to booking Tandem Paragliding at the minute for us....made all our reservations at attractions and restaurants with adequate timing.....it was all relaxed. A tour of Langa with lunch at Mzanzi, vineyards, Cape Point, Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens (by golf cart!), Old Biscuit Mill - Saturday food market, Robbyn Island, Table Top Mountain, Hermanas, African Penguins at Betty's Bay....and great advise as to what to do in our free time - and what recommendation of dishes at restaurants.....TOP MARKS! To all staff .....their follow up was impeccable....I hope they expand to other areas. They also organized our tour of Soweto in Joburg.....all was PERFECT.....look no further

Cape Town in a Day. We had a group attending an international meeting and could not get organized until the last minute of available scheduling to actual see and appreciate Cape Town. - No problem for PG and Bianca! With 5 days notice, Bianca arranged a beautiful day for 10 of us covering Table Top Mountain, Boulder Beach and Cape Point. It included all the entry fees to attractions, transportation, lunch and most importantly our awesome guide, Paul. All was arranged and communicated by email. Paul made the day fun and informative, he is full of energy and passionate about his country and especially Cape Town. The 3 destinations are a must to see, but the drive along the coast and Paul's narration along the way are just as special and made the day complete. The day was long and but not too exhausting and we finished feeling we had seen the highlights of this beautiful and unique place. Worth every penny (or rand) spent! I hope for the opportunity to return and work with PG, Bianca, and Paul again!

Very good. Our go to guide was not available and he recommended someone from PG Tops. We were very pleased with our Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope your. The highlight of the day though had to be the Penguins in Simonstown!

Great Day trip. I spent a couple days researching tours in Cape Town. I knew the couple points we HAD to see, and we had a time constraint. After narrowing our selection down to two, PG Tops replied promptly with a perfect itinerary. I worked with Bianca to develop the timeline. She was great at getting our desired stops and stuff together. The night before the trip, two other friends wanted to join. I called up and made the adjustment. We were picked up in the morning by Paul. The van was clean and relatively new. Paul was energetic and knowledgeable about Cape Town. We could tell he had a passion for the area. We hit up the Ostrich Farm, Boulder Beach, Cape Point and Groot Costantia Winery. They even arranged to take us directly to our friend's house for his spit brai.I strongly recommend the services of PG Tops.

Efficient!. Our itinerary was very tight but thanks to Rayn we could cover a lot in 3 days! There is much to see in Cape Town but PGTops made sure that we have not missed the major attractions! Very accommodative and friendly team.

Peninsula Tour. Gavin is fantastic. He was the perfect blend of charming and informational; he told us about the history of the sites and was a great resource for any questions we had throughout the day. Most importantly, he can also locate the best ice cream along the route.If you have an allergy to the buses, a private tour with PG Tops - Gavin, specifically - is worth it!

Great local experience. We really enjoyed the township tour of Langa, led by Richard. It is an excellent way to understand the culture and history of Cape Town, as well as experience the way many local Cape Town residents live each day. Our tour guide lives in Langa, and knew people at each of the stops on the Township Tour, which made the tour feel extremely authentic. He was also extremely knowledgable, and answered all of our questions. We had so much fun!

PG Tops helped us make the most of our Cape Town visit. With just a single day to see the out-of-town sights after a visit to Cape Town, my choice of tour guide for my group of friends was important. With help from TripAdvisor, I reached out to a handful of tour companies. Only two responded with interest in providing us a custom, private tour. The first was PG Tops. The second was fully booked, and referred us to... PG Tops.Over a handful of emails, I shared our priorities (the penguins at Boulders Beach and Cape Point), and left the rest to the team there. They made it easy for me to share information with my friends, they communicated effectively (all via email, as I wanted) as we planned the trip. They paid attention to everything going on -- from the Two Oceans Marathon, with road closures they anticipated and planned around, to weather.Carel picked us up at our hotel on schedule. The van he drove us around in all day was comfortable. He was a font of knowledge, about everything in the area. He took us to great look out (read: photo op) points all throughout the day. He got us to Boulders before any other humans showed up, allowing us to spend some quality time with the penguins who hung out on the beaches outside the protected colony. He found several great spots on the way to Cape Point to experience the landscape, the views, and even the intense wind.We all appreciated his flexibility, too. One of my friends had to head back to Cape Town to catch a flight while the rest of us stayed behind, and the team at PG Tops planned it advance and Carel executed perfectly, planning a lunch for us while he met the airport transfer with our friend.It was a whirlwind day, and thanks to Carel and PG Tops, we got to see and do everything we wanted -- and more. That day was a perfect end to our visit to Cape Town. I would definitely call them again for Cape tours. The price was fair, the hospitality was excellent, and everything worked exactly as promised! Thank you so much!

Perfect Teaser into Capetown. With limited time in Capetown we organised a day and a half to give us a feel for the city and surrounding area. From booking the tour, getting picked up at the hotel, touring the area and visiting some amazing sites the team gave us everything we wanted. Thanks to Madelaine, Sarina and Rudi for making this so special.
Cape Town Highlights. Excellent tour, family friendly, flexible, highly recommended. Cover most of the things we wanted to see and got some good recommendations for our free time

Great tour and guide!. We booked a tour with this company via the Internet for one full day in Capetown South Africa. We were met at the cruise ship terminal by our guide Carel who took us directly to Table Mountain on a beautiful sunny hot blue sky day. Carel was a great guide: personable, knowledgable, friendly. While on Table Mountain we talked about changing our booked tour from a city tour to a drive to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. Carel was very flexible on this as was PG TOPS. We had a wonderful day in a stunningly beautiful place. Highly recommend this drive and visit. Carel was so informative and he felt like a friend as we toured this wonderful place. He and the company are highly reliable and dependable. And the price was right too. Highly recommend both PG TOPS and Carel.

Great tour: Donna was amazing! . Our tour was wonderful! We wanted to do a lot in one day and PG tops made it possible for a reasonable price. With only one day in Cape Town we wanted to see the city highlights as well as the Cape Peninsula. Donna, our tour guide was amazing. Very patient, professional, knowledgable, flexible and funny. I would recommend!

Yolanda and Sarina - Thank You!. This is a great boutique agency highly recommended by my sister. They did not disappoint. Yolanda planned a fantastic itinerary and met me at airport and sent me off. Sarina took me around and was my guide throughout my trip. They made my trip unforgettable. Highly professional, efficient and SO much fun!

Amazing time in Cape Town. Recently spent 4 days in Cape Town and was looking for secure, reputable tours around the area. Everything good about this company is to be believed. Madelaine was very helpful in organising the tours. On first day our guide was Godfrey ( a.k.a.God if Table mountain clear on day of visit !! - It Was !!! ) Very knowledgeable and passionate about his township. Went on a city tour, district 6 museum, Table Top Mountain via revolving gondola, and finished with the highlight - A tour of Langa township. So much to take in and made memorable with Godfrey's knowledge and insight to the area.Second tour was with Deon and the Cape Peninsular. Very knowledgeable about area and included penguin colony, funicular railway up to lighthouse. A windy warm day where we saw ostriches and baboons as well.Third day was also with Deon. This time it was the wine district tour without the wineries - This amused Deon. We went to Cheetah sanctuary which was a definite highlight to see work with cheetahs plus opportunity to stroke one, Followed by tour of district and brief stops at Stellensbosch and Franschoek plus an amazing motor museum.Thank you so very much for making our stay in Cape Town so memorable.

PG Tops Travel and Tours - Day Tours. We booked three tours with PG Tops and Carel was a wonderful guide. Over the three days we visited some of Cape Town’s most beautiful sights (Table Mountain, The Cape of Good Hope, Boulders beach, Hout Bay, Stellenbosch to name a few) and we also got to feed seals, see amazing natural stones & crystals and snap amazing shots of the different wildlife. Apart from the fact that he is a really lovely person (witty, interesting and accommodating) he was professional & enthusiastic about what he does. I have been on many tours in many different countries and he is definitely one of the best. Carel is a great ambassador for Cape Town. I would highly recommend him. Thanks for looking after my family and I!

Thank you PG Tops for a wonderful experience. . We had four tours booked with PG Tops this Feb/Mar 2016 and wouldn't hesitate to recommend them, they were punctual, reliable and very knowledgable.  We had yolanda, Carle and Jarred conduct our tours all of which were really lovely friendly people, without being at all intrusive they were all very professional. Yolanda managed to arrange a lunch booking at short notice at La Petite Ferme, it was a wonderful meal, thank you Yolanda. Madeleine came along to our Aquila safari, what a lovely girl.

Three trips from Cape Town. We had three trips with Paul which were all excellent.We did Table Mountain on the first morning and thought we would not get up there due to the cloud cover, but Paul knew exactly the right time for us to go up as the clouds were moving so we had no queues up or down. When we came down there were really big queues to go up.We did the penguins, seals and Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope, plus the winelands.He was great as he was born in South Africa and knew so much about the place where ever we went

Taste of the Cape in 4 Days. First time we have used a tour company but we can heartily recommend Bianca Jarred Clive and the team 4 trips over 4 days from Table Mountain to the Cape of Good Hope will some wine, penguins and a lion thrown in for good measure. I cannot recommend PG Tops highly enough. Bespoke tours for our interests with knowledgable guides on hand to smooth the wayGive them a try you will not be disappointed.

Cape wonderful. We were impressed with the service provided by email by Sofie at PG Tops. We booked the Cape Peninsula and Winelands tours, plus an airport pick-up.
