After a long flight it was nice to be met by a smiling Bianca who took the three of us to our hotel. Our tour guide Jarred gave us two excellent bespoke tours. He was extremely knowledgeable particularly on everything to do with nature. Happy to recommend PG Tops to those visiting Cape Town wishing to go on private tours.

First-class tailored touring experience!. My mother and I visited Cape Town on holiday and were put in touch with PG Tops after we contacted another tour guide, Clive, who was fully booked. We wanted a tour company who could arrange customised trips based on our preferred itinerary and PG Tops fulfilled this brief admirably. Sarina took us on a full-day tour to Cape Point, Simon's Town and the Boulders Beach penguins. She also added in a boat trip to a colony of seals which was great too. The trip was such a success that we booked 3 further trips with PG Tops. On the last trip, we were lucky to have owner Pieter personally take us round the Constantia vineyards. Highly recommended. Thanks guys!

Great Day to Cape Point and Boulders Beach. PG Tops gave us a great day out with our guide Donna and we can't recommend this highly enough. Donna picked us up on time and after stopping off to see the Sea Lions we stopped at a lovely spot for a coffee. Then on towards Cape Point with a quick unscheduled stop at a winery, Donna is a fountain of knowledge and during our journey kept us entertained with details of the areas that we passed through, historical information and the many languages of South Africa. Cape Point is an amazing location and Donna stopped twice to rescue errant tortoises that decided to cross the road in front of us. Then on to the lighthouse and a lovely lunch - Donna managed to organise a table for us so that we didn't have to queue. Finally to Boulders Beach to see the penguins, not to be missed! We had a great day out and would recommend PG Tops to anyone and a huge thank you to Donna for a great day, it wouldn't have been the same without you.

What an amazing day and an amazing tour!. After reading through T.A. for tour guide recommendations, we emailed Madelaine at PG tours and asked her about the Cape Point / Peninsula. She put together a great tour based on a couple questions around what we wanted to see and whether we wanted to just sit and ride or get out and do easy walking or take a bit more of a hike. Our tour guide, Gavin, picked us up on our hotel in a comfortable clean vehicle and off we went for a fabulous day of travel, sights and even a brisk hour hike up one of the trails around Cape Point (the highlight of our tour). Lunch in a small seaside town. Gavin's been in the tour business awhile and seems to know how much information is useful and when to just let the scenery do the talking. He also had some great tips on what to do/ where to go for some gifts we needed in Cape Town proper. Had us home to the minute when scheduled! He also was very clever about which route to take on the weekend to be ahead of the bigger crowds at the most popular stops. To be honest, i'd read that all the tour guides with PGT were good, but when we go back, we'll definitely ask for Gavin again! Given that I've been going to C.T. for almost twenty years, I really appreciated that Gavin got how much we knew and how to shift around the plans to make the trip perfect!

Fantastic Peninsula Tour with Gavin. My husband and I booked the full day peninsula tour with Gavin as our tour guide and driver. He was the perfect host - charming, informative and easy to talk to. Best of all he imparted lots of interesting information without it seeming rote. We tailored the tour to our interests and saw beautiful mind-blowing scenery, the penguin beach and the Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. It was an efficient and comfortable way to see the major sites of Cape Town. We highly recommend this tour company and Gavin.

Thanks PG Tops. We finally booked our South Africa experience with Sofie at PG Tops. What a fantastic experience. The brief was very simple - we wanted to experience the sights and scenes of South Africa for 2 weeks, the first period around the Cape Town and coastal area and then move on to a few days safari in Kruger.Sofie was very professional and attentive and asked us what we liked, what level of comfort we were looking for, what food we enjoyed eating, where we liked to stay, what in particular we would like to see and so on.Nothing seemed to be an issue and Sofie e mailed us on numerous occasions and even spoke to us on the phone to try to understand our requirements more specifically.The result was a fantastic vacation staying in sumptuous accommodation, eating some lovely S African food, seeing great sights and having one of the best holidays we have ever had.Credit should also be heaped upon our guide - Johan. Throughout the Cape leg of the holiday Johan drove us over 2000km. We struck a chord with many common views and hobbies and the places we stopped at were often revised following these conversations.Vacation consisted of the following:Day 1 Arrival at CapeTown, tour of table mountain and part of city accommodation More seasons.Day 2 Penguins at Stormy point. Accommodation More SeasonsDay 3 Robben Island and Peninsula. Accommodation More SeasonsDay 4 Wine tasting in Franshoek, Motor Museum. Accommodation Le Quartier FrancaisDay 5 Alloe Fera factory, Ostrich Farm Accommodation De DenneDay 6 Knysna Featherbed visit. Accommodation Atlantic houseDay 7 Transport museum George, bird sanctuary Tsitsikama. Accommodation The FerneryDay 8 Addo National Park, Port Elizabeth Accommodation Radisson BluDay 9-12 Fly to Kruger for Safari at Lion Sands Private Game reserveOverall this offered a personalised private tour that was tailored to our requirements for a similar price to a good tour organised in the UK but with around 30 people. That personal touch and ability to modify at a moments notice was priceless and I have no hesitation to recommend the company.thanks again to Sofie, Johan and Peter at PG Tops

A day in Cape Town. My friend and I were to arrive in Cape Town on a cruise ship around 8 a.m. Our flights home were not until 6 p.m., so we were looking for a tour company that could introduce us to the sights of Cape Town and deliver us to the airport in time. I had spent quite some time in the city previously, but my friend had not. I found PG Tops Travel and Tours on Trip Advisor and made arrangements with Yolanda. Sarina was at the dock 10 minutes early ready to go. I had hoped to take the cable car to Table Mountain, but the fog prevented us from doing that. Sarina substituted Signal Mtn and a visit to Rhodes Monument where we were able to have great views of the city. We visited Hout Bay, walked through the central city, had lunch and shopped at the wharf area. It could not have been more perfect. I highly recommend this company.

Personal Private and Accoodating. If you appreciate the personal service that a private tour provides, then this is the company for you. We did a city tour on the first day and the cape tour on the second day. We were met at the hotel and at the end of the day they helped us move our luggage to the cruise ship. And then they picked us up at the cruise ship the next day. We had different guides each day. What we appreciate the most is being able to talk with the guides, ask questions and have meaningful conversations about the city and the country. It was like having a friend show you around. The highlight for me was Boulder beach and thousands of penguins. But the Cape was a bucket list item - it was just so very windy. Our visit to Cape Town was fun and informative. We highly recommend PG Tops for a private tour. Great VALUE!

If you do the Winelands Tour try the Wine and Chocolate Pairing!. We did 4 days of touring with PG Tops (2 Days of Winelands, 1 Day Shark Cage Diving, and 1 Day Peninsula Tour), and it was money well spent! Our guides, Bianca and Ryan, had a ton of local knowledge, so we ended up saving time (we started our Peninsula tour early to avoid having to queue) and visiting some places we never would have found on our own (we visited a couple of great wineries that we'd never heard of and Ryan also recommended the most delicious Fish and Chips shop in Simonstown). Both Ryan and Bianca were super friendly and flexible (my husband decided that there was one particular winery he wanted to visit, so Ryan rearranged our day's plans to make sure we had time to visit it), so all four days were relaxing and stress free.One of the fun surprises for me was the Wine and Chocolate Pairing at Spier Winery. We live in Switzerland, so I was skeptical about how good the chocolate could be compared to Swiss chocolate ;), but it was super unique and delicious! The chocolates had different flavors that paired with different wines, but the real surprise was how the chocolate flavor changed the taste of the wine! Super interesting! Thanks, Bianca, for recommending that we try it!I can't wait for another chance to visit South Africa and discover more with PG Tops!

Awesome !!! Did the Garden Route with them -- all 14 of us!!!. We were an extended family of 05 Adults + 03 Senior Citizens (65 plus) + 02 Teenagers + 04 Children (between 05 - 09yrs) and were visiting Cape Town & The Garden Route for the first time, that too during the peak months of December. We approached PG Tops quite late in September to take care of our itinerary planning, ground arrangements & guide for a Personalized Experience. The first e-mail itself from Ms.Yolanda was a nerve soother and we knew we were in safe hands. Complete professionalism in planning the itinerary, considering we were to complete the Garden Route from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth in 03 days flat, suggesting attractions, places to eat with due consideration for us vegetarians with kids and complete transparency in communication of the charges and the payment schedules. The icing on the cake (which we later discovered while on the tour) was their suggestion to pre-book reservations at restaurants considering the size of the group, cuisine preferences & the peak season (25th December to 30th December), that's a personal touch par excellence !!! Lots of blessings from all family members to Ms.Yolanda & the entire PG Tops team for this.Arrival day, Christmas eve, we missed connecting flights and upset our arrival schedules. The PG Tops Private Guide Mr. Rod & driver Mr. David ensured they picked us up post midnight, informed the hotel about the delay, ensured rooms were allotted and a speedy check-in with sleepy kids.The biggest satisfaction undoubtedly on the tour has been Mr. Rod (our guide), vast experience, very knowledgeable, soft spoken, a hit with the kids and the seniors of the family alike. He has ensured that all attractions as per our itinerary have been enjoyed by the family at Cape Town and along the Garden Route as well, reconfirming room reservations, restaurant reservations as well as flight timings. A personal Thank You Rod & David for your efforts, God Bless You You can't get any better service than this!!! A dream vacation coming together !!!

Excellent Day Trip. We worked with Yolanda to arrange a full day tour with our very specific needs and she was wonderful. I was really hoping she was going to be our guide and was surprised when it was someone else but the day still went well. My daughter and I travel extensively and know what we want to see. Normally I rent a car but decided we were packing in a wine tour as well and I won't drink and drive so a guide was the best route. We swam with penguins, rode camels, saw Cape Point, and took some amazing pictures at the color beach huts of Muizenberg Beach and did a wine tasting tour at a beautiful winery. I know at times our tour guide may have been frustrated with our itinerary and tried to substitute another beach for Muizenberg that didn't work for us,so we held strong and required our original stop, but overall we got along fine and he was super knowledgeable about every aspect of our tour. He was a wealth of information and I was really impressed with his intelligence. I'm very glad that we chose this tour company and I think you can't go wrong in booking with PG Tops Travel and Tours. The are responsible, professional in all communications, and definitely priced well compared to other vendors that I interviewed. Thanks for a wonderful day!!!!

Cape Point. Due to the gridlock at the Waterfront on NYE and not getting back to our Hotel until 4 a.m. it was with trepidation that we set off at 8 am to Cape Point. Half the party didn't make it so we had the very smart van to ourselves. We were warned that there would be queues everywhere and we would struggle to see the attractions.However, we needn't have worried - we had a fantastic day, fantastic guide and apart from a short queue at the Penguins we didn't have to queue at all.Cape Point was spectacular, the baboons entertaining and the meal at the Two Oceans Restaurant excellent.Thank you Sarina and PG Tops for a splendid experience.

Wine Tastings and Peninsula Tour. After visiting South Africa for 11 years it was great to return with six friends. It being their first time we wanted to show them the sights in the Cape Town area. We booked two days with PG Tops Travel. From start to finish the experience was excellent. Quick response to emails to punctual arrival of our very friendly guide, Donna. We had a great couple of days with no pressure of driving. Donna accommodated our changes to itinerary and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommended and good value.

Great guides, great experience!. Booked 2 days of touring for our group of 12. First day: table mountain, city, and township tour. Our main guide Jamie was very knowledgeable and flexible. Township tour guide was Langa township resident Odwa, who spoke from first-hand experience living there. Quite eye-opening!Second day: Peninsula tour - Cape of Good Hope, Simonstown, Boulders Beach, etc. It was all breathtakingly gorgeous, and we learned a lot from our knowledgeable guide Jamie! Excellent service.
cape point and penguins. we had a great day with a great guide - he listen to what we wanted and we had a fab day because of this !!!

Family tour of cape town. PG tops planned us a 5 day tour of cape town and the surrounding areas, the tour guides were simply wonderful always friendly and on time on what were long hot days. Cape town has so much to see and do that PG tops are a must to get the most out of your visit

Cape Peninsula Tour . My wife and I visited Cape Town for our honeymoon. She is obsessed with penguins, so we decided to do the Cape Peninsula tour. Our tour guide, Gavin, was amazing! So friendly, extremely knowledgeable about the area, and super fun to spend the day with! We saw so much during our tour and learned not only about the area, but the culture! Thank you so much for such an enjoyable experience!

Planned an amazing honeymoon!. We used PG Tops/Luxury Safaris to plan our 2 week honeymoon in South Africa and Victoria Falls. We worked with Caren and Yolanda and they were both phenomenal! They were very patient and asked the right questions to understand everything we wanted to do. They worked within our budget to include as much as we could. They always provided different options to help us make an informed decision. The tour guide they assigned to us during our trip, Jarred, was amazing! He was very knowledgeable and friendly. We felt like we experienced everything through the eyes of a local. I would highly recommend PG Tops for any travel needs. We fell in love with South Africa and will definitely use them again when we return!

Family Vacation in Cape Town. The tours, drivers and recommendations were all A+. We are all experienced travelers and know great service when we get it. You exceeded our high expectations!!!!! Looking forward to returning!!

great start to Cape Town!. My husband and I booked a private full day city tour for our first day in Cape Town, and Bianca was on time picking us up from our hotel in Camps Bay and we had a wonderful introduction to the city with her. She was friendly, very easy going, and flexible with our activities throughout the day. We were supposed to start the day with Table Mountain but due to cloud cover she recommended holding off for a better day (which worked out perfectly for us as 2 days later we ended up with perfect weather to visit). Instead she took us to the Botanical Gardens, a wine tasting in Constantia, and we had lunch and walked around the Company Gardens. She even incorporated our request for a beer stop and we spent a fun afternoon at Beerhouse on Long and wrapped up with Signal Hill. It was a great first impression of Cape Town, thanks Bianca for a fun first day in the city!

Wonderful tour. Our guide Pieter took us for a day tour of the Cape. We set off early to beat the crowds and arrived at Cape Point before the tour buses. The scenery here is beautiful. Pieter was very knowledgeable and luckily for us he is also a photographer and so shared some handy tips. Our next stop was Boulders beach and the Penguin colony - which is amazing, it is as though the Penguins are on holiday! We thoroughly recommend PG Tops Tours and if you are interested in photography ask for Pieter.

Awesome Tour. Enjoyed a full day Penninsula with Yolanda and a half day township tour with Godfrey.Both tour guides were awesome!! We are a family of 5 and they made the tour relevant and exciting for all of us. They are very knowledgeable and this was a highlight of our trip. Highly recommendedDan (Toronto)

Yolanda is a miracle worker. We were quite late in booking our tour of Cape Town. So late in fact that PG Tops was actually the only company that even tried to help us out. I'm very glad they did because it was fantastic. Yolanda bent over backwards for us and made miracles happen on the busiest week of the year in Cape Town. We had different tour guides each day and while each of them was great we were really impressed with Ryan. Ryan was very knowledgable about the area and history and he gave us great tips about things to do on our free time. He even ordered pizza for us when we couldn't get our phone working. We were very impressed that not only did PG Tops help us out when no-one else was even interested, but they still went out of there way to make sure we had a great time while in Cape Town.

Great day tour after disembarking our cruise!. We had just disembarked our cruise and needed to fill some time before our flight. PG Tops tours were great. We arrived at 7.30 to avoid the cues at table mountain, had an amazing time on top, then went to Blouberg beach and a compound. They had a big van to put us and our luggage in and then dropped us off at the airport. The day was very relaxed and flexible. It was great. Shame we couldn't spend more time on the tour. Thank you.

Great tour to cape peninsula. The tour Thiama was very good. Everything worked out very well, the car was great. He was very smart to avoid the long waiting queues into the cape as we resorted all places to see which is important in high season. The only down side was the lunch location at harbour view in Simons Town which was only average. The tour guide was very knowledgable and very friendly. We closed the day with a wine tasting in Constantia which was great. Thank you.

Two days all over the Mother City and more. Jamie took me on a half day and an entire day trip to... I guess almost everywhere in and around Cape Town. Amazing landscapes, adorable penguins and an exciting city. Table mountain, Cape of good hope, the gorgeous botanical garden at Kistenbosch, Simon's town etc ...We also spent a day at Aquila game reserve admiring the landscapes and beautiful animals. Loved every minute !

Brilliant tour guide. Devon from PG Tops Tours took us to Table Mountain and a city tour. He knowledge and passion for Cape Town was brilliant and he understood exactly what we wanted to get out of the day's touring. All in all, well worthwhile and I would highly recommend PG Tops

Tour of Cape Town. Richard took us on a half day tour of Cape Town. He was very friendly and knowledgeable. Above all, he was willing to do whatever or go wherever we wanted. We stopped for drinks in Camps Bay (he did not drink), toured the city and rode the cable car up Table Mountain. He was entertaining, friendly and professional. I would recommend, without any reservations, PG Tops to anyone wanting a tour of the area.

Cape Peninsula Tour. My husband and I did the full day Cape Peninsula Tour with Jerrod. We didn't realize when booking that it was a private tour which turned out to be great. We saw all the major sites and he gave us the option stop at places like Hout Bay to take a boat tour to see the seals, gave us time to walk on some of the beautiful beaches, and to walk up to the lighthouse at Cape Point. It was nice to do things at our own pace and we never felt rushed. We had a great lunch in Simon's Town and absolutely loved seeing the penguins at the hidden beach (not just the boardwalk) at Boulder's beach. Jerrod was so informative and personable and really made it a fantastic tour. Would HIGHLY recommend PG Tops to anyone looking to go on a day tour of Cape Town.

Cape of Good Hope. Bianca was right on time picking us up and so friendly all day. We had the best time all day. We went to The Cape of Good Hope where we kayaked with penguins. Later in the day Bianca took us to a wonderful hiking location and picked us up on the other side. After our hike, Bianca took us to an ostrich farm to feed them which was fantastic. She also drove us around for a while to show us all the animals in the area which was so much fun. We were able to see so much wildlife thanks to Bianca.
Cape Point Tour. We had an amazing time!! Our tour guide, Jamie was the best! Definitely would book again with PG Tops

Great Tours with PG Tops. We had great tours with PG Tops - a day in the Winelands with Deon and a day in the Cape with the owner Pieter. Very attentive, tailor made to our needs and we covered everything on our "must do list" and more. Highly recomended.

Highly recommended!. My husband and I just finished two days of tours with Bianca and we had a fantastic time! First we did the city/Table Mountain tour and then the day-long Cape tour. Bianca was early to meet us both days, and her energy and enthusiasm were highlights for sure. We loved being able to do the days at our own pace with lots of history and knowledge added to the experience. Bianca felt like a friend while still maintaining her professionalism. We absolutely recommend her and PG Topps - thank you!

Cape Peninsula. We arranged for the Cape Peninsula tour which was all day. Bianca was very prompt in picking us up. We had a wonderful day. Going to the Cape Peninsula. Doing a mini hike which was great!Boulder Beach is a cool and unique experience. Lot of pictures taken that day. Do yourself a favor and book a tour from them. I'll be back to Cape Town in the near future.

provided a great guide for our garden route tour!. PG Tops was very easy to work with. Just a few e-mails with Serina and we had everything set up. Our four day tour was wonderful. The vehicle that PG Tops provided was very nice (a toyota Rav4) and the guide, Andrew, was fantastic. Our tour was enhanced by having someone who knew the area so well. Without Andrew, we would have missed so many enjoyable places. Thank you, PG Tops, for setting us up with a great tour and guide.

Fantastic Day. Decided to have a private tour on my last day in town after a week of business. PG Tops was perfect. We went to the Cape of Good Hope, Boulders, etc. Plus a swing through a vineyard before taking me to the airport. Highly recommended.

Great way to tour the Cape!. While on vacation in Cape Town my wife and I had the pleasure of taking a tour to the Cape of Good Hope with Sarina as our guide. She was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and a lot of fun. She made it clear from the outset that it was our day and that what we wanted to do on the trip was of paramount importance. Her driving was excellent and she made our trip very comfortable and interesting.

Super Super Super Tour and Guide!. It was my first trip to South Africa with my son (14 months old) and wife. We very much wanted to see the sites but also wanted a hassle free, relaxing holiday. I searched the internet and came across Pg Tops offering a variety of private tours and subsequently booked two full days; cable city and cape of good hope tour. The initial enquiry was handle in a professional and friendly manner by Sarina Venter who provided all the information we needed and dealt with any queries promptly.Both trips were excellent and a real highlight of our trip. Our guide Donna Oosthuizen was absolutely fantastic and could not have been more helpful. She was knowledgeable about the history, animals and fauna of South Africa and knew all the best places to go including secluded beaches and short cuts to avoid the Cape Town traffic! Nothing was too much trouble and it was like travelling with my big sister, she helped look after our son and tailored both days around our preferences and nothing was too much trouble. I cannot write enough superlatives about our whole experience with Pg Tops from the initial contact, booking and actual tour, so go ahead and book a tour now!!

Jarred Vosges: enthusiastic, knowledgeable, patient, engaging....and the list goes on. What do you look for in a private tour? Tour design (the Cape Peninsula), small group (there were two of us), flexibility, local insights, and logistics management. All true. But most important, an introduction to the culture, flora, fauna, geography, history, and current events by an agreeable companion .That's Jarred Vosges of PG Tops Travel and Tours. He knows the area, he loves the area, and he enjoys sharing the area. Use PG Tops Travel and Tours. You won't be disappointed.

Excellent tour group!. We just returned from a blissful week in Cape Town and we owe much of our great experiences to PG Tops. They were recommended by friends who used them last year and we now owe those friends an appreciation cocktail. From the very first email inquiry, I knew that we were in good hands.I cannot possibly say enough kind words about Sarina, our coordinator. I looked forward to every email response that I received from her. We were a group of five, all with differing thoughts on itineraries and juggling changes and recommendations and additions was no problem at all. Sarina was on it every step of the way with kind words, professionalism and a fantastic sense of humor.We used them for our airport transfer (Sarina was gracious enough to pick us up at 11:00pm), a tour to Gansbaai (stopped for whale watching, lunch at a winery and a pick up of a friend who did the shark dive) and a full day tour to Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and an ostrich farm. And transport to and from a wedding (sorry Pieter ;-) For the day tours, our guide was Jarred and he is terrific! Super knowledgeable, not only on sites and history, but plant life and ecosystems. He was very accommodating, very entertaining and quite funny. We all really enjoyed his guide skills and friendly nature.And for every transfer and pick up, not only did they arrive on time, but 5 minutes early which we appreciated (tho, we may not have been ready, we loved the punctuality).And note, Sarina is now a full fledged tour guide. If you are lucky enough to have either of them, you will have a great time.We feel like we made friends in Cape Town and hope to return soon and take advantage of other tours that they offer and their generous and genuine hospitality.

The Trip of a Lifetime. This was my first trip to Cape Town and I am positive it will not be my last thanks to PG Tours. From leaving the Airport Terminal until I was back to the airport a week later , the Cape Town experience was phenomenal. I toured with Frank on my first daty to my hike up Lions Head, and he was so informative and friendly. The rest of the week, I was Bianca. She was the more like a friend rather than a tour guide. She know so much knowledge about her country and was so filled with life , it made the experience all so better , great vacation .

Cape of Good Hope. Remember looking at the southern tip of Africa in 3rd grade geography class? Remember learning about the Cape of Good Hope? We really wanted to see where the explorers rounded the continent. Supposedly it's where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, although picky people point that that depends on currents.Bianca took four of us for the day on a drive that included, besides the Cape, penguins, baboons, boat ride to fur seal island, gorgeous (but freezing) beaches, and stunning views of this beautiful area. She never rushed us. She seemed knowledgeable about her country and answered all our questions. The vehicle was large and comfortable for all of us. I would highly recommend PG Tops Travel.

Excellent Cape Tour. Dion our tour guide spent Two days showing my wife and I around the Cape area. He asked us want we wanted to see and gave us recommendations of what we should see. He managed to get the balance spot on. Thank you.PS. Cheetah Outreach was amazing.

Yolanda was amazing!. This was my first trip to Cape Town and after engaging with a few local tour agents, it became very clear quickly I was going to get help from Yolanda from PG Tops. Yolanda was super prompt in all of her replies, she managed to find me a wonder private tour guide to Cape Point, even though they were fully booked. The airport transfer was efficiently arranged and the tour guide (Johan) she recommended was extremely knowledgeable as well. Thank you Yolanda!

Excellent private day tour. Richard, our guide spent three wonderful days with us touring the Winelands, Table Mountain and the Cape as well as an excursion to Hermanus. He was an excellent driver, knowledgable and very personable. Richard made our three days of touring very enjoyable. Sofie helped us organize the itinerary for each day. I highly recommend this tour group and Richard as a private guide in particular.

Great Tours from Great People. We booked 3 tours (Cape Peninsular, Shark Cage Diving and a trip to Botlierskop Game Reserve) and had fantastic time and great service. The team at HQ planned a custom trip for us based on what we were looking for. Bianca and Godfrey were great guides and really informative and friendly and made the day pass by with ease. Richard was an absolute legend and was a top bloke during the course of the day and we would highly recommend asking for him if you can!

Had the time of my life! Private Tour is the way to go!. I booked PG Tops as a referral from another agency as they were fully booked and I am glad I did! My guide was Bianca was superb. Bianca made sure to hit all my areas I wanted to visit and even found me a place to buy a chess set I and been looking for for the past 5 weeks. Bianca even took me to a few places I would have never thought of that were some of the most memorable moments of my Peninsular tour! As I am a picture taker she was more than willing to get in there and take pictures of me and to watch my gopro do a time lapse as I climbed up to take pictures form the cliffs.I had a stop to do in Cape Town to pick up a gift from KTM and this was the only way and time I had to pick it up, Bianca took me there and even let me collect my friends from a hostel and take them back to my hotel in Camps Bay. It was a fully packed day with laughter, spectacular moments and just a Great time!I highly recommend taking PG Tops when you need a private tour!

Ryan was great!. Ryan of PG Tops arranged two great private tours for my family during our short stay in Cape Town. He tailored the tours to our interests and needs. He was very knowledgeable, easy to work with, and would ceaselessly answer even our most mundane questions with pleasure! The whole process was seamless, easy, and he was a very safe driver to boot.We went on a Cape Peninsula tour on the first day and a Winelands tour on the subsequent day. Ryan met us at the designated time with a well-maintained van. The Cape Peninsula was beautiful and Ryan arranged for lunch at a restaurant that easily catered to the many vegans in our group. On the Winelands tour, Ryan selected three distinct wineries that met our taste and had pre-booked wine tastings at each. He picked a wonderfully scenic winery-restaurant for lunch and had informed them of our vegan requests prior to arrival. What a treat was it to have Ryan show us around these two days!Booking the tours via email and payment via their provided secure link was a breeze. I would not hesitate to use PG Tops again and, in particular, Ryan, should we visit Cape Town in the future!
Jarred was very friendly and well informed. I had an excellent four days in Cape Town with these guys. Really lovely guide who knew lots and took account of my preferences. I'd definitely recommend.

1st time to Cape Town (Sept 2015)--Made the right choice to hire PG Tops. We ended up having three different guides during our week in Cape town due to having to break up our tour days across a week. Rudi gave us a tour of the city of Cape Town that included all the typical attractions. The tour was a good starting point for us as we had arrived late the previous evening. The winds kicked up and the 'tablecloth' surrounded Table mountain so we had to postpone our tour up the mountain for another day. For our safari at Inverdoorn, Jared picked us up from our hotel and actually rode along in the Land Rover with us while on safari which was helpful with his previous experience as a safari guide. We were able to ask him questions/comments that he saw on the day at Inverdoorn on the ride back to Cape Town. For the Biscuit Mill, township tour, and Stellenbosch trip we had Godfrey. The walking tour through the streets of the Langa township was authentic and made you feel like you were able to see exactly how the people that live in those types of settings live day to day. Godfrey is very well known in that area and we felt comfortable learning about the area with him as our guide. Our last two days around Cape Town were again spent with Jared around Cape Point and Cape Peninsula. We felt extremely comfortable with Jared and his approach with customers is top notch. All the trips were outstanding and we overall felt very lucky to have PG Tops organize our trip for us and cater to what we either did or didn't want to see while we were on vacation. Originally we had pursued Clive to be our tour guide but he kindly referred us to PG Tops. Initially we felt disappointed to not had reserved Clive without enough advance notice but in the end were thrilled with PG Tops. Sofia was our main contact person ahead of time and her timely and professional responses to our emails showed us that they ran a good business and cared about their customers. If we ever go back to Cape Town (hopefully someday :) we would definitely reserve PG Tops to guide us around again! Thank you to PG Tops (and especially Rudi, Godfrey, and Jared)!

What a great day!. My husband and I just returned from a fabulous day tour with Bianca. She arrived perfectly on time and off we went for a day around the cape peninsula. We hit all the main sites and really enjoyed her company. She was open to all of our questions about the culture and gave us great suggestions for other parts of our trip that we are doing on our own. She went above and beyond to accommodate our requests, as unconventional as one was (thanks again!). I wish I would have know earlier that PG Tops could have organized all of our other tours (wineland, Hermanus, ect). Highly recommend!

What a great day!. After flying into Cape Town late the prior evening with my wife and my twin 11 year old daughters, we awoke to what we now understand to be a fairly typical strong breeze for Cape Town in the warmer months. So strong that the table mountain cable car was on wind hold! With that our plans to go up table mountain went out the window, so we decided to try and get on a tour out to the cape of good hope. Having discovered that most organised tours had already left that morning, I rang several private tour operators and they all were full - not surprising given I was calling for an appointment for that same day! One referred me to PG Tops. Having had a quick look on the website and the trip advisor ratings I called PG Tops and the rest is history. PG himself was very helpful and a private tour was promptly organised. We were picked up from our accommodation in the waterfront area by our guide Deon. Deon treated us to a very special day indeed! We drove out from Cape Town past the stadium and along the water through Sea Point and Clifton and then up the stunning Chapman's Peak drive, before heading down into Simon's Town to see the penguin colony at the Boulders, which we all loved. From there we headed out to Cape Point and then around to the Cape of Good Hope, where we caught the venicular railway to the top of the point for the spectacular views. This was topped off by a late lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant up at the Cape, which was also very good. After lunch we drove back via Constantia wine country which was very nice. The views of the Cape on our drive on a very windy but very clear day were just spectacular. Deon kept the kids and ourselves constantly entertained with story after story - everything about different land marks, through to South African politics and history, health and wellness and everything in between. It was a fantastic conversation! Along the way we had the chance to see penguins, seals, baboons, ostrich and rock rabbits/Dassie. It was a super day and I couldn't speak highly enough of both Deon for being a fantastic guide and PG for turning what started as a frustrating morning into a brilliant day for our family!

Couldn't ask for more!. This tour company was referred to us by another company. PG Tops did a great job of putting together an individualized tour for us! Bianca did an amazing job of guiding us around Cape Town to Boulders Beach to the Cape of Good Hope and back again. Bianca was punctual, flexible, knowledgeable, friendly and energetic. We couldn't have asked for a better guide and highly recommend this tour company!

Winner. Bianca was our guide for two days of sightseeing. We were referred to PG TOPS by another top rated travel advisor private tour guide and we feel we got the best deal. PG Tops was very attentive to our communications, we had lots of back and forth on email due to the time differences. We were able to pin down our preferences and they provided us with the perfect guide for our styles. Bianca got us into Table Mountain early in the morning and the day was spectacular. She was able to help us navigate the area on the waterfront without treating us like children. She answered a thousand questions. The best part was on the second day we decided to leave earlier than planned and she was very accomodating. PG Tops even refunded part of our prepayment due to the way our tour unfolded on day 1 with our spending the afternoon on Robben Island and not with PG Tops, which was something we didn't expect. This type of action was above and beyond what was expected and was the type of service we expereienced from the staff and from our guide. I think that the best way to see a new part of the world is with a private guide and PG Tops was an excellent service. I highly recommend them on your excursion into Capetown. Nancy

Lovely tour by Rudi! . My fiancée and I took a Cape Point/ Simons Town tour with Rudi and absolutely loved it! He picked us up from out hotel in Camp's Bay right on time and was incredibly knowledgable as we started our day tour. We visited Hout Bay, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Simons Town and even a quick stop for wine tasting at Constancia (because we weren't going to have time to get to the winelands). He absolutely knew everything and was so sweet! Would highly recommend!

Engaging, Informative and Fun. With a group of friends, I recently visited Cape Town and a few nearby towns for four days. Yolanda was a fantastic and fun guide. She was flexible, informed and a great driver. I will select Yolanda and PG Tops Travel for my future travels to South Africa. I highly recommend PG Tops Travel.

Cape to Cape. We had a great trip to Cape Agulhas via the Overberg and back via Hermanus, and next day went to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope too. My son had just come from the North Cape of Norway so top of Europe to bottom of Africa in 10 days meant he was pretty well 'caped' this year! Rudi our guide is a great raconteur and a mine of useful information on the regions we passed through and on South Africa in general, and seems to have been to even more places around the globe than us - including beating us to the North Cape! Anyone who, like Rudi, has been to Easter Island for their birthday just has to trump me and my travel tales! The great thing about driving with just us and Rudi in the car was that we could converse with each other rather than as often happens with larger groups in buses when the guide tends to talk at you rather then with you. PG Tops offer lots more trips and next time we're in South Africa (my youngest daughter was much taken with hearing about our penguin sightings at Boulders Beach so another visit is definitely on the cards!) we will try some more, including to Langa Township. Friendly people and great service - PG Tops are hard to beat - give them a try!

Only Way to Go!!. My family of four (all adults) were only going to be in Cape Town for 3 full days and wanted to see as much as we could. For one of the days, I booked a full day Cape Peninsula Tour along with a stop for a little wine tasting at Constantia Glen. Our day was fabulous. Our guide, Richard, picked us up at our hotel and our adventure began. We had a very comfortable van. Richard had grown up in the Cape Town area and was very knowledgeable of everything we were going to see. We stopped at Hout Bay where you can do a little shopping from the vendors that have set up at the harbor. We then went to Cape Point and walked up to the lighthouse. Richard suggested lunch at the restaurant there called Two Oceans. The timing was perfect and it wasn't too crowded. Our lunch was delicious and the views were beautiful. We then went to the Cape of Good Hope and then Boulders Beach Penguin Colony and ending with wine tasting before being dropped off at our hotel. Richard was such a nice and easy going guy. We never felt rushed and were able to see and do everything the four of us wanted to do. To set up the tour, I emailed with Thami who got back to me and assured me that we could do everything that was on my list.

Great tour of the cape, thanks Bianca!. We had a great experience with Bianca on our tour of the cape and penguin colony. She was very knowledgeable and easy going. She let us wander on our own when appropriate and even added in a stop at her favorite boutique winery on our way back to the city. She also gave us a great restaurant recommendation in Camps Bay. Thanks!!

A brilliant day out. We are a family of 2 adults and 3 children aged 11 to 15. We only had a couple of days in Cape Town and decided we'd spend one day in the city, and one seeing as much of the surroundings as we could.I was wary of a "day trip" as I feared the boys might find it boring, but needn't have worried - we all had a brilliant day thanks to PG Tops and our guide, Rudi.We went to the Cape of Good Hope, with several stops including an ostrich farm, penguins and some beautiful beaches. Rudi was very flexible on timing, chatty and informative, and very nice company. Lunch at Simonstown was great, a beautiful spot and good food, and a lovely beach for the boys to run around on. We were all so glad I'd booked the tour.

Exccellent tour of Cape town. TO begin with this tour company is excellent and specifically Richard the guide is the person you should have your tours with.We had stumbled upon PG tops and tours was through another guide while we were enquiring on the various tours. My initial correspondence and mails was with Thami. He was well informed about the tours and we were able to finalize the tours and deals with him. Here I must say that it is a private guided tour hence it is coming cheap. We reached Capetown and had our tours the next day which to begin was quite disappointing as there was no tour guide at the allocated time i.e. 9am. When contacted we were being given different times which led to a lot of confusion. After all that at 10:30 am the tour guide was there and let me tell you after that all the early morning confusion was just forgotten. Richard the guide who came was excellent, he was just too good in terms of knowledge of the place, very friendly and was ready to go that extra mile just to make us satisfied and happy. We were also visited by the owner of PG tops Peter at the cape of god hope were he was apologetic for the morning mess and also gave a free R500 worth lunch for the mistake and it is rarely that you see such good gestures. Richard even went out of the way and took us to a great farm house restaurant called IMHOFF. The food was not only amazing but it was like one of the bes tlunch we had during our stay in Cape town. All in all this company is god and should you want to book any tours do it without hesitation. I understand that PG tours does take care of their guests and my above report should support my statement.

Three days in capetown . Great highly recommend Jarrod he was informative but also gave us space and time to explore. Flexible timetable really enjoyed the three days we had . Would highly recommend as a way to see a lot of Capetown

Service Excellence. My friend and I had the opportunity to visit Capetown, South Africa. After having numerous emails with Sofie from Pg Tops, I was prepared to have a great time. I did get a bit concerned when the transport that was arranged to pick us up at the airport didn't show however, after we made it to the hotel, things started looking up. After numerous apologies, they made up for not meeting us at airport, by providing lunch on the tour days. We did the table mountain hike with Frank, who was an excellent guide explaining at every point as we hiked up and back down the mountain. The hike was challenging, but Frank kept a good pace and allowed us to rest when we needed. Then the city tour, the district 6 museum, peninsula tour, Capepoint tour, boulders beach to see the penguins, the botanical gardens with our guide Jarred was most enjoyable. Jarred was very knowledgeable and pleasant. I would not hesitate to recommend Pg Tops to anyone who is travelling to Capetown.

Amazing tour and incredible service.. My husband and I spent 3 days in Cape Town before moving on to safari and then wine country. I had originally booked a peninsula tour with PG Tops for our final day in Cape Town, intending to tour Robben Island on our own the day before. But we were dumb and forgot to pre-order our tickets for the Robben Island ferry, and they were sold out when we got to the ticket office. There were still tickets available for the following day (our last in Cape Town), but we had the peninsula tour already booked. I found PG's contact information and got through to Yolanda who immediately set to work trying to accommodate us for a peninsula tour THAT day, instead of as scheduled, so that we could still tour Robben Island before leaving Cape Town. Yolanda connected us with Pieter, and after a couple short phone calls our schedule change was confirmed. Pieter, the founder/owner of PG Tops, couldn't find another driver to take us so last minute, so he changed his personal plans for the day and drove us himself. We were completely blown away by this incredible display of customer service. It was about an hour from the time we placed our initial call to Yolanda, to the time Pieter picked us up at our hotel for our last minute peninsula tour. The tour itself was absolutely perfect. Pieter was a wonderful guide and super knowledgeable. The day was our favorite in Cape Town.

Wonderful customized Cape Peninsula tour. I was in Cape Town on a last minute, brief business trip. I had never been to Africa before and would have only one day for any sightseeing, with a 7:30 flight at the end. I am not a group tour sort of person, so I looked for a provider with whom I could book a custom, personal tour that would give me a chance to do a little hiking. I was actually referred to PG Tops by another provider. Nela was fantastic to work with to set up the tour, she was very responsive and had a quote to me within hours, and answered all my miscellaneous questions very promptly and in a very friendly manner. After a rainy few days I was blessed with a clear and sunny Saturday. Jarred Vosges was my tour guide, and he was tremendous and friendly and relaxing to spend the day with. I did not have a lot of time to research the area before my trip, but I learned a lot from Jarred. He has a very nice, low key , conversational style of telling the history of the region and the plants and animals without being preachy or boring at all. He was also very flexible in rearranging the day to fit in things like Table Mountain and Chapman;s Peak Drive , which were closed earlier in the day but open later. I went to Cape Point and did the walks to the lighthouses, and then a point to point hike on the boardwalk to the Cape of Good Hope. I was initially surprised Jarred didn't actually hike with me at Cape Point, but it's not like it is possible to get lost- and after a week of business meals and meetings, I found I really enjoyed the freedom and solitude to go at my own pace. Plus it was great to do the Cape Point to Cape of Good Hope as a point to point. Jarred recommended a side visit to the beach in between, which was great as I had it entirely to myself. We got to do Chapman's Peak drive going north, and we visited the penguins at Boulder Beach. I did have a little problem at Table Mountain, which was the last stop before the airport - a cloud started peeking over right as I ascended and the entire top was in a fog. I couldn't see anything but more importantly, the line to get down (it was 5 PM) was extremely long and I worried about missing my flight. I pled my case, and showed my itinerary to the cable car operator and they let me bypass the line (hate to ask for special treatment but sometimes it's necessary!) . Jarred got me to the airport on time. I had a fantastic day and if I can ever come back and bring my family I know who to go to. I will also point out, though it was not the major part of my decision that the tour price was $100-$200 less than the quotes I received from other companies, who were also much slower in answering.

Great private tour to the Cape and wine country!. My husband and I along with our teenage daughter recently took two days of a private tour with PG Tops Travel and Tours and had a fantastic time. Our first day was down to the Cape of Good Hope area, and Rudi our driver was very knowledgeable of the area, and very flexible on timing, accommodating all of our requests. He had pre booked our lunch so we were sure to get in, and was happy to take side trips when we were interested in something special.Our second day trip was to the wine country and we had another fantastic day! Because of weather, Table Mtn. had been closed and this was our last day. Rudi called ahead to see if it would be open, and when it was, he took us there first before heading out to the wineries. He had pre booked three different wineries that were all excellent, and again made a lunch reservation ahead of time. We wanted to spend some extra time in the surrounding towns and he happily accommodated, and knew the area well to give us the history as we went. Both days were amazing, and we saw much more than we would have been able to on a group tour or on our own. I would highly recommend PG Tops travel to anyone visiting Cape Town! Tammy B

Great Cape Town and Pennisula Tors.. My husband and I along with my parents spent two and a half days in mid-May touring Cape Town with Bianca from PG Tops Tours and had a great time. Prior to our trip, I had been referred to PG Tops by another company who could not accommodate our reservation. I had many emails back and forth with Sophie who was great at making recommendations and listening to what we're interested in doing in order to come up with a great itinerary. Once settled, we paid half via PayPal before our trip and the balance on the last day of the tour. The costs included our private tour with Bianca in a very nice, clean van, as well as all entrance fees along the way. The only thing not included were meals during the outings, but we knew that ahead of time. We went up to Table Mountain and to Lions Head the first day. Bianca was great--she had gone to our inn to pick us up at the prearranged time, but we were running a bit late since we wanted to have lunch after cleaning up from our international flight before our tour. She came to get us at the restaurant and waited while we finished. At Table Mountain and Lions Head she never rushed us--the amount of time we spent or the amount walking was completely up to us...you never felt rushed. The next day we toured the peninsula --- we stopped to feed the ostrich and shop at the ostrich farm, we were lucky to see wild ostrich on the beach on the way to the Cape of Good Hope, visited the Cape of Good Hope, the lighthouse, sat down to eat at the Two Oceans Restaurant, and visited the Penguins at Boulder beach. Again, the day was at ease and at our pace making for a very personal experience. Bianca did what we wanted at our pace--if we wanted to spend and hour walking along the beach to get good pictures of the wild ostrich, no problem; if we wanted to walk or ride up to the lighthouse it was up to us. The final day, PG Tops had arranged a private tour of Kirstenbosch for us with one of their head botanists as my father is a semi-professional gardener. I had tried to contact Kirstenbosch directly as the gardening journals had recommended doing this to get the private tour and access to the non-public greenhouses; however, the garden had never responded directly. PG Tops made it happen. We finished our day with wine tasting and lunch at Constantia. Bianca was great and very enjoyable to spend our tour with. She even had authentic South African license plates made for my husband who collects them from all over the world. All in all, we were very pleased. we didn't make it to the Castle of Good Hope because we spent so much time at the garden, but that was our choice and not our priority and Bianca offered to return the entrance fee for that. We were extremely lucky in that our weather was sunny, clear and beautiful for the most part). If you want personalized tour without being pressured, I highly recommend PG Tops and Bianca. Just communicate your priorities and they will make it happen. Cape Town is great and PG Tops makes it even more enjoyable.

Cape Town Tour/ three days. We had a wonderful three day stay in Cape Town because of the tours we booked through PG Tops travel. Jarred was a great tour guide. He was informative and friendly, as well as being on time and professional. We all enjoyed his company. The recommendations for activities and restaurants were all great. Our Township tour with Godfrey was also fantastic. Godfrey gave us a valuable view inside the township and and an understanding of the people that live there.

Great Guides and Tours. Our first day in Cape Town, we had a 1/2 day tour of Table Mountain and a short city tour. Our guide was Jarred, who is full of energy, enthusiasm and information regarding his city. I highly recommend a 1/2 day or full day tour of Cape Town. Then 2 days later we did a full day tour with Yolanda down to the peninsula. Yolanda, too, is fantastic. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about why she does. We covered a lot of ground, saw amazing sites and I would definitely recommend either Jarred or Yolanda for your Cape Town touring.

Excellent Way to See Cape Town. We usually avoid organized tours but this was a great way to see Cape Town as its very personal and can be customized to ensure you see what you want. PG Tops hooked us up with Paul and we had a great time with him. Paul was down to earth and went out of his way to allow us to see what we wanted without force feeding us anything. In addition, he took us to some of his favorite restaurants and they were all excellent. The front office staff at PG Tops was also very helpful (thanks Yolanda) in getting us set up prior to our departure to South Africa. Overall PG Tops is a top notch operation and I highly recommend them.

No hassle way to see Cape Point. We had a beautiful day to drive down to Cape Point from our hotel in Cape Town. Our guide, Jared, was personable and well informed. It was stress-free having someone drive us down on the "wrong" side of the road, stopping at spectacular look out points & giving us an overview of the the area. We had started our trip from the U.S. disastrously, missing our nonstop due to mechanical & weather delays. After contacting PG Tops by email they were very accommodating about picking us up at the airport and then picking up the 3rd member of the party who had already arrived. It's a breath-taking view and the stop off at the penguin colony was fun too. Cute but strange sound creatures.

This is no box tour. I was lucky enough to spend two days with PG Tops tours. One heading out to Cape Point and another into Cape Winelands. These were offered by two different guides, both incredibly friendly, knowledgable, and fun. What makes PG Tops stand out is there commitment to customized tours. Unlike big bus tours with designated stops, scripts, and tourist traps, PG Tops lets you decide where to go and what to see. Of course they have suggestions but in the end it is up to the guest.Isn't that how it should be?For full review and pictures see here! http://www.thislifeintrips.com/day-trip-cape-point-pg-tops-tours-review/

Great full day Cape Point Tour. My husband and I only had two days in Cape Town and we booked a full day private day tour with PG Tops. Email communication was very prompt and rates were very reasonable. We could not have asked for a better guide in Bianca. She picked us up promptly at our hotel and she was full of energy and so easy to talk to. We really lucked out with the weather. It was a 100% chance of rain and we dodged it every where we went. She was great about stopping when I wanted to take pictures and took lots of pictures of my husband and I. We had a great lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant at Cape Point and ended the day with a wine tasting at Constantia Glen. We really enjoyed the day and can't thank Bianca enough. We are hoping to come back to Cape Town next year and we will be sure to once again use PG Tops and Bianca again!

Five Star Service and Fun. This was my first visit to South Africa and to Cape Town. I have to say that I struck gold when I used PG Tops Travel and Tours. From the very first instance of contact they were very professional and helpful in every way. I was slightly apprehensive to say the least as I was travelling on my own. I needn't have worried I was looked after wonderfully. I have to say that my guide Rudi was fabulous and he really made my trip so enjoyable. He was so knowledgable and helpful in every way. Also he was great fun and we really did have a great time. He timed all of our trips to perfection and we didn't have to wait long even to get to the top of Table Mountain. I am sure that this will not be my last trip to South Africa and I will definitely be using PG Tops Travel again and couldn't recommend them highly enough. Like everyone your not really sure when you see reviews on trip advisor but they are really as good as people say they are and especially Rudi.

First rate service from a first rate company with exceptional staff. This was our first visit to Cape Town and we planned a few sightseeing days before boarding our cruise ship for the return to the UK.We wanted to make the most of what could well be a "once in a lifetime" visit, so we checked carefully through the Trip Advisor reviews and finally chose this company. What a good decision!!!Our local itinerary was as follows:-Day 1 - early morning arrival at CPT. We were met and via a brief orientation tour, taken to our hotel, the Radisson Blu Waterfront, again another excellent choice. We spent the rest of the day walking around the upmarket V&A Waterfront, a great place to unwind and to buy our first souvenirs!Day 2 - Cape Town tour including Table Mountain and Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens.Day 3 - Cape Winelands tour including several wineries and Franschhoek and Stellenbosch, plus an amazing restaurant overlooking the Franschhoek valley for lunch.Day 4 - Cape Peninsula tour to Cape Point including Chapman's Peak Drive.Day 5 - Overburg tour to Herrnanus and one of our favourite locations, the Creation Winery in the Hemel en Aarde Valley (Heaven on Earth), - the name speaks for itself!Day 6 - Sadly the end of our time in Cape Town with a transfer to the port to join our cruise ship. All of these tours had amazing highlights, too many to recount in this short review. Having our own guide meant that we could plan each day, vary timings and our initial schedule, to cater for our individual requirements and as a further example of flexibility, make sure we ascended Table Mountain when the weather was appropriate. Of course we had wonderful views, which may not have been the case if this planning and flexibility were not possible.Throughout our guide was Jarred Vosges. He was superb, polite, punctual, easy to talk to, about pretty well anything and became a "friend". We could not think of anything he could have done differently to make this experience match our "once in a lifetime" requirement. However we now feel that a return visit, perhaps at a different time of year, must be near the top of our personal "bucket list".

Amazingly Enojyable!. The service that was given pre, during and post was just so great that we didn't feel foreign at all! Jarred was awesome and knowledgeable, giving in to our whimps and fancies, bringing us to places that we requested for and just keeping us immersed in the culture and beauty that Cape Town has to offer! Though the weather did not permit us to go up to Table Mountain or visit the outdoors more than we could, kudos to Jarred who still made the trip enjoyable and wonderful! Two thumbs (and big toes as well) to Jarred!

Five Stars from a Hard Grader. I can vouch for all the rave support for PGTops. If you are going to do a tour while in South Africa they should be where you go. Making the reservation on line was a breeze. I was looking forward to the tour for the entire week I was there on business. So the night before the tour I finally looked at the confirmation only to see that the date was for the day after what I thought was the tour date. Big issue since I would be a on a plane then. A quick call to PG with an explanation of what was the problem resulted in an email with the right date – tomorrow. Disappointment averted. Bianca my guide was a life long local with great knowledge of the area. We talked a wide range of topics ranging from baboons to politics to the best spot to find local art. Big fun. In the end it felt like I had hung out with a local friend vs a tour guide. I am a hard grader but I would give five stars.

Winelands tour of Constantia Glen and Groot Constantia. Thank you for a very insightful tour. Lots of background information was given to us in a relaxed friendly manner. A definite must for tour groups in the Cape! I would definitely recommend this tour to friends and business colleagues.Kind regardsMelody, SANSOR

A Great Experience: Thanks Sofie and Johan!. We had an excellent tour experience with the tour guide Johan that Sofie arranged for us. Had never had a private guided tour before, and were concerned with the expense. It was absolutely worth it! While we had arranged for a Cape Point Tour, Johan took the time to listen to what we had already done on our generic bus tours in Cape Town, and adapted his tour (significantly) to fit our needs, including a detour to the Table Mountain Tram that wasn't anywhere near the original route. He was pleasant, had a wealth of local information, took us "off the beaten path" a couple of times to show us some of his favorite spots, took pictures of the two of us in all the right places, and helped my wife identify and photograph essentially every flowering plant between Cape Town and Cape Point. He helped us get restaurant reservations at the Two Ocean Restaurant at Cape Point, and even made great recommendations on what to order. Both the money and the time (from 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM) we spent was well worth it!Sofie was a gem. During the weeks and days leading up to our visit I would preliminary schedule and then not get back to her; on several occasions due to other traveling we were doing that limited our access to WiFi. She stuck with us to the end. The day before the tour, I let her know that due to hearing issues, it was essential that we have a guide that spoke English clearly and would take my limitation into account. Even with such short notice (actually less than 24 hours from the time someone would be picking us up) she was able to provide us with Johan, who met our requirements perfectly. I would absolutely without qualification recommend Johan and the good folks at PG Tops Travel to anyone interested in a tour. While it is unlikely we'll ever run into anybody where we live (Mountain states of USA) that will be looking for a guide, we hope we do, so we can make a referral. We would trust our family and our friends with him without any problem.Thanks folks!!!

Professional company with great guides. We use PG Tops for a township tour, cape peninsula tour and animal sanctuary tour.Godfrey was our guide for the Langa township tour and the fact that he lives in the township and knows the history in detail made for a very rich experience indeed, thanks "God". Bianca was our guide for the other tours and she ensured we saw everything we wanted and anything she was unable to answer (we asked lots of questions!!) she came back with the answer the following day.We had to move some of our non PG Tops trips around and Barbara at PG was very accommodating in moving our PG days to accommodate changes in our diary.Very professional and great days! thx

Thank you for an excellent trip !!. we had a great 7 days trip that included the Sabi Sabi private game reserve , the garden route and two days in Cape town area. All was arranged in a perfect way by Caren from PG Tops . Her service level , her adaptability to any request we had was just amazing . I highly recommend Caren and PG Tops. We also had a great tour guide during the trip , Andrew Penn , that was booked by PG Tops.
Excellent!. Thank you, Rudi!A very enjoyable day in Cape Town and surroundings. We were lucky with the weather and you did a great job looking after us. 5 out of 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Two days of awesome! This touring company is TOPs for a reason!. We booked 2 days of touring ....first day was Cape of good hope,penguins,winery,baboons,lighthouses,lunch on the ocean,table mountain . Yolanda was our tour guide and driver ...but so much more! She made sure we saw everything we asked for and more ....very informative and knows her stuff ! Excellent job Yolanda ..Second day was a full day of driving over mountain ranges,wineries and eventually getting to our SHARK CAGE DIVE...Bianca was outstanding and knew all the pertinent info and Marina Company Staff . She made sure we were picked up at 7:30 am and took amazing care of us the entire day . If your looking for a company to assist you with "your bucket list " and does it effortlessly and privately ...JUST DO IT! Cape Town is an amazing place and we were showed it all ...but the recommendations these ladies gave us for evening dining ,drinking ,shopping etc....we're perfect and very safe ! Thank you Yolanda and Bianca ....when we can return the hospitality in the USA come for a visit / you are always welcome!

Excellent Tour Company. We booked two full day tours with PG Tops and they did not disappoint. Our tour guide Bianca Smith was amazing. Very knowledgeable with the history of the area, plants, trees and nature in general. She went out of her way to provide us with a memorable experience. She even delivered a South African flag to our hotel on the morning we were departing from Cape Town as she knew my husband was looking for one.I would highly recommend this tour company!!

Fantastic tours with Erica to Cape of Good Hope and Wine Country!. We found PG Tops when looking for day tours to the Cape of Good Hope and around wine country during a trip to Cape Town, and we were were thoroughly impressed. First, the office staff was extremely helpful and made the reservations very clear and easy. Second, it seemed that they matched us to the perfect guide for our tours - Erica. Throughout our two week travels in South Africa, we had three different tour guides, and Erica was far and above the best! She was extremely knowledgeable and charming, and she really took the time to get to know us on the tours and make any adjustments possible to personalize our experiences. We first took a great tour through the Cape of Good Hope, and she shared all her favorite spots for wildlife watching and really appreciating nature. On our second day (our wedding anniversary), we toured wineries that she had chosen perfectly to share the great wines, foods, and scenery but also to celebrate our special day. We couldn't have asked for a better guide, and we certainly couldn't have put together such memorable experiences without her expert help. She and PG Tops made our anniversary day and trip very special, and we'd strongly recommend her and PG Tops to anyone looking for a tour guide around Cape Town!

fantastic. We were a large group of 9 people and Yolanda made Peter gave us a very nice and enjoyable time. The day at the shark diving was amazing and is highly recommendable. We also very much enjoyed the day of the peninsula tour and Cape point. Also the day at the vineyards was very nice, despite the fact that many were closed due to the holiday. All in all, it was a very successful trip

Everything We Wanted To See and More. We were so very pleased with our PG Tops Travel and Tours which took us to three different vineyards across the Valleys. The guide Richard did a fantastic job and we appreciated visiting vineyards of varying sizes. This included on boutique vineyard where our tastings were done with the winemaker. We also enjoyed a wonderful lunch and appreciated the recommendation that came from Sofie. We highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Cape Town, South Africa who is interested in spending a day touring the nearby vineyards.

Excellent Cape Peninsula Day Trip. My partner and I took a private Cape Peninsula day trip with Jog. It was fantastic!We saw everything we wanted to see and more. Camps Bay, Hout Bay, Seal Island, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Boulders/Penguins, and Kirstenbosch. It was a fantastic day, with a lovely lunch at Black Marlin restaurant. Jog was a great guide with a lot of local knowledge.The vehicle was comfortable and we spend a good amount of time at each stop. Well worth the trip.

Excellent Day. We did the Cape Point tour and had a wonderful day. Our guide even made reservations at Two Oceans Restaurant! It was a splendid day trip and we thoroughly enjoyed seeing the Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, and the penguins. Highly recommended.

Amazing group trip - seamless from start to finish. Pieter and Caren and the whole PG Tops team did an absolutely amazing job of putting together and carrying out a truly memorable trip for our large group. We had only a few days and a long list of activities, plus our group grew very large - the PG Tops team was able to deal with it all. They were available at any time to answer questions and were incredibly knowledgeable. Every detail was taken care of for us, while still being spontaneous and able to accommodate our wishes. I cannot recommend them enough. I sincerely thank Pieter and Caren for the trip of a lifetime, and I can't wait to come back again!

Four fabulous days in Cape Town!. PG Tops arranged four fabulous days in Cape Town for us. Our driver/guide Paul was great, always prompt for pick ups and great source of information about the area. From shark cage diving to wine tasting, we did a little bit of everything. I would highly recommend PG Tops and Paul to anyone planning a visit to Cape Town.

2 fabulous days - Cape Point, Boulders, Langa Township, and Stellenbosch. This was my parents' first trip to Africa and I could think of no one more capable to show them the city of Cape Town than Pieter Geldenhuys of PG Tops. While traveling in South Africa last year with friends, I was introduced to Pieter through a former client who raved about what an amazing time they had. Pieter designed a completely custom city tour based upon our interests and knowledge of the city including my desire to try "bunny chow" (it's delicious, by the way). He also charmed the pants off (figuratively, of course) all 4 of us! So, given the short period of time we had to spend in the city pre- and post-safari I immediately thought of PG Tops. Day 1 was focused on mom who was excited to see Cape Point and the penguin colony at Boulders Beach. We also stopped in Hout Bay to see the seals and continued on to Kalk Bay for a bit of shopping. At every step, Pieter gave us options and never seemed to hurry. We couldn't have asked for a better guide or a more fun day. Day 2 began with a township tour led by Odwa. He offered us a unique view of life in an urban township and shared a great deal of his personal struggle growing up in Langa in a poor, single-parent home. His story is one of great hope and courage, and shows just how much South Africa has evolved in the last 20 years. He believes in the idea of South Africa as a "Rainbow Nation" and he'll make you believe it too:) After this Pieter collected us to head out to Cheetah Outreach and Somerset West for an amazing lunch at Waterkloof. The wine, food, view and venue were outstanding. I am pretty sure this is heaven on earth. More options were offered after lunch and we chose to continue on to Stellenbosch for a quick drive thru the town and the University, and a tasting at Ken Forrester. It is hard for me to imagine how these days could have been any more pleasant, informative, and seamless. Pieter has an amazing ability to read people and cater to their interests and time constraints. I can't say enough good things about the PG Tops Team.

Cape Town 1/2 day tour. We had a very limited time in Cape Town due to my poor planning. Jarred picked us up at our hotel at 8 am and dropped us at the airport at 3:30 pm. We went first to Table Mountain, then Bo Kaap, District 6 and the museum, the company gardens area for a walk and lunch and finally a local market. I specifically requested a guide who was historically knowledgeable and my expectations were exceeded. We were incredibly lucky with the weather which always helps.Jarred was very courteous and the car was very clean.  I would definitely recommend this company and would use them again.

Bianca Smith, This Lady know her stuff, Fantastic. Ive been coming to Cape Town for many years with Golf groups from all over Europe.But this year was special, Bianca Smith and PG Tops made the trip stress free. We where picked up each day on time and taken directly to reception to register, On one occasion we did not reserve Golf Buggies, and on our arrival in the blistering heat realised that it was not going to be fun, walking 18 holes, the group where prepared to cancel the round and go back to the hotel, obviously the mistake was doing. Bianca told us to take a seat in the clubhouse and have a cold drink, minutes later we had 4 Buggies and my clients where over the moon, she saved my bacon, thank you. ;) Bianca has a knowledge of the Cape that is second to none, full of info and with her friendly and charming art made the site seeing a real pleasure.We will be back again ;) i can't speak highly enough of PG Tops and the Delightful Bianca Smith.Thanks AgainFrancis Burke PGA Professional.

Bianca Smith, guide extraordinaire!. Bianca was knowledgeable, delightful, resourceful and thoughtful -- an all-around great guide for our days in Cape Town. We got to see everything on our agenda and more, despite raging fires causing Bianca to smoothly rearrange the whole itinerary. We were lucky to be in the hands of PG Tops and our new friend, Bianca.

PG Tops and Bianca were the best!. We made arrangements to use PG Tops for three days of tours while in the Capetown area. We couldn't have been more pleased with the correspondence, arrangements, and our tour guide Bianca. She was a delight to be with, offered great information about the area, and turned out to be amazingly resourceful in rearranging our tours to take in everything we wanted to see. We arrived during the fires on the Cape, and Bianca made all of the necessary adjustments to avoid the fires, get us to Table Mountain on the one day it was clear, and got us through the fires to see the penguins. Bianca arranged a city tour which included a stop at the District 6 museum, great restaurant for lunch, and Table Mountain on one day, a peninsula tour on another day, and a wine tour to Stellenbosch on another day. It was the perfect itinerary for the time we had in Capetown.We can and will recommend PG Tops to our friends going to Capetown and for sure Bianca as their tour guide. What a great experience and fantastic memories.

First Rate Tour , Fantastic!!. A first rate tour experience in Cape Town with PG Tops Tour & TravelWe are following up on a 4-day private tour booked through PG Tops Tour and Travel company in Cape Town from December 22-26, 2014. There were four of us traveling from Canada. We arrived in Cape Town, after disembarking from a 30-day cruise aboard Nautica with Oceania Cruise Lines.We booked our tour through Bianca at PG Tops. We have nothing but praise for Bianca, the tour company and guides. Everything went so very smoothly, hitting all the highlights we had hoped for and more, as well all the guides were so friendly, courteous and very knowledgeable...Bianca, Jarrett and Rod. Our tour days with PG Tops tour company capped off a wonderful 6-weeks of travel...terrific finale.To highlight some of the many positives that made Bianca and PG Tops tour company a standout in our minds.1. PROMPT RESPONSE: At the outset I'd sent a number of emails to various tour companies in Cape Town that I'd researched online. Initially, I did not have this company's email, however one of the companies I'd initially sent an email to did respond but unfortunately it was booked, however this company did recommend PG Tops as a very good tour company. I followed up this suggestion with a quick email to PG Tops tour company. PG Tops representative, Bianca, responded promptly....very quick considering the time difference. This was before I'd had any response from the remaining companies which I'd emailed days prior. We found this most impressive as this suggested reliability to us.
