We selected the private tour option.They pick up us at 9:00 am at our hotel and in 8 hours we visited the all the spots we wanted.We went to Cam´s Bay, Cape Point, Boulders Beach, to a craft´s market and as an extra our guide took us to a vineyard for a wine tasting. Our guide was very kind, he was a local resident so he explained us everything we wanted in order to understand the life and culture of the area.This is the best option to have a complete view of Cape Town in just one day. You will not regret it.

Best two days of our time in Cape Town. We had two full days booked with PG during our stay in Cape Town - one for a day in the wine lands and one for a day driving to Cape Point. Both days was great and beyond what we could have imagined. Our guide Roelf was the best guide ever - he knew everything and pointed out things along the way. He knew about the wines, the fauna and the histories. We started out as clients and ended up as friends. On the last day we arrived early back from the tour and he took us up to Table mountain even though we had not booked this - it was our last chance of visiting the mountain and he was more than happy to help us by driving us up to the cable car, joining us up there and driving us down again. It was a great experience and if we ever come back we will def be booking PG and Roelf again!

PG Tops is a middleman, my tour was outsourced. Pros: Responsive to email, friendly staffCons: Throughout my email communications, there was no indication that PG Tops is actually just a middleman. After I confirmed my reservation, they sent me an email with all the details, and it was then I realized my actual tour operator for the Langa Township tour was in fact with another company called African Eagle. If I'd wanted to choose African Eagle, I could have booked it with them myself! I specifically chose PG Tops because of their high ranking on TripAdvisor, and African Eagle had a much lower ranking on TripAdvisor. Needless to say, I was not surprised when the tour turned out to be mediocre (eg. the pick up was 1 hour late, our tour guide kept disappearing and handing us off to other people during the tour).If I had to do it again, I would not choose PG Tops or African Eagle.

Fantastic Tour Guides!. My sister and myself visited Cape Town 3rd December to 14th December 2013. We had three complete days out with PG Tours, as well as pick up and drop off from airport, and could not be more pleased with them. Our guide was Rudi and we could not have asked for anyone more professional and knowledgeable he truly made our days out and we got much more out of them than we would have on our own. Prior to our arrival, I gave them a list of things we would like to do and they arranged a complete itinerary for us covering everything and giving us suggestions. We did so much! Cheetah Sanctuary, winelands, Cape Peninsula tour, horse riding at Imhoff Farm, chocolate and wine tasting at the most stunning wine estate, and a horseback safari plus more! They also arranged for us to go on a group Shark Cage Diving experience at Klenbaai. He made the journeys to and from our various destinations go very quickly by giving us detailed explanations of everything we saw and answering our endless questions. If you want to get to see what Cape Town has to offer this really is the best way of doing it. We would definitely ask for Rudi again as well, nothing was too much trouble for him. Special thanks to Yolanda also who sorted everything out before our arrival and kept in touch with us whilst we were there even though she was on holiday.

Great Day Tours in and around Cape Town thanks to PG Tops. I was recently in Cape Town on business but added a few days to enjoy the warmth and to see the area. Was I ever glad that PG Tops was recommended. I did the following day trips: Aquila private game reserve safari; the Cape Peninsula Tour and; Robben Island / Table Mountain and City Tour - they were all great. My guide was Yolanda and I couldn't have asked for a nicer more engaging person - she was a wealth of klnowledge and great fun to be around. I recommend PG Tops without any hesitation - well organized, client focused and simply good people! Next time I'm back i will certainly call them up and do other tours. Russell, Canada

Awesome tour. I had a 14 hour layover in Cape Town and wanted to do a tour of the top attractions. I was actually referred to PG Tops from another tour operator I found that wasn't able to accommodate me (which speaks to reputation of this operator). I scheduled a day trip to see Table Mountain and the Cape of Good Hope. Everything was done over e-mail and Pieter (the owner) was very responsive and coordinated well. The tour guide, Rudi, was great. He was on-time, very professional, and had interesting facts to share about the area. Overall, I had a great time. Highly recommended.

Can't get any better. If you are looking for a reliable and enjoyable tour experience, PG will come up tops! My family of 2 adults and 4 young children were fortunate enough to be accompanied by Rudi for my 11 days adventure in cape town and the garden route. Everything was well organised. We had good food, great wine recommended by Rudi and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Botlierskop private game reserve that we stayed in was awesome and we had a chef to personalise our dinner menu. Rudi is a gem of tour guide and you should ask for him if you are considering a private tour.

Capetown tours. My husband and I and two of our good friends had two wonderful days with Roelf of PG Tours. He picked us up right on time at our hotel in Capetown and took us to the wine country and shopping the first day and a tour of the peninsula the next day. We toured two wineries, had a great lunch at one, and when we were on the way back to the hotel, my friend mentioned that she would be interested in some jewelry. Roelf knew of a wholesale diamond store, who stayed open late for us. Yes, she did buy a gorgeous ring! The next day was also fabulous. Roelf recommended an excellent seafood restaurant right on the water, where we ate fresh fish and prawns until we were ready to burst! Roelf was very knowledgable about the area and patiently answered all our questions, stopped for pictures, etc. We would not hesitate to recommend PG Tours to anyone.

Fabulous Service!. Seriously, you can't do better than PG Tops and if I'm ever in the Cape or have friends going there I will recommend that they use this service. Punctual, flexible, courteous, friendly and responsive! Yolanda was the absolute best and totally knew what she was doing! Everyone in our party appreciated her knowledge and expertise...we managed to see so much in the short time we were there! Hats off to PG Tops!

Great Time. Went out with Pieter on the Cape of Good Hope Trip for the day. For those who are interested in more than just sightseeing, he surely knows his SA history and politics - I didn't stop asking questions. He took us to a great locals lunch spot as well. Great day.

Fantastic week in Cape Town with Yolanda from PG Tops. My wife and I spent 6 days in Cape Town with Yolanda who showed us around and went the extra mile every day to make sure we discover the nicest parts of her city and culture. Yolanda has been extremely friendly, very knowledgeable and really attentive to all our needs and expectation. She really took care of all details during our stay and this has been, by far, our best guided tour ever!I used other companies in the past to do the Peninsula tour, whales watching or visit the vineyards and none of the previous experiences I have had so far has been as good as what we experienced with PG Tops. They are actually selecting their partners and the places you visit so that you consistently enjoy the best available options. We'll for sure come back in Cape Town in a near future and we'll of course ask PG Tops, and in particular Yolanda, to guide us again. Thank you so much for this fantastic week in a fabulous town!

Discover Cape Town. I highly recommend this fantastic whole day tour through Cape Town and Langa with Roelf and Sugar! The guides make all the difference and these two were absolutely great. Very knowledgable about the town and its inhabitants, eager to answer all questions and curious to learn more...there is so much too see in Cape Town, this tour is definitely a great way of making the most of your stay!

PG tops - top tour guides!. we've just visited cape town and did both the townships and wineland tours with PG tours. both tourguides were friendly, knowledgable and attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed both trips. the township tour provides a very personal insight into a very different side of african culture that you wont get on any other tour. godfrey was our guide for the morning and was from the township he took us to. he made us feel very safe and comfortable and looked after us at all times. the highlight was definately getting to go to church as we went on a sunday. if churches were more like that in england im fairly sure attendance would be higher!!wine tasting was obviously very different and great fun. we hadnt a clue about wine tasting but had a good laugh and rudy took us to 4 very different estates to give us an idea of the range that is available. only complaint was he couldnt join in the tasting with us as he was designated driver! would definately recommend this company if you are lucky enough to be visiting the area

PG Tops -Yolanda is awesome. Friends traveled to Cape Town in April and recommended PG Tops and Yolanda. We took a private tour of Cape Point with Yolanda in October and we were NOT disappointed. Yolanda is personable and knows her stuff. She clearly loves her job and doesn't tire of driving around tourists and taking photos. Great attitude. We had a great day with her and we would recommend any of the tours offered by PG tops. Wish we had time to do more of them!

Really convenient and fun tour. Roelf was our guide for the Cape Point and Penguins tour. Really fantastic. He was informative and fun, answered our questions, treated us to tons of snacks, and when we told him a couple of fun markets we wanted to hit up, he made sure we made those stops on our tour. It was exactly what we wanted on our honeymoon as we ran around the cape. You gotta ask him about the koeksisters...i am pretty sure we got diabetes after hosing those bad boys down.

Amazing Adventure !!!. We spent unforgettable time with Roelf, our tour guide from PG Tops. We had 4 visiting days : City Tour : Castle of Good Hope, Signal hill, the Company Gardens, Bo Kaap and more; The Winelands with 3 wine tastings and the great region of Stellenbosch and Franschhoek; The Cape Point day where we saw zebra, baboons and pinguins at Boulders Beach and much more.. 4. We went to the Hermanus whales festival which was just an amazing and wonderful adventure. There is much more to do with PG Tops and we will definitely come down very soon to explore more deeply this fascinating region of South Africa! A big thanks to all the PG Tops Team! BBZ - VC - GP.

Worth every Rand!. We just spent 4 days in Cape Town and can highly recommend the PG Tops guide services. They have great vehicles, are very accommodating and will taylor your day to what you really want to do. We did a full day trip to the Cape of Good Hope, then another full day touring the city and then out to the wine country. They keep you safe, informed and guide you through such things as the best places to curio shop and what is customary for tipping at restaurants. We had a wonderful experience and would choose them again.

PG tops- was the tops!. Guides were professional, knowledgable, insightful and very nice!Pieter was our favorite! Took my wife and step-son shark cage diving and to see whales!Had a great time, guiding was reasonable and well worth it! Would recommend anyone to use PG TOPS, classy company!If we go back to Cape Town, we are definetly using this folks again to guide us!Ruiz familyBrownsville, Texas

PG Tops is amazing. Truly such a great experience with Pieter and Yolanda. It was an incredible whirlwind of a tour. We saw so much. Pieter is incredibly knowledgable about Cape Town and South Africa especially it's history and politics. He is a great guy and kept us all laughing the entire trip. I would recommend him to anyone as well as Yolanda, they are great people who are so enthusiastic and love where they live. The trip could not have gone better. I was sad to leave!

Fantastic 3 days in Cape Town with kids. While my husband was going to be off working, I was going to be on my own with the three boys in Cape Town for four days in September. Although I've never used a tour company on any of our travels, I decided it was best to hire someone for this trip. It was the best thing I could have done, and I really think I found the best tour guide for the job. Yolanda was fantastic! She is young, vibrant, and excited to share all she knows about the area and the country with her guests. The best part for me was she had spent a year as an au pair in the past, so she really got kids- was able to talk with them and explain things to them in a way that they understood and found exciting. I feel like the boys learned a lot, and I did too! She was able to make it interesting for all of us. In talking with her it seems she could really tailor make a tour that anyone, young or old, with any interests, could be very happy with. She loves her job and it really shows. It was a whirlwind three days, in which we saw cheetahs, whales, seals, penguins, ostriches, along with any other wild life that crossed our paths. We hiked Lion's Head (definitely a highlight), walked from Cape Point to the Cape of Good Hope (beautiful!) and went blokarting. We had a fantastic city tour and really loved the castle portion especially. We were also able to drive around much of the area and take in some really incredible scenery. I cannot say enough good about Yolanda and the company. They were very easy to work with, reasonably priced, and provided three great days for us! She made traveling with three kids super easy- I didn't have to think about where we were going or what to see, or where we were going to eat. All the information she was able share with us really enhanced our experience in Cape Town. Would recommend to anyone.

The best way to see Cape Town. Pieter, Godfrey, and the entire team of PG Tops made our touring of Cape Town so complete and satisfying. We know we could not have done it any other way. The weather was iffy, sometimes rainy and chilly and sometimes sunny. They adapted our days accordingly so we got to Table Top Mountain, the Townships, and the Gardens in mostly sunshine, and finally had a day for Robben Island when the sea was calm enough. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent as well. They were always on time and had so much in depth information and never rushed us from place to place. It was a terrific experience.

Awesome touring in Cape Town. Thank you Pieter of PG Tops - Cape Town! You have first rate tour guides and drivers and first rate tour products. Your boys took the group of us our for two consecutive days and we got a taste of what Cape Town has to offer. We LOVED the Lagos Township and fell in love with the children at the school. We can't wait to come back. Vanita and friends.....San Francisco

Guides to an unforgettable adventure!. A couple of my colleagues and I were in Cape Town for business and snuck away for a day to tour the city. We are so glad we did!! We travel around the world for business and Yolanda helped make Cape Town an unforgettable adventure. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the area and flexible with our times and what we wanted to see. I highly recommend PG Tops tours and can especially recommend Yolanda as a friendly, experienced guide. Definitely add this to your to-do list.

Great experience from beginning to end. I found PG Tops from Tripadvisor and was impressed with the great reviews. They did not dispappoint. I started with an email and corresponded with Bianca, who was very responsive and informative. After several rounds of emails, we finally settled on an itinerary two days of touring in and around Cape Town. For my husband and me, our must-sees were Table Mountain (husband) and Robben Island (me). I also wanted to get a sense of the city and go out to the winelands.Rudi picked us up on time on a morning with terrible weather. Table Mtn was a no-go that morning, and I wasn't due to go to Robben Island until the afternoon. So Rudi improvised and took us through the Waterfront where we did a little shopping and then brought us to Camp's Bay so we could see the other side of the mountain. Ultimately we had some lunch before I was due to catch the ferry to Robben Island, and then he would whisk my husband up the mountain, so he could get that in. My husband tells me that Rudi actually waited to see me board the ferry before they left for the mountain. When I returned from Robben Island, Rudi was waiting for me just as planned.Due to a scheduling change, my husband could not join in for any of our 2nd day of touring, so Rudi had the dubious honor of being my personal guide for the day. He walked me through the Castle of Good Hope and then drove me out to the winelands. He was such a trooper watching me taste wines all day. I had a fabulous day and much of that is due to his professionalism, great information and good humor. I would strongly recommend that anyone looking for a personal and custom tour of Cape Town and its surrounding areas to contact PG Tops. You will not be disappointed. I hope we'll be back to South Africa again, and they'll be tops on my list.

Great time in Cape Town. Just wanted to say a big thank you! To Pieter and Rudi for a great time in Cape Town. We booked several tours with them and they did a great job accommodating our family. The service and commication before hand was very prompt and professional! I would definitely recommend pg tops tours!

Our Favorite Day in Cape Town!. My husband and I did the Cape Point tour with Rudi and had an absolutely terrific time. Rudi was so sweet and willing to answer all of my many questions about what life is like for Capetonians. We also really enjoyed that parts of the tour were with Rudi, but there was also flexibility to explore certain places - Cape Point, Kirstenbosch Gardens - on our own. This tour is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town!Additionally, booking the tour with Pieter over email was completely effortless. My only regret is that we didn't book more tours with PG Tops!

Contact PG if you want to have one-of-a-kind unique experience!. What amazed me most about my PG experience was that he was able to create a super-unique experience that I know I wouldn't be able to create for myself. I told Pieter that I wanted to do some bike riding, preferably at Cape Point. I realize now that biking up Cape Point would be silly / impossible... but Pieter figured out a way to accommodate my love for biking in an unbelievable way. He used his contact network to create a biking experience for us on Chapman's Peak, a super scenic windy road hugging the mountainous cliffs of Cape Town. For anyone who's been to South Africa, you probably know that Chapman's Peak is an amazing drive. Now imagine that same experience, except you're on a bike! It was incredible and it took my breath away. The entire time, Pieter and his bike rental contact made sure that we were safe, and we were able to do something that probably <1% of tourists do. (In case you're wondering - there aren't bike rental shops around this location - he had to get these bikes brought in!). It was the favorite activity BY FAR for everyone in my travel group - he made me look like a trip planning genius!Beyond all this - Pieter's awesome for the depth of knowledge regarding his country. He walked us through South Africa's history, patiently entertaining my very curious and inquisitive travel group. (We had millions of questions!). You can have a standard tour experience with other vendors, but you really get more with PG. Totally recommend! :-)

Best way to see this beautiful place!. I was sent to Cape Town for work and a friend tagged along. We decided that since part of the time she would be on her own, the best way to arrange our sightseeing was to hire a guide. We were referred to PG Tops. We toured many days with Roelf and he was fantastic, fun, and knowledgeable. The best thing was that he was completely flexible and open to changing plans according to whatever we felt like seeing (as long as it wasn't ladybugs, Roelf is scared of them :) Don't miss the hike up Lion's Head, the winelands tour, and the Cape Tour. Our last day in Cape Town Godfrey took us on the Township tour. As spectacular as the Cape Town and environs tours were, the Township tour was equally moving and should not be missed. Godfrey was very sensitive to our nervousness that we didn't want to bee seen as gawkers, but rather that we wanted to learn about the townships, how they came about, and how they are evolving. He took us to his home and neighborhood and we thank him for that.

Best way to see Cape Town!. We booked two day tours with PG Tops tours and Roelof was our guide. We corresponded with him via email before our arrival in Cape Town. He responded quickly to all of our questions. He arrived at our hotel promptly and was flexible with rearranging the schedule to work around the rainy weather. We rode in style in an impeccably clean BMW along the coast to Hermanus to see the whales. We stopped on the way back to CT at a farm stand to enjoy tea and delicious local pastries. During our city tour of CT he willingly made side trips that we requested. He shared with us details about the language, culture and history of the area. Roelof was professional, polite, knowledgable as well as witty and attentive. We felt like we had spent two days with a family friend. This was our first experience with a private tour and the one on one attention made our visit a memorable one.

Highly recommended the Cape Town tour. With only two days notice Peter managed to arrange a five star tour of Cape Town for me.I only had a single day from landing in the morning to see as much as possible because of work commitments for my remaining days.Yolonda was my guide & is a great talker, she’s the perfect tonic to a city full of spirit as we cruised around in a BMW. The different districts, Signal Hill, vineyard and sunset drive back for dinner at V&A.Peter had even arranged beers on Long street to party into the next day.Thank you for both a memorable first day in Cape Town.

Excellent Service and Excellent Tours. Booked all our tours with PG Tops and it was a great decision to so. Our guide, Peter, was very knowledgeable and fun to talk to. He was very kind and considerate of us, and we got to see so many amazing things throughout Cape Town. Most notably I was interested in climbing a mountain while I was here and Peter actually drove me to Lion's Head and climbed the mountain with me. He did it for no charge and said it was his absolute pleasure to do so. Very nice tour guide, and a very professional and friendly tour company. I highly recommend them for their hospitality and excellent service.

Could not be better. We went with Roelof from PG Tops on a day tour of the Cape Peninsula, including stops at Kommetjie, Cape Point and at the penguin sanctuary. Roelof was knowledgeable, friendly and considerate of all our needs. Highly recommended!

Cape Town tour. Just finished the 2nd tour booked through PG Tops. Day 1 was a city tour. Day 2 was a trip to wine country visiting Stellenbosch with lunch in Francshoek. I cannot say enough about the 2 tours. The guide Roelff was amazing, the sites we saw gave us a remarkable taste of what Cape Town is about. Our stay has been nothing short of awsome.

Fantastic Private Tour. We booked four days with PG tops tours to see the Capetown area. We have booked many private tours and had many guides in the past. This was one of the best, specifically because of Roelf, who was our guide for our time there. We were able to pack many sites into our time there and felt like we saw a great deal of what there is to see, but we never felt rushed. Roelf was wonderful - he is flexible, knowledgeable, thoughtful, accommodating, and an all around extremely nice and fun guy. He quickly picked up on things we liked and would then plug more of that into the tour as we went along. The quality of our time there was made significantly better because of Roelf and we would highly recommend him as well as PG Tops in general.

Thanks Yolonda and Godfrey!. We loved having Yolanda and Godrey as our tour guides while visiting the Cape Town area. Godfrey's Township tour just "knocked our socks off' (as the old saying goes.) We were a group of 3 high school students and 2 "teachers" and we learned so much by seeing the Langa Township through Godfrey's eyes. I'm so glad that we did that tour on our first day in Cape Town. We all highly recommend it.And Yolanda was just the most amazing breath of fresh air. Her energy and enthusiasm kept us upbeat and anxious for the next turn in the road. She showed us the Cape Point area on a gloomy, rainy day, but it did not seem that way to us. We loved her tour and loved her personality. She drove us the 4.5 hours each way to Gondwana, too. We spent a great deal of time with Yolanda, and HIGHLY recommend her. Thanks so much to you both. Our school will see you next year, for certain. :)

Thank you PG tops for an amazing experience!. Just got back from South Africa and loved our time in Cape Town. I think Cape Town on its own is an exceptional place and we would've loved our time anyway, but having great guides to accompany us to the different sites was definitely a bonus I did not expect. Our guides from PG Tops were absolutely AWESOME--not only are they were well informed about the places we visited, but they were very personable and friendly. One huge difference I noticed from guides i've had in the past is that they are not just trying to get their shift done and wanting to get their time with us out of the way; they were hospitable and let us have our time at all the places we visited so that we could appreciate each spot they took us to. We didn't feel rushed once. Me and a group of 5 other girlfriends spent 4 1/2 days in Cape Town; 4 of which we used PG Tops to guide us. Day 1 - Our guide, Godfrey, met us at our hotel and we started the day driving through District 6 and visiting Langa township. We spent about 3-4 hours within the township touring a home shared by 3 families, visiting a preschool, and visiting a local bar within the area. Living in the township himself, we felt we got a better idea of the life there and appreciated that. It was as if someone was inviting us into their home so that we could have a glimpse of the life there. We were supposed to go to Table Mountain on this day also, but because of the rain, it was closed. Godfrey improvised by showing us some other sites in Cape Town and more than made up for our missing Table Mountain that day. He was great. Day 2 - For the rest of our Cape tours, Roelof guided us, and he was wonderful. I was amazed by his people skills and knowledge being as young as he is. We spent this day doing the Cape Peninsula tour. The Cape seaside is one of the most picturesque coastal areas i've ever seen. We spent the whole day stopping along all the different points, from Cape of Good Hope to Capepoint to Boulder beach in Simon's town. Day 3 - Shark diving. We arranged our shark cage diving through PG Tops who works with Marine Dynamics. It's about a 2-3 hour drive from Cape to Gaanesbai but we thought it was well worth it. Well maybe 2 of the 5 ppl I travelled with didn't think so, as they got seasick and didn't feel up to doing the actual dive. I'll write about Marine Dynamics and the dive on another review, but they were great. Day 4 - Robben Island and the wine country in the afternoon. Because it was rainy or didn't fit into our schedule the other 3 days, Roelof got us to Table Mountain on this morning. It was foggy but as it's one of the top sites there, glad we were able to go up. From here, he took us to the port for Robben Island. That was a great visit. He dropped us off at the port and met back with us when we arrived back. Roelof gave us time to grab a bite and shop around the waterfront, and then it was a mad dash to the wine country. Unfortunately, we didn't get to go to Stellbosch which was the plan. Most of the places stop doing tastings at about 5, and because we spent a little more time shopping and made the stop at Table Mountain, we wouldn't have gotten there on time. However, Roelof did a great job of improvising and getting us to a nice spot in Paarl. 4 of the 6 of us don't drink, and when I let Roelof know this earlier in the day, while 2 of us tried the wine, he set it up so the the other 4 could have a "chocolate" tasting which they seemed to enjoy. He was also going to take us to cheese tasting spot, but because we wouldn't have gotten there on time as we were already tasting our chocolate and wine, he surprised us with cheese after our tastings, that he rushed to get at some point while we were doing our tastings. It was a perfect end. We reached Cape in the evening and one of the girls wanted to drive by Camp's Bay. I didn't think we had time and thought it was definitely way past the time he needed to spend with us, but he was so accommodating that he said he could drive by there and he did. At the end of our trip we were sad to say goodbye to him, it was as if we had another friend spending those days with us. I have travelled quite a bit, mostly visiting sites w/o guides, but of all the guided tours i've had in the past, this surpassed my expectations. I will definitely recommend PG Tops to anyone I know visiting South Africa in the future.

Awesome Times. I just got back from Capetown with my friends. We had an absolutely amazing time! Capetown is beautiful, and there is plenty to see and do. I was extremely happy with the tour guides from PG Tops. Each tour guide was knowledgeable, friendly, accomodating, and easy to understand. I have travelled extensively thoroughout the world, and I have to say that the tour guides from PG Tops are the best that I have encountered. Prior to our trip I exchanged emails with Pieter, who helped build out the itenarary for my friends and I. Pieter was great in answering all of our questions and building out a great itenarary. Our tour guides in Capetown were Godfrey and Roelof. Godfrey was our tour guide for the first day in Cape. He took us to Langa township, along with other sites. Godrey did a great job! We felt safe going into the township with him. He answered all our questions, and was super friendly and knowledgable!The next three days, we explored the wonders of Capetown with another guide named Roelef. Roelef was amazing! I was very impressed with his knowledge and people skills. My entire group liked him. He was informative, and kept us all laughing. Also easy to understand and made the stories interesting. He was very accomodating to our group. Three days with a person can be a lot sometimes, but he just blended in with our group. He definitely exceeded our expectations!The tour guides made sure we saw everything we had planned and adjusted our planned itenarary based on the weather and our requests. We had an awesome time thanks to the knowledgable, dynamic and fun staff from PG Tops.Thank you guys for everything :)

Great time in Cape Town thanks to PG Tops and Rudi!. We usually tour new places on our own but decided to take a private tour while we were in South Africa. It was a treat to have PG Tops and Rudi take care of us! We may never tour on our own again!The first day we took the Wine Lands tour. One of our foursome is a car enthusiast and I suggested we visit a car museum in Stellenbosch that I had read about. Rudi was glad to customize our day for us so we went and loved it.The second day we went on the peninsula tour. What a wonderful day...until one gentleman is our group fell and needed to see a doctor. Rudi quickly drove us to the emergency room in Cape Town. Rudi was so kind and helpful and stayed right with us. He made a very stressful time much more bearable and we still made it to Table mountain after 8 stiches!We would definitely recommend PG Tops! Yolanda was helpful and punctual with replies as we made reservations. Rudi was knowledgeable, punctual, considerate and an all round nice guy!

Best Decision Ever. Myself , my wife and my daughter recently visited Cape Town for the first time. We decided on a private tour guide due to all the conflicting reports on how dangerous [or not] Cape Town is. Let me firstly say that we had no trouble in Cape Town, or anywhere else during our visit to South Africa. It is no more or less dangerous than most other destinations.  Right from the start we knew we had made the right decision in our choice of tour guides. Yolanda is bubbly, friendly and a wealth of knowledge on Cape Town and South Africa. We got a great feel for the country ,the people and the history. Yolanda could not do enough to make our trip enjoyable and gave us advice on restaurants, shopping and other travel destinations apart from Cape Town. A self confessed " Cape Town Snob" Yolanda showed us a side of the city we never would have seen on our own. And the township tour she organised for us with Godfrey was my daughters highlight. This is a must for anyone visiting South Africa and Godfrey, a resident of Langa Township himself,really knows his stuff. So if you are considering a trip to Cape Town I highly recommend the team at PG Tops, they will really ensure you thoroughly enjoy your South African adventure.

Capetown=San Francisco=Great. went on half day of capetown, day down the peninsula, day in wine country. yolanda was a great guide. she was prompt, knew her stuff, kept a great pace to accommodate us, safe driver, very cordial and got along well with our adult kids. because the weather can be tricky on table mountain and may close the tram , she advised us to go up on the first day as it was clear. the following two days, you could not see the mountain top. it was cold at the top of the mountain; best with windbreaker/camera/binocs/sunglasses. though it was after the usual end time for the tour, she helped us getting around the pier area which was a great help in orienting us since we had just arrived that day from the states. next day went down the cape and we spent more time at places or watching animals that interested us and passed on some things that were of no interest to the family. we had arranged a late lunch reservation and she got us back on time. roelf unexpectedly met us as he had anticipated parking would be an issue and took us into the old biscuit mill. yolanda aftewards, took us to a laundry as we had the usual 20kg luggage limit. because we would be out all next day, she picked it up for us and dropped it off at the hotel. unfortunately yolanda was unavailable the next day for the trip to the wine country but rudy was just as great. he arranged for us to visit the wineries that were better known for their reds(our preference). since we also had a dinner reservation in franschhoek at 7 pm, for a small additional fee arranged ahead of time, rudy waited and picked us up after dinner and returned to capetown at 11pm. was a long day for all but especially rudy, but he was great( and all the descriptors for yolanda apply to rudy as well). i would not recommend self driving in the wine country unless you have a designated driver as the drinking laws appear much stricter.wish we could have spent more time with both guides both in and around capetown. they maximized our short time in cape town and truly "took care of us". we would recommend them to anyone.

Great trip. Roelf was a wonderful guide. Very knowlegeable and punctual. Toured winelands and the peninsula. We were able to swith our tour days based on the weather. Always received prompt responses to any email questions. Have already passed on their phone number/web site to other people heading to Cape Town. LW

Wonderful time in Cape Town. PG Tops made visiting Cape Town an extraordinary experience. Their knowledge of the area is unparalleled as well as their friendliness and professionalism. Besides a city tour in Cape Town we also did a Stellenbosch winelands visit and a peninsula tour as well. Everything was perfectly planned and timed we really enjoyed it.

Wonderful Two days in Cape town. I cannot recommend PG Tops highly enough.I decided a last minute trip to cape town.They were quick to response and help to arrange a two day trip. We saw the breath-taking sunset in Atlantic Ocean. Our tour guide Erica is a incredibly friendly and consideration, she also offer us a lot of historic imformation about cape town.Pieter, Bianca, Erica and and all the PG Tops team I didn't get to meet, thank you very much for this memorable tour.Visited May 2013

Great time in Cape Town. I had a great experience in Cape Town. They were quick to respond to my emails and recommended two days of activities that fit my objectives perfectly. My guide Roelof was friendly, helpful and on time. Every aspect of the tour was well done. RSC

A memorable Cape Town trip with my daughter and Pieter!. Our last minute trip was enticing because of great air fares and a desire to see CT. Working with Betsy (BJAdventures) and Pieter of PGTops, my daughter Agatha and I had an absolutely wonderful time on the peninsula. We were so lucky to have Pieter as our guide for 3 full days - which spanned hiking and rock climbing to the top of Lion's Head to a spectacular tour of the Cape of Good Hope to great wine/beer and chocolate tastings in the Winelands and beautiful Stellenbosch and of course....time with the Cheetahs, a particular favorite for Agatha.Important to me is having a guide who understands and respects his/her traveling clients and works with me to fulfill our greatest expectations. Pieter excelled at understanding our interests and abilities, was flexible to altering plans, if desired--while always being on time. Being a history buff, I especially appreciated the many discussions we had regarding the history of Cape Town - its people, its culture and its role in modern day society, globally and nationally. Thanks Pieter...and thanks to my dear friend and travel advisor - Betsy (BJAdventures). Paulette (and Agatha)

THANK YOU YOLANDA!!. Thank you Yolanda for an outstanding tour of Cape Point and the surrounding environs. Yo collected us at our hotel in an impeccably clean BMW and from that point on, we were in perfect company. Yo is versed in everything-Cape Town, but she wanted input and questions from us from the start of the tour, and we obliged. She handled everything in stride, made side diversions when asked, and even set us about on a 45 minute hike of Cape Point/Cape of Good Hope. There's no BS with Yolanda. She is a straight-at-you, lets have a good time, talk politics/economics/religion/sports kind of gal, and all in all is pretty awesome. Actually, the entire PG Tops group is an absolute pleasure to deal with. I booked the tour direct with PG Tops and stayed in regular communication with Pieter straight through the tour of Cape Point, and even through his recommendations for dinner and wineries. Absolutely recommended without reservation - you cannot go wrong with PG Tops.

Thank you PG Tops! :). There are tour guides who simply tell you the facts about the city, and then there are those who go the extra mile in providing personalized service. Our tour guide Roelof, aside from being knowledgeable, also paid close attention to our questions and comments during the tour...though it was outside the scope of our itinerary, he made sure we got to try "Biltong", secured a booking for us at a sought after seafood restaurant, introduced us to Afrikaans music, and got us special souvenirs at the end of the tour. We felt that we were given a unique Cape Town experience truly tailored to our preferences. For that, thank you very much Roelof and PG Tops! :)

Brilliant!!. Had a short break in Cape Town before joining a cruise home. We had so many things that we wanted to do, but it didn't seem possible in the two and a half days available before we had to leave. We need not of worried, PG Tops pulled out all the stops to ensure we got all we wanted to do in, and we never felt like we rushed or had missed something. They took care of everything, including transfers from the airport on arrival, and to the port for our departure. Our guides, Rudy and Nicole made the whole experience never to be forgotten. Their knowledge and enthusiasm shone through, and coupled with their warmth and attention to detail ensured we made the most of the short time we had in CT. We would never have been able to do what we did without your help, so a big thanks to you and all the PG Tops team we didn't get to meet. Eddie & Beverley. UK.

Fantastic tour of the So. African Peninsula!!. Thanks to PG Tops and to our driver/tour guide Rudy, for making our trip to So. Africa so great! Rudy picked us up on time and was incredibly friendly, offering information on the area, places to go and made sure that we had ample opportunities to capture the beautiful So. Africa landscape.If you are going to SA for the first time and are looking for an excursion company, these guys are awesome! Thanks!-John and Alice, USA

Outstanding Service & Warmth. I cannot recommend PG Tops highly enough. I emailed Pieter with very short notice and nothing was too much trouble. Rolf collected my mother and I in an impeccably clean BMW, what a treat and whisked us up to Table Top Mountain for the first cable car at 8.00 am. We were lucky to have a beautifully clear day. What a view, it was very fresh, my mother thought chilly, so make sure you wear layers and take a scarf.We then set off to Stellenbosch to visit the wineries Ernie Els gets a big tick, lunch at Delaire Graff gets a big tick and the tasting at Rustenberg, although the wines were delicious, particularly their Cabernet, the service was not a patch on the Ernie Els experience. This was a recommendation from PG Tops and an experience not to be missed. We wished we'd had time to return for their cheese platter in the late afternoon paired with their delicious Shiraz or Big Easy Bordeaux blend - next time! What was nice about the tour was it was designed for 'us', compared to being in a large group getting on and off a shuttle bus or SUV. If we wanted to stay longer somewhere, or stop along the way we could. Rolf our driver was telling us, that the onwer, Pieter's philosophy is to provide the guests with a memorable experience, in order to do that Rolf called himself a 'knowledgeable driver', he knew the answers to most of our questions, and pointed out sites along the way.It was a long day for us from 7.30 am to 6.00 pm, and although we didn't have the time to spend walking the streets of Franschoek at the end of our day, Rolf made sure he drove past the sites and pointed things out for us to experience next time.Pieter and Rolf, thank you, as you know I have already recommended you to friends who have also toured with you in Apirl, and they are also recommending you to their friends.So, until we meet again.Thank you.Michelle & SonjaMargaret River & Mandurah (Western Australia)Travelled April 2013

Wonderful Full-day Cape Tour. We booked a full-day cape tour and were very pleased! Donovan was our driver and was so friendly, knowledgeable, flexible, and down-to-earth. He told us so many interesting things about the area. He seemed genuinely interested in us and really listened to our requests, while making good suggestions based on his experience. He was very flexible about dropping in "unscheduled" places. We had plenty of time to explore at all of our stops. Though it was a very windy, overcast day with a little bit of rain, we made the most of it and saw everything we wanted to despite the weather. A very memorable day for our family of 4 (2 parents and 2 children age 17 and 21.)

Excellent Service. Was recommended PG Tops and turned out to be great choice. Picked us up at airport to take us to hotel in Camps Bay. Booked them to take us to Cape of Good Hope for day trip and then booked them to take us from Camps Bay to hotel in Stellenbosch where we were attending a wedding. First class in all aspects. Trip to the Cape was just an amazing day out and Rolfe a terrific host and driver whose knowledge and patience was terrific. Ruddy(?) who picked us up at airport and took us to Stellenbosch was also a friendly and courteous host. Would highly recommend then to anyone looking for a first class service.

Amazing Capetown Tour Company. My husband and I recently spent 2 wonderful days with Roelf in Capetown doing a winelands tour and the Cape Point tour and couldn't have been happier with PG Tops. From the get go, Pieter was a huge help in assisting us with planning our SA honeymoon and Roelf was an excellent tour guide, giving us a very special experience. The winelands tour was great and he even surprised us with a bonus chocolate tasting and beer tasting. We had an incredible picnic lunch at Hartenberg, which remains one of the top highlights of our honeymoon and great wine tastings at Warwick, Fairview and Grande Provence. The Cape Point tour was excellent and Roelf again provided us with a very personal, comfortable and fun day exploring the small fishing villages along the route to the Cape Point, the penguins at Boulders Beach and sending us on our way for a fun hike to the point, where he met us at the top with some much needed water bottles. :)After two amazing days, we decided to add on a township tour with Godfrey who was another great tour guide. Incredibly knowledgable about the history of Capetown and the Langa township that we visited. A HUGE thank you to PG Tops for giving us such memorable experiences in your beautiful city. We would recommend PG Tops to anyone traveling to Capetown.

A Great Day, Thanks to PG tops!. I had only 48 hours to explore the highlights of Cape town and thanks to Pieter he was able to accommodate and arrange for full day tour to Cape Point within a very short notice period. I was lucky to have Yolanda as my tour guide that day. With her passion to Cape town and her job i had a wonderful experience in this beautiful city. Definitely recommend PG tours and i look forward to my next visit to Cape town.

Excellent time in CT thanks to PG Tops. We spent several days in CT touring with Pieter and his great team. We visited several wineries, the Biscuit Mill (a famous food market), went paragliding, shark diving, did a full tour of the Cape Peninsula as well as a tour of District 6 and the townships. The guides were also happy to accommodate our requests from asking where we can buy snowball souvenirs on our way to the airport to finding out which bars are best suited for drinks while watching kites surfers. Pieter, the owner of the company, was happy cutting short his day off and coming to get us on a 15 minute notice to visit the Cheetahs. For the townships, our tour guide was from the township and his tour gave us a great insight on how life in the townships are. Roelf took us to a visit of the Cape Peninsula as well as to a full day tour of the wineries and is very pleasant and knowledgeable. Overall, the staff is also responsive, always on time, in a good mood and have answers to all our questions. They are flexible and happy to change the schedule even at the last minute. We would highly recommend PG tops. Our experience in CT would not have been the same without them.

Two great days of adventure. We arrived in Cape Town after a couple of weeks of lots of driving down the East Coast, and not a huge amount of exercise. Thankfully, Pieter was just the man to get our hearts pumping and legs burning! Our first afternoon with him had us hiking up Table Mountain on one of its more strenuous routes. Whenever we did take a break, Pieter and Roelf were excellent raconteurs, telling tall tales about the history of their great city. They timed the hike so that we arrived at the top close to sunset - as it was a clear day, the views were simply incredible.On our second day with PG Tops, we spent the morning downhill mountain biking both in Tokai Forest, and from the top of Chapman's Peak. We then did our best to replenish spent calories at a local eatery - mission accomplished!We were very impressed with how PG Tops catered to our specific needs - it's obvious that they possess a wide body of knowledge about the area, and that they truly enjoy delivering top-class service. Thanks again.

Excellent Garden Route Tour!. I first discovered PG Tops from some research I did on TripAdvisor's website, and I now know first-hand that the rave reviews I read were entirely accurate! I contacted PG Tops to arrange a tour of the Garden Route for me and a good friend of mine and Pieter, the owner of PG Tops, worked with me (mostly via email) to plan what turned out to be a fabulous 6-night adventure along South Africa's beautiful Garden Route. Pieter was our guide for the entire trip and was fun, energetic, and extremely knowledgeable about the region and all things South Africa. He is extremely passionate about his country and showing his guests a great time. Some memorable highlights included an early morning bike ride near Cape Agulhas (southern tip of Africa), canoeing in an area known as Wilderness (with a picnic breakfast at a lovely waterfall), a scenic walk to the Knysna Heads, hanging out at Afrovibe Backpackers, and visiting Tsitsikamma National Park. Also, I must mention that Pieter and his team were a great resource in helping us plan our time in Cape Town and recommending some great day trips -- Cape Point & Peninsula Tour; and a visit to the winelands. PG Tops is a top notch company & I would definitely recommend them to anyone visiting Cape Town or the surrounding areas!

Highly Recommended. Very responsive company with great tour options. The whole family enjoyed it. Roelf did a superb job and was very knowledgeable about the area. Always on time, comfortable vehicle, flexible schedule if the weather demands it. Overall, a wonderful experience.

YOLO!. My friends and I were in South Africa for another friend's wedding and wanted to make the most of it and do everything that we could during our short stay. On everyone's first day we planned a tour of the winelands with PG Tours and let me tell you this was the best decision we made! Our tour guide, Yolanda, was the best! She was extremely friendly and knowledgeable of the winelands. We visited some of the best wineries/vineyards I have ever experiences. Through the duration of our trip, Yolanda became more that a guide to us, she became a friend. We were all so sad for the day to come to an end. My friends and I are so grateful to have met Yolanda (Yolo) on our trip. Book PG Tours and Ask for Yolanda!!!

Reliable. We were glad Roelf from PG Tops took care all our tours and transfers when we were in CPT. The itinerary was discussed with us in advance (including booking of restaurants) but Roelf remained very flexible to any changes when asked during the tours. He is highly knowledgeable about South Africa and always prepare to inform/answer and never forget to greet and smile. We found Roelf neat, punctual and organise. The vehicle (Toyota Quantum) provided was clean, tidy and adequate, bottle drinks were provided during the tour. All seats come with seatbelt and the vehicle was equipped with microphone and speakers, all of us can hear Roelf very clearly while he was driving and that, road safety was not compromised. Prior to the trip, we communicated with a few tour agents but found that not only Roelf was responsive but the rate quoted was very reasonable and questions were answered diligently and sensibly. Overall, we, old and young in the group, found comfort in touring with Roelf. Thank you Roelf!p/s: We also found that Lawhill is an excellent place to stay and they have great team to take care of guest too!

3 Perfect Days in Cape Town (With PG Tops). Ever flown United Airlines and read one of those articles in the "3 Perfect Days in ..." series? Well, we had one of those experiences with PG Tops in Cape Town. We arrived in CPT at 8am on a Friday and flew out at at 3 pm on Sunday. We were met at the airport and this was our itinerary: Friday a.m.: Langa black Township, including lunch in the township; Fri pm: Table Mountain with gondola ride; Sat all day: Cape tour, including tour of beaches, headlands, lighthouse and the penguin colony; Sunday am: Winelands tour with visits to wineries and lunch.We became instant best friends with Pieter at the airport and had a great time. Erica was our guide on the weekend and was perfect. We have already encouraged friends to visit Cape Town and to hook up with PG Tops. Thanks guys!

Completely Impressed!. I was in South Africa with a friend for just a few short days and while there, wanted to capitalize on our time. PG Tops Tours offered some incredible options to touring and exploring the country. I'm glad we did 2 days of tours with PG Tops - Cape Point on day 1 and Winelands on day 2. The Cape Point tour consisted seeing the Cape of Good Hope, Penguins!, Jubilee Square, feeding ostriches, and driving through beautiful towns. We had Roelf as our tour guide that day, and had an incredible time with him. Very knowledgeable and customer service oriented. The Winelands tour consisted of seeing the South African wine country and stopping at a number of wineries. Tony was our tour guide this day, and was great. We visited 3 wineries, including a stop for lunch, and relaxed in the countryside! Overall, both Roelf and Tony made our experience a wonderful one. Will definitely return to this beautiful country!

If there's one thing you do in South Africa.... Take a PG Tops Tour!After spending 3 months in the East African bush, I was really looking forward to an adventure down in South Africa. A friend highly recommended getting in touch with Pieter at PG Tops Tours and boy, did they exceed expectations!I'm not one much for tours (much prefer exploring on my own), but PG Tops doesn't even count as one...it's more like an experience where you hang out with some really cool people who are highly professional, attentive, and well-informed about beautiful South Africa.We took two tours - one with Roelof (Cape Point) and one with Tony (Winelands). Cape Point was stunning and made even more enjoyable by Roelof's awesome company. At one point, he ended up teaching my friend how to longarm dance alongside the road in Stellenbosch! Talk about a memory! Tony was also incredible during the Winelands tour. He was up for fun and really focused on showing us a great time. Tony taught us how to taste wine (typically I'm just good at drinking, so great learning!) and also took us to pet some baby cheetahs (I was a scare-dy cat at first, but Tony helped us muster the courage).We were lucky to meet both of these great guys!I'm totally impressed by PG Tops and plan to see them again the next time I'm down in South Africa! Best tour ever.

YOLO!. My friends and I came to Cape Town for a wedding and decided to do a wine tour before the festivities commenced. Little did we know this wine tour was going to be the best ever! Yolonda was extremely nice and took to us immediately. She was warm, funny, and obviously knew a lot about wine and South Africa. We received more than just information on wine, we had a South Africa history lesson and we LOVED it! I enjoyed going to the different wineries and even taking a bit of a detour for market shopping. Yolonda really made this wine tour special for my friends and I. It set the tone for the rest of our trip and we could not stop talking about how great it was. We were all sad to depart at the end of the journey. Yolonda and this wine tour will definitely be a part of our South Africa stories for years to come. I recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Cape Town...and make sure you request Yolonda, she's amazing!

AMAZING!!!. I have recently come back from South Africa and spent a week with Roelf and Tony showing us the sites of Cape Town, they were always on time, helpful, polite and did such an incredible job and most of all I had an absolute blast with them! Every question answered that we wanted to know about the city and even at 5am pick ups Roelf was extremely accomodating and friendly. We went shark diving, Robben Island, Table Moutain, 3 wine tours and Cape Point. I can't speak highly enough of this company and have already recommended to a friend who will be booking a trip next year after my rave review. Thank you so much everyone at PG Tops I had the best time and will be back very soon :)

These guy's are the best!. I've just come back from a trip to CT where our group of seven was incredibly lucky to be shown around by PG Tops tours - and let me tell you they live up to their name!We did Shark diving, Cape Point, Table Mountain, Winelands and various transfers and all were fantastic! The whole team at PG Tops from Pieter who owns the company and was amazing at helping us to plan our trips with great advice and patience to Yolanda who stayed in touch from the office with confirmations etc and Roelf and Tony who took us out on our tours. They are knowledgable and informative while also being great fun and completely flexable and real value for money. I've done all of these tours in CT before so I have something to compare against and they really are in my opinion the best - to not use them would really be your loss! I'll be reccomending them to anyone I know going out to CT and will definatley be calling them again the next time I'm in town. Thanks guy's - we had a ball!

Capetown Drive. Pieter and Tony drove us all over for two days. They were prompt, informative, very polite and great fun to be with during our stay. It gave us a chance to see South Africa through their eyes and see animals and Signal and Table Mountain and an enjoyable wine tour, and lunch at Two Oceans.. We even were able to fit in a trip to La Columbe!! Thanks to them both we had a great trip!!

excellent service in the Cape. My folks and my husband and I have Just spent a week in Cape town and used PG TOPS for all our transfers and also booked a fabulous wine tour with them too., Roelof took care of us for the week he was awesome always on time, very easy going and chatty with lots of interesting facts to tell us.Thanks heaps guys for making our Cape experience so relaxing and easy. I highly recommend using these guys.shauna

I will take it to my grave!. My friend and I spent two days touring with Tony while in Cape Town. We had planned to do a Peninsula tour the first half-day, followed by a half-day winelands tour the next day. We had anticipated a relaxing, sedate, pleasant tour of the area, but what we got was so much more! Tony picked us up around 8 am on the first day, and drove us down the coast, stopping at a few popular tourist destinations, but focusing on more interesting and less well-known spots. We saw so many beautiful places along the way, including Clifton Bay, Chapman's Point, Long Beach, Buffel's Bay, and of course the Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point. We had a wonderful sushi lunch at the restaurant at Cape Point, overlooking the sea. Saw the penguins and a few other cute little coastal towns along the way. Tony was a knowledgeable, fun, energetic guide, and the conversation flowed easily for the many hours we spent in the van. It quickly became apparent what one of his passions was, shark cage diving. We discussed it for quite some time, and decided that we absolutely had to do this instead of driving around the winelands. Tony contacted Pieter and we were able to set it up for the following day. We appreciated the flexibility and were very excited for our new adventure. Tony picked us up at 4 am the next morning and we set off for the 2.5 hour or so drive to Gansbaai. By this time, we were laughing and talking like old friends, so we enjoyed the drive and the sunrise over the mountains was beautiful. The shark cage diving excursion was booked with Marine Dynamics. We really liked this company because of their focus on education, conservation, and research. Several volunteers and researchers were on board, and much of the company's profits go toward those ends. This was truly an amazing experience! We rode about 15-20 minutes out in very rough waters, until we reached shark alley. I will review the excursion separately, but I will just say that we had several close encounters with GIANT great whites, saw several southern right whales, and Geyser island, which is referred to as "seal island" or "McDonald's" for sharks... This was one of the highlights of our entire trip, one that we will never forget!After warming up from our time on the boat, Tony took us on a mini-wine tour, and we had lunch at Creation winery. The tasting menu was OK. Some of the canapes were a bit dry and the service was not great, but the wine was exceptional and the company enjoyable.We highly recommend PG Tops, particularly Tony. We felt like we got an insider's tour of the peninsula and VIP treatment on the shark cage dive. We passed giant tour buses full of tourists, and were so thankful that we had our own personal guide rather than a canned, scripted tour of the area with 50 other people.

PG is Tops. Penguins and Peninsular tour with Pieter was more than just a fun day. Pieter is knowledgeable, funny and personable; as a tour guide you couldn't ask for better. He gives you all the information you need/want and delivers it with a big smile and an infectious laugh and always has another joke to tell. Not only did Pieter give us a good history and overview of Cape Town and how it was established and grew but he also gave us a lot of insight into culture and social history of the people. He asked us questions to find out where our interest and knowledge lay and tailored the information to our interest. Pieter also organised the stops and route he took us taking into account where and when the large tour bus groups would likely be, and therefore we avoided long queues and obscured views! His recommendation for a lunch stop was spot on and we enjoyed good food with a beautiful view and great company.From start to finish the day was fun and I highly recommend PG Tops - you won't regret it.

Great experience in Capetown. We were totally satisfied with pgtops! Our guide, Yolanda was very energetic and flexible person. We enjoyed her guiding. What is more, she knows every good place to eat along the way. We enjoyed great meals at Capepoint and wine lands . We would contact her again if we go back to the city again.

Tops in Tours is PG Tops. Used PG Tops tours for airport pick up and drop off sevice from CPT. Then scheduled two full-day tours with Yolanda to Winelands and Cape Point. Fantastic service with personalized attention to your interests. Yolanda is not only informative and interesting, but also entertaining - she is like traveling with a good friend. Her winery choices were excellent as were her chosen stops on the Cape Point tour. Highly recommend PG Tops! Robert & Ingrid, Gig Harbor, WA USA.

Our tours of Cape Town with PG Tops. The six of us (including four 20+ year olds) just returned from South Africa and had an extraordinary experience with PG Tops tours of Cape Town and the surrounding area. Pieter (our tour guide) was highly informative, easily kept our interest for the entire trip, and was able to relate to everyone in our group, but particularly to the 20+ year olds who had never been to Cape Town before. His knowledge is exceptional, which is often true of guides, but most importantly, he was able to make the trip a highly personalized experience for each person in our group. His colleague, Godfrey, who took us on a township tour of Langa was also extraordinary. We would all highly recommend both of them to any family that is travelling to South Africa.

Spectacular. Cannot say enough good things about Pieter, we spent two days with him on a guided tour of Cape Town and the surrounding areas, and each day was jam-packed with wonderful adventures! Pieter was a breeze to deal with and so flexible, we got his name from a coworker only a few days before we were heading to CT and luckily he had space for us, so a few emails later we were all sorted. We spent a wonderful day in wine country and one doing the peninsula drive, and I can't imagine how they could've been better. His knowledge of the area is top notch, but what really made this trip such a pleasure is his attention to detail and getting all the small things right. He struck a great balance of giving us some options on stuff to do, but without making it seem like we were doing all the work, and he was flexible as our plans changed (or the weather) so we always had something on tap next. The most important thing is that he's just a great guy, someone you will enjoy spending time with (as are his colleagues I'm sure) and I have a lot of respect for the fact that he just started this business up himself and cares so deeply about it. Highest compliment I can give is that I never felt over the course of two days like we were on a guided tour, it truly felt like we had a friend in town who was showing us around. Great job Pieter, thanks for all the great memories, and we hope to see you on another trip to CT soon!Mike&Alison

Excellent!!. Pieter and his team are absolutely wonderful and made our trip to South Africa one of the most memorable experiences of my life! Each and every one of the guides I met were charismatic, funny and knowledgeable. I visited Cape Town with my boyfriend and his family for a brief but wonderful 3 days. Roelof picked us up from the airport and was such a breath of fresh air after the grueling trip from the States. Godfrey took us on a township tour in Langa the next day which was a truly life changing experience. The third day we met Pieter for a dramatic car trip down the coast to the Cape of Good Hope. Pieter is intelligent, fun, and can always be counted on to tell a Chuck Norris joke or five :) Ask him to play some South African pop music for you... I promise you won't be disappointed! I give PG Tops my highest recommendation and hope to travel with them again in the future!

Flawless!!. On a scale of 1 to 10 I’d give PG Tops Tours a 12! From the immediate response to my email inquiry (by Pieter who was actually on a mountain in the middle of a hike) right down to the end of our 2 days of touring with our guide, Roelf, PG demonstrated professionalism while providing top-notch service. We are 3 young professionals from Canada working in Johannesburg for 2 months and thus we only had one long weekend to spend in Cape Town. Not only was PG tours able to provide us with a private tour (in a swanky BMW) which hit all the spots on our must-see lists but as Roelf got to know us he made recommendations for additional stops which he thought we would enjoy. Our guide was fully prepared with contact information for all the tourist hot spots (and a number of local places too) to ensure that our tour was flawless. Roelf was extremely knowledgeable about pretty much everything and he was fun to hang out with as well! By the end of our tour we definitely felt as though we had made a new friend. I would definitely recommend PG tours for anyone visiting Cape Town – I know I’ll be calling them next time I come back!

Highly recommended!. Look no further than PG tours! When my 26-year old son and I travelled to Cape Town (we stayed for 3 nights before going on safari) PG coordinated everything, and absolutely flawlessly. Prior to our arrival, I contacted them and every question (there were a lot) were answered promptly and fully. They even arranged a ½ day sandboaring tour for my son with a reputable adventure company.We took the all day Cape Point tour as well as the ½ day wine tasting. Both private tours were guided by Yolanda who was both informative and an absolute pleasure to be around. Her knowledge and friendly demeanor really made our time in Cape Town. The cars were very comfortable and Yolanda made us feel really welcomed. She tirelessly stopped at every photo spot and took some wonderful pictures for us. She even made hard-to get reservations at the famous La Petite Ferme restaurant and it was wonderful! In summary, PG Tours did a wonderful job and really seemed to go above and beyond to make sure that we had the best experience possible, and we did! Both of us would highly recommend them.

PG TOPS IS THE BEST. Honestly, look no further ---> PG TOPS will meet all and your every needs! Promise. Our family of four was booked with these great guides for about six days and wow, what a fabulous and memorable six days! We covered all of the ins and outs of Cape Town and even traveled to the wine country and Hermanus for a great-white cage dive! The guides are not only young, entertaining, and pleasant to be around but they are also informative and patient! Seriously, stop reading all these little reviews and just hit them up right now!

best tourguide ever. I was in Cape Town for a week with a couple of friends, and we used the PG Tops for a couple different excursions: the Cape Point tour, as well as wine tasting. Both were professionally run and a whole lot of fun. 5 stars for the best tour guide ever: Roelf. Ask for him by name.

Fantastic tour company. I was in Cape Town for a wedding and followed it up with a safari in Kruger. The PG Tops staff were superb lining up airport pickups, day trips and hikes. They helped us navigate the multitude of shark tours, heli tours and even brought us along for a sunrise hike up Lions Head. Most importantly, they helped us select our safari lodge (Sabi Sabi) which was a unique once in a lifetime trip. All the while, we got the sense that we were their guests, not their clients.If you are in SA, you won't be disapointed to work with them.

Great South African Tour. Our family had a great tour with PG Tops and Pieter in early June. We went to the winelands for two days and he showed us how terrific South African wines were, picked out excellent restaurants featuring local cuisine, did the Peninsula and the Cape of Good Hope. Table Mountain and Capetown were on the list too. Pieter was very informative, patient and fun to have as our guide. Very glad he was our guide. We would highly recommend PG Tops!Bill L.
The best Cape Town tours and a great team!. Just coming back from CT, this trip is a must! If you are looking for the best don't hesitate to contact PG TOPS!!!!!

Wonderful Experiences!!. We booked PG Tops for 2 full days and Roelf was our host. The first day we did the Cape/Peninsula tour and we were not only amazed by the sheer beauty of the place but were equally thrilled by the hospitality and fun element in Roelf. The first day when we decided to hike down, he joined us and helped me so much that I dont think I would have been able to mange it myself. He was there at each step to guide me and help me with the most difficult part of the terrain.. Amazing experience..Whether it was a detour to do the cricket stadium which my son so wanted to do, or making booking bookings at Boulders, he was very efficient...Next day, it was winelands and again the tour was customised to meet just our requirements!!A chocolate tasting for my son and best wine tours for us..Lastly, the icing on cake was some very fun songs that he played and sang for us on our way back.. We laughed a lot with him both of the days..Roelf, thanks for making our tours so special.. We really appreciate it and will remember it.. The chocolate song is amazing too..Please go and watch 'Zindagi na milegi Dobara', the film that we talked about.Specail thanks for table mountain : )Do well!!

The best Cape Town Tours. We have arrived home from a trip to South Africa. One of the places we visited there was Cape Town. Roelf was our host. Sincerally, we enjoyed a lot our trip to Cape Town because I am pretty sure that he had the best tour company and our guide Roelf, he just was excellent. He took us to a lot of places on a same day. He was knowledgeable, very kind and very friendly. Moreover, he made us feel like at home, like if we were visiting our own friends, and we felt very happy and confortable with the 2 day tour. I greatly recommed PG Tops Travel as your tour company. I am pretty sure you would never be disappointed. I wil give them ten stars out of them. Thank you guys for making our visit to Cape Town the best of the best!!!

Wonderful people!! We recommend them without hesitation.. We just arrived from a trip to Cape Town where we had Yolanda and Pieter for hosts. They were the nicest people, full of enthusiasm for their city and its surroundings; so much so that we all ended up wanting to move to Cape Town. They were super knowledgeable and friendly and we felt that we were visiting old friends. We recommend them. We are sure that you will not be disappointed.

Great way to see Cape Town. My partner and I booked Pieter (PG Tops) for a full day tour of Cape Town as a way of seeing the most sights in the short time that we had in Cape Town but also to have a knowledgeable guide. Pieter filled both of these roles! A great start for me was the addition of a coolbox with water and a couple of cans of beer for the journey! This was undertaken in a spacious air conditioned van and as it was just me and my partner, we had plenty of space to enjoy!The tour itself covered everything we wanted to see from the natural wonders of Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, the penguins and Boulders Beach to the markets and shops in Simonstown and of course the vineyard tours. A very well rounded tour covering everything that we wanted to do with a good variety to stop us getting bored. We felt relaxed and not hurried but also able to make our own decisions about how we wanted the day to go, with tips and suggestions from Pieter. Finally to add that a big part for us booking with Pieter was the speed of his responses to emails and also the Website appearance. Both very professional. The website is informative but also lends a bit of fun to the tours and services offered. One evening in the UK I sent an email at about 1830 UK time (1930 in SA) which was responded to within about 30-40 minutes. I was not expecting anything until the next day but to have the answers straight away just made it one less thing to do before the holiday. Great service, informative, non intrusive and good fun, highly recommended.

PG Tops - the only way to go. Initially, my group had booked PG Tops for airport transfer from Cape Town to the Waterfront. Yolande was there to meet us off the flight and was so friendly, welcoming and professional that we booked her for two one-day private tours - to Cape Point and to the Winelands.  On both occasions, Yolande was punctual, fun to be with and a mine of information. Importantly, too, the mini bus was clean and well-maintained.  PG Tops is a small company with the personal touch. An advantage of this is that staff can really get to know their clients and flexibility can be built into trips to suit the needs and interests of those travelling. This is a feature usually lacking with larger tour companies who are tied to rigid schedules.  We will most definitely be booking this company again.

Tops for Tours. My husband and I travelled to Cape Town with 4 of our friends. Yolanda picked us up from the airport and was kind, helpful and very professional. The 6 of us booked Yolanda for 2 tours and made our days out very enjoyable and on very friendly terms - just like old friends. Hopefully, in the future, we will travel to Cape Town again and would most certainly use PG Tops for any trips we may want to do. Thank you so much Yolanda for all your help and kindness.

Private Tour - the only way to go!. Earlier this month, several forty-something friends and I travelled to Cape Town looking for fun and adventure. Our goal was to visit as many “must see” sites while having some down time to simply enjoy the environment. We rented apartments on the V&A Waterfront, which put us in a prime location for visiting the shops and fabulous restaurants. We were also in close proximity to the convention center which was hosting the Annual Cape Town International Jazzfest - it was fabulous. With that said, we feel as though we made some really good choices. But I must add that selecting PG Tops and staff was our best choice by far. The owner, Pieter Geldenhuys, worked with us to build a two-day itinerary that not only kept us on budget, but covered the "must sees" we requested. For example, my group visited Table Mountain with the opportunity to ride the cable cars up the mountain, District 6 Museum which provides in-depth information on South African apartheid, as well as a 2-hour walking tour of a township, meeting the people, talking to students and witnessing everyday life. The tour concluded with an authentic African meal at a local restaurant – what a surprise! We even had our own private entertainment. Great day!!! And big shoutout to Godfrey, our tour guide for the day. Godfrey speaks with an innate knowledge of the area, the people, and the mix of cultures. He is a kind man with expert familiarity. We could not have asked for more - thanks Godfrey! Also, special shoutout to Roelf who guided us on our Day 2 safari. Again, you can make your tour as adventurous as you dare - Pieter will make it happen. I strongly recommend PG Tops for all your tour needs. It is especially convenient to have their door-to-door pickup service along with the overall feeling of safety and comfort.Thanks Everyone!

"PG Tops" is Tops in Tours. My sweetheart and I visited Botswana and South Africa 4 years ago. One of the highlights of the trip -- and of our relationship -- was a day spent touring the Cape of Good Hope Peninsula (and other Cape Town Sites) with Pieter Geldenhuys, Owner of PG Tops. The weather was rainy, but it made no difference -- the scenery was stunning and dramatic. Even better was the running commentary from Pieter -- which included a highly knowledgeable history of South Africa. Four years later, we are still in touch with him -- and got to talk to him today as he helped us (remotely) buy some beaded animal heads at an outdoor market in Cape Town. If you are looking for tours of the wine country, Cape Town, the Peninsula -- or attending rugby matches (with, we understand, outstanding tailgating) -- you cannot do better then Pieter.

Top 5 Reasons that Pieter if the Best Tour Guide in Cape Town. (1) Pieter knows more Capetonians than the mayor of Cape Town.(2) Visiting wineries before 10am is accepted and encouraged--ten in two days is recommended!(3) He will take you hiking, climbing, sight seeing, shopping, penguin-watching, wine tasting and gourmet dining all in the same day.(4) He takes great photos, especially photos of jumping in the air!(5) By the end of your trip, Pieter will be more of a friend than a guide.

The best way to spend any day!. I travelled to South Africa for my brother in laws 40th birthday for a long weekend and we had our heart set on doing some deep sea fishing off Cape Point but as often is the case the sea was too rough for us to go out and we didnt fancy spending four hours feeling ill!
