Great Tour. A good mix of knowledge and letting you roam free and wander. I highly recommend this tour even if you are someone who normally does not like having a tour guide.
Awesome trip. We did the cape point tour and it was amazing. Ziggy is very kind and made our visit to Cape Town even better!!
awesome tour. thanks brendon for such an amazing and interesting tour.i loved it, really enjoyed the day☺️also the food was very good, so thanks to bouth of you for the great time i had in capetown☺️

Best day tour in Cape Town!. We had such an amazing day with Lucky and Lost. This day tour is probably the most varied one you can get: culture, nature, wildlife, hikes and amazing view points, good food and a wine tasting, all in just one day!Brendan is a fantastic guide: he told a lot of interesting things, but he also gave us the time to walk around at every stop at our own pace. No rush on this tour!I loved the South African music playing in the car when we were driving through all those beautiful landscapes of Cape of Good Hope.The lunch we had was delicious and is in itself a reason to do this tour.If you want a day trip that is different than a thousand other day trips that are offered in Cape Town, you've come to the right place.Highly recommended!

Fantastic day tour. The tour was terrific. Brendan our guide for the day knowledgeable & easy going. Lunch was a Cape Malay curry made by his gf Ziggy alrhough Brendan cut up the veges ☺ was delicious. The walk at The Point up to the old lighthouse was picturesque & the walk along the ocean breathtaking. Had the best day l'd do it again & recommend it to anyone!! Thank you Brendan

Excellent tour. This tour is one of the best I have been on. Our guide Brendon was really knowledgeable and took the time to answer any questions. We saw penguins, and other wildlife, did some wine tasting and learnt a lot about Cape Town. Thank you for the awesome day!!
A great day of fun. Love our day out and the guide was very knowledgeable and dynamic! Would domit again, no doubt.Thanks Ziggy!

Fun and friendly. Ziggy and Brendan are wonderful tour guides. They are passionate about their home country and will tell you lots of interesting stories about the different places you'll stop. The lunch they made us was delicious and we had the most beautiful picnic spot. Highly recommend this tour!!
Awesome tour. Lots of stops, interesting stories and something for everyone. I would highly recommend this tour. It was a great day.
Funky Van & Pinguins. Never visited the Cape and looking for good people to drive and show you around?Don't look further and book a tour with Funky Ziggy and Brendan Big Man!A good time assured...

Fun day out. Ziggy/Ziggie is a legend. Really nice and funny. There isn't lots of driving and you get to see a fair few of the many highlights Cape Town has to offer.Really good value for money, would highly recommend.

Amazing tour!. We had so much fun on our tour with Ziggy and Brandon! They are super friendly and explained to us many interesting things about Cape Town and its history! We saw many cool places such as Bo Kaap, Chapman's Peak, Boulders beach with the lovely penguins, Cape Point and a breathtaking walk to Cape of Good Hope, Wine Tasting which was our last stop.. awesome!! The lunch was super delicious and the company very nice! I would definitely recommend it to everyone because they are really cool and there's a good vibe!! Don't miss the ice-cream/sorbet in Simon's Town.. ask Ziggy! :)

Cape Town Essential. Had such a great day with Brendan as our tour guide. The tour is a great if you are looking for a more intimate experience seeing as tour group sizes are smaller than others. Brendan had a good playlist of South African music. The highlights of the day for myself were seeing the Penguins, wine tasting and Chapmans Peak drive. Some parts of the day felt a little rushed but we did fit a lot into one day and one tour. Always great to be shown around by a local. Thanks again!

This a must do tour. As a solo traveler met a lot of awesome people through this tour who I continued to stay in contact with. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It's a smaller tour so I'd book with them as soon as possible. Ziggy and Brenden are amazing people, backpackers and just make the experience what it is. Trust me, you won't regret it. Thanks you guys. -Adam from Cleveland

So much fun!. The tour covered great locations and the couple that run the tour are incredibly nice and welcoming. They give you a much less 'tourist' version of the tour and a more relaxed, version of how they would see South Africa. Highly recommend.

Peninsula Tour of the Cape. Beautifully organised tour was a highlight of our stay in Cape Town. Brendan and Ziggy were wonderful hosts and guarantee a fun, friendly and exciting day out! Couldn't more highly recommend them! If a Pennsiula tour is on your 'to do' list make sure you book lucky and lost tours. Kind Regards, Dom

Fab tour. We had a great day. Ziggy and Brandon were fantastic hosts, very knowledgable about their home town. Picked up on time great lunch and local snacks. Beautiful coastal walk, and wine tasting at a vineyard with stunning view

Not just a "tour". As themselves said, this couple were bored of standard tours when they were traveling... so they just wanted to make a different experience to let you know the southafrican culture and lifestyle. If you are not looking for what everybody does, just try this guys! Cool & nice well travelled people, they'll become friends.

Really enjoyable. Lucky and Lost is a great way to explore Cape Town at its most South African! Brendan was our guide and, even though it was his first time leading a tour, was really knowledgeable, welcoming, and fun to be around. We were taken to many of the best spots along the peninsula, treated to a homemade South African style lunch, informed about the history and myths along the different stops, and listened to South African music while on the bus.The small groups make for a much more personal experience and you really feel comfortable. I would definitely recommend them as one of the best ways to see a lot in one day!

Awesome !!!. Really cool and diferent tour. The mood is like you had friends fron South Africa showing you proudly how they're country is. All the stops worth it and Brendan did a great job with us. The spots were amazing .. really a great great tour!
Lucky and lost tour cape town. Very enthusiastic en good guide. They take you to nice places. They don't stay too long by places as you can see by other tours. Good vibe.
A Must-Take Tour. Absolutely amazing! The highlight of my Cape Town week. Ziggy puts in such love and compassion on her tours and you feed off of that energy to have an unforgettable day.

A perfect day tour of Cape Town and surrondings. Lucky and Lost Tours guides Ziggy and Brendan really made this day trip into one perfect day!This young and energetic couple are born and raised in Cape Town and have travelled the world so they know thier stuff and what it takes to make a great day tour of it. They obviously love their city and will gomto great lenghts to share it with you. Our group of backpackers blended really well during a day trip thanks to personal attention from our guides and their talent to connect with people. Playing a great mix of South African pop rock music in the background, sharing their positive energy and giving us personal attention all the time. I could go on like this forever but I'll keep it short and no nonsense instead. To experience this you need to do it. Thumbs up to these honest young people, well done!!!

Best Tour EVER!. I've done many guided tours in many countries and this was hands down the best! Ziggy and Brendan are awesome guides - fun, knowledgeable and chilled - and the whole day felt like I was on a mission with my best mates. The sites we saw were varied and beautiful, the home cooked meal was the business and the local tunes playing were top notch. Highly recommended for anyone wanting something different from the usual boring guided tour with a bunch of randoms!

less tourists, more cape = awesome day out. These two really know the cape. Back roads, delicious food and wine, seeing the sights, and getting (nearly) lost in out of the way places that only the locals know. Do yourself a favour and go and see the Cape with them.. what a exhilarating day out!

Absolutely fantastic Cape tour. My buddy and I did Ziggy's Cape of Good Hope tour about a week ago and we could not have been more pleased with the decision. Ziggy is super knowledgeable about the entire region -- history, nature, people -- and also very friendly. My group was pretty small, but I can imagine Ziggy would make it very easy for solo travelers to have a great time with everyone else on the tour. Other tours have you do a small amount of cycling at the Cape, but Ziggy -- very thoughtfully -- skips this to allow you to take one of the most beautiful hour-long walks I've ever experienced from the lighthouse to another gorgeous viewpoint -- absolutely spectacular! Of course, I enjoyed the stunning scenery, the delicious (and healthy) lunch, and the winery stop, but it was also a pleasure just to spend the afternoon with Ziggy and talk to her about South Africa and her travels around the world. Our day together was one of the highlights of my time in Cape Town and, really, all of South Africa.

A really good way to go all around the Cape Peninsula in just one day!. We had a really good day! We started the tour in Bo-Kaap, then Boulder's beach, Cape of Good Hope and cherry on top: wine tasting! All of this enjoyng some good South African music and beautiful views. The guides were super friendly and the food really good! I would recommend this tour to everyone :)

Cape of Good Hope Tour. This Tour was amazing and i had such a wonderful day. Everything was perfect, the food, the wine, lots of information and an beautiful view in many places. You were great and so lovely guys. i will never forget this awesome day!!! Thanks for that!!! All the best!!!!!!!!!!

From a scale 1-5 ? 10000000000000000000. You can't do Cape Town with out a Lucky and lost tour. Everything's literally perfect. The music, views, wine, penguins and THE FOOD . Not to mention the tour guides, Ziggy and Brenden are beyond awesome! I constantly travel and go on a slew of tours, but this was definitely my favorite. I've done it once, and I'll gladly do it again when I'm back in Cape Town.

Local is Lekker. I got the privilege to go on the first Lucky and Lost peninsula tour and what a fantastic day it was. Ziggy and Brendan, two of the raddest locals you will ever meet, thank you for such a fun filled day. From the local tunes playing in the car to the most delicious local dish for lunch, made by Ziggy herself, to the quirky and fact full info along the way, this was one of the best tours I have been on in a long time. Brilliant way to see the beauty of Cape Town. This is truly a magical city and Lucky & Lost Tours certainly add their bit of fairy dust to the whole experience. P.S. Learnt the word Lekker which is South African slang for great, delicious, amazing, awesome, fantastic, brilliant, awe inspiring, best ever... the list of goodness goes on. So in the words of a true South African this tour was LEKKER!

Excursion to Cape of Good Hope- Friends of Dorothy. Excellent for for a one-day excursion in Cape Town, Friends of Dorothy and Tim are totally recommendable: reliability, good organization and good choice of best scenic spots, witty and intelligent travel guide.

cape town. Tim did an amazing job--very knowledgeable, efficient, great sense of humor, feel like we really got a wonderful taste of the area--he is a wealth of knowledge regarding not only the sights, but also the politics, the culture, the history and nuances

Cape Peninsula. We had an informative, light-hearted, full-day with Tim Freeman circumnavigating the Cape Peninsula in his all-comfort land barge. He picked up on special "wishes" and made them happen save for that Band of Zebra we thought he might pull out of his magic bag. Next time. Since we are in Cape Town on on extended trip, there will be a next time.

exclusive tour to Cape of Good Hope, Boulder to see the Penquins, Lunch at Cape Point etc. Just need people to know Tim Freeman is one of the best tour guides I have had the experience of knowing. He is quite friendly, very knowlegeable, and a great historian !We spent a full day driving to the end of the cape, down to Cape of Good Hope, Boulder to visit the natural penquin colony there. Lunch at Cape Point Restaurant was excellent. Drove to Chapman Peak, saw the wonderful beaches of Cape Town, where the great white sharks breed. Cape Good Hope, the lighthouse, center of the earth, the line of oceans meeting Atlantic and Indian oceans etc. What a day. Excellent tour. Just contact Friends of Dorothy for your experience

Perfect Day. Tim did a great job and highly recommend. My friends and I had 1 free day in Cape Town. He was a referral and he was perfect. We don't drink much so didn't want to do a full day going to wineries but wanted to see the scenery of the area. He personalized the day and suggested a visit to the Dylan Lewis sculpture garden. This was the highlight of the day. Tim's knowledge and sense of humor made the rainy day a highlight of our entire trip to South Africa.

CAPETOWN tours with TIM FREEMAN. Let me begin by saying that Tim is a wonderful God, he is very knowledgeable on all of the sites and everything there is to see in Cape Town and beyond. We toured the city of Cape Town, the Y Winelands, The peninsula, the Township of longa. I found Tim to be a walking encyclopedia with Humor added. I would certainly recommend ham highly to any new Cape Town visitors.

Fantastic Tour Guide and Service. Tim is an incredible guide! Best way to see the Cape Peninsula in a day. His robust knowledge of the history, animals, plant life and "must see's" made for an interesting and meaningful tour. I highly recommend this company.

The Cape in a day.. From the initial contact with Tim, via recommendation, he was attentive and keen to deliver exactly what we wanted. In our case an intense 1 day private tour of the Cape.He delivered, we had a great day, it was informative and humorous, Tim's knowledge of all things RSA, but also many other topics, is truly impressive.So we would recommend him without hesitation.
Top moment!. What a great guide to visit Cape Town area!...lot of knowledge and very nice person! Pro-active to offer out of the box tours, so you don't feel you are with the mass of tourists.

Tim's customized tour made our South African visit perfect!. My husband, cousin, and I were visiting South Africa last October. We were confirmed on a ten-day bicycle trip leaving from Cape Town followed by two safaris. We were arriving in Cape Town five days before our tours were to begin. Tim and I corresponded via email numerous times. Tim reviewed our trips and put together two days of touring that did NOT overlap with anything we would be doing. His expertise and willingness to work with us rounded out our vacation perfectly. The three of us would highly recommend any tours (especially self arranged) by Friends of Dorothy, especially Tim Freeman.

Another Perfect Day !. This was a very good day of exploring sights and scenic views that I've never seen before. Tim organized my trip by reviewing things and areas I had visited last year. Tim proposed a tour route and then executed it perfectly. I really enjoyed the day and Tim made me feel comfortable all the many many miles we traveled. Tim went out of the way ( overtime) to get everything accomplished ( visited). A very good way to see the Cape , highly recommend!

great day out in the winelands. great day out visiting wineries for tastings - including the beautiful stark conde winery and the winery at maison.Interesting visit to Franschoek centre. Tim is informative as a guide and lots of interesting anecdotes

onederful. had two trips out with Tim on this visit to cape town - some beautiful wineries and a visit to an interesting farm garden which grew every kind of produce in a most wonderful location - second visit to a sculpture garden - an oasis of calm and beauty- Tim is a knowledgeable guide and good company - a must when in cape town!

Amusing and Educational. We visited a few select vineyards and were treated especially well as Tim appears to have such a good relationship with them. He guided us smoothly through the wine tastings, and the region, with great knowledge, both of the wines, and the locale. We stopped for a relaxed lunch at one of the vineyards but went with the a la carte rather than the tasting menu so as to give us time to fit in more vineyards in the afternoon. The minibus was very comfortable for the six of us, with plenty of space for our purchases en route. We thoroughly enjoyed our day and count it among the highlights of our time in Capetown
Great Experience. We absolutely loved touring the wine lands with Tim during our honeymoon. He took us to some exclusive places and was very knowledgeable about the region and the culture.

Cape Wineries (Stellenbosch and Franschhoek). This was an excellent tour, conducted with panache by Tim. We visited the following wineries (with their highlights):1) Meerlust: Rubicon (Bordeax-style) blend, mostly Bordeaux red grapes (Merlot/Cab) but also a Pinot Noir2) Simonsig: the Tiara (Bordeaux-style) blend, Mr. Borio's Shiraz, and the two Chenin Blancs that Ellis hated3) Hartenberg: the Mackenzie (Bordeaux-style) blend and the full range of reds4) Moreson: Pinotage and sparkling winesWe received a warm reception at each of the wineries, as well as a good selection of excellent wines. I would give the edge to Simonsig because their excellent Shiraz offerings. Note that the selection of wineries may change with each tour on account of availability and scheduling. You really can't go wrong with the South African wineries, however, either on account of the wines offered or the bucolic settings.At Franschhoek, we had an excellent lunch at the French Connection restaurant. The menu was extensive and highly affordable, and we were allowed to uncork our two bottles of "Mackenzie" wines just purchased at Hartenberg. Several of us ordered the sliced kudu (large antelope) steak, which was juicy and delicious, a perfect match for our wines!Cape Town is a wonderful city to visit, but it's not easy to visit either the Cape of Good Hope or the Cape wineries if you don't have a car. Tim is a knowledgeable and charismatic guide who showed us all of these places and greatly enhanced our visit. And he was very patient with our sometimes chaotic seven-person group. Finally, while this probably goes without saying given the company's name, Tim was the perfect match for our group with 5 of 7 members being openly gay men. We learned a lot! :-)

Excellent Day Tour of Cape Town. I arrived with a large group from the USA and decided to book a day tour of Cape Town with Tim. I couldn't be more pleased with the experience. Tim was friendly and knowledgeable, and a true professional. The best part of the experience is that he was able to offer several suggestions, and then tailored the tour around our individual choices. I highly recommend him for your stay in Cape Town.

Knowledgable and diligent tour guide. Tim was wonderful to work with. We (my husband, 20 yo daughter and I) corresponded and talked on the phone with him before our trip, and he helped us to scope out what we would do in Capetown on our own, and what we would do with him: one day to the Peninsula and one day to the Wine Country. Tim made a real effort to discern what did and didn't interest us -- he adjusted restaurants for the second day with him based on our reactions to the first. Also, having noticed our interest in nature, he took us to the beautiful Babylonstoren farm.

Detailed and well planned out 3 day trip. We were a group of us traveling from Washington D.C and Tim came highly recommended to us. He lived up to everything we had been told!. Our day trips, meals and travel arrangements were all well thought out and carefully planned. Tim is also well informed about local stuff and is able to answer most trivia questions and historical tidbits, which we did bombard him with.He should be your first choice for any Cape Town and surround travel plans!.

Inspiring guided tour in Cape Town. Tim Freman planed after our preferences, organized and led us (family of 5, age 12 to 55 years) through a wonderful day in Cape Town. He was knowledgeable, amusing and inspiring. Highly recommended!

What a Treat!. From the moment we met up with Tim to the time of drop off we had an amazing time throughout. The wealth of knowledge that Tim has of Cape Town coupled with a warm and engaging manner kept us entertained throughout the tour of the magnificent Cape Town peninsula. Tim tailored the tour to what we wanted and delivered all the way knowing when to stop for photos and when and where to avoid the crowds. John, the girls and I had a blast. Many thanks!!

a decade of TIM and I will book again when I come back to Cape Town. Dear Tim,Thank you again for the wonderful stories, explanations and your "Yes I Can" attitude. Once would nearly think you work for Radisson Blu.Since all these years you underline the thruth....wine and people are getting better with age -:)Patrick & this time Gigi too!

Fantastic Experience with Tim. We spent two wonderful days with Tim touring the Stellenbosch and Franschhoek region the first day and Hermanus area day 2. The great experience started long before we arrived in Cape Town. Tim suggested places to stay, restaurants and what to see on our own in Cape Town. On tour, Tim is extremely knowledgeable about wine, food, wildlife, local politics and tourism. I can't imagine a better guide. Thanks Tim!

Beautiful day in the winelands . We had a great day visiting the Western Cape winelands areas. Tim is well informed and shared his knowledge and kept us entertained along the journey. We visited Jordan's & Rustenberg in Stellenbosch, had a wonderful lunch in Franschoek and then finished the day at Spice Route in Paarl. A lovely day, beautiful scenery, great vineyards & great company from Tim.

Winelands tour was amazing. Seven of us enjoyed an excellent day with Tim. From the moment he picked us up at our hotel, it was clear we were going to have an amazing day. We visited 3 wineries, Jordan's, Rustenberg and Spice Route - we could have included more but we were well looked after at all venues. We also enjoyed a delicious and leisurely lunch at La Petite Ferme. Tim is very knowledgable and kept us entertained throughout the day which made the time in the van as much part of the experience as enjoying the wine.

Two fantastic days with Tim. What a wonderful guide!. We (A group of four/2 couples) engaged Tim for 2 days. The first day he took us on the "Wine land Tour" and the second day on the Cape Peninsula Tour. After finding it very difficult to find a Tour Guide, Tim proved to be a fantastic choice. He is extremely knowledgeable, funny, punctual,engaging and flexible. He was great and we all agreed that he was the best Tour Guide we ever had. Would definitely go back and utilise him again.

Wonderful day with a pleasant, friendly guide. We utilized Tim to take us to Hermanos (whales), drive aong the coast. and visit a penguin ,etc. Tim was great, one of the best guides we had. It was our last day in Capetown, and at the conclusion of the tour he dropped us off at the airport. we enjoyed Tim's company and learned from him. Highly recommend !!

Wonderful day and a half tour of Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. Tim Freeman was my gracious, knowledgeable, entertaining tour guide for a day and a half in Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. Tim is that wonderful combination of professional and friendly. Tim has a depth of knowledge about Cape Town and the environs, he is flexible, accommodating, and worked hard to make my trip enjoyable, relaxing, personalized, and interesting. Highlights of the tours: penguins, the beach at Muizenberg, the Cape of Good Hope, the bird who stole my lunch (I was finished) at the delicious Two Oceans restaurant, the South African Jewish Museum and District Six. Thank you Tim for a great time!

A Wonderful Guide. We engaged Tim for just a half day tour of Cape Town. Tim proved to be a terrific choice. Friendly, erudite and very witty, we thoroughly enjoyed our brief but thorough and informative tour. Great guy and a top quality guide.

Touring with Tim. Tim contributed a five star touring day to our perfect 8 days in Cape Town. Tim took my family of 11 on a very personal Cape Peninsula full day tour which was both educational, physical and fun! We range in age from 9 to 75.

Very Knowledgeable Guide. We hired Tim so that we made the most of the days we had in Cape Town and were able to relax and enjoy the days we had with Tim.We did the Cape Point tour and stopped at beaches and the Botsnical Gardens to learn about the Flowers of the area enroute.We also visited the Penguins at Boulder beach and the National Lark as well as a fishing area.Tim made the day very interesting and we learnt a lot about South Africa as this was our first visit.We went to the Cape of Good Hope and claimed to the top to look out over the oceans.We then had lunch at a really nice resturant called the Two Oceons.Tim has a nice vehicle and we felt very safe with him at all times.He was prompt when collecting us from the Hotel and know the History of SA as well as other interesting factsThe second day Tim took us to Cale Town itself and gave us a lot of good information and sights which we would never have known on our own.We then went on to District 6 and he told us about the history of this area very interesting and then we went to the Maly area and had lucch with a local lady in her house which was great with amazing food and company.After lunch we went to Langa Township which was a very moving experience not to be missed when in CT if you want to see the other side of life in South Africa.We felt very safe in the Township and enjoyed interacting with the locals and seeing their way of life.Our guide at the township was great full of interesting information about life in a township which we did not know about.We saw local pottery projects and went to a local beer house and shared beer with the locals, and saw in a ladies house and it was a very interesting afternoon.I would recommend Tim if you want to make the most of you time in Cape Town area and to learn about local life.

Amazing Cape Town Tour!. My friends and I were in Cape Town for a total of 4 days. On two of those days, we booked tours with Tim. One was a wine tasting day in Stellenboch and the other was a Peninsula tour. Both were absolutely fantastic! Tim was able to accommodate everything we were looking for... My two friends were interested in doing some port tasting, so he managed to squeeze a place in for them - even on a Sunday! The wineries he chose were all wonderful.On our second tour, we went to the peninsula and saw penguins at the reserve and seals along the way. We also stopped in multiple bays along the way and ate at a fantastic restaurant for lunch. We made it to the Cape of Good Hope and Tim let us stop at several scenic areas to take photos and point out wildlife. He was extremely knowledgable about the history of South Africa and we learned a great deal from our time with him.I would highly recommend Friends of Dorothy tours to anyone who is in Cape Town. They are absolutely worth the price!!!

Great Experience - Personalized Tours. I have been meaning to write this review for a long time -- Tim was absolutely great! The tour lasted all day and we certainly learned a lot about the history of Cape Town. We also had an amazing meal -- way better than The Flagship if you ever consider going there. :) Thank you, Tim!

Great way to learn about the culture and drink wine. We just finished a tour of Cape Town with Tim Freeman. Originally we asked to do a peninsula tour but we did say - if the weather is going to bad - please just think of something else for us to do.When we met him - he informed us that the weather was miserable and that he recommended that we do the wine tour. Being wine drinkers - we were 100% fine with that suggestion.On our way to do the wine tasting - we learned about the history of Cape Town and little other tid bits of information. The information that he shared, along with his personal stories helped paint a picture of what life is in South Africa and Cape Town.Being someone that loves to learn about the culture and identity of an area - this was perfect.The wineries that he picked were great - along with the lunch location. Now this might not seem like a big deal - but I called him on a Sunday (on Sundays 85% of wineries are closed) at 9:30 am for a 10:30 am start. So yes - he pulled off a Superman like moved and rescued the day.

Best way to enjoy the winelands and Peninsula!. We were a company of five going for two daytrips. The first was the winelands of Stellenbosch and surroundings ("Yellow Brick Road") and the second was Cape Peninsula with False bay, penguins, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point Nature reserve ("The Ruby Slipper").On the Winelands tour we stopped at some really beautiful wineries, but also got to see Stellenbosch, Franschoek and the beautiful surroundings. Our guide Tim helped us pick out wineries, but was also very flexible to the changing wishes of the group. While driving Tim told us a lot of fascinating stories about Cape Town, wine making, different grapes etc. All in all it was a marvellous day, filled with wine, good food and beautiful sights.The next day we went on the Peninsula tour. We went through Simon´s town (where we were introduced to Just Nuisance), via the penguin colony to Cape of Good Hope. Here we had a walk through the Cape point nature reserve and then went for a great seafood lunch at restaurant Two Oceans. We saw a lot of different animals, but were also amazed by the flowers. Unlikely at it seems the group agreed that this day was perhaps even better than the first one! The sights along the coastline are absolutely unforgettable. Whoever books a trip with Tim is in for a real treat. He is incredibly knowledgeable, and has a deep understanding of so many subjects (Cape Town history and politics, wine and winemaking, architecture, birds, plants...) paired with a gift of delivering anecdotes. I learned (and laughed) so much during the two days! Tim is also the perfect host, engaging everyone in the party and making sure all are having a good time.In short: when in Cape Town, day touring with Tim Freeman of Friends of Dorothy is something not to be missed!

Wine tour in Stellenbosch etc. Tim knew all about wine and took us to beautiful places with very good wine in Stelenbosch and Franschok. We also learned lots about South Africa and the scenery we passed. Highly recommended! His van was comfortable.

Tour to Hermanus. What a great day! Tim was prompt (early actually) to pick us up at our hotel. We had scheduled a tour to go to Hermanus for a day to look for Right Whales and also to tour the area. We had a lovely tour through Cape Town, then through the Elgin Orchard area. We stopped just short of Hermanus at the top of a peak to look down at the amazing coast and view from above, but also to try to spot where the whales may be. We then made our way to Hermanus. Such a beautiful quaint little town and the coast line was spectacular! Crashing wave over a rocky coast. There was a cliff trail that you could walk along or sit and watch. We spotted several whales, from a distance, but still was so cool to see!Then we went to lunch on the waterfront with Tim and had great food, sat outside, and even saw several whales breach during lunch!We then drove to Betty's Bay where they have the African penguin colony. This place was great! Less touristy than Simon's Town, Boulder's Beach (so we hear), and we were able to get closer to the penguins, there were 100's!Our drive back was the coastal route/scenic route along Chapman's Peak Drive. The sun was setting and the view was phenomenal! We even saw baboons walking along the wall on the side of the road! Tim is an amazing tour guide! He is fun, easy to get a long with, and very knowledgable about the area and the history of Cape Town, and enjoys telling you about it!I highly recommend booking a private tour with Tim. Thanks Tim!

Cape Town Peninsula Tour. We did the Peninsula Tour with Tim today. He was at our hotel at 9 AM to whisk us down the Cape. We spent a few minutes at the Botanic Garden before heading to the Boulders to see the Penguin Colony, followed by the dramatic ride to the Cape of Good Hope. We all climbed to the top of the Cape peak and followed that with a delicious lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant. We then drove up the Atlantic coast and had a quick wine tasting at a nearby vineyard. We headed back to Cape Town and saw the 12 Apostles rock formation.We passed through Clifton & Camps Bay before we headed back into the city. Tim is a fun, interesting guy who shares his cultural, historical and geographic knowledge of South Africa & Cape Town throughout the tour. I highly recommend using Tim on your next visit to Cape Town. You will not be disappointed!

Two Full, Fantastic Days of Wine Tours. This review is a bit overdue, but after a few weeks I am still thinking about my two days on the wine trails, how much I learned about he area, and how much fun we had. The first day, Tim collected me and two friends from the Hotel in Cape Town. Driving out to the wine country, he pointed out important landmarks, interesting historical attractions, and fun facts about the area you're sure not likely to get on other tours. We started day one in Franschoek as Tim fulfilled our request to focus on some of South Africa's best sparkling wines. We toured three wineries, had a fantastic lunch at Delaire Graff, and purchased more wine than we knew what to do with. For anyone looking for a gay friendly tour operator, Friend's of Dorothy is it (as one might assume). Day two of the wine excursions included myself and 4 gay friends from London that I'd recently met at a wedding. While always professional, Tim made this day even more fun. The humor and jokes flowed as freely as the wine and rain that day. We toured several spectacular estates, purchased even more wine, had a Delicious lunch and one of South Africa's best, Overture. I was looking for a gay friendly wine tour, and was connected to Tim through Out in Africa tours. I'm so glad to have made the connection.

Fantastic time in Cape Town, thank you Tim. We had one day in Cape Town stopover while on QM2, I had organised with Tim to take us to Table Mountain, Stellenbosch Botanical Gardens and a winery. Our cruise ship was late arriving due to high winds but Tim was waiting for us in his nice, clean people mover. He had advised us to buy tickets for the cable car for table mountains online before we arrived. This saved us a lot of time as the queues to buy tickets let alone getting on the cable car was very long. We got there long before 4 bus loads from our ship had arrived and had 45 minute wait to get to the top. Tim pointed out quite a lot of interesting information. We then went to botanical gardens where we tried different South African foods in the cafe and then Tim took us for a walking tour of the gardens and once again was very knowledgeable and pointed out many interesting plants. He also managed to take us to a very nice winery called Klein Constantia for wine tasting. We had a great time and saw so much in a day.We definitely recommend booking Tim.

Four Day Tour of Cape Town. My wife and I had a terrific time in Cape Town and the surrounding area with Tim Freeman of Friends of Dorothy Day Tours as our guide. We are in our 70s and are still fairly agile, but without Tim's guidance and help we would not have accomplished half of what we did with him. After hearing the things we wanted to do and see, he managed everything. He did the driving, arranged reservations, chose places for lunch, etc. He made excellent additional suggestions.We toured Cape Town itself both walking and driving where we saw District 6, the Castle, the Company's Gardens, Signal Hill and more. Since our four days with Tim were on alternate days spread out over a week, Tim showed us many places we could return to on our own (including Table Mountain, the Slave Lodge, the Anglican Cathedral, and others). Outside the city, we went to the superb Hartenberg winery estate, the beautiful Kirstenboch Gardens, and the fruit and vegetable gardens in Babylonstoren. Along the way we stopped at places to sample artisan chocolates, craft beer, and olives. We went to Simon's Town and Betty's Bay to see the penguins and stood on the Cape of Good Hope. The drives to and from these places were beautiful. The mountains and beaches are fantastic sights.Tim also arranged for a tour of Langa Township with a guide from the community itself. It was a sobering and enlightening experience. I helped us contextualize our trip in the context of South African history, culture, and current affairs. We were a bit apprehensive but there was no need to have been. The people of Langa Township welcomed us. We recommend this visit stronglyNever did we feel rushed. Although we went many places in a few days, we had ample time at each of our destinations. With Tim doing the driving, it eliminated all of the extra time required to schedule a tour on one's own and to figure out how to get to places!It was more than worth the money. We visited Amsterdam on our own before flying to Cape Town. We did quite well there but Cape Town with a tour guide--especially Tim--was much more successful.Tim possesses a broad and deep knowledge of Cape Town and South Africa which he eagerly shares with his clients. He is very articulate and speaks clearly. We had no problem hearing him in the back seat of his comfortable SUV. He also thrives on his clients' suggestions, questions, and opinions. At times he had to remind us that we should be looking out the window!Tim is an affable, cheerful traveling companion. We felt that we had made a friend. Our advice is to seize the opportunity to engage Tim as a tour guide. You won't regret it for a minute. Our visit to Cape Town and environs was the trip of a life time and Tim Freeman was instrumental in making it so!

Tim is fantastic!. I have been to Cape Town a few times, but I learned more on this trip than any before--all thanks to Tim! His knowledge is beyond any tour guide I have ever met and he is a true pleasure to be around. We did the Cape Peninsula tour and went to the Winelands, and even asked Tim to take us to Kirstenbosch on our last day there because we enjoyed having him as our guide so much. Tim was happy to cater to our needs--from getting my dad a stool to make it easier for him to get into the van to taking us to a wine farm that was recommended to us for its sheer beauty. One of the highlights of being with Tim was the first day when he picked us up--he had seen whales not far from our hotel, and he was so excited to show them to us! His enthusiasm was contagious and was a great introduction to our time in Cape Town!Tim is an amazing guide and we would highly recommend him to anyone who wants to see Cape Town and learn a lot along the way!

Great tour of Cape Town. We took a walking tour of Cape Town with Tim and it was a really great way to learn about the city. We did the tour on our first full day and I would highly recommend doing this - it really helped us get a feel for the city and all the history there. Tim is a great guide - really nice and fun to be with. The best part was that we saw a lot of things we might otherwise have missed or just walked on by if we Tim wasn't there to show us. We had a terrific trip to South Africa and Tim's tour was the perfect way to start the trip.

Highly Informative: Tale Of Two Cities Tour. We are a family of five on an 11-month Round-The-World trip, road-schooling our teens along the way. In Cape Town, one major educational goal was to learn about the different populations of South Africa. Tim delivered in spades. We started our day with an overview of the European history, focused on Central Cape Town. Highlights for us were the Company Gardens, the flower market, District Six, and Groote Kirk. We then headed up to Signal Hill for the noon gun. It was an exciting ride up the hillside and we got there just in time.Next was the Cape Malay district where we admired the cheerfully painted homes, saw the prettiest mosque in Cape Town, and visited a spice shop. We had a curried-chicken lunch in a cook's home, and learned to make samosas. The food was delicious, and the conversation very informative. This was the first time my husband had been in a Muslim home, so he was very interested in the art work and the family's day-to-day life. Finally, we ended our day at Langa Township. This was simply amazing. We learned so much about the township system, how/when/why people moved to Cape Town after the fall of apartheid, and the community itself. We were happy to see people's pride in their community and the projects in place to help people learn a trade or craft. To be honest, it was a little uncomfortable to be visiting a community in such an intimate way, peering in to their homes and picking our way through the narrow paths. Visiting Langa, however, was vital to our understanding of South Africa, Cape Town, and Apartheid. (After all, traveling is all about experiencing new and different things, and if you're really trying to do that, you're going to be a little uncomfortable once in a while.) Note, however, that we were warmly welcomed by the Langa guide, the Langa children, and the people we met along the way.Tim's knowledge about the city was vast. He was able to answer all of our questions in great detail. His fellow "teachers", our cook in the Cape Malay district, and our local Langa guide, were friendly and welcomed our questions. They all had clear pride in their cultures, businesses, and communities. One downside of the tour for us was that the morning and lunch portion of the tour was very quickly-paced. We felt as if we were rushing through several elements. If I were to do this again, I'd want to take it more leisurely and break it in to two days.

Wealth of Knowledge. We spent 2 days with Tim doing the Cape Peninsular and Cape Winelands tours. I had never worked with a private guide before, and Tim doing a wonderful job working with us to tailor the tours to our interests. Instead of just vineyards he expanded our day in the winelands to include chocolate and olives which were fascinating. He is a wealth of knowledge and easily dealt with closed roads due to fires to ensure we saw all our major interests.

pulls the rabbit out of the hat. We have been with Tim several times on our trips to Cape Town in the past and it has always been an enjoyable experience. Everything is focused on the customers' satisfaction and Tim strives to achieve this whatever it might be. He is intuitive to what the customer desires and will do anything to pull a surprise out of the bag. On this occasion we visited a fantastic stud farm with the most marvelous scenery. Amazing! The food was super!He is endowed with an encyclopaedic knowledge of the history and politics of the area and you know you are in safe hands. A must when in Cape Town - a cut above the rest

Highly informative - thank you Tim!. I moved to cape town 6 weeks ago to head the marketing for the Glen Boutique Hotel. My employee introduced me to Tim from Friends of Dorothy Tours to give me a much needed insight into Cape Town. I went on 3 fantastic tours with some other employees which gave us an obscene amount knowledge and just the thing I thing I needed to educate our guests. Tim is a true gentleman and very easy to get on with. He's intuitive, and with that, caters for everyone's needs. I highly recommend those eager to tour Cape Town!Thanks again Tim!

3rd time and just as great. Just got back from my 3rd visit to Cape Town, having used Tim's services on each and every visit. It was our friend's first time in the Mother City, so they enjoyed the introductions and history in Tim's commentary.He's very easy going, so will take time to listen to what his guests want from their tour and tailor it accordingly. The water bottles in a chilled cooler in the minibus were a nice touch, seeing as though it was 40c when we were out wine tasting. Will definitely go back to CPT and will definitely be using Tim again.

A second great day with Tim. My second time touring with Tim was just as good as the first. He did a half day Cape Town tour with my husband and I. His level and breadth of knowledge is remarkable, On top of that, he is witty and passionate about South Africa and his tours and, most important, very good at understanding and tailoring the tour to your interest. Highly recommend!

Superb Guide. Very Knowledgeable, Friendly, & Well Organized. Tim Freeman of Friends of Dorothy Tours is an exceptional guide. We hired Tim as our private guide for 2 full days while we were in Cape Town. We also hired him to plan the rest of our 12 day itinerary for after we left Cape Town. We were extremely pleased. He did an outstanding job. Tim knows so many off the beaten path interesting places - places that only a long time resident knows. He also has a firm grasp of history, and is very good at spotting wildlife. We were especially pleased because he crafted a personal tour for us based on our interests, not his. As an example, we do not drink alcohol, so the typical wine tasting was not for us. However, In lieu of wine tasting, Tim came up with a "dark chocolate tasting" tour at a family run gourmet chocolate kitchen. It was one of the highlights of my trip. He also arranged for an olive oil tasting for us. I tend to ask a ton of questions, and unlike many guides, Tim was always able to answer my questions, and so far, none of his answers have proven to be incorrect.When we return to South Africa we definitely plan to hire Tim Freeman as our guide again. He was great!

An Excellent Guide for Cape Town. We were in Cape Town for a short visit, with only one full day to see as much as we could. We had a wonderful time and an awesome day, mostly due to Tim and his tour. He is the perfect mix of personable, knowledgeable, organized and fun. He will tailor your tour so that it fits your interests and schedules. The lunch he arranged was delicious and memorable, as were trips to visit a township, the coast, penguins, Sea Lions, Gardens, Big Bang, etc. etc. He is also a wealth of knowledge about South Africa and its history, as well as a great story teller. I would highly recommend Tim and Friends of Dorothy Tours. Whether you are a couple, group of adults or a family with children, he will create a perfect day that is sure to be memorable and special. We hope to return to Cape Town and stay longer, and when we do, we will definitely call Tim again.

Amazing Private Guide Makes the Difference between a Good Time and an Incredible Experience!. Our family [including 2 young adult sons] had Tim as a private guide for two chock full days in Cape Town. Tim was responsive even before we arrived by exchanging several emails asking us detailed & pertinent questions so he could plan an itinerary that fit our family's needs. He listened very well and knows all the ins & outs about Cape Town so we always felt in good hands. In 2 days, he took us up to hike around Table Mountain, a full City Tour hitting the highlights of Cape Town central, arranged a private Cape Malay cooking lesson in a private home in BoKaap, a tour of a township including visiting inside personal homes, a lovely day in Stellenbosch winelands with wine tasting and gourmet lunch. Any guide can take you to those places, but what distinguished Tim was his depth of knowledge and enthusiasm to share the history and inside stories of each place- really made the history come alive. On a practical level, Tim was on time, followed through on everything he promised and managed to meet the interests of the parents and the younger adults. Sign up for Tim when you go to Cape Town!

Excellent Day Trip. This was my second tour with Tim and I enjoyed it just as much as the first. I wanted to arrange a tour to go wine tasting as well as seeing some of the beautiful scenery around Cape Town. Tim was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and he is very efficient in replying to emails!If you are visiting Cape Town, I would recommend getting in touch with Tim and booking a tour with him. He books up quickly so make sure you book well in advance.He took us to some beautiful vineyards and arranged for us to have lunch overlooking a vineyard with a stunning view. As well as wine tasting, he was able to arrange for us to visit a couple of places that do cheese tasting. Tim has lived in Cape Town for nearly 30 years and has a great perspective on the history and culture of the city and South Africa in general. He also knows a lot about wine and food and is great company.

A Great Day Out. This was my first visit to Cape Town but it was my partner's third. He had been on a tour with Tim a few years ago and we were lucky enough to be able to book a tour with Tim on new year's eve. Tim couldn't have been more helpful in working with us to tailor the day to allow us to see what we wanted and he had some great suggestions. In the end we enjoyed a fantastic day tasting wine in Stellenbosch, visiting the town of Stellenbosch and having an amazing lunch in Paarl - all places Tim recommended. He is a very well informed guide - his knowledge ranges from the history and culture of South Africa, its wines, food and also its wildlife (including being a keen ornithologist!) I would highly recommend Tim as your guide if you are visiting Cape Town.

Full Marks. Phenomenal, from start to finish the tour was fantastic. Tim took us everywhere we wanted to go and had a huge wealth of knowledge about the area to draw from. If something wasn't going well in a winery of eatery, Tim sorted it out for us. I can't speak highly of the tour and would recommend it to everyone

TOUR OF PARADISE. This was our second time we hired the services of Tim to guide our group in discovering the less known vineyards of the Cape. Myself, my partner, and four other friends make regular trips from Toronto to indulge in the beauty and tastes of South Africa. We enjoyed Tim's tour of the wine lands so much, that we signed up for his tour of the Cape Point as well. Tim is very knowledgeable on the cape area and well read on South African history. His rates are very reasonable, and definitely makes any trip to Capetown more enjoyable. Give Tim a try!

Fun Down Under in Capetown. Tim was a joy to work with..he entertained our requests to change a tour without any hesitation and recommended things that made the tours something very special..some examples were Streetwires,.a cottage industry shop in the colorful Bokap neighborhood..proceeds from this wire animal shop go to AIDS and breast cancer research..Our visit to the Langa township was a fascinating, life-changing experience..and his choice of the Two Oceans Restaurant on the fullday Cape tour approached a true gourmet experience..I have been a travel agent in the United States for over 40 years and have dealt with various tour operators but Tim is one of the best!..Thanks again..Roger (and his husband, Robert)

First Rate Tour Company. We are very independent travelers. When we hire a private guide, it is important to us that the person is not only knowledgeable but that they are fun and personable in addition. We were in touch with a number of private guide companies in Cape Town and ultimately chose Tim from Friends of Dorothy for two full days of touring. Tim really paid attention to what we wanted and helped us plan two customized days of touring rather than the preplanned itineraries that other companies offered. We did a day down the Cape peninsula and a day in the Winelands. Each day included fabulous food and some stops that were more popular among locals than tourists.Tim had an unfortunate accident shortly before our trip. He went above and beyond to make sure that he put us in touch with his replacement, Anine, and that we were satisfied with the substitution. Anine turned out to be charming, full of information, and a delight to be with. She even helped us choose restaurants for our dinners and made sure we had reservations. We were delighted with our two days of touring and highly recommend Friends of Dorothy.

Cape Town Guide. Tim was really helpful from the moment of contact, suggesting great trips for our short visit to Cape Town. Via e mail we arranged a Peninsula Tour, Drive to Hermanus (Whale Watching) and a City Tour, including visit to a Township.Unfortunately Tim had an injury before our visit, but he kindly passed us into the hands of Faiek Allie of ACT tours, who was truly superb, organising a personal tour and fitting in Seal watching, Penguins, Table Mountain, the District Six Museum and the Noon Gun.Tim took the trouble to join us (on crutches) at the Langa Township, and both guides offered genuine care to ensure we had a great trip - would highly recommend.

Would do it again!. Typically, I am not fond of being on a tour. However, when I found out we can customize the tour to what we would like to do with only the people in your traveling group I was willing to give it a try especially traveling with 3 other women.We did the wine tour one day and drove the cost to see the penguins the next day. Our guide was Cheryl (Tim was having surgery) and she was fabulous. She set up some magnificent visits to wineries for some terrific tastings a few of them pored by the owner. The ride along the coast was breathtaking. Cheryl was very knowledgeable and passionate about all of Cape Town. She was also very accommodating to many of our requests (finding boxes to pack wine, dropping us off at the harbor, to shop etc). Everything was very well organized. I would love to do it again.

Cape Town Tours. We recently had the opportunity to experience the excellent guided tours given by Friends of Dorothy. We spent two days exploring wineries and other cape attractions. I cannot adequately express what an awesome experience we had. Every day was so well put together, and yet, so very flexible! We lingered a bit long at one of the wineries, and our guide worked so hard to push everything back! We are so appreciative about all of the time and effort that went into putting our tours together! We also appreciate that every place that was included in our tour was willing to work with our crazy schedule changes! We could not have asked for a better tour company!

Most Knowledgeable Guide. Tim's probably the most overly qualified and intellectual guide you will meet. If you like deep conversations, poetry, history etc he will be your handy encyclopaedia.Sharp witted and well organised, we saw Cape Town Malay Quarters and feasted at our host Latifah's home. She and her dishes were lovely!We also visited a township and went into couple of homes for a first hand experience. Also a Peninsular tour including Cape of Good Hope and on 3rd day, Stellenbosch winelands where we indulged in cheeses and cold cuts with some wine. Wonderful for port, olive oil and balsamic vinegar too! Tim was good company and kept his MPV stocked with delicious juices. One of the smoothies was so good we looked in supermarts but eluded us. Mates felt a pity we didn't manage visit Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens as planned and wished Tim prompted us on that, on hindsight.

Wonderful day spent with Tim Freeman. We were a group of 8 looking for a day tour of Cape Town which would include visits to a township and wineries. Tim coordinated everything, and even decreased the cost of the tour when one couple dropped out and we were able to use a smaller vehicle. We had an incredible experience at the Langa township. Tim then questioned us closely about our wishes regarding the wine tour, and guided us through two wineries which matched our taste in wines. In between we had a delicious lunch in an idyllic setting. We found Tim to be personable, informative, and very willing to create a tour to meet our wishes.

3 Perfect Days in Cape Town. If your time in Cape Town is limited you should definitely book a tour!! We were very fortunate to find Tim Freeman's Friends of Dorothy Tours. We were in such great hands with him and I cannot recommend him enough. He's extremely knowledgeable, so passionate about what Cape Town has to offer and a lot of fun. We booked three tours during our three day stay.. The first day we did the city tour, second was the cape winelands in Stellenbosch and the third was the cape peninsula tour to the cape of good hope. All three tours were completely different and packed with so much you really need to experience for yourself. We were very impressed, thanks Tim!!!! ---David and Eddie

All I can say is wow!. Tim was our private tour guide for a day tour of Cape Town. We had an incredible tour!!!! He is extremely knowledgeable and did a great job showing us the many points of interest and beauty in the Cape Town area. We saw seals, penguins, the Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Lion's Head, the wonderful views on Chapman Peak Drive and so much more. Tim provided drinks and snacks and made us feel comfortable the entire tour. Without question, I would highly recommend Tim to anyone interested in seeing the sights in the Cape Town area.

Great guide. Tim took us on an abbreviated peninsula tour for the day (we had a three hour lunch already planned in Simon's town). Tim fit in so much in a short period of time - but we never felt rushed and we learned so much in a short period of time. Tim is personal and very knowledgeable - just what we were looking for! I highly recommend Tim and wouldn't hesitate using him again in Cape Town.

Cape Town Tours. We enjoyed a full-day wine tour as well as a city tour with Tim Freeman. Tim is knowledgeable, entertaining and experienced in touring the entire Cape Town area. We had issues with flights, and Tim was willing to change schedules to ensure our party connected. I would highly recommend Tim and Friends of Dorothy for anyone visiting the Cape area. Well done!

Tim Freeman. We had Tim Freeman as a guide for two days in Cap town and wine area beginning of march and it was exceptional!He was always on time, very available to take us where We want to go.But the most important thing; he was so INTERESTING in everything,He knew a lot about the history of South Africa.He was a very good connaisseur for the wine tour too.A very Nice Guy . We recommend it for sure.Therese and Guy from Quebec in Canada

Brilliant.... What an amazing way to see the winelands of Cape Town.Starting with the phone call I booked the tour on, Tim was upfront and honest about the expectations of the tour such as costs, how much could be fitted in as well as the types of wine I enjoy drinking and which ones I don't then (as he explained) he could better plan the day and the tour to suit my needs.I cannot recommend Tim enough to anyone who is interested in his tours as I believe Tim takes the time to understand the client and their needs before heading out with them in the morning. Tim made me feel very comfortable throughout the day and I never felt rushed or bored at all.I highly recommend Tim Freeman and Friends of Dorothy Tours, even if the tour you are looking for isn't listed on the web site, give him a try anyway as I am sure he would be able to customise something which would suit you.

Excellent day with Tim Freeman!. My family of seven adults had a great day with Tim exploring the Cape Peninsula during Easter. Prior to our arrival to Cape Town, we had e-mail contact and planned what we wanted to see end experience. Tim came up with some ideas and they were great all the way. He picked us up at the hotel at 9.00 in the morning, and our trip started with a short stop at Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens. He has great knowledge and gave us an introduction to the beautiful and special flora this area is known for. Then we went to the False Bay Coast at Muizenberg and the surfer 's corner. We drove on to Kalk Bay harbor to see the Cape Fur Seals, and at the local fish market we also got a little introduction to the “catch of the day”! After Simon’s Town and Boulders Beach with the penguins, we headed into the National Park. We walked from Cape Point to Cape of Good Hope, a 40 minutes beautiful walk. Tim met us down there with the car, and from there we drove back along the Atlantic Ocean to Noordhoek, where we had lunch at The Food Barn. We had a nice break with great food and a fun and interesting conversation with Tim. After lunch the drive went on back to Cape Town through Chapman's Peak and Hout bay, a beautiful drive! Back in town, we ended up at Signal Hill where Tim had organized some bubbles for us. Beautiful views with a glass of bubbles in hand! A great way to end a great day with a great guide! I can recommend Tim Freeman and will absolutely contact him again if we go back to Cape Town in the future.
Super Day Tour With Tim Freeman. This was a amazing tour and I liked it very much. Tim Freeman was recommended by a friend. It was a good tour and everyone liked it.

Great Time. Tim took me and my friends on an all day peninsula tour. It was a great day - the drive was beautiful. Tim was very easy to deal with in making plans and gave great talks along the way! Highly recommend him!

Excellent experience!!. Our group of 11 had customised a 3-day tour with Tim. It was an excellent experience! Tim was witty, knowledgable and extremely helpful. All this topped with a dose if dry British humour.Arranging the tour with him was extremely easy. He responds promptly to email, and pays great attention to all our needs and various requests. With Tim, every small detail is taken care off and he goes to great lengths to planning the perfect tour for us - he offers advice on great eating places etc! Highly recommended!!

A fantastic day all round with Tim Freeman. Tim was recommended by a good friend and we are so glad we took a tour with him and would not hesitate to use him again. He is educated and informed with a great sense of humour! We did a winelands tour but Tim delved into the history and facts all along the way and we learned so much about South Africa, local politics, wildlife, places to visit etc. We visited 2 vinyards, La Motte & Jordan where you taste about 7 wines at each, so be prepared!Tim booked lunch at the French Connection in Franschhoek which was informal & relaxed with fantastic food. Truly the best mussels we have ever had!!All in all, a 1st class experience with a 1st class tour guide. Book him!Visited December 2013

Ruby Slipper tour. We spent a wonderful day with Tim exploring the Cape. He picked us up promptly at the hotel and after asking a few questions about what we would like to see, whisked us off to explore the spectacular coastal area, stopping at a winery for tastings and a purchase, and later a short hike up to see the view from Cape Point. Tim was a very informative, friendly guide and I would highly recommend his day tours for a fun, relaxed way to see amazing Cape Town.

Great 2 days in Cape Town. My husband and I spent 2 days with Tim as our guide...one day on the peninsula tour and one day in the wine country. We learned so much about South Africa, the bird and animal life, country politics, South African wines, etc. We were very happy with our experience and highly recommend Tim as an expert and "fun"guide.MarthaMill Valley, California

Lovely day trip out of capetown. Tim was an excellent personable extremely knowledgeable guide-- we did stellenbosch quickly -- but prioritized the cape peninsula and penguins. A lovely day! Deborah / two couples from DC area

Tim Freeman - Best Guide Ever. Tim Freeman guided my family around Cape Town and was beyond brilliant. He knew anything and everything and above all made it fascinating. I love animals and am not a bird watcher, but he made that fun also. We really got to know the area and also the Winelands. He is rated the highest in the guide system and had to pass a battery of tests. I am sure he did it with flying colors. You will learn and feel so much smarter after you ride with him. You can tell he is passionate about his job which makes it that much more of a wonderful experience. A+.

Smart Respected Local Friend. Tim was much more then we hoped for when we booked our 3 days of local guide with Friends of Dorothy Tour. I was travelling with my 2 sons, 21 and 24. They shared in the planning and Tim added a lot to our family vacation. He was incredibly knowledgeable about everything Capetown and environs had to offer. From an active day on Cape Point, to the Wineries, to the townships, Cape Malay lunch, Botanical Gardens, we where pleasantly surprised by his wealth of knowledge and good sense of humor. He took all the work of planning and we had all the fun. Tim met us at our hotel each morning, and we looked forward to seeing him and what he would have in store for us. Book him!!

A perfect tailor made day. Tim did a great job keeping our group of 10 in check without coming over as a school master. He is very knowledgable both on what you see but also South African history and current affairs. His selection of wineries was spot on and his advice on the wines the same. All 10 of us said we'd hire him again.

Best tour guide - Tim Freeman@friendsofdorthytours.co.za. We found Tim Freeman through tripadvisor. What a find! Tim is so intellegent, knows his facts, great sense of humor, right on time, and so entertaining.Tim knew how to cleverly "beat" the traffic, so there was no waiting..great insight and best ofall you could tell how much he loved his job and South Africa. His friendly nature, made it easyto be with him, so much so, we booked him for three days.We loved all his added history and insights and his wonderful personality. Plus a really great driver, our familyfelt right at home. He also introduced points of interest not in all the tour books, which made itpersonally carved out for our family. A winning experience!

Remarkable!. We spent 3 days with Tim, the 'best' guide anybody could be so lucky to have.What a treat, from lunch in a private home, to hidden treasures of Cape Town, and the Winelands.The best being his incredible knowledge, wit, and spontaneous insights and history along the way!A 5 star + guide! it doesn't get any better!

A fantastic day all around. Two friends and I elected to take the Friends of Dorothy wine tour, and it couldn't have been a better experience. We booked a private tour, which ended up being ideal, since we could pick our starting time and have a great deal of input on what types of wine-tasting activities we got to experience. We were picked up promptly at our apartment in Cape Town and chauffeured around in a comfortable and well air-conditioned van. What made the day most special, however, was our guide, Tim, who was warm, friendly, witty, and has an incredibly vast depth of knowledge of the area and all things wine-related. We did three wine tastings (one paired with delicious chocolates) and had a delicious lunch outside, with a spectacular view of the beautiful countryside, all of which Tim arranged for us ahead of time. Five stars all around - I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Tim and his tours if you're visiting the Cape Town area. Thanks again, Tim! Cheers, Greg (Gregg and Mark)

A fabulous day at the wineries with Tim. We cannot recommend Tim's tour of the wineries highly enough. He picked us up at our apartment in his van which was very comfortable for traveling for the day tour. Tim is an ex lawyer and extremely knowledgeable about the history of South Africa and about the region we were visiting. The tour was nicely paced and we had time to visit a number of wineries where he always knew the management which meant we were always treated well. He also knows his wines so was able to pick the wineries where we could experience our particular preferences in wine. All in all a wonderful day out and highly recommended. John and Greg

Spectacular Cape Peninsula Tour with Tim. Tim from Friends of Dorothy made all arrangements, picked us up at our Cape Town hotel in the morning for the best day of our already amazing trip. He took us out to the Cape of Good Hope, encountering on the way penguins, baboons (do not open your car window), ostriches, something that looks like a giant guinea pig, gale force winds, crashing waves, surfers, an excellent lunch, history, poetry, and witty conversation. Recommend you wear sunscreen, good walking shoes, and sunglasses. Scenery is beyond description. Cameras cannot capture, so leave those at the hotel and drink in the experience. We have another tour scheduled with him tomorrow and can't wait!

Tim Freeman's perfect tours. This is our second round of tours with Tim. This time we went east along the coast taking in olive, wine and chocolate tasting en route. Lunch's were always a culinary delight and education. As always a fountain of knowledge. Tim really made our holiday memorable. I would not hesitate to contact Tim on our next trip over and recommend Tim's tours of the Cape or elsewhere.

Tim Freeman's Tour of the Peninsula and Cape Town makes for a fabulous day!. Tim picked me up at the airport and gave me a quick tour of Cape Town and then again the next day for a tour of the peninsula and wine tasting. The days flew by and Tim is so very knowledgeable on so many topics - yes even mountain climbing and the English influence in South Africa and we had a great time exploring Cape Town. I immediately felt comfortable with Tim as I was traveling alone and was very thankful I had taken the time to spend two days in Cape Town during my travels through South Africa. I learned so much and wondered how much others miss when visiting Cape Town without a guide like Tim. We covered a great deal of territory and even squeezed in some shopping at his local favorites - all of who knew Tim and welcomed him and me. Great day Tim, thank you so much and I will ask for you again during my next trip to Cape Town. Deb

Perfect Peninsula Tour. Our peninsula tour with Tim Freeman was the highlight of our stay in Cape Town! Tim's knowledge of the area and his quick wit kept us entertained the entire day. We chatted via e-mail with Tim prior to our visit and told him what we wanted to see. He figured out the best route and didn't disappoint! We visited Fish Hoek, Shelly Beach, Simon's Town, the Penguin Colony, the Cape of Good Hope, Chapman's Peak Drive. We wanted to have lunch at the Food Barn, so he planned a stop there as well. Our last stop of the day was Constancia Farms Winery. We can't say enough good things about Tim! It was a day that we will remember for the rest of our lives. If you get a chance to go with him on a tour, do it! You won't be sorry!

Informative, professional and a great day out. You will be hard pressed to beat a day out with Tim. He knows the area very well. Has plenty of stories to tell and goes out of his way to meet your needs. I had a friend over from the UK who did a couple of tours with him - one to the winelands and the other around the peninsula. Both were professionally run - with a clean comfortable vehicle. Tim arrives on time and keeps the day running smoothly without you feeling pressed. You will come away having had fun, seen a lot and increased your knowledge of Cape Town and its delights. Don't miss out.

Great day out with Tim. Just spent an amazing day with Tim, on an all day tour of the highlights of the Cape. We visited a great winery for a tasting and then Tim took us all around the peninsular. Tim is great fun to be with, and really knowledgable about the Cape. We also had a fantastic lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant. Thanks Tim for a great day.

Great day of touring. We made arrangements via email with Tim Freeman for a peninsula tour. It was fantastic. We started with some quick highlights of Cape Town. Tim's knowledge showed through in an easy conversational style. He pulled over several times to allow us to take photos and he was quick to granted camera so both my wife and I could be in the shot. His knowledge of plant and animal life on the cape added immeasurably to the experience. It was well worth doing the private tour and so much more enjoyable than being part of a bigger group. Thanks Tim for a great day!

Outstanding customized tours to suit your individual interests and schedule. We couldn't be more pleased with the all-day tour of the Cape winelands that Tim Freeman helped to coordinate. We wrote to Tim in advance of our trip to South Africa and shared with him a list of wineries we were interested in visiting around Stellenbosch, Paarl and Somerset West. Tim was very helpful in asking us what our personal interests were (serious wine tasting, sight-seeing, architecture, etc.). He made some suggestions for wineries he thought we might enjoy and politely suggested that some of the wineries we thought of visiting were either very remote or might be limited in their wine selections. Tim picked us up from our hotel in his roomy and comfortable van, showed us the cooler he had packed with water and refreshments to enjoy during our tour, and confirmed our time schedule. We were very impressed with how knowledgeable and witty Tim is. He not only made personal introductions to the staff at each of the five wineries (and our lunch-time restaurant as well), he made sure that all tasting and entrance fees were taken care of so that we didn't need to worry about extra expenses. He pointed out interesting plants, birds and animals along our journey, picking up on the fact that we had just come from a safari in Botswana and Zambia. Tim is very personable, professional and well-prepared. We were thrilled that we were able to visit five wineries on a gentle and comfortable pace without having to worry about directions or details. We enjoyed Cape Town so much we are sure we will be returning to South Africa again soon. We will be sure to book another tour with Tim and Friends of Dorothy Tours! Enjoy!

Great day with Tim!. Had a great one day highlights of the Cape tour with Tim. I can't say enough. Arrangements were easy. Tim was flexible and knowldedgable. He really tried to tailor the tour to meet our interests. Most impressive was his knowledge of the geography, geology, politics and history. I don't think I asked a question that he couldn't answer, , , and I ask a lot. Can't say enough good things!

Ticked all the boxes - great day out. On a one day Cape Peninsular tour, I saw whales frolicking close inshore, had a very close encounter with a fur seal, enjoyed the penguins, walked from the Cape of Good Hope to Cape Point and was treated to amazing sea and land views. Added to the excellent lunch overlooking the sea near Cape Point it was exactly what I had wanted from the tour. When you can see big coaches disgorging 70 or 80 people who just want a photo at the Cape signpost, it's clear how worthwhile a good guide is. Tim threw in a Cape Town tour on the way out of town, stopped frequently and flexibly and has a great deal of humorously delivered knowledge to share.

Tour with Tim. Tim was an excellent tour guide. He has a brilliant memory and can educate you on more than most people can retain. He showed us all the must see sights and steered us through a beautiful tour around the peninsula and wine tours. If you are interested in seeing wineries, hire Tim. He is more knowledgable than the winery employees so he can add a lot of additional info and great suggestions. He was very courteous and has a great personality for keeping people entertained. Highly recommend him.

Cape Town with Tim. My family hired Tim for two days of touring around Cape Town. He was experienced and knowledgeable. He took us to the wine country and to the Cape of Good Hope. We had an amazing experience with fantastic food, great conversation, and spectacular views of the coast. Tim was the epitome of a what we wanted in a tour guide - he brought us to places that were unique and interesting while having the education and knowledge to explain the history and background of the areas we visited. He also provided suggestions of places to visit in our free time based on our interests - he helped us buy tickets for a rugby game, suggested trails for hiking up Table Mountain, and found an amazing store/museum for us to look at Tanzanite jewelry. I would highly recommend hiring Tim as a tour guide.

Highly recommend. We had a fabulous day touring the Cape Town peninsula with Tim. We booked via email and from the first contact to saying good bye we had an excellent service. Tim has a natural friendly style and is very well informed about the area. His clean and comfortable vehicle (VW T5 minibus) had supplies such as water and snacks - plus some umbrellas (which were needed for this Cape Town winter weather). We were picked up from our hotel as planned at 9am and we followed his route around the cape which took advantage of the (little) sun and meant we avoided most buses/coaches. There were four of us and we feel this tour was good value for money. It is worth investing more in a personal tour and having a guide meant we learnt a lot more about the area and its history. We had a really good day and we are sure you will too! Many thanks to Tim.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We have just returned from a very wet and windy Cape Town. However all was not lost as we had booked a Peninsula Tour with Tim at Friends of Dorothy and we were in for a real treat. The weather was not perfect at all times throughout our day but Tim made the day a wonderful experience. He was knowledgeable on all aspects of our drive, from the flora and fauna to the history and the more up to date events in the area. We learnt a great deal and enjoyed this day out immensely, I would recommend his company and the drive. Thanks Tim.

Lovely Day. We recently visited Cape Town to see our daughter who is studying at University of Cape Town. I contacted Tim prior to arriving and described what we were interested in doing - a tour of the wine country, preferably including some wineries that were a little more off the beaten path. Tim picked us up at our hotel around 9:00 am and we headed towards the Stellenbosch area. We toured three wineries over the course of the day including a lovely one with a Japanese style tea garden. Tim was knowledgeable and entertaining; frequently quoting poetry to illustrate a point. Over the course of the day, we chatted about wine, history, the areas we were visiting and a wide range of subjects. He made changes to our itinerary as we went based on comments we made. For example, after I talked about how much I loved to cook, he added in a stop at an olive farm where we sampled different olive oils made on site. Tim sent me a list of restaurant recommendations and I had selected three that I thought we would enjoy. We had a wonderful lunch at La Petite Ferme which was one of the three on my list. All in all the day fit perfectly with what I had envisioned and I would highly recommend Tim for anyone interested in doing a tour.
