Wonderful Trip. I just returned from the 2 day trip. My group was lucky enough to have Paul as our guide and thus a wonderful time.Would gladly both recommend to others and go again myself!!

This trip allowed you to see and experience a variety of activities and scenery!. The trip allowed me to experience a large portion of south Africa. I saw a lot of animals and wonderful scenery! Our guide, Paul, was VERY knowledgable and excited to share each of our experiences! I was the only one from the group who did the optional crocodile cage diving and while the others were waiting, Paul was on the boardwalk above taking pictures of me and the crocs! That was very nice of him! We were never rushed along the trip- he made sure we knew it was OUR trip that we paid for! Great trip and I would highly recommend it if you have the time and would like to see and experience South Africa in a unique way!

The 4 day Garden Route tour. It was a great experience, and you definetly need to go on the trip! I enjoyed every bit of it. It is ideal for people travelling alone and wanting to meet new people, but it is suitable for both young and older couples with an open mind as well. The only thing I could request a bit more of is better structure, as it seemed like we were always in a hurry to go to the next place.

Garden Route 4 Day Tour. The best weekend of my 3 months in South Africa!! What an adventure!! Maudi is one of the best tour guides I've ever had. He was fun to hang out with and very professional, a perfect combination. He really wanted the whole tour group to have a great time, and that really makes a difference. Each day was filled with adventure. I walked with elephants, explored caves, rode an ostrich, canoed in paradise, met local children on a beach, bungie jumped the worlds highest bungy bridge, and got to see my favourite African animals on a game drive!! It's the Cheetah by the way :) Hotspots offers many different tours, so you can choose what you'd like to do/see and how long you'd like your trip to be. I'm Canadian, and the other members of the tour group were Swiss, Russian and German, ranging in age from 19 to 55. It was an excellent way to meet other travellers and learn about the countries they come from. I would definitely recommend Hotspots2c!
Perfect weekend!. There is not a lot more to add to the title! Well organised, great people, very friendly tour guide, well chosen places..... I had a really good time, thanks everyone!

Great hotspots. I was on the Three days garden route and safari tour. The tour was great and very interesting. Xenni is a great guide, being always in a good mood and spreading his positivity among the group. Xenni has also explaind many things while driving during the tour. All hotspots have been excellent. I just can recommend the tour. Thanks to all .. Miriam

Garden Route Trip. Thank you for the amazing places that you recommend for us. we love adventure and you offered us different types of adventure that we really enjoyed it. Guest Houses that you offered us were amazing!!!!!We missed South Africa after this Trip. everyday, me and my husband say "Good morning beautiful world!!!" Thank you "Zeny Yasbek" you make the trip really brilliant!!!

Western Cape and Garden Route. I had the absolute best time on both of these trips, the 3-day Western Cape and the 4-day garden route tours! Isaac(3-day) and Xenny (4-day) were incredibly FANTASTIC guides and became great friends! As well as teaching us so much they were so fun as well! This is why i did two tours with Hotspots, because the guides really did all they could to make it great, by being flexible and chilled taking time to stop off and spend longer time at certain points on the tour we enjoyed, asking us if everything was okay and would let us do any extra activities we would like along the way! I went with the budget option, which meant i stayed in dorm rooms in hostels, and this was definitely a great option, as not only did you make friends on your own tour, but also could make friends with other travelers in the hostels. All the hostels were very well chosen, as they allowed the tour to flow seamlessly without any long trips to get there, and they were clean and comfortable!I'm so so glad I went on these fantastic tours, and despite originally thinking I would never do a bungy jump, I did the world's highest! And it was phenomenal! These tours I will always remember, I saw some of the most beautiful sites of South Africa, had lots of fun, and made really great friends. All round, exactly what you want!

big 5 safari game. I travelled from Cape Town to make a safari game.Our guide Paul did a great job.But, it wasn't a comfortable bus, I think.It was a long way to get there, the bus was crowded and had a tiny space into.About the safari, I think it should have more animals, because most of then were hidden in the bush or were far away.But it was good anyway.
Garden Route. Awesome trip! Had an amazing time. Xenny our guide did a wonderful job and was friendly, informative and fun!

The best way to see the beautiful country of south africa. I recently took the 3 day western cape tour and the 4 day garden route tour. Both trips were impeccably well organised and ran smoothly. The busses are comfortable and the guides are flexible with stop-offs and are even happy to alter the itinerary if needed. Our guides marlyon (western cape) and Issac (garden route) were friendly, knowledgable and easy going and in both cases really made the trip! Issac even bought us all an ice cream! The tours are very reasonably priced considering how much is on offer and include all accommodation. We opted for the budget accommodation and stayed in dorms in hostels. All the hostels were clean and comfortable although sometimes a little busy! I would probably opt for the pricier option of private rooms in future. We saw so much of the beautiful countryside and never felt rushed or "herded" around. The guides let you enjoy every stop and never hurry you on. We met wonderful people on the trips...some who I will keep up with forever! Hotspots tours would be ideal for first time travellers, students or those travelling alone x

One Day Wine Trip. This was an AMAZING trip! Our guide was SPECTACULAR. We got to see all the major sights along the route as well as some extra stops that just made our adventure complete. Morrie, our guide, really added to the enjoyment of our tour. Cape Point, seals, penguins, wine, what else can you ask for? The trip was memorable! :) :)

Fabulous weekend!!. I went on the 2 day safari trip while on a recent trip to south africa. It was definitely my most memorable weekend packed full of exciting things. We did a game drive on the first day before spending the night in a fab hostel where we had the tastiest braii (big BBQ) and played pool in the hostel bar all evening where we mad plenty of friends. The following day was crammed full of unforgettable experiences. We got to spend the morning with 3 elephants where we hand fed them and got to have photos while sitting on their knees or backs. It was incredible to get up so close to these majestic animals. From there we went to an ostrich farm which is definitely an experience you won't forget as you see people ride them and attempt to kiss them. Finally we stopped at cango animal ranch where you ge to see lots of different animals in a zoo like setting but get taken round by a guide which is very informative. Here we were abl to pay a little extra to get up close with some of the animals including white tiger cubs, lemurs, snakes or cheetahs. I spent time cuddling the cheetahs which was unbelievable they were so tame and purred away while you stroked them. Fabulous company to do a safari with as you get to do so many more things with them.

2 DAYS WILD SAFARI. During the month of October 2011 I went on a 2 day wild safari trip together with some students that were in Cape Town to study English.We had an amazing time .We had Isaac as our driver and he was so friendly but professional because he always answered our questions.I'll be in CT again in July and have already arranged a 7 day Garden Route Trip with 12 students from Italy.

An incredible experience!. I'm brazilian and i've been on a 4 days garden route tour by the time i was studying english in cape town, and it was simply amazing, the vehicle is very comfortable, our guide, xenny is one of the nicest person i've ever met, he gave us a lot of tips about best places to visit, to eat, and shared with us a lot of histories of south africa, the most beautiful place i've seen. I also made some good friends on this tour, people from another countries that i hope to keep in touch. IT WAS AWESOME!

Amazing 3 day tour with Isaac. I recently went on the 3 day tour of the western cape and had an amazing time on this tour. We had Isaac as our driver and he was first class - he added some comedy to the trip, was able to advise us on how to get the best value for our money and was always at hand to answer any questions. The door-to-door pick up is a nice touch as there is no hassle in getting to a meeting point for a specific time! Highlights of the trip would have to be the cage diving with the great white sharks - a must do for any adrenaline junkies out there - and just generally traveling around the coast taking in the amazing scenery of south africa. Definitely recommend this tour and this company and plan on taking another safari tour with them in the near future.

Nice people and excellent service. I booked with them a 2 DAY WILDLIFE SAFARI tour and a Shark Cage diving and they were all the time friendly and nice, each question I had they nicely answered, and I just can be thankfull to them as I really had a good time during those 2 tours.I would highly recommend them!!

AMAZING GARDEN ROUTE WITH HOTSPOTS2C. Hi everyone! I did a Garden Route tour (4days) by hotspots2c from Cape Town! It was an absolutely unforgetable experience! I have enjoyed it very much!!!We visited so many wonderful places and main attaractions of the Route (Cape Town-Mossel Bay- Wilderness-Knysna-Tsitsikama National Park-Natures Valey-Pletentberg Bay-Oudtshoorn) in 4 days! We did canoe on a river, visited elephant park (fed them and walked with them), ostrich farm, jumbed from the highest bridge (260 m)- bungy jumpinig, got some tan on the beach, intered the Camgo Cave! Every day was an adventure! Organization and accomodation (backpackers) were perfect! Our guide, Johan, was very knowledgeable and flexible. He tried to do everything in the best way and comfortable for the people! Highly recommend to do this tour to everyone who comes to South Africa!I think that this is the best way to visit Garden Route if you do not have a car or can not drive. Cost of a trip was absolutely affordable. Thank you very much for this trip! Karina, 24 years, Russia

Great Day With Rob. We had the good fortune of spending our first full day in CapeTown with Rob. We thought we'd be too tired to fully appreciate our private tour, but we were so wrong. Rob is an extremely educated, interesting and engaging guide. We spent the first 15 minutes discussing what would be most interesting for us personally. We loved that this day was tailor made to our liking. We had many opportunities to stop in different areas in and around CapeTown. There was no question that Rob couldn't answer, and his insights into everything from people to food to history were enlightening and intelligent. He shared his own background which helped us fully understand the complexity of the South Africa people, as well as showing us the similarities between all people. He was willing to stop at a moment's notice for anything from a photo op to an impromptu shopping spree. We have no hesitation in recommending Rob to anyone, regardless of age or interests, for a memorable touring experience! Thanks Rob:)

Best private tour of Cape Twon. I first contacted Rob a year ago when I was planning our trip to South Africa and from the very first email I knew we were in for a treat. Rob's honesty, friendliness and desire to help us make this a trip of a lifetime was apparent from the start. During the next few months Rob and I stayed in touch and he was so helpful when I asked him about the best restaurants to try and things I should know before we came.We only had three days in CT and Rob greeted us with a smile and a map of the area on our second day. He was genuinely interested in personalizing our day to fit our needs and interests. For example we were more interested in seeing what the locals do, the best vineyard, restaurants and city highlights than standing in line to go to the top of Table Mountain.One of our stops was the Botanical Gardens and we were thrilled to have Rob explain the fauna and its importance to the ecosystem of South Africa and CT. It was a beautiful park and wish we could have spend more time exploring with him. We went to the Penguin colony where we learned their plight and the dwindling numbers. Our highlight was a respite from the day when we stopped t a beautiful winery and sampled some of the local wines, relaxed and took in the view before goign to lunch and one of Rob's favourite places that we would never have known about.While we did not go to up Table Mountain we did go to the hill (forgot the name) across from it and took beautiful pix of the mountain and city below. Rob also took us to a special surprise to learn about what can be done to recycle tea bags and help locals earn a living. That is all I am going to say as I don't want to ruin the surprise.I am sure I have left some things out??? We absolutely loved CT and there is no doubt we will be back to spend a month next time. If you are looking for a knowledgeable guide and a friend for your special trip you don't need to look any further. Rob was amazing and made our time in CT very special. My only regret is we did not hire him again the next day to take us to the Winelands as he has a farm (winery) there and would have definitely given us the 5 star tour there too. Instead we had rented a car but with his recommendations of some incredible wineries we had a wonderful two days in Franschhoek and Stellenbosch too.Thank you Rob.

A Great Day Out. Fabulous day with a wonderful guide, not only for the wine tasting, but also birdlife and South African culture. Highly recommended, especially for visitors new to the Cape Town region.

Favorite Wine Tour. We spent two days with Rob touring the wine regions outside of Cape Town, including both Franschhoek and Stellenbosch. Rob was very knowledgeable about the areas as he actually grew up nearby. Also, he makes his own wine so had plenty of connections so we were able to see some behind the scenes aspects of wine making we probably wouldn't have been able to do otherwise. I can not overstate how beautiful it is here..it far exceeded our expectations. Rob was also loads of fun and we had plenty of good conversation with him. Great wine, great people, great scenery...what else could you ask for?

Best private tour guide !. Rob took us on our tours of the Cape and its surrounding areas and separately, wine country just outside of Cape Town. His insight and knowledge of the area was unbelievable and he was fantastic with our kids (age 14 and 11). He grows wine so his insight into the wine part of the tour was especially good. He knows food in the area very well and took us to great lunch places and guided us to excellent dinner places as well. He knows so much that he educated my girls on several aspects of the tour. He is really an engaging and fun person to spend time with. His tour really helped make our trip outstanding.

Wonderful day. Just returned from a personalised day tour with Rob. Everything about it was top class from comfort knowledge to friendship.Feel we met as strangers and left as friends.Rob was punctual unhurried polite, humorous and most of all knowledgable on everything. Hid attitude to life is just so great. His love for his city and its people lovely to see.So glad to have found this on here and would not hesitate to recommend his services.Rob thank you again - 5 star
very informative and knowledgeable.. we were well educated on Cape Town and area by the time we finished our tour for the day. weather wasn't cooperative but Rob made the most of the day.

The best guide in Cape Town. Our group of four spent two delightful and informative days with Rob, doing the Peninsula and City tours. He is the consummate professional: prompt, organized, knowledgeable and very, very pleasant. He managed potential conflicts with grace, was very straightforward in answering our many questions about the current political and social situations in S. Africa....and gave us terrific restaurant recommendations too! Finally, he gave us some tips on the rest of our trip, which were very helpful. Would definitely recommend Rob for a tremendous experience.

Rob Davidowitz, Excellent Guide for Capetown Area. Rob Davidowitz was our private guide for one day in the Winelands, outside of Cape Town, South Africa. In addition to being a wealth of knowledge about wines and the history of South Africa, Rob is just one of the most knowledgeable people I've ever met. However, Rob will never bore you with details unless you ask him to! It was very interesting to spend the day someone who was born during apartheid and lived through it all those years. Rob will not take you to the typical places in the Winelands area (unless you want him to). Instead, we went to a vineyard and did a very informative food and wine pairing as well as a very interesting tour of the winemaking facility. In addition we went to a local chocolatier for a fun and educational chocolate tasting (I'm a chocaholic and I loved this stop). I can't say enough nice things about Rob and I highly recommend him as a guide when you visit Cape Town!!

Unforgettable trip to Table Mountain National Park. In the beginning of our tour Rob showed us a map of the region we wanted to see and tailored the tour to our interests. Seems like a small thing, but it was just one of the things he did to make our trip more enjoyable. Rob was absolutely FANTASTIC! Extremely attentive at all times; taking care of things down to the smallest detail. It is amazing how much we packed into a single day. His stories and descriptions of the sites and the landmarks were excellent. He truly went "above and beyond" in so many ways.We learned so much from him and had a lot of fun in a process too! We really enjoyed our time with him. Nina @ Michael BNew York City

Fantastic personalised tour. We were only visiting Cape Town for a couple of nights so wanted to fit in as much as possible. After searching the Internet we found a few companies offering generic tours of the most popular areas. However, when we found Rob on trip advisor we thought he sounded fantastic so even rearranged our shark cage dive so we could go with him.Rob certainly did not disappoint. He is an extremely knowledgeable man who was able to tell us all about the history and culture of South Africa. As well as imparting a wealth of knowledge about each location visited.He personalised the whole day to our preferences which was fantastic as we got to see abit of everything - botanical gardens, boulders beach penguin colony, wine tasting, Chapmans Coast drive, and a surprise visit to a local teabag project. We had a truly memorable experience which was interesting for the whole family.Thank you very much Rob from the Button family!

Excellent guide for a visit to The Cape. Bob was very flexible and tailored our tour of Cape Town and Paarl to meet our needs. He had a lot of experience of South Africa with great anecdotes which kept us amused.We would heartily recommend his guide services.Thank you Rob for a great day out.

Cape Town Area, Whale watching, Penguin colonies, Wineries . Rob was AMAZING as a tour guide and friend. It was like we knew one another forever! He was bright, engaging, highly educated and passionate about every tour! He provided us with information on our "off days" which gave us the opportunity to tour Cape Town and experience the finest eateries, best kept secrets, and the greatest deals!! Thanks Sooo much Rob!!!

Cape Town tour with Rob. We just finished two full days touring Cape Town with Rob. Just like every other reviews says, the tour was amazing. Rob is very friendly and VERY knowledgable in many areas. From wine to African political history to plants to social action ....the list goes on and on. Cape Town has a beautiful history and Rob is passionate about his heritage. He shares it all to you. If you are lucky enough to book with him DO SO. I feel like we lucked out in Cape Town. And we will return to this beautiful city!!

Amazing time in Cape Town. We booked Rob for two days while we visited Cape Town for the first time. It was the best decision we made. Rob made sure we saw exactly what we were interested in. The team talk at the start of the day was such a great way to plan our day. The maps were so helpful giving us an over view of the route. But best of all Rob is so informative and his love of his city is fantastic. You could not get a better guide. We had the best time and would definitely book again. Highlight for us both was the behind the scenes at the wine farm and the amazing wine tasting. You have to try it!!

Excellent, fun, and informative. We had a wonderful time with Rob. He was so knowledgeable and passionate about Cape Town. He was incredibly helpful and went so far as to make recommendations for other activities on days he was not available to tour with us. He really helped make our trip to Cape Town one of the most memorable vacations we have ever had.Thanks so much Rob, we had the best time with you!

A highlight of our South African visit. It is almost impossible to better a tour of any region of the world than one that is conducted by a well informed local. Rob is highly recommended. He is encyclopedic in his knowledge of the area's history, culture, wines, foods and local vegetation highlights. He seems to know most people personally whether at the Botanic Gardens, a restaurant, winery or tourist site. He has a pleasant, friendly manner and it is a pleasure to spend the day in his company. We went on two of Rob's tours - the Winelands Tour and the Peninsula & Constantia Winelands Tour - both were excellent. I wish we had had the time to take other tours offered by Rob. We learnt so much about the region, its history, wines and food - Rob was the high point in our week in Cape Town.

Always a good Time with Rob😊. That's the second time i rent Rob's service. He is always an efficient and nice tour guide. He will ask and propose you different things to do and to see according to your wishes. Always a pleasure to share with him the history, the knowledge of this town that he really love. We did several things for my daughter of 8 and also for me. Fees of 4000 zar for a day but you won't regret that. We will come back again in Capetown and definately will contact Rob again as there are still plenty of things we haven't done.

Two fantastic days in Capetown. Rob gave us two fantastic days in Capetowns surrounding areas. We had a great day in the Stellenbosch wine region - the wine tour was very interesting.Would definitely recommend Robs unique pairing with food. Ryan's was a fabulous choice for lunch.2nd day to Hermanus was equally as good the day began with a detour to Newlands cricket ground ( special request) then a stop off at a local speciality food farm shop - we had a superb lunch with a sea view which under normal circumstances you would be able to see the whales but as the sea was choppy, this was not possible, We had a magnificent journey back via the coast. Rob answered our many questions and gave us an insight to the culture of South Africa. Next time we return to Capetown we would not hesitate to book another day or two with Rob.

Imagine having the Cape's top ambassador as your host for the day. Cape Town and its surroundings are among the most beautiful places in the world, and the day-long tour Rob put together and led us on deepened our appreciation -- not only for the beauty of the region, but for its history, geography, its people and cultures, its challenges. A keen conversationalist, Rob combined his love for the Cape, his wide-ranging experiences and interests, and knowledge of the area to create a unique day for us. If we are ever so fortunate to be able to travel to Cape Town again, we'd be sure to set aside a day with Rob.

Amazing, wonderful visit to Cape Town thanks to Rob!. What can I say about Rob that hasn't already been said? He is a wonderful, knowledge and genuinely fine person. Like many others, I contacted Rob based on all of the positive reviews he had received in Trip Advisor. He was professional and helpful from the start, quickly responding to my emails and providing great recommendations on everything from hotels and restaurants in addition to tour options. We really appreciated his candidness that he wouldn't take us to the typical 'tourist spots' that we could see on our own but rather provide us with a unique, customized 'experience' based on our interests. We spent two days with Rob touring the wine land and the Cape. His background, knowledge and experience allowed us to gain insight to these beautiful areas that we would never have received touring on our own. Thank you Rob for giving us an experience of a lifetime that we will never forget!

Excellent tour of Capetown and around. Rob is the most informative and courteous guide, I have met. He took very good care of us during the two days he was with us. He is well informed about most locations/ routes in Capetown. In fact you can ask him about any topic and he can give his views on it. Rob gave us a very good tour of cape peninsula and the city. His car was well maintained and very comfortable. I would highly recommend Rob to anyone visiting Capetown.

Cape of Hope day trip. We had a really great day out with Rob during our full day trip down to the Cape of Hope. He was both organised, friendly and very knowledgeable about every subject we quizzed him on. The stops he helped us pick for the day were all great - especially his choice of lunch stop - amazing. Highly recommend stopping to meet the Tea Bag team - that is such a great success story. Our family can't recommend Rob highly enough - just book him early!

Two days of wonderful fascination. Following the excelent reviews and recommendations on here we secured Rob's services for two full tailor-made days around the Cape Peninsular and wine-making regions and were very pleased that we did. Rob met us at our hotel and together we went through the options for the day's touring. His love and knowledge of the country and people is second to none and we saw places and wildlife that we would never have seen had we tried to do everything by ourselves. Our first day was to Groot Constantia for a look at the house and museum, then round through Simonstown to Boulder Beach for the penguins and on to the Cape of Good Hope itself where we even saw a wild ostrich. Lunch at a farm restaurant was outstanding. Our second day was to Stellenbosch where Rob treated us to a personal tour of a winery and a fascinating lesson in the local wines and how to appreciate them with different foods, an experience that we shall never forget. On to Franschhoek for lunch and afterwards a visit to a chocolatier. Our only regret is that the tour was so captivating that we didn't have enough time to visit all the other attractions in this wonderful area. We cannot recommend Rob too highly and when we return to this beautiful region we shall certainly seek his services again.

Guided tour of Stellenbosch wine producers. Well organised, comfortable and interesting tour to different wine producers in and around Stellenbosch, including Great Constantia and Babylon toren. Rob was very knowledgeable and looked after us extremely well. Would definitely highly recommend him!

great way to see the sights. We , family of 4 with 2 teenage girls , had 2 brilliant days with Rob as our guideHe was very knowledgable and professional and bespoked both our Peninsula tour and Wine tasting tour to suit our preferencesWe all had a great time and also learnt about the areaThoroughly recommend Rob to anyone wishing to see the sights

good food, good company, wealth of information and lots of laughs!. Just wanted to say thank-you so much for an amazing last day of our trip to Capetown - if we come back we'll make sure to do a few more trips with you!ReviewWe arranged this based on all the reviews on this site and were not disappointed! Rob met us at our hotel, planned the whole day according to what we were interested in and had a lot to offer for all tastes.We stayed away from the "touristy" spots as we had seen them on our own earlier - but still had SO much to see. Rob is very knowledgeable about so much in the area and has such an easygoing manner that it made the day all that much more special.We very much regret that we had left this to the last day and did not spend more time touring with him. We left not only having enjoyed the day but feeling like we had made a new friend.HIGHLY recommend this to anyone as the trip will be tailored to your tastes.

The best decision we made in Cape Town. Here's a little secret: On our third morning in Cape Town, we thought about cancelling our trip with Rob. My wife and I had gone on tours the previous two days, both very good, and we were tired and not feeling especially well. We had already booked the day's tour, though, so we decided to power through. Thank goodness. Our day with Rob in February 2016 was, by far, the most fun/educational/culturally enlightening experience in Cape Town. We told Rob in advance that we were interested in a tour focusing on South Africa's food culture. We went to a terrific breakfast at a bacon-themed restaurant, followed by a walk around Central Cape Town, including food markets and shops. Rob, knowing we were slightly under the weather, made plenty of time to stop frequently and adjusted the pace to our energy levels. After lunchtime, we headed toward a winery, where we enjoyed cheese and some very good wine, in between Rob broadening our minds with Cape Town and South Africa culture, politics and customs. He can speak intelligently on many, many topics and has his own interesting back story, but perhaps more impressive, Rob is a great listener. Almost without us realizing it, he customized a day to our personalities and interests, picking up little hints in our conversations and steering our tour toward sights and experiences that would satisfy those interests. You know how sometimes after a day-long tour, you're kind of ready for it to end? It's easy to be tired and ready to just move on. Well after our day with Rob, which lasted from around 9 a.m. till about 6 p.m., we were sad there wasn't more on the to-do list or another day with Rob. If we had cancelled the tour, we would've never known how much we would've missed. As it is, I have only one regret: I should've booked all three days with Rob. He's the absolute best tour guide I've ever had.

Do yourself a favour and book a day or two with Rob. . What can I say that hasn't already been said? Super nice guy, knowledgeable and friendly. Capetown is wonderful and hiring Rob as your guide will only improve your experience. We had a lovely day.

Rob Davidowitz - Guide Extraordinaire. We used Rob for 2 days and frankly have nothing bad to say about him.From our first approach we were impressed with the speed of response to emails and that Rob actually answers your questions.Suggested two full day itineraries which we broadly followed.On first meeting he was on time, well presented and took time explaining route, what options we had and worked with us to map out each day.One day was spent touring Cape Town and surrounding areas including the Penguin Colony, a must and Table Mountain and the second in the Winelands.Rob is extremely knowledgable, friendly and regularly checked with us how each tour was going. We have done a number of Private Tours and Rob is up there with the very best.

Cape Town and more!. Don't come to Cape Town without spending at least one day with Rob. It is much more than a tour of the highlights - the ones you actually plan with Rob before you start your day - it is so much more. His narritive on each and every area we visited exceeded our expectations. His background and experiences shed light on so much more than we could have learned on our own. Pleasant, friendly, professional & a true gentleman.

Friends, wine & food. Cape Town is a fabulous destination , it's even better when you have Rob Davidowitz leading the way. He is the ultimate authority on Cape Town & South Africa, if you choose the wine country, I think he owns it. Everybody is his friend and you get to see and taste everything, we had a great time. I really think he should raise his prices because he goes over the top and charges so little, we loved Davis and so will you!

Stellenbosch and Cape tours over 2 amazing days with Rob. If you want an authentic, personalized tour of Cape Town and surrounds, Rob is your guide. He is warm, friendly, extremely knowledgeable and very flexible. Rob makes you part of the planning process to ensure that everyone sees what interests them. We travelled in absolute comfort as Rob thinks of every detail. We even had wonderful, cold water whenever we needed it. The stops were always of interest and most memorable!We hope you will be fortunate enough to book Rob for your tour. He is a treasure. He also gives great restaurant suggestions! Our tours were full day and we had many photo ops. Wear good walking shoes and bring a hat. Enjoy!

What A Day!. It's all true! We, and two other couples, traveled comfortably for a day on the peninsula. After discussing the options, the day is defined. The tour was fun. We saw the bounty, beauty and learned the importance of Cape Town throughout it's history. Best tour guide we have used. Will definitely use on our next visits. Bill and Amy

Cape Town including peninsula. My wife and I travelled two days with Rob in Cape Town peninsula. We have not had a better tour guide on our numerous travels anywhere in the world. Rob is a pleasant person to be with and his knowledge of the area is second to none. His wine is too.Richard and Marie

Great day with Robert. Believe the great reviews Rob gets. He is fun, informative, flexible and full of good ideas for a great day out. We would recommend having him for a full day as time passes so quickly with him. Rob meets you at your hotel, discusses options with you and then keeps you entertained and informed all day. you will see so much more with him than without him!

Awesome day. Rob is an incredibly fun, energetic and knowledgable guide. He listened to our wants and planned the day accordingly. The time with him flew by! Best way to see Cape Town area. I would highly recommend him and definitely use his services again if we are lucky enough to return to the area!

Great way to see all of Cape Town. My husband and I booked 2 trips with Rob while we were honeymooning in Cape Town. We did a half-day city tour and a full day trip to the Cape of Good Hope. With a week in Cape Town, we thought it would be nice to have a mix of guided tours and time to independently wander around. We also thought that a one-on-one tour would help us see more of Cape Town, rather than a guided tour with a large group.We had the absolute BEST time with Rob. Each day we chatted before our tour began, so that Rob could learn a little about us and our interests. He was so knowledgeable about Cape Town history and took us to a few placesin the city that only the locals would really know about. On our full day trip to the Cape of Good Hope, we talked through possible pit stops based on what we'd like to see - including the African penguin colony, lunch on a self-sustaining farm, and Chapman's Peak.Not only did we learn a lot, but we found ourselves laughing a whole lot, too. Rob is funny and personable. He loved learning about our culture and life at home just as much as we liked learning about South African culture. He even gave us some great suggestions of activities to do in our free time, and restaurants to check out that were around our hotel. We took him up on a lot of these suggestions and they did not disappoint.If we have the opportunity to return to Cape Town for another visit, I would absolutely find time to tour with Rob again.

Excellent Choice. Rob is great. Not only is he a fun guy to spend the day with, he is also a body of knowledge on a very wide range of subjects (from local wines to South African foreign policy). I cannot recommend this guy enough!

Strongly Recommended!. Prior to travelling to Cape Town I found Rob Davidowitz through the significant number of positive reviews on tripadvisor which I am very glad I did. Rob is a very friendly, personable and knowledgeable person. He came to collect my husband and I from our hotel in the morning and we got on straight away. We spoke about what are passions were, where we were coming from and what are expectations were for the day. Together we planned what was best for us in a limited timeframe. He made sure that we saw Cape Town as a local rather than a tourist.We really enjoyed the day and his company. We strongly recommend him!

Most Informative Two Days in Cape Town. Rob came highly recommended on this site, he is a wealth of knowledge and very personable. My husband and I only had two days in Cape Town so we wanted to make the most of it. Rob fulfilled everything we wanted plus much more! He personalized our two days and gave us many different options to chose from. We highly recommend him.

2 great days. Rob is the best tour guide I have ever had, and as a constant traveler I have had many!He knowledgeable, easy going, warm and friendly. And he knows all the best places to eat! I recommend him without reservation. You will have a wonderful time, and really feel like got to know the city.

Great Tour Guide. Rob was a wonderful tour guide who made our day tour very special. He was incredibly knowledgeable and just seems to know everything about everything which was wonderful. He took us the Cape Point spots we wanted to see.

Tour of Kirstenbosch, Constantia and Hout Bay with Rob Davidowitz. My wife and I visited South Africa in October 2015. Rob Davidowitz was recommended to us by friends as a knowledgeable tour guide in Cape Town. Our original intention was to have Rob show us historic Cape Town, but a large labour demonstration in the downtown area dictated a change of plans. Rob came up quickly with an alternative. Our first stop was Kirstenbosche National Botanical Garden. Rob's knowledge of the myriad plants including their historical uses was impressive.Rob then took us to Beau Constantia winery and got us admitted before normal opening time. The view of the tablelands below and the wine tastings were outstanding.Next, we visited the Steenberg Estate and ate lunch at their "Sixteen82 Bistro". The Angelfish in tomato and chickpea stew was delicious.Finally, Rob escorted us to the T-Bag handicraft factory in Hout Bay. This cottage industry based on the use of donated used tea bags supports several local artisans and their artwork is quite unique.Rob was courteous, knowledgeable and professional throughout and has an infectious love for his homeland. We had a wonderful time sightseeing and conversing with him about South Africa. We would recommend Rob most highly

Great tour with a guide who feels like an old friend. We had an amazing 1/2 day tour of Cape Town and Constantia with Rob during our Honeymoon. Rob is incredibly friendly and easy to get along with - from the minute you meet him you'll feel like you are reuniting with an old friend. He's also very attentive and follows up with you for anything you may have discussed during your trip.We had lunch at La Colombe which was fantastic, and then on to a couple of wineries where Rob's passion and knowledge of wine really made for a great time. He added so much background and information to each wine we tasted that it made for a great experience - much better than what the server at the wine farms told us about the estate and different wines. I highly recommend Rob and will be referring friends and family who make the way to SA to enlist his services.Thanks Rob for an amazing day!

Wonderful three days in Capetown . We( three Couples) spent three days with Rob, sightseeing the city, the Cape and the wine regions. We have travelled to many places on all continents. We often utilize private guides. We have never encountered a guide as knowledgeable and enthusiastic as Rob. His intelligence and sense of humor made the trip very special. His tour was customized to our wishes we learned a lot, ate well and saw many beautiful places away from the crowds of tourist buses.Highly recommend!

Rob is the key to experiencing Cape Town. I only had one full day to visit Cape Town. Rob not only was the highlight of my South Africa visit, he created memories of a lifetime. He spent time upfront to get to know me and to learn what mattered to me. He then fashioned a day in Cape Town that I will never forget. He taught me about the history and challenges faced by SA, He showed me the majestic beauty and natural wonders of Cape Town but most memorably he introduced me to local people, vintners, fishermen, craftsmen and others, who told the real story of this destination. No matter what question I asked, he attentively responded with informative and meaningful responses. Rob is the consummate guide who you would be fortunate to experience.

Tour designed just for you.. Rob was an awesome tour guide. Allows you to decide what you are interested in seeing, then develops the day around what you want. He is very personable and interesting and gives you a true flavor of Cape Town. Highly recommend!

Nice full day tour of the Cape Town peninsula with Rob. We did a full day peninsula tour with Rob and really enjoyed our day. Rob is very knowledgeable, he happily discusses any subjects from botanical, food to South African politics, which makes the visit even more informative. Yes Rob`s tour are expensive, but totally worth the price.

Fun, interesting, knowledgeable guide. We spent two days with Rob touring vineyards, a brewery, and the peninsula. Each day was special and the sites were so varied. Rob has a wonderful sense of history and does his absolute best to share his knowledge - whether it be of making a good champagne or finding the best fish in the village or appreciating efforts to empower the various communities.

Excellent tours. We spent 2 days with Rob - day 1 was a tour of Stellenbosch with wine and a chocolate tasting; day 2 was a tour of the Cape Peninsula. Rob provided a wealth of information about the areas we visited and on a variety of other topics. He has a very diverse background of business and travel experiences that he brings to the table to keep things interesting. Before we started out for our tours, he gave us an overview of where we would be going and what our options were for the day. We had the best wine tasting with him at Villiera Wines - we got a behind the scenes view plus a tasting with information on food pairing. We keep talking about how great it was! We would highly recommend doing a tour with Rob - we can't wait to go back to Cape Town and would definitely choose him again (I still want to visit the gardens with the botanist!).

Fabulous knowledge of Cape Town and South Africa. We spent 1 1/2 days touring Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula with Rob. Like all good guides, he knows the history, culture, politics, flora & fauna, etc. of his area. His personality is over the top and makes the time totally enjoyable. We especially enjoyed meeting a pair of fish mongers in Simon's Town who were total characters. When in downtown Cape Town he took us to a restaurant food court where we had lunch with the local office workers rather than other tourists. Although we didn't have the time to tour the wine country, it is obvious that Rob, a serious amateur winemaker, knows the industry very well.

Top Flight Personal Tour experience - Do not hesitate to book!. As many others have written before us, Rob truly delivers a personalized tour. From the time he meets you wherever you are staying where you spend the first 30 minutes talking about what is possible and discussing the direction for your day, to the drop off at the end of your day, Rob provides descriptions, history, context, and answers to all sorts of questions (and my wife is one of the Queens of questions, and Rob did not miss a beat). He loves his city, and it shows. And, by the time you return home he summarizes all of the topics you talked about and provides active links for each. Just a great experience.Like others, I booked Rob way in advance, and despite having had knee surgery the previous week, he was up driving and walking about with us from the start. His knowledge of Cape Town is great, and we really enjoyed our three days together. Whether you visit the wine country, the city, or the headlands, every day was fun and unique. Rob has an interesting and diverse personal history which helps add a lot of color and light to the places we went. One hint: He loves the unusual, so don't be shy about asking about odd duck things or places. I am sure there are other guides that do a great job in Cape Town, but you will have an amazing time with Rob, and all the 5 star ratings are well deserved.

A truly wonderful 3 days touring Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula with Rob.. Rob gave us an amazing tour of the Cape. He was so knowledgeable and entertaining with great stories, information and interesting bits of trivia. He brought the area alive and took us to some fabulous well-known and not so well-known hidden gems: from stunning vistas of the peninsula, to amazing history and buildings in Cape Town, delicious eateries and incredible local arts and crafts like Streetwires in the Bo-Kaap and Tea Bag Designs in Hout Bay. Rob is a friendly, enthusiastic guide who tailor-made the 3 day tour to our interests. I would highly recommend his tours to all visitors of Cape Town.

Not your run of the mill sightseeing tour!. All of the previous reviews sum up our exact experience with Rob. I found Rob on TA and was impressed by the reviews. I emailed Rob and his response was prompt, friendly and informative. He loved wine so I knew he was our guy. I was a little nervous when we booked 2 full days of sightseeing and he did not want a deposit but there he was ,as promised, waiting in our hotel lobby. We had 6 adults in our group and we all were amazed at his enthusiasm and knowledge about CT and South Africa. I would highly recommend Rob to anyone who wants a creative and personalized tour of the beautiful Cape Town area.

This makes 246 well deserved 5 dot Ratings. I decided to hire Rob for two days while we were in Cape Town, based on the strength of the reviews on this site. Once again, fellow reviewers, you have come through!I booked Rob about 8 months in advance of the trip, which I get the sense is a good idea, as he appears to lead a busy, full life both guiding, winemaking and traveling on his own. I asked for one day on the peninsula and one in wine lands.As others have described, the first 20-30 minutes are spent planning OUR day (not Robs). A very useful map is marked up with a combination of arrows circles and Rob's little designs as we decide what to do that day.I could go into detail about all the stops that are similar to the other reviews, but I think that its more useful to tell you that Rob's main goal is not to show you stuff. Its to challenge you, to make you think, to engage you in thoughtful intelligent conversation about the people, the food, the wine (and yes, the chocolate).We spent much of our road time discussing personal interests, politics (South African and American) and social issues. We stopped at out of the way places for lunch that gave us a local flavor. The stores and businesses we visited were definitely out of the ordinary.This is the type of experience that I think a lot of us crave when we travel... not just to have our picture taken next to some distant sign, but to make us think. Rob succeeds in doing that for you. And while he may sometimes come across as having a strong opinion, its far outweighed by his knowledge and love for the city and region he lives in.Thanks Rob!!!

Unforgettable day touring the wine country of Cape Town. Rob is an extraordinary guide and host for an unforgettable experience exploring the Cape Town wine county. After going over various options, he crafted a personalized itinerary of tours and tastings at Stellenbosch's Beyerskloof and Villiers wineries, a spectacular lunch at Kleine Zalza's Terroir then a fascinating chocolate tasting at de Villiers in Paarle with humor, insight, and a passionate love of his beloved South Africa. I could not recommend him any more highly!

Fantastic 2 Days...... Rob will be a the perfect guide for your stay in Cape town and the wineries in the surrounding areas. He is not only knowledgeable about the area and wine but also has a great knowledge of the history of his country. It was a 5 star tour and we felt absolutely taken care of. Thank you Rob for a great introduction to the area and showing us that close to your heart. John and Aleks

The Best Tour of the Peninsula that You Can Take. A girlfriend and I were traveling Cape Town. My husband was also there but with his rugby team and actually chose to spend the day with me/my friend instead of the team so that he could go on Rob's tour. That's how awesome Rob is. Although I interviewed multiple tour companies, I knew that Rob would be our guy right away. I was able to schedule everything through email, he was incredibly helpful/informative/flexible, and super easy going. When he picked us up in the morning, we went over all of our options and he tailored a trip to our interests. It's a private tour so he's able to do this and I HIGHLY recommend that. We saw such a unique side of Cape Town, and one that totally interested us personally. Since Rob is a local with endless knowledge and endless connections (it seemed that everyone knew and loved him), he took us to places off the regular path and he knew so much about the country and the areas we were in. He's incredibly friendly, funny, knowledgeable, and well-traveled. So basically he's just a great guy to spend a day with whether you're on a tour or not. We spent a whole day with him and couldn't believe how fast it went! If you're going to Cape Town and want to do any tours - choose Rob! When we compared notes with friends, he was above and beyond the best guide out there and, when I go back, I will only book him!

A wonderful day. A wonderful dayWe, a Dutch family of grandfather (73) and –mother (72), our son and his wife and our 2 grandchildren (Laura 7 and Caspar 10), have spend a wonderful day with Rob. Our meeting started with a consultation of our interests and possibilities of the adults and the children. As a result we started visiting the Kirstenbosch National Garden. Further on we visited for instance the little village Fish Hoek, Mineral World, where the children could sample coloured minerals and we visited the African pinguins of Boulder Beach. At a request of our son, Rob had organised a picnic at a beach for a very nice lunch while the children could play on the beach as well. On our way back to Cape Town we admired the landscape and got a lot of information about flora and fauna as well as answers to our questions about living in South-Africa, education etc. We can recommend Rob without any hesitation.Hans and Marjan, Ede, April 2015

Great Wine Country Tour. Rob took us on a great wine country tour, visiting several wineries and a distillery, all of which were fascinating and very good. He is extremely knowledgeable about the area and has an engaging style. Even better, he is very flexible in that we essentially changed what we wanted to see the day before the tour and that was no problem for Rob. He also guided us but was very open to our desires on what to see and when. He fully explained the time lines and what we could get done in the allotted time and let us decide.In addition Rob recommended a couple of other guides because he was not available on those days and one was excellent (a township guide) and the other very good. It was a pleasure to spend the day with Rob and we would recommend him without hesitation.

Simply The Best Holiday Experience. Rob, Thank you so much for helping us plan the perfect day with you. You are so knowledgeable and informative on your local area. It was fantastic that you sat down with us and explained all the different options for us to consider going to. We planned our perfect day and we enjoyed every minute of it. A full day of interest, laughs and many new happy memories. When we visit Capetown again, we will not hesitate to contact you again to book and see some of the remaining highlights of the region.

We're joining the chorus!. Rob's consistently great reviews drew us to him. We work in a large Washington state winery and wanted to see vineyards in Stellenbosch and enjoy their fine wines. Rob met us at our hotel, and we planned the day. We appreciated that he talked about the terrior of the areas, the wind patterns, and other environmental factors affecting the vineyards. The day was wonderful: great wine, beautiful scenery, good company. Rob's knowledgeable and personable. We wouldn't hesitate to spend more time with him.

Perfect! One of the highlights of our trip. How to challenge your tour guide, 2 kids 7 and 10 who like to run around, 2 adults and 2 seniors of which one had limited mobility.Rob did an excellent job taking us around the peninsula for a day spending time with the kids at Kirstenbosch explaining the flora, showing us around Fish hoek for a glimpse of SA life style, Simon's town and much much more. Rob knowledge about SA culture & history is amazing and one of the reasons why this was such a great day.Rob's big concern when preparing our day was how to balance the different interests in our family but he did an excellent job and my requests were not easy... like skipping the restaurant and go for a pick-nick on the beach:-)If your looking to learn, discuss, enjoy and experience look no further Rob is your ideal guide! SA is an amazing place to visit and spending a day with Rob will help you appreciate the people, history and nature even more.Rob a big thanks for a wonderful day and hope that our path will cross again.Hans, Marike and family. Baie Dankie

Perfect day. Spent a full day with Rob, a very symaptic and well informed gentelman who took hisntime and effort to teach us about wine and wine making and also gave us a lot of information about S.A in an very honest way.Not cheap but high quality all the way and we had a very good day in his company.Higly recomended if you you want alot of info and and can manage a steep learing curve.Rob is a gentleman that will look after you more than very well.Higly recomended in all ways but prepare youreself a bit in advance and you will get a more out off your day with Rob.He is very flexibel and there is a lot to learn if you want and can manage the program you decide to go for.Go as a smal grupp or just as a coupel is recomended.You are in the best care you can be and the wine is superb.Best from Thomas and Linda

Outstanding Private Tour Company. In two full days of touring we obtained knowledge about the Cape Town region that far excceeded anything obtainable from guide books. We were impressed not only with Rob's vast local knowledge but also with his ability to listen to our questions and communicate his replies clearly and succinctly.We were particularly impressed with the several email exchanges prior to reaching Cape Town, where Rob sought to understand our particular needs and interests. Then, at the beginning of each day Rob produced a map and explained in detail our objectives for the day. He delivered in spades.Elsewhere Rob has been described as an ambassador for Cape Town. This view we wholeheartedly endorse.

Great Experience, Six Stars !. I was lucky enough to get two tours scheduled with Rob. My tour actually started before my arrival, with Rob asking my preferences and interests. At the start of each tour Rob highlighted a map of the route and what we would achieve during day. Every attraction that I requested was worked into my tour, and much more was added in culture, history and even geology. Rob's tour is a great way to see Cape Town and surrounding peninsula. Both the city and peninsula are equally enlightening and entertaining. Rob is truly an ambassador for Cape Town. "Must Do" tour recommendation !
Customized Tour. Rob was an excellent tour guide! If you want to learn about the real Cape Town and not the cookie cutter version, book with them.

Cape Cuisine Tour - meeting wonderful people in their homes. If considering a visit to Cape Town, do yourself a favour and book your tours with Rob Davidowitz. Our group of four seasoned travellers were absolutely delighted that we chose to begin our three-week trip to South Africa with Rob's Cape Cuisine tour. We started the day with his home-cooked 'bushman's breakfast backdropped by Table Mountain, toured the inspiring Khayelitsha (township) gourmet biscuit business, and then enjoyed ethnically-diverse food-tastings and warm hospitality in family homes on opposite ends of the city. As we drove between venues, Rob provided an engaging, lively commentary and Q+A - the perfect introduction to South Africa and Cape Town. Highly recommended - if you are lucky, he will be available for more than the one day we were able to book.

Private day tour to winel lands Cape Town. Rob really was the most knowledgeable and informative guide we have encountered on our visits to countries all over the world. His pleasant and friendly manner really made the day a most memorable experience. He met our cruise ship at the port and soon whisked us away to our first visit, a delightful winery near Stelenbosch , the best wine tasting experience we have ever had. Next lunch at a delightful deli in Stelenbosch and finally a visit to a chocolate factory tasting experience.We had a brilliant day and were most thankful we had Rob to guide us, he must surely be the number one guide in Cape Town.Shirley and Robert, Denise and Robert

Excellent history lesson. Rob gave us a half day tour in Cape Town. His knowledge of the history of the country was excellent. He knew how to keep us from the crowds, which was very pleasing. The fog moved in and ended our viewing except for the beach, which was the same as any beach anywhere. He is not inexpensive, but we would definitely use him again.

Brilliant wine tour. I have to agree with everybody that Rob is a fantastic guide. We spent a fabulous day tasting wine with Rob in March 2015. Our tour was bespoke to us. We just explained what we liked and he did the rest. Like oaked Chardonnay - no worries we can stop at Glen Carlou, like chocolate - I will just add chocolate tasting at the end. This was our favourite day of the whole trip and this was down to Rob. There may be many other guides out there but there is only one Rob. What he doesn't know about wine or Cape Town in general probably isn't worth knowing. Some of his food pairings were inspired and really original. Stem ginger - wow! A truly private tour provided by a true gentleman.

Wendy Whitman. Thanks to Rob I had my 2 most amazing days in the Cape Town area getting a real feel of the country - the Peninsula tour was literally the most beautiful day I have ever spent - stunning scenery at every turn - there is no possible way you could find a better guide than Rob - he's awesome! I am bringing my whole family back so they can experience what I was so fortunate enough to - thank you Rob!

A whole new world of wine and food. This is the second time I have spent a day with Rob and was even better. He led our party (two couples) on a very personal bespoke journey off the beaten track to wine farms that we would never have discovered on our own. His knowledge of the wine industry and viticulture was second to none and he taught us that it was ok to eat and drink at the same time as long as the wine is fine! I can't recommend him highly enough and will definitely use him again.

Rob is one of a kind. We had the privilege (party of six) to spend two glorious days with Rob. First, we toured the Cape peninsula, then the Winelands. Rob was amazing, our time with him was truly well spent. He is a weath of knowledge (tied for the smartest person I've ever met) and so fun to be around. I highly recommend a tour with Rob, he brings South Africa to life!

Ate our way across Cape Town!. We did the culinary tour with Rob. It was truly a unique experience and certainly got our trip to Cape Town off to an amazing start. We learned so much about the history and culture of Cape Town, it really gave us a great foundation for the rest of our trip. Rob was very knowledgeable and truly in love with his beautiful city, with all it's complexities. I could not recommend him any more highly!

Outstanding tour experience. Rob is a wealth of knowledge and experience. He is a wine expert, historian, botanist, nature and wildlife professional. His enthusiasm and exuberance is infectious, while he is patient and informative. Touring Cape Town and the wine region with him was a great adventure!

Truly spectacular. We spent 2 whole days with Rob, The wine tour was excellent certainly opened my eyes to how food can change how wine tastes. Rob has extensive knowledge and history about the wine making industry and the history of everything Cape Town, it was 2nd to none, We had a fabulous tour with stunning scenery and a wonderful tour of the wineries, where we saw each process from start to finish. The lunch places Rob chose we excellent, food was great as was the locations (stunning).Cape Peninsular tour was extensive, we visited loads of places with Rob, he has great knowledge of history of each place, The penguins were really cute, the cape point and cape hope were great, the teabag factory was an eye opener to see how businesses are helping the local community with changing lives. I would certainly recommend Rob as your tour guide, I had a air cast fracture boot on for our stay in Cape Town and Rob never rushed us and got as close to the entrances as he could, so I did not have to walk far, even if it meant he had to go park after and run down the road by himself to return to us.When we return to Cape Town, I would make Rob my first call to book him, we had a great time Rob thanks for everything. ps BUY A DONKEY

Excelent Day Trip. Hi Rob we would like to thank you again for an excellent day trip. Your provided and informative and fun day, we especially enjoyed the history of south africa that you provided, the fish and chips we tried and the fabulous lunch.This was a great day out and you were the best tour guide. I would highly recommend Rob to anyone travelling to Cape Town if you want warm and genuine and overall great day seeing the sightsRegards Natasha ( Stables family)

A GREAT DAY OUT. We contacted Rob after reading the reviews in Tripadvisor and what a good decision that was. We had a most enjoyable day visiting 3 wineries, a chocolate tasting, a very pleasant lunch and a short stop in Stellenbosch. Our only complaint was that there wasn't enough time to visit Franschhoek & Paarl. We met a guide in the morning and said goodbye to a friend in the evening after a great day out.

Perfect day with Rob in the beautiful Cape. Rob organized a fantastic day in the Cape for my mother and me. We were driven around comfortably while visiting great places for wine tasting, sightseeing, lunch and chocolates. The Cape Town area has so much to offer, and we felt in the middle of it. Rob is a genuinely enthusiastic and warm person, who has great knowledge of the area and its products. We were lucky to see the grape harvest and could witness the process from the grape right into the pressing and the barrels. We even were able to taste during the different stages. Very interesting and special. The day was topped with a special gift for my mum and one for myself. That was a very nice gesture. Thank you Rob! We wish you all the best and maybe see you again when we visit Cape Town again in the future.
Perfect birthday!. Rob perfectly guided my husband and I through the wineries. Great day, great company, and great knowledge of geography, wine and food. Book in advance!

If you do one thing when in Cape Town..... We spent a day with Rob earlier this month whilst in Cape Town and enjoyed an unforgettable day. Robs a has a wealth of knowledge and is great company. I would 100% recommend to anyone who has a thirst for wine with great company! Rob was very knowledgeable about wines, food and Cape Town generally. If you do one thing whilst in Cape Town – do this!

A Fantastic day. We met with Rob during our first stay in Capetown and immediately felt comfortable and interested in his knowledge and experience of the area.We were offered various routes, all explained to us in a friendly and informative way. After selecting a few options, we headed off to a few local vineyards. Each stop was exactly as described, ranging from beautiful views of the landscape, to great wine- culminating in a lovely dinner. It was our best day out of our entire stay in SA.Sometimes tour guides can make one feel uneasy or often ramble on about irrelevant things, but Rob was a genuine joy to listen to.Any man that brings droewors and caramel popcorn along to pair with various wines is a winner in my book!5/5!

Great insight and knowledge. We had a day of touring the wine region and a day of tasting the local foods at peoples home. Both were amazing. Rob is a great host and has great kowledge of the local wine makers . The food tastings today were a real,treat . Very relaxed and the different flavours and discussions around the food was really interesting.

Not to be missed. Our second time with Rob and, as in the past, he made sure it was an incredible culinary experience. He helped us design the day and escorted us through unique wineries run by real characters and then onto a fabulous restaurant for lunch (La Motte......don't miss !). What makes these trips so special is that Rob is such a wonderful host. Whilst ensuring we enjoyed the food and wine, he also gave us a real insight into the history and culture of this wonderful country and what it's like living in South Africa today.

Best tour guide ever!!. My partner and I go on a lot of tours and this was hands down the best we have been on all around the world. From start to finish the tour was fantastic. We only wished that we had more time to spend with him.As the other reviews have said Rob is very knowledgable on a vast array of subjects and he is such a pleasure to chat with. You simply have to go on a tour with Rob. You may even find yourself booking a few more day tours with him, as we did. Thanks so much Rob. C&B

Rob knows everything!. We are a family of 5 with vastly differing interests, but Rob managed to add a little something for everyone on our day trip around and about Cape Town. I'm not sure if there's a single subject that he doesn't know at least a little something about (if not a whole lot!) Communication before the tour was excellent and the tour itself more than we had hoped for.We covered penguins, wine tasting, sprawling botanic gardens, a fishing town, lunch at a lovely farm-style café and a township project all in the same day. There was never a lull in the conversation because he know so much, not only about Cape Town and South Africa, but all topics under the sun, so it was very easy to spend the whole day with him.Basically, I wish all tour guides were Rob. He's got it right.(I've ticked that it was family - teens because there is no option for family with proper grown up children!)

A truly great and fun day touring with Rob. I was one of 5 who spent the day touring around the Cape with Rob and enjoyed every moment. From the moment he greeted me with enthusiasm and a lovely smile when picking me up at my hotel, I knew it was going to be a positive experience. He is knowledgeable, articulate and adds is touch of wit and flavor. He was very easy to understand, with a great voice and vocabulary I learned so much and wished I had several more days to spend touring with him. He was well dressed and groomed and his van was very clean and comfortable. He navigated us safely around the city including the curvy, narrow roads on the coast. I was completely at ease with him behind the wheel.. I mention this because it is not usually the case when traveling abroad with most taxi drivers and even many tour operators and you hope you survive the day! He customized our tour beautifully, incorporating the sights that we were most interested in and added some fun stops that we would not have known about and they were delightful. It is very obvious that he loves sharing his wonderful city with visitors and gives 100% to making sure that it is a positive experience. I highly recommend him and look forward to getting back there sometime soon and touring with him again. Many thanks and warm aloha to Rob!

Local Expert. Rob was delightful from the moment he shook our hands and called us by name as if he had known us all our lives until the moment he dropped us off at our hotel. We enjoyed his sense of humor and knowledge. He is very quick witted and not once did we stump him with our questions. Everywhere we went, someone knew Rob. He's a favorite with the locals. His enthusiasm and passion was courageous. Rob gave us tips for our remaining days in Cape Town. He's a wealth of information. I highly recommend him as your tour guide.

Cape Town Private Tours. Four of us spent a full day with Rob ,touring the cape peninsula. It was well organized and professional right from the start. Rob picked us up at our lodge, where we spent 20 minutes or so discussing the day's plan, which Rob tailored to our wishes. His van is new, roomy, and very comfortable. Rob has a deep knowledge of South Africa, and was happy to share it with us. Our dialogue was very interesting, and made the day go by in a flash. Rob is an excellent ambassador for Cape Town....his love of his city and his country comes across in his many stories. I would highly recommend Rob as a tour guide.

Wine tasting par excellence!!!. My husband and I spent a day with Rob wine and brandy tasting whilst in Cape town and were so glad we opted for an exclusive tour. We were both looking forward to meeting Rob as his emails regarding the tour were so informative and friendly and we were not disappointed. He even helped us find another excellent tour guide as he was not available to take us to Cape Point. We had a fantastic time, Rob was a great guide and the wine tasting with different foods was amazing, he took us to a lovely restaurant for lunch and we finished with brandy and chocolate tasting. I always said I hated brandy but am now converted to brandy drinking. Rob told us about the wine in plain English and we felt as if we had known him for years, this tour was one of the highlights of our holiday and when we go back to Cape Town we will definitely book Rob again, I have told him he cannot retire until we get back. He is a truly nice person and is justifiably proud of his beautiful country. If you go to Cape Town make sure you do at least one tour with Rob I guarantee you will not be disappointed!!

a customized tour of Capetown. I really recommend Rob as a guide if you visit this wonderful town and peninsula. My daughter of 6 and I spent 2 days with Rob and even if the weather was not sunny, Rob succeeded making theses days very interesting and surprising. It wasn't a tour of Capetown and its surrounding, it was our personal Tour of the area. Rob told us a lot about the fauna, flora of this particular place, also about the people and their way of life. The wine tasting and the policy of the wineyards were absolutely amazing, thanks Rob for the all good moments we shared together.

Best way to enjoy Cape Town and the wine lands. This has been our second experience seeing Cape Town and the surrounding area with Rob. We first met Rob in 2001 and vowed we would be back to see more of Cape Town with him. He is a delightful, enthusiastic person with in-depth knowledge of the area's history, culture and its amazing wine and food. We spent a day touring Cape Town, the downtown area and historic district, as well as trying some "local" food. Our second day was spent in the wine country where we experienced an educational wine pairing as well as a variety of lovely wineries. We were so lucky to have been able to schedule our time with him again. He has become a good friend and we highly recommend Rob as a guide! If he is unavailable, he is highly connected and can suggest a great alternative.

Spent a wonderful day with Rob!!. I contacted Rob over a year prior to my trip to book his services for two days. When he informed me he was only available on one of the days I knew I had probably picked a GREAT guide, and I was not disappointed. My niece and nephew joined me on my trip, and we took the culinary and wine tour that Rob offers, since we are all ‘foodies’ and also love wine. Rob took us to Stellenbosch and Franschhoek areas to different lovely wineries, and visited the winery whose wine we had been drinking ever since our flight on South African Airlines, which was Pinotage. A wine that is pretty much unknown in the US.Rob said we could eat lunch from just a sandwich to a silver service meal. I told him to plan on a high end meal. We had a wonderful lunch at a beautiful wine property that offered a wine pairing to compliment each course, YUMMM!!We also got a full tour, behind the scenes, of a winery as well as a chocolate tasting at another stop. Rob stopped at a really nice gallery that included really nice souvenirs, crafts and paintings,The whole day was first class, and Rob was informative and entertaining. I couldn’t have picked a better tour for the day!

Terrific Tour Guide. We were fortunate to spend two lovely days with Rob in the wine country near Cape Town! His knowledge, enthusiasm, and connections made our tours unforgettable! We learned so much about the region and social issues in addition to enjoying some fabulous wine tastings and a "bean to bar" artisan chocolate tasting. We had terrific gourmet lunches that were unbelievably inexpensive, and without his knowledge of the area, we would not have known which places to choose (the number of options rival those in Napa/Sonoma). If you are lucky enough to book Rob for your tours, do it! You won't regret a minute you spend with him.

The Best Way to Enjoy the Winelands. Our group was lucky enough to book Rob for two days of our 6 day visit to Cape Town a few weeks ago. We contacted him 6 months ago, and he only had two days available. So as soon as you start planning your trip, contact him. He was able to refer us to another terrific guide for two additional days of touring. That guide described Rob Davidowitz perfectly- Legendary!Rob and I communicated before our visit so he knew what we were wanting to see, what types of wine we enjoy, etc. He then laid out two wonderful days touring Stellenbosch and Franschoek.He has excellent access to many wineries, as he is a winemaker himself. We learned much about winemaking, wine tasting, in addition to the history of the region. We had two amazing lunches- one at Tokara in the Stellenbosch region and the other at LaMotte in the Franschoek area. I also recommend spending a bit of time walking around the charming towns of Stellenbosch and Franschoek. Also he took us to a chocolate tasting at DV artisan chocolates, which was even more fun than wine tasting! After we returned home, he sent us links to all the topics we discussed so that we can research more what interested us. Thanks, Rob!

Great Day in Cape Town. We'd researched many options before finding Rob of Beautiful Cape Town Tours. He was exactly what we were looking for - an easy-going, yet knowledgeable guide to show us the city.Rob sat down with us at our hotel to discuss our options for the day. He brought maps to orient us to the Cape Town area and give us an idea of what we could fit into our itinerary. We indicated a few particulars and left the rest to Rob. What a pleasure it was to spend the day, relaxed in his immaculate car, as Rob told us the history of the area and shared some of his favorite places with us. We particularly enjoyed his candid discussion of the Apartheid era and his participation in the rallies, etc., that marked the end of this time.We had a wonderful lunch at a vineyard Rob recommended and finished the day tired, but with a good introduction to Cape Town.

A Perfect Day. Highlight of our trip. We spent the day with Rob on the Winelands tour. From the very first minute, when he promptly picked us up in our Capetown hotel, to our sad farewell ... it was non-stop learning, laughs, top quality food, insanely good wine, tasty local craft beer, and decadent chocolate. Rob ticked all our important boxes:WINE - We don't get a lot of exposure to SA wine in the US, so this was an eye-opener. Visiting wine farms with a wine connoisseur and a winemaker (yes, Rob makes MCC sparkling wine) was a precious experience. Learning about the local varietals, and food pairing -- really amazing, even for us ... and we consider ourselves wine-o's! All this, put against the backdrop of scenic Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, and Paarl, made it priceless. Our favorite was Beyerskloof Pinotage Reserve, for it's full body complexity and price point.FOOD - Rob wisely chose the perfect lunch spot, Pierneef a La Motte, within La Motte Winery. The design of the place is modern, and the food was "a modern take on classic SA dishes." Again, very fair price point for the quality of food.CHOCOLATE - To be honest, I was skeptical about this "bean to bar" tasting experience. But this was the perfect way to end our day. It was a quick "around the world" trip in real chocolate, not the overprocessed sugar bars we know. I will never taste chocolate in the same way again.EXPERIENCE - As he says in his website, Rob delivers on providing a unique, private, once-in-a-lifetime experience. Our only regret was that Rob was unavailable to tour us on our other days in town (and we made reservations over 6 months ago!)Trust Rob, let him plan a great day for you, and soak in every minute. He is an encyclopedia of knowledge, passionate about what he does, and genuinely fun to be around. One last piece of advice ... book him early!

A real learning experience with Rob. We just returned from a month long trip to parts of Africa and Europe which was wonderful.We started our trip in Cape Town and wanted a private tour of the wine region and other points of interest.
