We decided to research a private tour ourselves as we are tired of high end hotel concierges sending us to their commissioned friends.We turned to trip advisor as we did for most of our trip and were very impressed with all the comments and experiences of fellow users respecting the day trips offered by Rob Davidowitz.I could explain at length our day with Rob but suffice it to say that all of the generous comments and reviews we read were true to the experience we shared as well.Rob designed our day in the morning with us, was open to any ideas we had but guided us to points of interest he understood we would appreciate. Rob knows and clearly loves to provide this service and to share his experiences with those select few who are fortunate to spend a day or two with him. He has excellent knowledge of the history and socio-political and economic issues of the country and we were delighted to hear it from someone who has experienced the great things which South Africa affords and can provide some insight to the past history which a North American sees only though the filtered eyes of the media.What was most impressive was what he taught us about the wine industry, how to undertake a proper wine tasting experience and his exclusive access and permissions he enjoys at many fine vineyards in the region.We strongly recommend Rob to fellow travellers and would hope we have the opportunity to visit again and spend another day with Rob exploring new venues.Thanks to Rob for a great day and an excellent start to our trip in South Africa and thanks to fellow trip advisor reviewers who helped us to find Rob.

Cape Town Day Tour with Rob Davidowitz. Take a day driving tour with Rob Davidowitz! It's a great way to tour to Pinguin Island and is see Cape of Good Hope and the coastal towns, especially if you don't want to drive. Rob came and got us at our hotel and we sat down with him to decide what we wanted to see and he made great recommendations. He is very friendly and has a wealth of information about the Cape area, wineries and general history of the area. We spent the day with him and wished we could of booked more days. Be sure to book in advance as his schedule gets booked up fast. It was a sheer pleasure to spend the day with him.

A day to remember. My wife booked a wine tour with Rob from Australia, Rob turned up on time armed with a couple of maps and a few ideas. We went to a couple of different wineries, a chocolate factory and a brewery along with a stop for some fine dining. We spent a fantastic day with Rob tasting wine, learning about the industry. Rob knows his stuff and is very happy to share his talents and skills with anyone interested. He is a great bloke and organises his tours exceptionally well, I would have loved to spend more time with Rob but could not fit it in

A wonderful experience!!. My husband and I spent two days with Rob and thoroughly enjoyed the time. We booked a wine tour experience and Cape of Good Hope tour. Rob arrived early on the first day with his maps to show us where we would be travelling and with suggested stops along the way. We chose those that were of interest to us and then set off. Rob was full of information about Cape Town and his life and experiences. We quickly established a comfortable relationship, one which continued through our two days together. Our two trips were certainly off the tourist track for the most part and a highlight of our trip to Africa. Rob has a wonderful knowledge of food & wine and we shared lunch at 2 absolutely amazing restaurants that we would not have visited without him. We felt we were tripping around Cape Town with an old friend! I would recommend Rob to anyone wanting to have an enjoyable unique experience while they were visiting Cape Town. He always answers questions promptly and is happy to accommodate requests. Once again Rob many thanks for an unforgettable experience!!

Highest Praise!. The best way for me to describe the two days spent visiting the Cape Wine Regions, and Cape Peninsula areas with Rob, earlier this month, was the feeling that I was an honoured guest, and that he was delighted to have the opportunity to share his love and passion of his homeland with me. On both days, Rob arrived early, equipped with laminated maps, which he used to chart proposed routes, based on my interests. Both of the excursions were peppered with interesting facts, regional and social history, and surprizing methods of conveying information! Rob is well informed, flexible, well prepared, and thoughtful- If that wasn’t enough, he listened to everything that I said, so that he could create a catered tour. He has a knack for small details that enriched the overall experience (a small welcoming gift, with an explanation of African Tribal customs, and on the second day a box of Rooibos Tea, in follow up to a conversation of the previous day, as examples). I was also very impressed by the “welcome home” e-mail I received the day I returned to Canada, which included links to topics of interest from the two days spent in Rob’s company, as well as an overview of the two days. The highest endorsement I can provide is the statement that I would be happy to recommend Rob’s services to my family and loved ones, and I would do so, without hesitation. Thanks Rob, for helping to make my adventures in South Africa amazing!!!

Best way to see and experience Cape Town. A friend of our recommended Rob for our tour guide. I reached out to him about 4months before we were expected in Cape Town and booked his services for 2-days of our 5-day visit. We were traveling with our family of 5 (3 kids ages 7, 12, 14). Rob was on time, his van was immaculate and beautiful and comfortable for an all day drive. He was so engaging with our entire family. He got the kids involved in wanting to know and understand the history of not only Cape Town but South Africa. He knows a lot about everything, a truly amazing conversationalist. He is also a very passionate about Cape Town and enjoys sharing all of it's beauty with you. We would highly recommend Rob to anyone interested in seeing and learning about Cape Town and South Africa, our two days with him (a Cape of Good Hope and Winelands tour), was definitely our highlight of Cape Town and of our trip to South Africa.We can't recommend highly enough! Thank you Rob!

Informative and fun. My husband and I spent the day with Rob in the wine country outside of Cape Town. Rob picked us up at our hotel. He asked us questions about the type of wine that we like to drink which helped him to figure out the best areas for us to visit. He even brought a laminated map that he drew on to show us where we were and where we would be going. Rob brought us behind the scenes at on of the vineyards where he produces sparkling wine. We had the opportunity to see the machinery and he walked us through the process. He took our wine tasting to a new level by showing us how to pair different wines with different foods. He brought snacks and allowed us to taste them and sip the wine to determine what we liked. We had a delicious lunch at another vineyard. After lunch Rob let us choose what to do next. We decided to do a chocolate tasting. The chocolate tasting allowed us to taste raw, unadulterated chocolate made from beans from different parts of the world. We never felt any pressure to buy wine. The wine tour was about learning about the region, the grapes, the wine making process, and just having fun. Rob is very easy to talk to. It was like spending the day with a friend. He even gave us tips about how to spend the rest of our time in Cape Town. I would highly recommend this tour.

ROB DELIVERS. The reviews you read about Rob's service is exactly what we experienced.Rob is a very parochial and proud Capetonian who makes it his mission to promote and ensure his guests experience the real culture and hospitality of the southern cape area.Rob is referred to by The Cape Grace Hotel as a 'walking encyclopadie' because of his vast knowledge of the area and his attention to detail.Rob ensures the day is your day from beginning to end.We spent 2 full days with Rob in early July and cannot thank him enough for the experiences we shared.Rob is the ultimate professional and a lovely person to spend 2 days with.Thanks Rob

Wonderful Day in Cape Town!. We visited South Africa for my inlaw's wedding anniversary and wanted to ensure the trip was something special. Rob definitely delivered on that front. He explained the options for the day to us, and we chose what we wanted to do: this included visiting a fishing community, Cape of Good Hope, the penguin colony, and a wonderful business that helps disadvantaged individuals by hiring them to make crafts out of tea bags! Rob was a wonderful guide. He clearly LOVES his city and country and was able to answer our many questions about it. He's also quite the foodie and recommended amazing breakfast and lunch places for our tour--as well as a dinner place for us to go to on our own that we also really enjoyed. I was a little afraid that the day would be a lot of driving, but with the well-planned stops Rob had in store we never drove for more than 40 minutes or so without stopping. The van was very comfortable as well. All in all, it was a very memorable day!

Could not have been a more beautiful day!. My husband and I shared a beautiful day the end of June with Rob, and it couldn't have been better! He was at our hotel at the appointed time and we sat down to hear and discuss options for the day. I loved his maps and his ability to write upside down to show us more about each possibility. When we decided on our favorites, he then told us about how much time each would take and what we could reasonably fit into the day. Having agreed upon an itinerary, we started out at Kirstenbosch Gardens, where Rob was a wealth of information about the plants that we were able to see in our hour-plus visit. The garden is worth a day, if you have the time, but we didn't. From there were went to a little fishing village and saw the day's catch that would appear at Cape Town Restaurants that night, then on to Boulder Beach to see the penguins and to the Cape of Good Hope. Our trip up the western side of the cape was filled with beautiful scenery--very different from the eastern side-- and included a delicious lunch at a deli in Noordhoek. We ended the day with a drive around the City Central and more information about Cape Town. Rob was a perfect guide--knowledgeable, genial, flexible--and just a lot of fun. During the day we learned so much about the history and culture of the Cape in addition to the places we went. We were very pleased with everything, and would highly recommend spending a day--or more--with him. It exceeded our expectations and we were delighted that everything was so well communicated via the Internet in advance and we had no surprises about anything except the beauty and the enjoyment of our experience.

Highlight of our holiday. I can't really add anything that hasn't already been said about a day spent with Rob. All email communication prior to our visit was brilliant and informative and I felt I knew Rob a little already when he met us at our hotel and we agreed how we were going to spend the day. However, I was not prepared for such a blow-away day - it was great. Rob was skilled enough to keep all of us engaged - which when the party includes a 21 and 18 year old isn't always easy! I never thought I would see my kids interested in Botanical Gardens - but they were totally engaged with Rob. In summary, Rob is a thoroughly nice person and a total professional who will share with you a plethora of facts and comments about what you are seeing - and much of what you are not! Thank you Rob for an amazing day.

Absolutely wonderful day, fascinating and fun. We had a fantastic day with Rob. He gave us various options to choose from and we picked what most interested us which was ideal. Rob is passionate about Capetown and his enthusiasm is infectious. His knowledge is vast and he's very talented at relating to people, all the information he gave us was really interesting. He also showed us many areas of Capetown you would never discover without his guidance. It was my first trip to Capetown but my boyfriends 5th, yet Rob managed to keep both of us hugely entertained all day. I can't recommend Rob more highly, a day with him left me falling in love with an incredible city.

Don't visit Cape Town without meeting Rob. I had arranged our trip to the Winelands with Rob over the internet and he met us exactly as promised. We discussed what we wanted to get out of our day together by looking at maps, ideas etc and set off to visit a wine farm (Villiera) first - where we had a fantastic few hours. Rob made the experience fun and informative, touring the farm and learning how wine is made, trying out various wines, paring them with foods. Leave your thoughts on wine at home and let Rob educate you. His knowledge about wine is exceptional and his enthusiasm contagious. We then toured the winelands area and had a lovely lunch on another wine farm Tokara.. We regretted not booking more tours with him.

I don't appreciate it when someone doesn't tell the truth. I was looking forward to spending the one day we had in Cape Town touring with Rob after all these reviews.He met us promptly and showed us a route with 7 potential stops, telling us we had to pick 5, if we wanted to get back by 5:30 or 6pm. I asked him about Table Mountain and he said the gondola was closed that morning due to inclement weather, after checking a site on his phone, but would check again later.Rob was informative, friendly, and talkative. He took us to the botanical gardens, a fish market, and the penguins. After lunch, I asked again about Table Mountain and he checked quickly and said it was still closed due to high winds. He dropped us off an hour early, 4:30pm, at our hotel. We could have gone to one or two more stops, especially if we had made a much shorter visit to his friend's tea bag shop.When we got back, we decided to hike up to the gondola. When we got there it had just closed for the day. Two people told us it had been operating throughout the day with no problems. Rob could have just dropped us off there if he didn't want to go up.He seems to be a nice guy, and this contrasts with all the other reviews, but I don't appreciate being lied to.

Cape of Good Hope Tour. We spent the day with Rob exploring the best of the Cape. Rob is a wealth of knowledge and very professional. A little pricey but worth it for the experience he gives. On time, well organised and happy to tailor the tour based on your requirements or interests. We learn't a lot during our day and had great fun. We would recommend.

Two days in Cape Town with Rob. I has taken me almost two weeks thinking what can I say about our tour experience with Rob, than non of you have already said and I've come to the conclusion that it is all about the love and pride that he has for his country. His enthusiasm when he speaks, the knowledge and the simply details, makes him the best!!! Rob is a "must" if you go to Cape Town. He is a genuine South African which is reflected is the way he speaks about his country. He kindly share with you the past and present history of his country, the beauty of his people and the spectacular city that he has the honor to live in! Definitively Rob was key to our very successful trip! We are already planning a near future second visit and we will be delighted to have him again. Thanks you Rob!!!

Wonderful Cape Town tour with Rob!. We spent two days with Rob and thoroughly enjoyed it! He is extremely knowledgeable (about seemingly everything - seriously!) and his passion and enthusiasm is contagious. Because he is a life-long resident of South Africa, he has experienced the significant changes the country has went through over the years. We found it absolutely fascinating to learn his personal history and perspectives. From the moment I first contacted him, Rob was informative, thorough and patient as I e-mailed question after question to him. By the time we arrived, he had a good sense of what we were looking for and guided us in the right direction so we could maximize our brief time in Cape Town. He also introduced us to some fabulous food!I would not hesitate to recommend Rob to anyone who is looking for top-notch, highly personalized service while touring Cape Town.

You will come away loving Cape Town. Rob is the most ideal guide: passionate, enthusiastic, in-depth knowledge about everything Cape Town. We spent two full days and he went over and above our expectations. He took us to the highlights as well as the unusual spots that are overlooked by most visitors. He is also a foodie and wine-lover, so he was able to recommend fabulous places for dinner. We loved getting to know him and his beautiful city.

Very Informative and a Great Day. We spent the day with Rob as our private tour guide and we couldn't be more happy with our experience. After figuring out any special interests form my wife and I we headed out on our determined route.We decided to do wine country and were given a wonderful behind the scenes tour where we learned about the process of wine and champagne making (the traditional way). Very interesting. We also had a wonderful lunch, toured some great architecture and did a chocolate tasting.Rob even greeted us with a gift but was unfortunately stolen out of our checked bag at the airport. I was under the impression that getting your luggage wrapped protected your bag... not the contents... Live and learn.Highly Recommended.

Fantastic Tour with Rob. Rob tooks us from Cape Town through Stellenbosch. What an amazing day we had with Rob. He started our day by quickly going over exactly what we could do and we planned our day. Rob was very knowledgeable and answered all of our questions. Next time we come to South Africa I will definitely go on another tour with Rob!

The third time we met Rob for new experiences in and around C.T.. Thank you again, Rob, for the two nice days we could spend with you.Because the weather has been very hot during the first days of february we resigned making long tours - so thiss year we could have a look to different points of interest, restaurants and events in and around Cape Town.On our first day we started enjoying the contents of your cool bag with a lot of specialities and tapas to eat and drinkWe stopped at the vineyard hotel is in Newlands in the southern suburbs of Cape Town to enjoy a very special lunch, the nice park and your never ending stories about the vines of C.T.We also got to know about the local brewery's beer from CBC (Cape Brewing Company) - followed by the "adventure" of going to the food market at The Old biscuit mill.On the second day we have been introduced trying out Cape Town city's new public transport system and see how easy ist has got to move around in Cape Town.We visited the Slow food market on Saturday mornings in Stellenbosch - lots of impressions at a nice place.After a sight seeing tour and a stop at "The Original T-bag Design Shop" near Kirstenbosch we enjoyed our lunch on the beach in Hout Bay at a restaurant called On The Dunes.Unforgettable again the lot of stories Rob knows to tell about the country and the people of the region.He also gave tips what to do using the "Hop-on-hop-off-Bus" in C.T., so we spend two nice days in the wonderful plant garden "Kirstenbosch" and at the vineyard Groot Constantia with it's excellent restaurant Jonkershuis.Dear Rob - if we come back in 2015 be sure, you will here from us in time.Sabine & Udo

A fabulous tour with Rob!. We had a wonderful day touring the Peninsula with Rob! Rob modified the tour at the last minute to accomodate our two friends and include a few additional sites. He was a pleasure to be with as he is so knowledgeable and articulate about the area and history. We were blessed with a glorious day and one that will last in our memories.

Don't visit Cape Town without a tour with Rob!. I recently accompanied four of my Australian mates on a trip to the place of my birth, Cape Town. We were lucky enough to secure Rob's services for four tours- two full day trips and two half day trips.We were more than pleasantly surprised at Rob's professionalism and depth of knowledge. He has the ability to showcase the usual tourist haunts but adds a new dimension with his vast knowledge of the Cape, its history and its flora and fauna.Don't visit Cape Town without a tour with Rob!

ROB'S THE KNOWLEDGE MAN!!. We had a great two days with Rob (with Sharon & Vic Davis). Rob is a great raconteur, wine expert & foodie. He didn't disappoint & made sure we got the best of the 2 days we had with him.Would recommend him to anyone who is visiting the Cape.Shirley & Pete Smith

AMAZING!. What else can be said about the experience that hasn't been already written.My wife and I traveled to Cape Town this past week and the only tour I booked was this one with Rob given all the great reviews he had. Without a doubt he exceeded our expectations and was one of the highlights of our trip.Rob has great conversations and we felt we were travelling with a very good friend. He was very engaging and thoughtful of our needs and what things we wanted to see. He kept the tour very entertaining and no high-level wine BS. He spent time at the end of our tour to give us suggestions on what to see during our following days in Cape Town. I literally landed yesterday back home and the first thing I did today was write this review. If you are going to Cape Town - BOOK this tour. You will nor regret it.

The BEST PRIVATE TOUR EVER. My husband and I cannot express enough how absolutely fabulous the time we spent with Rob was - he exceeded all our expectations and we were so sad we had only managed to book him for two days.From the date of booking he kept in touch and gave us good information and suggestions.He met us promptly at our hotel and gave us an over view of the day ahead and asked if we would want to change any of the itinerary. Our first day was spent in the wine region and we had our most memorable day - tasting wine, stopping for coffees, visiting Stellenbosch etc and topped off with an outstanding lunch in an exquisite venue.Second day we visited the Cape Peninsula and Rob took us to places we would not have found eg. fishing harbour and meeting the fishermen and their wives.. Stopping for photographs whenever we wanted and giving us so much indepth information about every conceivable subject. Rob is really like a friend to us now and if we are lucky enough to go back to Cape Town it will only be booked if we can spend time with him again....Our hotel The Cape Grace was fabulous and we left Cape Town on the Queen Mary 2 but the highlight of this trip was our 2 days with Rob.........

Best part of our trip!. Wow! Rob is the BEST tour guide. He was extremely knowledgable, kind, fun and easy going. My husband, Rob and I spent the day at local restaurants (the Food Barn was fantastic), the fish market, the botanical gardens, Boulders Beach, Chapmans Peak Drive and more. We enjoyed learning all we could about Cape Town's culture and experiencing it the away Rob Strategically planned. You could easily say he's the most interesting man in the world. :-) We recommend all our friends and family visit Rob if traveling to CT. Thanks again, Rob!

The best way to see and experience Cape Town!!. Just back from our second day with Rob, had a fab time, all the sights and experiences we wanted, expert knowledge, plenty of stories and laughs. We saw and experienced things we would never have found on our own, esp since we only had a couple if days, excellent wine tasting experience with real behind the scenes action and useful tips. Absolutely recommend Rob's tours!

Buy a Donkey Rob!. "Buy a donkey" is Afrikaan for "thank you very much", one of the many things taught to us by this lovely warm hearted and witty man. We were so lucky to book Rob up for 8 days in total which included a one day tour of Cape Town, a one day tour of the Cape Peninsula, and a 6 day tour of the Garden Route. Rob tailors your tours to exactly match your interests. He succeeded so well with us and we had an absolutely brilliant holiday as a result. To give an idea of what Rob arranged for us, he found wonderful restaurants for hugely enjoyable lunches and dinners, introduced us to many amazing and interesting people, and booked fabulous accommodation along the Garden Route. He also arranged many excursions including to botanical gardens, bird sanctuary, ostrich farm and penguin colony, plus an exciting ride on a mountain caboose and an oyster boat trip.Rob was always funny and good natured, smartly dressed, and maintained his vehicle in pristine condition. His driving was excellent and we always felt safe, and the vehicle itself was extremely comfortable and spacious with loads of leg room. Rob kept a good supply of cold water and snacks in the vehicle which were very welcome. If you're lucky enough to get Rob as your tour guide (he gets booked up very quickly!) you are sure to have an absolutely great experience. There isn't much Rob doesn't know about South Africa! So finally we say again thank you very much Rob, Buy a Donkey! Love and hugs from Rene and me and good luck in all your future endeavours. You are one in a million!

Still the best!. Believe everything you read in these reviews. Rob offers a very professional high quality tour. From its food and wine to animals and history, Rob knows South Africa. We were very happy to be able to book him.

Great to spend a day with Rob!. My 2 adult children and I booked a day tour with Rob, from Beautiful Cape Town Tours. We decided that a Wine and Chocolate Tour was the tour that suited us best. We had such a wonderful time with Rob and he taught us a lot about the wine country and about chocolate. The wine country is so beautiful, you can not go wrong with this tour. Rob made it all the better!

Best Tour Guide in Cape Town. If you want the the friendliest, most organised, most professional and most knowledgable guide in Cape Town, then Rob is your guy! Even the manager at my hotel was impressed by how he sat down with me and discussed our options for the day to maximise my time and to see what I wanted to see. He listened to what I wanted and had pre-booked the most amazing lunch for us at La Colombe! I spent only one day with Rob as my tour guide (and he also adopted me into his family for another day of fun but that's another story). I would highly recommend that you travel around Cape Town with Rob. The whole process of booking through to the actual day of the tour was extremely professional. I had an absolute blast and I look forward to returning to Cape Town in the future and spending more time with Rob.

BEST "REAL" VIEW OF CAPE TOWN AND SOUTH AFRICA. ROB IS GREAT. He listens very well. We wanted a certain tour, with certain information - and he delivered exactly what we asked for in a very professional and FUN way. We really felt like we knew and had a reasonable understanding of Cape Town and the history of how it got to be where it is today. Rob knows ALL there is to know about the area. Book him early - he is hard to schedule - that is how good he is.

Two Memorable Fun-packed Days!. We were visiting Cape Town for the first time and our two days with Rob were a first class way for us to explore the city and surrounding countryside. Rob's enthusiasm, knowledge and friendly service were quite exceptional and I would not hesitate to highly recommend his services.
A great way to capture cape town. A very friendly, informative couple of days. Rob was a great guide who involves you in the tour as well as being very knowledgeable. Highly recommended.

It was GREAT!. We are still in Cape Town and the day tour with Rob was one of our highlights till now. From the time he picked us up from our place it seemed to become a wonderful day with lots of tasteful experiences: Spice-Shop at Bo Kaap - you have to try the Samosa and Koek Sisters - Wine tasting in Stellenbosch - Chocolate tasting - Beer tasting and lots of interesting stories about Cape Town and its history. It is totally up to you where you want to go and what you want to see, you can plan the trip in advance with his help via email. Just to say - everybody who comes to CapeTown must have a daytrip with Rob - It was amazing and has exceeded our expectations! Ulrike & Tobi

A gem within a gem. I have always thought that Cape Town is a gem of a place. Discovering Rob and his unique way of showing you around was like uncovering a gem within a gem. I had been to Cape Town several times before but my recent visit was with two college friends, first timers to Cape Town. Immensely knowledgeable about a broad range of topics, professional, fun, kind, accommodating, Rob's way is the best way to see Cape Town and surroundings; one is sure to take home lots of fun and insightful memories. I also ended up liking Cape Town more. Nonna Ponferrada, Washington DC

Great city shared with us by an Amazing Guide..... Spent two incredible days with Rob Davidowitz. His vast and varied knowledge of all things South Africa made for a really enjoyable and interesting experience. We spent our time together learning about wine, chocolate, penquins and South African culture. Rob always had a great story to share with us and really made our trip to Capetown that much more special. Rob really went out of his way to make sure that we had the experience that we were looking for. Don't hesitate to arrange your time with Rob, your trip won't be same without him!

A Perfect Winelands-Tour. It was already my 4th visit in Cape Town and my 3rd tour with Rob and it was as usual amazing. Sometimes I wish we could have exceptional tour guides like Rob in Switzerland but they are hard to find. this man has an extraordinary knowledge of Wine, the hidden jewels (like restaurants or wine estates) and Cape Town in general. But he is not only a tour guide...his abilities as a magician are as well astonishing. It was for sure not my last visit in Cape Town and I am really looking forward to my next tour with Rob!With greetings from Switzerland!Boris

Beautiful city with a knowledgable guide. Well Rob Davidowitz of Beautiful cape tour is a person with a very high knowledge of this most beautiful city and it's surroundings from its history to its politics it's weather to the wines grown we had a most wonderful 2 days travelling with Rob he brought to life This magical city with a sense of humour and interesting anecdotes we loved it as not the usual tour guide . He showed us a map before we started out and asking us what we wanted to see I said you know the place better he said your the guests and yes he made us feel very special we traveled with a German friend and her Iranian husband and everything he said was understood by them the husbands English was not good but Rob spoke very precise they enjoyed it very much . His 7 seater vehicle was comfortable he also had some snacks and cold drinks very welcome . We had seen so many wonderful sights brought more to life by Robs knowledge of a city he is very proud of and on a personal note he took us to Cape Town town hall where Nelson Mandela made his speech after his release from27 years in prison Rob was there that day and with emotion he told us about it . We have travelled the world had many guides but no one more interesting and knowledgable without being boring then Rob. He is not just a guide but a very friendly refreshing person who has enhanced our visit to Cape Town .

Fantastic Winelands Wine and Chocolate Tour. From the start to the finish of our wonderful day Rob was informative and attentive. His overall knowledge of the region, wine and chocolate would, I'm sure, be hard to beat.Rob picked us up and dropped us off at our hotel. He started with a short brief about the area and confirmed with us exactly what we would like to do for the tour. Our day included 3 vineyard visits (one for lunch) and the unique chocolate tasting that others have described. We also explored Stellenbosch.His desire to make our tour personal with an itinerary to suit us was carefully thought out. We were impressed by his enthusiasm and his desire to give us a great experience - and he certainly did.We have no hesitation at all in recommending Rob's Beautiful Cape Town Private Tours.

Excellent day spent in the company of a knowledgable and engaging guide. Rob delivered an truly memorable day, comprising 4 vineyard visits, an excellent lunch and a tour of Stellenbosch town which included a visit to the university rugby ground. In short we got what we asked for plus numerous extras all in the company of a knowledgable and experienced guide who adapted the components of each stop off "on the hoof" as he learned more about the types of things we wanted to experience.Faultless and memorable

The best day of touring imaginable. Couldn't have been better.. Four of us spend a thoroughly delightful day with Rob as we tour the wine area surrounding Cape Town. Before we departed Rob sat down with a map and showed us what he had planned and offered us a few choices. Alone choice was between another wine tasting or chocolate tasting. We unanimously voted for the chocolate and weren't disappointed. Who knew! Rob told us lots of stories; we learned a lot about South Africa and Cape Town and listened to us as well. The wine education was fantastic. None of us will ever drink or order wine the same way as previously. My advise, book early and tour with Rob.

Private Wine Tour from Cape Town. A visit to Cape Town area would not be complete without a tour of the beautiful wine region and if you are looking for 'The Best' then I highly recommend touring with Rob! It was a beautiful full day of wine, food and chocolate tasting. Rob's knowledge and stories added to the overall experience and made this tour one of the highlights of my trip! I would highly recommend booking early as he books up quickly. You'll get picked up right at your door and the tour will be everything and more than is promised. Worth every cent! Many thanks Rob for the wonderful memories of the Cape Town Wine Region!

Having a proper planned day. Having a fantastic day,I choose the best way of getting a beautiful tour with the only team that provides private tours . When I met with the tour guide Rob he did not take me to the car right away,we sat down and he asked me what I wanted to do so I told him that I would like to do the Cape Peninsula tour so he told me there is a lot of of places to go so with the places he told me I choose what I was interested in. I had a vision of myself already on tour and I could not wait to get there.It was time to go,I stood and walked with confidence going to the car and knowing that my day had been planned. I went to the World of Botanical Gardens,woow I love nature,beautiful flowers,its not only flowers we also get medicine from them and the beautiful gardens with high mountain and spring water too,it was amazing the tour guide was walking next to me and giving me the education about the flowers of which I found it more interesting.We went to Kalk Bay and I was so much interested in the community,the people from the restaurants buy their fish and the people from the community too,the day was so beautiful and I saw the seals sun basking.We went for lunch at the Food Barn restaurant the food was delicious and the environment was the best place to be at and it was not over crowded.My Tour Guide took me to Beau Constantia woow the wine farm is so beautiful,I did wine tasting and food pairing too.I enjoyed the wine for the first time in my life.Above all having your private tour with your family,your fiancé,on your own or on honey moon this is the only way you may choose to have the best experience. This was the most memorable day for me. Thank you Rob.

"Could not have wanted more - Simply the Best". From the first contact with Rob he did not let us down in any way.The first email from him made us feel as though we were really special. His guidance was invaluable - we had never been to South Africa before and not knowing what to do we were pointed in the right direction. Rob asked lots of questions to find out what our likes and dislikes were to enable him to tailor our day with him in Cape Town and surrounds. Rob's presentation of both himself and his vehicle was impeccable.His knowledge of everywhere we went was amazing. The respect he was shown by everyone we came in contact with was unreal. Just loved our visit to the fishing village and meeting the fishermen. Learning all about the Baboons we saw along the way, Our day with Rob was really full of fun and laughter. Lunch fantastic. The visit to the tea bag lady amazing.We cannot recommend Rob highly enough. Thanks Rob it was fantastic. Robyn and Doug

A wonderful tour. Thank you, Rob, for a truly memorable morning in Capetown and Stellenbosch. We just couldn't have asked for more, and learned so much from you during the course of the tour. We thoroughly enjoyed visiting the two wineries, and the lovely village of Stellenbosch. Also thank you for recommending a wonderful place for dinner, it was the best. We will remember you!Mark and Megan

The best tour guide in Cape Town by far. We spent a day with Rob in Cape Town and what a day it was. Rob personalizes every tour to meet your specific needs and wishes and he is truly passionate about his job and his city and his country. His wealth of knowledge is unparalleled and can answer any questions asked of him. We saw everything we wanted to and more and had one of the best meal at lunch we have ever had. And leave it to Rob to have inside knowledge of this quaint little restaurant. If you want to truly experience Cape Town, give Rob a call. He even ordered great weather for us :)A heartfelt thank you, Rob. We look forward to seeing you again. Scott & Cathy

Fantastic tour with top guide. I first saw Rob on the TV series “1000 places to see before you die” and I liked him right away. So when it was my turn to visit South Africa I specifically asked him to be our guide at least for a day in the wine country. What a nice day it was. Rob shared his love of South Africa and his support of sustainable farming. Beyond being flexible (our original flight was cancelled so we came thru Europe one day later), he was extremely passionate about wines and very knowledgeable on the subject. It was a fantastic experience overall and a great introduction to South Africa. I almost forgot about the gifts. Thank you again Rob - we really appreciate it !To prospective travelers. If you are looking for a truly great and personalized experience, you got to call Rob. You will not regret it.

The top guide in the Western Cape. Rob is not just the top guide in the Western Cape, he's also a sommelier, a botanist, a chef and knows all the best places for a wide range of interests. And at the end of the tour, he will become your friend. So, I strongly recommend Rob as your guide during your trip to the beautiful Cape Town. Oh, and don't forget to ask him to teach you how to say "thank you very much" in Afrikaans.

Beautiful Tour. Cape Town is so beautiful and we were very fortunate to have Rob as our guide on a tour of the peninsula. Rob has an encyclopedic knowledge of the history, people, wild life, and geography of the area. With four adults asking all kinds of questions, he never missed a beat in answering us. Rob obviously loves his city and the surrounding area. It was a bit amazing that he managed to show us everything on our list in a comfortable, timely manner when our two husbands kept wanting to stop for one more “quick picture”. It was a pleasure working with Rob from our first contact to our last.

Tripadvisor, time to add 6 stars. Before our 3 day trip to Cape Town I took to trip advisor to find a tour to get the most out of our trip in the limited timeframe we had available. Trip Advisor didn't let me down with this one, I found Rob and his incredible collection of reviews, all of them I can now confirm are completely justified. I made contact with our dates and requirements and very swiftly got a response that I could see had been composed with time, care & attention to detail. I knew at this point I had stumbled upon a real gem, I was sold and booked our tour of the Cape Peninsular. Rob collected us from our hotel & gave us loads of information about the things we would have the opportunity to see during the day. This allows Rob to get a feel for what you are interested in and cherry pick the best places to take you. We decided upon a visit to a fishing village, Simon's Town, the penguin colony at Boulders beach (a must), and down to the Cape of Good Hope. We then drove back along Chapman's peak drive which, although much shorter is even more beautiful than the Big Sur coastline on highway 1 in California. Lunch was taken at The Food Barn Deli, the food was fantastic & atmosphere outstanding. Our final stop of the day was at the Kirstenbosch Gardens, another great spot that we will defiantly visit again to spend more time exploring if & when we visit Cape Town in the future. One of the things that made our day even better was spotting Whales just of the coast on no less than four occasions. Whales had not be discussed at all until the first time we spotted them just of shore, Rob very quickly noticed our interest and adjusted the plan to suite. For the rest of the day he was on the lookout and stopping to look at every opportunity. The whole day from start to finish was magic. Rob is probably one of the most knowledgable & charismatic people I have ever had the privilege to meet. He is truly passionate about Cape Town & South Africa and I cannot think of a single way he could have made our day better. His wealth of knowledge seems to know no bounds, from South Africa, Cape Town, the rest of the world, Animals, Geology, Botany, History, Politics, right through to English tv & Top Gear. There was never a dull or quiet moment.I now consider Rob to be a friend in Cape Town and I recommend you look no further for your trip to Beautiful Cape Town. A return trip to Cape Town will not be far around the corner and I know one of the first things that will be arranged is a tour or two with Rob. Thanks so much.

Very informative. We spent one day on a private our with Rob. He was very informative on both South African Culture, political history and wines. His access to the backrooms of the wineries allowed us to see more then the usual. Next time in Cape Town we will book a number of days with him. Highly recommended.

Top Day Thanks Rob. Excellent and enjoyable day, thanks so much Rob, the reviews were all 100% correct. Thoroughly recommend anyone wanting a personalised, informative day tour whilst in beautiful Capetown. We did Stellenbosch Winelands area and had a lovely lunch in a local informal restaurant which was exactly what we had asked for. The winetasting first up was also very enjoyable! We just had to sit back and enjoy the magnificent scenery, the chocolate tasting was a highlight for us and the vehicle very comfy. The follow up email with links to everything we had discussed (and more) was professional and most appreciated. Rob a special thank you also for recommending Villa Zest for our stay in Capetown, it too was excellent. If its a day trip or sightseeing you are after, you cannot go wrong with Rob from Beautiful Capetown Tours. 5 stars!

Wonderful two days with Rob. Before we went on a safaritrip to Botswana and Zimbabwe we stayed a few days in Cape Town. On the internet I looked for a private guide to show us the city and the Cape. I found Rob who got some marvelous reviews. In reality it was even better! In a wonderful way he combined the knowledge that he has about almost every subject that you can think of and a lot of interesting personal stories. All that told with great enthusiasm! Even our two daughters of 13 and 18 years old fell in love with Cape Town and the Cape of good hope because of Rob's stories. Next to that he took us to places where a regular tour will not come and did we have two great lunches with him. Obviously I can recommend him to everybody!

Highly, highly recommend!. Rob has a wealth of knowledge about Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. We thoroughly enjoyed our 1.5 days touring with him. His recommendations for other tours and restaurants were also spot-on! Can't imagine a better tour guide out there than Rob!

First class. What can I say about Rob that hasn't already been said?I booked Rob to take us on a Winelands tour and we all thoroughly enjoyed the day.I was quite happy to go along with Rob's suggestions but he checked before we set-off to make sure this would fit in with our requirements.In all we visited three wineries, one restaurant and one chocolatier in the day and each of them was great (just a pity we didn't have time to fit in a brewery as well) Not quite wine, women and song but wine, chocolate and biltong comes a close second in my book.

Cape Tour. Our friends and us (4 total) booked a tour of the Cape of Good Hope with Rob and had a wonderful day. Rob was quite flexible in tailoring our itinerary to meet our interest. Pre-communication was excellent and he was punctual for the beginning and end of our tour. We made a quick stop at the Constantia Winery before heading south. He is extremely knowledgeable of all relevant subjects (even penguin habits) for the area and we had many discussions at any depth of granularity we wished to choose. Rob has a great sense of humor with an occasional "profound saying" and kept the day full of fun for all. He chose a great little gourmet restaurant in Hout Bay for us to have a quick late lunch that we all thoroughly enjoyed. The van was very comfortable, clean and modern. I highly recommend his services.Steve M

Awesome experience. Our family of four had the pleasure of Rob's wineland tour including a tour of Stellenbosch, Beyerskloof and a surprise treat- an artisanal chocolate tasting. Rob is very knowledgable of both wine and South Africa in general. My 18 and 20 year old children were quite engaged as well as my wife and I. We had behind the scenes access at one of the wineries. Overall a really great tour that I'd definitely recommend to others. Rob goes above and beyond- he made a special trip back to our hotel the following day when he discovered that we left a small item behind- before we even missed it.

Excellent Tour. I booked Rob on the strength of his consistently strong Tripadvisor reviews. He deserves them all. He took us out for the first day of our honeymoon in Cape Town and we had a wonderful day. He gave us lots of choices of things to do, we picked our favourites and the pace was excellent - highlights were seeing a dassie on the top of Table Mountain and seals floating on their backs in a working fishing village. Also the best meal we had in Cape Town - at the Food Barn. We would never have heard of this if it hadn't been for Rob tuning into what we said we liked to eat. He was a great talker on such a diverse range of subjects, from the history of South Africa to how to fold up your bedding. Thank you so much, Rob.

All the other reviewers are right. Rob is a 6 star guide.. We booked Rob for a full day to take our entire family on a wine tour followed by table mountain. Because our group was very large Rob went to the effort of booking a separate tour bus and driver to make sure everyone was comfortable. Our wine tour was fantastic and Rob's knowledge was first rate. We went to real wineries, not tourist traps, and were able to get right into the heart of the operation. Our other stops included a city tour of Stellenbosch, a FABULOUS outdoor farm barbeque and table mountain. At every turn Rob had more facts and information, was open to any questions we had (regardless of how ridiculous or politically sensitive) and was enthusiastic and constantly engaging. This is especially good considering the range of ages and professions withing our large group. Rob's tour was by far the highlight of every person in our groups time in Cape Town.I would also like to point out how good Rob is at communicating effectively by email and text message ahead of the tour. When planning something from overseas it is very refreshing that his communication skills were excellent and prompt. The other reviewers have it right, Rob is 5+ stars and is most likely the best guide in CT.

Would give 6 stars if I could. Rob is a great tourguide. He is a native of the area and very knowledgeable, enthusiastic and energetic. He will take you "off the beaten path" for some real local flavor. He is especially good for touring the winelands as he has personal experience in the winemaking industry and is extremely knowledgeable in this area. He seems to know everyone in the towns and villages we visited. He made our trip to Cape Town memorable. We had 2 full day tours: one of the winelands and the other of the Cape peninsula. From great sights to great restaurants and shopping and intimate winery tours and tasting this was a great choice for touring outside of the city.

Awesome Rob Tours. Maaaaate what a fantastic day. Rob sits you down and explains what your options are for the day ahead so you get the most for your Rand. He is very knowledgeable about plants, wine, geology, fish, the whole works. Thanks for letting us try the smoked snook.

if you want to find the essence of Cape Town. We just came back from Cape Town, South Africa and had a fantastic 2 days in Cape Town with Rob Davidowitz, a private guide, doing business as Beautiful Cape Town Private Tours. I think we saw and experienced the best of what Cape Town has to offer through the knowledgeable experience of our very personable and attentive guide. We probably did more than some people, and probably less than others, but whatever we did, Rob made our adventure very memorable and with the feeling that we would want to go back some day to have him show us more. At the end of the day, I felt that we had experienced the very essence of Cape Town and it's culture. One cannot ask more than that from a guide showing you his Cape Town as he sees it.

Rob is the BEST!. We had two days in Cape Town and decided to make the most of them by hiring a guide. Rob was just fabulous. Day One was the Peninsula Tour which included many beautiful sights including the Penguins and Table Mountain. We particularly liked the local flavor though: visiting the fish market and the lady who makes collectibles out of tea bags. Had a lovely lunch at the Food Barn. Day Two we visited the wine country. Rob is a partner in Villiera Wine Farm in Stellenbosch and he is quite the expert in wine making and more importantly, wine tasting :). The tasting was quite informative as we paired wines with food with surprising results, not your normal wine tasting. Off to lunch at at Pierneef à La Motte in Franschhoek, a top shelf restaurant, wine farm with beautiful gardens. It was just a perfect two days! Rob is knowledgeable, personable and fun. He even followed up with us by sending a list of all the sights and topics we covered with corresponding website links for further information! We highly recommend him and would certainly contact him should we visit his beloved Cape Town again.

SUPERB TOUR WITH ROB. Kevin and MarySale, ManchesterWe visited Cape Town for the first time in April this year (2013) before arriving we had made arrangements with Rob by correspondence to escort us around the Cape Peninsula which also included visiting other famous and important sites in Cape Town. He arrived at our Hotel promptly on time and suggested that we sit down together to get to know something about each other and information about the tour. This was great, not only did we leave after about 30 minutes, but we left the hotel more like old friends.His tour of the Peninsula and the beautiful Botanical Gardens in Capetown was tremendous, he is so knowledgeable, and the tour of Cable Mountain was absolutely great.We would throughly recommend this tour with Rob, and should we come again to Cape Town we would certainly love to use his services once more

Rob's tour was just great!. We had just 1 day in Cape town and wanted to see and feel as much as possible in this short time. Thanx to Rob, we did it. He showed us the best places at the Cape peninsula tour and managed to show us the view on the city from the above (in the cloudy weather) and the best restaurant in Africa! He really knows and loves what he does. A lot of interesting and useful information! All the help you need (we had a small problem with bank card, it was solved). We've even got a small local gift from him! And he prepared the towels for us as we wanted to swim in the ocean! Well done, Rob! Hope to see you again!

Brilliant tour experience!. My wife and I did 2 personalized full-day tours with Rob; the Winelands Tour and the Cape Peninsula Tour... what an amazing time! An "in a nutshell" description of Rob is as follows -- he is a truly warm, wonderful, stimulating and engaging person overlaid with the encyclopedia-ic situational-awareness and knowledge of Google Glass and Wikipedia, respectively!Cape Town is a fabulous city and Rob unfolds it for you in the most amazing way. It is not just about the sights themselves but the epistemology behind them as well -- this is what Rob specializes in. In short, if you are a foodie, a oenophile, loves the mountains, beaches, wildlife, nature and the ocean, then Cape Town is the city for you, and most definitely, Rob is the man! Just find out for yourself, you will not be disappointed!

our best day. Our first visit to Capetown and what a memorable day we had with Rob. My son and his family had toured with Rob last year and enjoyed it so much that they bought us a tour with him as a Christmas present and it was very special. Rob met us at our hotel and we talked about our interests and discussed what we wanted to get out of the tour. He is truly passionate about his home town and his knowledge of everything from history to botany to wine is amazing. A lovely man, a pleasure to be with and I hope we will do it again.

Awesome Capetown Tour!. We (3 adult family members) spent 2 full days this week with Rob on our recent visit to Capetown post safari. We selected Rob on the basis of the glowing Trip Advisor reviews. Rob has truly expert knowledge on so many subjects being a former engineer, pilot, manufacturer, businessman and winemaker.He met us at Cape Grace hotel with maps of the region to explain the topography of the Cape. Together we reviewed the areas of our interests and began to prioritize what we could accomplish in the 2 days.Day 1, Rob delved into the history of Capetown with emphasis on the Dutch Colonial architecture.We then visited a fishing village and sampled the fresh local fish from a cafe on the dock. Then a delicious lunch at a wonderful local spot. A scenic drive of the cape followed. Just gorgeous! The final stop of the day was Table Mountain. Day 2 we toured the wine country. We stopped at Villieri wine farm where we enjoyed a wine tasting and a lecture on wine pairing. Lunch followed at a farm cafe in Stellenbosch where we had a chance to discuss the historical, political and social issues.Rob is passionate about Capetown and it is contagious!We parted with new found knowledge, delightful memories and even local gifts. Our only regrets were that we didn't have one more day to spend with Rob! Many thanks to Rob for his efforts and graciousness!!

Two wonderful days around Capetown. Imagine your first visit to Capetown, and being looked after by (1) a native, with years of local knowledge, and (2) a winery owner, with "inside" connections in that industry. Rob of Beautiful Cape Town Tours is both of these! Our group of 6 spent two days with Rob, one going south down to Cape Good Hope (and many other sights along the way), and the second heading north into the famed Stellenbosch wine area. As Rob is part owner of one of the wineries there, we had truly "red carpet" treatment, and were surprised to find how much about viticulture AND oenology Rob knows - he's not just quoting something he read in the "guides' handbook!" We especially enjoyed a very hands-on, practical session of matching different wines with different foods. Rob is now on our list of people to highly recommend to friends who travel!

Memorable tour!. My husband and I booked a one-day peninsula tour with Rob, and we can't speak highly enough about him and the day we spent with him. As others have noted, Rob is extremely flexible and, at the same time, realistic about what you can see and do in one day. Because the tours are private, you benefit from spending time alone with someone who loves Cape Town and has an impressive body of knowledge about every facet of the area. He's also open, enthusiastic and reliable. We found Rob on Trip Advisor and, after reading all of the glowing testimonials, decided to book the tour. We are extremely glad that we did.

Rob & wine - the perfect combination. As we were staying in Stellenbosch we booked Rob to take us on a full day wine tour. Rob met us at our hotel and instead of rushing us out to the car he sat with us to discuss what we’d like to do during the day and then came up with suggestions to suit.Rob is passionate about wine and this was immediately evident when we visited our first wine farm to enjoy some sparkling wine. He has a unique way of introducing the basis of smelling and tasting wine and his knowledge is second to none.We visited some wine farms, had an excellent lunch and concluded the day with a chocolate tasting which was as exciting as the wine tastings; we will never eat “everyday” chocolate again! The day passed far too quickly, we enjoyed it so much and didn’t want it to end!As well as his knowledge of wines and their production, Rob is an excellent guide to the history of the areas we visited and of South Africa as a whole. He has a great sense of humour and kept us entertained with his stories. Rob has a great personality and warmth which makes you relax and enjoy the whole experience. We cannot thank Rob enough for an excellent day out and would highly recommend him.Dave & Angee - Scotland

Amazing tour of Cape Town and surrounding areas. We have just arrived back from a 3 week tour of S. Africa, including 6 days in Cape Town. Our research on Trip Advisor and the web led us to Rob, with whom we spent 4 full days and we were thoroughly entertained for every minute! He has an incredible knowledge of history, flora, fauna, geography, culture etc. But best of all he knows many local people, some of whom we had the privilege of meeting and eating with in their own houses on Rob's 'Cape Cuisine' tour. It was fascinating to learn S. Africa's history through their stories and recollections.  We were blessed with fine weather on Rob's tour of the Cape Peninsula, where we saw the penguin colony, many fine bays, beaches and wonderful scenery. Our city tour took in many sights and one amazing place that Rob knew where Archbishop Tutu made a promise, that has been 'kept' - I won't ruin the surprise for you! Our wine tour consisted of Rob taking us through many wines and matching them with various foods. A great day out, and easy to nod off on the return drive to Cape Town.We had a really great holiday, and packed so much in to our time in Cape Town thanks to Rob.

Wine Tour Through Cape Town - Rob was outstanding!!!!. A group of seven of use went to cape town for a few days and decided to take a tour of the Stellenbosch region. Based on Trip Advisor reviews we chose Rob as our tour guide and we were very happy we did. I have traveled a lot in my life and have never had a better tour guide than Rob. He did a great job telling us about the wineries that we visited but he also gave us a ton of information about the history of Cape Town and he had many other recommendations for other things that we could do while we were in town. He knew a lot about the wine but was also able to relax and have a good time. If I went back to Cape Town I would definitely give Rob a call!

We Want To Adopt Rob!. We started our 3 week African adventure in Cape Town. Research led me to Rob Davidowitz of Beautiful Cape Town Tours http://bit.ly/11hTt4N . Always reticent to get into a vehicle and be “talked at” for an entire day, Rob, a native Capetonian, sounded like a breath of fresh air. We corresponded via email and his emails were engaging, warm and welcoming and I could tell I had found someone very special. Rob arrived at Sea Five, in Camp's Bay with maps and photos in hand and we started our day together with Rob outlining the various sights and experiences to be had, asking us to indicate our interests and preferences so he could tailor the itinerary to us! He pointed out Cape Horn is in fact not the southern most tip of Africa and the additional one and a half hour drive to get there, though pretty, would only yield a sign for us to photograph – a long way to go to take a picture. We agreed and together, with Rob’s expert guidance we mapped out our fantastic day touring the Cape Peninsula.Rob’s encyclopedic knowledge, gifted storytelling and incredible passion for his country made every minute entertaining, fun and engaging. With stops along this gorgeous route, he explained the topography and illustrated the unique geology of the surrounding striated mountains in a way that actually brought those peaks to life! Who can make rocks sound exciting? Rob! Our amazing day with Rob had come to an end much too soon and I was so sorry we had not booked him for our Cape Town city tour, or for our Winelands tour. We felt we’d spent time with an old, dear friend and we hated to see him go. We hugged and vowed to meet again (maybe in Niagara Rob!). I cannot recommend Rob more highly! Book him today! You'll thank me.If you wish to read about our day with Rob and see some of the pics we took, visit our blog http://bit.ly/17bkHMQP.S. One of the loveliest surprises was an email from Rob upon our return home with not only a very sweet welcome message but also a spreadsheet with links to the information about the many, many, many things we talked about during our day together. A man after my own heart!

Customized Non-tourist Tour. I contacted Rob regarding a day trip that was to start a 2 1/2 week South African trip. I explained that my husband and I would be with family in Cape Town for 4 days following our first day and would likely see all the touristy hot spots. We wanted to see something different on our first day. Rob delivered. We saw the less traveled highlights of Cape Town and the winelands around the city. It was fabulous! Rob was a wealth of information about the area, the culture, the wine and even the chocolate. I would highly recommend Rob to anyone who is interested in seeing what is extra special about an amazing place. Let him teach you about "South African Time". It is a great experience!Anna and Phil B.

Wine Tour of Stellenbosch. Spent the day touring the Stellenbosch wine region with Rob. Could not have asked for a better experience! If you are looking for an interesting wine tour with great food and drinks and an opportunity to experience Cape Town from a local, Rob is your guy. We also had plenty of options to customize our tour throughout the day. We were picked up promptly from our hotel in Cape Town and Rob provided a great history of Cape Town on our way to Stellenbosh. He was very knowledgeable about Cape Town, the Stellenbosch wine region and learned many other interesting facts throughout the day! Would definitely hire Rob again for a tour in Cape Town.

Great day out around the Cape Peninsular. I entrusted the three most important ladies in my life (my wife, mother and mother-in-law) to Rob for a day of guided touring around the cape peninsular. They absolutely loved it. Rob takes the time to ensure he tailors his tours to his clients’ interests and likes. He’s an absolute mine of interesting information. Full of useful background and humorous stories and it’s obvious that he’s passionate about promoting his home country to the full but equally happy to discuss its turbulent past. All three of my family were delighted with the day and I’ve got absolutely no hesitation in recommending him. Rob – many thanks again. If trip advisor allowed 6 star reviews you’d be getting one.

Capetown tour with Rob.. Capetown is such a beautiful city. Robs knowlege of Cape Town is more extensive than my knowlege of my home town! Through it all he covered much more of the city than we could ever find on our own. What could have been a simple day of looking at maps and arranging for transportation turned into a fun filled day of many sights & experiences. I took so many pictures during this tour I don't think I can fit it anywhere. If anyone asked me about Cape Town and how much there was to see and enjoy Rob's name would certainly pop up in this conversation.Definitely 5 stars!

Winelands tour with Rob. We had a day with Rob touring the Winelands and it is was everything we were looking for!!! We toured several wine areas and got know so much about food, wine and chocolate in the Cape. This was coupled with his nice little surprises along the way... Furthermore we discussed just about anything between the heaven and the earth and he knows it all (when it comes to Cape Town and South Africa that is ;-) ) and it made for a very good day with lots of new experiences.

Best Ever!. My California family of 6 traveled to Cape Town for the first time and we had only 3 days to see and learn as much as we could about the city/region/country. We spent 1 of the days with Rob (who I found on Trip Advisor) and we had the best time ever! From the moment I first made contact via email with him, Rob was attentive to our needs. After meeting him in our hotel lobby, I knew it was going to be a grand day. He began by giving us a brief background of the people, history, geography, politics, etc. and mapped out suggestions of things we could do. From there, we made an itinerary of a full day's Cape tour. It was fabulous. The penguins at Boulders are adorable; the fish and chips at Kalky's in Simonstown were delicious; the scenery along Camps Bay, Hout Bay, Chapman's Peak was spectacular; lunch in Noordhoek was simply scrumptious and the story and visit to the T Bag Shop was inspiring and empowering. Rob more than met our expectations. He is knowledgeable, gregarious, energetic, warm, witty and FUN! My only wish is that we had more time to spend with Rob touring the other areas. Rob, thank you for a fantastic day!

A long overdue 'Thank You'.... This review should have been written about a year and a half ago...well I got the time now so here it is - sorry for the wait Rob.Rob can only be described as the epitome of Cape Town Hospitality! He has perfected an art that many 5* establishments are striving to achieve. Our tour started out with a very enthusiastic tour guide, but ended in a cherished friendship.To say that Rob has a wealth of knowledge about his beloved city would be to remark that the English are rather fond of tea. The passion he has for the area and everything in it is at the very least contagious. This was no more a tour than it was a long overdue adventure with friends! Fantastic wine, incredible food, breathtaking sights and the best host a honeymoon couple could ask for, made for one EPIC day in the Mother City.Keep up the good work Rob!! You will hear from me again in the near future!

Truly amazing!. 4 days were spent with Rob in January and we are glad we booked in early! Absolutely cannot fault anything about the customised tours with Rob. He shared so much of his knowledge we left feeling like we had been in South Africa for years. The highlight was definitely the winery tour and the food tour!! Everything was so well thought out and made us feel very special. It became very clear from the moment we met Rob as to why his reviews are so high. It's all in the detail and the little things.. Even if you have done Cape Town before I guarantee Rob would be able to offer a completely different perspective! Thanks again for making it such a great trip for us Rob.Dorothy and Buzz.

personal tour of the Cape. We were met at the airport by Juseff, a very enterprising gentleman with a Mercedes to market. He took us to the hotel and offered us a day tour of the city and the Cape area for the next day. He informed us and entertained us with local customs and history as well as taking us to the more interesting parts of the Cape. A very well-spent day and at a very reasonable cost.

Two of the best days ever!. Rob’s encyclopaedic knowledge of the history and geography of the Cape is something everyone needs to really benefit from everything that SA has to offer. He really does know everything and everybody. Whether it is the ladies who sell fish, the wine producers, the chocolatiers and cheese makers, you get to meet them and learn from them. As they say in S.A “WHAT A PLEASURE!”Born into a wine family, Rob’s deep knowledge as a winemaker was a revelation. My wife and I just couldn’t believe how the matching of food and wine could add so much to our enjoyment.He made our visit so enjoyable and we thoroughly recommends anyone visiting the area to ensure you have at least one day with Rob.

A perfect guide for a fascinating place!!. A perfectly wonderful tour guide who actually listened to what you wanted to see and then expanded from there. Knowledgeable about history, culture and the area, Rob was superb. A great, outgoing conversationalist, we joked and laughed all over the Cape Town area. Being a foodie, also, he took us to tastes of the local cuisine, which were delicious. We were among the locals, avoiding the tourist traps, and seeing how life really was. Rob followed up via email after we returned home, sending us web sites and recipes for using the spices we had brought home to once again eat the South African way...We could not have been happier with such an excellent guide and person.

Here's a tip: BOOK EARLY!. What can I say that hasn't already been said in his other 115 very postiive reviews?1. This is not a tour company. Rob arranges be it, do it, experience it excursions. I felt more engaged than I typically do during a show and tell type tour. 2. The excursions are built around what you want to do. Rob met with us in the morning after a few emails compiling our ideas to discuss what he thought was possible. Rob has ideas and access that you can't find online or in guide books. For example, I had said that I wanted to see animals and Rob "happend" to know a wine maker who also owned a small amount of hoofstock (giraffe, zebra, and antelope) and arranged for the wine maker to not only show us his wines but also his animal collection. So if you have an idea of what you want to see and do tell Rob, chances are he will know how to arrange it. 3. You will need to book early. We had originally tried to book Rob in 2012, but as the highest rated tour company in the Cape Town area he is understandably booked months in advance. We booked Sept for Jan, if you only have a limited time in Cape Town I would suggest booking as soon as possible.

There cannot be a better touring experience. Rob was a wedding present from our friends - and what a mighty fine one he was too. Although he did not come gift wrapped, he was extremely presentable, so interesting and made our day so special. He has a huge depth of knowedge and covered such a huge amount of history of south africa along with current affairs, it really gave us a feel for the place. As for the wine experience.. mmmm! We cannot recommend him highly enough - he is everything you could possibly want and more - and a much better wedding present than a toaster!

Catered to your interests. I had arranged with Rob for a full day tour, but due to our delayed flight leaving home, we missed our connection. Rob was very accommodating and patiently waited for my call that we had arrived. Unfortunately, our late arrival only allowed a few hours of touring Constantia wine area. It was great! Rob met us promptly and discussed with us our options. We immediately felt comfortable with him. It was a short drive from our hotel. Beautiful views of the wineries and great conversation and food. Just a great afternoon all around. We hope to return again to Cape Town and will definitely contact Rob again. Thanks, Rob!

Everything you could ever want for a hugely successful & enjoyable Tour. If you were ever unsure about the value of a Private Tour & also want a unique experience, then Rob is the one to 'tick all the boxes'. As a Family our consensus related to five main features, with an example, although, there were many others: Personal - we outlined our requirements prior to the Tour which was based on a Winelands experience. Rob suggested some improvements & alternatives we were not aware of, which would & did, make the day more interesting & enjoyable. Attention to detail - on the day & before we departed, Maps & drawings were produced which provided a great visual overview. Knowledge - comprehensive, not only related to the Tour but, generally. Friendly & fun - the right balance throughout. Professionalism - wants to get it right for the Customer. You would not be disappointed.

Experience Cape Town Fantastically. My wife and I were lucky to have been able to share three days in Cape Town with Rob, and cannot thank him enough for sharing his city with us and for giving us so many highlights and unique experiences during our time with him. We have not stopped talking about how much we loved Cape Town and the many beautiful, interesting, historical and singularly special places we shared. His knowledge and love of the city and its environs certainly come through in our conversations, and we are hard-pressed to prioritize our adventures. How can one choose amongst so many - our special breakfast on the Mandela balcony, the spice market, the fish market, the Dutch governor's estate, Latefa, Sandra, and David's culinary delights, the gardens, the Township tour, etc, etc. Each and every one of these stay in our memory and leave us with a marvelous feeling about Cape Town, its people, and certain very special new friends (ie: Siviwie - our Township guide - and Rob). Rob's knowledge, professionalism, sense of humor and general concern for his clients, as well as the comfortable, luxury vehicle we traveled in all are what one hopes to find in a private guide, but seldom does - unless you travel with Rob. We look forward to our next opportunity to visit Cape Town where we hope to have the opportunity so spend some time with him.

A completely unique and enjoyable way to see Cape Town. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Rob during our brief stay in Cape Town. The depth and variety of his knowledge is only surpassed by his genuine enthusiasm for sharing his country's history, culture and people. He took the time each day to sit down with us before-hand to plan the day's activities, customizing the experience to match our interests and schedule. I cannot think of a better way to experience the Western Cape than with Rob as a guide.

Professional, friendly and funny. Rob is a very well prepared and professional guide, serious in his job but easy going and with lots of sense of humour at the same time. Always client-oriented, he can sense perfectly what you need and organize it for you on the spot or prepare it beforehand. Great knowledge about the region, the country and the wine industry, always pro-active and going the extra mile. He gave us many travel tips that served us a lot during the rest of our voyage. Strongly recommended!

Excellent Tour Guide. Book a tour with Rob! It's one of the best experiences you will have in Cape Town! Rob is an intelligent, friendly and fun tour guide! He greeted us with an an explanation of what we could see whilst on tour of the Cape Peninsula and when we got into his luxury vehicle he presented me with a gift! Talk about pleasing the lady of the house! He is extremely knowledgeable and is a foodie much like us! We can't thank him enough of our fantastic experience with him and when we come back to Cape Town another tour with him will be first on our list! Thanks Rob!

First Rate!. My fiancé and I booked Rob for a one day tour of the wine lands, and it has to be said...it was the best thing we did while in Cape Town! And that is saying a lot, because we had an awesome stay! I felt instantly at ease with Rob, he just has that Midas touch which gives you confidence from the outset. He spoke to us about our tastes to personalise our trip and made sure we were happy. I loved that we had constant conversations going in the van, not just about wine but also South Africa and its history in general. Suffice to say, it really made the trip so much more worth while. We not only learnt so much about the wines (what this guy doesn't know isn't worth knowing!) but I am really happy that I walked away knowing more about the country as well. The added personal touches blew me away and I have to join all of the other 100+ Trip Advisors in saying that Rob is first rate and is worth every penny! Please don't hesitate and just get Rob booked. You won't regret it!

A fantastic region brought to life by an enthusiast and true gentleman. From my first contact with Rob via email to saying goodbye after our fantastic tour I thoroughly enjoyed the experience personally created for us. Rob collected us from our residence even though we were staying out at Blouberg. He has a pristine luxury vehicle making you feel safe and comfortable. After a brief geography lesson of the local area Rob gets down to business to understand your expectations and tastes. He crafted a tour based on this brief conversation that met all our expectations. Having been on many wine tours in Australia, France, Germany and New Zealand I thought I knew what to expect but Rob took it to another level. The tasting experience at the first wine farm was a whole new and exciting experience blowing away preconceptions of wine types and favours. From this 1st stop the day went from strength to strength. It is not only about wine as Rob's knowledge of the area and South African history is deep. The personal touches that Rob includes makes this a truly 5-star experience. We'd take the same tour again and will definitely be insisting to others that they do the same.

Excellent Surprise. Cape Town is fantastic, it was a nice surprise to me. I sent a e-mail to Rob like one month before telling what me and my wife like to do generally, and at the end i wrote "book what you think is better".He really did well, in my case was wines and fine cuisine, but later he surprise me and we went to a place taste boutique chocolates, fantastic! He knows the history of his land very well, so was perfect.Thank`s RobRegardsTiago

One day is NOT enough!!. We took the Cape Peninsula Experience with Rob on the first day of November this year. And what an experience it was!! Rob made sure we could tailor our trip to our liking and he presented us with a multitude of options, one better than the other; it was difficult to choose...:)! Once we set off on the trip, he immediately knocked us off our feet with his charming personality and limitless knowledge. No question was too difficult for him to answer.
