His specially caring way with our children was VERY appreciated, both by our children and us, the parents!! So, THANK YOU VERY MUCH, ROB!! The only thing we regret is that we couldn't spend more time with you.....!

Just fantastic, stop thinkinging about it and book now!. Have just spent today with Rob and really don't know what more I can do but echo all the wonderful things that other reviewers have said. It has been one of our best experiences on holiday ever, Rob brings energy, enthusiasm and interest to every minute of the day. Do not come and expect the usual quiet boring tour with intermittent moments of interest, Rob's passion and immense knowledge demands attention but is conveyed with such good humour that you will quickly feel less like a 'tourist' and more like someone who is visiting a good friend and having them show you around their most favourite place in the world. Thanks to Rob and all the Winelands people who helped to make today so special. And Rob, if you ever find yourself in in UK and fancy a visit to Worcester you would be more than welcome to stay with us.

Rob is the best!!!!!!!!!!! Our tour around the Cape including was amazing and informative!!!!. Rob is lively, friendly, informative, a wealth of information and full of insight into the history, the present and the movement forward in a rich and diverse country....My husband and I were lucky to have found Rob--the day we spent with him was one of the highlights of our first trip to Africa. Rob is also fun and enthusiastic and knows how to connect with people in order to make sure you see and learn about what interests you..Our fabulous tour around cape was topped off with Rob arranging a fabulous lunch with Bruce Robertson at his beach house--an amazing day, fabulous lunch and Dan and I will be singing Rob's praises to anyone from the USA who wants to visit Capetown and surrounding area..Thank you Rob for sharing your beautiful country and the welcoming spirit of Africa with us!!!

Entertaining, informative, delightful city tour of Cape Town with Rob!. Rob shared all the city highlights as well as hidden away gems of Cape Town. He is enthusiastic and knowledgable about his city and loves to share! Thanks for a phenomenal day we will not forget!

Private Customized Cape Town Tour. Rob was an amazing guide. From the beginning he laid out all the options that were available then listened as my diverse group decided which attractions were must see. Then helped us map out a strategy to fit it all in. He has a remarkable depth of knowledge of subjects ranging from the political climate (and how it related to our own) to the best Android apps. He not only took us to some of the most amazing eateries but pointed out spots we should check out on our on. At each location we stopped at it was obvious that he was well known and well regarded. Made all the more impressive because like I said we created our *own* custom tour. The Wine and Chocolate Tours were amazing and I felt like every nook and cranny were available to us because we were with Rob. His sense of humor and Trivia would have entertained in any context but add the breath taking scenery as a backdrop and you have the recipe for a most enjoyable time. I can clearly say, without a hint of exaggeration, that our visit of Cape Town was more memorable because we saw it though Rob's eyes.

Cape tour, Kistenbosch, and wine country.. I spent two days with Rob traveling with a group of friends from the US. Our time with Rob was an abundant experience full of insights into the diverse culture and history of Cape Town. The tour around the Cape was spectacular and included a stop in the lovely Kirstenboch botanical gardens and a visit with the penguines. Lunch was a delicious organic meal at the picturesque Food Barn in Noordhoek. If you enjoy wine, I highly recommend Rob's tour of Cape Town wine country. Let him personalize the experience for you. Our tour included a visit to an organic vineyard where we learn about how sparkling wine is made. The education and wine tasting was great fun and we were all more than a little tipsy after. The day in bed with chocolate tasting at an artesianal chocolate factory. I will never eat Hersheys again!

Cape Town with Rob Davidowitz. Traveling with Stacey James & Dazzle Africa, I had the opportunity to go (with my group) on2 days of customized tours with Rob in Cape Town. On each day he used clear maps to explain to the 6 members all the options for the day, using as a starter the ideas we had sent in way too impractical emails. He worked to get a consensus; every group member was happy. We were a lively group with lots of questions. Rob was adept at honoring each one's participation, like agood teacher. We got a ton of detailed info. & hands-on demos. He answered every question in depth on a very wide range of topics. We saw all the best tourist places, in a meaningful way. I experienced my own Cape Town at Daddy Long Legs, Tommy's Book's and Addis in Cape Ethiopian Restaurant and I am so glad that I got to experience Rob's Cape Town with my group.

Best Cape Town Tour. The best Cape Town Tour is with Rob Davidowitz! We had a group of 9 travelers from the United States with a diverse request list. Rob beautifully structured 3 separate tours, one of the Cape, a fantastic wine tour and lastly, a historical city tour. I participated in the tour of the City, which included interesting facts and stories based on the history of Cape Town and the experiences that has shaped Rob's own life history in the city. He tied in cultural, military, apartheid and social histories. We ate at a fantastic restaurant that suited everyone's needs and he made an effort to customize the day based on our on-going interests. He was absolutely delightful, made sure that before we began our tour that he explained the outline of the day to see if anyone had any other requests. He was very informational, entertaining and most of all personable. We truly enjoyed being with him. My only desire is that we could have stayed longer and experienced more of what he calls home....

Prepare your mind and tastebuds for a Cape Town culinary experience!. We were fortunate enough to be able to spend a day with Rob experiencing the culinary delights of Cape Town. Now, this is not a usual type sightseeing tour, but a cultural and culinary experience where you will sample the delights of the varied cuisines in the homes of the true locals. We started off on the balcony of the Town Hall to have an Africaans "farmer style" breakfast, then on to visit a spice store in BoKaap, followed by a Cape Malay feast at the home of Latifa. The food was a feast and each dish tempted us, one after the other! Onward to visit the home of Sandra where more delightful food was presented to us along with her tremendously warm personality. It was sad for us to enventually leave her home and venture to the township of Langa. David was waiting for us there with his traditional African style food and maize beer. As a result we developed a taste for pap and spicy chakalaka, and then requested it during our travels in southern Africa! If you are interested in the food and cultural aspects of food, then this experience will delight you. However, bear in mind that you will not need to eat that evening nor the next day! Thank you Rob for the great day out!

A wonderful view of Capetown. Yesterday we spent a wonderful day seeing Capetown through the eyes of Rob. His genuine affection for his home shows in every detail of his tour. He started giving us the options for our day, than giving us a history of the city. We than walked around the central part of town and saw the small area where Parliment, the church where Desmont TuTu preached and a Dutch church. This corner is where history was made. Then it was off to Wine Country. We started with lunch at Tokara winery, the food was delicious.rob is knowledgeable is so many subjects that we had an invigorating conversation. Then it was off to the Warick winery for a tasting. We then went for a unique chocolate tasting at DV Artesinal Chocolates. Wow what a finish to the day.Anyone who wants a personal,unique and interesting tour of Capetown should contact Rob. He is a gem

2 Wonderful Days of Tours with Rob. We had a group of 6 people and we booked Rob to be our guide for 2 days touring around the Cape Peninsula and Hermanus. We had a wonderful time. He was a great guide. Rob was very knowledgeable about the areas that we went to and he was constantly providing us with interesting information about the local areas and sites. We traveled to Hermanus on one day to see the whales and on the next day we traveled around the Cape Peninsula. He took us to a small local Fish & Chips place that was a great place to stop for lunch. We never would have found it on our own. Rob was very flexible and he was willing to stop whenever we wanted to take photos. Rob really helped to make our trip to Cape Town very enjoyable and memorable.

Half day tour of Cape Town with lunch. We have just returned to England following our third visit to Cape Town and on each of our visits we have spent either a half or full day with Rob Davidowitz. Quite simply we have learned and therefore enjoyed more about Cape Town and the western Cape in his company than we could have found out for ourselves over an infinitely longer time span.Whether it is the history of the Cape, its diverse people, the varied flora and fauna, the economy, the politics, wine making- you pick your subject and he will know about it and has the gift to be able to communicate his knowledge with great enthousiasm. Amazingly for such a talkative person he even possesses the ability to listen!Seriously though, if you want a thoroughly informative and enjoyable day in Cape Town we would unhesitatingly recommend you get in touch with Rob Davidowitz.Anthony, Liz and AndrewManchester

Be sure to send your bio. Rob goes out of his way to make sure you have an amazing experience, and will personalize a tour to the interests of your group, so give some thought to what interests you before you set up your visit. He has a vast knowledge of the Cape Town area and can take you to places you would not even know to request. Also, think ahead about the kind of meal you would enjoy for lunch. If you want some amazing gifts, ask him to take you to Streetwires and get a guided tour of wire and bead craft. Rob asks to be paid in South African Rand. We were staying in the downtown area of Cape Town and I should warn you that the ATM machines close down very early, so get your money together before you start the day. Voice of experience speaking!

Great guide for Cape Town. Rob is the best. I cannot give a higher recommendation for his guiding professionalism and the passion he expresses for history, culture, and of course, wine. If you plan to visit Cape Town, your experience will be greatly enriched by working with Rob on setting up a personal tour.

What an experience!. Rob is truly one of the greatest tour guides I've ever come across and I will recommend his tours to anybody!The effort and passion he puts into his work shows and making it personal for everyone that takes a tour.He does his own wine tasting at the farms which shows you how he really does go the extra mile and wants to be part of your great experience!Not only friendly, diligent and witty but a down to earth person that you will surely enjoy going with to see the sights and teach you what you could possibly want to know.

Rob's Tours. We toured with Rob on a modified peninsular tour and a 2nd day to the winelands.. Robs intimate knowledge of the winelands (he was born there and grew up in the winelands) is unparalleled. He made wine tasting easy and will make pairings you would never imagine. We went to the botanical gardens and you would think he planted all the plants himself. He shows you all the uses these plants have played in medicine. Rob sits down with you before you start and talks to you to see what interests YOU!! I really don't know how to categorize Rob - Tour guide,humanitarian- ambassador-story teller and an entertaing humor. He is proud of Cape Town (He is absolutely passionate) and should be with this an amazing city and area. He surprised us everytime he picked us up (I won't spoil it for you) and he seems like a family friend.His knowledge will keep you interested every minute of the day. He does not do groups. I think he only does tours 3 days a week the other 2 he spends at a winery he has interest in. If you are going to Cape town just book now !!

Fantastic Winelands. After reading the wonderful reviews about Rob on Trip Advisor we decided to ask him to assist us in organising and hosting our day tour of the Winelands. He greeted us with a warm and friendly smile and began talking about the options we could explore. It was evident that he had a particular passion for good wine and food, we knew we were in good hands. Through-out the day he extended our knowledge of Stellenbosch, Franschcoek , bio diverse farm practices, wine and food pairing and much much more. Our lunch at Overture was magnificent and the convivial Rob had to suggest we move on or we would miss our last stop! Thanks to Rob's knowledge,skills and wonderful sense of humour we all had a very special day to remember. Sue, Neville and the gang

Wonderful Tour of Cape Town!!!!. We spent 5 nights in Cape Town and had arranged a trip with Rob for the last day we were in town. We were thinking, gee, we've already seen most of the city, went to Table Mountain, Cape of Good Hope, did the Winelands tour, did many of the other touristy things and thought so what else could there be to see. Well, Rob met us at the hotel and had us sit down to find out what we had already seen and done and then came up with an itineary that he thought we might like. We didn't just like it, we loved it!!! Rob took us on the most fasinating tour ever. He made the history of the town come alive and gave us a whole new perspective on Cape Town and South Africa. Rob has lived through a lot of the recent history and gave us a very personal view of how things were and how they evolved to what they are today. We covered many of the major sites in the city, toured the marketplace, sampled wonderful bits of South African cusine along the way, then ventured up to Signal Hill where we participated in shooting off the canon at noon. After that we went to a spice market and learned about all kinds of spices and how they are used in Cape Malay foods and then surprised us by taking to a wonderful woman's home in Bo Kaap where we had the most amazing feast. She must have cooked up 20 or more dishes and breads and everything was absolutely delicious. Friom there he took us to a couple of very intimate and private wineries. The setting was stuinning. One of them was towards the top of a mountain and you had a panoramic view of the wine valley. It was like being in a millionaire's living room experiencing the best life has to offer. Then we visited a second winery that was somewhat more tradiitonal (Dutch) and the estate was beautiful. Rob had plenty of stories and experiences to share with us and made you feel right at home.The day with Rob was one of the best days of our lives and we would highly recommend a tour with Rob. You will not be dissapointed. Rob is the Best!!! Doug & Mariluz

Really fun and nice trip. Rob is humorous, knowledge, and a very friendly tour guide. He make me feel that I meet a friend, not a tourist agent. I really love the way he explained everything and the options he provided for my tour. With him, my trip become marvelous.Only with Rob for the wine and cuisine tour, but I think other tours that he provide will be great, too.Thanks again for being with us, Rob.

You will want to spend more days with Rob. I also want to spend more days with Rob. We did have such a great time together. He's such a thoughtful tour guide I have ever known. He spoiled me in the way that I don't want to do any public tour anymore. Your interests and your tastes will be fully captured by Rob. In that way he will make memorable days for you in Cape Town.p/s: Oh, he "spoiled" me in many other ways >:) You should experience it yourself ^o^

The perfect tour guide for Cape Town. Rob Davidowitz is knowledgeable, articulate and passionate about his world. After two and a half days with him, we felt as though we had come to know Cape Town through an old friend. We got to know the city, the Cape Peninsula, and the wine country. Everywhere we went, his detailed understanding of the history and culture which he shared in a nearly off-handed way, and usually with a personal twist included, made us feel we really understood this fabulous place. My wife loves plants and has dragged me to gardens around the world. Rob took us through Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden, and, seeing it through his eyes, for the first time I was as enthralled as she was. At City Hall, Bishop Tutu's cathedral, Bo-Kaap neighborhood, Rob had an anecdote at each place that left us with an historical perspective and a warm appreciation. Thanks to his warmth and professionalism, we will always have a good memory of Cape Town.

Rob made our days in Cape Town. Since a very first moment we met, we were strongly confident that we would have a great time with Rob, even the trip started in a cold and rainy day. He is the first tour guide with a wealth of knowledge, sense of humor that I have ever met. We had an adventure to explore the Cape Town's cuisine in Rob's way, so many glues to know the culture through the food. I would highly recommend spending a day with Rob if you are in Cape Town. Don't forget to do Rob's tip for amazing pictures.

Rob & Cape Town a Perfect Match. We contracted with Rob for a full day tour of the Cape Town Penninsula 9/6/12. What can I say other than FABULOUS and BOOK EARLY!!! From the moment we met Rob in the hotel lobby Rob's main concern was making the tour "our tour" offering suggestions and incorporating our wishes. Along with an excirting fun-filled adventure to vineyards, a drive along Chapman's Peak road, to the Cape of Good Hope, and tea bag factory Rob brought humor and a wealth of knowledge about the area.We would highly recommend Rob.....you will not be disappointed.

Rob Davidowitz Cape Town Tours. Rob is a very low-key, very professional and informative guide. We did the one day Cape Town Pennisula tour and added on the Tea Bag Factory. He is very flexible combining the tour highlights and incorporating your requests. He made our day memorable and entertaining...he has a great sense of humor! We would recommend him highly with one very important point...BOOK EARLY....he is very much in demand.

Fantastic day in wine country!!!!. We spent a day with Rob in the wine country, and it was absolutely fantastic!!! We were traveling with our two daughters, aged 14 and 11, and were concerned about finding a way to make a wine country tour interesting to them. Rob knew exactly what to do, and planned a very memorable day for all of us, that truly appealed to everyone. We started out at a great bakery in Cape Town that the girls loved, and then went on to wine tasting, cheese tasting, chocolate tasting and a wonderful restaurant for lunch. Rob shared many of his insights on life in Cape Town and South Africa with us, and made the day both educational and memorable for all of us. I would HIGHLY recommend spending a day with Rob if you're visiting Cape Town and lucky enough to be able to find a day he's free!!!

A Thoroughly Enjoyable Day in Wine Country. Rob is a most wonderful tour guide! He is a charming gentleman whose goal is to provide an enjoyable, relaxed, informative day to his guests. Rob gave my family a variety of experiences - tasting great wine, unique cheeses, and delectable chocolates. He not only shared his knowledge and enthusiasm for high quality food and drink, he also shared his extensive knowledge of South African history with us. Rob achieved his goal of giving us a special day. We'll cherish the memories!

Great Day with Rob!. My daughters and I had a wonderful day with Rob in Cape Town this August. We were concerned how to tour Cape Town on our own, and choosing Rob for our guide was the best decision we could have made. He cares passionately about his city and country, and shared many insights with us, as well as answered all o our questions. We toured the Kirstenbosch gardens, and drove all over the Cape. He even took us to his favorite fish lunch at the harbor. You won't be sorry you booked a trip with Rob!

Great Day in the Wine Lands. Rob was terrific from start to finish. He planned a great day for my family and I that included a mix of tastings, great food, and sweet treats, as well as a behind-the-scenes look at the wine making process. Throughout, he shared his vast knowledge on a wide range of topics - from farming sustainability, to politics, to South African history. I would highly recommend anyone visiting the Cape Town area spend a day being toured around by Rob.

Three great days with Rob in and around Cape Town. What a great adventure to explore Cape Town, the coast, and the wine country with Rob Davidowitz as our personal guide and wine expert. Not only is he a delightful companion, but his knowledge of the area's history is amazing, how does he remember all that stuff??? From the Kirstenbosch Gardens to the Stellenbosch Wine Area it was great, just needed a few more days to drink it up (literally). Do not miss a visit with Rob to Overture for lunch, near Ernie Els Vineyards, just don't plan to move for the remainder of the day (too much good wine is not a good thing,after all). Just now getting around to doing our album and remembering what a memorable experience we enjoyed and wishing we could pack our bags and do it all again soon. We have recommended Rob to several friends and will continue to do so.Jim and Melle Cleghorn (Visited August 2011)

One of the best days ever: The Cuisine of the Cape Tour. After reading about Rob's concept of the Cuisine of the Cape tour we had to give it a try. What an incredible day. Rob picked us up at our hotel and off we went on our eating adventure. Right from the start, our day was filled with pleasant surprises. Because of the rain, Rob managed to change our first stop from an outdoor farmer's breakfast to a breakfast on the covered balcony of city hall. We went from house to house meeting the most wonderful people and sampling all the different cultures and foods found in Cape Town. It's a lot of food but it was an experience my wife, daughter and I will never forget. The next morning we had a city tour planned and Rob again met us at our hotel and offered suggestions of things we might like to do. He was full of great ideas and, once again, we had a great morning. A day with Rob is highly recommended.

Sightseeing in and around Cape Town. We had a wonderful private guide named Rob Davidowitz who picked us up at Derwent House and toured us throughout the City and other areas like the Bo Kaap/Malay area, The Spice market, Simon Town, Cape Peninsula, Hout Bay, Kalky's Bay. Constantia Glen Winery,Rob was our private guide for two full days and he was amazing, knowledgeable and tailored our tour to what we were interested in doing.He took us to Hout Bay where we saw a most amazing business called T Bag Design which is a must to visit! He also introduced us to the Streetwire project where amazing art is produced by creative local folks. We had the opportunity to meet a family and have lunch with them in their home and that was terrific!!Rob is the BEST!!!!Marcella & Kenneth HenryVisited June 2012

Day tour of the wine lands Western Cape Province of South Africa. Waiting for us absolutely on time, with a friendly smiling face was Rob Davidowitz. From the moment we met to the end of our journey into the wine lands bordering Cape Town our day was packed with the geography and history of our destinations. That coupled with an educational tour into wine making and tasting as well as experimenting with different flavours of food groups to enhance the palate through a meal with wine. We ate exceptionally well stopping for cheese tasting in Stellenbosch, followed by a divine lunch in another vineyard and topped of with excuitsite chocolate in Paarl.The day was filled with mirth and humor as well as some moments of reflection when we discussed more serious topics.A seriously NOT TO BE MISSED experience thanks to Rob.

A Wonderful Adventure!. My wife and I spent 2 1/2 days with Rob starting the first day after arriving from Los Angeles the last weekend of May. I could tell from the moment we met Rob in our hotel lobby to review the day's itinerary, that we had chosen the best! Generally, we dislike tours and being shuttled around to see worthless sights that I could probably care less about. I tend to get boed easily and after a fe minutes at a site, I want to move on to the next. Rob has a keen sense to make even the most boring topics, amazingly interesting. The best thing about Rob is his love for food and wine--a passion we share as well. I don't want to give away any of Rob's trade secrets, but he took the wine tour to the next level by making you think about what you are drinking and how best to pair up the wine with food to make dining an Experience. Much more than a wine tour, Rob enlightened us with the best culinary experience and shared his passion for food and wine at every opportunity. On the last day, he took us to a farm that produces high quality chocolates to do some chocolate tasting--something I would never have thought of, but it was one of the highlights of the trip. Rob even made, what I thought would be a pretty typical boring walk through a botanical garden, a very interesting experience. Rob made us see the Cape Peninsula and Wine Country in a way we could never have seen by ourselves. There were nuances to being with Rob that made our time with him worthwhile: we visited lesser known wineries that allowed for more personal attention, he engaged us in the history of the Cape to better understand how certain vents shaped the political, social and business environment, while at the botanical garden he explained the importance of about a dozen plants and their importance in the ecosystem (in what otherwise may have just been a walk through a park, but Rob made it interactive and I really enjoyed it as opposed to questioning why I was having someone drive me to a park simply to walk me around for 5 minutes before getting bored).South Africa, and especially Cape Town, is our new favorite place in the world, largely in part to Rob's guidance and making sure he educated us on the place he so proudly calls home.

Cape Town Tours then Rob is the one!!. The excellent review ratings here on Tripadvsior pointed me to opt for Rob. It was indeed a remarkable Cape Peninsular tour as Rob was truly passionate about his home town. He was so informative and knew everything about the place. We started off with Kirstenbosch gardens and Rob impressed us with his knowledge in Botany. He took us to Constantia Winelands and through the fishing villages and Simon’s town and filled us with a lot of information about the history of the place. The tiny interesting details he threw in amazed us that he knew so much and kept even our 5 year old girl entertained. We next went to Boulder’s beach to see the penguins and stopped to have a lovely lunch out there.Rob took us to the perfect scenic spots along Chapman’s peak drive and could even explain the reason behind names like False Bay, Lady’s mile and what was line fish all about!!! We had a fun trip to the World of Birds and then back to the hotel via Camps Bay and Clifton.His personal touch to the tour and talkative friendly nature made us feel that Rob was our family friend more than a tour guide. We strongly recommend him to all who want to go to Cape town.Thank You Rob for a Wonderful time ……..

Cape town tours. We used a South african tour company called "WineDesk waterfront " to organised tours for us around Cape Town must see....Cape point Boulder bay (Penguins), Pebbels project, Township tour, Winelandstour, Hike up Table Mountain, a biscycle ride around the city and the historic visit to Robben Island .All tours were excellent value for money with well informed and entusiastic guides who could not do more to give us a sense of the country and culture that was South Africa.South Africa has so much diversity in culture and scenery that I am sure will make a fantasic trip for anyone and using Wine Desk should make it that much more interesting.

There is no one better. We spent 2 fabulous days with Rob last week. My only problem was we should have spent more time with him!Rob is amazing. He mapped out exactly what we asked for and made our days with him amazing beyond belief. He showed us things and explained them at a level no book or normal guide can. We have traveled the world and used guides in many major areas. Rob is among the best!Highly recommended to anyone spending ANY length of time in this region.

He's the man!. We've booked quite short-term a Cape Peninsula Tour and choosed to go with Rob, based on the stunning TA ratings he's got. We couldn't have done any better. It was sincere pleasure touring around with him and we had a fantastic mixture of seights, people, experiences and, not to forget, fun.I can absolutely recommend Rob for everybody who is looking for the non-standardized way of doing a tour and is open-minded to learn about this fantastic piece of earth and it's lovely people.Thank you again, Rob. Hope to see you for another tour!

We are a couple from Germany and.... We are a couple from Germany and spend our holidays for a few years in Cape Town. We thought we already knew a little bit about the country and the Western Cape region. But...In January 2012 we followed a hint from a friend living in Cape Town and contacted Rob to arrange a date for one or two days.We had luck: fortunately two customers cancelled the booking so we could start already on the next day with our "Exploring Western Cape".IT WAS SO GREAT!Not only the locations which Rob showed to us, but also the lot of interesting and humorous stories Rob was telling to us. We have seen so much - we learned so much about Cape Town (first day) and the region around (the other day) - and we laughed a lot - not one minute has been boring or uninteresting.Thanks for answering all the questions we had - even about cooking.My wife loves cooking and is very interested in all things around it. We both love good food, especially when we travel. So we enjoyed not only the real south african meal in the nice restaurant but Rob explained all the different tips of south african food.He also likes cooking and we got some real south african recipes. Next day he fist stopped at a shop where we could buy some spices to take home to Germany.Thank you Rob for these nice two days which gave us so much new impressions of "your region" - we could feel that you love your country and their people. Thanks for showing us your country with your eyes.Not to forget: The air-condition in your "lekker" car also has been not so bad :-)Sorry that we remembered (while looking a picture show of our trip together with friends) so late making this review.We are planning our next holidays again in Jan.2013 and you can be sure: we will contact you in time to spend another exiting 2 day together with you.

Highly recommended. We visited Cape Town in early April for 10 days and decided to contact Rob to design two bespoke tours given that our family consisted of two adults and two children (4 and 6). Rob did exactly that in a way which was imaginative, flexible and, most importantly, receptive to the interests of both adult and child. We have never written a review in Tripadvisor until now, but felt that Rob tried so hard to make both trips special, that it was the least we could do to point others, like us, in his direction. It is his genuine enthusiasm and friendliness that makes the difference, notwithstanding his own personal touches which to repeat here would spoil what perhaps makes him unique among guides. Simply put, both days spent with Rob were the most memorable of our trip and he comes highly recommended.

Fabulous Wine Tasting Experience. Our hotel recommended a private tour through Stellenbosch and my group was lucky enough to have Rob (owner) as our tour guide. We explained what we were looking for and had recommendations on our trip plan. My group was extremely pleased on the tour--we even got to have a traditional farmer's lunch at a vineyard! Highly recommend this tour!

part of the family. I am currently living in Cape Town and my family visited in March from the states. They wanted to do a tour of the peninsula and, and after reading Rob's reviews on this site I went ahead and scheduled a full day tour. Rob met with us the before we got started on the tour to go over our options. He took into account what each of us wanted to get out of the tour and managed to accomplish everything in just one day, without us feeling rushed at all. The tour with Rob was definitely the highlight of the trip for my family- by the end of the day they felt like Rob was part of the family!

Make it 61 !. 60 previous "Excellent" reviews now add a 61st ; my wife discovered Rob through TripAdvisor , so we hoped for a great experience ... and were in no way disappointed !Following Rob's advice , we opted for the Winelands tour , although we were to spend the next two days touring the area on our own... and we were VERY glad we started with a day with Rob.From his instruction on wine-tasting (we actually experienced a few of the things the experts go on about ,much to our cynical confusion) , to visits to particularly fascinating wine estates (including Villiera , a biological ecosystem and social set-up which could well be emulated everywhere , to Beyerskloof , another wonderful and valuable method of giving back to the community) to lunch on an estate near Stellenbosch , Rob kept us entertained and fascinated .But we do have one complaint : our nine hours with Rob were all too short !

Five Star Tailor-made Package. We first met Rob in 2001 when the hotel we were staying in recommended him for a private tour. On that occasion he organised a tour to the Cape, a township, Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens, and to a couple of vineyards. He proved then to be a charming and sociable person and it was apparent that he was knowledgeable and passionate about Cape Town.In January 2012, we were due to join a cruise ship at Cape Town and had a day in port before sailaway, so we contacted him to arrange another tour. This time, we wanted something different. We are interested in wildlife and wildlife photography so he was able to arrange a tour of a wild life bird sanctuary near Cape Town, and even arranged for a local 'birder' to accompany us, who also proved to be an expert in his subject and we had a wonderful few hours there. Following this we travelled over the hills to Franschoek, where we stopped for lunch in a restaurant in an exquisite setting.Overall, we were extremely pleased with our tour, for which we have lots of memories. Rob is very good at putting together a package to suit individual needs and we cannot speak highly enough of him.

Wonderful, educational and fun wine tour for all.. Just visited South Africa from Kruger to Cape Town with my two adult children. My oldest is currently doing research in the Kruger and has been living in the park. One of the things she wanted to do was a wine tour when we visited Cape Town. Hired Rob and we are so glad we did. He listened to what we liked (or didn't in the case of my son) and gave us a wonderful tour with good wine, good food and lots of laughs. We would highly recommend him for all of your touring needs.

So wonderful! Highly Recommended!. We booked two tours with Rob - a city tour and a winelands tour. He was highly recommended on trip advisor and we're writing this review to confirm that he really is a five-star guide with a ten-star sense of humor! Rob's knowledge of local flora and fauna shinned on top of Table Mountain, and his understanding of the history and culture of Cape Town provided a window into day-to-day life. We had two amazing lunches, one at a local curry market, and another at a fabulous winery. Both very different but equally delicious! Our wineland's tour included a personalized wine tasting experience and a tour of the winemaking process that took us from a grape on the vine to wine in the glass. Also, he sent us an email with links to some of the things we spoke about during our two tours. If you only book one tour in Cape Town, book it with Rob. He brings out the flavors of Cape Town, literally and figuratively.

A must do tour from the very best!. We booked two tours with Rob from Beautiful Cape Town Tours and were absolutely blown away! Our peninsula tour and our Stellenbosch tour were unforgettable! His knowledge, passion, and enthusiasm was unparalleled and he is an utterly charming and brilliant raconteur!! The wine tasting was exciting and informative. We had an opportunity to walk through the wine making process from the vine to the bottle. Our experience was so enhanced by his in depth knowledge and passion for this city and his love of it's merits. He introduced us to two of our finest restaurant meals in Cape Town! - The Food Barn and the Jordan winery restaurant. Our days were spent like a wonderful visit hosted by a very close personal friend!I highly recommend Rob to introduce you to this magnificent city!If you love food and wine, Rob's tour is a must!

Great way to experience Cape Town!. For our trip to South Africa, my husband, friend and myself wanted a complete tour that included both major sites and local culture. Rob provided all of the above and then some! His love for his city was palpable! I loved that he walked (and drove) us through the history of Cape Town during the city tour portion of our day. Seeing the evolution of the city through his eyes was one of the highlights for me! Our day included a tour of the Bo Kaap, a wonderful (and memorable!) lunch at Mzoli's in Guguletto, and a tour of Table Mountain. It was a fantastic day and every one of us left Cape Town hoping to return someday!I definitely recommend Rob! Check out his website to see all of the different tours he offers. And if you have a particular itinerary in mind he is more than accomodating! After our tour, he followed up with an email highlighting all of the sites we saw and things we talked about. He also emailed us a list of his recommendations for our next stops in the area, Cape Point and Franschhoek. He loves Cape Town and is so very excited to share his city with all!

Abolutely Perfect. It was the nicest Holiday Trip we ever had, perfect planning and professional guiding. Everything was perfect, we saw wonderful places and Rob tips and tricks were amazing. Everywhere he brought us, we will never forget the beautiful landscape. Cape Town seams to be the best place on earth, and especially the unknown insider tips were outstanding, like in the winelands, never had seen such nice winefarms, the Maison outside Frankschhoek was unbelievable snuggling.
Fantastic. Amazing service and would recommend anyone going to cape town especially those going for the first time

Magnificent. Rob Davidowitz is a true professional and a nice bloke. If you want the best day imaginable in the Cape winelands, you have to use Rob, he brings the region to life with his 'in-depth' knowledge.

World Class Guide for a World Class destination and experience.. We are seasoned travellers, cynical,questioning and hard to please.Our guide Barry ticked every box we asked for and added a few extra surprises himself.Everywhere he took us it felt that it was there just for us.This guy knows everybody and everything and makes the most of his knowledge with entertaining experiences and stories.This was not feel like a 'Standard' tour, but as if it was designed to help us find the experiences we wanted from the Cape Area. Fantastic value,5 stars are not enough!!

Amazing wine tour with great company. I can highly recommend this wine tour. Our day with Rob is one of our most memorable days of our vacation in Cape Town. Rob is very knowledgeable and taught us all about wine while having lots of fun and being in an amazing setting. He took us to vineyards in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek, where we also had a great lunch. He planned the day according to our wishes and we ended up enjoying ourselves so much that we arrived back to the hotel almost two hours late.A few days later he sent us an email with a long list of internet links to everything that we had talked about. That is clearly somebody who loves what he's doing!

Professionalism that met ever requirement. We spent 3 days with Rob exploring the culture, wine history and scenery of Cape Town. From our very fist mail to Rob, we knew that he was the only person to show us around Cape Town. He was extremely efficient and professional in the manner that he answered all our questions and requests and he went to on to meet our every expectation about our Cape Town visit, and much, much more. Rob was an absolute pleasure to be with for 3 days and there was not a single moment during our visit that we where not completely enthralled with what he had to show us. By my own admission, we are extremely fussy travellers but Rob took this completely in his stride like a consummate professional and looking back, Rob was the best choice of any Cape Town service that we could have chosen. Don’t go to anyone elseTHANK YOU, Rob !

If you want to not only see Cape Town, but also feel it, smell it and taste it-go with Rob!. I normally never hire a guide when I travel, as I enjoy my freedom and flexibility to go off the usual tourist route, so I came across Rob's page really fishing for ideas on what to see. However, having read the reviews and looked at Rob's site my friend and I decided to give it a go. Rob was with us for 1.5 days out of 2.5 days that we spent there. My expectations were very high, but what we've experienced was much better than I had imagined-we have enjoyed absolutely every minute of it. Rob has not just shown us Cape Town, he made us feel part of it for this short time that we spent there. We really felt it, smelled it and tasted it. Rob adjusted the programme on the go based on what our interests were. All of it, from personal accounts of South Africa's recent history, to current polical and social developments, to tasting fish on the pier and at a local cafe in a village where we were the only tourists, a short 'course' on surviving in the bush at the botanical gardens, to visiting a development project and great fun throughout-was absolutely great. I left South Africa feeling totally in love with the country and with Cape Town in particular, and also having found a new friend in Rob. I am definitely coming back and will be recommending Rob to anyone planning to visit Cape Town. Alina

Rob is the man! No other way to see beautiful Cape Town!. We visited Cape Town and trusted Rob to show us all of the highlights of Cape Town based on all of his previous reviews. We had very high expectations due to the reviews...and he completely exceeded all of them, times ten. We toured with him for two days. He took us to the different wine regions with rich history, amazing wine, and delicious food! We visited the beautiful botanical gardens, penguin colony, around Table Mountain, Camps Bay, and drove the breathtaking Chapman's Peak Drive. He really does personalize your tour to whatever your interests are! There is no other way to see Cape Town because of the incredible expertise Rob provides! We will recommend Rob to all our friends and will visit him again soon! We left Cape Town feeling like we had traveled with a good friend!

Great guide -a great authentic cultural experience. On our first day with Rob we took the Cape Cuisine Tour which is really more about people than food (although there is a LOT of food!). The day was jam packed and we had the privilege of meeting a variety of Cape locals in their homes. Each of our stops was in a different socio-economic neighborhood and each of our hosts was inspiring in their abilities and outlooks on life. I can't imagine another way to soak up so much insight into life in Cape Town in one day.Our second day was a general tour of the Cape. The scenery was beautiful and we got a good sense of the flora and geography of the Cape. We didn't make it to any wineries and wish we had included one or two on our schedule. Rob is a great guide who seems to know everything about all things South African. So glad he was able to show us around.

Absolutely Fantastic!. I was looking forward to meeting Rob from the very first email and expectations were not only met but well and truly exceeded. We thoroughly enjoyed our day with Rob. He is funny, witty and what that man does not know about Cape Town is not worth knowing. He is like a walking encyclopedia, I feel very lucky to have found someone to share the tour with who was so very interesting and knowledgable and with an obvious love and passion for South Africa itself.It can be intimidating spending a whole day with someone you dont know but this worry was soon blown out the window in minutes of meeting Rob. , It was the last day of our four week travels of South Africa so me and my partner were a little bit snipey with each other (as am sure couples travelling with each other will completely understand) and a little low that it was our time to go home, Rob took this in his stride and made us chuckle all the way round Cape Town.A truly exceptional person and tour operator. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Excellent!!!!. Rob was absolutely great. We are an older couple with very specific interests, and Rob was able to tailor our time with him to hit only the aspects of Cape Town and surroundings that we were truly interested in. He was always willing to change the itinerary to fit what we wanted. He was always willing to give his advice but NEVER imposed anything on us-he always kept our priorities at heart-truly amazing guide!!! At the end of our time with him, he provided us with links to every topic we covered-not only on the places we visited but actual conversation topics we had during the drive and walks! You cannot go wrong with Rob. He is the definition of professional.

Fantastic tailor-made tour!. Happy my husband took the time to find Rob. Great Cape Tour, looking at exactly what we wanted, and with a baby to add to that! Rob has all the background knowledge and more, and it happy to share it with his guests. he is also not shy to talk to strangers on the road and explain their situations and backgrounds - all of this with empathy towards the person he is talking to. Great tour, very nice person, when we return we shall certainly be calling on Rob again.

Best Tour Guide. I have never written a review on TripAdvisor before, but I felt the need to because of the experience I had. I have been fortunate to do a lot of traveling, and Rob is the best tour guide period. Besides being accommodating above and beyond what was required, he was extremely well versed in ever conceivable topic be it geology, botany, geopolitics, history, economics, agriculture, etc. I had the great fortune to spend three days with Rob, and it was by far the best money spent on the entire trip. I left with a greater appreciation of what I was seeing and experiencing-something I will never forget. I am not doing justice with how impressed I was with Rob in writing this review. I give my highest recommendation, and would recommend anyone traveling to Cape Town to spend at least one day if not longer learning from him.

Awesome experience. Don't be like us and arrange your tours after you arrive in Cape Town. Rob was only available for a winelands tour on our last day and after the experience we kicked ourselves because we hadn't arranged our other tours through him as well. The difference between Rob and the others is like night and day!! He is funny, extremely knowledgable, courteous and personable, all of which combine to make his tours "must do's" when visiting Cape Town. Thanks again Rob.

Excellent tour. Rob is an excellent tour guide. He customized our tour to exactly what we wanted and suggested things we never would have thought of or otherwise known about. Rob is so knowledgeable, fun, and friendly. It was a great day and definitely the best tour we did in South Africa.
Amazing experience. Our guide Rob s enthusiasm and wealth of knowledge made our expierence exceptional.A "must do " if you re in Cape Town !!

Interesting, Informative, and Fun!. It was a day spent exploring the wine country but also exploring South African food and South African culture. Rob is very knowledgeable in all three. We had a great time talking with him and exploring the wine country near Cape Town. We had a complete tour of a winery Rob is involved in, several tastings, gourmet lunch, and very interesting and informative conversation.

Absolutely brilliant!. My wife & i spent the day with Rob out in the Winelands which i can honestly say was fantastic! Rob is a friendly guy with a great sense of humour. Rob clearly knows his work because he was brilliantly informative and whatever it was we wanted to do in the winelands he knew exactly where to take us. There was not a moment in our day that we did not find fascinating & attractive.Thank you Rob for a stunning tour.

A fascinating personalised tour with the charming & erudite Rob. We spend a day with Rob Davidowitz, and it was fantastic in all respects. Rob asked us what our interests were, and tailored the visit of Cape Town and Constantia, taking in the main sights and telling us much fascinating history and lots of super-interesting tangential tidbits too. He is most delightful, and so our day lasted somewhat longer than initially planned, as we had such a great time. Very highly recommended!

Best Tour Ever. After reading reviews online about Rob and his ability to conduct a tour we had very high expectations before we arrived. We were not disappointed. We booked Rob for two day’s worth of touring. One day in the wine region of Stellenbosch and Franschoek and one day at Table Mountain, Cape Point, Botanical Gardens amongst other hidden local gems.Rob being a local and wine maker was able to take us too many local places and private wineries to avoid mass numbers of tourists giving us the ability to really soak in Cape Town. Besides from learning a great deal about Cape Town you will learn a great deal about the people of South Africa amongst other things. I highly recommend Rob.

The best tour guide ever.. I chose Rob based on the other Trip Advisor reviews, which I was afraid were too good to be true. They weren't. He is even better than they said. And he is much more than a tour guide. We all can not stop raving about how great he was. He took us to the wine country. We learned a university degree's worth of information and ate and drank our way into glorious bliss. If you want the greatest tour and guide ever, then this is your choice. You also get a friend and a lot of laughs as a bonus. And be sure to ask him about the wizard.

Rob the perfect host. My italian friends were here on holiday 2 weeks ago and they asked me to write a note on their behalf... in English... for Rob at Beautiful Cape Town Tours and thank him for the amazing service they had. They were very happy with Cape Town and with Rob's ways... despite the language barrier they could understand and appreciate the thorough explanation Rob gave them. Rob, a big GRAZIE to you from Michela e Marco from Verona.I am glad I recommended you! Federica

Best day ever!. We did a half-day winelands tour with Rob in Stellenbosch. It was one of the best days ever I had insane amounts of fun some great wine and very good champagne. We did an amazing lunch in an absolutely beautiful setting. We even each got a personalized bottle of wine. I would do the whole day over again in a heartbeat no doubt about that. Amazing amazing experience!!

Amazing insight into the Cape Peninsula. As an ex-South African now living in London I thought I already knew all there was to know about Cape Town, but Rob took us to some incredible places that I would never have found on my own. His knowledge and enthusiasm for his subject is awe inspiring and I have no hesitation in recommending him to anyone who wants to see more of the Cape Peninsula (and beyond) than just Table Mountain !

There is Rob and then there is everyone else. If you are searching for a tour guide that not only knows everything but has a flare for sharing his love for Cape Town then Rob is the guide for you. We originally found Rob while searching the web and one always has some trepidation of what to ultimately expect. Our experience exceeded our wildest imagination. We spent an independent day in the Winelands and Rob was gracious enough to set up a plan for where to go, where to eat and which wineries were worthwhile. When we connected with Rob in Cape Town we had 2 amazing days seeing all the highlights as well in sharing in Rob's personal experiences growing up in Cape Town. This is one fabulous guide! I recommend him frequently without hesitation!

One word...A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!!!!. Beautiful, beautiful Cape Town, was well worth the long flight (12+ hrs) great place, great tour guide and brilliant food and drinks not forgetting the many amazing attractions we were introduce to. Thanks for all your hospitality and the sights of so many fantastic "Hot Spots" WE'LL BE BACK...DEFINITELY!!! ps: Thanks again...Will definitely recommend you to all friends and family as a very reliable and trustworthy tour guide with lots of great humour and a very likeable personality :-))

What an amazingggggg experience.. After having not lived in Africa for many years it was time to explore my new home town in a more professional way.Being a visual person the day started off brilliantly. I have never had a tour guide start the day off by showing me a map of where we are and where we are going to (this being an aerial view). By this introduction Rob already blew my mind. It immediately put the entire route into perspective, so much so, that as we were journeying along all I needed to do was simply soak up the vast amount of information which came pouring out of Rob (with such passion) that one dared not waste this invaluable moment. A more informative and charasmatic guide we could not have gotten. He does have a bit of a quircky humour though:-) Never the less, as they say in Africa....it was amaazinggg.Rob is not the cheapest of guides but well worth every cent spent!!!!!

Absolute must!. We had an absolutely incredible day with rob! He customized our day trip to include all of our desires. Along the way he taught us about the history of cape town and south Africa and the impact it has had on the city we see today. Rob took us to see the botanical gardens, the old manor house in constancia,the penguins at boulders, the fish market where we even had the opportunity to taste some snoek, the great views of the western cape, and the famous table mountain. Rob was super friendly, very professional and an absolute pleasure to spend the day with! We recommend highly!Rob, thanks for the memories of beautiful cape town!

The best tour I have ever had!. My partner is from South Africa I am Kiwi. He decided to do 'a tour' just to please me. Guess who enjoyed it the most! It was unique, entertaining, informative and a total pleasure.

One word - Exceptional!. I have traveled extensively and this was not my first visit to Cape Town, but touring with Beautiful Cape Town Tours made it one of my finest ever holiday experiences. Rob was simply the best guide you could ever hope to have - extremely experienced, knowledgeable and highly entertaining. It felt more as if I was touring with a friend who I had known for many years, such is Rob's personable style and sensitive approach to his client's needs. His interesting and very amusing anecdotes brought the city and surrounding areas alive in a way I have yet to experience from any other tour guide anywhere in the world.If you're looking for a tailored personalized touring experience in Cape Town and surrounds then I can highly recommend Beautiful Cape Town Tours. In a word it was exceptional!

Unforgettable day on the outskirts of Cape Town. It 'absolutely mandatory, if you're in Cape Town, spend a day with Rob. In our tour we had arranged a day off, so we decided to make use of the competence and friendliness of Rob. One day along the coast, visiting the beaches where the penguins live, eating in a nice waterfront restaurant and tasting the local wines with Rob is a board that we feel we can give.Rob gave us a lesson on how to best appreciate the quality of the wine in relation to food, a lovely surprise on the road to our hotel.Not only beautiful scenery and wineries but also history, history of the city, the problems of the past and hopes for the future, in a few words with Rob we felt travelers and only touristsRino and crew

Amazing Cape Town, amazing & knowledgeable guide. Rob was a great guide to the Cape area. He took what we wanted to see and tailored a great trip around the Cape region. And past that he was just a good guy to spend the day with. We would highly recommend using his services.RM

Fun, informative and possible to customise. Some friends and I took several tours with Beautiful Cape Town Tours and everytime they were great. Rob, our guide is knowledgeable on many topics (I especially appreciated his knowledge of wine) and knows the city like no other. He always managed to provide us with a very informative and enjoyable tour and is always looking to customise the tour to our wihses and interests. I can highly recommend him to anyone interested in seeing what Cape Town has to offer, and learn something while you're at it. One notion of caution though; Rob likes a prank so be on your garde. He had me fooled once to great delight of my friends.

Amazing. Myself, my husband and another couple travelled to South Africa in March 2010. When we arrived we got our hotel to arrange a Wineland tour and we had no preference so let them select who to book it with. We were picked up by Rob from Beautiful Cape Town Private Tours and from that moment on it was amazing. I drink wine with dinner but never realized how much better it taste when paired with the right product. We were shown this aspect of the tour and then from lunch, to ice cream in town, to seeing how the silk items were made was astounding. I could go on and on but just believe me when I say that there is nothing that Rob does not know about Capetown and after this tour we love it just as much as he does.There is nothing more I can say to express how great this tour was and I would recommend Rob and Beautiful Cape Town Private Tours to anyone.Juanita

All round Entertaining and informative. Travelling with young kids seeing sites is now always easy, but Rob's all round knowledge and great sense of humour kept use all entertatined. He was very professional and well worth the cost with not only local knowledge, but displayed a great knowledge of world affairs. He'd heard of iCarly and the wiggles - so kids were happy.We all felt safe and comfortable and he has a really comfortable car. I will definitely keep in contact and recommend to friends. Good on ya from Larry, Jody and the kids in Aus

Fabulous Day from Cape Town to The Cape of Good Hope. Our tour guide for the day Rob was exceptional and very personable. He shared stories, facts and loads of information throughout the day. It was a great ending to our vacation. I would not hesitate in calling him should we be blessed to go to South Africa again.

Fabulous family visit. This was our first visit to Cape Town and Rob made us feel so comfortable and secure that we will certainly return. The day spent with Rob was one of the highlight of my family’s visit to this amazing country.It is clear that Rob is very well connected and this made our Cape Town experience just that much more special. He showed us a side of Cape Town that we could only have seen with a highly regarded person living in the city. We were originally planning on touring with a group touring company but are absolutely convinced, having spent the day with Rob, that this would have been a very bad mistake.

The greatest guide we ever had!. We took 3 tours with Rob of Beautiful Capetown Tours altogether (2 whole day tours and one half day one) and every time we were absolutely delighted and impressed by his way of combining and carrying out the tours. He is an inexhaustible source of information and enthusiasm about his favourite town, whose attractions, history and culinary delicacies he presents in his own inimitable way. Everything was extremely well planned and organised and we always got more information, fun and special attracions than expected.We highly recommend touring with Rob while in Cape Town.

just beautiful!!. i just had the best tour ever. It was the first time for me, being in South Africa and i couldnt have chosen a better tourguide. He was so well prepared and knew excatly what I wanted to see and whatever question I had, he knew the answer. The places and wine estates, he showed me around were unique and I felt special, because no big tourist busses went to those beautiful places.Thank you very much again...i can only recommend him!!!

excellent time visitng cape town. Rob is an excellent guide. we spent one day with him visiting many of the areas around Cape Town... parks and sights. his knowledge was all encompassing and he not only knew the bests sights but also the right time to go in order to miss the large crowds.. David S.

Fabulous guide. Rob Davidowitz was an amazing guide...my friend and I spent the day with him in the winelands of South Africa. This was one of my favorite days in Capetown. He is friendly, intelligent, funny and knowledgeable. He knows everything there is to know about South Africa. Anyone who goes to Capetown should not miss out on a enjoyable and memorable day with Rob!
Cape Town is surrounded by scenic beauty. An amazing trip and our tour was outstanding. I could not get over all the beauty. Our guide was everything we could ask for.

Fantastic Guide for Everything Cape Town. I first used Rob as a tour guide for Cape Town back in 2009 - 3 days. Day 1: City Tour. Day 2 - Winelands. Day 3 - Cape of Good Hope. Rob is wonderfully organized and completely learned on the history and culture of everything Cape Town. Very personable, fun and engaging, Rob facilitated fascinating conversation with his encyclopedic knowledge of the region. He would start each day with a thorough orientation of the day's activities complete with maps and photos. He is very attentive to his clients wishes and a wonderful host to the Mother City. I've recommended Rob to several friends who all have similar positive feedback and I've re-hired him myself when I've hosted new friends in Cape Town. Highly Recommended!

Outsanding Tour Guide, Great Knowledge and Personality. Rob does an outstanding job of matching your interests with his expansive knowledge of Cape Town to develop a unique itinerary.Several of us wanted to see the coast, botanical gardens, penguins and Table Mountain.Robb developed a great itinerary, identified a great restaurant for lunch and away we went. Outstanding. Impressive knowledge of local points of interest as well as botany.As a result of this tour, several of us worked with Rob to develop a wine country outing. Once again, Rob arranged a fantastic mix of wineries in addition to another great lunch at one of our stops. Most impressive was Rob's hour long wine tasting and pairing "teach-in." We sampled several wines and paired each with various small bites to test our palate. Great experience.

A real insider's view of Cape Town. We used Rob Davidowitz and his company for day tours in Cape Town. Although I grew up in the area, and we have visited many times before, Rob introduced us to new places, he tailored the tours to our interests, and he impressed us with the depth and breadth of his knowledge. Highlights included eating freshly caught fish at 10:00am; eating lunch in a charming farmhouse; a walking tour of downtown Cape Town; a tour of the wine country; and wine-tasting at a private winery. Rob's enthusiasm for his home town was captivating and he related well to both our teenager and our elderly parents. In addition, Rob gave us insider tips which we put to good use on the days we were touring on our own. We used one of his guides for a walking tour, and he was equally impressive. We highly recommend Beautiful Cape Town Private Tours, and can't wait to use them again!

Rob was the best!. Rob Davidowitz was such an amazing tour guide. He gave us lots of tour options and we chose our itinerary. Rob was so knowledgeable about South Africa, the people, history, wild life, wine and more. He was also so much fun, we laughed for 2 days. We could not have asked for a better guide.

Rob was very professional and knowledgeable. There were 6 of us and we had 2 days with Rob in Capetown. The first day we saw all the main sights of Capetown and the second day we did the wine country. It was a wonderful two days and we got to see everything and Rob was extremely knowledgeable about all of the sights. I would highly recommend him to anyone looking for a tour in Capetown....

A boutique Cape Town experience to remember!. My wife and I who hail from CT but live in Frankfurt, hosted a German couple who were visiting South Africa for the first time and decided to use Beautiful Cape Town Priovate Tours (Rob Davidowitz) in providing them a private 2-day Cape Town and surroundings experience.We were very impressed with the varied but detailed program that he devised for us (based on our interests) which included: DAY ONE - a private and detailed guided tour of a functioning wine estate (including a special wine-tasting) in Stellenbosch, visits to Franschoek and a wonderful local restaurant for lunch, additional wine tastings at a few selected award-winning boutique wineries etc and then a beautiful scenic drive back to our Cape Town Waterfornt hotel. Rob, being a wine-maker hmself has intimate knowledge of the process involved in producing top wines (including 'methode champenoise') and has close relationships with many of the wine producers in the region. DAY TWO - we headed out on a tour of the Cape Penninsula which included visits to Kirstenbosch Botannical Gardens (and an extremely instructive lesson on the indigenous flora of the Cape), Kalk Bay harbour (where we interacted with the local fishermen and sampled 'smoked snoek'), the Penguin sanctuary at Simonstown, Noordhoek village where we had lunch in another excellent restaurant, Hout Bay and Chapman's Peak, Llandudno, Clifton, Camps Bay and finshed with a cable-car ride to the top of Table Mountain!.Rob has incredible knowledge of the Fauna and Flora of the area, the best places to eat and visit and devised a program that provided a unique experience to our friends and showcased the best that Cape Town has to offer - all in 2 full days!His sense of humour and his impromptu anecdotes about the different places we were visiting made the whole experience very enjoyable and relaxing. We never felt pressured to finish the photo-taking or hurry along if we lingered at a particular point of interest, and his attention to detail and attentive attitude towards his 4 guests was admirable, considering the number of times he must have been asked the same thing!A truly memorable experience and we felt proud as Capetonians to show our German friends the Cape in such style and professionalim, thanks to Rob Davidowitz!

Knowledgeable, personable and very well informed. We spent 3 days touring in and around Cape Town with Rob. The first day we did the wine country and found him to be a very knowledgeable guide and very informed about wines and also about food and restaurants. The second day we did the penninsula down to the Cape of Good Hope another fantastic day, he proved to be an excellant geologist and historian about this area. The third day was Table Mountain and the City of Cape Town, again we had a fantastic time. Rob is an extremely interesting and well versed person, we would not hesitate to recommend him to anyone.

No Better Way to See Cape Town. This was our first visit to South Africa, and Cape Town the first stop. The way your vacation begins can influence your entire trip, and having Rob Davidowitz show you the sites around Cape Town for 2 days and impart his vast knowledge about EVERYTHING with you is definitley the way to begin. He was so entertaining and friendly that it was hard to believe we had just met him. He was extremely accomodating when we decided to change some things last minute, really making it "OUR" trip. Once we returned home, he followed up with an email, giving us information regarding all the things we had talked about and wanted to learn about. I would highly recommend Rob as a Cape Town guide, and would love to go back and have him show us more of that beautiful area!

Fantastic day in the wine country. Rob took us on a fantastic and very presonal tour of the Stellenbosch wine country, just an hour outside of Cape Town. He picked us up at the hotel and asked us what we wanted to do, and we were able to completely customize our day. First stop was to Table Mountain, where the crowds were already gathered to take the gondola to the top. Rob suggested we skip this and head straight to wine country, as we'd end up spending half our day waiting in line. In a very short while, we arrived at Villiera where he is a partner, for a tour of the wine making facilities and a tasting of their diverse range of wines. Then we stopped at Terrior for a wonderful lunch in a very relaxing environment. Afterwards, it was off to the Golden Triagle for a tastingat Rust en Vrede, and finally a stop at Annondale. Overall, it was a fantastic day, and Rob was a very knowledgable, engaging and entertaining host. This is not your run of the mill tour, it's truly a personal experience.
A wealth of knowledge. Our tour guide Rob could not have been more pleasant or knowledgable. Rob's expertise and engaging manner made our two days of touring a memorable experience.

South Africa Trip. We went on the half day Uthando tour. It was such a rare opportunity to meet some wonderful South Africans that are working to help others learn skills to provide for themselves. We visited four community projects in the Khayelitsha township. We were forever touched by their kindness!
Make sure you go on this tour.

A truly inspiring morning, Thank you Uthando !. We recently visited South Africa and booked a tour with Uthando , it was the highlight of our trip ! We were collected by Xolani ( our guide for the morning ) his knowledge of the history of South Africa was fantastic , delivered with such passion and enthusiasm. We visited three different projects, ending with the community centre for the elders , where we were met with singing and dancing and much laughter ! We were not sure not to expect from the visit or if it may be suitable for our two children age (12 &15 ) but we came away understanding so much more about the history , the politics and of the past struggles of South Africa.We will follow Uthando with great interest and hope to return one day . Thank you James and Xolani

Uthando Half day charity tour. Had the most fantastic time on the tour - Xolani was great and took us to 4 wonderful places that they are helping - a garden project "gardening is cool" , a crèche , a community project helping with health , beading activities and after school activities and the Maccasar pottery project. it was great to see first hand the good people are doing for others and to have been even a small bit involved was super.thank you James and the team for a wonderful product and for being so caring.

Remembering the Mandela years. On Friday 28th October I had the privilege of joining the Uthando Tour for a guided visit to several community upliftment projects around the Cape Town environs. Overall, James Fearney's knowledge of the recent sociopolitical history of South Africa and its impact on diverse communities was thorough and detailed, with a strong ethos of the constructive approach developed by the Mandela administration to uniting a divided country and facing fearlessly the injustices of the past, whilst treating with compassion those in need of help in the implementation of democracy. The projects that we visited showed that this continues to be achieved in many encouraging and endearing ways for ordinary people: at a school in Retreat we were delighted by an Opera outreach project with school children playing along in a production of Hansel and Gretel; in Khayelitsha we joined a local men's choir and dance group in favourite South African sing alongs and saw all the good work being done by this community centre in health, crafts and rooftop garden; around the corner we visited a pretty community garden growing vegetables to feed locals and to sell to market; and in Macassar we drummed along with a group of potters making hand-crafted ceramics to uplift the youth of the area. Truly, the people we met were so warm-hearted and friendly, the initiatives so well thought out and useful, that it took me back to those most inspiring years when Mandela was in the Presidency, and South Africa wowed the world. Thank you Uthando for sharing the love and creativity of our wonderful people!

Probably the most thought provoking thing we did on our holiday, thank you James and Xolani. What can I say? Only praise!!! My wife and myself went on holiday to celebrate my wife's 60th birthday, we had 19 nights and a very varied holiday. Although we enjoyed every part of the holiday, our visit on the Uthando township tour will remain in our memory for the rest of our lives. This tour was recommended by our U.K. Travel company. Holiday Architects in Cheltenham, how pleased that they made this recommendation. James and Xolani our guides,picked us up from our apartment at 8:30am for a half day tour. James talked to our party of eight while driving to the townships, what an interesting talk, giving us the history of Uthando a not for profit charity. Xolani then talked about his life and where he was brought up as a child, again, very interesting.We visited four projects, firstly we visited a nursery school, then onto a craft workshop followed by a garden project for after school activities. Our last stop was a dance studio for a full rehearsal for a show. Our travel agent had passed on that it was my wife's birthday. The beautiful children sang happy birthday to her. James also gave her a book about Conversation with the Elders, sponsored by Uthando. If you are in Cape Town, make sure you book this tour. Everyone benefits

What an amazing tour and incredible experience.Uthando we thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. We had the privilege this morning of doing a tour with the CEO of Uthando,James Fernie.Uthando promises on their website to " constantly strivie to offer TRULY inspiring, authentic and meaningful experiences WHILE doing good, showcasing remarkable stories AND helping to raise money for innovative community projects."We shine a light on beautiful people, doing incredible things WHILE helping them"Well today I found this to be 100% true!We started our day with a visit to a school in the area of Retreat to watch a 45 minute dress rehearsal of Hansel and Gretel, a production being staged as part of Cape Town Opera (CTO) Outreach Programme.This was amazing and so enjoyable as the children joined together with professional opera singers to create a fun,brilliant musical experience.We then went on to visit eKhaya eKasi “Home in the Hood” Art and Education Centre.This centre creates employment for and serves as a resource centre for poor families from the community.We were treated to drumming and dancing by an extremely professional group of dancers from the community.Our next stop was at Abalimi Bezekhaya “Farmers of the home”.This is an organic vegetable growing enterprise that trains hundreds of micro farmers in the theory and practice of organic farming!!!!!!! Amazing!!The last ( but definitely not least ) stop was at a pottery in Macasser.This is run by a truly awe inspiring man,Johan, who not only creates emplyment but produces an equisite range of pottery.The tour was truly an awe inspiring experience.James was so knowledgeable about South African history,culture and the community and social development in the areas we visited.But,to me, it is his passion for what he does and more importantly the people who are like his family.James "is what he is" and truly is a " person of the people."Thank you James

Highlight of Cape Town Visit. Its hard to put into words the value Uthando tours brings to the validation of community born and run efforts in and near Cape Town as well as to the incredible power of sharing these experiences with a wider global community. I have worked in international community development for over six years and I have never encountered a tourism operation like Uthando. James and Xolani are incredibly intentional and genuine members of the greater South African community and they bring that intention into each interaction. I was connected with James through a dear friend and colleague of mine and was excited to visit the various community projects they highlight on the tour, but nothing could have prepared me for the experience. I feel honored to have met the various community members we visited and I am filled with renewed hope and inspiration to approach my work and my own community efforts with as much love and kindness as those from Uthando do. This tour is an absolute must for anyone seeking to understand South Africa, Cape Town, community development, and even themselves better.

Happy children...and adults!. James took us to see all aspects of the great work that Uthando provides to improve the quality of life for the people of the township. I envied the beautiful gardens and wished that my thumb was as green as the people caring for the plants! The children were so excited to show us their results in developing their many talents. It showed that these children are not only educated...but fed and inspired by the wonderful teachers who were so proud of their students in every way. The tour was too short, I could have spent all day watching these activities.

Projects in Townships of Cape Town that show attempts to overcome the oppression of apartheid.. With James as our guide we went from one example of the children’s activities to another-ballet, acting, hip hop dance, pottery. It was so moving and powerful to see that the systematic efforts to totally destroy the humanity of the black South African people had failed. In fact not only could their spirit not be crushed, but in some bizarre ironic way their spirit can serve as an example to the world of how to heal and move forward from atrocities that a nation and a people have suffered as victim, perpetrator and bystander. Thank you James for supporting these projects and providing glimpses for the world to see of what can be for these post-apartheid children.
