The children entertained us with singing and dancing. It was both an eye-opening and an uplifting experience and we recommend it to anyone visiting Cape Town.

À must to do. Travelled with swedish lejonresor and had this wonderful tour with mr James ferrie. Fantastic Way to meet south africans and chare ideas and histories. Also very informative of south africas history.

Discover the "Heart" of Cape Town. Uthando offers a unique chance to meet some of the beautiful people who are making the townships of Cape Town a better place to live. I visited several projects including a senior's care facility, two very different dance groups and a soccer academy. James will provide you with a clear, concise background of the history of the region as you drive, then will turn the tour over to the people running the projects when you arrive at a location. It is a unique opportunity to witness the unique "rhythm" of life in a township (instead of just looking out a bus window). I left feeling inspired by the generous spirit of these hard-working and positive people.

Toured Uthando Project in March 2012. We have visited South Africa twice in the past 3 years and always love to go into the townships and meet the people, visit the children and learn about their culture and lifestyle. Our tour operator arranged for us to visit 3 projects that Uthando operates and we are so glad we did. The work this organization is doing is amazing and so vitally important. We visited daycares, met the most amazing women who grew vegetables for the community and educated the local children how to be self sufficient. The music center was excellent and heart warming. For anyone with a social conscience, you should plan to participate in one of these tours. We were so impressed that we returned home and sent a donation to James, the founder, to assist him with continuing his work.

An Inspiring Day. As President of Spirit of Africa Adventures, I spent several day in Cape Town recently on a trip from the USA to visit different organizations that offer Voluntourism opportunities to my travelers. The experience with Uthando was a highlight: The guide was so knowledgeable and passionate and painted a clear and frank picture of how the Apartheid regime's policies still reverberate in South Africa's communities today. The projects they support offer a bright light of hope and inspired me to bring a group of travelers back for their voluntourism excursion. Well worth the time!

The highlight of two weeks in South Africa. My family - with daughters 12 1nd 15 years old - had just arrived in Cape Town after 5 days at a beautiful and luxurious safari lodge. James greeted us at our hotel and in the 25 minutes it took to get us to our first Uthando stop, he had mesmerized my girls with a succinct, engaging, emotional and thorough history of apartheid and the existance of the townships. James is a stellar storyteller - unlike some of the other guides we had throughout our Cape Town stay - and the story he had to tell was one of inspiration, hope and love. I had told our tour agent that I wanted my girls to meet people and learn about the community through experience, not passive observation. That is exactly the what our Uthando tour offered. We met the heroes that selflessly dedicate themselves to others in the townships day in and day out. We met and talked and danced and sang and ate and shared stories with a small cross section of the many people Uthando serves and supports. It was a moving, emotional and incredibly uplifting day. We saw first hand how one person can make a tremendous difference in a community, and it inspired us all. In two weeks filled with the finest hotels and meals and vineyards and natural wonders - we all agreed that the Uthando tour was the absolute highlight of our South African trip

Important, distressing, heartwarming, educational. After 10 days of relatively lux safari travel with the family, we closed out our SA trip with 2 days in capetown, and on the advice of our travel consultant, spent 1/2 of our last day with james. This is less of a 'tourist' field trip to the townships, and much more of an education and, for our family, quite eye-opening. James picked us up on time at our hotel, and spent our commute introducing / educating us to the history of the townships, and filling in holes / gaps in our understanding of apartheid in general. We stopped with him at an urban co-op vegetable garden, a childrens choir project, and a dance center, both rehearsing while we were there. James has encyclopedic knowledge, but wisely lets the folks at the projects speak for themselves. the experience was a wonderful one for us all, both making us aware of the abject poverty that millions are still living in in the townships, as well as the hope that small projects can make a big difference. worthwhile for our family in many many ways.

You will see the South African lives you might otherwise miss. I booked half-day tours twice with James Fernie of Uthando to see a number of the township activities his organization funds and assists. James is an extraordinarily well-informed, good-hearted and engaging guide, but the jewel of his tours is the interaction with some of the most wonderful people I have ever met who work daily improving and empowering the lives of the township residents. One could imagine a trip to the townships would be depressing, but this tour and the opportunity to meet people, talk with them and see all that they are doing raises your faith in South Africa's future. If you are in the Cape Town area, take the tour. Otherwise, you will be missing the lives led by the majority of the country's population.

excellent introduction to the Townships. We took a half-day tour with James to three different projects in the townships supported by his nonprofit, Uthando. We stopped at a day care center, a senior citizen's activity center, and a organic vegetable garden which grows produce that is used in the community but also sold in the suburbs. He gave an excellent overview of the history of apartheid and how the townships came to be, as well as conveying his enthusiasm for his work and his admiration of the human spirit of the residents he works with. Highly recommended if you go to Cape Town.

Great Uthando Field Trip June 11, 2012. Thanks to the stellar recommendations from Trip Advisor, we booked a half day field trip with Uthando for our family vacation to South Africa. We couldn't have got it more right! James was a great host, but really let the people we met at the projects take the spotlight. He was right on time to pick us up from our hotel and provided just the right amount of detail and history to give us the proper background. A complete professional and at no time did we worry about our safety. James' passion for the people in the informal settlements is infectious! We visited three projects. Our favorite was the organic garden and Mama Nokwanda. She told her story on the porch of the thatch-roofed building on a beautiful sky blue morning while sharing tea with us then gave us a tour of the garden itself. The day we were there some grad students were installing a biodigestor! We would recommend booking the tour for the afternoon so that you can see more of the incredible work being done in after school programs for students. The whole morning was at the same time eye opening and inspirational! We are so glad we now have faces and names to remember and think about from our visit to Cape Town and South Africa.

Eye opening view of life in the townships.. We took a half day tour with our 3 teenagers to three different Uthando projects in the the townships outside Cape Town. James Fernie did a fabulous job of the describing the history, culture and current state of affairs in the townships. The kids commented that they had learned far more about Africa and the effects of aparteid on this trip than they would have in a year a school. It was quite eye opening for all of us to see the conditions that people face in the townships, but highly inspirational to see the spirit of the people and understand the many projects underway to improve living conditions. James and Uthando deserve a lot of credit and as much support as we can provide.

Amazing! This tour is a must while in Cape Town!. I was so happy my teacher arranged for this tour! I am studying abroad from LA and its so essential to understand the country. James Fernie takes you to meet the people first hand in the townships. I was so touched and inspired by the work being done at the schools! The children were so wonderful and warm. On the tour James answered all of our questions about the history of the country, the people, and where we were going. Our tour included five journalism students so there were lots of questions and James answered them all. It also made sense. We did a lot of tours in one week and oftentimes I get bored or don't follow the details, but James made it easy to understand and was so helpful in understanding more about the country. I just wanted to mention a part about safety. I felt incredible safe! Everyone greeted us so warmly. You don't want to just roam into the townships by yourself, a tour is the best route and this tour gave me such an eye opening experience. My boyfriend is coming to visit me end of the summer and I'm going to take him! I highly recommend it! -Tallie J

Life changing and inspirational!!!!. I did this tour on my 3rd day in Cape Town and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since. If you are coming to South Africa, you have to see THIS part of it. The people we met at the various organizations within the townships are simply the most beautiful people I have and will probably ever meet in my life. What amazed me most was that despite living in place of extreme poverty and despair, these people are so positive. It definitely puts things in perspective if, like me, you are from a 1st world country(U.S.).James was a great guide and because he has lived the history, he was very knowledgeable about the area and the people. This is definitely a must-do if you come to Cape Town, and if you are like me you will definitely want to come back.

Inspirational! A must include for any trip to Cape Town. James Fernie takes you in to meet the people in the communities - people who want to make a difference - on each day you get to meet people from different initiatives that range from dance schools to keep the kids off the streets in the afternoon, through to a wonderful project where they use a combination of music and plays to spread community messages such as AIDS prevention, through to a great bunch of ladies who are growing their own organic vegetables in the township, through to a group of kids that do gum boot dancing! The list is long and you would have to visit for a few days to meet all the people whose lives he touches in the townships. I have now been privileged to go on his tours three times - and each time it has been a complete revelation. I cannot recommend the tours highly enough!

A worthwhile experience. A great experience. Uthando empowers community based organizations and it's great to know that the language of care and support is universal. James has a wealth of knowledge on South Africa and it was helpful to learn more about 'the country's history.

Inspiring and Meaningful. Do not consider any other outfit.. James Fernie and his Uthando organization give a dignified and substantive platform to the real and vibrant people within the townships of Cape Town. It was the highlight of our trip. Furthermore, their business model is predicated on empowering the communities, rather than remunerating poverty.

Uthando is a breath of fresh air- a welcome alternative to the typical township tours. My parents were recently visiting from the U.S. and kept asking me if they could get out to see the Townships. They felt that it wouldn't be right for them to come all the way to South Africa and not be exposed to how the majority of people live here. That made total sense to me, but I was worried that the township tours would reinforce a voyeuristic dynamic between tourists and township residents that I was very uncomfortable with. So I was relieved and excited to discover that Uthando tours were created to respond to my exact concerns. At first, I was taken aback by the cost, but when I learned that it is a certified fair-trade tour and 1/2 of the cost goes to help fund the projects we would see, I decided that it would be worth the extra cost. There was so much that I appreciated about the experience.The tour was hosted in a way that was extremely respectful of the communities we visited. James, our guide, was very conscious of not creating a tourist spectacle as we moved through the communities. And when we arrived to the different projects, he handed the tour over to the members of the projects to talk about what they were doing in their own words and from their own experience.I also appreciated how the tour was centred on the good that's happening in the Townships. It illuminated the unsung heros- the powerful grassroots community initiatives that are addressing the legacy of apartheid with relentless creativity, energy and love. It certainly exposed the challenges as well, but through the lens of possibility. And I enjoyed how down-to-earth, personal, and open James was with us. He shared his knowledge of the history of apartheid and the legacy it has left behind, but also his own perspective and personal experience of having lived through it as a young boy and young adult. The only thing about the experience that I felt was lacking was that the projects we visited didn't have any activities going on at the time. So we spoke to the staff (often the founders) and learned about the amazing work they were doing, but weren't able to see it in action. I realize it's hard to time tours just right so that you arrive at a time of more community involvement, but I think that would have made the experience come to live in a much richer way.

A true experience of Cape Town is not complete without visting one of its many townships. Uthando tours, which aim to give tourists authentic experiences of life within the townships of Cape Town, really opened our eyes to the life within these sprawling 'communities'.This is, of course, the other side of Cape Town, one that you’re very much isolated from if you only stay within the confines of the city proper. Which is still very white!We went to visit 3 projects that showcased some of the positive community work that was being done within the townships. We saw an orphanage for kids with HIV, an urban agricultural program where locals were thought how to setup organic gardens and a youth development program which involved motivating youth through song and dance.You need to see a township first-hand to decide for yourself if you should be hopeful about all the change witnessed, or terrified as to how the majority of South Africans live.

The real South Africa. The tour with Uthando taught us more about South African history than any guidebook. Charlene was our tour guide and is passionate about Uthando. We visited 2 'educare' centres (nursery schools) - in Khayelitsha and Gugulethu, the community garden project (Abalimi Bezekhaya) and the Thokozani brothers youth choir. It was humbling to see how much is achieved with so little, and the support Uthando gives to these projects is vital. You need your camera, and your smile. Don't miss this!

Real, authentic, caring, well organized!. What a great team has James gathered around him! wow.Thank you for your help - for making Cape Towns Townships so accessible and special to me and so helpful to our project!Very professional and well organized work without missing the emotional and real touch!Keep up the great work! Thank you again!Und please people support this organization and the local communities!

Amazing tour with amazing guides. We took an extended township tour to get a better feel of the life for many in South Africa. We found Uthando through a friend of ours that grew up upon South Africa and new of the good work being down by Uthando. We visited several of the community programs that Uthando helps fund and even got an impromptu singing concert by one of the community groups! In between, the guides were informative and provided background on the history of South Africa and Aparthied. What an amazing day.

Whatever you do in Cape Town, do this. Uthando is run by James Fernie who as well as being the founder and inspiration behind Uthando, is probably the best tour guide I've ever accompanied. His own historical prespectives of South Africa are balanced and personal, having grown up in the apartheid years. This is no "township tour". This is a showcase of projects in which seed money is given to project leaders to build from the ground up. We witnessed well established projects and well as ones vying for future sponsorship. In all case, we saw dedicated and energetic leadership and young people obviously enjoying what they were doing.I could not recommend this more, as it was recommended to me and my family. Do it and learn something about our world, but more importantly, learn something about yourself.

A definite can't miss tour while in Cape Town. My name is Ashley Cooper I am the co-founder of Peace Love and Photography, a documentary film about mine & my partners travels around the World raising money for charity. That being said, as a part of our work we have been visiting and reviewing many different organizations while staying here in Cape Town & I can say without a doubt this tour has something special. Our tour guide Charlene, has a passion for what she does & it comes through in an infectious way that makes you care deeply about the South African culture and its people. You leave the tour uplifted with a sense of hope and admiration for the people of Cape Town. The only request I have is that they keep doing what they are doing. Uthandosa means Love as they told us & that is the only thing on your mind when the tour comes to an end.

One of the highlights of my trip to South Africa. If you are at all interested in a visit to a township in Cape Town area, this tour by Uthando is the tour to take. I took this tour in December, collected from where I was staying and guided by Charlene and joined by two American travellers. We visited some of the projects supported by Uthando. The majority of what you pay for the tour goes directly to the projects you have visited. I guess the projects visited depends on the day.Charlene was an excellent tour leader. She provided a lot of information on the history of the region and of the culture of the Xhosa people. She was able to answer any question aimed at her and the rapport she has with the township dwellers was very evident. I have described the 4 projects we visited below. I can only echo what the other reviewers have said - it was truly wonderful to meet the people of the townships and to see what they are achieving for themselves with help and support from Uthando. Even a month later, I can still clearly remember the smiles, friendliness, optimism, passion we encountered that day. I will definitely take this tour again when I am next in Cape Town.Project 1 Happy Feet (Langa Township) - a local guy is teaching young kids gum-boot dancing in an after-school setting. The leader spoke passionately about his work and the kids performed with such enthusiasm and a real sense of fun. Uthando funded the building where the Happy Feet dance troupe rehearse. Project 2 Volcano Arts Project (Gugulethu Township) – Mandlesizwe, a local guy runs a performance group putting on educational plays for the local community and schools. We spoke to Maldlesizwe about previous productions and plans for the future. Uthando had built a large stage and performance are beside his house. Project 3 Thokozani Brothers (Khayelitsha Township) - a choir for teenagers run by older locals, who themselves peform in a senior choir which has travelled overseas. The director explained that the senior choir provides role models for the teenagers and the choir gives them a chance to experience life outside the township through performing.Project 4 Abalimi Bezekaya ((Khayelitsha Township) – local people are growing vegetables and herbs and passing these skills onto other members of the local community. The ladies working on this project provided us with tea and freshly-baked cakes!!

Most cherished memory from Cape Town. My husband and I went on a Uthando tour end of December with James from Uthando. This is not a tour when you go in to the township and look from the outside at people and how they live. Instead you get a unique view into some of the great projects that Uthando is supporting to make a real difference to the people and local communities involved. We visited a dance group in Gugulethu, a music project project engaging young boys and girls called Thokozani Brothers, an organic micro farming project called Abalimi Bezekhaya, and finally the Volcano Arts Project. It was amazing and uplifting to see all the energy and optimism among the people involved in the projects. And it felt good knowing that a significant share of what we paid for the tour actually goes into the projects Uthando is supporting. On the way James also shared a lot of his knowledge about South African history and development, which was truly interesting. This was by far my most memorable experience from Cape Town. Don't miss it!

Eye-opening, humbling and extremely interesting. This philantrophic trip with one of the kindest and most knowledgeable people I know, whose sensitive approach to difficult issues can only be lauded, was an eye-opening experience for me. Of course one is aware of the huge challenges that are faced by our less fortunate fellow South African citizens, but actually coming face to face with the problems being faced in our townships, being able to interact for a short while with the people involved in the projects that are supported by Uthando and getting the historical background to this all, was an extremely interesting and at the same time humbling experience. We can learn a lot from the citizens of the townships, whose capacity to go on with life despite all the hardships they have to face daily, to smile and be friendly and generous and who just never seem to give up hope is absolutely remarkable. I hope that after having had the opportunity to visit the projects, we will become more generous and compassionate ourselves and learn that give not just take is important in life. This half day experience will always be remembered as a highlight. Thank you for the opportunity!

A great thing to do on your trip to Cape Town. This tour was extremely worth while and I would highly recommend it for anyone traveling to Cape Town, South Africa. Uthando does amazing work and should be supported by all tourists visiting this area. I highly recommend this tour group.
Everyone can contribute in a small way. I think we all feel that we want to contribute to a better world. This is one way you can do it by going on an Uthando tour in Cape town! Well organized,

Amazing trip to Township to see what positive changes can and are taking place there!. Uthando is a phenomenal organization that is funding about 25 projects in the townships outside Cape Town. We visited three of them and learned first hand how Uthando is helping these organizations grow and provide much needed services to the neediest inhabitants of the townships. We also learned so much from our guide about the history of Apartheid and townships. We highly recommend spending a half day with Uthando and supporting them in any way you can.

An emotional trip. An uplifting, emotional and inspirational tour. We were astounded by the resliance of these amazing township dwellers, who with a little financial assistance can transform their lives with the projects that are run for and by them. These are designed mainly to "uplift" the quality of life for both the young and old, and are run by some very dedicated volunteers. This is not about visiting poor people to see how they life - but to see just what can be achieved to ehance lives - and in particular keep young people from turning to crime. In addition we were given a very balanced account of the history and consequences of the aparthied era. This is a tour not to be missed if you want to really have an insight into the country away from the tourist spots.

Great Organization. We went at the end of our trip as a last minute idea and it was a great experience. Charlene is great and was flexible with us. We got to go to Thokozani Brothers first which is a youth choir and we were lucky to get a performance amongst the township. It was amazing to see what they could do with so little. We then stopped by a garden project and were treated to a snack and tea. We couldn't believe how they could grow so much in such poor dirt. Their cookbook is inspiring. We then stopped by a preschool and amazed at the organization of the children there as well. Lastly we went to the end of the year party at NOAH and could see the love that james has for the place. We ended the day with more dancing and singing. Whole process truly inspiring. Wish we would have planned ahead to bring donations so please plan ahead and don't hesitate. Felt safe and was good to see the progress being made and that most of the tour fee goes back to the organization.

BE INSPIRED!. .During a recent holiday in SA I went to three township projects supported by Uthando. A pre school centre --what adorable chidren and what superb work Margaret does with them. A day centre for older people-amazing in every way. The "old" people asked us all sorts of questions and sang and danced for us and with us.They go 3 days a week and are transported to and from their homes so no-one has to walk. They make soap and sell it to Capetown hotels.The third project was a community garden which produces wonderful vegetables and fruit from an essentially poor and sandy soil. These and many more township initiatives are funded by Uthando.I found the whole experience totally inspiring, and would recommend such tours to everyone who visits SouthAfrica.

See and understand true township life. If you would like to get an honest and personal look at what is happening today in the township neighborhoods of Cape Town, book a few hours of touring with Uthando SA. "Uthando" translates as "love." Uthando SA has a beat on the pulse of things happening in Khayelitsha and Gugulethu where determination, perserverance and love are making a difference in the lives of residents. What's happening is the growth of non-profit organizations seeded and managed by hard working, visionary residents of these communities. The organizations vary from child day care and orphanage to senior centers to community gardens, youth empowerment and performing art groups, human rights groups and other examples of people improving their lives and making a difference by pushing forward and standing up for themselves and their neighbors. In a touring group large or small you can see, learn about and in some cases meet people doing phenomenal things in the aftermath of a long period of adverse circumstances. James Fernie and his Uthando SA staff have spent a lot of time getting to know and supporting the work of people and organizations in the Cape Flats neighborhoods. They have an excellent understanding of the complexities of Cape Town, how things work in the townships, and how the townships fit into the fabric of the greater city. They are instruments of good will, positive community relations and significant steps forward. Trust them to show you what's happening in these vast neighborhoods where uthando is making a difference.

A must for anyone visiting Cape Town. A casual recommendation from a friend led me to one of the most moving experiences in my travelling life. This was not a township tour, and thank goodness for that. The day started with James picking us up from our hotel and we were instantly captured by this man's experience and passion in running a phenomenal project. We toured an old people's recreation centre, a day care centre and helped with the rehousing of an old lady in her 80's, before Stopping for tea at a farm cooperative which supplies vegetables to schools in the Cape area. I was moved, humbled, made to laugh and cry and thank the very good people of Uthando for letting me experience a little of their lives. I will be back. Every time I visit Cape Town, I will go back!Thank you!

Essential and unforgettable. A fascinating, moving and educational experience and an essential counter to a stay in glossy, glamorous Cape Town. Visiting the vast township area and witnessing what this charitable organisation is achieving is a real eye-opener, and there was no sense of simply gawping at disadvantaged people. Charlene's potted history of the country as we drove there was a masterclass in brevity and balance. We visited first, the pre-school run by the inspirational Margaret and saw the new brick building going up to replace the patched up, tin-roofed shack in use up til now. Next we went to the day centre for the elderly, swapped information about our lives and learned how how they spend their time. They sang for us so beautifully and so movingly, this generation who lived through the worst of the apartheid regime. Finally we visited the womens' community organic farm where they gave us refreshments and showed the admirable work they do, preparing veg boxes for Cape Town homes and restaurants. James and Charlene are inspirational as was the whole experience.

Uthando means Love. Uthando is a tour that everyone should experience!. I had the privilege of being a part of an Uthando Cultural Tour led by Charlene. The experience changed my life and has given me a restored hope and faith in humankind our ability to affect change. We visited a school run by Mama Gloria and an old age centre where the attendees make soap and other crafts that are sold to hotels and individuals. Both the children and the elderly we met were so enthusiastic and grateful that we came to see them and experience their culture. It was my honor to be a part of their lives if only for a moment. James and Charlene and all of Uthando are doing vital and important work. I strongly recommend that all traveler to Cape Town take part in and experience this tour and Uthando. Thank you for making these peoples lives richer and my life richer.

A "must do" for visitors to the Cape Town area. My wife, two girls (9 years and 8 years) and I had half a day with Charlene of Uthando visiting some of the projects they support. The e-mail rapport we had before the day was excellent and we came armed with a suitcase of clothes, CDs, toys and the like for Charlene to distribute as she felt best.The day was superb, with Charlene sharing with us the hstory and challenges of the area, how things were today and we saw first hand projects that were making a difference in their communities.It provided a superb insight into South Africa and was and education for us all. In a holiday that was full of memorable experiences this day provided a great reminder how lucky some of us are. We look forward to continuing a relationship with James and the team at Uthando.Keep up the great workLove, Phil, Sue, Imogen & ZaraFrom the UK

An Experience NOT To Be Missed. This experience should be mandatory on anyone's itinerary when visiting CapeTown. I was able to do something that I never thought possible - visit a township and meet people who would make me cry with tears of hope and joy and laugh with the same. Charlene was inspirational with the way she spoke about the work that Uthando does and her special relationship with the people they support is so heartfelt. We were treated to singing and dancing by children and their elderly counterparts and I was even given my very own African name! This is a memory I will never forget and I look forward to keeping Uthando close at heart and being able to contribute where I can! Thank you, thank you, thank you for all you do!!

An amazing, inspirational, uplifting and eye-opening day. Our day with Charlene from Uthando was the most special of our whole trip to South Africa. We were very keen that our children (son (14) and daughter (12)) should come away from our trip with some understanding of the history of South Africa and some idea of its ongoing challenges as well as having enjoyed all the wonderful hospitality and incredible experiences it has to offer. Both children had been very bothered by the shacks on either side of the N2 as we drove into Cape Town from the airport and had asked us all sorts of questions that we really weren't equipped to answer. Charlene was a wonderful guide, teacher and host as she took us round the townships of Guguletu and Khayalitsha and she helped us all to better understand what we were seeing. We met some truly incredible people at the youth theatre, day care and gardening projects that we visited. Our visits felt reassuringly unintrusive and the welcome we received at all of them made us feel privileged to be there. Our day with Uthando was an incredibly positive experience, emotional and hugely enjoyable. We feel very fortunate to have met people like Margaret and Volcano whose commitment to their communities is awe inspiring to say the least. We wish Uthando and all of their projects the success that they deserve.

The best tour in South Africa!!. My Uthando tour was superb! It was definately the best thing I have done on my travels to date. Unlike other township tours Uthando offers the chance to visit amazing organisations within the townships and give something back to the community. My tourguide (Charlene) was extremely knowledgable and friendly and when back in SA I will definately be returning to Uthando. This is a must for anyone wanting to get more out of an organised tour than usual. Truelly inspirational!!

Inspirational tour of Uthando. Doing an Uthando tour is a really amazing experience. You don't just drive around a township and see the official tourist sites, but rather you visit local projects that Uthando supports. We visited two projects, one called 'Happy Feet' which is about teaching young kids gumboot dancing as a way of occupying the after school hours, and a vegetable growing project. It was just amazing to see the initiative and dedication of those involved, also that these are things that have grown up through the community, rather than being imposed from top down. It's also a very good way of seeing township life and experiencing its vibrancy, and the fact that despite their material poverty in a land of wealth, there is an amazing sense of community and care for one another. I got taken round by Charlene, who is very knowledgeable about South Africa's current situation.

Most meaningful experience of our week in Cape Town. Uthando is a wonderful non-profit organization working to show some of the uplifting, amazing things happening in the townships of Cape Town. We visited a senior day care center, a pet hospital, a center for abused women and children and a community garden project. Along the way we learned about the history of apartheid in South Africa and the ways in which the township residents are working to create a better life for themselves as well as the ways visitors can assist. Uthando is a true model of responsible tourism!

Best part of our trip. Last summer (winter in SA), we spent three weeks with friends in South Africa with a side trip to Vic Falls and Botswana. We will definitely return-feel like we barely scratched the surface. And every day had at least one peak experience, sometimes several. Every day we met and enjoyed the company of the nicest, most welcoming people imaginable. So this is the context for what I am about to say about James Fernie, the Executive Director and moving force behind Uthando, and his amazing non-profit. Uthando gave us a unique opportunity to get a close-up view of life in a Cape township and to meet people who are truly helping to build South Africa and make the lives of all South Africans better. It is a unique business model. We hire Uthando to provide us with access to leaders in the community development field, Uthando passes back payments to support the community development projects with whom it maintains relationships. Uthando ensures that one gets to meet people who share their insights and stories about their work. In our case, we visited four sites: a pre-school, a jobs and skills development center, a program that promotes community organic gardening and a literacy program that employs sports (football) to lure youth to a constructive learning environment. In each case, we had the opportunity for in-depth conversations about the work being done. James is a very knowledgable guide. He has lived the history and been involved in creating change. We wanted to have a closeup experience of township life without being dispassionate gawkers. The Uthando Private Tours program provides this opportunity. We left feeling that we had made a small but meaningful financial contribution to the projects that we visited - in exchange we met some truly extraordinary people and left hopeful for the future of this great and beautiful country and for our world. We gained a deeper understanding of township life and of the history, strength and beauty of this community. The day we spend with James on tour was truly transformative. If you do one thing when you go to Cape Town, book a tour with Uthando Private Tours!

An inspirational morning.. Of all the things we saw and did in South Africa when we are telling friends about our visit it is Uthando that we start with and talk about the most. It was an amazing visit. We met the ladies who grow vegetables to sell to restaurants in Cape Town, the old folk who meet for lunch and travel down memory lane and the young people in a theatre group who trying to make a difference to other young people in schools through messages conveyed through music and drama. We felt so honoured to meet these people and see the difference Uthando is making to their lives. When the old folk sang to us they made a difference to our lives and gave us a lasting memory. We only know a little of the struggles they have endured in their lives but they so appreciated the time we spent with them. It is when we reflect afterwards that we fully realise what a wonderful part of our tour this visit to the township with Uthando was. Thankyou to everyone.

My day in the Township with James was one of the best days I have spent in all my journeys to Africa.. James has helped such a variety of projects. I visited a kindergarten, a dance class, a classical music session, a school where an anti-drugs program was highlighted by a troupe of talented entertainers, and a vegetable growing project - where the dusty urban soil had been transformed to give an abundance of vegetables. This work is inspirational and life changing for all who are lucky enough to take part.

Uthando is absolutely fantastic. What an outstanding venture. James Fernie gave us a one day tour of the gardens project and of youth groups dancing and playing music. This idea should be spread to more groups. The visit will stay in our memory forever. James gave us a superb view of the porjects and of South Africa in general. He should stand for elected office.

Stop Skimming The Surface-This Time Dig Deeper. I've worked in Botswana and Zimbabwe, rented a home in Cape Town & traveled to most parts of Africa too many times to count. But the BEST day I spent was with James. We started at a graduation ceremony for 3 & 4 year olds, -- beaming parents & proud kids :) Then we went to a football field where along with hundreds of others we rolled out yards of orange & yellow fabric to create a "Sun" at each end was a Solar Cooker. At High Noon we all smiled to the heavens as a plane flew over to snap our photo. I then got taken to his own hood where a street fair was in progress. We ended our day by attending first a local dance performance by a few groups, then a professional dance recital in a theatre. I laughed, I cried, I unashamedly sung Shakira's 'Waka Waka' song at the top of my lungs. If I could pay to do that all again every day of my life I would sign on without thinking in less than one second.

It was one of the most inspirational experiences of my life.. My husband and I spent the day in the township with James and felt it was one of the most memorable experiences of our entire lives. We learned so much and were so inspired by the people, programs and accomplishments of the people that we met.We feel so grateful for the experience of getting to know James and the people and programs he introduced us to during our trip to South Africa. It was a stupendous and illuminating day.Beryl KreiselUSA

The best thing I did in Cape Town.... My Uthando outing was a genuinely inspiring experience. Getting to meet people and learn about community organisations within township areas like Gugulethu and Khayelitsha was so interesting, personally rewarding, and ultimately just really, really enjoyable. On my trip we visited a community choral group, saw a kids' dance group in practice, visited a local theatre group whilst they were performing, and had morning tea with the creators of a beautiful and flourishing community garden. James is an excellent host and is very knowledgeable about the organisations, and - most importantly - he definitely seems like he genuinely cares about each and every one of them. Do this trip if you would like to see another (equally beautiful) side of Cape Town besides gorgeous beaches and grand, gated mansions. It was the highlight of my three-month stay in Cape Town....

Inspiring for us and empowering for South Africans. We were curious to learn about and visit the townships, but reluctant to do so, not wanting to be intrusive -but also not wanting to just stare at strangers from a bus window. The concierge at the Welgelegen Guest House (also great) put us on to Uthando South Africa, which was described as a non-profit, fair trade tourism outfit. We attended one of their events, met the leader, James, other members of Uthando and different groups from various townships. It was a marvelous experience and really was non-exploitative.Uthando is trying to help build a new South Africa, and all the cliche's about townships are turned on their head. You meet creative, energetic people, and you realize that there is more that connects us than separates us. At that event in Cape Town, they showcased the performing talents of -I don't know how many groups of all ages- who performed everything from regional/tribal songs and dance, to modern dance, to rap and hip hop. They also presented various small groups who were involved in creating businesses, selling crafts, helping youth at risk, promoting multi-racial & ethnic harmony etc., all of whom you could talk with, question and get to know. Our friends then went to visit the townships with them on another day, but we missed out because I got sick.Even without a visit to their homes, the experience was incredibly inspiring and introduced my wife and I to elements of South Africa that we would have spent weeks tracking down by ourselves, if ever.Educational, entertaining, helping build a better world. Sounds too good to be true, but it wasn't. I hope this conveys how enthusiastic we are about being allowed more deeply into the culture of South Africa, beyond the standard game park experience.

First time in South Africa. I arrived late in the evening but Tania was there at the airport to meet me. From first impression it was like getting picked up by my sister. We could not have asked for a better guide to introduce us to Cape Town and the wine lands in Stellenbaugh. Tania can trace her heritage in South Africa back over 300 years and her knowledge just flows out. Not in a fact after fact way but in a way that makes you intimately acquainted with this beautiful land. After spending two days with her it was hard to say goodbye. But Zambia was calling! If I can be so lucky to return to Cape Town my fist call would be to Tania at Discovery Tours. Make it your first as well, you will not be disappointed.

Best Tour Company in Cape Town!. We chose Discovery Tours after our friends had a marvelous time with them the year prior. Upon meeting Tania at the airport, my (new) husband and I knew this would be a match. After all, if you were going to spend an entire day with someone during your honeymoon, you would hope that they would be enjoyable! Tania was just that--pleasant, funny, relaxed, and most importantly--informative! We did the Wine Tour with her and the Cape Peninsula tour, (she also picked us up from the airport), and both were unbelievable. She brought us to all of the noted stops on the latter, however she had no problem stopping here and there to take photos of us along the way. She was very flexible to our interests and desires, and after a few hours together, it really felt like we were old friends. We couldn't wait to be reunited for the Wine Tour, which also proved to be beautiful and full of surprises (free tastings, truffles, etc. because it was our honeymoon). Tania also recommended many restaurants and helped us organize the rest of our days and our trip to Table Mountain. If you are looking for a personal, individualized approach, Tania and Yaseen are the easy choice.Note: Although I was excited to meet Yaseen after the wonderful things I had heard about him as well, he was booked on other tours during our stay. Either way, we were just as happy to have Tania as our guide again!

Outstanding!. I had a pleasure of meeting both Tania and Yaseen again. Their highly personalized tours with extremely relaxed and friendly services simply cannot be matched. They do not arrange group tours, but tailor-made tours just for you. Leave all your tour needs to them and they will make it happen. Highly recommended.

Great experience!. We had two fantastic days with Discovery Tours! Yaseen greeted us with smiles and humor at 2:30 AM when our flight from Amsterdam was delayed 5 hours. Tania lead a fun and sunny day through the beautiful wine country and Yaseen took us down the cape another day. They're warm and knowledgeable locals who are immensely informative about the region including plants, animals, food and wine,history, and sociopolitical issues. Just a delight to be with them!

Great tour guides. Personal touch, comfortable ride, flexible itinerary or they'll suggest a route. Toured the wine country one day with Tania and the Cape the next day with Yaseen. Both are warm, extremely knowledgeable about flora and fauna, geology, history and political factors. They always make you feel completely comfortable. They both grew up here so know the area like the back of their hand. I could be friends with these folks

Outstanding!. We found Discovery Tours on Trip Advisor and Tania & Yaseen were responsive and informative via email when we were booking our tour of Cape Point. We discussed our interests and priorities for the tour and planned the details prior to leaving the US. We also arranged for them to provide our airport pick up on arrival. Although our flight was delayed by 11 hours, Yaseen was there to collect us at 11:30pm (23:30)! This was a great introduction, as we learned he would also be our guide for the tour 2 days later.He arrived promptly on the day of our tour in a comfortable, high end vehicle and off we went. Yaseen is a wealth of information about the area and South African history and culture. He packed in ALL of our must sees and chatted with us amiably as we covered the many scenic points of the Cape Peninsula. At one point there was a miscommunication about where to meet up with him when we departed on a short hike. We returned to the starting point, he went to a different spot. After exchanging a few texts he came back to fetch us and we resumed the tour. That put us 45 minutes behind schedule, but he still stuck to the original plan and we saw everything on our agenda without rushing. As a matter of fact, our tour ended approximately 2 hours later than we had booked. It was an outstanding, enjoyable, and informative experience. We highly recommend Discovery Tours.

Two fantastic tours. We toured with Tania and Yaseen for two days in August and could not recommend them more highly. They are both wonderful people and are so knowledgeable about Cape Town and the surrounding area. Our first tour was the Cape Peninsula tour with Yaseen. Yaseen picked us up at our hotel and drove us to Simonstown, Boulders Beach, Cape Point, and back up the peninsula. We loved his stories, his restaurant and café recommendations, his enthusiasm for wildlife, and his occasional trivia questions. We saw so much incredible scenery and wildlife and were so impressed by how much Yaseen knew about seemingly everything.The second tour we took was the Cape Winelands tour with Tania. This tour was completely different than the Cape Peninsula tour, and we’re so glad we decided to do both. Our expectations were completely exceeded: Tania could not have been nicer, and we absolutely loved everywhere that she took us. In addition to visiting several wine estates, Tania also took us to an olive oil tasting, a beer tasting, and a chocolate tasting. We stopped for lunch in Franschhoek, and at the restaurant that Tania recommended we had what turned out to be our favorite meal of the entire trip. Tania and Yaseen were a big part of what made our trip to Cape Town so memorable. We hope to be back one day and would certainly take another tour with them!

Thoroughly enjoyable ... with a great knowledge of local flora and fauna, history and culture. Tania offered great communication to accommodate our last minute booking request.Even though the weather on the day was not perfect, Tania was a ray of sunshine, and wealth of information on South African history and culture, flora and fauna, and spot on recommendation for 'best fish and chips in the world'. Thanks heaps!! Tania.

Cape peninsula private tour. We had 2 days in Cape Town and decided that this was a good way to pack as much of sightseeing as we can in a short period of time. We took a private tour with Yaseen and it was great. He picked us up from the hotel on time and took us around all key parts of the peninsula. He asked us what we like and where we would like to spend more time and adjusted the tour accordingly. We were never rushed and felt like we managed to accomplished what we set out to do. Yaseen himself is a great guide. There's no question that he couldn't answer and no piece of history of South Africa that he didn't know. He has a great personality and had the right balance of keeping us informed and entertained. Would highly recommend for everyone.

Entertaining, Reliable, Local Knowledge. We have booked Tania and Yaseen every trip in Cape Town for 15 years. They are reliable, always on time, at the airport with ID, taking us to places we could never have found on our own. Local knowledge is important to see stuff that is impossible to find with just a Lonely Planet book in your hand. They have standard tours and they are flexible enough to customize the tour to your own curiosity. And they welcome the challenges. Both are pleasant up-beat and love what they do...it shows. The cost for a private experience with them is very affordable and worth every rand!! We'll see them again soon!

Outstanding Cape Peninsula Tour. Before leaving the U.S., we arranged for a full-day private Cape Peninsula tour with Discovery. I wanted sufficient time to photograph when and where I wanted during the tour, and this was the best way to do it. Yaseen proved to be a knowledgeable and charming guide, taking us to all the sights we wanted to experience, and more. He also offered to take photos of us with my camera at key spots, and this added to the visual memories. In addition, it was very interesting to learn of his and his family's life growing up in South Africa, during and after apartheid. In short, a tour well worth the time and money.

Amazing tour of Cape Town and area with Yassen. We were looking for a flexible tour of the Cape Town area for a short just over two day trip with my family. Yassen was very accommodating of our requests and we had a wonderful time driving around Cape Town with him. We did a full day tour of the cape peninsula followed by a tour of the Kirstenbosch gardens and the winelands the next day finishing our tour with going up Table Mountain on our last morning. Yassen was our guide for the trip and we enjoyed his company. He was brilliant at answering all our questions and talked about the local history. Our first day was cloudy/misty so the view at cape point was pretty much zero, but Yassen made sure to keep us entertained with spotting local wildlife and introducing us to the unique plants of the region (especially for my mum who loves plants). All in all we had a fantastic tour with Yassen and I would definitely recommend Discovery Tours.

Wonderful and informative time with Yaseen!. First, tripadvisor, you guys have an amazingly narrow view of what constitutes a family. The only family options available under "type of visit" were "family with young children" and "family with teenagers". That's terrible. What if it were a family of siblings, family with no children or alternative family structures? Rant aside with TripAdvisor, we had a wonderful with Yaseen from Discovery Tours. He took us on 3 full day tours of the city, the cape peninsular and the winelands. Usually, my gripe with private tours is that the guide don't provide enough information. Not in yaseen's case. He is obviously an intelligent and well-read individual who takes pride in his work. Ask him anything and chances are that he will be able to answer fully and then some.Aside from being very knowledgeable, he was also very personable and friendly, making effort to engage everyone in the group. Even for the most unsocial yours truly. He will try and try again until you crack. :) Together with a great sense of humor, he made our time spent in and around Cape Town memorable and fuss-free. He took care of us very well indeed.Another thing to note, Yaseen is the business owner of Discovery Tours together with his wife Tania. So you cannot get a better person more motivated and interested that you have a fulfilling tour with them. Speaking as a business owner myself, I understand his motivation and drive. He will do his best for you, so you really can't go wrong with him.

Cape peninsula tour. Went for a cape peninsula tour with Mr Yaseen today and was pleasantly surprised with his knowledge and easy attitude. Yaseen made sure that every place throughout the 9 hour trip was explained properly and no question went unanswered. What stood out was his sense of Humor and his ability to keep my whole family entertained throughout while showing us all the highlights of the Peninsula tour. Would surely recommend his company to anyone who is looking for a tour with someone of knowledge and who blends in with the family easily.

Two memorable days traveling the winelands and cape peninsula. After many hours of traveling to Cape Town we were greeted at the airport by Yaseen who made us feel right home. The next day Tania collected us in her Range Rover and took us on a tour of the cape. We visited several small towns and had time to walk around on our own. One of the highlights was a beautiful lunch at a seaside restaurant with impeccable food. The rest of the day we spent seeing the penguins, tour the cape, seeing wildlife and a beautiful sunset. On the second day, Yaseen took us on a tour of the winelands. Each winery was carefully chosen. One of the highlights was a winery on a private estate. We were treated to a private tasting with a sommelier. Afterwards, Yaseen had arranged for lunch at beautiful winery with a gorgeous view. We couldn't go wrong with Tania and Yassen and felt like we were amongst friends. Highly recommend.

Two Days of Day Trips. My googling for one of the best tour companies in Cape Town sent me to Discovery Tours. I lucked out that this was the first company listed and that I emailed. Communicating with Yaseen beforehand was easy through email. He always replied quickly! We took the Winelands tour one day and the Peninsula tour the next. Yaseen was full of information about the areas and made sure we saw some of South Africa's different animals roaming freely around the area. If you love smaller, quaint shopping, Franschhoek from the Winelands tour and Kalk Bay from the Peninsula tour were my favorite places. If you love old old books, get Yaseen to take you to Quagga in Kalk Bay. You'll LOVE it! I too know we made a new friend across the globe in Yaseen. I just called him today to ask some questions. He told us we must come back. Africa had never been on my list of places to go before, but after this trip we took, we will definitely be going back to see more! Thank you, Yaseen!

2 perfect days with Tania!. My friend and I only had two days in Cape Town and Tania put together just the perfect itinerary for us that included sights in Cape Town and a journey down to the Cape of Good Hope including Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden. She drove us in her lovely Range Rover and offered interesting commentary and historical context. All in all a great experience!

Can't go wrong with Yaseen or Tania at Discovery tours. My family of four took tours with both Tania and Yaseen on two consecutive days. We first took a tour to the Cape Peninsula with Tania. We stopped at Boulder Beach on the way to Cape Point and had a wonderful time. Tania is is very warm, knowledgeable, and passionate about her job. She really wants to make sure you have the best time possible and encourages questions. She even somehow managed to spot a whale in the ocean on the way to Boulder Beach while she was driving. I'm still trying to figure out how she did that! During our tour we mentioned that we were interested in going out to the wine country on our last day in Cape Town. Tania mentioned a cheetah sanctuary that she thought our daughters would enjoy and said that Yaseen could probably give us the tour the next day.The next day we were picked by Yaseen who instantly made our girsl feel at ease with his stories about South African culture and quizzes he gave them to test their knowledge. Yaseen is also a wealth of knowledge about Cape Town. We had a wonderful time with Yaseen at the Graff Winery and the Cheetah sanctuary. He also took us to a bird sanctuary where both my daughters were able to hold and eagle on their arm. Very memorable experience. I would recommend Discovery Tours without hesitation and you should just go ahead and make your reservation with them. You will not regret it!

Took care of us for two days in Cape Town. We felt like we have friends in Cape Town after spending two days with Discovery Tours. One day around the Cape with Yassine with history, animals and marvelous scenery, the second day Table Mountain, a look at the town, the Botanical Gardens and a taste of wine country with Tania. The fact they both shared personal stories of living and working during a lot of the recent history of the area, added an extra dimension to our stay. They were called last minute, adapted to our vague plans beautifully, added personal touches such as dropping our shopping bags at the B&B after dropping us off at the Waterfront. We felt we had friends showing us their home town!

Terrific Winelands and Cape Peninsula Day Tours! Wonderful guides!. I have had the great pleasure of touring with both Tania, and Yasin, and I can recommend them most highly! I was in Cape Town in December 2015, when my son and I enjoyed a fabulous Winelands tour with Tania, which involved beautiful views, wine tasting at excellent vineyards, time to explore Franschhoek and Stellenbosch, lunch at a restaurant where the view, the cuisine, and the ambiance were exceptional, all in the delightful company of Tania, who gave us fascinating commentary about the winelands, as well as insights into the politics of South Africa. In January, 2016, both of my sons and I embarked on a fascinating exploration of the coastline and Cape Peninsula with Yasin, who was a font of information about the flora and fauna of the peninsula, from baboons to penguins, and who deftly navigated our to countless beautiful views. Both Yasin and Tania are incredibly congenial, knowledgeable guides, and we felt very fortunate to be able to spend our very special days in Cape Town with them on two different occasions. They are ideal guides, and we can’t recommend them highly enough.

Nature, people, stories, wines - great experience in Cape Town paradise. 4 days, 4 day trips, ever lasting memories. After some research on the web checking reviews from travelers, we decided to contact Tania from Discovery Tours. Bingo! Tania, Yaseen and Mark - they are all very warm and friendly people, great guides, professional and knowledgeable about the region, its history, and the surrounding nature. And they can tell exciting stories about places visited, especially Mark with his log-term background of Cape Town National Park ranger and professor-like knowledge of virtually every plant or bird that you can see there. The wine tasting trip took us to several beautiful and quiet estates like Anthonij Rupert or Boschendal. Great time, great experience, strongly recommended company.

Highlight of our Cape Town visit!. We did the day trip around the Cape and we had a very very good time! Yaseen was a great guide and we didn't for a minute get bored or loose interest in the tour. We were travelling with our young kids (6 and 4) and they too really enjoyed the visit. Yaseen planned a stopover to the natural stone museum which the kids loved! They spent 30 minutes collecting precious stones and gems and were very well entertained.The sights are spectacular and highly recommend the trip. There are cheaper options to drive around the Cape but its worth paying a little more to go with Discovery Tours. The trip felt very personal and Yaseen made every effort to make our trip special. Ps. We forgot our phone in the car and he very kindly came the next day to our hotel to return it. Thanks again!

Excellent Wine Tour. This was our second wine trip with discovery tours. Once again Tanya did not disapoint, we gave her an idea of what types of wine we liked and she took us to many excellent winery's. A very enjoyable day with Tanya who is an excellent tour guide who happily shared her knowledge of wine and beautiful Cape Town's history .☺

Beyond All Expectations. With only 2 short days to explore Cape Town - we made possibly the best (and luckiest!) decision of our travel lives in booking the services of Discovery Tours. From the moment Yaseen picked us up at the airport, it felt like visiting a friend we didn't know we had. Deeply knowledgable, highly personable, and sincerely caring, Yaseen ensured we experienced the Cape Peninsula to the fullest, sharing with us incredible landscapes where we were totally alone in nature - a far cry from some of the areas packed with tour vehicles we saw elsewhere. It felt like truly discovering the Cape Peninsula, not simply "touring". As well as his expert knowledge of flora, fauna and geography, Yaseen also provided deep insight into the history of South Africa, having personally experienced its most turbulent periods. This perspective gave essential context to all that we saw - invaluable when trying to grasp a place as stunning, complicated and singular as South Africa. We're already planning a return trip, and Yaseen and Tania will be our first stop for advice, expertise & guidance. It's no exaggeration to say that Discovery Tours *Made* our trip to Cape Town. We arrived as strangers, and left feeling we had friends in South Africa. We can't recommend Discovery Tours highly enough.-Brion & Miriam, Portland, Oregon, USA

This is more than a tour-it is an education.. We spent one of the best travel days of our life with Yaseem on the Cape Peninsula. He knows his area, but more importantly his country and its history which makes the whole experience come to life. I though I was spending a day with a close relative--he cares about people and not just as a business. If you have an interest in a particular place he will insure that you'll learn about it even if it's not like the itinerary. In addition he knows about the game and plants throughout the entire tour. I would not hesitate to use this company again for any of their tours and highly recommend them without qualification.

Excellent Day Tour. We have just returned from a holiday in South Africa which we started by visiting Cape Town. On our second day we went out on a day tour with Yaseen, and had a wonderful day. We were a family group of 5 adults from the UK, and none of us had visited South Africa before. One of the group is a keen birdwatcher, and we therefore asked during the booking process if we could slightly amend the route of the Cape Peninsula tour. Yaseen and Tania were more than happy to do this for us, and we therefore did the route in reverse, and ended with a visit to Kirsten bosch Gardens.The booking process was extremly easy and all queries were answered fully and promptly. Payment was made by cash on the day of the tour. Both Yaseen and Tania are interested in wildlife and love their city and are happy to share this knowledge and enthusiasm.Yaseen arrived on time, and already knew all our names. He was an excellent guide for the day, chatty and funny. He showed us some beautiful places, found us lots of birds and animals and was flexible in his approach.We would all be very happy to recommend Discovery Tours and if we go cack to Cape Town, which we hope to one day, we would love to go on another tour with them. Thanks Yaseen.

Discovery Tours Highly Recommended.. On a first trip to Cape Town we decided to arrange a private trip around the Cape Peninsula, to include the Kirstenbosch Gardens and also to be collected from and dropped back to the airport by the same people.I requested Tania as I had read that she was very knowledgeable on plants and birds.Tania met us at the airport and was so helpful, even assisting me in buying a local mobile phone and choosing a safe ATM in airport.She picked us up at our hotel next morning and was extremely flexible, fitting in all the things we wanted to do, such as having a swim and some time for a walk . She made sure we saw every possible animal , bird and plant during the day.Her friendly company , her knowledge and advice made for a great start to our holiday.Choosing a private tour, though somewhat more expensive than a group tour,is well worth it and very good value.Yaseen dropped us off at the airport, where we were collecting a rental car to drive the Garden Route. He too was extremely helpful, showing us the route from airport to N2 and giving advice and directions which greatly helped us. We would definitely use Discovery tours again if in Cape Town.

A memorable day on the Cape. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we contacted Tania at Discovery Tours via email many months in advance of our trip to South Africa. Tania promptly responded to our initial inquiry and all subsequent emails. By the time she picked us up for our private tour of Cape Point and the Cape of Good Hope, we felt like we were sightseeing with a friend. It was a lovely day made that much better by Tania's easy manner. We opted to have a picnic lunch, and glad we did. Tania picked a bench overlooking the sea--such an incredible view--it was picture perfect! Because traffic was light we finished our tour early but instead of dropping us off early, Tania offered us some additional options to finish up the day. She went the extra mile to make our tour a great success.

Yaseen of Discovery Tours is excellent. We are mostly do-it-ourselves travelers, but we decided to hire a private guide and driver for two days in Cape Town and the Winelands. We are so glad we found Yaseen. He immediately put us at ease. He is intelligent and patient, with a good sense of humor. He met us promptly at the airport, chatted with us a bit about what we wanted to see and do, and then zipped us everywhere, leaving us with no worries about the driving. He was flexible, making sure we saw what we wanted to see, but also using his local knowledge to make both days more interesting and scenic than we could have done for ourselves. He also found the animals we had hoped to see in the park. He had booked tables for us at the restaurants we had mentioned by email—and then got us there without stress. He was great about answering our questions, explaining the history of what we were seeing. He also gave us time to explore different areas on foot by ourselves, saying "I'll meet you in front of that restaurant in 20-30 minutes" so that we also had chunks of time alone, throughout the day. If we go back, we will get in touch with Discovery Tours right away.

Two wonderful days out of Cape Town. We had 2 separate trips with Discovery on 22 & 24th March. We emailed Discovery before we travelled and their replies were prompt and most helpful. I am disabled and I needed to check out that they could take me and my mobility scooter in their vehicle. This was checked out and proved great as the trips worked well for me.The first trip was with Lindsay covering Cape Peninsula and although we have visited a couple of times before Lindsay managed to find plenty of interest for us to see that we had not seen before. The second trip was to the Winelands with Mark and this was most interesting as again he knew the area so well and showed us all we wanted to see. Lunch at a vineyard was booked for us and it was a great day out. Both trips certainly took a full day and were excellent value.

Excellent day on tha Cape!. Yaseen from Discovery, a native Capetonian, was a fabulous host to this beautiful city and Cape. He drove us to so many gorgeous sights we would never have imagined to explore. It felt more like we spent the day with a friend, as Yaseen makes you feel like family and so very welcome. He also went above and beyond, making many excellent suggestions for our ongoing travels. We would like to highly recommend Discovery. Yaseen is an experienced driver, took us down narrow coastal roads and rough terrain in a brand new Range Rover. It was a comfortable, safe, smooth, air conditioned drive. His commentary of local Cape life was insightful. He made our trip unforgettable! Many many thanks!

Enjoying South Africa. Going on holiday is something people do to shake off their everyday concerns.The planning arranging,,choosing are all part of this deviation from the norm,Nivember,last year my wife and I stayed for three weeks in Cape Yown and ubdertook many tours with Tania and Yaseen both the owners of Discovery Tours.It was an overwhelming experiense as they showed us the city and the splendid surrounding area.Moreover,they are knowledgeable about their history and well informed about contempory developments,not only in their own country,They are nature lovers,telling you special things about fauna and flora and very informative on culture,food and drinks.Unnecessary to say that both are very good drivers and that their charming and casual way of presentation are all the more reason to visit secotd time Cape Town in coming November.Highlly recommended.

Great experience - Highly Recommend!. I came to Cape Town for vacation with a group of girl friends in February. We had really wanted an opportunity to experience the Cape Peninsula and our tour with Discovery Tours definitely didn't disappoint. Yaseen was so friendly and very knowledgeable about Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula. You can also tell he loves what he does! He was also extremely flexible and accommodating and has a great sense of humor. He understood when we wanted to spend extra time at one location and we never felt rushed. Yaseen took us to countless view points that were all equally stunning including False Bay & Chapman's Peak. We stopped in a great little town called Simonstown, and popped by Boulder's Beach to see the penguin colony. We later had a fantastic lunch in Cape Point, stopped at Cape of Good Hope, saw lots of wild life including ostriches & baboons, and ended the day at a fabulous winery which Yaseen was able to fit in the tour for us. I can't say enough good things about our day and Yaseen. If you're considering a tour, you can't go wrong with Discovery Tours.

Beautiful Day in Cape Town!. Our day tour with Discovery Tours was my favorite part of Cape Town! The one on one interaction with Yaseen and our group of 5 was unbeatable. Because it was just our group on the tour, Yaseen was able to tailor the day around our wants. We were able to see so many wonderful views - stopping when we wanted, in order to get the perfect picture! We spent the day traveling all over Cape Town; we visited must-see tourist locations, historical monuments, saw plenty of different wildlife (baboons, African penguins, ostrich, antelope, etc.), stopped at a local coffee shop and even got to squeeze in a wine tasting at Cape Town Vineyards! If you're traveling to Cape Town, give Discovery Tours a call!

Great company and lots of knowledge.. Having decided we wanted to see more of the area's around Cape Town and the Cape peninsula l found Discovery tours. From the moment l emailed them and explained what we wanted Tania replied with a full day itinerary of exactly what we wanted. We booked the day being picked up at 8.30 in the morning from our hotel and off we went with Tania, heading off on our day out, we had a fantastic day and fantastic company with Tania. Thank you for making our day so memorable. Wendy, Sheila and Margaret x

If you want the real cape then this is it !. A superb tour. Tanya's infectious love of her country comes through with her great knowledge and genuine warmth and friendliness She took us to unspoilt beaches off the beaten track and joy of joys with her brilliant tracking eyes she found us the rare mountain zebras stunningly camouflaged on the cape peninsula . Nothing was too mch trouble and we would highly recommend Discovery Tours

Great service, great company, highly recommended. My wife, mother-in-law and I visited Cape Town over the Christmas period and we arranged for Discovery Tours to take us on several day trips. From the moment Yaseen met us at the airport we knew we had made a great choice. Over the next 3 weeks we enjoyed many adventures together and Yaseen's humour, vast knowledge and passion for South Africa didn't just add to our experience it made it!If you find yourself in Cape Town and want to see, feel and enjoy the surrounding area then look no further than the excellent Discovery Tours. Yassen, thank you for making our trip so memorable.

Excellent service from the moment I emailed to book the tour. I booked the Cape Peninsula tour and Yaseen picked us up from our accommodation in his spotless mini-van. We learnt lots of interesting facts about South Africa and saw places that we would not have known about had we have driven ourselves. I would have no hesitation in recommending Discovery Tours. Thank you Yaseen for making it a fantastic day.

Great tour!. I was in Capetown for only 3 days but friends booked for us a day tour around Cape Town with Yaseen and I was able to see a lot of the surrounding area. Yaseen's knowledge about the area, history and things to visit was absolutely fantastic and by far the highlight of my short trip. His funny and entertaining way made the day flew by in no time. Thank you for a great day and tour!

Wonderful Day Out. We booked the Cape Peninsula Tour and spent a full and enjoyable day with Yaseen. He is passionate about Cape Town and its beautiful landscape and made sure we saw all the sights. He told us interesting facts along the way and the whole day was one of the highlights of our holiday.

Amazing time. Tanya picked us from the airport with an amazing smile, and from that point we went everywhere, with Tania I miss her all ready.
She knew which winery to go too, all history of cape town and just so flexible,
my husband bill and I recommend Tania and Discover tours to anyone from 2 to a group tour.

Excellent knowledge and very friendly service!!. This is our second time to Cape Town and of course booked again with Discovery Tours. Tanya we now feel as a very dear friend. She knows the area and really enjoys her job. Looking forward to our next return to Cape Town and to book our tours again through Discovery Tours!!!

Your "Cousin" Tania is waiting to show you around Cape Peninsula. Forget any ideas you might have of being stuck in a car with a boring old tour guide. From the moment Tania of Discovery Tours picked us up in Cape Town early in the morning, it was like our long, lost wonderful cousin had picked us for a day of fun, sights, and more.She was totally open to fitting needs of our group. Husband needed some great coffee? No problem, we stopped off in a charming village for delicious coffee. I'll be trying to burn off those uber buttery croissants that we also found there for all of 2016, but can't blame that on Tania. Honestly, worth every bite.She also was in tune to the needs of our two teen girls. Making this a great tour for them, as well.Having traveled the world and being from California, I had wondered just how magnificent can this Cape coastline be? Beyond incredible is the answer. Wow oh Wow.Tania is the one to see this coastline with. She knows every inch, melding together information about nature and the history of the area.She arranged lunch for us at the Cape. Took care of every detail that made this a great day and very importantly, kept us out in front of the crazy holiday traffic and crowds.If you are planning a trip to Cape Town, I would not hesitate to book with Tania and Discovery Day Tours.One thing I am including in all my TA SA reviews--if you are traveling with any kids under 18, even if they are your own, make sure you double check the new SA travel guidelines. They are over the top strict and unlike anywhere else we have traveled in the world.

Cape Peninsula with Tania. My husband and I did a one day Cape Peninsula tour with Tania. Even though i had very high expectations after reading the reviews, we were in for a fantastic day of sightseeing and understanding the history, the flora and the fauna of the place. She made us feel very comfortable and at ease, and was relaxed and patient throughout the day. She took us to exotic off beat locations besides the usual places. It was a day to remember, and very well spent.

Absolutely the Best. Yaseen and Tania are exceptional guides but equally important is they are outstanding, top shelf people. They love their City and know what to do, how to get there, and beat the crowds all while sharing their wealth of historical knowledge. We toured Cape Peninsula, Hermanus and the City with Yaseen and the Winelands with Tania. They are prompt, if not early, were extremely accommodating with our time frames and quickly and expertly dealt with our impromptu changes. We had 4 days in Cape Town and never could have covered all the sights and areas without Discovery Tours. Yaseen and Tania have a wealth of knowledge of Cape Town and the surrounding areas, are very professional with great senses of humor. We highly recommend Discovery Tours.
