Yaseen and Tania will not disappoint.

Cape Peninsular Tour. Did a day tour with Yaseen on 17Dec. He surely knows cape town well, brought us to many scenic locations, even managed to spot animals such as ostriches and baboons. He is knowledgeable, humorous and most importantly alot of passion for cape town.

The Best Way to Experience the Cape. Four of us planned to spend 4 ½ days in Cape Town before boarding a ship, but were not sure of the best way to take in the sights. Discovery Tours was our answer. On day 1, we had a cape peninsula private tour with Yaseen. We visited all the usual sites like Boulders Beach to see the penguins, and Cape Point. But Yaseen also took us to striking spots where we were the only visitors and that made this visit special. In addition to his great knowledge of the area, Yaseen has a great sense of humor and kept us in stiches. So not only was it a beautiful trip, it was fun.On the second day, Yaseen’s wife Tania took us into the wine country, where we visited farms we had requested and two they had suggested (Meerlust, Rust & Vrede, Thelema, Lynx in Franschhoek and Spice Route in Paarland). We had lunch at the Delaire Graff Estate which was amazing.That many wineries is a very aggressive schedule, and Tania adjusted the original schedule “on the fly” to make sure we were able to see them all. These wineries were all great, Tania was a terrific guide, and we again had loads of fun.On the third day, Yaseen drove us to Hermanus, which was another great trip and well worth the time it took to get there. On the fourth day, Yaseen gave us a 4-hour “mini-tour” of Cape Town highlights before dropping us at the ship.We started talking with Discovery Tours almost a year in advance, and we were glad we did. They are extremely good and very popular.

Terrific tour company!. We did 3 days tours with Discovery Tours and simply can't praise them enough. Warm, welcoming, accommodating, knowledgeable and highly professional. We felt as if we were being hosted by friends. Thank you Tania and Yaseen!

Outstanding cape peninsula tour!. We had a cape peninsula private tour with Yaseen of Discovery Tours yesterday. We loved it! The scenery was beautiful! We visited all the usual sites like Boulders Beach to see the penguins, and Cape Point. But we also went to striking spots where we were the only visitors and that made this visit special. We ended up with a beer at a local pub watching the Springboks! What a day! I recommend Yaseen and discovery tours to anyone wanting a special day tour in Cape Town.

Fantastic, full day of sightseeing. We had a superb tour of the Cape Peninsula with Tania. She was a really great guide with a very full knowledge of the whole area as well as all its flora and fauna. I would recommend this tour company to anyone visiting Cape Town. You are guaranteed a great day out and will see far, far more than you could if you tried to do it any other way. Thank you Tania.

Enjoyable and informative Tour.. Our family had a highly enjoyable and informative day with Mark Hawthorne as our guide, exploring the Peninsula. He was friendly and enthusiastic. He made sure we got the most out of the trip, suggesting photo opportunities, making sure we saw as much as could within the the time we had. If we are lucky enough to return to the Cape Town we will definitely take another tour with Mark.

Knowledgable and friendly day tours. We did the full day Cape tour and the full day wine tour. Yaseen picked us up and Nine for an amazing, informative and entertaining day. The Cape is a must for any first time visitor, it being some of the most spectacular scenery you will ever see. We stopped numerous times for photos, baboons, ostriches, Zebra flora and fauna.We ate at the Two Oceans restaurant with a table perfectly situated for the awesome views. Yaseen could not have been nicer and I highly recommend this tour.His wife Tania took us into the wine country and she was delightful. Spectacular views along with a scrumptious lunch at Delaire Graff Estates were the highlight of the tour. The wine country is an hour away from Capetown so a full day is advisable especially if you want to do multiple tastings.I highly recommend this company for those that want an intimate private tour.

Excellent Day Trip with Discovery Tours. The booking process with Discovery Tours was straight forward and Yaseen confirmed our date very quickly. We wanted a tour of Cape Point and surrounding area. We were picked up from our hotel in Cape Town very promptly and from the moment we were picked up to the time we were dropped off, we had an excellent day. Yaseen was extremely flexible and took us to the places we want to be and gave us as much or as little time as we wanted. We were not rushed around like all the other large tour groups. Yaseen knew everything about the local area including geology and wildlife. He was also an excellent photographer. We ended up at a wine tasting location which was excellent. The price was excellent and this is the way to see Cape Point and the surrounding area. We saw Yaseen a couple of days later when he was doing a tour for another person and he instantly came to say hello.Would definitely recommend.

Great Customized Peninsula Tour. Even before we booked with Discovery Tours they were offering advice that ended up being great! We stayed at An African Villa on their recommendation which was perfect for us. Yaseem picked us from the airport and Tania gave us a personalized Cape Peninsula tour that included transport to the airport. Yaseem was very personable. I really appreciated that she appreciated my interest in birds and took the time to linger at a place known for whales. We saw a humpback tail slapping, which we would have missed if she had rushed us from one spot to the next. It was a great day!

Definitely a good value for your money!. I think Tania gave us the Cape Peninsula tour after Mienta because she told us a SoCal woman discovered many Cali plants were native to South Africa. That's news to me too! Everything Mienta said plus all prior positive reviews are true. I only spent time with Tania but I've no doubt Yaseen is great too. She was very personable, enthusiastic (seriously guys!), knowledgeable and flexible. You'd think someone who has been doing this for so many years would be bored of their job by now, but they're not. Tania showed us the Cape Peninsula as if she were showing her friends a good time. I felt so at ease with her and my friend and I learned so much about the areas we explored as well as the general history and current events at Capetown. This truly set the tone for my short stay here and really made the experience personal for me. It's nice to see pretty places on a trip, but even better to understand the historical and socioeconomic landscape. One last thing, Tania really wanted to make sure we saw the animals in the area and spent much time tracking them down - unsolicited. Thanks to her efforts we saw bontebok, ostriches (an entire family!), birds, baboons, and many others I've now forgotten. Here I thought I'd only see the Penguins at Bouldersbeach. You won't regret using Discovery Tours and I hope to return the enthusiasm should Tania and Yaseen find their way to the States again.

A Great Find!. I found Discovery Day Tours thanks to TripAdvisor and booked two private tours with the company for a recent visit to Cape Town. I was looking for an option for private tours rather than joining group tours that were offered through the travel agency I used to book the trip. I’m so glad that I made this decision! By opting for private tours, we were able to visit places and customize our time according to our interests, and we were lucky enough to genuinely like both Tania and Yaseen!Our first day was a tour of the Cape Peninsula with Tania. Spending time with her in Kirstenbosch Gardens was a great experience. She has a lot of knowledge about botanicals, and I was floored to learn how many plants found in Southern California are actually native to South Africa. We had a perfect day for enjoying the beauty of the land, and Tania was the perfect narrator. She recommended we have lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant at Cape Point, and it was a wonderful recommendation.We toured the Winelands the following day with Yaseen and had another perfect day. He kept us entertained, and I learned volumes about South Africa’s history. We stopped for tastings at three wineries, each selected to offer a different experience. The lunch recommendation was Delaire Graff, and it was tremendous! Both Tania and Yaseen know and love their homeland and make great ambassadors to show it to visitors. I loved hearing about the history and the culture of the area; we learned so much from our time with them. Both have amazing energy and enthusiasm, and I really appreciated their honesty in relating what life is actually like in the area.I highly recommend using Discovery Day Tours for private tours if you’re visiting Cape Town. They were very responsive through email while I was making arrangements, and they were great about personalizing things to our interests. Their restaurant recommendations were spot on, and it was so nice having them arrange everything for our bookings. They really know their stuff, and they’re both great people that you’ll enjoy spending the day with.

Great visit to Cape Town and surrounding area. We booked 3 days of well personalized day tours with Discovery several months before our trip to Cape Town in July of 2015. One of the things that impressed us right off the bat was the detail and promptness of their replies to our many emailed questions and requests. Our days with Tania were absolutely fantastic, we really couldn't have asked for anything better. It was great to have their proposed customized itinerary and then even better when she adjusted it on the fly to fit how we were feeling each day and the circumstances of the weather. Tania was friendly, knowledgeable and great company; we thoroughly enjoyed our time on her tours. She was prompt, well organized and arranged excellent meal options for us. We learned a tremendous amount about the area, the culture, the nature, the history and the people. She was very patient with our many questions and gave us great information that we are still thinking about. We are planning our next trip to South Africa already and one of the things that we know will be part of this future trip is that we will be spending more time with Discovery Tours. Thank You Tania for such an amazing time in the Cape Town area!

Great trip with Yaseen. Last week i went on a private tour with Yaseen. Since it was my first time in Capetown, i let him lead me all the way. We went to Rhodes memorial, Groot Constantia, Muizenberg, Kalkbaai, Simonstown, Boulders Beach, Cape of good hope, Noordhoek, Chapmans peak, Houtbay and Signal Hill.It was the best day ever! Not only because Capetown is just the most beautiful place. This day was also a great succes because of Yaseen´s enthusiasm. He knows everything. He likes it when you ask him as many as questions that you have. And also he knows what you need without you asking him. For me, for instance, i´m not a person who needs to have a extensive lunch. He knew that. But still gave me all the options. An other example is that i wanted to see the penguins very much. So he gave me all the time i needed at boulders beach.In other words, he 'reads' people. Which makes it so easy to travel a whole day together. Also, but that is personal, he has a great sense of humor which made me laugh more than once. In other words: this was a wonderful day with Yaseen as professional and wonderfull company. I would recommend this Discovery Private Day tours to anyone!

Amazing guides, bespoke itinerary & great service . Tania and Yaseen planned a wonderful trip for us of Cape Point and the winelands that we went on over several days. They were incredibly informative and knowledgeable. We spend most of our time with Tania who was good fun, personable and professional. She customized our tour to our tastes as we went along and make our stay in Cape Town simply wonderful! I highly recommend them for your tour!

Knowledgeable and flexible hosts. We used Tania and Yaseen services under the recommendation of the hotel we were in and we could not have been more lucky. From the airport pickup ( and drop off) to the daily private tour to Cape of Good Hope we have been treated amazingly. They were always on time, always ready to stop at any spot we were interested too, and ready to provide us information and history of all the beautiful places we visited.Last but not least, they advise us about our future holiday (.... Yes Yaseen, will be Tintswalo.....). Thanks again guys, keep it up!

Tour of the Cape of Good Hope. Tanya was an amazing guide. She picked us up from our hotel early and was full of energy and knowledge. Tanya taught us so much about the history and culture of South Africa. We saw some great animals and Tanya looked for animals for us while we ate lunch. Two days later we went on a wine tour with Yaseen. We also had a great time with him. He was also very knowledgable and took us to some great winery's. Great tour guides highly recommend using them!!!

"Private Tours around Cape Town with Discovery Tours". My husband and I visited Cape Town June 29th through July 6th 2015. Yaseen picked us up from the airport, and we immediately felt welcomed and perfectly at ease. We toured the wine lands and Cape Peninsula. Yaseen made sure we saw as much as we could without being rushed. He was very personable and knowledgeable about the history and all things regarding the Cape Town area. Yaseen was our guide for the Cape Town tours and we absolutely adored him! We didn't want the hassle of traveling to Kruger National Park in Johannesburg, so Tania recommended Sanbona Wild Life Reserve. We had a great time at Sanbona...it was beautiful. Both Yaseen and Tania's passion for Cape Town is evident....they made us love it too! Thanks Yaseen and Tania for making our vacation to Cape town a memorable one that will stay with us forever.Sebastian & Yvette Bell

Private Tours around Cape Town with Discovery Tours. I’ve take tours of the winelands, Cape Peninsula, Hermanus, and the West Coast with Tania and Yaseen in May 2015 and also in 2014. They are flexible and tailor the tour to any requests or personal interests. They always made sure that we saw as much as we could without being rushed. They are both very friendly and knowledgeable about all things regarding the Cape Town area. The Cape Town area is amazing and we had a great time on the tours with both Tania and Yaseen.

“Discovery Tours and Mark Hawthorne were perfect!”. Our family (two adults and two teenage boys - 13 and 15 years old) went to Cape Town in June 2014 and we hired Discovery Tours for the Peninsula Tour, Wineland and Kirstenbocsh gardens, and Hike to Table Mountain (Indian Vestler). Mark Hawthorne was our guid for all 3 tours and we LOVED him!!! He was very knowledgeable, friendly, flexible and nice. We all had a GREAT time!!!

Fabulous Peninsular tour. Picked up by Tania from our hotel and immediately felt welcomed and perfectly at ease. We had specifically asked to see certain things and Tania was more than happy to accommodate our wishes, making an itinerary that would suit us and any unexpected weather conditions. We had such a wonderful day and were over whelmed by the enormity of the scenery and beauty of this country. This tour was something we will never forget, and was all down to Tania's knowledge and expertise. So if there is certain things you need to see and do, then Discovery Tours will in my opinion be the people to speak to. Thank you Tania for a memorable day.

The Best!!. We were picked up and dropped off at the airport by Yaseen. Our plane was late coming in, but he was kind, courteous, professional and FULL of knowledge about Cape Town! Tanya took us on a day tour around the sites in Cape Town, she was interesting, fun and took us to places that we so enjoyed! Both Tanya and Yaseen shared history and fun facts about Cape Town in a non-pedantic way. They obviously love South Africa. Their passion for the place is so evident. They made us love it too!

just as the other reviewers say, don't skip the chance of having Discovery Tours help you enjoy the Cape Town area. I'm not sure I can add anything to the other comments about how wonderful Tania and Yaseem are. I used them for an airport pickup and for a one day tour to the Cape of Good Hope Park. Both were not only friendly but incredibly informative, full of helpful advice. I spent the day with Tania and felt like I was having an outing with a local girlfriend. I have to admit, I am not an expert on South Africa, but after only a week in the country, most of what I will have learned will have come from my time with Tania. Even in tourist places, she knows how to best avoid the crowds and how to protect you and other tourists (e.g., warning not to open car windows to get photos of baboons, etc.).They have been to the U.S. and have visited their former clients. I hope the next time they come to my country, I can return the favor and show them around my mountains and my protected wilderness areas (no baboons or penguins where I live though).

Look no further. I had a pleasure of meeting both Tania and Yaseen, who couldn't be more friendly, passionate, professional and knowledgeable. From a simple airport transfer to a day tour to Stellenbosch, they made me feel home instantly and as if visiting friends who know for a long period of time. Just tell them what they want to do or see and they will arrange everything for you. Can't wait going back to this beautiful mother city and see them again.

Beautiful Capetown Visit. Three of us were very fortunate to be able to visit this beautiful part of Africa. Our visit was enhanced especially by our trip to Stellenbosch and Franschhoek with their wineries. Yaseen was punctual in picking us up and conducted the tour in a very professional and entertaining fashion, knowing when to apply his superb knowledge and giving us our space. Our only complaint would be the noise from the sliding windows on the rear made it difficult to hear for the passengers in the rear. We were also pleased to take their tour of the Cape and absolutely loved the drive up the west coast and wished we could have had more time in that section.

Awesome day w/ awesome guide. My family has been to Cape Town 3 times and each time has had an amazing time with Tatia & Yaseen. They have remarkable knowledge of the area and know the best places to see and do things that are off the beaten path, if you want to. This time I had the pleasure of taking a tour from Cape Town down to the Cape of Good Hope with Mark. His knowledge of flora/fauna as well as the animal life and history of the area was FANTASTIC. I cannot praise him or this company enough. I am sure to take business cards from them each time I travel home, so that I can give them to anyone I know who may be going to Cape Town. I recommended them w/o any reservations! They feel like great friends to me!

Delightful trip. It was a great tour to explore the beauty of the cape peninsula. But it was our guide Tania who made this trip so special!!! She was professional, informative, entertaining, funny and always had a story or experience she shared and made the day a great enjoyable experience. Highlights for us were: cape of good hope nature reserve (beautiful scenery where we also saw baboons, ostrichs and bontebok), cape point, boulders beach with the penguin colony. We had lunch at the ‘two oceans’ restaurant inside the natural park and that was also an incredible tasty experience. With panoramic views set of the ocean we had seafood which was well prepared, presented beautifully, and served by friendly attentive waiters. Highly recommended.

Three Wonderful Days. We spent three wonderful days touring with Yaseen and Tania. The pace was leisurely, but we always saw more than we expected. We stopped at "local's" spots for morning and afternoon coffee breaks, which were as interesting as the sights we were seeing. Lunches were at specially selected restaurants, which maximized our experiences. Our favorite was dining al fresco at Constantia, followed by lunch at Two Oceans Restaurant overlooking the Cape of Good Hope.Our days seemed planned to maximize the use of our time as well as making sure we visited sites at the most opportune times. We happened to visit during a stormy period, but stayed mostly dry and still saw Table Mountain and the top of the Cape before the fog set in.Our group was carefully looked after, and people with mobility issues well taken care of.Yaseen and Tania were very forthcoming in answering all our questions about South Africa and clearly love their country. We left with a desire to return.

Simply the best!. If you do just one thing in Cape Town, spend a day with Tania touring the Cape. As others have said, you immediately feel like you're touring with a friend. Like you're going to Cape Town and your best friend says "you must look up Tania and Yaseen...they'll look after you." And how. We had a private tour for the 2 of us. We were picked up earlier than anyone else had offered at 8.30 from the Table Bay and for the next 10 hours...yes 10 hours...nothing at all was too much trouble. And you know what, while Tania knew all the best things to do, the best places to go, we never once felt as you usually do, that you're being taken to the places where the guide gets a kick back.And all thus with endless energy, friendliness and encyclopaedic knowledge. She is expert on wildlife and was desperate that we should see every possible species, going miles out of her way just to find Bontebok and the 'pyjama gang'......We saw absolutely every single whistle stop we could possibly have chosen and, because she did the round trip backwards, we never saw a single crowd anywhere.I cannot praise Discovery highly enough. They were the most competitive price from the quotes I got and Tania did far more than the others offered...unquestioningly, endlessly cheery and enthusiastic, with an effortless friendly manner that left you feeling you had known her for years.

Fantastic Tour. We took a family trip around the Cape Peninsula with Yaseen. It was really fantastic and one of the highlights of our 4 weeks in South Africa. Loved the history Yaseen gave us of the Afrikaaners and English in South Africa; he was engaging and knowledgeable and loved Capetown, the perfect guide! I highly recommend Discovery Tours and am so glad that we went with them. ( I just wish there was someone like Yaseen who could have guided us around Pretoria or Johannesburg... )

like touring with a friend. We only had 2 days in cape town and i'd contacted Yaseen months ahead - for the cape peninsula tour (day 1) and the wine tour (day 2), it was more than worth it. Yaseen turned up right on time at our hotel and kept us engaged with his information on each of the places we visited as well as his jokes. Its almost unnescessary to say that he knows cape town and surrounding areas very very well. We loved the drive down the cape peninsula - the various different beaches and the cape of good hope. Lots of good pictures and awesome memories. We had some thing planned in the evening and Yaseen managed to get everything done within time, likewise the next day the visit to different vineyards and Stallenbosche - he had catered to our tastes and taken us to vineyards we would have liked to visit. The entire tour was excellent and worth more than what we paid, it was so good one of my friends went back with his family a few months later with Discovery tours - Thanks Yaseen, we enjoyed our time in Cape Town.

fantastic people. Coming back from vacation and saying to our friends and relatives that it was wonderful to be in Cape Town,you are a lucky man.You know the country is splendid,the people is friendly and sunny like the weather.The greatest happiness however were our kind and helpful guides,Tania and Yaseen.Of all well-informed.Area,history,economy,food,restaurants etc..My friend and I visited with Tania several wine estates.The trip to the Wijnlanden is memorable not only because of the high qualified wines but also the well located places and the surrounding landscapes.Tania knows a lot of it.We enjoyed very much these two people making our vacation unforgettable.

Cape Town and Stellenbosch. Hi all! We enjoyed the Cape Town trip with Discovery tours. Yasin took us around on a full day tour. We went to sea face market and then to Penguin colony. Then to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. We had a lot of time to move around and then to Chapman's Peak. Last was the Camp bay with a spectacular view of posh and beautiful homes. We went to Table Mountain and Robben Island on our own - half day tour each. Then we did a half day tour to Stellenbosch with Yasin and enjoyed the grape wine lands. Thank you Yasin for the memorable trip. Especially for showing oedekral !!!!!

Like touring with a favorite relative. I have arranged and gone on many tours during our various trips and most have been very good. But the truly excellent ones are the ones where not only did our guide know the area well and was proud of the area but made you feel like that you weren't with a hired guide at all but rather with a close cousin who was showing you around. That was what our day with Tania was like. We (two couples) did the Cape Peninsula tour and hit all of the high points that other reviewers have mentioned. Tania went out of her way to show us the wildlife that we were looking for and was ready to stop anywhere we asked for photo ops or look at something closer. The mood and conversation during the long day (8:30 until almost 6:00) was like we had known Tania for years. This was one of the best guided tour experiences we have had. We still get all smiles when we tell people about our experience or discuss it amongst ourselves. I can easily give Discovery my highest recommendation.

Simply Fabulous. Cape Town-Discovery Tour Review of The Peninsula Tour.I had made arrangements with Discovery tours back in April, 2014 for our visit in November, 2014. Our group was visiting Cape Town on November 14, 15, and 16, 2014. We would all be arriving on the Holland America Ship Rotterdam.November 14, 2014, we were a group of 12 with 6 in each van. Our guides Tania and Yaseen met us at the port as promised at 8:30. Our first tour was their Peninsula Tour. We visited a shark lookout point for a fantastic view of surfers below and the lovely coast. We went to Simon's Town a quaint village by the sea. There we saw the statue of Just Nuisance (you will have to go there to learn his story). We saw penguins at Boulder Beach, taking a lovely walk along the coast to a second park entrance, what views! We arrived at the Cape of Good Hope and had lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant. The food was great and view magnificent. We then took the funicular to the top for some more fantastic views. Cape Point was our next stop, again great views and a few seals to boot. The area was quite windy, somehow we avoided most of the rain that day. The HAL tour my friend was on went the opposite route we did and they got soaked. We were very lucky. Riding through the park we saw a baboon, ostrich, and two different kinds of deer. We then took Chapman's Peak Drive for marvelous coastal views. During the day we had seen False Bay and Hoek Bay. Our tour started at 8:30am and we got back to the ship at about 6:00pm. Tania and Yaseen were both wonderful guides going out of their way to please all. Everyone on the tour had a marvelous time. I was so happy! For anyone going to Cape Town by cruise ship or for a longer vacation I would highly recommend calling Discovery Tours, they are the most obliging company to deal with. All promises were kept and the tours we took far exceeded my expectations. This made me especially happy since I had made the arrangements. Thank you so much Tania and Yaseen.

Amazing Trip. My wife and I had a private day tour with Yaseen in November. From first contact we received a very professional, personalised and friendly experience. It was obvious from our correspondence prior to the tour that Tania & Yaseen fully understood exactly what we were looking for. Our first impressions couldn't have been better. Yaseen arrived on time, was very friendly and got to know us straight away. The whole day was tailored to fit our requests. Yaseen could tell that we were very interested in wildlife and went out of his way to find as much as possible. Some of the animals we saw included ostriches, bontebok, dassie, fur seals, baboons and penguins. The trip was made more interesting by Yaseen's knowledge of both the area and the wildlife. We stopped for lunch at the 2 oceans restaurant and had a very enjoyable meal. As we were only in Cape Town for a short time we asked if it would be possible to end our trip with a visit to a vineyard. Yaseen ensured we got to do this, even though it made the trip slightly longer than expected. We really cannot recommend Discovery Private Day Tours highly enough. The trip that we experienced was very unique, great value for money and provided fantastic company.

Just what we wanted. We spent a fantastic day we Tania showing us around the beautiful Cape Peninsula. This was not a rigid tour but was extremely flexible allowing us to spend as much time doing what interested us the most. Tania is genuinely friendly and got the right balance of feeding us information and leaving us to our own devices to soak in the wonderful surroundings of the landscape she is so proud of. We would never have seen some of the great sights and wildlife if we had toured the peninsula by ourselves. Strongly recommended.

Excellent Tour Guides for Cruiseship Passengers. We were on the HAL Rotterdam in November 2014 and had the pleasure of Tania as our guide for the Cape Point Tour on day 1 of our stay in Cape Town. I can certainly echo the positive reviews by previous TA reviewers. I think Tania has a gift to make you feel welcome as part of her circle of friends and family, so that it's more of a visit to a great city with someone you know than a typical tour. We had quite a few tours on this trip to South Africa, and without question, Tania was the best. I would not hesitate to recommend Tania and Yaseen for anyone travelling on the cruiseships looking for a private small group tour.

We discovered Cape Town and environs.. Based on a friend's rave review, we booked three days with Yaseen and the Discovery Tours.Our experience paralleled that of others: special, memorable and exceeding expectations. We toured the Cape peninsula, wine country and Cape Town itself. Yaseen proved to be a quick and good read of his audience. Thus, for instance, our wine country tour highlight was the chocolate tasting. We had plenty of outdoor time as well as a lovely flood of history and local tales to entertain and inform us as we drove.Yaseen has a rare gift. He can make the tour feel like he's doing it for time for friends. What a treat.We give Discovery Tours an unqualified five stars.

A great character for a great day. Yaseen picked us up in from our hotel, An African Villa (also highly recommended) for our private Cape Peninsula tour and was immediately full of stories ! We started off at the Cecil Rhodes statue to get the view and our bearings.He then took us around False Bay through pretty Kalk Bay and onto Simonstown.He told us not to bother going into the busy Boulders Bay Penguin colony as the Betty Bays penguin site near Hermanus was less crowded and more interesting.This turned out to be true!We were very impressed with the Fynbos vegetation in Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve spotting Bontebok. Eland ,ostrich and some very cheeky baboons rummaging through a lady's possessions(she had gone swimming!).After a very pleasant lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant we took a three quarter hour cliff walk to the Cape of Good Hope where Yaseen met us having driven around.We were soaking wet having been caught in a squall at the top! We stopped again to look at fur seals and dassies.Passing through Ocean View (an inland settlement!) and onto Noordhoek on the Atlantic side ,we then drove the spectacular Chapmans Drive over to Hout Bay then over to Camps Bay 'where all the beautiful people live' and back to our hotel.Yaseen is very knowledgable and gave us many tips on later parts of our journey ,Wineries in Stellenbosch,the Four Passes route through Franshoek ,De Gelders for whalewatching and even a list of animals not normally seen for our trip to the Kruger.An amiable companion ,full of jokes(he called me the Rhodes Scholar as I had researched the day quite well) and never worried about stopping for a photo opportunity ,we had a great day and I can heartily recommend Discovery for any trips around the Western Cape .

Passionate about their work. Tanya took us on two trips. The first was a Cape peninsula tour. I doubt anyone else could have provided a better experience than Tanya's description of the regions's history, her humor and the off the beaten track detours where we sighted Zebras, Ostriches, Kudus and other smaller animals.Our second trip was to the wine country. This was again an impeccably planned trip which she modified on-the-fly to accommodate our tastes and timings.The next time we visit South Africa, we definitely will be using Discovery Tours.

Extraordinary Tour Experience. There aren’t enough stars to rate Discovery Tours as highly as it deserves to be rated. Both Tania and Yaseen are incredible at what they do. We booked two day tours with them: one around the Cape of Good Hope and one to wine country. A friend recommended Tania and Yaseen highly, but our expectations were totally exceeded. Tania picked us up at our hotel for our Cape of Good Hope tour and we immediately felt at home with her – she was warm and energetic. Tania led us to all of the most picturesque spots while sharing fascinating stories and facts about where we were, including a ton of historical knowledge and facts about the wildlife we saw. She was particularly good at identifying types of birds as well as sighting rare and beautiful birds when we would never have noticed they were there. Our wine tour with Tania was also a blast. She asked us what type of wine we preferred and customized our tour accordingly, including a stop at a champagne-only wine tasting which got our day off to an extremely fun start. All of the wineries that Tania picked were excellent and we were astounded by the scenery and wildlife in the region. We were lucky enough to meet Yaseen after our second tour – he could not have been warmer or more fun to talk with. Anyone would have a fantastic experience on a tour led by Tania, Yaseen, or any of their associates. Tania and Yaseen also introduced us to a few wonderful restaurants during our tours and recommended some of the best spots we ate at during our trip. We plan to return to South Africa within the next year or two and will absolutely use Discovery Tours again. Our vacation would not have been the same without Tania and Yaseen.

Priceless Experience: Yaseen. It is so difficult to describe how special our time w/ Yaseen (and Tania!) was. We pretty much put our entire experience in their hands, which was a gamble, but it paid off more than we could ever have known. On a hunch (based on warm and responsive emails) I scheduled 3 tours w/ them, along with transfer to and from Sanbona. We spent about 40 hours in the space of a week with Yaseen (Tania joined him for about 8 hours of it). They are the most warm and wonderful couple, but this review is going to be primarily about Yaseen b/c we spent so much time w/ him. I just cannot describe how special Yaseen is... VERY SMART and very knowledgeable about the history of South Africa. I feel like I should get college credit b/c I learned so much! He is so enthusiastic and GENUINELY cares about making your trip the experience of a lifetime. I am not exaggerating. Examples: He will insist on taking your photo, which is invaluable. In my experience, you have to ask for photos, but he knows all of the best places and will make sure you will remember that moment! He will clear crowds and yell at people (politely) to not walk into the shot, too. Heh. Gotta love that. He will make sure that, if you are sitting down for a meal, you do not get jerked around. He will actually come in and track down the waitstaff to get your bill for you, so that you do not waste one precious moment. Make no mistake--he is not rushing anything. He is just making sure that you don't have to lift a finger or experience any sort of stress. I wish that I could clone him and put him in every country so that I can replicate the amazing experience we had in South Africa. This is an excerpt of an email that I wrote him after we returned, and I think it sums up my feelings:I actually miss you already! You meant/mean so much to us. The time we spent with you was the best time of the trip, and mere words of thanks do not do you justice. I was flipping through some of the photos and was laughing at the moments you caught that I was not even aware of! Amazing photos. I will certainly let you know when I have gone through them and put them up online. There are certain people you come across in life that leave such an impression, it almost brings me to tears. You are a rare breed, indeed! I really cannot bear the thought that I won't see you and Tania again--the most genuinely wonderful couple! So we must promise to keep in touch, and I do hope we can meet up again, at some point.We cannot thank YOU enough for adding to OUR lives and making the trip to SA the best trip ever and one we will never forget!

Private 2 Day Tour with Yaseen. My son and I had 2 days with Yaseen taking us to various attractions - wine areas, Cape of Good Hope, City areas etc. We organised this with his wife Tania. Both were excellent to work with tailoring our requirements to the time we had available, which was quite a stretch. Friendly personal service with a depth of local knowledge that would be hard to beat. They were recommended to us by friends who had had an excellent experience with Tania as guide. Obviously their high personal service standard is consistent - thanks again Tanis & Yaseen.

Cape Peninsula Tour excellent, but the Wine Region tour was disappointing. We took the Cape Peninsula Tour led by Yaseem on January 30th. It was a comprehensive tour with spectacular scenery, penguins, ostrich, antelope and baboons all in the wild! Yaseen was a wonderful guide - both professional and knowledgeable. The next day we went on a tour of the Cape Winelands, including Paarl, Franschhoek and Stellenbosch. While the itinerary was well thought out and our guide Mark was pleasant, he was not knowledgeable about wine or wine making. Given the cost of this tour for two people, because of his lack of knowledge, it was not good value.

Great tour with Discovery Tours. My husband and I were in Cape Town in September 2014 and Tannia with Discovery Tours gave us a superb tour. We had the best time ever! She took us to Camps Bay, Cape Point, Constantia Winery, Noordhoek, Chapmans Peak Drive, Hout Bay and to see the African Penguins along with a variety of other sightseeing landmarks, places and beautiful scenery along the way. In fact, she made sure we saw two wineries in Constantia instead of just one. Tannia gave us such an insightful history of Cape Town and you can see her love for the city shine through her. She pointed out so many things to us that we did not know existed in Cape Town. She has such a wonderful and enthusiastic personality and is such a joy to be with. I highly recommend Discovery Tours and I highly recommend Tannia as your tour guide so that you may have the best tour ever! We plan on going back to Cape Town and when we do we will be sure to call Tannia. I just know she will have more places for us to explore.

Amazing Private Tours with Tania. My husband and I booked with Discovery Tours after other recommended tour guides were booked. We were not disappointed at all, in fact we loved our 2 private tours with Tania to the Cape Point area and the winelands. She is so knowledgable and knows the answer to every question. She went way beyond the call of duty and extended our tour by showing us highlights in Cape Town. Tours were completely customizable and reasonably priced. Based on our preferences Tania picked out unique wineries with history, great tastings or special interest (like the Ernie Els winery). We were also able to tweek the itinerary because I wanted to get a little shopping in. The Cape Point tour was so beautiful and we stopped for all types of animals including the ostrich running around the light house. We enjoyed our time with Tania so much and invited her to lunch with us each day. We feel she is a friend and hope she and Yaseen will visit us when they come to the U.S. Book your Discovery Tour as soon as possible. You will be so happy that you did!

Great private tour and fun too.. We were recommended this company by a couple we met in South Africa. They had used discovery for a couple of tours and really rated them. We went on a winelands tour with Tania who picked us up bang on time from our hotel.The tours are private so you don't have to share a minibus with others. And you get to do what you want to do, which is great.We had a great tour full of interesting history about the areas and Tania was lovely. She made the day fun and enjoyable throughout. Can't recommend this company enough. If you have a spare day in Cape Town then email these guys and book something in. They will tailor make something for you and it is really reasonable. Thanks Tania for a great day.

Discovery Tours Top Notch!!. We recently returned from a trip of a lifetime which began with 5 days in Capetown. On the recommendation of friends, we had booked with Discovery Tours. Yaseen and Tania were wonderful! As well as being enthusiastic and knowledgeable, Yaseen kept us laughing as we toured Capetown and environs. Both are excellent guides and I highly recommend them to anyone who is taking a trip to Capetown.

Reliable and delightful. Tania and Yaseen assisted me with airport transfers. They were perfectly on time for both. Before I arrived in Cape Town Yaseen called to alert me that my incoming plane was delayed and stayed in touch throughout the day until the new schedule was finalised. This offered great peace of mind as the delay meant I arrived in the city alone at night. From the way I experienced both Yaseen and Tania and their description of the private tours they offer, I recommend them without reservation. Delightful, thoughtful, reliable people and experienced tour guides who were a pleasure to meet.

Extraordinary Trip with Yaseen! Surprise awaits!. My girlfriends and I were in capetown during the month of August 2014 for our holiday and it was amazing to have our trip with Yaseen!He's really knowledgeable and very willing to share. Very sincere!He gave us options to choose from for our trips and I think that's what a private tour should be about. The only time I didnt feel comfortable was when he told us we needed to rush for an appointment so we only had 20mins at a certain place. Twenty minutes later, we arrived at Delaire Graff Estate, and standing there was my boyfriend, who flew 6000miles with a ring in his hand and I said, Yes I do! With an awesome view overlooking the vineyard. It was the best thing that happened to my life! But it wouldn't have been possible without Yaseen who assisted in the planning for the surprise!I'm so glad we didn't miss the appointment! :pThat aside, Yaseen was really great throughout the whole tour and I would definitely want to book other tours with them the next time we visit capetown again :)cheers!

Cape Town Tours. We had two private tours- the Cape Peninsula and the wineries. Both were with Jaseem. He was an excellent guide. He was able to arrange the second tour on short notice and he modified the standard tour to accommodate our interests. He arranged a wonderful lunch at a scenic winery as well. They also provided transportation to and from the airport. We had a wonderful time and their rates are very attractive.

Great day discovering the Cape Peninsula. My wife and I did a private tour with Lindsay after reading the great reviews on trip advisor. We had a great time and saw everything we wanted to with Lindsay. First, booking was easy - we emailed a few months before and we were good to go. We were picked up at 9am and were taken all over Cape Town.We got to see Simons Town, Boulders Beach, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Points, False Bay, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, Chapmans Peak, Clifton and much more. Lindsay was very friendly and knowledgeable about everything. She was great about taking pictures of us everywhere we went - it was like having a personal photographer!We got back at our 6pm, so it was a packed day of great sights. The cost was a good value, especially considering how much we saw in just one day. I would definitely recommend a tour with Discovery.

Wonderful day on the Cape Peninsula. Booked our Cape Peninsula tour with Discovery on the recommendation of a friend and we couldn't have been happier. Yaseen was an excellent guide who truly seemed to love the area and showed it off to perfection. Not only did we see all the regular sights (beautiful area) we were treated to a mini-safari as we tracked animals off-the-beaten path. What a lovely day. We would highly recommend this company and will definitely use them again should we get a chance to return to Cape Town.

Yaseen the Magnificient. We booked two tours with Discovery Tours during our visit to Cape Town – the Cape Peninsular Tour and Hermanus cum Winelands Tour. Yaseen was our guide on both days and he did a fantastic job! He showed us the beauty of Cape Town and the surrounding areas and it was like being driven around by a friend sharing his intimate knowledge and love of the place with us. We could not have seen and experienced as much as we did without his expert guiding. He made changes to accommodate our interests so that we never felt like we were being rushed, and made quick detours to special places that we could never have seen if we were in a big coach with other people. By the end of the two days of tours with Yaseen, we felt as if we had seen many places in Cape Town that we had read about. Thanks, Yaseen, for sharing your enthusiastic and informative insights and for making our holiday in Cape Town so enjoyable!

Fantastic experience thanks to Discovery Tours. Discovery Tours was recommended to us by a friend who had encountered the company in March 2013. A little over a year later a group of us (seven) made it to Cape Town for my son's wedding (to an beautiful South African girl). Yaseem met us at the airport and got us to our rented apartment. Mark provided us a full day's tour of the Cape Peninsula. It was amazing and his knowledge of the flora, fauna and history of the region was phenomenal. We will go back to SA. Don't spend time getting quotes and "comparing" other tour services in the Cape Town area. Believe me - you cannot go wrong with T and Y (Discovery Tours). They are in high demand though so book early! THanks to them, it made a vacation and wedding trip pure perfection.

Awesome experience. Tania, Yaseen, and the hiking/birding guide Mark are all fabulous! Hike up Table Mountain, you won't regret it! Go birding with Mark in estuary areas, so beautiful! And Tania took us down the Cape Peninsula! Loved it!

wonderful last day. We thoroughly enjoyed spending our last day in the cape area with Tania. She was great company, full of information and fit in everything we wanted to see before we had to catch our flight home. She was recommended to us by a friend who had used Discovery Tours in 2010 and we would very much do the same. Thanks again for capping off a wonderful time in South Africa for us Tania!

We felt Tanya became a good friend in just 2 days. We booked 2 days with Discovery Tours over the internet. Yaseem met us at the airport and drove us to our B&B. For two days Tanya took us to the Wine Country and the Cape Peninsula. She adjusted the schedule as we went along to correspond with our wishes of what we most wanted to see. By the end of of the 2nd day we hated to part.They really know the area and where everything of interest is located and tell you all about it.

Outstading personal tours in Cape Town. Before coming to Cape Town, we contacted Discovery Tours and arranged to be met at the airport, given three days of private tours (Cape Town, the Wine Country, and the Cape Peninsula) and then delivered back to the airport. Tania and Yaseen were great guides and really enjoyable company. They handled all of the details perfectly and were extremely accommodating. We thoroughly enjoyed their company and every part of the three-day tour. By the way, Discovery Tours has a special relationship with African Villa, where we stayed, so the combination was perfect.

Excellent excellent. We were in Cape Town on vacation over the last week of May and contemplated renting a car but we knew the driver wouldn't be able to admire the amazing sights and views of the mountains all over the Cape fully if we did that. Moreover, there is always the nagging worry we would inadvertently drive into an undesirable neighbourhood, so we decided to go for a private tour instead.Scoured the net for day tour companies in Cape Town and contacted Discovery Tours after reading all the excellent reviews online. We are so glad we did. Our email queries to them were responded to very promptly and our booking was confirmed in no time. We decided on the Cape Peninsular tour and the Winelands Tour.Tania picked us up from our hotel in a very spacious Volkswagen MPV. As it was just the two of us and Tania driving, we had plenty of room in the vehicle. We had a lovely time chit-chatting and driving through the beautiful small towns around Cape Town on our way to the wineries. Tania is obviously very passionate about her job and she has a wealth of knowledge on the area. She pointed out the various plants/trees indigenous to the region, told us the names of various wildlife spotted along the way, recount histories of the towns and wineries we drove by and the prominent personalities that influenced the area - it was a smorgasbord of amazing bite-size information which made our trip so much more enjoyable.Because we drank a lot in the morning and over lunch in the wineries, she suggested we go for a chocolate tasting instead after lunch. Fantastic idea as we ended up buying not an insignificant amount of chocolates from the chocolatier. We also stopped by Franschhoek briefly to stretch our legs and do a spot of souvenir shopping.Besides the Winelands Tour we also used Discovery for a Cape Peninsular tour. Again, Tania was a wealth of information which made the whole trip so much more enriching. She also has a very sharp eye for spotting wildlife - we saw ostriches, elands, baboons, springboks, antelopes, guinea fowls, zebras and various birds of which names I can no longer remember. Everytime she exclaimed 'look!' it was a mad rush to ready the camera and point it at where she was pointing. She timed the Cape Peninsular tour expertly so we could catch the awe-inspiring view of the sunset over Hout Bay. Pictures of it on the net do not do the place justice, you have to be there (at that time of the day) to experience it.It was a perfect two days we spent with Tania and we were almost sad when the tour came to an end. We became good friends over the short time we spent together. If you are ever in the Cape Town area and in need of a (customisable) private tour, you can do no wrong but to contact Discovery.

Wonderful Tours!. We were in Cape Town for several days and in Franschhoek. From the moment Yaseen picked us up at the airport, we knew we were in good hands. As this was our second trip to South Africa, Yaseen found activities for us to do that we didn't do on our last trip. He was also very knowledgable in directing us to great local shops for items we were interested in (i.e. maps, antiques, etc.). In Constantia and Franschhoek, Yaseen took us to amazing wineries with stunning views. We will contact Discovery Tours again on our next trip back to Cape Town.

Perfect!. We spent a day with Yaseen over the Easter holidays. I am still not sure how he kept 2 adults and four children aged from 9 to 16 interested in so much all day long! We did a tour of the Cape with him and he took us to many points of special interest. Although I had definate ideas of what I wanted to see, we certainly saw much more and had a better day than we would have had if we had hired a car. I would highly recommend Discovery as they can clearly deliver a tour to suit every group. Thanks Yaseen!

Special day on the Cape Peninsula tour. We had a very enjoyable tour of the Cape Peninsula - Yaseem our driver/ guide made the day very special and fun for our whole family. We had a mixed aged group with youngsters and not so yougsters and Yaseem tailored the day for us. From the amazing scenary from Signal Hill and Cape Point to the wonderful wildlife (penguins, cape Zebra, ostrich, baboon, antelopes and more) we had an amazing day that will be remembered for a very long time. Many thanks Yaseem!

The way to go in Cape Town!. We were in Cape Town for the Two Oceans half marathon and fortunately checked out Trip Advisor to find the stellar reviews of Discovery Tours. Tania took us to the wine area on Monday and Yaseen to Cape Point on Wednesday. Both tours were fabulous and Tania and Yaseen were both so accommodating and really helped us understand the history and back stories of the area. Talk about diamonds of South Africa--these two are the real deal! On Monday we were looking for a bottle of kosher wine to take to a seder and Tania went out of her way to investigate this and find a place that would still be open later in the afternoon. Yaseen has such an eye for wildlife--we saw much more than we expected on our tour to the Cape. They both clearly have a passion for what they do. Highly recommended.

Wonderful day tour of Cape Peninsula. Like many others, we found Discovery Tours on Tripadvisor.com. We enjoy traveling and we always look to tripadvisor for ratings and reviews and Discovery Tours is consistently rated very high. We’re lucky to have Tania as our guide although based on all the reviews, the other team members are equally commendable and highly rated. The best thing about your own private tour is that you make your own schedule. Tania was very flexible with us. We’d made dinner reservation at La Colombe at 7pm and she suggested that we could delay the start of the tour for an hour so we wouldn’t have to wait around for the restaurant to open. On the day of the tour, Tania picked us up at the hotel and during our conversation, we told her we were not able to make it to Table Mountain the previous day due to weather closure. So she said she would make a detour to Table Mountain so that we could at least get some pictures taken. Traffic was bad and even though we didn’t make it all the way up to the top of the mountain, we were able to get some magnificent vista at the cable car station and certainly, pictures for our memory book. A great start.We visited all the places covering Simons Town, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, Clifton, etc. We saw baboons, ostriches and visited a penguin colony at Boulders. It was a full day. We also requested Tania to make a lunch reservation at Two Oceans Restaurant at Cape Point. The restaurant was very busy but the food was served quickly. If you go, the Hake and Chips is to die for, also Tania’s favorite. We also had the Signature Seafood Platter which is equally delicious. We still cannot stop talking about how delicious the meals were. We also want to make sure we mention about how attentive Tania was. We causally mentioned we were interested in those wire-bead animals that were very popular in S. Africa. And while we’re visiting the penguin colony, Tania took the initiative to pick up 3 wire-bead animals for us from a street vendor who did excellent craft work. It was such a sweet gesture as the street vendor was gone when we finished at the penguin colony. In fact, she even tracked down the street vendor when we said we wanted to see the rest of his collections. Those wire-bead animals are the favorites of my daughters and grandkids. Now we wish we had gotten more. At the end of our tour, Tania made an extra stop to visit the Constantia Uitsig Wine Estate before dropping us off at La Colombe for our sumptuous 5-course tasting menu dinner. She did it because she wanted to make sure we’re not too early for our dinner reservation. How is that for exceptional customer service!!So yes, we cannot ask for a better tour company or tour guide. Tania is remarkable and she made it a very special day for us.

Exceeded our Expectations. We were picked up at our hotel by Lindsey our guide for the day. We had a wonderful tour and saw much more than we could have imagined. Her knowledge and passion about the area and animals made our day a terrific adventure. We picked up lunch at a great deli/bakery/cafe and had a picnic on the beach on the way to the Cape of Good Hope. We were able to see the sights at our own pace and Lindsey took care of us like we were old friends. You can't go wrong with Discovery.

A Great Touring Company. We found Discovery Tours on the internet while preparing for our trip to South Africa. We typically do not "do" tours but found that this company offered private tours for close to the same price as large group tours and the reviews from clients certainly helped in our decision. Yaseem and Mark were great guides and we learned so much from them. Mark took us on the western coast tour up to Paternoster. It was off-season for the wild flower display but he was able to show us lots of bird life. Mark's knowledge from being a previous ranger was amazing. We had been told by the company (and appreciated their honesty) that March was perhaps not the best time of year to go north. However, we still decided to go and because there were limited flowers to see, was no fault of Discovery Tours.Yaseem took us on our other two tours - Cape Peninsula and the Winelands. His knowledge of the area and his ability to perceive our wishes was much appreciated. Our experience with Discovery Tours was first class and allowed both my husband and I to enjoy the scenery rather than one of us driving. When we completed our last tour with Yaseem, he provided us with information for our onward driving through the Garden Route (most of which we took).Thanks Discovery Tours for a great experience.

Awesome team!. We found Discovery Tours through our research prior to our trip to Cape Town, and after booking our flight transfers and a few tours through them, we also heard great things about Tania and Yaseen from the folks at An African Villa, where we stayed while we were in Cape Town.Yaseen picked us up from the airport when we landed, and started to introduce us to Cape Town on the way back to the hotel. We spent two full days with Yaseen, as he was our guide for both Cape Point and for the Winelands. On our full day Cape Point tour, Yaseen introduced us not just to Boulders Beach and Cape Point, but also showed us around Simon's Town, and a few lesser known gorgeous beaches. He was enthusiastic, entertaining, and an all around awesome guide. Yaseen gave us a bit of history and some culture background on the areas we visited, and it was refreshing to see how passionate he was about South Africa, and the Western Cape. Yaseen's car was comfortable, and he was a great driver. Using a private tour meant we were able to avoid long lines/crowds, as we had some flexibility with our detonations, and we were able to spend more or less time at each attraction as we saw fit. It also meant we didn't have to worry about driving or directions.Our second tour with Yaseen was a full day Winelands tour. We were able to see Stellenbosch and Paarl, and again got some history on the tour. We got to go to a few different wineries, as well as check out the town of Stellenbosch. Again, we had some flexibility as to which wineries we would go to and spend more or less time at. Yaseen was exceedingly flexible to our needs, and also took care of our lunch reservations based on what we were in the mood to eat that day. In the end were super thrilled with all of Yaseen's choices for the day.All in all, we loved how easy and stress-free (not to mention fun) the whole experience was. Yaseen made our first trip to Cape Town awesome! He made us felt very well taken care of, and we strongly, strongly recommend Discovery Tours for your Cape Town tourism needs.

Great fun, great use of time, great camaraderie. Tania took my wife and me from our hotel in Cape Town down to the Cape of Good Hope along the most beautiful and interesting routes. She provided good information along the way, tailored the trip to our interests, and provided good company. It was an A+ experience. By using Discovery Tours, we avoided having to drive ourselves (on the left side of the road), made sure to see the best sights, and packed the maximum fun into one day (pleasantly, without feeling rushed). This is the way to go.

Top touring with top people. We researched private tour operators in Cape Town and very fortunately chose Tania and Yaseen to look after us for 2 separate days, covering Cape Point on one and the Winelands on the other. Yaseen was our personal guide, and proved to be a fantastic guide and ambassador for the Western Cape, and South Africa in general. He's extremely knowledgeable, across all aspects of the area, combining with a great sense of fun, and ensured that we got what we wanted, as opposed to what we were given.Both Tania and Yaseen we're exceptionally helpful prior to our arriving in South Africa, by recommending sights to visit, timings and booking restaurants for us. When we had finished our 2 days, Yaseen produced a long list of recommendations/ideas for our ongoing travels through the country, most of which we took up.They both contributed to the wonderful time we had, particularly Yaseen, and we can't recommend them highly enough. If you want the best time in Cape Town and surrounds, get these guys to show you round!

Fabulous peninsula tour. We chose Tania as the price for a private tour for two was very similar to that of other operators for a group tour and we preferred the flexibility of the private experience.Tania tailored the itinerary to our tastes (focussing on penguin colony visit & time to explore Cape Point) and took us off the well-trodden tourist routes to look for wildlife in the national park (we weren't disappointed!) as well as allowing us plenty of photo opportunities to attempt to capture the stunning beauty of the Cape.Tania was very pleasant company for the day, knowledgeable about the area and we certainly felt well looked after. Highly recommended!

Captown short trip - 3 day tour. I usually like to travel without tour guides. But this time joined a work group with Yanseen and Tania as tour guides. Probably one of the best decisions I have made when it comes to travelling! Yanseen, in particular, is a great guide, informed from local history to culture, observant to our needs and willing to be flexible, and while humourous and a good conversationalist and knows when not to be intrusive. A trip to a beutiful city made lovelier by our "hosts"...

Excellent trip with excellent guide!. Yanseen and Tania are excellent tour guides. They took us to best spots to take wonderful pics, they knew where to find good restaurants and they shared a lot of interesting stories about Cape Town.

Capetown 3-day trip in Jan 2014. Yanseen and Tania were extremely good guides. Very friendly and helpful. Their main concern was to make sure everyone had a good time. They adjusted the itinerary according to the perceived needs of the group. Highly recommend!

Terrific tour guides in Cape Town. Yaseen and Tania are the best tour guides I have ever met. Their great effort has made my Cape Town trip unforgettable. I can feel that they really love this city and enjoy what they are doing from our three-day tours. In fact, this is my second time in Cape Town. In this trip, Yaseen has shown us some diffirent places. Even in the same place, I have seen different views due to his great advice. For example, Yaseen led us to a place where we can see the back of Table Mountain with lots of people surfing. For the Cape Point, he suggested us to go to the top of the hill to get a bird's-eye view of Cape Point. If I had another trip to Cape Town in the future, I would definetly use them again and I would like to recommend my friend to use them as well. D Zhong

A wonderful experience with a wonderful tour company. We had a great time in Cape Town many thanks to Yanseen and Tania's tour company.We were a large group of 7 people. Before the trip, I emailed around 3-4 companies. Discovery is the one with fatest response and one of the best price. Originally we agreed to a price for a group of 9. Unforturnately two friends could not make in the end. But the company did not change the price.We had a three-day tour of Cape Town. Yansee and Tania designed a good route for us. They were extremely nice. When I was kind of cheated by a local shop staff for buying 10 stamps although my intention was to buy only two, Yanseen bought the rest of 8 stamps and said he could use them in the future. When we had dinner at Camps Bay, Yansee offered to pick us up after dinner although the tour meant to end before the dinner.If anyone goes to Cape Town, Discovery is highly recommended. A good guide can definitely add color to the trip!

Loved these Guides and their Tours. In early January we made our first trip to Cape Town and used Discovery Tours for two and a half days of sightseeing with Yaseen and Tania. We did day tours of the Cape Peninsula and of the wine lands and a half day of Cape Town. They are excellent guides who have grown up in the area and are knowledgeable about the history and all the special features that come with it. They were a great help in designing the tours to be unique and personalized to us and working within our schedule and interests. Everything was top level, from the van we traveled in, to their delightful mix of professionalism and heart. Yaseen gave us an inside view of Cape Town and on our trip to the Cape Peninsula he gave us a wonderful and illuminating view of the stunning beaches and geographical landmarks as well as an introduction to the history of the area . When we went to the wine lands Tania chose a restaurant which we enjoyed so much we are still talking about it. We would highly recommend them to anyone looking for a wonderful and enjoyable way to enjoy this special part of the world. Chose them and forget the red bus.

Two excellent tours. We had the pleasure of both Yaseen and Tania's company on two private tours just before Christmas. Both were fantastic personalised days out. They both love their city and share their enthusiasm for all things good and bad that Cape Town has to offer. If you are thinking of a tour...invest in a private one. If you are choosing a private tour....look no further. We will be back with the family next year!!

Full day around Cape Point. Tania took me on a great day trip around to Cape Point. Being a solo traveler on the margins of a business trip, it was a relief to have such a knowledgeable and engaging companion for the day. We saw all the highlights, and she catered the itinerary around my interests. She even bought me some small souvenirs along the way! I would definitely arrange a future trip with Tania and hope I have the opportunity to do that.

Recomended. We made the winelands tour with Tania. She showed us 2 wine states, where we could taste, brought us to a fine lunch in Delaire Graff estate, made with us walks in Franschhoek and Stellenbosch...Tania was a very nice tourguide and told us a lot about capetwown and wines.We can recomend this tour provider.

Cape Peninsula tour with Tania. Had a wonderful day exploring the peninsula with Tania. Like traveling with a friend that knows everything and makes sure you are comfortable and happy as you go. My daughter was under the weather and Tania was so kind and helpful with making the day go wonderfully. Could not have asked for a better guide or nicer person to spend a day exploring one of the most beautiful places on this planet. Go for it...you will have a day you won't forget!

Outstanding in every way!. Took the Cape Point tour with Yaseen and the WInelands tour with Tania. I saw a lot of beautiful scenery, learned a lot of interesting history, and met two very cool people! Their tours and service are exactly as advertised, totally flexible per individual wishes, and well worth the fees charged. If I ever return to Cape Town, Yaseen and Tania will be one of the first calls I make!

Excellent day with Tania. My husband and I had a great day out with Tania. She has great knowledge and endless enthusiasm. She has made a great impression on us especially my husband as he was rather reserved regarding SA due to bad press in the past. The trip of cape peninsula is truly wonderful and scenic. I would book more tours with them when visit Cape Town next time.

Great Day Tour to the Cape Peninsula!. My friends and I booked a private tour to the Cape Peninsula with Discovery Tours after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and we could not have been more satisfied. Tania was the perfect guide. Her local knowledge was amazing and she could not do enough for us. I had been there last year, but I learned so much more with Tania. I saw wildlife and places I hadn't seen in 2012. I would definitely recommend Discovery Tours. We had a wonderful day.

Simply the best!. We chose Discovery Private Day Tours based on the glowing Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We spent three fabulous days exploring Cape Point and the West Coast with Mark and the wine lands with Yaseen. We had a fabulous time with two delightful and knowledgeable guides who tailored the days to fit with our interests and kept us enthralled and entertained throughout. We would have no hesitation in recommending them, would definitely use them again when we visit Cape Town and like an earlier reviewer, felt at the end we made new friends. Can't recommend them highly enough!

Cape point. Me and my wife had booked the cape point tour in November. Yaseen was our guide. He really is very knowledgable. We were picked up on time. Weather forecast had predicted heavy rains so he made sure we reached cape point before it started raining. Unfortunately it started raining heavily the moment we reached and couldnt climb up to the lighthouse. Return trip was marred by rain. But still it was memorable. Yaseen took us through roads which were much less travelled and would take us to some amazing isolated destinations but unfortunately we couldnt get out of the car much. It was frustrating.Yaseen has real good eye for wildlife and would spot an antelope or ostrich from far and would take us there. It was a real great experience apart from the rains.

Fantastic Tours Don't Look Any Further!!. We booked our airport transfers and two tours with Yaseen and Tanya. The airport transfers felt like we where being picked up and dropped off by friends. Tanya took us on our first day tour to Cape Hope. She is a wonderful guide we had a great fun day. It was very informative and we saw lots of wildlife over the day. We had a lovely lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant Tanya was extremely flexible with what we wanted to do. Nothing was too much trouble. Our Wine Tour guide was Yaseen and he was a wonderful guide as well. The weather on our wine tour was wild winds and driving rain but that didn't damped our day. Yaseen tailored it to our interests. I love champagne so he took us to a winery that specialized in sparkling wine delicious !! We went to a winery that paired chocolate and wine yum!!We had a long lunch at Delaires Winery that was amazing. Our lunch was one of the best meals I have ever had. Yaseen had let them know it was our anniversary and at the end of lunch a plate arrived with congratulations written in chocolate We had a wonderful couple of days with Yaseen and Tanya. Don't hesitate they are fantastic guides and a really lovely couple. They made our time in Cape Town very memorable. Thank you Tanya and Yaseen!!

Seamless airport pickup. I arranged an airport pick-up with Discovery Tours before I arrived in Cape Town and was greeted on arrival by Tania -- she was so friendly and fun! It was a warm and flawless welcome to one of the world's most beautiful cities. She was full of advice and good info. I would definitely recommend using this agency for airport transfers or private tours around the city.

Wonderful day on the southern peninsula. A few weeks ago my partner and I had a wonderful day trip with Yaseen to the southern peninsula. We chose Discovery Tours because of its high rating on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed in the least. Yaseen picked us up on time at our hotel and we immediately felt at ease with him, which was important because we were going to be spending the whole day with him. It was a beautiful sunny day, and we first stopped at the Cecil Rhodes memorial, with its commanding view of the Cape Flats and mountains beyond, then proceeded to Simons Town to hang out for a bit with the penguins and on down towards the cape. Along the way we learned a great deal from Yaseen about the area's flora, fauna, and history and enjoyed getting to know him. We stopped at several scenic spots along the way, including beautiful Buffels Bay, which was deserted, and headed on to Cape Point, which definitely was not deserted but worth the crowds. Had a delicious vegetarian lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant (didn't have to wait for a table, fortunately), then hiked up to the light house and its incredible views of the cliffs and ocean. Yaseen patiently stayed with his vehicle while we explored, then took us to the Cape of Good Hope sign, to another deserted windswept white sand beach, then in search of some wildlife. Yaseen's experience as a guide really paid off when we drove down a deserted secondary road to an area where we came across an ostrich, zebra, troupe of baboons, and eland-like animal--definitely a high point of an outstanding day.On the way back to Cape Town, we stopped by Noordhoek Farm Village and bought some great crafts at a shop there, snaked our way along Chapman's Peak Drive with amazing views of Hout Bay, and got back to our hotel before sunset.We unhesitatingly recommend Yaseen and Discovery Tours, and if/when we return to Cape Town we'll contact them for another tour.

Great guide to visit cape town with. We spent 2 days with our guide Mark. The first was to Cape point with various stops in between and the 2nd to the Wine region.Mark is extremely knowledgable on any subject you could imagine; from history, to wildlife to flowers etc etc. He used to work in conservation and still works as a mountain guide, therefore he talks very passionately about his subjects and it is hard not to be enthused. What we also loved were his stories about his family and his life in Cape town.He was really easy to get along with and genuinely nice guy who was very accommodating to our needs and interest throughout the 2 days.

Great way to enjoy Cape Town. This is a wonderful tour company, professional, fun, informative and safe. They picked us up for an airport transfer which was seemles, their warmth and enthusiasm shined from the beginning, a great no fuss, no worry way to arrive in Cape Town. A few days later we enjoyed a winery tour, which was terrific. We wish we had booked them for more tours, by the time we got to Cape Town and realised this company was a real gem, it was too late, they were booked out! Don't hesitate book as much as you can, you realy won't regret it.

A great choice in CapeTown. Two of us spent an amazing day with Yaseen packed with wonderful stops on our way to Cape Point. We visited the Rhodes Memorial, and Kalk Bay, stopped to see the Right Whales cavorting off the coast and visited the penguins at Boulders Beach. Upon entering the park we saw numerous birds and wild animals - ostrich, élan, baboons, and more. The drive back along the coast was spectacular. What truly made this tour outstanding was our guide, Yaseen. He was very knowledgeable, had a great eye for wildlife, and was very flexible. We enjoyed his sense of humor and enthusiasm for the day. I would book him immediately upon returning to CapeTown and only regret we didn't have more time to tour with him.

Great tours!. We took 2 all day tours – one tour with Tania to the Cape Peninsula and one with Mark to the West Coast National Park. Both Tania and Mark were a wealth of information and fun to be with.

Highlight of our Trip. Instead of renting a car, we decided to hire Yaseen and Tania to show us Cape Town and the surrounding area. It was the best decision we could make. Over the course of 4 days we saw all of the Cape Town attractions, went wine tasting, traveled to the Cape of Good Hope and did the Great White Shark experience. Yaseen and Tania are outstanding guides and became part of our family! Every morning they were outside our hotel waiting and every day we were treated to incredible sites and experiences. They made our Cape Town experience absolutely hassle free. They will even provide your airport transportation. Wow. I wish Trip Advisor gave 6 star ratings because Discovery Private Day Tours deserve it! Outstanding value!

Three Full Days With Tania & Yaseen. We were a party of three couples (all experienced international travelers) traveling to SA for the first time. Arrangements were made with Tania for the Cape Town portion of our trip and Yaseen drove us for each of the three days we had planned; Cape Town and environs, Cape of Good Hope and Wine Country. In our years of traveling internationally Discovery Tours is one of the finest tour firms we've used. Their patience with our group, flexibility with our schedule, knowledge of the country and it's history and just overall warm personality and good humor made this a very memorable visit for the six of us. All communications were responded to promptly, pickup times were right on the button and costs were very competitive. It was a sad moment when we parted company with Yaseen. You will not be disappointed with Discovery Tours.

Two days with Lyndsey and Mark. We booked a two-day tour of Cape Town area and the winelands, one day each with Lyndsey and Mark, arranged through Discovery Tours.Lyndsey and Mark were friendly, knowledgeable and easy to talk with. The pace of the tour was fine...we did not feel rushed, and the vehicle was new and comfortable.We were impressed that they listened to our interests and tailored the tour to suit us...specifically gardens, flowers, and the Nelson Mandela statue at Drakenstein Correctional Centre near Paarl.We will highly recommend Discovery Tours to our friends back home.

2 Days in Cape Town with Tania and Yaseen.
