If Trip Advisor had a 5 Star + or 6 rating I would use it for Tania and Yaseen.My wife and I booked them for a tour of the Cape and Wine Country 2 weeks ago. Communication was clear and prompt and their costs for what they provide are well worth it.Tania was with us for the 1st day and took us both to the Cape. She listened to what we wanted to do and tailored the visit accordingly which is one of the reasons I would recommend Discovery Tours as opposed to being in a small group with a fixed itinerary and timing. She provided us with a memorable day and her knowledge of wildlife, flora, fauna,history etc is excellent and this applies to Yaseen also.Second day in terrible weather conditions, gale force winds and rain, we were with Yaseen and despite the lousy conditions also had a great trip.In conclusion, for me the best evaluation of a Company or Service like this is, would you do it again and do you feel you made new friends and the answer on both counts is a resounding yes.Use them, you won't be disappointed.

Great tour with Yaseen. My friend and I had a very short time in Cape Town so decided to use Discovery Tours to maximize what we saw. We also used them for our airport transfers. I would highly recommend using them for both. Yaseen was waiting for us when we arrived at the airport, gave us a full day tour of constantia and cape point, and drove us back to the airport (very early in the morning!). He was extremely reliable, drove us around in a comfortable vehicle, and gave us a great personalized tour. The price was very reasonable, and it was so nice to have a customized tour.Our full day tour was wonderful. We were trying to fit a lot in, and Yaseen did a great job of moving us along so we fit everything in but also allowing us time at each location so we didn't feel too raced. We really enjoyed the whole tour - wine tasting, stops at little seaside towns, penguins, cape point, chapman's peak drive, etc.A real highlight for us was the wildlife. Yaseen spotted whales off the coast, took us to see the penguins and hyrax, and found baboons and ostriches at cape point. What really set the tour apart though was that he knew we had hoped to see the zebra at cape point (there are only 5 so seeing them is rare). He took this as a challenge and hunted to find them, and he succeeded! We were really excited to see them, and then he found the bontebok in the park as well. Don't think there were any possible animals to see that he didn't spot! Yaseen grew up in Cape Town, but he also spent time as a guide in Kruger - it showed!If we make it back to Cape Town, we would definitely use Discovery Tours and hope to have Yaseen as our guide again! He does a fantastic job of showing guests both the known tourist sites and additional specific places/things he knows they will enjoy.

Adventures with Mark. My friend Erica and I spent a full day with Mark about a week and a half ago while doing the Cape Peninsula Tour. Mark was such an excellent guide- he showed us not just the regional sights but really pulled us in by telling us about his family, where they worked, what they liked to do, etc. Mark spent years taking people up Table Mountain so he's also an expert in different types of plants and birds, so he'd randomly stop the car to show us different types of medicinal plants and things like that, and we really just had the best time with him. We went to Boulder Bay and saw adorable penguins, went to a cute spot to pick up some lunch and then he drove us out to the cape, where we had tea before driving out to the sign that everyone takes their picture in front of. We saw baboons, antelope, ostrich and when we didn't think we would, we finally saw zebra, which had literally come out right in front of our car. I got some amazing shots and the whole experience was breathtaking. After the cape, Mark drove us through a beautiful seaside landscape ending at Chapman's Peak before bringing us back to the V&A Waterfront. Couldn't have had a better time, so glad we booked with Discovery Tours. Thanks for everything!

Awesome day in wine country!. Yaseen took our family of 4 on a tour through wine country. We stopped in Franschoek, Paarl, and Stellenbosch. We also stopped in the small downtown regions to walk around. He also gave us info about the history of south africa and the wine regions. He was very friendly and knowledgable. Him and his wife own this company and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to spend a day touring parts of south africa with a warm and friendly local.

2 Great Days with Yaseen at Discovery Tours. In late July we (2 couples) met up with Yaseen for a 2 day tour of Capetown prior to our going on a package tour of 3 countries in Africa. We arrived 2 days before the start to see some of the sights we would not see on our longer, more formal tour. We were not disappointed as Yaseen did an excellent job of getting us to several great wineries the first day and a great lunch at one of the wineries he selected. The second day covered several sections of Capetown, Signal Hill and a great stop at the gardens at Kirstenboch. We could not go to Table Mountain as it was closed for maintenance.Our foursome thoroughly enjoyed the tour and we wished he would have been our guide for the additional 2 days we spent in Capetown on our ither tour. Yaseen is very knowledgeable, has a great personality and comes highly recommended by us. We hope to get to South Africa again and if we do we will definitely use Discovery Tours!

A fantastic way to see greater Cape Town. In June, my wife and I spent two delightful days with Tania, co-owner of Discovery Tours. She is a treasure trove of knowledge, did a great job tailoring the touring to our special interests and is lots of fun to hang around with at lunch and throughout the day. Her fee for a private guided all day tour at about $100 a person is a bargain.We hope you can experience Tania for yourself!

Wonderful. My husband Stuart and I did the Cape of Good Hope tour with Tania in early July. We had the best time. Tania is a great host and guide and made the day a memorable experience. Tania has a wonderful knowledge of all the history as well as all the fauna and flora. We are really, really glad we did this tour and would recommend it to everyone who goes to Cape Town.

Excellent private day tour on Cape Peninsula. Tania took us on a day tour covering Cape Peninsula during our short stay in Cape Town. She was very knowledgeable and helpful throughout the trip. We felt safe and taken cared of during the trip. The scenery that we saw was magnificent. We took so many photos that our camera ran out of battery and storage towards the end of the tour. Tania volunteered many times to take photos using her mobile which she emailed to us after our trip. We appreciate that a lot.Overall it was a trip worth going, very private and secure. It would have been better if the weather was good to see the Table Mountain.

Exceptional private day tour, great value. Yaseen, co-owner of Discovery Tours with his wife Tania, took my husband and me on a marvelous day long trip from our B&B in Capetown central all the way down to Cape of Good Hope and the Cape Point Nature Reserve, with several very interesting stops on the way. Yaseen is a warm, engaging person who combines superb professionalism with exceptional knowledge of the area. He tailors this day trip to suit interests and physical capability for a perfectly marvelous time. Yaseen has great enthusiasm for his home city which he clearly loves and has superb knowledge of the beautiful landscape, seascape and flora and fauna. The cost for this private guide service was so very reasonable and is well worth it to receive such first class, personalized service. Don't even consider being in Cape Town without using Discovery Tours for a day tour!

It's all been said before, and it's all true!. In planning our first trip to CT, we had no idea how to plan our time, where to go, how to get around, etc. So I turned to TA and found Discovery Tours aka Yaseen and Tania. Suddenly, my problems were solved. They promptly responded to my many emails, made very helpful suggestions, and were always willing to give me some pointers.We have just finished spending 2 full days with Yaseen and loved every minute of it. We toured the Cape Point on one day and the Winelands on the next. He made the time fly by with his knowledge, stories, sense of humor, warmth, passion, and extra touches (like buying us some local snacks to sample). I love peppering guides with questions to get a feel for the culture. Fortunately, he loves answering questions. We covered politics, religion, racial history, local customs, education, etc, etc. My wife and I really learned a lot. Like others have said, we felt like we were spending the day with a good friend.He also has some pretty incredible eyesight, as he spotted various wildlife as we drove around Cape Point. Yaseen is in his mid 50s. Tania is a bit younger. They have been married for over 20 years and have been doing tours for over 15 years. They were both born and raised in South Africa. I wasn't sure if they did a tour together or separately. Turns out they do them separately.One other point to consider. As part of my trip planning, I had emailed several other guides highly recommended here on TA for itinerary suggestions and fees. Discovery Tours was by far the most reasonably priced for the same tours. While that was great, I had some nagging concerns that we'd be getting a budget tour, or something of lower quality, despite the glowing reviews here. I am pleased to report that my concerns were completely unfounded. For instance, our tour was supposed to end at 5pm each day. However we ran an hour over on each day because we were having so much fun and Yaseen kept wanting to show us more things. Yet he never asked or suggested that we owed him a penny more than his quoted rate. My wife and I have no reservations whatsoever in recommending he and Tania, who we had lunch with one day and was equally delightful, to anyone.

Unforgettable!. We enjoyed every minute of the time we spent touring Cape Town with Yaseen. It is obvious that he loves what he does and we appreciate the trouble he took to show us the best of Cape Town. We did the Cape Peninsular tour and the Winelands day trip and transfers from the airport with discovery tours which was very good value. Yaseen is a very warm person who was an excellent tour guide. He took us off the beaten track and packed our day with unforgettable memories. We hope we would be able visit Cape Peninsular again to see more of it in the not too distant future. We will definitely contact Yaseen and Tania to help us make the most of our next trip. Thanks very much from all of us.

Local knowledge and great company. My family (my partner, parents and myself) did a day trip to the Peninsula with Yaseen when we were in Cape Town in September. Yaseen was great company - very knowledgeable, easy-going with a great sense of humour. If like us, you don't know anyone in Cape Town, I imagine this is the closest you can get to having a friend show you around - it certainly beats bland large group tours. As we got poor weather on the day, it was very cosy to be travelling in the van with Yaseen,Yaseen had also picked us up from the airport on our arrival and everything went very smoothly.Wouldn't hesitate to recommend Discovery Tours.

First Class - Memories that will last a Lifetime. During a recent visit to CapeTown, Discovery tours were recommended to us by the hotel that we were staying at. We organised two trips with them and two airport pick ups and we found them to provide excellent friendly service, personally tailored to ensure that you can get the maximum of what you want from the trip.We organised two tours during our visit, one to Cape Point and One to the Winelands; on both trips we were escorted by Tania in a very comfortable air conditioned vehicle. Tania is very knowledgeable about the local area and history of the Cape and is very helpful in ensuring that the highlights away from the typical tourist trail are brought to our attention. We were able to see so much more at our leisure because of the thought and the planning that went in to design and timings of the trips.I would thoroughly recommend Discovery Tours if you are contemplating a trip to Cape Town and want to find out a little more about the local area. Discovery Tours can tailor the day to suit you and your agenda and also provide a great personal service that you will really appreciate.During our visit, I took numerous photographs of the wonderful inspirational scenery and I will have these forever; the memories of our trips with Tania around the beautiful Cape will also last forever.Thank you both for making out trip to Cape Town so enjoyable and memorable.
Fantastic day on the Peninsula tour. Had a fantastic day - Tania was a friendly and knowledgeable host, saw some excellent sites and animals in the national park, would highly recommend

Wonderful Independent Operator. My 13 year old daughter and I used Discovery Tours (Tania) for a tour of the Cape Peninsula, based on favourable reviews on trip advisor. To clarify, this is more like a guided drive than a guided tour. Tania does not accompany you to each of your stops and as long as you are not expecting this, you will be very pleased. She is such a down to earth, lovely, kind woman, you cannot help but love her by the end of the day. Our day involved a stop at Kolk Bay, where we shopped a bit too long, a drive to Boulders Park to see the penguins then down to the peninsula. We ate lunch on our own there and met Tania about 4 pm for the return drive through Chapman's Pass I'm glad we asked about the famous sign because she decided to drive there for a picture which is when we saw ostriches right by the ocean! The drive back is stunning and Tania was more than happy to stop for photos along the way. Once back in Capetown, she learned we would not have time to go up Table Mountain so she drove us up and we enjoyed the panoramic view even though the venicular was already closed. It was a long but really enjoyable day and I truly felt like I made a new friend. Discovery Tours provides excellent value..

Great day in wine country!. Spent a lovely day in the Stellenbosch wine area with Tania--beautiful countryside, visits to several wineries, a great lunch and time to shop leisurely before the fast pace of a tour coming up. Had a thoroughly enjoyable day with a most knowledgeable and pleasant guide. Highly recommend the services of Discovery Tours!

Fantastic experience. My new wife and I did two tours with Yaseen and Tania, one of the winelands (Yaseen), and one of the Peninsula (Tania). Both were fantastic, and tailored to our needs. Despite our only day of terrible weather on our entire trip, Yaseen's sense of humor and knowledge of the area made it a great day in the winelands. Likewise with Tania, who took us to see the penguins, the majestic views of Cape Point, and the beautiful Chapman Peak drive. They were also very flexible, changing schedules at the last minute for us, and helping us get a great deal on subversion. Would definitely recommend their services!

Amazing Tours,tailor made to your needs. I have never written a review before but felt compelled to share my find in Tania and Yaseen to anyone visiting Cape Town.On their advice we had 2 separate day tours,one around the Cape peninsular and another around the wine route. Both tours were excellent and it was great to share their passion for their country, it's culture and wildlife.As the holiday went on they found out more about us and our interests and changed the initial plans to make it even more enjoyable for us.We will certainly go back and use them again and we could not recommend them highly enough!

Great experience. When I was planning my family visit to Cape Town (my wife, my son and me) I picked up Discovery Tours based on the Trip Advisor recommendations. I contacted them via their website and we arranged everything very quickly by e-mail. We have decided for two tours: Cape Peninsula tour we made with Tanya and Winelands tour with Yaseen. Both of them are excellent tour guides. They run family business and they really supplement each other very well. They were very open and gave us plenty of information: on the nature but also on the older and recent history as well as on the current situation. As they both come from Cape Town province a lot of info was based on their personnel experience. They helped us very much to understand South Africa. They also passed a lot of hints on Cape Town area. Regarding the tours as such, I do recommend taking both of them. Cape Peninsula is a must if you are in Cape Town area (including Cape Point and Boulders Beach of course) and Winelands tour helps you to understand the country ( not mentioning wine tasting). As a summary: fully recommended.

Spectacular!. We found the dynamic duo from rave reviews on Tripadvisor. Yaseen took us on a private day trip to wine country. Despite the bad weather, we had a lovely day touring the finest wineries and breathtaking scenery. His insight as a local added immensely to our experience, and we ended the day with a full to-do list of restaurants, sights, and museums in Capetown. We can't wait for our Peninsula tour! Sure to be equally as fabulous... We highly recommend Discovery Tours, a true delight to plan our honeymoon with!

Best touring experience out of other available options. My husband and I were in Cape Town for 4 days and spent 2 days with Yaseen & Tania on Cape Tour and Wine Tour. We also scheduled our airport transfers with them and each time they were there right on time waiting for us. On our tour stops we saw people being herded off their luxury coach buses and I thought wow I'd hate to be one of them. With Yaseen and Tania, we stopped where and when we wanted to and avoided crowds. They were both so easy to talk with and knowledgeable about the area. It is only Yaseen or Tania who do the tours so if they are available you should schedule immediately. It is not worth the few dollars saved by doing a group tour vs. this privately tailored tour. Communication and assistance prior to our arrival in Cape Town were prompt and accurate as well.

Tania gave us a wonderful tour!. Tania took a friend and I on a private full-day tour of the Cape Peninsula and Constantia wineries. She was friendly, helpful, and very knowledgeable... we loved having a local's perspective. Infinitely better than doing one of the big group tours! She was very flexible so that we could spend more time doing what was most interesting to us. Highly recommended.

The Best. Well, it's all been said in previous reviews. If you really want a great tour experience, this is who you should contact. I had been to Cape Town twice before, but it was the first time for my wife, and we only had two days in the city. I wanted to customize the usual tour by shortening the time at the Cape and instead include a visit to the botanical garden. Yaseen suggested some changes that resulted in a perfect itinerary, including making a lunch reservation at a terrific restaurant (The Food Barn) a quick visit to Constantia Winery, and a visit to Kirstenbosch Gardens. The tour hit all the right buttons for us and, as others have said, it was like touring with a good friend.

Excellent Tour Guides. We booked two day-long tours with Tania and Yaseen. On the first day, Tania took us all round the Cape Peninsula and on the second, Yaseen showed us the wine regions around Cape Town.Both days were really enjoyable. Tania and Yaseen both really know their subject and obviously enjoy sharing their local area with visitors. It's more like being shown round by friends than a tour company.We'll definitely be trying some more of their tours the next time we make it to Cape Town.

Really great tour guides. I want to say how much we enjoyed our tours with Yaseen and Tania whilst in Cape Town. They are both so friendly and knowledgable as well as flexible that the trips are personalised from the word go .Yaseen took us around the Cape with several photo and coffee stops which were well timed.We had a fantastic lunch on an isolated beach with only ostrich and buck for company! He pointed out so much wildlife along the way which was a great bonus.Tania took us on a full day wine tour with spectacular scenery.I would highly recommend Discovery Tours and would definitely use them again when next in South Africa

Thanks TA, you did it again!. We are just back from a fantastic day with Tania. We have seen so much in a single day that would not have been possible any other way or I suspect with any other tour company. Whilst the key places of interest were inevitably busy with tourists and tour groups, Tania was, through her extensive knowledge of the area, able to take is to quiet and spectacular places and views. She was a mine of information about the flora and fauna and eagle eyed in spotting the wildlife. The private tour, the openness and friendly nature of the guiding and a willingness to appreciate quirky British humour ensured a totally relaxed, informative and exceptional day. Can't praise Tania enough!

Don't miss - perfect guide!. It doesn't get much better!! Tanya was a perfect guide and I left feeling like I had made a new friend. Knowledgable, efficient- we saw everything we dreamed if seeing with the most efficient use of our short time

Exceptional tour with Yaseen. After reading many reviews, we were trying to get our entire tour planning done by Discovery tours but we couldn't except for one day for peninsula tour.Yaseen is an exceptional, passionate, and friendly guide. As he shared, his knowledge about Cape town and history is due to his habit of reading. He also suggeted few books for us to read.Yaseen also made our kids (10 years and 6 years) extremely involved. To keep this long day enjoyable, he asked them question, promising that he would give them a surprise on a correct answer. And he did take our kids to Gem-Stones collectible place. This was not included in the tour itinerary. Kids had a blast ..Even though he was not available, he gave us few tips for next day we could cover on our own.5 Stars are less for acknowledging Yaseen. He made our visit not only memorable but every worth a penny. Angel.

Great Cape Town Experience. Our family enjoyed the time spent with Yaseen, who was very knowledgeable about Cape Town. His quick reply to any of our queries was much appreciated. One can see the passion that he has for what he does. There never was a dull moment. From Cape Town, we went to Kruger Park and the advises he gave us regarding the safari was all worth it. We can't wait to take another safari tour in Kruger with Yaseen!

Awesome is an Understatement. This was my second visit to Cape Town and also the second time when I called up Yaseen and Tanya for a 2 day Tour around with my wife and sister. We were thrilled with the experience of seeing Cape town with Yaseen. His sense of humour added to the enriching 2 days spent there!!He has a tremendous knowledge of things,people, nature and history of capetown.We were very happy and carry along with us fond memories of Cape and will definitely visit again.Cheers!!

Peninsula Tour. Our group of four was picked up right on time by Yaseen and treated to an exceptional day touring the Cape Peninsula. Yaseen greeted us warmly and right away inquired about our time in the area in order to tailor our day to ensure that we got the most out of the area. He couldn't have been more gracious with our questions or more obliging with photo stops. The weather was perfect, and we were able to explore and enjoy more than we had imagined. Spending the day with Yaseen was an excellent way to see the sights and learn about the Cape Peninsula and South Africa's history; we could not have accomplished all this on our own. It was a memorable day. Many, many thanks to Yaseen.

Tour of Cape Peninsula. We toured the Cape Peninsula with Tania and it could not have been a more perfect experience. Her knowledge and obvious enthusiasm for what she was showing us, her quick reaction to tailor the tour exactly to our interests, and her gentle friendliness could not be bettered. She must have taken this tour so many times with strangers yet she made it all so special and fresh for us. We appreciated that there was no taking us to places where she gained a "back-hander" for providing customers. From our initial contact and enquiry there was quick response and efficiency. Certainly "as good as it gets", utterly recommended and anyone who manages to book a tour with Discovery Tours will be lucky indeed.Thank you so much Tania, and good luck for the future.

unbelievable adventure. My friends and I recently came back from Cape Town and we are still mezmorized by its beauty. Our tour guides, Tania and Yaseen were amazing. The knowledge they had about Cape Town and the skill to deliver the historical aspect as well as fun facts of the city made the exploration even more exciting. In very friendly atmosphere in a comfortable vehicle, we enjoyed our discovery of Cape Twon. :) Thank you sooooooooo much Tania and Yaseen for your informative and fun trips!!! :)

As good as it gets. Just got back from the peninsula tour with Tania.Excellent, she took the time to get to know us and tailored the day to suit us. Very friendly without being overtly so, lots of interesting conversation and information on a wide range of topics. Tania also engineered plenty of time for us to be on our own, which we appreciated. This is our first tour in CT so i honestly cannot say discovery tours are the best, however, i can say today was superb and i would happily recommend discovery tours to anybody.

Amazing trip to Cape Town. Just came back from Cape Town!Glad I booked my tours with Tania and Yaseen. Even before I met them, I was really impressed with how quick my emails were answered as I was inquiring about the tours. Once there, we were picked up right on time everyday from the hotel in a real comfortable vehicle and got to see the best of Cape Town and the outskirts. Tania and Yaseen are extremely knowledgeable and friendly pointing out facts and information in every direction. It was great to have these 2 locals that have so much history of the area spending the day with us. Unlike most typical tour groups, we got to see not only the main attractions but also stop by some of Tania and Yaseen’s favorite local spots for picture taking, shopping and eating. Tania and Yaseen were so flexible in showing us around and were very attentive to what we wanted to see within each of our tours. They did not make us feel rushed. It is all about you having fun and exploring this magnificent place. From coastal beaches, spectacular mountain views, local shops, wineries, to interesting wildlife we got to see so much. Tania and Yaseen intentionally keep their tour groups small to provide you with that personalized experience, and you do feel it. I am so happy that I used Discovery Tours on this trip and would highly recommend anyone heading to Cape Town to contact Tania and Yaseen for a trip of a lifetime! Happy Traveling-

Terrific tour. We did a Peninsula tour with Yaseen and couldn't have asked for a better guide. Yaseen was tops in all areas - punctuality, knowledge, friendliness, advice. If he could have arranged better weather, I'm sure he would have! At the end of the day, I felt that we had the best possible introduction to the Peninsula and to the flora and fauna, and, in addition, some added interesting information about Cape Town. I will not hesitate to do another tour with Discovery Tours if I am ever back in Cape Town.

Discovery Tours - wonderful experience. My wife and I had two one day tours with Tania and Yassen and they were the best days of our holiday in Cape Town. They also provided us with faultless airport transfers.Their admin prior to the travel was clear and precise.The trips were fun and informative with two knowledgeable guides and their ability to spot game was simply breathtakingI strongly recommend anyone visiting CT to use Discovery Tours.

A great tour!. We had a wonderful day with Tania exploring the Cape. We saw some wonderful sights and learned much about the indigenous flora and fauna. The tour was friendly, informative and fun! We even spent the evening with Yaseem and Tania that turned out to be quite eventful!

Discovery Tours is THE BEST!. I could write all the same glowing remarks previously made here - but everything everyone says is true. When in Cape Town, use Yaseen. These guys are the best. 'nuff said!

Discovery Tours -- Simply the best!. My wife and I had the pleasure of taking a Capetown city tour on Oct. 7/12 with Tania, and a Cape Peninsula tour on Oct 9/12, with Yaseen. Prior to even meeting them I was impressed with their efficiency in replying to my emails, and offering tour suggestions. Both tours were exceptional. It is obvious that Tania and Yaseen love Capetown and the surrounding area. Their knowledge of the history, culture, horticulture, animals, and geographical features of South Africa, is extensive, and they seemed to really enjoy, and take pride, in sharing their knowledge with us. During our two tours we saw everything we would have seen with organized group tours, but, with Tania and Yaseen’s tours, being more personalized, we saw things and went places we would have missed with the organized tours. Touring with Tania and Yaseen feels like you have an old friend showing you their home town. If you go to Capetown, contact Tania and Yaseen at Discovery Tours. You will not be disappointed.

Made our stay!!. We cannot say enough good about our day with Yaseen of Discovery Tours! We did a day trip to the Cape and wish we had stayed longer so we could have done more trips with him. Within minutes he knew our interests and likes and automatically tailored the day to meet those...he gave us ample time to stop and do interesting things (that you usually just breeze by on a tour) but we never felt rushed. He has a great sense of humor, easy going vibe, and you feel like you've known him a lifetime. He made the day--and the trip to Cape Town--just spectacular. Would recommend a tour with him (or Tania!) hands down.

Outstanding Peninsula Tour. We traveled to Capetown with a large group, and booked this tour very early. Later our tour operator offered the same bus tour for the same price. We decided to keep our private tour and I advise you to do the same.It was exceptional, Tania took us places the buses don't go. We stopped at a small market and gourmet grocery where we picked up sandwiches. The then proceded on to the Cape Peninsula. We stopped a various scenic places and had lunch on the beach. We then continued on to the point and to view the whales. Which we were lucky enough to see.On our return trip, Tania stopped at a roadside market and even did our bidding for us. Those items were cheaper there than anywhere else in Capetown.We will treasure our day with Tania, and I'd advise anyone going to Capetown to contact Yaseen and Tania's private touring Co. for the best tour you will ever take.Thanks very Much for a great day!

An Excellent Tour with the Nicest People!. We recently had the pleasure of going on a private tour of the Cape Peninsula with Discovery Tours. The tour was excellent and exceeded our expectations!From the outset, I received prompt and friendly responses to my e-mails. Our private group had some specific interests (photography, animals, visiting a botanical garden, and seeing the statue of a Great Dane named “Just Nuisance” in Simon’s Town). I shared these with Tania by e-mail, and she made sure our tour would be tailored to our interests.On the morning of our tour, Yaseen met us early at our hotel. As he drove, he shared the history and significance of the places we would visit. We learned about the area’s history, animals, trees, plants, and flowers. Yaseen’s easy-going manner is perfectly suited for giving private tours, and we quickly found ourselves engaged in conversation as among friends.We visited all of the Cape Peninsula’s major sites, as well as some lesser-known locations in search of animals. We were fortunate to see: helmeted Guinea fowl, a rock hyrax, baboons, ostriches, bontebok, southern right whales, and African penguins.Yaseen was very accommodating in adjusting our schedule to match our interests -- even if it was just to please one of us. That is the beauty of being on a private tour with such personalized attention. By the end of our tour, we gained a great appreciation for the beauty of the Cape Peninsula. Our time with Discovery Tours exceeded all of our expectations.

The Best Cape Town has to offer!. I can’t imagine having experienced Cape Town with anyone more knowledgeable, anticipatory or fun than what we experienced with Tania and Yaseen. It is apparent that they have passion for what they do and the people that they guide. Their love for Cape Town and the energy that they exude made the experience one that I will not forget. I know that without Tania and Yaseen we never would have seen all that we wanted to see. They kept us on task when we wandered, awake with their wit when we were jet-lagged and in awe of the next beautiful discovery around the corner. The only negative is now there is a large ocean separating us from our wonderful new friends.

The BEST in Cape Town!. My wife and I recently spent about a week in Cape Town, after a week at Kruger Park. During our time in Capetown we stayed at An African Villa in Tamboerskloof. Proprietors Louis and Jimmy recommended and put us in touch with Tania and Yaseen (Discovery Tours) for a shuttle to and from the airport. In our e-mail correspondence with Tania and Yaseen we learned that they also provided various tours of the surrounding area. We wanted to do a day tour but were initially hesitant. We were worried about price and were not exactly sure what we wanted to see. Tania alleviated our fears when she suggested we combine a couple of different tours so as to see just exactly what we wanted. She was very accommodating and we were given a fair price. We were blown away! We saw the False Bay coastline, the penguins at Boulder’s Beach, took the funicular to the top of Cape Point (VERY windy when we were there), and did the scenic route to Hout Bay. (We actually saw much much more…too much to mention.) The highlight of this portion of our day was the actual Cape of Good Hope and the surrounding Nature Reserve where we saw ostrich and baboons. (Tania shared with us an interesting story of her personal encounter with baboons.) We also toured the winelands where we saw the towns of Franschhoek and Stellenbosch (where we had ice cream.) We eventually ended up at Neethlingshof Estate Winery where we tasted some excellent wines. (Tania’s knowledge of wine is outstanding.) All in all our day with Tania was probably one of the best days of our entire trip. She was so sweet, and so accommodating, and it was a joy to spend our day with her. It didn’t feel as if we were on tour…it felt like we were driving around with a long lost cousin! She was so casual and down to earth and easy to get along with. More than anything this is what made our day so special. We truly feel as though we’ve made friends for life. Throughout our day Tania shared with us stories of Yaseen. We finally had a chance to meet him when he picked us up (EARLY) at our lodging for our ride back to the airport to go home. He was equally as nice as Tania, and we were sad that we didn’t get to spend more time with HIM. We were truly sad to say goodbye to both of our new friends.

WOW! What else needs to be said?. Having just three days & nights to explore Cape Town, my girlfriend and I wanted to see and experience as much as possible. When we contacted Tania and Yaseen or Discovery Tours we expressed our desire and were pleased that they actually listened to what we wanted and set up three full days of adventure. While Tania and Yaseen have templates for tours that they do regularly, they were more than happy to adjust schedules and venues to accommodate our desires and requests. Tania was knowledgeable and fun throughout our day touring the winelands, even going beyond our scheduled amount of time so we could enjoy one last winery. Day 2 was spent touring the Cape Peninsula with Yaseen. Due to our penchant for bending our elbows and chatting with locals, we fell behind "schedule", but Yaseen made sure that we saw everything and the views and scenery along the Cape are not to be missed, nor is the sunset from atop Signal Hill. Day three was again spent with Tania and this time we traveled to Hermanus and were treated to whales jumping and splashing just off-shore as we lunched at a local seaside restaurant built into a cave on the rocky coast. From the time they picked us up at the airport to the moment they dropped us off, Tania and Yaseen were professional, friendly, punctual and most of all, they were fun to spend time with. We hired tour guides and departed with new friends.

Second to none. My wife and I spent two thoroughly enjoyable days in late July with Tania - one day east to Hermanus and the next to the western Cape - and regretted not having spent a third day in Cape Town under her expert guidance. She was punctual, well informed and never at a loss for something of interest to show or tell us, but more than that she was friendly and charming and just great fun to be with. To top it off, we foolishly left some belongings behind in her van which she returned to us (via her husband!) which was probably the last thing they felt like doing at that time. To make that effort for people you may well never see again epitomises the qualities which make her and her husband the sort of people who will deservedly do well in their chosen career, and we would recommend Discovery Tours wholeheartedly to anyone with time in Cape Town.

Would give 6 stars if possible. Our experience with Tania for two days in late August (Winelands and Cape Peninsula) strongly confirms everything said here by others. She is very special and is herself one of the highlights of our Cape Town experience. She exceeded expectations even before we met her by taking time via email to address concerns. She was always "on," went longer and did more, took us off the beaten path --we will never forget sitting in her car while baboons literally crawled all over it and one even perched on the rear windshield wiper. Tania knows her wine, history, socio-economics, fauna and flora, and she is fun. She also offers a competitive private tour rate. We would hire her again in a heartbeat. We didn't meet Yaseen this time but hope to in the future.

Tania best tour guide ever. My husband and I booked a 3 day tour to see as much of cape town as we could. Tania never stopped showing us all the wonders of beautiful Cape town. She has a wonderful ability of finding out your interests and then concentrating on fulfilling your expectations. Everyday was filled with incredible sights. Table Mountain, whales, gardens, from 9:00AM to 7:00PM she keep us active. She was patient, knowledgable, witty and amazing. We fell in love with Cape Town through the eyes of Tania and know she is #1 tour guide in our book. You will see and learn so much from her. Loved every minute we spent together, thanks for the memories Suzanne and Bernie.

Fantastic guide and outstanding tours!. On a recent trip to Cape Town my friends and I arranged to have Discovery Tours transport us to and from the airport as well as take us on 2-Day tours of the area. I am not sure what my expectations were but I do know that they were far exceeded! We didn't just get a "tour guide" we got someone who was extremely knowledgeable about the areas we toured and who really took the time to get to know us and let us get to know him. It was obvious from the start that Yaseen wasn't just "doing his job" he was enjoying his job and wanted to make sure we enjoyed our time with him. Our tour of the Cape Peninsula was fact filled and it was obvious that Yaseen quickly focused in on our interests and made sure to highlight them as we toured. On our Day trip to Hermanus, Yaseen not only found Right Whales for us to view, he got us as close to them as he could, away from the crowds where we were able to watch a mother and calf up close. He gave us a lot of valuable tips for our "day on our own" and the restaurants and activities he suggested really helped to make this a trip of a lifetime! The more time we spent with Yaseen, the more we all found we had in common. It felt more like we were visiting a friend who was showing us around town. I know that if we had just signed up for a typical bus tour of the area, we would not have gotten the quality and depth of the tour we received from Yaseen. If you go to Cape Town, Discovery Tours is a MUST!

Fantastic locations, outstanding guides. We had two unforgettable days in the Cape Town area with Yaseen and Tania. Day one, a Penninsula tour with Yaseen. Good background on the places we were to visit- but space to explore on our own. The itinerary was perfect! We saw the entire Penninsula that day, with our preferences for wild life and natural areas empahsized. The second day, Tania took us on a West Coast tour...she was amazing! A great birder and wildlife spoting guide, whose enthusiam for the beauty that is this area was contagious. Our trip to the West Coast National Park, and "hot spots' for birding will forever be remembered. We highly recommend Yaseen and Tania, and God willing, some day will return to tour with them again.

Outstanding tours and an amazing guide!. Based on reviews on Trip Advisor I booked Discovery Torus for our time in Cape Town. We were not disappointed; in fact, we were delighted, amazed and felt truly blessed for the time we spent with Yaseen. I hired a tour guide and felt we left with a friend of the heart!After two weeks on safari we landed in Cape Town and were met at the airport by Yaseen’s smiling face. He efficiently whisked us thru the crowds and off to our hotel to settle in and rest.Our first day Yaseen took us on a full day tour to the Cape Peninsula. Amazing!!! We stopped at several picturesque little villages and picked up a picnic lunch for later. We visited Boulders beach and saw the penguins and Yaseen dropped us off, told us to walk the board walk and then when everyone was turning around to walk back to their car at the beginning- there was Yaseen waiting to pick us up at the end.We went on to Cape Point National Park and the Cape of Good Hope. Yaseen went out of his way to drive us into some less traveled areas where we were delighted to see blesbok, eland and ostriches.We enjoyed a picnic on the rocks overlooking the ocean and watching the blesbok running in the meadow before us. We then went on to the Cape of Good Hope, which was very special. The scenery for the whole day was spectacula.rOur second day of touring we went to Hermanus to see the right whales. .On the way to Hermanus we stopped at a beautiful botanical gardens and several wineries for tastings. In Hermanus Yaseen spotted the whales and drove us right to a spot where the whales were- just below the cliff where we were standing! Awesome. The return drive had spectacular scenery. I felt like the drive was a cross between the Amalfi Coast and Highway One in California.It was a pleasure spending time with Yaseen. Having your own personal tour guide is such a treat and Yaseen has an excellent knowledge of the area, its history, politics as well as the local flora and fauna. He is patient, kind and has a great sense of humor! He made Cape Town come alive for us and we only wished we were there for a few more days to experience even more of this lovely city and area. . We learned so much and enjoyed so many unique opportunities throughout our stay and felt so comfortable and welcome in the hands of this outstanding, knowledgeable and warm individual. Our only regret was that we didn’t get to meet Tania.Next time!!!!You can’t go wrong with Discovery Tours. I can’t imagine going to Cape Town without contacting and touring with Yaseen and Tania!Barbara BroomellVisions Travel

Two fantastic, memorable days. We had two brilliant days with Tania visiting the wine lands and the cape peninsula. Tania was very friendly and gave explanations of everything we saw.Would highly recommend booking with discovery tours and will be spreading the recommendation back home to friends an family.Thank you for the lovely memories Tania!

Perfect service again. Again, as in 2008, the Tania-Yaseen provided perfect service.  Back in 2008, each of them took my wife and me on separate tours -- airport pickup, Tania driving us on the Cape Peninsula tour and Yaseen driving us to the District Six Museum and a township.  This year I returned with 6 professional colleagues and friends, and booked the Peninsula tour again. Her newly purchased van fit all 7 of us perfectly, and Tania kept up the cheery flow of information and help. We caught a good winter day in between storms. And they have been prompt and efficient. The only pause in our advance email correspondence came for a perfect reason: Enthusiastic previous customers had helped arrange a month-long tour of the US for Tania and Yaseen.

Great guiding in Cape Town. We hired Tania for three of the four days we were in Cape Town. This was based on her excellent ratings on Trip Advisor. The first day we did a trip around the Cape of Good Hope, stopping to see the penguins in Boulder Beach and also at other scenic points along the way. We also had some very specific shopping we wanted to do and Tania was very accommodating in taking us to these particular places. She also helped me deliver some books which I had brought from the U.S. to a charity in Cape Town. She couldn't have been nicer about all our different requests. Another day she took us to Table Mountain, the wine country and to the cheetah experience. Finally, we used her to take us to Kirstenbosch Gardens and to the airport. We could not have been more pleased with her service and also enjoyed her personality. Her family has lived in South Africa for generations and she had lots of knowledge of the country and culture to share with us. She was a delightful person to spend a few days with in Cape Town!

Excellent service. I booked airport transfers with Discovery Tours for my trip to Cape Town at end April/early May. I also booked a Cape Peninsula tour for early May. My decision was based on the ratings received on Trip Advisor and the cost (which my travel agent couldn't match).The airport transfers went without a hitch - they were waiting for me at the airport and turned up on time at the hotel. They also accommodated a stop at the hotel on the final transfer to pick up luggage before taking us to the cruise terminal. I could not have asked for more.The tour was excellent. Because of the time the cruise ship left Cape Town the tour start at 8 am and finished at 3 pm. They had no problems accommodating my requirements and again were punctual. The driver was knowledgeable and answered every question I had; the day was excellent and I would recommend anyone to use this tour company when visiing Cape Town.

Fabulous Cape Tour. My husband and I, along with our friends Greg and Marney, booked a day long tour of the Cape Peninsula with Tania. Her knowledge of the area and the economic/political history was very educational. Since it is a private tour in a small van, we were able to go on roads to see things inaccessible for large tour buses. We could also stop for photo opportunities whenever we wanted. This was the perfect way to see the entire Cape Peninsula with incredible views and stories. We enjoyed our day with Tania so much we invited her to dine with us that evening and felt fortunate that she accepted. Thank you, Tania!

Brilliant day in the winelands. We booked a day in the Winelands with Discovery Tours on the recommendation of the owners of Parker Cottage - and what a great recommendation that was!We spent the day with Yaseen and it was a wonderful day! Yaseen was a wonderful guide - brilliantly informative but never intrusive. We, as others have done, let the itinerary in Yaseen's hands and we enjoyed every minute of our day. Lunch at Delair Graff was magnificent.Not only did we get information about the Winelands but Yaseen gave us tips for our drive up the coast, everyone of which turned out to be something enjoyable or yummy or both!Could not recommend this tour company more thoroughly and it is great to give support to a small local business too.

Excellent tours of the Cape and Winelands. We booked Discovery Tours based on the excellent ratings they received in Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The first day Tania took my wife and I on a tour of the Cape--Boulders Beach to see the penguins, Cape Point National Park and the Cape of Good Hope. She went out of her way to drive us into some less traveled area where we were delighted to see our first antelopes, baboons and ostriches. We then went on to the Cape of Good Hope, which was very special. The scenery for the whole day was spectacular. On the second day Yaseen took us to the winelands. We left the itinerary in his hands and he came through with flying colors. We visited several wineries, ranging from a very small, intimate one to larger, more modern ones. Tania made lunch reservations at the Delaire winery. We had a table with a perfect view and the lunch was absolutely delicious. Yaseen left us to enjoy our lunch and then came back to collect us when we were done. We visited the town of Franchoek, and thoroughly enjoyed that. Yaseen and Tania were so friendly, knowledgeable and easy to talk to (especially for a whole day). We couldn't have made a better choice.

Cape Peninsular Tour. We arranged for Discovery Tours to collect us from a cruise ship, with our luggage at 9:30 am for a full-day tour and a drop-off at the airport.Yaseen arrived at the arranged time and off we went for a day to remember. The mini bus was comfortable and air-conditioned and after many cruise ship tours at different ports, it was really pleasant to have the vehicle to ourselves and not have to share with up to 50 other passengers. The other big bonus was that we had our own personal guide with an excellent knowledge of the area as well as the local flora and fauna. Yaseen took us to all the places of interest and went off the main tourist routes at times to show us some of the beautiful, almost deserted bays. He also went to the trouble of taking photos of us at various points such as the Cape of Good Hope. Our full-day tour was thoroughly enjoyable and literally flew by.I would recommend Discovery Tours to anyone and will definitely use them again when we return to Cape Town.

All you need to organize your Cape Town travels. Tania and Yaseen are first-class tour operators and they will provide you with excellent service. From the airport pick-up to drop-off to any tour of the Cape area they have it covered. Tania took our family down to the Cape of Good Hope and shared so much of this beautiful part of the country with us. We really felt like good friends at the end of the day. There is no comparison to traveling in a large bus with many tourists vs riding in private comfort with Discovery Tours and seeing the sights like a local. No need to look any further!

Discovery Tours is the best in Cape Town!!. Yaseen and Tania were great... their enthusiasm for Cape Town is very evident!! They are very professional yet friendly. They were very knowledgeable about Cape Town and South Africa. Yaseen really made me feel comfortable and safe in such a big city. I was able to see many wonderful attractions-- truly a one-in-a lifetime experience. I would highly recommend Discovery Tours to everyone who visits Cape Town, South Africa. I've never had such an awesome experience in my life!!! --STAR**, RN, BSN, MS(c)

Discovery Tours will make your visit unforgettable if traveling to CapeTown.. I was fortunate to go to CapeTown for a business trip with time for touring the area and FUN ! What a beautiful country but history that takes your breath away and how fortunate I feel to have been able to visit South Africa. If you travel to CapeTown - you really should not think twice about booking with Discovery Tours. You can't find a better resource and they REALLY will make your time in South Africa a trip of a lifetime.Our group was so fortunate that we had the guidance and expertise of Yaseen and Tania from Discovery Tours. Not only did they take us to such beautiful places as we toured the Cape,and throughout the city, but they are so willing to share about their country BUT make you feel like family. Yaseen and Tania were so attentive to our questions and from the pickup at the airport until 2 weeks later when we left, they were WONDERFUL. It was such a gift to learn about plants, animals, the best places to eat and shop and how the history of Cape Town is intertwined with the geography and settlement from experts who judged their day based on if we had an awesome one. Yaseen and Tania made my trip to South Africa a GREAT ADVENTURE. I am hoping to return as there is so much more to see and learn and my first contact will be to Discovery Tours. Thanks Yaseen and Tania - -It has been a week since I came home and all the memories still have me grinning :-)

There is a reason Discovery Tours has a 5-star rating on TripAdvisor!. We did a full-day trip with Discovery Tours down to the Cape of Good Hope with several stops along the way: penguin colony, botanical garden, cape point, lighthouse, etc... It was a private tour for us and our three boys (ages 7, 9, and 14) in a comfortable mini-van. I think it is important to note that Discovery Tours is not some huge travel company who books a zillion tours and assigns some random driver to take you around. This is a smaller company with an incredible focus on customer satisfaction. Our guide, Tania, was fantastic. She was warm, friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive to our every need. Pricing was much more reasonable than I expected for a private tour, and we got to pick our own itinerary! Why bother renting an expensive car and frustrating yourself with maps, directions, and driving on the wrong side of the street??? Just book a tour with Discovery Tours and let them handle it. All you have to do is sit back and enjoy the scenery as you drive through some of the most beautiful country in the world. Thanks, Tania!

I can't imagine a better experience in a new country.. The tour guides in this group are so helpful and smart. They can answer any question you might have about South Africa, and are so eager to help you learn about the country. During the tours we went to the most beautiful places that I know I wouldn't have been able to see without the tour guides. I can't say enough how much I enjoyed Discovery Tours and their hospitality. This is a tour group I will definitiely use in my future visits!

Outstanding Experiences. After previous experiences with Discovery Tours, there was no question they would be the first choice for our most recent trip to Cape Town. Once again, Discovery Tours provided excellent, individualized, and memorable experiences for our entire group. We learned and enjoyed so many unique opportunities throughout the Western Cape of South Africa. Discovery Tours made our visit completely positive and easy with their professional and hospitable approach.We look forward to our next visit with them. Discovery Tours is superb!

Extremely competent and passionate people that will help you leave a piece of your heart in South Africa.. I traveled with a group of student nurses, RNs, and a Dr. from The Pennsylvania State University. We had the pleasure of working with Tania and Yaseen for two event filled weeks. Tania and Yaseen made sure to efficiently use every moment of our stay in South Africa. This husband and wife duo is so well versed in knowledge related to the environment and the local wildlife that every time you go for a drive or a sightseeing adventure you will feel like you are on a safari. Tania and Yaseen are very open to answering questions you may have about local history, news, or cultural practices. My group learned so much just from asking questions. Yaseen, as an avid reader and local of South Africa, has a special grasp on topics related to South Africa. Often the town and street names have a fascinating story behind its naming. One of my favorite days with Yaseen was when he took the group to the Cape of Good Hope. Yaseen drove us through a reserve on a path that usually only the locals utilize. We had lunch on the rocks as we watched a group of ostriches and bontebok in the distance. On our way out of the reserve a group of baboons passed in front of the vehicle. The mothers were carrying the babies on their backs and a few of the bigger baboons sat in the middle of the road eating protea. A few miles up the road a group of ostriches passed by our vehicle. I was inches away from an ostrich and able to see its beautiful big eyes. Tania and Yaseen always made me feel safe and comfortable while being so many miles away from home. Truly my time in South Africa would not have been the same without meeting these two passionate and extremely competent individuals. Baie dankie, Tania and Yaseen. Totsiens for now :)!

Wine tasting in Capetown - just fantastic. We booked a day with Discovery Tours to take us into the winelands just outside Capetown. It was a birthday trip for me so we wanted to make it special. Tania (one of the co-owners of the company) was really first class. She took us to a few smaller vineyards that we would have missed and then was happy to take us to the ones I had earmarked. A private car and driver may cost a bit more but well worth it. You can see a lot more, drink a lot more wine and totally relax. Tania was also easy to be with and did not mind taking photographs of my husband and I at just about every stop. The wine here is just amazing, don't miss the champagne house just outside of Franshoek and the Delaire Graff estate- just for the interior decor, this wasn't actually the nicest wine we tasted but did have the wow factor. Tania got us back safely, if slightly tipsy, and I can highly recommend Discovery Tours.

A perfect introduction to the Cape Area. We had a two day tour, first day with Tania, covering the winelands. The second day withYaseen, taking us around the cape. Tania was very relaxing and good company and tookus to some diverse and beautiful areas with their wineries. A truly memorable day. Yaseen was very informative and interesting, ranging from history to the bird life, and wasvery accommodating in taking us just where we wanted to go. He was very good at takingus off the beaten track to see wildlife and the most remote beaches etc. A lovely holidayexperience with two very enthusiastic, knowledgeable and friendly guides.

Exceptional tours from exceptional people. My wife and I have just spent three wonderful days with Yaseen and Tania touring the Cape Peninusula,the Hermanus region and then the Winelands. What a great decision we made to book with Discovery Tours. Lovely people, attentive personal service, knowledgeable about hisotry,geography, culture, wildlife and good company throughout each day. They formally and then subtly tailored each day to suit our interests so that the many hours in their company simply flew by. We feel that we had insights into quiet places, off the beaten track to put alongside places that are instantly recognisable. We're already planning our next visit to this region and furhter north but will definitely start by contacting Tania and Yaseen. They made our stay in Cape Town memorable and thoroughly enjoyable. Book them now, for your trip, if you can!!

Out of this world. My wife and I would like to highly recommend Discovery Tours to anyone who wants to see CapeTown up close and personal. Notwithstanding there are many tour operators to choose from, having Tania with us was simply amazing. No rushes, always asking us what we would like to do and accomplish for the day, going out of her way to make things happen for us. It is always important for us to have a guide we are comfortable with, and Tania clearly fits the bill. Her husband and partner Yaseen would be as good, and we dare say that even though we have not met him personally. He had helped us a lot when we met with a minor theft on our first day at SA. Thanks Tania! We will always remember CapeTown because you made it happen for us, especially horse-riding along Noordherk Beach and the African Villa.So, never leave CapeTown without going with Discovery Tours. It will be an experience you'll never forget, and you will make new friends.

A perfect day in Winelands. From the first contact via internet, we had a good feeling about Tania and Yasseen. They were able to answer all the questions we had before reservations are made. We booked a transfer from the airport to our hotel and wanted to do a tour with them, after reading so many good reviews about them and looking into their website. At first they were already booked for the whole week that we would be spending in Cape town, but after a cancellation we could finally do a tour with them.  It was just perfect and relaxing. We made the tour with Yasseen, who is very nice and very out going. He had an excellent feeling about our taste and therefore he could suit the tour to it. We visited 4 wineries in Franschoek and Stellenbosh, and the towns too. We had lunch in one of them with a beatiful view and ended the tour visiting the oldest winery in Stellenbosch.

Amazing tours & wonderful people. My husband and I joined the Cape Peninsula tour with Tania and the Hermanus tour with Yaseen during our stay in Cape Town. They are some wonderful people you know you would never forget and would like to stay in touch with even after tours. They customized the tours for us and brought us to places other tours would not bring you to. They told us history of the region and everything about the animals, vegetation and lives in Cape Town. They were very attentive and always made sure we were having a good time and were in no rush. They also had very good eyes and looked out for the baboons, ostriches, antelopes and the blue cranes for us. We didn't feel like we were on a tour but more like we were hanging out with our friend. Even though it was not the season to see whales in Hermanus, we were surely not disappointed with the tour arranged by Yaseen. Also thanks to Tania for spotting the whales on our way back from Cape Point. All in all, if you want to avoid those tourisy and "organized" tours and would like to meet some wonderful people in Cape Town, go with Discovery Tours.Thanks again Tania & Yaseen!

The best decision we made on our trip to South Africa was to book with Discovery Tours. The time we spent with Discovery Tours was the highlight of our time in Cape Town. Yaseen and Tania are not only excellent tour guides but wonderful people. Our experience was more akin to spending time with old friends than with tour operators. My family and I took a trip around the Cape Peninsula with Yaseen and then a Winelands tour with Tania. Both Yaseen and Tania were very knowledgeable, informative and obviously love their native land. They were also very accommodating and catered each tour perfectly to our needs and desires, including heading off the beaten track to look for wildlife (we actually spotted an illusive Cape Mountain Zebra). We could not have asked for better guides.

Best tour ever!. Just returned from the Winelands with Yaseen with Discovery Tours, and it was so amazing I had to log into this site to recommend this tour company. I have traveled to many places and have been on many tours, but this was an exceptional company to do business with. He personalized the trip to our personalities and you can tell that he loves South Africa so much. It so exceeded our expectations, and they do tours outside of South Africa as well. When I return to Africa, I will most definitely book with Yaseen and Tanya again... I feel like I not only had a tour, but made a friend as well.

Very flexible tour operator - great private tour. We chose the full day Winelands tour with Discovery. We were actually staying in Fish Hoek - which is a suburb of Cape Town not serviced by many tour operators as it is a half hour outside the tourist areas of Cape Town. Discovery was the only tour operator willing to pick us up in Fish Hoek for a nominal additional charge. They are very flexible and asked us when we booked what types of wines we prefer and just some basic information about my husband and I so that they could tailor the tour to us. We indicated that we would like a nice lunch with a fantastic view along with some interesting wine tastings.Our tour guide was Yaseen - the husband of a husband and wife owned and operated tour company. The day we went I woke up not feeling so hot and Yaseen changed around our day a bit so that we weren't doing a lot of wine tasting in the morning before the wonderful lunch location that they picked out for us. He also gave us time to walk around Franshoek and Stellenbosch which was nice as we still had some gifts to buy and were at the end of our trip.We went to a tasting at a winery that was 600 years old, another that had the most awesome chocolate and wine pairing, then a fantastic lunch at a very chi chi place with an incredible view, from there we went to winery sitting by itself in a beautiful valley and ended with a tour at a winery that gives all profits to its workers in order to house and educate them. Quite a day!I would highly recommend this tour. Yaseen was extremely interesting to talk to in between the wine tastings. He knows a lot about the history of South Africa as well as what is currently happening in his country. During the tastings though he leaves you to just enjoy the scenery and wonderful wines.

Fabulous, attentive, personalised tours that couldn't possibly be surpassed!. Whilst still in England we booked a Cape Point tour and right from the first e mails got a good feeling that Yaseen & Tania would turn out to be the right company for us. Wow, so happy that a internet search gave us Yaseen. He is awesome; passionate about the history of CapeTown and so knowledgeable without being stuffy, making everything so interesting. Our very full day to Cape Point included lots of stops and was personalised to what would interest us, nothing was too much trouble. We were so impressed that we booked another outing to Hermanus a couple of days later, which was equally as fantastic. Yaseen rocks, don't even think about booking with anyone else.

Great peninsula tour. We had an amazing day and tour with tania. We were lucky enough to see seals, a whale with her baby, penguins and more on our day. great highlights tour and some of our favorite parts were the deviations from the norm. We got a little shopping in too which was great.

A wonderful day to Cape Point. We had a wonderful day with Tania who was lovely, informative and made us feel that by the end of the day we'd spent the day with a friend! Thanks Tania for a great day - I think it was our favourite day in Cape Town! Charlotte and Jack

Don't waste time shopping around; book with Discovery now!. We've recently returned from our first trip to Cape Town, during which we spent two wonderful days with Tania: the first to the Winelands and the second to the Cape Peninsula. The service provided was more personal than you could possibly expect; nothing was too much trouble for Tania. She suggested swapping our trips round due to poor weather on our first day (which was a great idea!), and consequently amended all our arrangements for lunch without us even asking. We did not feel rushed at any time, and really didn't want either trip to end! In fact the trip to the Peninsula did end much later than planned as we had an unexpected stop to watch seals surfing on the waves (copy of picture attached). Tania was as excited as us to witness this, and delighted to allow time for photos to be taken.Tania is passionate and knowledgable about her homeland, and great company for a day out - what more could you ask for??

Fantastic. We visited Cape Town in November 2010 for 5 days. We booked two personal tours with Discovery tours Cape Town which is owned by Yasin and Tania. One is Cape Peninsula and other is Hermanus. Each of the tour is of one full day. Yasin picked us from hotel early morning each day and dropped around sunset. He has excellent knowledge about history and area. These two tours are must do for anyone visiting Cape Town. It covers but not limited to all beautiful beaches around Cape Town, Penguins colony and watching whales at Hermanus. I strongly recommend personal tours with Yasin/Tania as they make the trip real memorable and one get the best value ones money.

We’d give them 200 stars if we could….. We’d give them 200 stars if we could….We seriously doubt you would get a better guided tour of Cape Town or for that matter better guides than Tania and Yaseen, period. They are warm, friendly and personal – they had wonderful stories to share about the city and its surroundings. We’ve traveled to many countries and been on so many tours but never been on ones that were this exciting. To the extent, we signed up for 3 tours but enjoyed their company so much that we ended up doing a 4th one with them. We hardly, if not ever, write much about our travels, but we could not resist writing about them….In terms of tours, we loved them all. The wine tour was exceptional and we couldn’t have asked for more. Tania was so accommodating - since my wife is not too fond of wine, she went the extra mile and took us to a nearby lion park and showed us more of the scenery around. We loved the city tour as well – I think Yaseen effectively ensured we didn’t forget the history of Cape Town. And I cant think of any other place we know our history so well!Cape Peninsula was undoubtedly breathtaking (and their best tour yet) and Yaseen made it extra special by taking us to the best spots where there would be no other tourists but you. The West Coast tour would have been the next – the park is truly wild and untouched and we were blown away by stretches of colorful flowers. And we did get the perfect postcard picture of Table Mountain in the background on our way back. It was the tour we signed up for after we finished 3 tours and it was the perfect ending to our trip – it was also unique in a way that we got to travel with both Tania and Yaseen together – which was loads of fun. If you’re wondering whether you should save the 100-150 Rand / person and go on a group tour, I’d say think again because there are probably very few places in the world you’d get this kind of value and personal touch! We left Cape Town with such beautiful memories and even shed a tear when we bid them good bye from the airport…..

What a great discovery. We have just returned from a fantastic holiday in Cape Town. Having read about Discovery Tours on Trip Advisor we contacted Tania and Yaseen by email a few weeks before leaving for Cape Town and asked them to put together a three day tour programme for us. They answered almost immediately and gave us lots of advice about the city and about trips they would recommend.They were totally flexible and took all our suggestions on board so we ended up with an itinerary tailored to our needs.The full day tours to the Cape and to the Winelands were superb. We were collected at our hotel right on time each day by Tania and her knowledge of South Africa and her sense of humour really added to our enjoyment.The fact that we were the only clients and had the full attention of such an expert Guide gave us great flexibility each day but Tania also made sure we saw all the key sights, even tracking down a wide variety of wildlife along the way.It was great to deal with a small team who are so committed to a high quality touring experience and so passionate about what South Africa has to offer visitors.

A Great Day. We spent the day with Yaseen on the Cape Tour....as noted by many it's an excellent way to see the cape. He takes you of the beaten path. you stretch your legs but getting out of the car frequently and he's very informative & funny. It's clear he loves what he does and where he lives. Also, he was correct - our first safari won't be our last!

Unbeatable tour experience, best ever. My girlfriend and I undertook a tour of the Cape and Peninsular tour with Yaseen from discovery tours, and it was an unforgettable experience. Yaseen is a wonderful tour guide. Knowledgeable, professional, friendly and likable. He tailored the tour exactly to suit our particular needs, and did a great job of taking us off the beaten track to see some of the more rare and unusual sights. Moreover, he took the time to plan the entire rest of our trip, personally writing out an itinerary spanning 5 days and the entire garden route. We followed his recommendations to the letter, and had the vacation of a lifetime.If you tour with Yaseen you are guaranteed a wonderful time, and within about an hour you will feel as if you are traveling with a very well informed old friend. I have been lucky enough to travel all over the world, and tour with a host of different operators. Yaseen and Discovery are head and shoulders above the rest.

Yaseen is the man in cape town. this is the second time we have hired Yaseen (Discovery Tours) to take us and friends on the cape peninsula tour. He is a friendly, knowledgable guide with a great sense of humour, nothing is too much trouble and he is worth every rand!!Ron A PlattDevon England

An Amazing Tour with an Amazing Guide. We spent a wonderful day with Yaseen. He was very friendly and knowledgeable (with a very dry sense of humour). He took us to see the whales off Hermanus Bay, and the penguin colony. Nothing was too much trouble. We were taken off the beaten track to see things that we would never have seen had we tried to tour round on our own (inclusing wild tortoise, a puff adder and baboons). We stopped at the Henry Porter Gardens and were treated to a cup of tea at the garden centre on the way back to Cape Town. What a fabulous day - we won't forget it and hope to return soon.

Outstanding Tour Guide. Discovery tours is owned and operated by a wonderful couple Yaseen and Tania.Yaseen was our private guide for 3 days. I have been traveling for the past 40 yrs and this is the first time I can say as far as day tours are concerned we found a winner in Discovery Tours. Yaseen is knowledgeable, kind , caring and friendly. He gave us free time to wander around by ourselves. He also took us to places off the beaten track. Prior to selecting a guide he sent us many emails with great suggestions on our trip to South Africa. I have no doubt im my mind that Discovery Tours is the way to go.Bertie TragerNew York

Completely surpassed our expectations!. We booked two tours with Discovery: the Peninsula and Constantia. Both were simply fabulous! My girlfriend and I had the time of our lives with Tania. She definitely knows her business! In fact, she has become a friend of ours now.

Four days with Tania and we felt like family. Not wanting to drive on the left and disliking bus tours, my husband and I booked four day tours with Tania, She helped us schedule our 10 days in the Cape Town area, being sure we had plenty of time to relax in between tours. First we did the Cape Peninsula, and Tania's delight in seeing the animals was equal to ours for the first time. Later in the week she drove us to Franschhoek, stopping at wineries along the way for tastings, and leaving us at the Plumwood Inn, one of her wonderful recommendations. A couple of days later she picked us up and took us to Hermanus, whale watching along the way. Upon our return to Cape Town, she drove us to the Western Cape to see the wildflowers, a glorious sight. We never felt rushed or as if we had missed anything. Knowledgeable, warm and friendly, we were sorry to see her go on the last day!

We didn't want the tour to end!. I can' imagine visiting Capetown without seeing this beautiful city and area through the eyes and hearts of Tania and Yaseen. Yaseen did our transfers and made everything so easy. And then we had the tremendous pleasure of spending the day with Tania to see the Cape Peninsula. What fun - it was just like touring with your best friend, and we could never have seen and learned so much without her. Don't hesitate - book these guys - and do it early!We miss you Tania and hope you will come see us next year in Seattle!

We had a wonderful day with Discovery Tours!. We booked the Peninsula tour from Discovery Tours based on their high ratings on Trip Advisor but also because of Tania's prompt and friendly replies to our emails. We had a list of places we wanted to see and Tania made sure we saw them all and much more. She was very kind and flexible and she took us to places where we could see as much of the wildlife as possible and shared her knowledge about South African nature and lifestyle. We had such a wonderful day with Tania and we would book her again anytime. Thank you Tania for making our visit to Cape Town so lovely and giving us a lot of wonderful memories!

Absolutely wonderful tour! I can't recommend Tania and Yaseen enough!. I was hesitant to book a tour and thought maybe I should save a little money and just do the self-guided bus tour or forgo Cape Point and Stellenbosch. I am so glad I didn't. My husband and I took a day tour to the Cape Peninsula and a day tour of Stellenbosch. Tania and Yaseen were so flexible in working with us when our flight was delayed and we had to reschedule a tour and airport pickup. The other reviews are spot on when they say it's like having a great friend show you around. Book with Discovery Tours, you won't regret it. They're punctual, professional, flexible, and will answer your endless emails and questions to plan the perfect day for you.

Awesome !. We arrived in Cape Town and stayed 5 nights in City Bowl Area at An African Villa. We wanted a tour of the Cape of Good Hope and Winelands but did not want the tour bus type excursion. They suggested Discovery Tours run by Husband and Wife duo Yaseen and Tania.Our first private tour with Yaseen was for the sites around Cape Town then the drive up to Cape of Good Hope with several stops between. Having Yaseen as our guide proved very valuable. He introduced us to many different areas that we would have driven by in a tour bus or not known about if driving on our own. The highlight during our tour was spotting 4 Cape Point Zebra in the Cape of Good Hope National park. These species of Zebra are very hard to spot and rarely seen from the road so we had a nice bit of luck. We also saw Bontebok, Baboon, and Ostrich while making our way around this beautiful landscape. Yaseen also arranged a stop into Ocean View Township so we could distribute sporting equipment and clothing to this poor community. They were displaced from their homeland during Apartheid but never given their land back once Apartheid ended.The following day we visited the Winelands with Tania from Discovery Tours. She is a wine aficionado so she was able to guide us to 5 boutique wineries in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek regions for some tastings and a nice lunch.
