Stunning views of the mountains and ocean from this area left us gazing at the beauty of this place all the while sipping nice wines.After each personal tour, we felt like we had been old friends with Yaseen and Tania. They are very knowledgable and friendly and we would recommend a private tour with them when visiting Cape Town.

Terrific Guide!. Tania provided two tours for our family of four when we visited Cape Town in August 2011 -- a one-day tour to Cape Point and a one-day tour of the wine region. She did a great job, tailoring the itinerary to our family's interests, showing us all the neat little spots she knew about on both routes, and providing lots of information and insights during our tours. Our day driving to Cape Point, seeing penguins, baboons, ostriches and absolutely spectatular scenery was one of the high points of our trip. We particularly appreciated her flexibility when we toured the wine region. She really worked hard to balance the interests of our teens, who were not at all interested in wineries and the adults, who were very definitely interested in wine-tasting! She adjusted her tour times in order to drop us off at the airport (with all our luggage) in time to catch our flight home. After two days of spending time with Tania, we all hugged goodbye and felt we had been warmly welcomed by her to this beautiful city and region. I would highly recommend Tania and Discovery Tours.

Discovery Tours the best to visit The Winelands. We spent a day travelling with Yaseen to The Winelands. He was great company, knowledgeable and seemed to cut off problems even before they occured. He has an easy going nature and made us both feel at ease with his commentary on the local history, recommendations for dinner and places to see.He asked if there were any special wineries we wanted to visit and arranged appointments for these as well as taking us to a couple of others that were different and all first class. He had made reservations for lunch for us at Delhein which was superb overlooking beautiful gardens.We highly recommend this company.

We couldn't have asked for better!. We booked Discovery Tours, in advance of our visit to Cape Town, for a tours to Cape Point and Hermanus. It was the best decision. The communications in preparation were helpful and informative. We also organised a transfer to our hotel. It's reassuring to know you are being met and taken directly to where you need to go.We couldn't have asked fro more from Tania on our tours. She was a delight to be with. Lots of enthusiasm and information about the areas we visited, Cape Town and South Africa, in general.We have lots of happy memories and photos of our two days out.Would recommend very highly

Best Tour Company in Cape Town!. My family and I spent the day with Yaseen, who took us on a tour of the Cape Winelands. He was very punctual, arriving to pick us up 30 minutes early. The tour vehicle is large and comfortable. Yaseen is VERY personable and VERY knowledgable. Though we were touring the winelands, he gave us so much information on the history of the entire Cape area and answered all of our questions. He took us to three very different wineries, all of which were spectacular. He was very attentive and got along great with our teenaged children as well. We had the pleasure of meeting Tania, also, who was touring with another group in some of the same areas we were touring. She is fabulous as well. We will recommend Discovery Tours to everyone we know. We plan on returning to South Africa one day, and will definitely be using Discovery Tours for all of our tours. We cannot say enough about their professionalism, knowledge, and kindness. Thank you, Yaseen!!!

A Wonderful Time at the winelands ". We just spend two weeks in south Africa and one of the best days was the tour we took with Yassin to the winelands . We had such a wonderful time with him because he has a great sense of humour , a very wide knowledge about the country and his love for what he does . We would have loved to take other tours with them but unfortunately they were booked all week . We loved Yassin and im sure we would have loved Tania (we heard a lot about her from yassin) hopefully our next visit to SA we will get to see more of them !  i would definitely recommend them to anyone who wants to spend a great time !

Wineland tour. We took a day trip with Tania through the magnificent Winelands visiting three wineries with the added bonuses of lion & cheetah sanctuaries. Tania is a very personable lady with a sound knowledge of the history & wild life within the Winelands. She has a passion for Africa that is contagious & we greatly enjoyed her company.

Wonderful tours - absolutely recommended. Discovery Tours organised two tours for my husband and I - day trips to Hermanus and to the Cape Winelands. Both were terrific, not only the great scenery and experiences (tasting South African wines!) but especially because of our guide, Tania. Her knowledge of her country is extensive and she was unfailingly courteous and eager for us to enjoy our tours. Importantly, she was happy to tailor the trips to suit us and our interests so we would gain maximum enjoyment - this was much appreciated. Also impressive was her careful,considerate driving. We highly recommend Discovery Tours, and Tania, to all travellers!Marie Aberle, Melbourne, Australia

Excellent Tour Operator. My family had the pleasure of having Yaseen from Discovery Tours take us around Cape Town for a day. The tour was a fantastic way of seeing the best of Cape Town. The Penisula Tour included sites such as Cape of Good Hope, Simon Town, quaint little fishing villages, beautiful beaches with the highlight being a drive along Chapmans Peak.Yaseen our guide and owner of Dscovery Tours was great, very personable, great with the kids, very knowledgable about Cape Town...make sure you ask him about how Cape Town was named??I would thoroughly recommend anyone going to Cape town to contact Discovery Tours.

Good tours. We spent 2 days touring with Tania doing the wine tour and the cape peninsula tours. She is very outgoing and friendly, and she is very knowledgeable about her country. We enjoyed both tours. In order to stay fresh, her approach is to take you along as if you were friends, and she sometimes stops as the mood strikes her to show you the sights. Generally this works well, but sometimes the stops seemed to be more for her enjoyment than focusing on what we wanted to see, so I suggest that you make it clear what you want to see. Nevertheless, we had fun and learned a lot, so I do recommend Discovery Tours.

The Best on The Cape. Tania and Yaseen are really the best guides one can have for Cape Town. Tania managed to plan a personalized itinerary to fit ALL the sites into our few short days there. Yaseen, you were fabulous! Your great sense of humour combined with a wealth of local knowledge made our tour truly unforgetable. A BIG thank you albeit belatedJulie and John

Informative, friendly, personalized tour of South Africa's wine country. We heard of Discovery Tours through a friend, so my in-laws and I decided to book a day-long tour of the wine country in South Africa. Our guide and co-owner of the company, Tania, picked us up right from our apartment in Cape Town, which was very convenient. Tania chatted with us as we drove out of the city, and once she got a sense of what we were looking to see and do, she chose which towns and wineries to take us to. Tania told us a lot about the history and geography of the areas we drove through, as well as the history of each winery. She was very knowledgeable, very easy to talk to and personable. It felt like spending the day with a lovely friend! We saw a variety of different types of wineries, had some time for souvenir shopping, and had three different wine tastings. Tania did not rush us in any way; she wanted to ensure that we got the most out of our experience. She is a very kind person, a knowledgeable tour guide, and a trustworthy driver. We hope that she and her husband will look us up if ever they pay a visit to the West Coast of Canada!

Friendly and Knowledgable ...Wonderful Experience. We were given a recommendation by friends to use Discovery Tours during our visit to Capetown. We easily made arrangements weeks in advance and when the time finally came for our visit Tania was on our doorstep exactly when she said she would be there. We took the all day Cape Peninsula tour and found her to be not only knowledgable but a wonderfully pleasant and friendly person. It was like visiting a friend and asking them to take you on a personalized tour of their city. We spent the day together and had a wonderful experience. We not only saw the sites but also had animal sightings we didn't expect. Tania knows a lot about just about any subject or animal you see. Bottom line if you find yourself in Capetown seek them out and USE THEM.

Once you have found Discovery Tours look no further.. We pre-booked Discovery Tours for a private tour of the Cape Peninsular about two months ago, in anticipation of disembarking a cruise ship for a 5 day stay in Cape Town. We selected the company based solely upon the glowing reviews shown on this web site. Having obviously had no communication with Tania for several weeks, we wondered whether plans would go wrong, but Tania picked us up promptly at the pre-arranged time at our hotel door. We then enjoyed a thoroughly pleasant day and, in the interests of brevity, we can only say that the whole experience lived up to our high expectations. We endorse all of the tributes and compliments already recorded on this website. It is virtually impossible to find any aspect of the tour that could have been improved upon, but if we had to find something, it would be the fact that Tania timed our arrival at Cape Point to coincide with the funicular to the lighthouse temporarily breaking down!!! Nevertheless the walk to the top did us good after 5 weeks on board ship. Thankyou Tania for a wonderful day.Harry and Diana

Discovery Tours: Simply Perfect!. Me, Donatella and Veronica have really to say thank you thank you and thank you to Tania and Yaseen. We decided book our Wineland and Cape Penisula tours with them and this has been our best choice! Tania suggested us how to change our plans according to the weather conditions so we could spent 2 beautifull and unforgettable perfect days. Especially for the Peninsula Tour when we left Cape Town the weather was really bad, Tania took time, showing us other places, waiting for the sun and finally we could have a beautifull sunny day so we could finish all the tour. Tania gave us always all the time we wantend to finish our visits, to take all the photos we wanted etc etc We liked very much her flexibility! I recommend Discovery Tours for any tour in Cape Town and think they are really the Best! Ciao Tania and Yaseen, Grazie!

amazing tour guides!. Yaseen was such an amazing tour guide! He took us to all the great spots, and was so knowledgeable. He was also very reliable and timely. I would recommend Discovery Tours to anyone traveling to Cape Town!
Perfect!. Thank you again Tania and Yaseen for wonderful days in CapeTown.You find every time some new places to show us in your beautiful country.Hope to see you next time we come there.
Simply Amazing. Going to Cape Town was probably one of the best experiences of my life and Yaseen definitely has a lot to do with that. Thank you so much, Yaseen and Tania!

Outstanding Experience. In Cape Town you must use Discovery Tours if doing a Cape Point Tour.....Tanya is Fantastic and very accomodating! We had booked a wine tour but had to cancel due to our travel plans. We had a great day and saw many of the sites -- Tanya made sure we were able to see all the wildlife and points of interest. The baboons, penguins and beaches made for a fun day -- we were taken to places that the large tour groups do not go.I will book any future trips through Discovery Tours -- the personal touch added greatly to our experience. We had a blast and it made our South Africa trip that much more enjoyable. A First Class experience. We felt like part of the family!

Absolutely the best - they arrange memories of a lifetime. Discovery Tours is without a doubt the best choice is Cape Town. Yaseen and Tania are very knowledgeable and personable. They are experts at planning and arranging the best experiences and they customize experiences based on visitors' interests and schedules. I would not consider returning to Cape Town without Discovery Tours. If you are planning a trip to Cape Town, you will be in the best hands with Dsicovery Tours.

"A wonderful experience". After much research I booked Discovery Tours for 3 days while my daughter and I were visting Cape Town. I have to say it was the best choice I could have ever made. Yaseen & Tania not only were flexible and accomodating to what we wanted to see and do, but they are also some of the nicest most enjoyable people we have ever meet. We spent two days with Yaseen seeing the sites from Cape Town to Cape Point, the Winelands, and all the wonderful sights in between. He made the tours so much fun and enjoyable and his knowledge of everything we saw and everywhere we went was great. The day we spent with Tania on the Cape Town city tour & shopping was wonderful. She was fun, knowledgable and knew the best places to shop for what we wanted to buy. We also used them for our transfer to the airport. When they dropped us off at the airport it was like saying good-bye to old friends not our tour guides. I would highly recommend booking Discovery Tours if you are wanting to experience and see the best of South Africa and also because Yaseen and Tania are the best, at least in our eyes.

Simply Amazing. We used Discovery Tours in 2009 for airport transportation. We were impressed with their efficiency. In December 2010 we decided to use them again for airport transportation plus several day tours. When we were delayed on our arrival (snowbound in Frankfurt) they quickly adjusted to our new arrival schedule and cancellation of one of our tours.Tania escorted us for the remainder of our tours. She was so informative, willing to adjust to several of our personal requests and was really delightful in every way. We saw so much in the shortened time we had in Cape Town. Absolutely the best tour guide ever. If you choose Discovery Tours...you won't be disappointed...you will simply be amazed!

Discovery Tours made our trip. They are AMAZING!. I researched group/private tour options for months before choosing Discovery Tours based off of their high ratings on Trip Advisor. My husband and I can say with absolute confidence that our experiences with Yaseen and Tania made our trip! Leading up to our departure, they helped us to customize our trip, which included tours of Cape Town, the Cape Peninsula, and wine country, and recommended an excellent and affordable B&B (Parker Cottage) that we LOVED. They also provided recommendations for things to do on our own while we weren't touring with them. I was nervous about traveling so far from home and from the moment we met them, they made us feel like we were visiting with old friends. Every tour was tailored to our interests and Yaseen made it a point to take us off the beaten path and experience the country like locals. We even met up with Tania on a beautiful, deserted beach near Cape Point for lunch!My husband and I recommend Discovery Tours whole-heartedly. We left South Africa with a refreshed view of the world and a love of the Cape Peninsula. We were blown away by the warmth and passion of both Yaseen and Tania. You cannot go wrong with them!

Holiday of a lifetime. From the very first email, husband and wife team Tania and Yassen were fantastic. With their help we came up with a garden route tour that was one of the highlights of my trip. Myself and my partner Mark headed for five nights round the garden route, with Yassen as our guide. He drove us around all the amazing must-sees stopping off along the way and visiting sites that, had we of opted for a self-drive, we would never have known about. Yassen is passionate about South Africa and its wildlife and this made the trip, as did his dry sense of humour. Throughout the period it was just the three of us, but Yaseen managed to find the balance between being the perfect guide and giving the two of us enough time and space as a couple to enjoy places on our own. I won’t bore you all with the details of our holiday, but thanks to Discovery we stayed in some fantastic accommodation, feasted in some top-notch restaurants, discovered some amazing places and all-in-all had an experience of a lifetime. I am not one to hand out praise willy-nilly (as Yaseen can- and will- testify) but in this case, it was well-earned.
very organized and knowledgable. They went above and beyond to make our trip memorable. We were very happy with all the day tours

Excellent Personal Service. Tania was our guide around the peninsula, and Yaseen provided transportation to and from the airport. Our party was just my 14 year old son and me. Tania did a great job of tailoring the trip to our preferences. In other words, we didn't spend much time shopping in the quaint towns and spent more time looking for animals and enjoying the scenery. Tania seemed to know just where to look for the animals, especially on side roads off the beaten path. Tania must have seen the area hundreds of times, but she had a way of presenting it to us that was fresh. The best thing about Tania and Yaseen is that after a very short time, you feel like you've known them all your life. Both are friendly and personable. My son and I will never forget the special day we spent with Tania and the memories we made with her.

A first class guide, knowledgeable and accommodating. Our guide was Tania who took us for a tour of the Cape peninsula. She was looking after only us and so we could decide where we wanted to go and what we wanted to see. We had a great time; Tania of course knows where to go, but she was also eagle eyed in spotting game.

You Can't Go Wrong with Discovery Tours!. I've always found that it is nicer to see a new city with a local as opposed to a large tour bus-type impersonal tour. And Discovery tours did not disappoint in Cape Town! I did three full day, private tours with them - the Peninsula, the Winelands and a cost drive to Hermanus - and would certainly recommend them for any of these tours and more. Tania, thank you very much for a fabulous visit to Cape Town!

An enjoyable and informative cape peninsular tour. Yaseen our driver gave us an enlightening tour and his knowledge of his home city was invaluable - no question was left unanswered - he took into account our age ranges in our family party of 6 (64 - 12) we returned knowledgeable and informed

Friendly and professional guides. We went out twice with Discovery Tours in Cape Town. To the Point & nCape the Good Hope and on a Wine Tour. Both Torus were well planned, great guided and VERY pleasant.They are very knowledable, prefessional and good humored.Indeed recommendable.

A very reasonably priced and excellent tour and guide. Four of us took two Cape Town full day tours and Yaseen was our guide. One day we went to Cape Point and return -- the second day we toured the wine country. Yaseen knew all the best stops and was attentative to making adjustments to suit our likes. This husband and wife team are the best and come highly recommended. Thanks again Yaseen and Tina.

Expect the best, you will get even more!. My husband and I went on a tour of Cape Peninsula with Tania on October 9th. What a fantastic day! Tania is a very nice and sincere person and she is passionate about the beauty of her country. She can talk about plants, birds, whales, baboons, penguins, wine, etc., and shares with you interesting parts of South African history. Tania had also arranged our transportation from the airport. They can do more than what appears on their website so I recommend that you email Tania if there is anything interesting that you want to do and which is not there. There is no doubt that we have had much more than what we expected!

"Discovery Tours" is the most personable and professional tour company that I have experienced.. We were in Cape Town 1 Oct 2010 until 8 October. We had 3 separate tours with Discovery Tours. This is a husband and wife team,they take parties up to 6 persons. Yassein and Tania are so comfortable to be with that we felt like FAMILY. Their knowledge of the entire area and their clarity in explaining any subject demonstrate a fantastic ability to clearly COMMUNICATE as well as a very KNOWLEDGEABLE understanding of the areas Geography,history, animals, and plant life . My wife (a artistic photographer) and I have had numerous tour companies throughout the world,NONE were better than this one.

Cape Town Guide. We hired Yaseen of Discovery Tours for two days of sightseeing. He was prompt, accommodating, informative, reasonably priced. He listened to our requests carefully and followed thru. On a particularly long day, we decided to have a picnic (his suggestion) instead of spending time in a restaurant so he bought sandwiches and found a lovely spot on the Cape to eat. When we asked for a scenic lunch spot with good food in the wine country, he took us to La Petite Ferme which was wonderful. In the wine country, he chose the wineries, and each of them was lovely. We highly recommend him or his wife for a day of sightseeing in Cape Town and surrounding areas.

Awesome Tour. We had Tania for a tour to Hermanus for whale watching from Cape Town. It was such a great tour! She was so friendly and full of information. She made us feel so comfortable. I couldn't have asked for anything more in a guide or a company. I will definitely go with them again the next time we head to Cape Town with a doubt. I would recommend them highly.
Yaseen and Tania are wonderful!. Personalized itinerary, friendly and knowledgeable guides, and amazing memories. The best tour operators in Cape Town. Highly recommended.

Entertaining, knowledgeable and accommodating.. The kind folks at An African Villa recommended Yaseen and Tania when we needed transportation from the airport. One quick trip with Yaseen and we were hooked. For two days he showed us more of Cape Town, the best wineries, and the most scenic routes around the peninsula than we could have seen in two weeks on our own. He took us to delightful, off the beaten track restaurants for lunch, and treated us to scenic vistas that were breathtaking, while letting us stop at any time for photo ops that were out of this world. He was informative, knowledgeable and hilarious, not to mention dependable and prompt. We'll call them on our next trip to Cape Town.

Great tours, great guide. A friend an I have gone on a tour with Tania and so have my mom and my sister. All our experiences were great. Tania is knowledgeable, fun and friendly. She clearly loves Cape Town and South Africa, and you can't help but fall in love with the place, too, with her as your guide. The rates are reasonable, and Tania is very flexible in terms of changing the itinerary to fit your interests, so you can tailor-fit a tour to suit you. I definitely recommend Discovery Tours, and will tour with them again if I'm lucky enough to go back to Cape Town.

I never expected such spectacular sights.... I never expected such spectacular sights on our tour of the peninsula - whales, penguins, lush green forests, beautiful rugged cliffs... Incredible. Tanya is a great guide.

Cape Town at its best!. Fantastic! If you wanna have a real nice insight go with Tania and Yaseen. You'll see the most fantastic places and get to know everything you want. They will provide you with interesting information without becoming too detailed. And besides this, both of them are really nice guys! We did a trip around the peninsula with Tania and this turned out to be one of our best days of our 3-week-SA-tour! Tell her that you wanna try the milktart at this cosy little cafe. We also had our transfer from the airport with Yaseen which was reliable and convenient as well. Highly recommendable!

Worth every Rand. Yaseen and his wife Tania run this small, private tour company. The love the outdoors, they love places off the beaten path, and they're delightful hosts. We booked a day with Yaseen for a Cape Point tour and it was fantastic -- the best day we've spent in our weeks in Cape Town.We not only visited all the prime scenic spots and had plenty of time to photograph some wildlife (baboons, ostrich, penguins), but Yaseen was both an expert guide and an exceptionally friendly one as well. (Yaseen even proved his mettle when we sat for a relaxing picnic near the Cape of Good Hope, dashing to the car well before anyone noticed to prevent an oncoming baboon from getting into our things.)There may be less expensive options for guided Cape tours, but the experience was more than worth it. We highly recommend Discovery Tours.

Fantastic private tour of the Cape Peninsula!. Our private tour of the peninsula with Yaseen was wonderful and extensive and one of the highlights of our trip to Cape Town! Yaseen is very friendly and knowledgeable, and all three of us enjoyed our day with him immensely. We also booked transfers to and from the airport with Discovery Tours, which was very convenient. We highly recommend Discovery Tours!

Expert and Friendly guide. Yaseen, the owner along with his wife Tania, was friendly, amusing and quite patient with my friend and I, whom he was stuck with for two days as we toured the Cape Town area - the peninsula, Table Mountain and the winelands. He created a custom trip just for us, so that we were free to explore at our leisure. Actually he only became concerned when the time we spent shopping made him suspect we'd been abducted! :) We could not have been better cared for, and his stories made even the short drives between sights of interest pass by quickly. His insider knowledge and local's view added depth to our trip, which we'd not have appreciated had we driven about on our own. If you are lucky enough to book him for a tour, don't hesitate!

Yaseen guided the four of us through a day we will never forget. Phil and Liz at Parker Cottage (www.parkercottage.co.za) suggested Discovery Tours since we expressed interest in seeing the entire cape on a day tour. Yaseen picked us up at 9:00am (he was actually a little bit early) and drove us through the city, down and around the cape, and back to the cottage by 5:00pm as promised. He stopped frequently enough that we were able to take plenty of pictures, never got sick of riding in the car, and were always comfortable. As an avid admirer of Cape Town (you'll see what I mean), he has a wealth of knowledge about the city's history, its present culture, and was not afraid to share his opinions on its direction and future when we asked him. He had interesting insights into South Africa as a whole and answered our constant barrage of questions about language, culture, cuisine, and geology with a smile. He is an intelligent, articulate, funny and generally warm person. I'm not going to post pictures of our tour because no photographs could do justice to the sights we saw and you must see it for yourself. Thank you Yaseen for a day that none of us will ever forget!

Wonderful! Friendly! Knowledgeable! Fantastic!. I could go on and on about the folks at Discovery. I was referred to Discovery by Phil and Liz at Parker Cottage. They arranged pick up service to the bed and breakfast. After emailing Yaseen adnd Tania ad naseum, they were able to arrange a private tour to Cape Point and included a number of other sights. I met Yaseen the evening I arrived. Instantly I knew I was dealing with a friendly soul and after 24 hours of travel it was the perfect welcome to South Africa. Tania took us on a tour to Cape Point. I found her to be extremenly knowleadgeable about South African history and wildlife. She was a wonderful guide and very understanding of my jet lag! It was a pleasure to spend the day with her. I'm so happy I chose Discovery and will continue to use them if I am lucky to return to South Africa!

Tania & Yaseen, fantastic tours. We took 2 day trips from the Villa with Discovery Tours, to the Winelands and around the Cape peninsula. We found both Tania and Yaseen to be engaging, knowledgeable, and fun guides with bundles of energy and enthusiasm. Their understanding of the local area, the history, the wildlife, and the wine is exceptional. The private tours were reasonably priced and perfectly tailored on the spot to our tastes as an active couple. We would recommend Discovery Tours to anyone looking to get the most out of a day in and around Cape Town, and our two days with Tania and Yaseen really did make our short stay a special one.

Tania and Yaseen are Fantastic. We only had three days in Cape Town but Tania and Yaseen of Discovery Tours gave us a very complete experience. First Tania picked us up at the airport and was very flexible after we missed our original flight. The next day we toured around the city on our own. The following day we went on a wonder Winelands tour with Tania. She was very knowledgable and took us to lots of great wineries, but most of all she was just really fun to be with. The next day Yaseen took us around Cape Point with a chance to visit lots of wonderful littlte towns. We even had an interesting encounter with a baboon was pretty amusing in retrospect. This tour was arranged on very short notice the day before when we discovered that their tour experience was truely the way to go. I would recommend DIscovery Tours enthusiatically.

Value for money. Cape Town: Discovery Tours Very pleasant private tour with Tania of Discovery Tours. If you travel with a five year old, this type of tour is the ideal and Discovery are reasonably priced for private tours. Tania is flexible, accommodating and goes the extra mile. Highly recommended.

Affordable and excellent guide for the Cape. My partner and I spent a day with Tania touring the Cape peninsula. She is a terrific guide -- very informative and very fun. We learned a lot and felt as if we had made a great friend by the end of the day. South Africa is a beautiful country with a complicated history, and Tania helped us to better understand what we saw all around us. Highly recommended to all visitors to Cape Town -- a trip with Tania will be one of the highlights of your stay.

Discovery Tours exceeds expectations. I arranged private tours to the city, the Cape Peninsula, the Winelands and Kirstenbosch Gardens with Tania, who was knowledgeable, flexible and adjusted as we went along to my particular interests and ability, and spot on in terms of hitting all the highlights. Both Tania has a passion for the native flora and fauna of the region, which made my visit more interesting than I had thought it would be. Discovery Tours is very reasonable, and offers the gold standard. i highly recommend them. LauraWDC

Discovery Tours, Cape Town. If you are going to Cape Town and want excellent (and even very affordably) tourassistance - then we do recommend you to contact Discovery Tours, operated by Tania and Yaseen. Tania and Yaseen are very kind, flexible, authentic, professional, knowledgeable, hospitable and honest people. It is really a pleasure to be together with them. We stayed in Cape Town for 14 days and had several tours with them to winelands (they really know the very best small Wineyards), the coastline and mountains. We had a variety of wonderful experiences on every tour and we do not hesitate to say that they were the best we experienced in South Africa. They know the country and they have a nice passion for nature, wildlife and flowers. Tania and Yaseen even helped us reserving tables at restaurants and arranged that we had a wonderful gastronomic New Years Eve at Buitenverwachting (an excellent wineyard). And they did not charge us for all these services, amazing. We very highly recommend Tania and Yaseen and Discovery Tours to future visitors in Cape Town visitors. You can trust them!

Wine Tours. My wife and I went to SA for our honeymoon and we did 4 days (2 days in a row, 1 day off) of Wine Tour and we had a blast! The road trip was amazing with stunning sceneries, stops at some beautiful wineries (Elgin: Iona/Antaraxia; Bot River: Luddite -Best Shiraz in SA imo; Franschhoek: Le Lude; Paarl: Vondeling; Stellenbosch: Waterford/Meerlust) and had succulent lunches at wonderful venues (Jordan, Delaire, La Petite Ferme…)! A big thank you, for a perfectly orchestrated tour, to our lovely experts: Pam & Anine, they were always very attentive to our everyday needs!!

Cooking with Cass Abrams, Phenomenal Experience!. We were scheduled to have a half-day cooking class with Cass Abrams, a local food celebrity in her own right. I didn't know what to expect as far as where the cooking class would take place, how many people would be joining us, etc. It turned out to be only my mother and I and we got to cook with Cass at her house! It was honestly one of my favorite experiences during our short, event-packed, 4 days in Cape Town. Cass was so welcoming, my mother and I made 4 traditional South African dishes (recipes that she has been credited with documenting so as not to be lost, which I think is so awesome) with Cass' instruction. Afterwards, we all sat down and ate lunch together. This is all right in her home, so intimate, and so much more than I expected from a cooking class. Our tour guide, Pam, was also with us the entire day. I cannot speak highly enough of her. She picked us up from our hotel and along the drive toward Cass's house, gave us a history of Cape Town itself and also what is known as Cape Malay cuisine. She is such an interesting woman and you can tell she genuinely loves the city and all that it encompasses! She took us by Truth Coffee before we went to see Cass, definitely worth checking out... It's got an industrial feel with the staff in steam-punk, Mad Max style attire; coffee is to die for as well, order the flat white, you won't be disappointed. Overall, you get a great history of the city without it feeling touristy, and, if you have a culinary interest, you cannot ask for a better experience than cooking with Cass. Bottom line, I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Cape Town, phenomenal experience!

Hands down our best Cape Town tour.. We requested that our travel agent book a cooking class while in Cape Town. What they found was more than we could imagine. It was to have been a half day, but there was so much to see and do it went beyond our scheduled time. With Ryan as our guide we received a cultural as well as culinary taste of the city. We visited Truth Coffee, Charly's Bakery, District 6 Museum, the Spice Market, and ended our tour in one of the lovely pastel homes on Cape Maley Bo-Kapp for a cooking class. What I liked about our tour with Cape Fusion and Ryan was that it was customized for us. It wasn't selected from a list of prearranged tours so there were no crowds of other tour groups to contend with. We were on a schedule but not bound by it, the tour could be altered as we went along. It was more like a local person finding what interest us then fulfilling our request. This is the way to see Cape Town, a small independent company that works on quality rather than quanity. That being said, you will need to book well in advance in order to have this unique experience.

Cape Eats Tour. We spent most of the day with Anine who was a delight. Not only did we visit lots of amazing places to drink coffee, taste wine and eat lots of speciality items we also met interesting people. She quickly absorbed what we were interested in and planned the tour around us. We learned a great deal of history and had an insight into the people of Cape Town. We visited Wireworld and talked to the artists making the lovely items. Anine even spent time at the end of the day helping us plan the rest of our time in the city. We cannot praise her high enough this was a wonderful way to spend a day!

Dont miss this Tour. We did a whole day Cape Town Eats Tour, just my husband and I.Pam was our guide and we had Anine on board as well so we were very spoilt.It was the best day! We saw so much of the city and tasted so many different foods in places we would not have thought or known to visit. Pam and Anine are both very professional, knowledgeable and entertaining and made sure we had a good time and were well fed. We got lots of tips for places to visit and restaurant / cafes to eat at for the rest of our stay in Cape Town. I highly recommend doing this tour on one of your first days in Cape Town, the information you receive will make the rest of your stay!!Book early as Pam and her Company are booked out well in advance.

An amazing day in Cape Town!. One of the true highlights of a "trip of a lifetime" to Southern Africa was our Cape Town Eats walking tour. Ryan was the perfect guide. He made us feel as if we were visiting a friend who couldn't wait to show us his city! His enthusiasm about every stop was contagious. And we loved everything we ate, saw, and experienced.Thanks, Ryan and Cape Fusion Tours. We will recommend you to anyone planning a visit to Cape Town!

Fabulous day trying local food places. This was probably one of the best ours we have ever taken. Not only was every place we stopped fantastic, but at the same time we learned history of Capetown!Would highly recommend and wear comfortable shoes!

Wine and food tour of Cape Town. We spent the day with Pam driving around Cape Town, visiting Stellenbosch and Franschhoek with its many vineyards and eating places. Pam was an amazing guide, friendly, enthusiastic and informative. She spoke with passion on the history and culture of the area and tailored the tour to our own interests. It was a highlight of our holiday, an unforgettable day and we would thoroughly recommend Pam as a guide. Richard and Louisa

Tour Cape Town with a friend. We loved two days touring Cape Town. We felt like we got a real feel for Cape Town thru the eyes of somebody who loves the city. Pam showed us wonderful craft shops and we sampled yummy food - - both street food and in restaurants ! Our driving tour of the coast was so much fun including our stop for lunch in a small beach town at a cafe. We loved the fresh fish and eating with locals. I'm bringing my husband to Cape Town next year and I'll be contacting Pam to show him her city.

Amazing day Cape Town Eats . We did a whole day Cape Town Eats Tour, just the two of us. Ryan was our guide. It was an amazing day! We enjoyed every minute of it. We saw so much of the city and tasted so many different foods: bacon, cheese, pastries, bunny chow, Xhosa dishes, we drank delicious coffee. The guide was very professional, knowledgeable and entertaining and he made sure we had a good time. As the tour was taylored to our wishes, we also did a bit of Cape Malay cooking at a local lady's home which was a great experience. We got lots of inspiration for places to visit for the rest of our stay in Cape Town. I highly recommend this company if you are looking for a quality city tour.

Awesome insight into Cape Town. Our guide Pam was a total professional clearly puts her heart, soul & passion in not only showing out of the way boutique food options but top restaurants, a inner city winery, street food, cafe specialities and a unique insight into the history & culture of Cape Town. The reception that Pam received clearly showed the standing she is held in. We tasted amazing coffee, cheese, middle eastern street food, sweets, a wine tasting, curry in a hollowed out bread roll & traditional african meal. Also we were given time to peruse a street market, view, purchase & donate (our choice) wire framed beaded animals from a non profit business set up to support abandoned women, a local business of collective artists who construct wire animals some of which are beaded, all of which were amazing. You also get a geographic appreciation of city central including historical buildings. A highlight was when leaving Davids bus station roof restaurant & telling him I was from New Zealand he wanted to know about the rugby haka so I did part of a haka for him. The absolute delight on his face was priceless. Memories for life. Thanks so much Pam for sharing your insiders knowledge with us. Do yourself a favour & take this tour. Amazing. Ian & Toni Carroll Yarram Victoria Australia August 2016.

This is the first thing you should do in Cape Town!. I spent 17 days in South Africa. I toured Capetown for four days. While I LOVED my entire trip and everything about it. Doing the foodie tour with Pam of Cape Fusion Tours is hands down my favorite time spent on the entire trip. It's the part of the trip that comes to mind most often. Taking the foodie tour with Pam is a great way to get the lay of the land. It will save you so much time later in your trip!!!She takes you everywhere and knows everyone. She introduces you to the locals, provides history, and by the end of the day you have a good idea of where you want to eat for the rest of your time in Capetown. She takes the guess work out of where and what to eat. I wish I had more time to experience more places. As an entrepreneur, I so loved learning about all the stories of how each person that we met came to owning their business. I loved learning about their ethnic diversity that makes up Capetown. Pam is incredibly knowledgable. She is very strategic about where she takes you and is good about listening to you and figuring out which restaurants are the best fit for you. As a solo traveler this was also a great way to experience Capetown with someone who felt like a friend. This tour is fantastic for a true foodie enthusiast.

Such a fun day!. We (30 yr old couple) spent the day with Pam touring Cape Town, eating and shopping! It was such a great way to see the city trying all different foods and being able to see all different cultures and areas of the city. Highly recommend this if you are visiting. Perfect combination of history, eating and getting to burn off the calories :)

Outstanding walking tour. On our first day in South Africa we had an absolutely wonderful outing with Ryan exploring the ethnic diversity and history of Cape Town. It was the perfect orientation to the tour and the extremely deep & complex history of the city & nation. Throughout our two week in SA we kept thinking & talking about what Ryan shared with us. The foods were very enjoyable - ranging from savory samosa to vegan bunny chow...and the best darn coffee I have ever had. As a professional tour guide myself I can be a "tough customer" when taking a walk...but Ryan was simply fantastic. He was engaging, answered questions with clarity & depth. In addition, Pam was a delight to work with.Absolutely highly recommend Cape Fusion Tours!

Excellent tour of Cape Town city sites and restaurants.. Cape Fusion Touring (private full day tour of Cape Town ---Ryan (our guide) was very flexible in order to provide a private tour to include areas of our interest. Highlights included: Table Mountain (which we couldn't do the day before due to windy weather), city tour of the Muslim community, native African foods, kiosks of African food above the City train station, District 6 Museum, (due to us not being able to go to Robben Island due to windy weather) Honest Chocolate shop for cocoa and dessert and ending with Truth coffee shop. He knew the people of the community and enjoyed showing us the spots.

Great way to explore around Capetown. These tours are specifically tailored to you and your group. You get your options - all fabulous sounding- you just choose the most appealing. Comfortable vans, friendly and interesting guides (Ryan!). A really good day of enjoying the Cape with no need to navigate, think, drive, or not enjoy the fine wine, beer, and food offerings of the area. A Must do!

Awesome time eating and exploring!!. Pam is amazing! We did two of her tours - one walking around Cape Town exploring and eating, and one all around the Cape Peninsula. They were both perfect! Essentially, her tours are like going someplace really interesting and having a friend drive you around to all the cool spots and tell you all about everything you need to know. We learned a ton and had a lot of really cool experiences. The food was all amazing and we met a lot of really cool people. Pam is also very flexible - she was perfectly happy to hang around and wait while we hiked some extra trails at Cape Point and drove over to take triumphant pictures when we were done! All in all the tours were absolutely great - experiences you wouldn't get any other way. Highly recommended!! After receiving all sorts of terrifying warnings about how we should never walk in Cape Town (I went for work and got automatic security emails), we were a little intimidated at the thought of exploring on our own. With Pam, we got about 17000 steps each day - to let you know we really did explore a ton of the area and we definitely worked up an appetite for all the awesome food. Other people of course wouldn't have to walk so much if they didn't want to, but we really enjoyed it.

Fantastic foodie tour. Ryan took us on a fabulous food journey. Starting on Bree street with cheese (culture club tasty cheese shop) and bacon (none for me but super cute shop) to a walk of the colorful Malay neighborhoods, stopping along the way for samosas, sweet treats, and a very cool wire/beading studio. We moved to a delicious chocolate cafe and tasting sweet bunny chow, meeting a chef on top of a train station, delicious chicken curry bunny chow and ended our food filled day with coffee with oranges and cookies. Would HIGHLY recommend!!

Township Cooking school with Pam. Pam started the day with coffee In a delightful location and a historical review. She's energetic and straight forward and summarizes the culture for outsiders. Her enthusiasm is contagious and Mama Lindi delighted in having us help her in the kitchen. The cooking school project provides some useful training for students and experience in kitchens where they can be hired upon completion. As a vegetarian interested in cooking, I loved the local foods we helped prepare including corn meal pap and curry. A quick drive through the township afterwards. Lovely day.

African Cooking Tour is an absolute must do in Cape Town!. We booked the African Cooking tour with Pam for our group of 8 friends. Pam sweetly rearranged her schedule to accommodate us as I desperately wanted to do this experience and it did not disappoint. From the visit to Truth Coffee to begin our discussion on apartheid to our visit to the District 6 museum, Pam helped us understand the history before heading out to Langa township.Once we got to Langa, we were so warmly greeted by Victor and the woman of the hour Mama Lindie. Our cooking class was filled with laughter, singing and dancing. Mama Lindie is fabulous, feisty and so kind. While we waited for some of our dishes to finish, Victor taught us about life in the township as well as Xhosa traditions before we got a chance to meet with the students at the cooking school. It was such a pleasure to sit down with the students, hear about their aspirations once they complete the course and talk about something we were all passionate about - good food. At the end of the day, we sat down together, feasted on our meal and shared stories. On the trip back into town, all of us were raving how the experience wildly surpassed expectations and was a highlight of the trip.Do yourself a favor and book this experience with Pam. If you leave S.A. without meeting Mama Lindie (and her students), you'll be doing yourself a huge disservice.

Cape Town Eats Tour: Foodie heaven!. We booked a walking tour via Pam for 2 families including 3 kids early May. After being picked up from our guesthouse at 9am we were taken for the next 7 hours by our excellent and incredibly friendly guide Ryan on a culinary discovery trip in Cape Town. After starting with a very nice session on Cape Malay cuisine (including folding samoosas ourselves), we hit the streets and sampled delicious food at the "to-be" places as well as typical local street fare whilst Ryan provided background on the city and South Africa in general. Kids friendly and vegetarian options were well accommodated. We absolutely loved it!

Highly recommended. Our group of 12 family and friends was booked with Pam by our travel consultant at Jacada Travel. This was a walking tour of central Cape Town for the first 6 hours, and then a trip up to the top of Table Mountain.Pam was extremely knowledgeable about the Cape Town food scene, but also about the history of Cape Town and South Africa in general.We visited many small local food purveyors, such as a bacon shop, cheese shop, chocolate shop and central Cape Town winery. We stopped at a local woman's house where we were given a hands on demonstration of how to make samosas, and then enjoyed the fruits of our labor. We also visited the central train station, including the rooftop food stalls, where Pam had one of the purveyors give a talk about African food. Our last part of the tour was a cable car ride up to the top of Table Mountain. All in all I would not hesitate in recommending this tour, but perhaps ask Pam to tweak it just a bit. I think the time spent at the local woman's home could be shortened by about 20 minutes, and the time spent with the chef at the food stall on the roof of the train station needs to be shortened as well. The chef is very personable and enthusiastic about African foods, but he went on for about 15 minutes, when 5 minutes would have sufficed. But again, as I am sure Pam would tailor a tour for you as you request, I have no problem recommending her.

Pam is a Champion!. Two couples spent 3 days with Pam and loved every minute! We started with the foodie walking tour of Cape Town on a Saturday. Went straight to Woodstock market for breakfast. This is a must but only on Saturday so plan the tour! Pam then took us all over this amazing city of contrasts. Lots of walking so wear good shoes and be reasonably fit. Regular stops for great coffees and small food offerings. A visit to Table Mountain was a highlight on a beautiful day. All in a great day. Our second day was a tour with Pam to the Cape of Good Hope and surrounding areas. Took the funicular at Cape Point to the top and walked down. Good decision!Brilliant lunch in a waterfront restaurant in a small fishing village.Our third day was a tour of the Stellenbosch wine area. Pam picked Mulderbosch for starters and then to two others. The choice for a wonderful lunch was La Petite Ferme.Pam is incredibly knowledgable, fired up, organised but endlessly flexible, well known and popular. She is funny, drives well in a first class vehicle and responds to every need. She is all over wine and food which suited us totally.If you want to get on one of Pam's private tours, book well ahead. She has added great knowledge and vale to this our first visit to Cape Town.

Food of course, but also an introduction to cape town, it's history and people. . We cannot recommend Pam's tour highly enough. All communication before the tour was timely and she made a special effort to accommodate a pescatarian. Pam is a lovely lady, really easy to chat with, a food enthusiast and a mine of useful information.On her recommendation, we did the tour early on in our stay, and it really helped to orientate us, plus gave us great ideas for lunches and dinners. All the places we ate were great and Pam used then to tell the story of cape town.Visits to 2 community enterprises were also a highlight.All in all, we couldn't have asked for a better start to our visit to cape town. In our view, the tour represented excellent value for moneyThanks Pam!!!

Great way to experience Cape Town. We booked 4 tours with Cape Fusion including the Cape Tour,Wineries,Cooking with Cass and city walking tour. We had 2 excellent days with Pam and another 2 outstanding days with Ryan. The drive to the Cape of Good Hope was a great introduction to the city and surrounds. Pam booked a lovely spot for lunch and we enjoyed shopping in the towns.All the tours are very professional and organized and a great way to enjoy the food,culture and insight into life and history of the Cape district.Truly amazing and we would catch up with them both on our next visit.

Great Tour and day with Ryan!. This tour was awesome! Ryan guided us through the heart of Cape Town food the culture. He explained the history of the city which with so interesting in itself. We were also able to get a closeup view of the how the some of the average Camp Town residents lived and worked. The food was outstanding and our guide was very knowledgeable. This was a great tour!

Perfect wine tour. My significant other and I booked a wine tasting tour with Pam and had a most amazing time! She was quick to respond to my emails about the booking and incorporated our favorite types of wine in the stops we made. We wanted to see a variety so went to 5 wineries, saw Stellenbosch and Franschoek, and had an amazing lunch (everything we had hoped for!). Pam was a charismatic, passionate, and informative guide and we enjoyed hearing both about Cape history and culture in addition to expanding our knowledge about wine. It was a perfect day; I'd highly recommend her especially if you are interested in great wine and food.

A great day with Pam. My husband & I spent a wonderful day with Pam. From start to finish, she thought of everything possible to make our day memorable and enjoyable. We visited 3 wineries and thoroughly enjoyed her shared knowledge and stories about the area and the wines. She went above and beyond.The 9 hours we spent together flew by so quickly that we wished we had more time. We highly recommend booking a tour with Pam. You will not be disappointed!

Fantastic private gourmet tour. To discover Cape Town , I will recommand you to try a private gourmet tour with Pam . She is very nice and funny . We spend a great time walking in CT to try food , coffee , African's food .She has fantastic addresses .For french people , don't be afraid , Pam speak english but she is easy to understand .Only one regret , 5 hours is too short , we want to come back and spend more time with Pam

A Great Intro To The Most Beautiful Place on Earth. My 14 year old daughter and I had the most wonderful opportunity to visit South Africa and were booked for a half day Foodie Tour with Ryan. Seriously jet lagged and in awe of our beautiful surroundings, Ryan picked us up right on time and introduced us to Cape Town. We started off in colorful Bo-Kaap trying out some Cape Malay pastries, He then took us to two venues where we could witness traditional African beading, one of which was an awesome non-profit shop that enriches the lives of less fortunate native women while realizing their talents. It was great to bring home some pieces of art while supporting a good cause. Moving ahead, we enjoyed ice cream bunny-chow (SO GOOD FOR BREAKFAST) and other goodies, then finishing up with traditional pap and samp, curry and meeting some wonderful natives along the way. Ryan was incredibly laid back, informative, very friendly and the perfect guide to show us places and foods we wouldn't have gotten a chance to experience on our own. Thank you Ryan and Pam for taking good care of us and sharing your gorgeous city with us. We will be back!

3 fantastic days in Cape Town with Ryan. Ryan picked us up right on time for our 1/2 day wine tour in the Constantia wine region. We started off with a fantastic lunch and wine tasting at Contantia Glen,made a quick stop at Groot Constantia and then went to our favourite High Constantia. Our last stop was at Steenberg. Our second day was a full day in the old wine regions. Ryan was very friendly and easy going. He joined us for lunch so that we could visit with him and gain as much information as we could. He is very knowledgable about the regions and Cape Town. His tour was very flexible and we were able to add a tour of a car museum and one last stop at Meerlust which was our favourite for sure. Our third day with Ryan was a tour of Cape Town starting with a stop at Truth Coffee, then the District 6 museum and then to our township cooking class. As we were cooking Ryan took our cameras and got some great shots for us. He then drove us around the township and then to the spice shop with a final stop at the butcher shop to purchase biltong. Ryan was a great tour guide and we would recommend him in a heart beat. He was very flexible and altered the tour to suit your likes as he got to know youThanks for 3 great days in Cape Town!

Seriously good food and wine experience!. I'm not usually one for guided tours however when you have a guide as knowledgeable, well connected and fun as Pam it makes it worthwhile! We did a day tour of the Stellenboch wine region with her and it was such a great experience. Her passion and knowledge about wine, the local wine winemakers, South African history and politics is really impressive. If you're into food and wine I think a Cape Fusion Tour is a must-do if visiting Cape Town.

Great Tour of Hermanus Valley with Ryan. I wanted to see the best of Hermanus in a single with limited time while making my french tastebuds go "boom". It seems a it too much for a single wine tour but well.. it went beyond my expectations. Every estate was carefully chosen, got an amazing mystery wine pairing @ creation wines while ang Ryna evena managed to get me to meet a french winemaker @ Bouchard Finlayson and add an extra estate that a friend recommended. Actually ... Ryan was right the view was nice but the wine not so much ! I must go back !

Best wine tours...always. This is our sixth visit to Cape Town and we simply couldn't come without a wine tour with Pam. This time we have done 2 and have the city tour still to look foward to. Her itinerary is always fabulous and her knowledge of each winery and all the best restaurants is amazing. It really is like a day out with an old friend. A perfect 2 days. We have managed anything from 4 to 7 farms in a day, it's up to you to decide what pace and how much tasting you want. As we visit a lot of farms that need prebooking, letting Pam sort it all out if great. Pick up and drop off for a wine tour is a.must and her vehicles are spotless. Cannot recommend Cape Fusion enough but book early as she has a lot of happy repeat customers like us

Insider knowledge, insight and access. We were recently in Cape Town for a wedding and went on a day tour to the wineries of Stellenboch and Franschhoek with a group of friends. This is my second time in Cape Town and second time doing a food and wine tour with Cape Fusion Tours. The great thing about Pam is she personalises the itinerary to you and has genuine depth of knowledge and insight about the region, the people, as well as the wineries, the wine and, of course, the winemakers. You come away have learnt something as well as having had a gastronomic adventure. On the tour we just did we went to some big wineries and some boutique wineries and at all of them we had a unique 'insiders' experience, not just a cellar door drop. As global travellers, we have been on several foodie tours and experiences, and without doubt, the personal touch, knowledge and friendliness of Pam and the Cape Fusion Tours team make this experience world class (not to mention the great wines and restaurants of the Cape!)

Wonderful wine, beautiful countryside and and an incredibly clever, well informed guide. . Pam is a wonderful and warm tour guide who brought us to some amazing Stellenbosch vineyards -- some large, some small and all great. The centerpiece luncheon was amazing.

Something special always happens with Pam. Maybe we are just lucky, but this is my third tour with Pam and something special always happens... whether it's a chat with the wine-maker or a sneak behind the scenes peak... her choices are always impeccable, her knowledge and manner make the days a firm favourite when I am in Cape Town... it's never the same twice, so we will be back!

Great experience with Anine and Mama Lindy. In November we had the opportunity to spend a whole day with Anine on a combined Food and wine Tour in and around Cape Town. District Six Museum and the Cooking class with Mama Lindy + Victor left a deep impression. Together with Anines heart warming personality we will keep a great experience in our minds and hearts.

Fantastic food, enthusiastic guide, great introduction to the city!. I had the pleasure of Pam McOnie's company on this tour, and it was fantastic. She was incredibly warm and flexible, attentive to our needs, and wonderfully pleasant.We got a bit of history, information on the cultural make-up of the city, learned about different areas, and walked... and ate!We tried many types of food, including koeksisters, melk tart, bobotie, borewors, a curry, a couple of coffees, and much more. We tried many types of cuisine, met several local cooks, and were given great advice on not only the food and drink scene, but also other important local tips.This was our first tour upon entering Cape Town, and I'm very glad that it was. It served as the perfect introduction into the city and its delights.

Cape Town and area. Pam picked us up at our hotel in Cape Town .We had 2 wonderful days with her..She was very knowledgeable and showed us places which were extremely interesting and not on the normal tourist route.She had a great sense of humour and informed us in the history of South Africa as well us other interesting fact .......We could not have seen and done this on our own.....

Wine Tour on Oct. 10 - Franschhoek Region. Pam picked us up at my hotel in Cape Town (including my daughter & her friend who are in Cape Town for six months on co-op from their U.S. university) and our first stop was Babylonstoren. It was early so no wine-tasting here but Pam wanted us to experience the organic farm that is located on this winery. We arrived in time for a guided tour given by one of their knowledgeable employees and saw some beautiful sites also. You can lodge here and some of the rooms have kitchens. You are allowed to pick anything from the gardens and use. It was a great first stop! After that we were off to La Motte Winery for our winetasting. This is my first experience and it was fantastic. The wines were delicious and Pam is very well-versed about the winemaking process, the background on the winery and the history of the region. And we bought some great wines at great prices! Afterwards we went to lunch at La Petite Ferme. How delicious and what a stunningly beautiful locale!! We walked around the little town and did a little shopping before heading to our next winetasting in Stellenbosch. That winery closed a little early that day so we didn't have an opportunity for a second winetasing but that was really okay. Between the winetasting at La Motte and lunch, I was definitely feeling it! We walked around thte quaint streets of the Stellenbosch shopping area and learned more about the region from Pam.I highly recommend Pam as your wine region tour guide. She was fun, energetic and very knowledgeable.

Wonderful walking tour of Cape Town with fantastic ethnic food. Great walking tour of Cape Town's lesser known ethnic foods. This is a wonderful tour. It was recommended by our tour company and was even better than we thought it would be. Pamela was a great guide, organized and knowledgable but also totally flexible. The food was great. Lunch including semp and beans and pap served by a wonderful chef at a food stall on top of the station was a highlight of our trip to South Africa. This is a tour not to be missed if you are a lover of ethnic foods (and excellent coffee!), but it is also a fun and informative walking tour of the different areas of downtown Cape Town.
Love for food. Exellent Coffee, fun and good food and great guiding. Personal guide who were very helpfull and happy.

Cape Peninsula and Wineland Tours. My wife and had two wonderful days with Cape Fusion Tours.Anine took us around the Cape pointingpints of interest but not importantly sharing with us the history and culture of South Africa.She reserved the best table in the house for our lunch at Harbour House restaurant.On the way back I asked if we could detour to Constantia to visit a vineyard Ibwas interested in.She mangrd to get us in although it was closed to the general public.The second tour was with Pam.She picked us up in Franschhoek and took us to visit four of her favorite vineyards In the Stellenbosch area. Again she shared with us information that enhanced our visit to the area.When she sensed that my wife would be interested in something other than additional wine tasting ,she modified the schedule and suggested we go and visit a beautiful garden .We made all the arrangements online.All correspondence was handled promptly and professionally.We wholeheartedly recommend Cape Fusion Tours to the independent traveller.
EATS of Cape town. Anine took us on a special adventure which met and exceeded all our weird dietary needs. Just do it !

Wonderful Day!. Just a fantastic overall experience. Visiting our daughter who was on a co-op work assignment through her college. Took a one day tour with my wife, my daughter, and my daughter's friend, who are all either nurses or nursing students. Pam was wonderful, and able to provide information with regard to South Africa's health care system while driving to our various locations...information that was fascinating. Took us to the Waterford Estate, which had a wonderful tasting of wine and chocolate in a beautiful location...everyone enjoyed this immensely. As I am more of a beer fan, she tailored the trip to bring us to a local mini-brewery, which I thoroughly enjoyed. Brought us to a wonderful restaurant/brewery/chocolate tasting, where we enjoyed spectacular views while enjoying our meal...she also explained South African cuisine while we were eating. Since our daughter and her friend are staying in Cape Town through November, she also took the time to show them other areas that they may want to visit while staying in South Africa. Couldn't be happier....highly recommend!

Culinary Tour with Anine. Anine guided us on a spectacular gastronomic experience, commencing with a visit to the Old Biscuit Mill's Saturday Market (foodie heaven) and culminating with breaking bread with Ghamida, our delightful cooking teacher! We prepared delicious samosas, curried chicken and roti, and laughed hysterically whilst learning about the Cape Malay culture from one of the area's own. Such a personalized and unforgettable day! Thank you, Anine and Pam!

Great food tour. My husband and I were lucky enough to go on a food tour with Anine. She met us at our hotel and started us off with chocolate for breakfast .....she had us hooked. We got to see such a variety of local cuisine that you would not get if you just stuck to Bree/ long st or the V&A. We loved sampling the local cuisine and loved meeting chef Sandili. The other highlight was Truth coffee shop which was terrific. Ask lots of questions bc Anine is a wealth of knowledge not to be missed.

Fabulous walking and eating tour of Cape Town with Cape Fusion Day Tours!. My daughter and I went on a walking and eating tour of Cape Town.We were met at our hotel by our guide. Our guide Anine was absolutely fantastic! She went above and beyond to ensure that we has an absolutely wonderful experience. We walked around Bo Kaap and tasted food from various local restaurants. We went to some wonderful stores called Monkey Biz and Streetwires. (I highly recommend that you visit these places.) We visited a wonderful coffee shop called Truth where all the locals were so friendly and welcoming. We also went to Gardens and an outdoor food market where we tasted plenty of delicious foods and bought lots of souvenirs from local vendors. Anine tailored the day to our wants, and did not rush us at all. I highly recommend this company. If you use them, ask for Anine! For this type of tour you need to wear comfortable walking shoes and take some local cash with you because many of the local vendors do not accept credit cards.

Terrific insight into Cape Town. My husband and I spent an amazing day with Pam. She picked us up at our hotel and then we proceeded to taste the different foods and coffee of Cape Town. As we walked the Bo Kapp area we were given mush insight into its history and had the opportunity to meet some of its residents as we tasted the local cuisine and shop for local handicraft. We especially enjoyed tasting authentic African cuisine followed by an amazing coffee house. We ended the day tasting wine in Constantia. This day with Pam left us even more passionate for South Africa.

Cape Fusion Tours are the Best!. I visited Cape Town with my 19-year-old daughter and my 15-year-old son. We needed to come up with an itinerary that we would all enjoy despite our varied interests. Pam and I emailed back and forth before the trip and she came up with a fabulous two days for us. Anine was our guide and she is fantastic! Even my not-so-outgoing son was quickly at ease with her. Everywhere we went she knew people to make our visit even more enjoyable.We went to the District 6 museum, the Afrikaans Language Museum and monument, shopping for South African shwe shwe fabric, chocolate tasting, bunny chow tasting and much more. My favorite though was cooking with Mama Lindy. Mama Lindy is a gem and the township cooking school is a wonderful community resource started from the ground up. I've now gathered all the ingredients from the class and I can't wait to have a dinner with friends and share all the recipes.All three of us had a great time in Cape Town and it was largely due to Pam and Anine. We would never have had such an enjoyable trip without them.

Fantastic day in Wine Land. We spent a day with Pam and toured South Africa's amazing and beautiful Wine region. Pam had planned and arranged the entire day, full of wine, beer, and chocolate tastings, and topped it off with a gorgeous lunch and Jackson Estates.In addition to the culinary expertise, Pam provided wonderful cultural and historical background of the region. A real breath of fresh air, and day we will never forget!

Outstanding Food Tour and so much more!. We took the food tour but it was so much more than just food. We met passionate people who love to share their knowledge on local cuisine. Pam, as many others have said, is a fountain of knowledge and contacts. She introduced us to local eateries we would not have found on our own. We had the best sample of South African comfort food (make sure you have only a small breakfast). She also gave us an introduction to the emerging food scene in Cape Town - from high end restaurants with famous chefs to local butchers. We were given a chance to view local crafts and even the craftsmen workshops. When Pam found out that I was interested in fabric she took the time at the end of the tour to stop at a local fabric designers shop. Nothing was too much trouble. Pam provided one of the best private tours we have ever had!

An absolute delight!. What an experience! I traveled to South Africa in July with my children (15, 13, 11) and my parents. I didn't coordinate the sights and the tours that we eventually took but we were the fortunate recipients. It was a delight. Anine was knowledgeable and a real treasure as we traveled together over two days. I don't know think that there was anything Anine didn't know - we almost couldn't stump her. And the information she imparted even managed to interest jaded American kids who normally can't be bothered :) Anine was flexible and managed to juggle the needs and desires of all ages (11 - 75); we really got to see an amazing amount of the area around Cape Town in our two days including Maiden's Cove, Noordhoek Farm village, Chapman's Peak Drive, Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, Boulders Beach, Robben Island, a crocodile farm, and the Winelands.

3 Fabulous Days with Anine. From the moment Anine picked me up I felt like I was visiting Cape Town with a native friend. My first day visiting Cape Town included District 6 museum, Table Mountain and Bo-Kaap with a visit to a steampunk coffee shop and cooking school with Mama Lindy - an event unto itself. I can't wait to try out my new recipes on friends. Day 2 was Saturday so a must stop, especially for foodies, is the Biscuit Mill. Not only was this a treat for the eyes, ears and taste buds, it provided many cultural insights in just one place. We then spent the rest of the day driving down the coast, visiting the Cape of Good Hope, seeing the penguins and other sea life. Day 3 was a wonderful visit to the wine country. This was a day filled with gorgeous natural scenery, Cape Dutch architecture, good wine and even a chocolate tasting.When we set out on our adventure, Anine had certain things in mind but as the three days went on she modified plans as she got to know what I liked and that I wanted to pack as much as possible into the time I had in her town. And, she knew everyone - from the gentleman at the District 6 Museum whose home had been in the District to various vendors at the Biscuit Mill, the doorman at the coffee shop and wine makers. My time with Anine was fabulous. I learned so much and had so much fun. I can't wait to go back and spend more time with Anine exploring her city and the area around it.

Pam is Amazing!. With Pam, even though this is mine and my family's 3rd visit to Capetown, in 2 days, I've seen and learnt so much about this beautiful city than I actually knew!Pam is so knowledgeable and patient!'Thank you for being a fantastic tour guide!!!

Pam most definitely can!. We organised a "cooking with Cass" (Cass Abrahams) tour with Pam. WOW, what a special morning. We had loads of fun cooking and learning. We also received a signed cook book. Pam organised everything to perfection and as noted before is incredibly knowledgeable on Cape Town and its surrounds. We had a mini guided tour on the way to Cass :-) Next time we are in CT will definitely book more foodie tours. Thanks so much Pam and Cass, we had a very special day.

WOW!. We spent three days with Pam touring Cape Town and the wine lands. What fun! Pam is so knowledgeable, and knew of so many special places to take us. She is a walking, talking Wikipedia for this area. Highly recommend she guide you through this fabulous place.

Pam is the best!. We were a large group spanning three generations with some real characters in the bunch. Pam was so, so patient and considerate and in addition to wrangling us with ease, she took great care of my elderly mom and stepfather. She really knows her stuff whether it be shopping at the coolest Capetown boutiques, checking out the coolest eateries, or visiting the cultural gems such as the District Six museum. Of course she is a real pro at exploring the winelands as well. I've always shied away from tour guides (my boyfriend and I prefer to do things on our own) but after this excellent experience with Pam I see it made a world of difference in our visit. It's like knowing a local but better because she knows so much! She is also super sweet and funny. I can't recommend her enough.

Phenomenal Food Tour!. My husband and I spent the day with Pam on the culinary tour of Cape Town. We had the most incredible time eating our way through the city. Pam showed us hidden gems that we never would have found on our own, including the most delicious lunch featuring maize and traditional South African stew and we learned how to make traditional Cape Malay samosas in the home of a local. As we walked through the city, Pam provided an in depth history of South Africa pointing out key landmarks and even sharing her personal experiences as a native. Her tour is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town!

The only way to experience the food and wine culture of Cape Town. I can't imagine seeing Cape Town and wine country without the the guidance of Cape Fusion Tours. If you love food and wine, Pam is a magician! Our experience was beyond what we hoped for. The time that Pam spent in advance of our trip determining what we wanted to see/do made all the difference. We can't wait to come back for more time adventuring with Cape Fusion Tours.

Wonderful introduction. Anine was our tour guide and she was excellent, nothing too much trouble. We had several email exchanges before arriving so our trips were tailor made for us. Anine was very easy to get on with and took us around the Cape Peninsular on our first day taking us around the coast to Cape Point & Cape of Good hope, we saw the Penguins at Boulders Bay - just a quick visit, very touristy but has to be done, We took in all the sights along the way stopping here and there at places of interest and had a late lunch at Harbour House in Kalk Bay. All Excellent. On our second day Anine took us into Stellenbosch and we visited 3 wine farms, all different, all beautiful. We also had some time in Stellenbosch Town itself which is very pretty full of cafe culture & art galleries. Lunch in La Petite Ferme was delicious. We also visited Babylonstoren an Organic Farm & finally truth coffee in the city which was very interesting. Anine stayed with us until 7.30pm on the second day giving us notes on where to go for the rest of our stay. Very helpful & very kind. Would highly recommend.

A fantastic, fun day in the wine lands.. Before arriving, I exchanged friendly and informative emails with Pam, who helped us plan a great wine tour. Anine was our guide for the day and she was brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend them if you want a wonderful, relaxed and enjoyable day wine tasting. Anine is a lovely and lively lady who pays attention to detail. The extra touches are what makes this company do special. We did a wine and olive oil tasting (fantastic!) and then a wine and chocolate pairing before lunch at La Petite Ferme. We did our final post lunch tasting at a place practically next door. It did cost a little more than a few places I looked but the service was exceptional and absolutely worth it. If we return to Cape Town I would definitely use them for another of their tours as they all sound great! Thanks for a great experience.

Forget 5 stars this review should be 6....& some!....Anine you were yet another star!. Excellent food walking adventure with Anine from ‘Cape Fusion Tours’ which offered so much more than just a foodie experience. We strolled the streets of Cape Town and were introduced to the melting pot of cultures, history, ate a variety of street foods & met some wonderfully interesting people. Such as Christophe, owner of a wine tasting establishment ‘Dorrance’ located in the courtyard of a gorgeous boutique establishment ‘Cape Heritage Hotel’ where the oldest vine in the Southern Hemisphere still thrives & David a highly respected local chef who specialises in traditional black South African food such as Pap & Samp & Beans for the locals. An interesting & revealing encounter where he explained with passion & pride the basic food from his & Nelson Mandelas heritage then prepared us tapas size portions of his home style fare.
