We opted for the 6 day adventure tour with cape extreme and we didn't know fully what to expect - but when you have such a talented tour guide called lourence pritourius who finds a way to bring 9 people from different backgrounds travelling together to become friends then you know your in for a trip of a life time - we saw the most amazing parts of south africa coupled with wildlife you won't see elsewhere in the world (see pics) everyday we set out and travelled to different areas such as the most southerly point on the continent of Africa where the Indian ocean meets the Atlantic ocean - at no point were we ever rushed from one place to another and often stopped along the way to take great group pictures - there was no low point of this trip and I'm happy to answer any questions from fellow travellers thinking about the trip we just completed - Lourence 'Luvrence' Pretorius really did make the trip by mixing with everyone and i hope one day he will travel over to Ireland and we can repay the generosity- to the other guys i travelled with i do hope to see ye in Dublin sometime for a Guinness

Very accommodating and activity packed tour. Man, what an amazing tour. Filled with great people and an EXCEPTIONAL tour guide (shoutout to you Lourens). Every day felt full of activities, it was really quite exhausting in the best way possible. Lourens went out of his way to make sure we had fun, whether it be scheduling new activities or just comical banter. Trip of a lifetime.

ATVing and Sandboarding . We had a wonderful time with Werner! He was knowledgable about Cape Town and played great music for us along the way! He offered to take pictures of us and gave us snacks and water on our way home. Definitely recommend. It was an experience we will never forget!

Cape to Addo 4 day tour 4 - 7 July 2016. This is by far my most memorable travel experience. Lourens Pretorius is a top notch tour guide who went above and beyond to ensure everyone enjoyed the tour. Even more, his infectious personality made it virtually impossible for anyone to have a bad time. His candor was even more refreshing. He resisted the urge to baffle the "tourists" with BS. He said honestly when he did not have the answer to a question. And he did not give false information to seem more knowledgeable. And he was as accommodating to everyone equally. Truly made the trip that much more enjoyable.

Well run company with an even greater staff. While in Cape Town, we used Cape Xtreme to complete half day adventures, like abseiling from Table Mountain, which was wonderful. After, we had a three day tour with the Cape Xtreme crew where we were able to visit a game reserve, an elephant sanctuary, go bungee jumping, and cage diving with great white sharks. They were extremely well organized tours that provided all of the logistical support and transportation back and forth from hostel to adventure sight. The staff was hysterical and was always there to provide a laugh. I would go through Cape Xtreme again in a heartbeat, for a relaxing way of getting the most done in a short time with great people!

Best part of our trip. My friend and I completed the Cape to Addo six day tour and it was an amazing experience. Nico, our guide, was awesome and always made sure we were having a good time. If you go on this tour, do the bungee jump!
Cape Point Tour with Werner. Had a great time last weekend on the Cape Point Tour with Werner. He is extremely knowledgeable and an all around blast to spend the day with.

awesome 6 day cape to addo tour. I went on the 6 day and really really enjoyed it! you get to do a lot of stuff along the southern coast so the days are really full and exciting. definitely try the bunjy jump. our tour guide Machial was amazing can't think him enough for sharing all of his knowledge and really learning about South Africa. the tour is reasonably priced and all the add ins are quite fun other than the animal sanctuary which is just sad to see these beautiful animals locked away in cages. I would definitely like to see the tour take this off but other than that I had an amazing time!!!

Werner is AMAZING!!. The group that I traveled with was cursed at by a Cape Xtreme employee, which explains why I rated the company so low. However, I had the pleasure of having Werner as my tour guide and he was phenomenal. He was very knowledge about the places we traveled to and he was beyond kind, respectful, and engaging. Werner made my 2-day safari trip wonderful!

6 Day Garden Route Tour . Over my 3 and a half week (too short) adventure in South Africa the best part was our six day safari with our tour guide Nico. Nico was a wonderful time, knowledgable and enthusiastic about everything around him. Everything was well organized and we never felt rushed. The animal encounters, scenic views and my safari family will all be greatly missed. This was my first time with Cape Xtreme and definitely will not be my last! Thank you Cape Xtreme for the memories.

Cape to Addo Safari with Nico. This safari was an amazing experience. All the activities were well planned and organized such that nothing was rushed. Nico, our guide was amazing and made the experience unique with all the facts and stories he had about the places we went to and the things we saw.

2 Day Garden Route with Werner- AMAZING!. Earlier this month, I had the amazing opportunity of participating in CapeXtreme's 2 Day Garden Route Tour. This featured a game drive at Garden Route Game Lodge, a visit with the elephants at Indalu Game Reserve, and a trip to the Cango Wildlife Park. I spent six weeks in South Africa and this tour was easily one of top highlights on my trip. Our guide, Werner, was extremely knowledgeable, passionate about his country and the places that we were visiting, and had so much heart. He was a very open, friendly, and personable guide. After a short time, it really felt like he was just another well acquainted friend in our travel party who happened to know everything about everything. He told us stories of the places we were visiting, just driving through and so many interesting personal stories of his life in South Africa. It gave such a nice, personal touch to the tour. It added a real human element beyond "So this is this place...Any questions?" I'm so glad he was our guide! The tour itinerary is a MUST for any animal lovers and I'm very happy to say that all of these animal facilities are top notch! Excellent rescue and conservation efforts. You can feel good about the experience that you'll have with this tour as well as the experience that the animals that you meet are having too!While this was the only tour with Cape Xtreme that I had a chance to do, I would definitely take another (And hopefully longer!) tour with them when I return to South Africa. And trust me...when you go, you'll want to go back too!

Solid company that takes care of its clients. We were in Cape Town for 4 days in the beginning of June and one of bucket list items is to do the Great White Shark Cage dive. Since that is a weather dependent acitivtiy, I booked the Cage Diving tour and the Absolutely Unique Cape Peninsula Tour with Cape Xtreme with the request to switch the dates of my two tours if there are weather issues. Bronwyn was very repsonsive to my inquiries and confirmed they will be able to do that. The Shark Cage Diving tour (operated by White Shark Ventures) proceeded as scheduled, however we were only 30 minutes at sea when the operator indicated the winds picked up and they needed to turn the boat around. The other groups on the tour that booked with the operator were offered a voucher for another cage diving tour that most weren't able to take advantage of as they will not be in Capetown for the next scheduled dive. We also couldn't make the next scheduled dive and Cape Xtreme promptly refunded the Cage Diving portion of our tour costs within a week; the transportation costs were not refunded as it already occurred.We thoroughly enjoyed the The Absolutely Unique Cape Peninsula Tour. There were approximately 10 people total on this tour.

Solid and memorable experience. If you tell somebody you're even thinking of going to Capetown, their mouth drops in awe, as it's on everybody's bucket list. During my short (and not enough) two-week time volunteering there, I hopped onto my roommate's 3-day Garden Route tour. The scenery and location speak for themselves and it is crazy amazing (you roll to where Leo Decaprio has a home, interact with elephants, and even get a chance to dive with crocs and pet baby cheetahs). But, what made the tour is the tour guide, Gareth Dale. Solid man, who actually grew upon along the path of where the tour goes and knows his s****. Really friendly and flexible, never felt hurried or that it was "his" tour; rather, he molded to what the folk in the group (about 7 of us) had energy and a liking for, with obviously a goal of hitting the best parts. Great experience, great guide, and so glad I did it. HIGHLY recommended.

1 Day Tour and 2 Day Safari. I first used Cape Xtreme tours on the one day tour around the area, our guide was Lourens and he was so great. It was ideal, he knew exactly where to take us to see everything we needed in a nutshell. We were so satisfied that we then booked the two day weekend safari trip for the following weekend. It was seriously so great, Lourens is so friendly and knowledgable about the area. It was so much fun and I definitely recommend these tours to anyone who just wants to relax and see the main points without worrying about driving or getting lost. Also if you just want to have a good time and meet some new people, plus the Sedgefield house is really awesome! Thank you Cape Xtreme!!

An amazing time with Cape to Addo. We did the 1 day pennisula tour 2 day safari with Gareth, the tour guide. It was an amazing experience and definitely did not want to leave. The elephant encounter left me speechless! Truly amazing. Definitely a must when in Cape Town!

Cape Xtreme Quad Biking Reservations. Friends of mine are honeymooning in Cape Town, and as a wedding gift I wanted to contribute to their trip and book them an hour long quad biking adventure in the Atlantis Dunes through Cape Xtreme. When the date I requested was unavailable their amazing customer service team was able to help me book the next day and send a new confirmation without a hassle. Afterwards I immediately received a follow up email with directions, contact information suggested arrival time, travel time etc. to make getting from their hotel in Cape Town as easy as possible. Whether you are booking for yourself or a gift for others, I recommend Cape Xtreme. I hope my friends have just as positive of an experience when they go quad biking!
1 day and 2 day tours. We went on the 1-day Cape Point tour with Lourens and had so much fun that we decided to book a 2-day safari tour with Lourens the next weekend. It was awesome!

6 day Cape to Addo. Amazing 6 day tour full of scenic routes, animal encounters, adventure, friends and relaxation. The garden route is a must for any SA visitors. Got to meet and travel with an incredible group of people who made it an even better experience. Shout out to our awesome tour guide, Lourens Pretorius, for taking the trip to a whole new level.

Cape to Addo 4 day tour. This tour was amazing!! I'm really happy I booked it. I had a ton of fun with everything we did. Plus the people there made it that more special. Our tour guide was awesome as well. Highly recommend!
Garden route, bungee jump, zip wiring!!. The most amazing week, a fantastic guide and met some lovely people. The elephants were so gentle and friendly. Thank you

Great fun on the 3 day big game trip. Had such a good time with friends and probably one of the things that made it really great was our tour guide Werner, we all agreed on that, such passion and always motivated! Such a humbling experience to see the big 5 animals up close

Excellent tour company, our tour guide for the 3 day garden route safari. Great tour company, very well organised, great guide, worth every penny! Would recommend this to anybody visiting Cape Town. Safari was amazing!

Amazing 6 day garden route safari . Everything was perfect! A great way to travel along the garden route. Our tour guide Nico was amazing! He knew a lot about the places we were at and told us many interesting facts. He was always making us laugh and making sure we had a great time. You should totally do this tour and request Nico as your tour guide!!

Great way to travel and see the most of the Garden Route!. I booked a 6-day Tour with Cape to Addo and never regretted it! Our guide Machiel was great! He not only had a lot of knowledge that he passed on to us, but he made everything we did fun! In between and after the activities on schedule, he tailored the tour to our needs and wishes. We were a group of 10, consisting of 9 girls as this is a great and safe way for women travelling on their own. The tour bus is comfortable and spaceous, the hostels are great and well chosen! The activities were also nicely picked out, offering a great variety to consider everyone's needs, from thrill-seeking to chilling on the beach. Every day is always packed with things to do, without being stressful or overwhelming - it was always the right amount! Activities include canoeing, surfing, game drives, climbing/acro branching, bungee jumping, elephant interaction, shark cage diving and many more. Basically everything the garden route has to offer! (Maybe a suggestion to the organisers: skip Tsitsikamma scenic walk to have more time in Jeffrey's bay for e.g. beach horse rides etc). I have absolutely nothing to object and would recommend Cape to Addo and Cape Xtreme Tours without hesitation!

Garden Route 4-day. In general good value. We were 7 guests and to guides in the Toyota van so plenty of space to move around and change seats when you liked to learn to know new friends.The two different hostels we stayed at for the three nights had good bunks, clean sheets and good order at night time - I slept well. The hostel at Jeffrey's bay is placed right above the beach with a stunning view over the ocean and 2 minutes walk to the water! Breakfasts and dinners included were ok - you weren't hungry. Lunches at the gas stations were bad - fatty and with no taste so ask the guides to try and find other places..! Included activities like the Cango Caves adventure tour and the Elephant sanctuary were good and the extras like the 216 m bungy jump and zip lining over nice waterfalls was very good. I changed the game drive for surf lesson and got a very professional teacher which, sad to say, didn't help..:-)Last line - you get more than you pay for with this tour

Peninsula Full Day Tour. I had booked this tour well in advance. Lovely experience with our caring guide Bianca.Amazing view of Cape of Good Hope, Penguin Colony at Boulders along with some other beautiful beaches. Enjoyed every moment of the tour. Thanks Bronwyn for all the arrangements!

Cape Point, Penguins & Constantia. We had a great day out on this tour which is one of the least extreme tours offered! Nadia was our guide and driver and she was helpful and informative. The tour started with a traditional breakfast muffin and walk in Boo Kaap, on to Camps Bay, driving the coast road with spectacular scenery to Cape Point. Next stop Boulders Beach to see the penguins - swimming with them was not available as it was the wrong season. Then on to Kalk Bay for a great fish and chips lunch, and finally Constantia winelands for a wine tasting. A great day out with plenty to see and do. Highly recommended

1 day sandboarding and paragliding trip. This was SO MUCH FUN!!! I'd never been skiing or snowboarding before, but it was surprisingly easy to learn how to sandboard. Our guide, Lourens, was a good teacher...and very patient! Paragliding was really cool - the views from Signal Hill were fantastic!All transportation between events was taken care of and the guides had snacks. I would HIGHLY recommend scheduling a tour with this company.

AMAZING! 2 Day Safari. We booked this 2 day safari online before our visit to Cape Town, We were picked up from our hotel at 5:00am on 5/9/15 by Garreth, who was brilliant and very informative on the road, even when everyone else was sleeping he noticed that I was still awake and he continued to inform me of where we were and what to look out for. When we arrived at the safari site we changed vehicle and started our adventure where for a small fee we met,fed and walked with the elephants, it was amazing. We moved onto another site and for another small fee where we were issued with wellies and a stick and walked with the lions, they were huge but amazing. We got brilliant pictures, as the guide took our phone. not the usual when you usually go places and they try and sell you their pictures.We met back up with Garreth and he took us to the house that we were all staying in, which was great and very comfortable. We met loads of interesting people who were also staying there and doing different tours. Here we met the other tour guides one being Gavin who was also very nice and made everyone welcome. Between them they prepared a barbeque and we all sat catching up before we headed to the beach bar, which was a good end to a brilliant day.The next day we left at 7:15 and headed to Cango Wildlife Ranch, this was another great place to visit and seen a lot of interesting animals, where you can also pay a small fee to have an encounter with some. Before heading back Garreth took us to a great wee place for lunch, where we had the most amazing milkshakes.Even when we headed back to Cape Town his still continued to inform us about the scenery and what to look out for (baboons being one of them). We arrived back at out hotel after the best two days we as a family have ever had.I would highly recommend this company as the tour was very reasonably priced and very professional, as if the rest of the tour guides are as good as Garreth you will be in very good hands.{You may even be lucky and get him}
Best 3 day tour, ever!. We loved the 3 day Garden Route Extreme tour! The guide was great, the experiences incredible, the house nice and all the staff super friendly and helpful :)

Tour Guide Nico & Lorry are my favorites!. My experience was unbelievably awesome. The tour guides were the best people ever, experiences made even better! The people I met on the tour were the most fun and definitely added to my upbeat memories created throughout the tour. Every experience made me feel alive and I am so grateful I was able to achieve all that I did with such an awesome crew. Nico was my tour guide for the three day safari, and was luckily able to meet Lorry on our excursion and later on was my tour guide for the one day Cape tour. These guys were always smiling and full of jokes, always had me having a good time and definitely made some life long friends throughout this experience. I would not suggest any other tour company, there are many other AMAZING tour guides I got to meet and hang out with. Love love love them all!

TOUR GUIDE LORRY IS THE BEST. We only had about a day and a half in the wonderful Cape Town and our tour guide Lorry made them the best of our 12 day trip. We did the Cape Peninsula tour which was one full day with lunch and hotel pickups included and our half day we did the best winery tour ever! Lorry had the day off and suggested we go to the winery area to have some wine, cheese, chocolate and beer tastings. He was very hysterical- we all learned so much about Cape Town because of him! He made everything so convenient for us we even got dropped off at the airport feeling great about our vacation and the few tastings we had ;)

Shark Cage Diving. Although our trip was cancelled due to bad weather, everyone at Cape Xtreme could not have been nicer. From booking to handling the refund, everyone answered our questions and had wonderful customer service.

Peninsula tour is a must do in Cape Town!. We had already hiked Table Mountain and only had a day and half in Cape Town with so many things we wanted to see! In order to squeeze it all in we signed up for the peninsula tour and it was an awesome way to see Cape Town. We went to Camps Bay and took beautiful pictures. The whole bus tour also provided beautiful views of the ocean and mountains. We then went to Cape of Good Hope and walked up to the lighthouse. We also went to Boulders beach to see the pennguins!! Lunch was included in Simons Town as well. We also went to Bo-Kaap to see the beautifully colored houses. The tour also included a delicious wine tasting at a local winery!! This tour was a great way to see Cape Town and learn all about the area. We had such a great day and enjoyed our tour guide Lorry so much that we booked a half day wine tour the next day. The wine tour included wine tasting at two different places, cheese tasting, chocolate tasting, lunch, and a everlasting!

Always an experience. This is my second time travelling with Cape to Addo and I still find it incredibly fun and breathtakingly beautiful how you present our country. It was always good to know that you were always trying to support us and make things easier for us even though how small the task might be. Your professionalism and knowledgeable staff made the trip a thing people will never forget. The well planned trip and flexibility of everything was a combination well suited for anyone. I would recommend anyone to have a go at this simply magnificent experience. On a personal not I would like to thank Lourens and Nadia for making the Cape to Addo tour something I, specifically the students, a time they will never forget as long as they live. Your support to me and my colleagues is something to aspire to. Thanks guys and I didn't sleep through the trip again.

ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!. Where do I even begin?! 7 of us booked the Peninsula Tour and we could NOT have had a more perfect day! The Table Mountain hike was incredible (we couldn't abseil because of the weather conditions), sand boarding was a blast, and capping it off with surfing in Muizenburg was fantastic. Our guide, Gareth was the BEST! He made the day absolutely unforgettable! He was patient, entertaining, and full of the local knowledge and shared Cape Town recommendations for all of us. This tour is worth every penny!! And if you can, request Gareth, you won't regret it!!! Thank you for the highlight of our Cape Town visit!

Incredible week !. We had a fantastic week full of interesting activities and a load of fun. The schedule is really well organized, we saw nice landscapes, a lot of wild animals trought Addo Park, Lions Walk, Elephant ridding, Cango Wildlife Ranch and we had our quota of aventure with cannoying and budgy jumping. Special thanks to Lourens and Toni who made that week awesome. And of course, thank you to the office who is scheduling everything during this 6 days.
Had a blast!. Used this company when going paragliding with the group. Our tour guide, Jimmy, was awesome! So funny and entertaining!

Used them twice! - (Almost) Perfect!. The first time we used this company was for the Peninsula Tour. During this tour, you get to see the colorful Bo Kaap houses, Hout Bay, Camps Bay, Chapman's peak drive, Cape of Good Hope, Boulders beach (penguin colony), Simon's Town, Kalk bay (lunch time, meal included) and finish your day tasting wine in Constantia. Totally worth it, so many pictures to be taken, and probably some of the best scenaries I've had the chance to see.We liked our day some much that we decided to book later on our trip the Garden Route tour for 3 days with this tour operator as well. Although you must be aware that this is a long drive from Cape Town, the activities were totally worth the wait. On your first day, you get to see wild animals in a game reserve, then have the chance to walk with the lions. On the second day, you first visit the farmers' market where you can buy souvenirs and food. After, you are heading to Bloukrans Bridge for the highest bungy jump. You will also have the chance to ride and walk with elephants in a sanctuary during the same day. Finally on your third day, you'll visit the spectacular Cango Caves. This is like a marathon of activities and the guide will offer you to add some more if you have spare time. You can also go after dinner if you are up to it. They have a private hostel, but you need to share a dorm during your two nights... unless you pay more for a private room. The only negative point, they had no wifi in the bus, even though they said they would. Not a big deal when you consider all the stuff I did, but I like companies that stick to their promise and the ride what quite long.. Wifi is avalaible in the hostel though.Although this whole tour was quite expensive (knowing you must pay each activities separately from the booking price), this was the best time I've had during my six-week journey in Cape Town. Small group, fun atmosphere, crazy activities, knowlegeable guide, MUST RECOMMAND!!!

Peninsula - Well Worth it!. The tour is great, but the tour guide is what MAKES the tour. Our tour guide Gareth was absolute best. He must have been tired from the same tour the day before but he gave it his all and capped our trip to Cape Town in the best way possible. THANK YOU!

Fun in the Sun!. Sand boarding in the dunes was a fun afternoon activity. It was hot and sunny but felt cool as the sand is cooled underneath by water, so you could even go barefoot. The boards that you just velcro to your feet are better than the ones with snowboarding bindings. It is a little bit hard to turn, but it was also fun just to slide down sitting on the boards.

Truly the best way to see the best of South Africa. We can't imagine a better way to spend our week in South Africa. You get to see so much with this tour company. And unlike the other tour companies a lot of the excursions are fairly active. So you don't feel like a fat slob after a week of sitting on the bus. I highly recommend Cape to Addo.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Great tour at a great value. Lori was a great tour guide and very knowledgeable about the area. He gave us plenty of time at all the stops to walk around and take pictures. He stopped at one of the local markets and bought us a variety of local snack which were very tasty. The Fish and Chip lunch was wonderful.  Overall it was a great day.

Had a great time - Garden route tour. I (solo traveller) was with a group of young girls for the three days garden route tour. Though I was the only one from older age group, I never felt left out. We had plenty of activities, long scenic drives, good food and good guide- James. Nadia from the company was also there for the trip and she also contributed to make the trip enjoyable for everyone. The guide went the extra mile to accommodate my requests and saw to it that I was comfortable. He was always there to accompany me whenever he could when I did the Birds of Eden as the rest of the group had gone to the elephant park. We had lot of fun during the trip and we could manage all the planned activities within the short span of time. Thank you James and Nadia.All the girls did the bungee jumping and I had my fun watching them! Food at the B&B was simple and home cooked and very tasty . I really enjoyed both the dinners.If you have less time for sight seeing in SA, then I would recommend this well organised tour.I also did the shark cage diving tour arranged by Cape to Addo. It was also well organised and saw many sharks at close quarters.Stephanie from the office was in touch with me, followed up with me thro email while planning the trip. It was really a pleasant experience planning my trip with her. Thank you Cape to Addo for the memorable trip

Quad biking on sand dunes. Great time on the sand dunes despite it really raining. The guide was mindful of going an appropriate pace for the group but only stopped once to get pictures. Really good fun and value for money, the only thing that could have made it better (apart from the sun!) would have been letting us free at the end to go at our own pace as my husband was stuck behind me in the line at my speed. Great company, professional and good communication, would definitely book with them again next time we are in Cape Town!

sandboarding and quadbike. Fun tour all around. The sandboarding was a unique thing to check out, particularly since none of us have snowboarded before. Got sand just about everywhere but it was a fun time. The quadbikes were also fun to ride around on. Got a great tour of the dunes and got to pick up some speed. Unfortunately the bikes weren't in the best shape. They stalled out on us many times and the guide had to get them going. A little maintenance would have made this part of the trip more enjoyable.

Best service out of all our operators. I feel the need to give praise to Stephanie who works at reservations at Cape to Addo :) I work at a Travel Agency that books a lot of Garden Route and Kruger Tours and I can honestly say Stephanie from Cape To Addo gives me the best service! I don't even recommend other safari companies to my clients anymore. She is fast, efficient and very friendly! Always on the ball! Their tours are also great and I have never gotten a complaint from my clients.Should you wish to see more of the Garden Route or Kruger Park do not even look at other companies. Choose Cape to Addo! And thanks Stephanie for making us Travel Agents job easy and fun! Nicole - Neelsie Travel Stellenbosch

Amazing day tour!. I and some friends enjoyed a day tour from Cape Town, via Camps Bay, Cape of the good hope and much more. We got to see all the highlights of the small towns in the cape town area. Perfect especially if you don't have much time in town because you get all the highlights that are hard to find on your own. Included the penguins, wine tasting, lunch and wine tasting. Good value for your money!

3 day weekend blast. hola!! I did the 3 day weekend garden route tour - was good squiz along the costal route to garden route and back by little karoo. we had gareth who was informative guide, good music, and good craic in the pub at night. yes I would recommend, a lot crammed into the 3 days but still plenty of time to relax.go for it!!!

Amazingly Awesome African Experience. Being on tour with these guys is an experience to remember. All the guides are qualified and they are tons of fun to be with. Cape to Addo is your guaranteed ticket for a truly African experience.

Cape to Addo 7 day tour. My sister and I (both seniors) joined a wonderful group of young travelers for a fantastic week of culture, adventure and lots of laughs along The Garden Route. Lourens was a fantastic guide and excellent driver, with a great sense of humor. We hiked in beautiful national parks, met lots of ostriches which some tried to ride, we partied and tried lots of beers en route, we ziplined, walked with and rode beautiful elephants and walked with lions. Many of our group bungee jumped, some took surf lessons and we all had fun. We had a great day in Addo Elephant National Park and fantastic canoeing and hiking in a wilderness area. Accommodation was good, Avoca B&B set amidst citrus orchards along the Sunday River was a stand out and our location on the beach at Jeffreys Bay was lovely.

Cape Peninsula Tour. It was amazing! Everyone should do this. We saw the whole peninsula, did some hiking, amazing views, beaches, penguins, delicious fish and chips, wine tasting. Great times! Oh yea n James is the man!

Cape Peninsula Tour - A cool jam-packed day!. We traveled all over the Cape, and crammed in loads: Cape Point, coastal drive, Township visit, wine tasting, penguin spotting, and fish and chips in one of the harbors! What made it more enjoyable were the other folk. Very welcoming, and tour guide Lourens and his mate had a good vibe about them too.

Fantastic - highly recommended!. I did the 5 day Cape to Addo, and absolutely loved it. I only wish I could have done the 7 days. My tour guide was Lourens Pretorius and he was excellent. The thing that stood out about Lourens "Lourie" was that he always went the extra mile to make sure everyone on tour was happy and having a great time. He is very experienced and knowledgable, and made each day loads of fun (also played great music in the bus). The accommodation was excellent and the daily activities were awesome. Walking with the lions and elephants, canoeing and hiking to a waterfall, zip lining, bungee jumping and an amazing game drive made this trip one of the best I have done. I would recommend this tour, and this company to anyone. I will be back!

7 Days Garden Route Tour Amazing !!!. Thank You for the Tour, it was a very good experience. I met different people, saw different landscape, one time you are in the city and one hour later you are in the desert (when i didn t sleep) ! I am very happy because I have my picture with Lion's baby ! Backpackers were nice too !Louhrens was a very good guide, he explained a lot of things about landscapes and animals, he is friendly and if we have a problem he is here to help you. Thank you for the trip !!!!!

The mist amazing week I've ever had. From 3-10-2014 / 3-16-2014 I did the garden tour, with Laurens as a guide. I did so many things that's almost to much to tell. We did a walk with lions and were able to touch them, the same for elephants. It's really an experiance you will not forget for the rest of your life. Laurens knows a lot of facts about the nature and the animals, what makes the trip really interesting. Beside of that he is a dedicated gide, who does everything for the clients to have an unforgettable trip

Awesome trip with Lourens. It was an awesome trip along the garden route. We were a mix of different nations ( France, Belgium, Italian Swiss, Netherlands and Germany). We walked with 6 month old lions, touchElephants, did a bungee jump, we zip lined, and on our game drive we saw a 'buffalo rhino'and. During our tours and dinner we had interesting and funny chats about different themes. Lourdes looked after everybody and did his best that we all had a good time. I can highly recommend this tour with Lourdes.Such a great trip. Thank you!

Cape to Awesome!. My boyfriend and I did the Cape to Addo trip and it was one of the highlights of our trip to South Africa. It was a great way to see South Western South Africa and for a reasonable price. The tour includes a few extra activities, but also brings you to lots of excursions(you pay extra for, but prices are very reasonable) allowing you to do a lot in such a short time frame. We won the lottery on tour guides with getting Lourens. If you have time to wait for a good guide -- get this guy. We went on several excursions while we were in Africa and this guy was our favorite. He was extremely helpful, accommodating, funny, and when we needed anything - which we were no short on asking for favors - he always delivered. Don't pass up a chance to try the 7 day package :) Two thumbs way up!

Perfect trip for backpackers!. Cape to Addo is a perfect chance to get to know the Western Cape. It is (compared to others) so cheap and you'll get in touch with so many other people. In our tour bus, we had 9 different nationalities. You stay in really good accommodation near beaches or other beautiful landscapes. In my opinion the tour is very good planned, because you are starting at the ocean to see whales or dolphins, later riding on through the beautiful landscape of the "route 62", then watching animals in parks or national parks (addo elephant park).To be honest, we weren't really convinced of doing a group tour at the beginning, because we are not the kind of people who want to have a plan in holiday. But we realised that this is the best way to get to know new people, to get around very cheap and to get the first touch with South Africa. And now, to be honest again: it was a great decision. We found new friends (you are travelling with a majority of young backpacker), had great fun (like ostriche riding, kayaking, hiking, cage diving with crocodiles, etc.) and had an awesome guide: he was a great cook, driver, guide and also a friend. He always tried to please everybody and also told us really cool facts about South Africa and the locations we visited.We are still talking about this trip and won't forget the fun we had. We are really convinced about it, so I don't see a reason not to book it when you are in Cape Town, looking forward to have fun, facts, animals and South Africa as you want it!

A wonderful week traveling along the Garden Route. My husband and I, both seniors, opted for this budget safari even though the company warned us that our traveling companions would much younger than us and that the tour was geared to a younger age bracket. We took the 7 day Cape to Addo tour in January 2014 and we enjoyed every minute of it. Our driver and guide Nico picked us in Hermanus where we were staying with friends and we then met our traveling companions. They hailed from Argentina, Brazil, the UK and the Netherlands, and we all enjoyed one another's company throughout the entire trip. We spent 7 interesting and adventure filled days together. The program was varied, balanced, and interesting. We watched our companions bungee jump from the Bloukrans bridge, joined them zip lining, hiking, and swimming in some of the beautiful beaches where we stopped along the way. The itinerary followed the Garden Route and included visits to many natural wonders, such as the Cango Caves. Our trip culminated in the visit of Addo Elephant Park where we took an early morning game drive with a park ranger during which we saw lions, tens of elephants, jackals, zebras, etc, followed by another drive with Nico who took us to another section of the park where we saw many more wild animals. The accommodations where we spent the nights were all comfortable, clean, and well situated. The guest house at Sedgefield was located near the beautiful Myoli beach where the owner of the company Gavin, and Nico our guide drove us before dinner, for a memorable swim in the sunset. Everything about this trip was enjoyable and Nico spent a lot of energy to insure that everyone was comfortable and had a good time. His efforts were successful. It was a wonderful trip.
Amazing trip. I would recommend to do that tour with lourens. It was an amazing trip with a really interesting guide.

Of the beaten Track Wine tour delight. All I have to say is Jimmy (James)! That may sound strange, but this tour guide and driver is a true gem to have around. Very knowledgeable, patient, insightful and funny character. We booked (Rather late, as usual with my family) for a wine tour of the Winelands region of Western Cape, and gladly my endless search directed me Revel who went out of their way to accomodate my large party on a one day notice of intention to partake on a tour. The tour took us to Paarl, stellenbosh and Franschoek regions to some fantastic wine tasting venues (Not the commercially known wineries, but some true hidden gems of the region) for some vino tasting and interesting pairings with not only food but chocolates and cheeses (Try the Marble cheese from Fairview). Jimmy Took us off the beaten track for some insightful and knowledgeable tastings and visiting, even going as far as taking us to see the prison from which the Great Madiba was released from (not Robben Island for all you self appointed Mandela fundis out there), which was off the tour route but worth the visit, and even at a stage assisting on one of the wineries to provide us with information on the wines being served (yes by him as well), to which i might add was delightful and surprising and he kept all in a familiar tone and funny. Revel went out of the way to provide us with a modified rate to accomodate us and not just sticking to the price is this take it or leave policy that some other operators stick to. I recommend you give these chaps a call to book you next tour. I am definitely putting these guys on my speed dial to kill off some items of my bucket list. (Do read the funny captions on the back of their tour buses - Hilarious)

A Fascinating Journey. Martin Hitge picked us up at our hotel in Capetown on a Sunday morning and we soon got acquainted with a group of delightful traveling companions from Austalia, Brazil and the UK. We were in for a fascinating and varied travel experience. Our first stop was Hermanus, the world's whale watching capitol. We then visited Cape Agulhas, Africa's southernmost point, where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet. Monday's highlight was a visit to the Cango Caves near Oudtshorn, South Africa's ostrich center. That evening we were treated to ostrich steaks from a local ranch. They were delicious, like eating a very tender beef steak. Other highlights included a stop at the Bloukrans Bridge, where some of the younger members of our party partook in the world's highest bungie jump. A hike along the coast in Tsitsikamma National Park on a rainy morning provided spectaucular views of a rugged coast, a chance to see many wildflowers and rock hyrax, the closet living relative of elephants. Game drives in Addo Elephant National Park provided an opportunity to see large herds of buffalo and elephants as well as zebra, kudo, warthogs, jackals and other animals. A special treat was a stop at Botlierskop Farms where we had the opportunity to walk with Mufasa and Lyla, a pair of young, very well trained lions. We could even pet Lyla on the rump. Our accomodations were backpacker lodges. They were simple but clean and comfortable. Martin, it was a great trip. We would do it again. Many many thanks.Bill and Pat CieslaFort Collins, Colorado, USA

Fantastic!!!!!. A highly recommended tour and our tour guide Lourens made sure that the experience was memorable. Informative and accommodating throughout, he joined in some activities like Bungee jumping , zip wiring and para-gliding and showed he was as thrilled as the rest of us at the experience. We were part of an interesting mix of people - all ages and nationalities and we gelled and had great times. The Safari,Walking with Lions and other wildlife experiences were truly awe inspiring!!! Photography enthusiasts will be in their element.Varied accomodation was good and the food was excellent - some of it cooked by Lourens - some exotic meats on the braai! A wonderful trip. Thank you.

A great week with an awesome guide. A bit if trepidation when being picked up in Cape Town for a week with a bunch if strangers. However within a few minutes of the minibus full of eight nationalities making up the eleven string group chatter started and we all started to take the mick out if each other's stereotypes; the German efficiency, volume of the yanks etc. Martin our guide was just great, very accommodating of the various activities the group wanted to do ( mainly making sure we got to the pili pili beach bar in sedgefield!) and very informative of the various places we passed through. He was even a half decent cook! We stayed at some great hostels with one overlooking the sands of Jeffery's Bay. Three nights spent at a house in sedgefield that the company had bought. This was our least favourite overnight stop although the BBQ on the last night was good. The minibus is ok but a little cramped when full. The distances are long covering over 2000km in total. Very varied places and activities. Social highlight was beating Martin at beerpong on the last night! Some really fab photos of a week to remember forever. Oh, and did I mention Martin?!

Amazing Experience!. Our day tour down to Cape Hope and everywhere in between was amazing and so much fun! Most of the credit goes to our fantastic tour guide, James, who made the day a blast with his knowledge, fun personality, and easy going spirit. He made sure we learned about the history, as well as saw all aspects of Cape Town and the surrounding areas. He made our first time visit to Cape Town and South Africa a wonderful experience. Thank you, James...you rock! Dave & Vanessa

7 day Cape to Addo tour (Garden Route). Booked this 7 day tour with my partner & had a great week. We've never done an organised tour before & we were very impressed with our guide Martin & the various accommodation we stayed in. We enjoyed a week of different activities and seeing many sights & wildlife on the way. Martin was a great guide, informative, helpful & looked after the group well. There were 11 of us from 8 different countries, so it was a really mixed group and everyone got on well and we had some good laughs together. If you want to see as much as you can in 1 week then do this tour, u won't regret it.
Peninsula tour fun. We had a great time with Lorry! Wine, penguins, great sites! Lorry- the best modern american country - Zac Brown Band - listen to it!! Thanks for the great day buddy!

FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE!. This is my first time in South Africa and I was not sure what to expect. We booked this company and had James for 2 days with our group. He was just phenomenal! Really funny and personable and knew a whole lot about the area. He was really flexible as well as adjustable to all the different personalities in our group. I definitely recommend this company and especially James!

Fantastic!!!. We booked a tour through this company - they assigned us a wonderful guide by the name of James. He was knowledgable about the area and history, was also very accommodating! We had a large group and he was able to accommodate all of our needs. Request him if you book through this company! Amazing tour!!

Amazing 3 Day Garden Route Tour. Travelled to SA for a month, and this trip was easily the highlight of my entire trip. The 3 day Garden Route tour is absolutely amazing and worth every penny. It's incredible how much these tour guides put into the itinerary and the amount that we accomplished in 3 days..... Definite highlights were the Bloukrans Bungee Jump and the Cango Caves. Shout out to Garreth and Gavin, amazing tour guides, had a great time with everyone on this trip and recommend it to anyone in the Cape Region!

amazing weekend. The three day Garden Route tour is an amazing experience, which I would recommend to everyone! It is crazy how much fun things you can do in one weekend. In the three day trip, I saw the famous African big five on a beautiful safari trip, I walked with lions, played with tiger cubs, rode on an elephant and jumped from the highest bungee in the world! The friendly tour guides and the fun tour group made the trip even greater! Thanks a lot guys, it was a great experience!

Cape to Addo was the best way to see the coast in 7 days!. We travelled from Cape Town to Port E and back again with Cape to Addo and it was an absolute blast!!! We travelled in a 12 passenger van and there was 7 of us. More then enough room for all our stuff and super comfortable to travel. The days were full of fun adventure sights (ie. zip lining, safaris, bungee jumping, canoeing, beer tasting) but there was also enough time for us to relax and enjoy the beaches. The choices of backpackers were infinitely beyond my expectations with unique vibes and comfortable rooms. Our guide was knowledgeable and interesting. I made our booking online without any problems. As a whole the company was accommodating and helpful. Would totally recommend!

Definitely the right thing for young people to do. I came back on Sunday from the 3 Day Garden Route Tour and I must say that this is the most amazing thing I have done here so far. We were picked up on Friday morning by our tour guide to drive to our first stop, a Game Reserve, to do a Safari. We saw lions, elephants, zebras, giraffes and other animals. It was really cool because you get really close to the animals, especially the giraffes. After that we went to a place where we had the chance to walk with the lions. This was an amazing experience! The lions were really calm and I was not afraid at all. We even got the chance to touch them, and I took a lot of cool pictures.On the second day, we went to an Elephant Sanctuary, where we could walk with the elephants. Later on, we were allowed to take a ride on them. We also went to see (and experience) the highest Bungee in the world at the Bloukrans Bridge. For all those people who are adventurous, this is the right thing to do! People who did not want to jump could still enter the bridge and see their group members facing the fear. The team on the bridge was very cool; they were very encouraging and even had a DJ table. The music really helped and got us in a party mood so that we would not get too anxious about the jump.On Sunday, we could choose between the Cango Caves and the Cango Wildlife Park. I went to the Wildlife Park where I was shown all the different animals, but the coolest thing was that I got the chance to pet a tiger! The whole trip was an amazing experience. I got so many chances to do things that I have never done before. The time you spend in the car to get from one activity to another goes by so quickly, because we were driving through the most beautiful landscapes. Our tour guides were very keen to make this trip a unique experience. They were very helpful and made sure we had a lot of fun. You could always go for a beer with them after the trips, so it felt like a big group of friends instead of tourists and tour guides. All in all, this tour absolutely is the right thing to do if you’re young and looking for an adventure. After the trip, you will have so many cool pictures to make your friends back home jealous! ;) I also checked other tours on their website. There are a lot of other things to do such as a Surf & Safari Tour or a Wine & Whales Tour. Just check out their website, there will definitely be something that you will like!

Would definitely book through Cape Xtreme / Revel Adventures again!. My boyfriend & I were very impressed with the service we received from Cape-Xtreme / Revel Adventures Day Tours.We came to Africa on 3rd March and pre-booked all our tours and activities through Cape Xtreme. Our contact, Pinda, was always really helpful and even during our stay she has kept in touch, has been incredibly informative, honest and friendly. She has been really genuine throughout and has helped us to fulfil our trip to the best it could be.We did cancel one of our planned activities (we decided in the end that one was too far away), and Pinda kindly arranged for us to go on a complementary sunset cruise followed by a 3 course evening meal at City Grill as she knew we were spending the day at the waterfront. It was so thoughtful of her, and we even saw some southern right whales even though it's not the right season for whale watching.Both Pinda and James Adams (our tour guide) have made our trip truly amazing and bothare incredible assets to this company. We will definitely be recommending Cape Xtreme / Revel, and when we come back to South Africa we will definitely be contacting your company first!Thanks again to you and your wonderful staff for making our visit toAfrica everything it could have been and more :)

Great day out!. I went sand boarding with Revel and had a fantastic time! I had not tried it before, but the guide was great and gave good instruction. I was picked up from the hostel and dropped back off later in the day. I would definitely sand board again through this company.

The most stunning day out you could ever ask for!. By the time I leave Cape Town, this will have been one of the most memorable days out during my stay. The views are stunning, the day is relaxed and chilled aswell as educating. One of the highlights for me personally was getting up close and personal to Ostriches! It is just a brilliant day and well worth the money as the views are one of a kind.
A picturesque tourist photo spot. Nice to be able to get a photo of Table Mountain from a distance in the photo frame. Beautiful to say the least!

A whole day to Cape Point with DC Tours. We booked via Internet a full day tour to Cape Point with DC Tours-Darren Combrink. I must say we had a fantastic tour from 8 a.m. to about 6 p.m. with Darren. He explained every thing to us, was so much helpful, answered all our questions. It was so nice to be with him. He had arranged a table for us at Two Oceans Restaurant were we had a very good lunch. Before driving home to our Lodge, Darren arranged for us a wine tasting at Groot Constantia, which we liked very much. We were very happy for choosing DC Tours. The 4 Guys from Germany
Great Cape Town and Kirstenbosh tours. Fantastic. Darren went out of his way to accommodate my elderly Mother and made it absolutely special for both of us. Thank you

Great private guide in Cape Town and surroundings. Darren is a very knowledgeable guide and extremely pleasant. We enjoyed all three days with him.He understood what we liked to do and also stopped at three really good restaurants with excellent food. An added bonus is the fact that he took almost 80 photos that he sent us on Dropbox. I can highly recommend him.

Fantastic Private Tour. I recently visited Joburg for business and decided to extend my stay and visit Cape Town for the first time. Before departing for my trip I contacted DC Tours based upon the reviews and signed up on-line for the Cape Peninsula Coastal Delight tour. Sign-up was simple and I had regular contact via email from Darren prior to the day of the tour. It was a Sunday and he met me at my hotel right on time. I was amazed to find out that I was the only person on the tour that day! I wouldn't have blamed Darren if he had cancelled on me but I'm glad he didn't as it turned out to be a fantastic private tour. Overall, I echo what all of the other reviewers have said. The sights are fantastic, the food at Two Oceans was outstanding, and Darren's a very safe driver with a very nice van. But most of all, Darren is exceptionally pleasant and customer service oriented. In fact, because I was the only person on the tour that day, we had some extra time and he took me to the Groot Constantia Winery for a wine tasting on the way back to my hotel. A bonus that is not typically on the tour but a perfect way to end an excellent day and tour. Contact Darren.... you won't be disappointed!

Cape Point tour. Darren's guiding skills are second to none!He did a great job informing of the history in the area, and was very flexible with the itineary. Everything from getting good tables for lunch to providing good advice on what to see and when to see it. Spending a day with Darren is a day well spent and one of my best memories from this trip to the Cape. Worth every penny!

Best day. Best guide. Cape Point. We choose DC Tours from all the awesome reviews on TripAdvisor. Now we know why they were 5 star reviews.From our first contact with Darren to our last we had fun. He picked us up from our AirBNB accommodation on time and is a new clean van. By our first stop we were like old friends. The rest of the day was filled with information about where we were going and what we were seeing, stories and laughter. I have dodgy knees so taking stairs was at times a challenge for me. Darren made sure he took me the route with least amount of stairs or shorter distance and if we had to go the longer way he said I'd be rewarded with an awesome view and he wasn't wrong. It was worth the extra steps. At no time was I rushed, and Darren was always checking I was ok and there to help with a hand if I needed it.As it turned out there was only 2 of us on the day trip so it was really personalised to us. We could spend as little or as long as we wanted at stops and Darren was always on hand to take photos of us and being a keen photographer himself helped us get the best shot of scene.Darren thank you for a great day and keep on 'working it' and 'visiting those penguins' lol

Absolutely fantastic private tour - Darren is the perfect guide!. If you are looking to book a tour of cape point (or any tour for that matter), book with Darren. He is absolutely fantastic, the tour is not rushed, he likes to leave early so as to avoid the massive tours, and he takes pictures for you and sends them via drop box. What is there not to like? Also, Darren is a great guide to get to know, and we had a great day with him!!

Cape Point Day Tour. Darren at DC Tours really makes this trip - he is the ultimate guide -knowledgeable, professional and friendly!! We felt like we received the VIP treatment and thoroughly enjoyed the day. A BIG thank you!!

Fun and Informative. We did several trips with DC Tours while visiting the Cape Town area and couldn't have asked for more. Darren was very friendly and knowledgeable. He made sure we had a good time and saw everything we could possibly see. We had a lot of laughs along the way. Thanks for making our time so special Darren.

excellent day out. we were lucky enough to find DC Tours here on trip advisor, we booked on line expecting to be part of a minibus tour, when Darren picked us up , at our accommodation, it was in a 6 seat people carrier and only us in it.we then got a wonderful tour of the cape peninsula from Darren giving us plenty of time at each destination to take in the beautiful scenery . He was a great guide and we really enjoyed the tour, we were really pleased with the value for money and would definitely use him again and recommend DC tours to our friends

Outstanding!. My wife and I had the pleasure to spend three days with Darren, traveling from Cape Town to Cape Point to Hermanus and quite a few places in between. He is both knowledgeable and passionate about the Region and he manages to provide it in as much or as little detail as you want from him, based on your interest of any particular topic. Darren was quick to understand our interests and adjust our itinerary and even made adjustments on the fly to ensure weather conditions worked to our favor relative to the places we were seeing....without missing anything over the three days. I also enjoyed the fact that a number of places we experienced were off the beaten path, including a few nice local restaurants that were his favorites and not those highly frequented by tourists.Darren also has a great eye for photography and identified opportunities for good shots that weren't always apparent to an amateur like me. He even took photos with his own camera of things he hadn't noticed in his previous trips and even shared them with us afterwards. If you're spending any time in Cape Town, I highly recommend giving Darren a call!

Hovering of Sea Point. This is on top of Lions Head where you can have an accompanied fly over Sea Point and have a wonderful view of Table Mountain, Robben Island, Water-front, etc. You are accompanied by a specialist and safe at all times.

Excellent day trip in Cape Town!. We had a great time with Darren exploring a number of beautiful places Cape Town has to offer. Darren was extremely knowledgeable of all of the sites we visited and drove by, as well as regarding the culture and history of South Africa! He was very accommodating to our schedule and fun. We will definitely recommend DC Tours to our friends/family and we can't wait to come back to Cape Town and do another tour.
Trip. Was an awesome trip and beautiful views!Bring your camera with because there are spectacular views!

Exceptional. What a fantastic day we had with Darren, he took us to the most unusual & wonderful places. He is an excellent guide and knows a lot, we had so much fun and didn't want the day to end. Will definitely use DC Tours the next time I have overseas visitors.

Best tour guide in the WC. Had a glorious day in and around Franschoek with the most knowledgable and interesting tour guide. He was outstanding with the kids!!! Would recommend Darren in a flash! If you visit Cape Town and don't use Fatten....you haven't visited Cape Town at all.
Great tour to Cape Point. I advise everybody to go to a full day tour to Cape Point. Excellent experience of nature and wild life

Cape of Good Hope half day tour . We booked Darren for a half day tour because of his high trip advisor rating and he certainly lived up to his excellent rating.We enjoyed a very pleasant tour with Darren, he was punctual, friendly and both he and his sizeable vehicle were smartly turned out. I would definitely recommend DC Tours and book again if I found myself back in Cape Town.

Cape Day Tour. I would recommend DC Tours to any visitor to Cape Town. Darren, the owner and guide clearly loves his work and loves his city. He picked us up right on time at our guesthouse and we set off for a tour of the Cape peninsula. He takes an interest in the flora and fauna of the Cape as well as its history. He also has a unique family perspective of the Cape lighthouse that he shares with his clients. The weather was a bit questionable all day, but he tailored our tour to escape the weather and still see the sights.His van is new, clean, and in excellent condition. He only takes 6 guests on any day so you will not feel like you are being herded onto a mob tour. At the end of the day, he offered to drop us off anywhere in town if we had other evening plans rather than just dropping us off at our lodging.A great day with a great tour guide.

DC; reliable tour operator ! Review from Saudi !. Darren is very reliable and worthy person. His professionalism was clear for us from the moment we emailed him. He is very passionate and sincer person. I was in my honeymoon and Aquila Game Reserve was my first choice. He was so kind with us, making us living the moment with the wild life !

Went sightseeing. Took several tours around town, to the botanical gardens, and to Hout Bay. Nice little diversion if you have a lot of time at your hands to just be chauffeured around, or a good way of getting to know the city or peninsula if only here for a few days. I would recommend getting off at the Two Oceans Aquarium when circling back along the waterside and spend a few hours here, so catch a morning ride - or go another day. The aquarium's sharks, turtles and frogs are worth a visit.

Excellent - most highly recommended. Thank you Darren for making our stay in Cape Town so memorable! Your suggestion of being at the top of Table Mountain at 8am on our first day was the start of a magical week spent exploring the wonders of this beautiful area. Our trip to the wine lands was both fun and fruitful and our third day trip to the Cape Peninsula was stunning.The local knowledge you kindly shared helped us appreciate our beautiful surroundings and understand the history of this fascinating country. You were great company and each trip felt extra special as you adapted it to fit in with our requirements. It was such a treat to be driven to the most breath-taking of places and your recommendations for lunch were always spot on! Also many thanks for taking a number of photos whilst we were busy enjoying the scenery and events and then sharing them on our return home – a lovely reminder of our holiday and we were just too engrossed in taking everything in to remember to take photographs.We had an amazing holiday, helped by your first class tours, and would most definitely recommend your services to anyone visiting this amazing city. Julie & Peter Darraugh – April 2015

Excellent Cape Peninsula Highlight Tour. Great selection of tours offered. Very knowledgable tour guide who went out of his way to make it a great outing. Comfortable tour bus & altogether wonderful way to experience the Cape Peninsula.
Excellent Tour. Darren is an awesome guy, knowledgeable and attentive. A great, friendly Tour Guide. A passionate Cape Towner

Small tours with a big heart!. I can think of no better way to visit the Cape Winelands that with someone else doing the driving!! My good fortune was that Darren Combrink, the owner/operator of DC Tours had a space available in one of his groups and we were off the magnificent Franschoek area on a crisp spring Saturday morning.Spoiler alert: this was a wine tour. Much frivolity and joy can be seen the photos and could be gleaned from my review!Darren was a great tour guide and host. He's knowledgeable about the Cape, easy to talk to and fun to ride with. A better trip I couldn't think of. With little things, he adds great value to the journey: on-the-bus WiFi hotspot so that guests can update Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc during the journey; facility for guests to charge their smartphones as one chews power taking so many pics.We first stopped at Chamonix wine estate and began a delightful, progressively tipsy day of wine tasting. Chamonix has a lovely old-world-Cape charm that even so early was pleasant. Unfortunately we weren't staying to eat, but I suggest that you give their outdoor dining area a chance.Next up was Haute Cabriere wine estate, the home of Pierre Jourdan wine. What a magnificent setting for a superb tour and tasting experience. Taken underground to their cellers and given a delightful, fun and humourous talk by one of the family was a treat.We enjoyed a pleasant lunch high up the mountain-side overlooking the Franschoek valley at Le Petit Ferme, after which a stroll through the main street of town meant encounters with the creativity and magnificent art galleries that the area is renowned for.I was quite sad to the day end, but glad to get a rest before heading out for a night on the town.I highly recommend the professionalism and charm that is Darren Combrink and DC Tours.

Great experience with a great guide. We did a day trip around cape point with Darren. He was awesome from the start when we first booked right until he dropped us off after the tour. He was extremely accommodating to what we wanted to do and provided excellent communication via email prior to the tour.Throughout the tour Darren was relaxed and easy to talk with and provided great information, humored my wifes addiciton with photography and did not rush through the day.

The Spice of Life!. Darren from DC Tours hosted my husband and three teenagers for a day of wine tasting at Backsberg ("Backsberg has been chosen as one of the Top 100 Wineries of the Year by Wine & Spirits Magazine in New York") and all the flavours of relaxation at the introduction of The Spice Route (" ... a sensory feast for today’s connoisseurs of craftsmanship and authenticity") in Paarl. Darren communicated clearly and accurately before our trip, making sure he understood our needs, giving tips and ideas, as well as on the day which included updates on expected weather conditions. He is a knowledgeable guide, easy to engage with and one felt totally at ease (an excellent attribute when you are essentially spending hours with a 'stranger'!) with his friendly and consistent manner.Our tour bus was spotless, air-conditioned, soft but suitable music, had free wi-fi and one is able to charge your phone "on wheels" so remember your USB cable. We were offered bottled water and biscuits (which the children just about finished!) after our first stop Being a true gentleman, Darren opened the doors for the ladies especially. (Love that!)We were absolutely impressed with Darren calm and patient manner with three (moody at times) teenagers, one adult who spoke non stop (me) and a husband who needed to smoke, eat, taste wine and attack on "Clash of Clans" all at once!It is clear that Darren is passionate about his profession and the enjoyment and satisfaction of his clients are at the very height of how he measures his success.We look forward to exploring more places with Darren as our guide to the best the Cape has to offer!!

Cape Penisula Tour. Wow, what a great tour! We especially liked the tempo and scope of the tour. We also liked that we were the only two people on the tour, making it easier to focus on our desires. Darren is a hands on guide, walking everywhere with us to make sure we saw it all and understood what we were looking at. H e took us to special places that only insiders would know and appreciate. We had been in Cape Town and West Cape for more than two weeks, and this tour was the grande finale.

A Beautiful Cape Peninsula Adventure. I had a great time on my day tour of the Cape Peninsula with DC Tours. Darren was a terrific guide, sharing his breadth and depth of knowledge and adding to my understanding of the history and natural beauty of the area. I had looked for, and booked, the tour primarily to experience the scenery and natural beauty of the area, but Darren's background made it all the more interesting. Darren also took great care of us on the tour with little things, like cookies and WiFi en route. When I was deciding on doing the tour, I was worried that I wouldn't be able to fit the tour into my busy itinerary during my short stay in the Cape, but Darren made the decision easy by offering to take me to the airport at the end of the tour so I could make my continuing flight to Johannesburg. I'm grateful that I was able to do everything on my wish list, due to his help. The day I went on the tour was a picture-perfect day, and all the places we visited -- Hout Bay, Chapman's Peak, Kommetjie, Cape of Good Hope, Boulders Beach, and Simon's Town, to name just a few -- were gorgeous. DC Tours are highly recommended!

Cape Peninsula Tour. My wife and I had a great time with DC Tours. Darren was a knowledgable guide with clear email communications before the trip. Afterwards, Darren set up a drop box to share photos that he took during our tour. Highly recommended.

West Coast National Park, !Khwa ttu (San Culture), and West Coast Fossil Park. We are a couple traveling with our nine year old grand daughter. Our tour with Darren was at the end of our nearly three week visit to South Africa. Our only regret is that we did not discover him much earlier. From our initial contacts via email months ago, Darren has been responsive, knowledgeable and very helpful.The day before our tour, we made a special request of him and he pleasantly complied. Darren is comfortable to be around and has an amazing grasp of history, culture, and wildlife. He is really thoughtful and had a snack plus water as well as binoculars and bird, animal, and flower information sheets to use as needed. He adjusts to the personalities of his clients - he can be quiet or have a great conversation with you. Darren keeps updated on everything related to each of his tours. He worked with us on our interests and time constraints. The San People cultural tour was an incredible experience and we wouldn't have known about it without Darren. The Fossil Park was fascinating and we were happy we took the extra time to go there. This is not Prime Season for West Coast National Park but Darren brought us to absolutely beautiful places, and pointed out wildlife and birds. He knew we would be interested in an educational building there. He introduced us to a wonderful restaurant that served excellent ethnic food in a lovely setting. We highly recommend Darren for any and all tours that he offers and suggest you consider an individualized tour with him. Janet, Tim, and Maia

Penguins, Baboons & Cape of good hope. Wow! Magical day we had with Darren, a highlight of our holiday! Darren arrived early and well prepared for our trip, we weren't really sure what we wanted to see, other than I had my heart set on the penguins at Boulders Beach, so together we decided on the Cape of Good Hope and it was a fantastic choice! Darren was knowledgable, friendly and easy going, found us lots of non-touristy view points & animals that we wouldn't have found on our own. He knows Cape Town and it's history like the back of his hand! Detours were made to show us extra places of interest such as vineyard grounds and a local township, he even happily took our photos throughout the day, stopping to update his own collection also, showing a genuine interest and passion for his job, wildlife, nature and his home country! Wouldn't hesitate to book again and recommend to all! Emily & Stuart, Leicester UK
Cape point tour. Darren was a magnificent guide ! He knows the region as no one and brings you to unique spots. I truly recommend his services

Interesting and pleasant. We booked DC Tours for 3 days while we were in Cape Town. It included safari, Table Mountain, city sightseeing and paragliding. Top experience and top service. Good recomondations for the time we would spend on our own that helped us have an even better holiday in South Africa!
Great experience!. Very pleased with the tours overall. It has been very interesting and fun! Darren is a cool guy who knows what he is doing

Wine Tasting Days with Scottish friendships. We had our Scottish friends over to Cape Town and decided to have a day of wine tasting and lunch in Franschhoek. Darren was promt on arrival, very polite with a friendly, warm but also professional manner. We were offered chilled water throughout the journey, he was also ready to make suggestions inline with what we had in mind for the tour. He kept us company throughout the day with a great sense of humour with a lot of information of the local area. A great day out with a very enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide who felt more like one of our friends.

Wonderful tours of a beautiful city. My family and I booked two day tours with Darren from DC Tours while in Cape Town over the December/January holiday period.The first was a day out in the beautiful winelands of Franschhoek: the day began with a cheese and wine pairing at Fairview (one of the older wine farms, with famous cheese and wonderful wines), followed by a wine tasting at Haute Cabriere (some more wonderful wine coupled with exquisite views). We had lunch at Cafe Bon Bon and finished off the day with a chocolate tasting at Huguenot Chocolates, and a wander around the lovely Franschhoek village. The second was the Cape Peninsula Coastal Delight tour. This beautifully scenic tour took us from Sea Point, around Hout Bay and on to Chapman's Peak Drive, all the way around the coastline to Cape Point. We hiked (not really a hike but a slightly challenging uphill walk) to the lighthouse, which was followed by a delicious seafood lunch at Cape Point restaurant (very good food, and great service!) After lunch, we wound our way through the Cape Point Nature Reserve (spotting lots of baboons along the way!) and continued on to see the penguins at Boulders Beach. This wonderful day was topped off by cake and tea at Rhodes Memorial.Everything about both these tours was incredibly well organised - all the bookings were done by Darren beforehand - which enabled a very relaxing and stress-free experience! Darren is an excellent guide. He is very knowledgeable about Cape Town and expertly answered all our questions - he certainly knows his stuff! We had such a great time and we were all quite sad to leave the comfort of his minibus at the end of the day (his bus even had wifi!)We would definitely recommend him and DC Tours to anyone wanting to discover the beautiful Cape - we can't wait to visit again and experience some more tours with Darren!!!

Great day out!!. There is absolutely nothing one can find fault with, with Darren! We did the Cape Peninsula tour with him on Saturday, 17 January. From the moment he picked us up at the V&A Waterfront (because we stayed quite a bit away from the city), he made myself and my mother feel so comfortable, like we've known one another for ages! He is very knowledgeable, super friendly. We've made a new friend in the Mother City! He is quite the happy snapper when it comes to taking photos, so there's almost no need for you to take your camera along on this trip. Any trip with him is highly recommended, as he goes the extra mile for you, and personalises the tour according to your needs. I misplaced my camera bag somehow, and two days later, Darren found it in the tour bus. He drove to the Waterfront, while we happened to be there, just to get the bag back to me. He is an absolute gem!

Cape Peninsula tour. We visited Cape Town in early January on our honeymoon and were lucky enough to have Darren of DC Tours as our guide for a full day spent touring the Cape Peninsula. Darren is highly professional, knowledgable, and also just fun to hang around with. He informs you about the history, flora and fauna of your surroundings without ever sounding like he is lecturing you. Our only regret is we hadn't booked him for the rest of our trip! We definitely would recommend Darren for any activities in the Cape.

What a great experience and service. The booking process was exceptional and well organised.Their experienced drivers went the extra mile to ensure our trip was perfect. I would definitely recommend Darren and his team and would definitely use them again. I cannot wait to return to Cape Town and try some of their other tours!!!!!!

Christmas/NY in Cape Town - Wonderful! - The Davies family. I would highly recommend Darren Combrink and his team at D C Tours. He is highly professional and his prices are very reasonable. We returned to the UK this week after a wonderful stay in Cape Town over Christmas and New Year and we used D C Tours to take us on a number of day and half-day trips. The planning started months ago and from the very outset, Darren was able to give us some excellent and honest advice (via emails and phone) on the type of tours available and even came up with our own 'bespoke' tour which involved a double descent of Table Mountain - mountain biking down in the morning and then coming down from the very top by cable car in the afternoon. He was extremely informative about South African history and also about the geography and natural landscape of the area. Absolutely top guide!

Superb in every way!. We booked 3 Day trips with DC Tours:Wine TourTable Mountain with mountain biking!Cape of Good Hope/Boulders BeachI highly recommend all of them!We had a lot of email contact with Darren before our arrival in Cape Town, which meant that our trips were tailor made (this was such a help as we were a party of 8, in Cape Town at the busiest time of the year). Darren and his colleague Fahiema (for the Wine Tour) were incredibly knowledgeable, personable and easy going, keen to ensure that we all enjoyed every element of the trip.We were travelling with teenagers, so the addition of free WiFi in the tour van was a real bonus! Can't wait to return to Cape Town to try some other DC Tours!
Wow!!!what a friend.. We had an absolutely great day. Darren is so friendly and absolutely loves people. Our day was perfect with him. The way he knows Cape Town history is amazing.

5 days in Cape Town. Travel and have Darren as a guide is set in luck . Make us to have good day always with good humor and concern for our well being . It would be impossible to think that everything would be so organized and having so good daily choices . Services such as mobile internet , charging batteries for cell phones , distribution of wonderful cookies and water make us have an extra welfare . Punctuality safe driving and always prepared for the trip to be a success . Congratulations and thanks Darren

Our friend in Cape Town. Darren is certainly our new found friend in Cape Town. He was referred to us by a mutual friend and we were fortunate to find a competent, attentive and knowledgeable person to be our guide. He was also on time, which is important to us Swiss. He not only took us to the two places we absolutely wanted to see in such a short time, but he helped us discover parts of Cape Town that only the locals could experience.
