Darren caters to the needs of everyone. His enthousiasm is infectious. He even has cookies in the back of his van. We are planning to return next year with our teen-age daughters to explore more of the area and beyond. We highly recommend DC Tours.

Best way to see Cape Town. We had a wonderful five tour of Cape Town and its surroundings. A big part of that was having Darren as our guide. He enjoys showing you around the well-known places, but he will also take you to discover places he himself has not seen before. He offers outstanding flexibility in designing your tour. His selections of restaurants and wineries was amazing. As an added bonus, he offers a free WiFi spot in his car. He will take lots of photographs with his own camera and make them available to you on the internet. We have done private tours in many other cities around the world, and Darren is among the best, if not the best, tour guide we have had.

Excellent tour. While searching for a Cape peninsula tour we came across DC Tours and decided to book a day tour. Darren picked us up from our hotel and offered an outstanding personalized tour just for the two of us. He for sure is the right person to show you the peninsula, he has lots of knowledge and will make sure that there is something included for everyone. We spent an excellent day with him and enjoyed our tour very much. If you are in Cape Town and need someone to show you around, DC Tours is the way to go.

Cape Town Explorer. We were so very fortunate to have an opportunity to explore the environs of Cape Town with Darren for eight remarkable days. Darren is a very capable driver and tour guide. He is reliably knowledgable of all things related to South Africa and he easily connected us with the people and places that represent every facet of this beautiful country's culture. With Darren as our guide, our experience in Cape Town was such that we are determined to return to this incredible city. With Darren as our guide, we explored the peninsula, Hermanus, Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, truly wonderful restaurants and bistros, Table Mountain, the coast, the gardens, the music, the museums and galleries, gorgeous vineyard views, quaint villages, townships and memories that will last forever. We will always recommend Darren to those who plan a visit to Cape Town.

A tourist tour guide.... Darren was a great tour guide. if I wasn't on my honeymoon, I would have thoughts he was on vacation with us. He knows the country and its treasures. He customized the trips on our schedule, which was wonderful. If I ever go back to SA again, I would ask Darren to accompany me wherever I go.

Excellent Personalized tour. Excellent top of the line tour by a wonderful not-your-normal tour guide. Darren was great man with unparalleled passion for nature, great person to be with for a full day. We had wonderfull time at the West Cost National Park.The highlight of the tour was the Honey Tour to a great top-of-the-line honey farmer in South Africa named "Simply Bees" at Hopefield . Wonderful high-quality products, we just wished we have enough space to buy enough from them. The owners of the "Simply Bees" Helena and her husband were so generous and lovely; we loved the outdoor tea-with honey treat, the Cheddar chees with honey bread was so yummy.YousefSaudi ArabiaExcellent tour with an excellent tour operator

2 days in Cap Town, excellent experience. We spent 2 days in Cape Town and Derren was for us much more than a simple guide. I think we could learn about the city and its surroundings much better than the time available allowed us to

fantastic day in capetown. A fabulous day starting with a trip up the mountain via cable car - we were the first in the queue and it was a stunning clear but chilly start - stupendous views from uptop and we joined the free tour at the top which was interesting. Then we headed up signal hill - fabulous view of the city , then to the Noon day gun - what an experience. Then headed into Cape Town via Bo Kaap, taking in the history and the sights....narrow streets and lovely old architecture. Lunched in town at a Moroccan bar on the street. Fabulous décor and menu. Winter in May but we were now boiling hot and so the excellent selection of beer was very welcome. Probably the best service we had the whole holiday - friendly, professional and excellent quality. Loved that lunch! Then it was off to the Castle - A fort that was built by the Dutch East India Company between 1666 and 1679, the Castle is the oldest existing colonial building in South Africa , then to Rhodes Memorial and another stunning view - and very interesting and impressive legacy of the man who was both a benefactor and a ruthless capitalist - ending the day with a beer and tea and a sinful lemon meringue at the Rhodes Mem café. Wow - an amazing day.It was wonderful to be treated to this wonderful day hosted by Darren - he is so organised and knowledgeable - it was a memorable day. Thanks!

A day out with Darren. It was my first time in Cape Town and while I was travelling with a Cape Town girl, having Darren organise the day, pick us up from our base and deliver us home after a wonderful day touring this fantastic City just made it all the more enjoyable. Darren has tremendous passion for Cape Town and the Western Cape and this coupled with his knowledge of the City, its many attractions, both the well known and the hidden secrets, made our day with him, one of the highlights of our three weeks in South Africa. Throw in a great lunch spot and a late afternoon beer at the Rhodes Memorial, it was like spending a day out with a good mate. For anybody visiting Cape Town and looking for that extra something to make a good holiday into an unforgettable experience, we would thoroughly recommend a call to DC tours. Darren certainly was our "top man" in Cape Town.

Fabulesous and professional team to help enjoying and discovering the Mandela's Country. It was a gorgeous Sunday, from 9am to 6 pm we visited a fabulous Sunday market (Constantia Waldorf Organic Market (Constantia)). The market was purely African and various African artists (musicians and etc) entertained not only tourist, as well as capetonian. We got lovely tour at Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens (My friends you got to visit this unique garden in the world). We end up by wine tour and testing at Groot Constantia winery cape town. I am planning my second tour with DC tour, they are wonderful, patient and passionate to entertain visitors.

Unmatched excellence. Truly "your friend in Cape Town".. Darren is clearly passionate about his work and this translates to an incredible experience for his clients. I was lucky to have Darren as my personal guide in Cape Town and onward to the Garden Route and there is simply no way I could have had such an enriching experience on my own. Darren is well connected to some key figures of the apartheid era which sets him apart from other guides. He offers a tour that gets way beyond Mandela and provides a glimpse of what real life was like for South Africans in recent times. A great tour for a history buff like myself.Beyond that, Darren loved to take me to special off the beaten path places that a typical tourist would not venture. This made me feel that I was getting a true South African experience and not just sliding across the veneer.The vehicle is clean and comfortable and Darren is an excellent driver, even putting a nervous passenger like myself at ease.Darren catered the tours to my interests and desires. His style is casual and friendly. He's easy to talk with and fun to be around.I can't recommend him highly enough. For a day or a week, it would be a shame to miss out on the experience of Cape Town with Darren. Many thanks!

discover the country with a passionate local guide. good contact to safe if you're looking for a guide who's ready to listen your request, to make you a tailor-made trip and share with you his knowledge and culture of his country.You can be sure he'll bring you to beautiful places, threath you as a "friend" and not as a "foreign visitor" so you can have the very best of what the country can offer.I recommend and you enjoy! Thanks, Darren.

Exceptional Company to Explore and Experience South Africa.. We spent April touring the best of the Western Cape and Cape Town With D.C. Tours. They also set up a week Safari for us in the Pilanesburg region. The Sights were Amazing, Accommodation and Dining choices excellent. The key aspect that readers of this review need to know is that D.C. Tours provide the friendliest personalized tours I have ever experienced!

Four days in Cape Town, South Africa. Our private tour was organised through DC Tours of Capetown.We secured the services of the owner tour director Mr. Darren Combrink.The tours were well organised, easy paced, with delightful pit stop breaks at various cafes for a nibble and refreshments.The transport vehicle clean and comfortable.Each days tour had been meticulously mapped out spanning 7 to 8 hours. Tours included scenic drives, sites of historical interest and at other times a stroll in the quaint towns with their white painted buildings.Darren's depth of knowledge was impressive, his vocabulary broad and entertaining as was his personal charm and the relaxed unhurried manner in which he took us through.He answered all our queries, some of which were on the black & white issues of the apartheid era leading right up to the present. All were answered truthfully and mind you, without a blush.He produced out of nowhere this wonderful lady Sherrie who had lived through the historical times who gave us first hand accounts of what life was like then, having actually become personally involved in the struggle. What she described was eye opening. The living quarters of the slaves, the clock maker and Oom Samie Se Winkel the old curiosity shop in Stellenbosch, the second hand dealer in Stamford, the Jordanian sand bottle artist in Hermanus and the penguins of Stony Point were some of the unusual items of interest along Route 44, in addition to the grand architecture and dwellings of a by gone era in Pniel and Franschoek and the tasty Malay cuisine at the home Mrs FaizaWe were so glad that we did the tour with Darren and his team. Thoroughly enjoyable.Bella & Chandi

Great experience!. Our trip with DC Tours was a great experience! Darren took us to the most beautiful places in and around Cape Town and made our trip to south africa unforgettable. We can recommend this to everyone who wants a Special and personal sightseeing tour in South africa!

S.A.. DC Tours provided us with a very friendly, professional, knowledgeable and flexible guide. Darren took us off the beaten track to see beautiful passes, nature, animals and some local history. We always felt safe and well cared for, a true gentleman.

A wide,varied and awesome experience. Darren managed to tick all the boxes on his tours. He focused on cultural, historical and visual experiences for the tourist, and included a variety of wild life exposures. You will be left with a real "feel" for the country after a few days with DC Tours South Africa . You will eat and drink at the most beautiful and unusual places, quite often off the beaten track and representative of the "real" South Africa as apposed to the touristy venues. Darren will customize his tours based on the interests of the tourist. I can definitely recommend DC tours if you want to get to grips with the culture and beauty of South Africa. Darren is flexible, energetic and knowledgable and will ensure you have a great and full experience.

Tour to wine farms. DC Tours South Africa arranged a lovely day out on the Paarl wine route.We had no idea what to expect but our tour guide was exceptional.Darren took us to the Spice Route wine farm, what an experience. The wine farm has so much to offer and thanks to Darren he knew exactly where to go on the farm. We enjoyed a wine and chocolate pairing before visiting the La Grapperia. We suddenly realised this wine farm caters for winter visits, they have a fire place. We cannot wait for a tour in July during the winter months. We visited the Red Hot Glass factory and watched a lovely display of glass blowing.The tour then moved to the Rhebokskloof wine farm on the west side of Paarl. We enjoyed a lovely picnic under trees next to the lake. If you interested in wine tours, contact Darren at DC Tours to plan something special.

Fantastic Cape Peninsula trip. We booked this trip as part of a short stay in Cape Town. It was excellent and we have to support all the other great reviews posted here. An excellent and informative guide that gave us a lot of information of the history of sites as well as the South African history. After being traveling here for 10 years; I learned more this day than the previous 10 years of the S-A culture and history.If you ever need (and you might think you don´t) an excellent day of Cape Town - call them!We watched the seals from the boat at Hout Bay, we visited the Cape Point, we saw the penguins at Boulders beach and we finished off with wine tasting in Constantia...

Awesome trip in SA. Thank you so much African Blue tours and congratulations to David, Valentine , Duncan and Matthew !A few day trips with this team made me addict to SA.With Matthew we spent a fabulous day exploring the West Coast National Park and the Cape Peninsula. Thanks to him we discovered the beautiful landscapes of SA.And then with Duncan who was so patient, caring, passionate , we discovered the Tsitsikamma region, had a fun day kayaking , walking on the suspension bridge at Storms River Mouth and then on the garden route where he showed us such a beautiful route.And at last but not least thanks to David and Valentine for their impecable organization of our stay in SA !

family holiday. We can't rate African Blue Tours highly enough!!! David, the owner of the company, was our extremely knowledgable, amiable and passionate tour guide. He took our family of 5 on two private day trips, Cape Peninsula and District Six/Langa Township.He managed to combine his vast knowledge of the area as a local with an easy ambience and attention to detail making our tours tailored to our wishes and seamless in management. But we had fun too!! And learnt so much. The Cape Tour was fabulous, with personal touches such as providing cold water bottles, showing us where he surfed as a teenager, taking us to the non-tourist side of boulders beach, reserving us a great view lunch table at Cape Point restaurant, giving us a choice of wine estates, even keeping us calm as a wayward baboon came to check us for food whilst watching the ostriches!! All the while giving us snippets of local info, historical references and current political news. The tour to District Six and Langa though was something else. He introduced us to a whole subject matter that we had very limited knowledge of previously, and it opened our eyes to the huge traumatic politics of apartheid in this area of SA.David took us to the museum which was fascinating, and then a car tour of the area including the now very desolate district six and showed us with very precise knowledge where the old tracks and houses were, where the remaining churches and mosques fitted in.David has a very good friend and working colleague, Odwa, a wonderful and clever 26yr old man who was brought up in Langa Township, and still lives there. Odwa took us on a walking tour of the township, he reassured us of our safety and of our being very welcome, and that the local people would be very pleased to open up their homes and show us how they live. It blew our minds away seeing all the housing/shelters and what the township means to the people who dwell there. We visited the orphanage and saw the children's beautiful and fabulous welcoming dance. It was truly humbling. Would thoroughly recommend taking your children there and meeting Odwa and hearing the story of Langa.

Fantastic Cape Peninsula trip. I booked a day with Matt to explore the Cape Peninsula and would highly recommend it. A great day seeing the sights but Matt made the day fantastic as I learnt so much. He is incredibly knowledgeable, wanted to share his history and wealth of information and was happy to answer a constant stream of questions. We had sufficient time in each location and he was happy to deviate the trip to accommodate some of our personal requests.

Excellent Great Cape Peninsula Tour. We booked a full day Cape Peninsula tour with African Blue having read the very positive reviews from other travellers. Karen our guide picked us up from our hotel on time and immediately put us at ease with her friendly approach and informative chat about Cape Town. The drive down to the Cape was really interesting and alongside the scenery we saw a huge variety of birds, animals and flora, with Karen able to give us a great commentary on what we were seeing. Excellent lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant with great views. The afternoon saw us taking in the Boulders Beach peguins and then the Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens which really are a "must see". Overall an excellent tour and well worth the money.

Outstanding tour and fun too. We took a full day tour to the Cape of Good Hope with Matt who proved to be not only knowledgeable but friendly and fun. We were a small group of 6 which sure beat going on a huge tour bus. This company offers many tours of Cape Town and I would highly recommend them.

Great tours!. African Blue took care of me for three days while I was in Cape Town. The good service started with a clear, easy to navigate website. There was also friendly and timely response to my email inquiries, and easy and secure payment methods. The tours were top notch. Great experience overall!

Great Cape Peninsula tour. Had a great day with Matthew on an African Blue day tour of the Cape Peninsula. Matthew had very interesting information about Cape Town, and it was really great hearing about the area from someone who grew up there. The van was very comfortable with only 6 of us for the day. We hit all the big stops and had plenty of time to hike up to the Cape Point lighthouse, take pictures, hang out at the beach with penguins and even got to spend an hour at Kirstenboch. Wonderful views and beautiful weather all day. Had a great time and I have already recommended this tour to another couple who was traveling to Cape Town.

Great service and tour. David always answered to all my emails and questions very quickly. He provided great service and I also ended up really enjoying the tour that I booked through him to Kruger Park (3-day tour plus Blyde River Canyon). There are many tour operators in South Africa and it was hard for me to compare and choose one – if you are in the same position, look no further and book through African Blue Tours, you won’t regret it.

Shipwreck / Cape Agulhas Day Tour. A wonderful and well-priced full day experience. I selected the shipwreck tour, but my guide Duncan left the actual details and agenda totally up to me. An outstanding guide and very accommodating. Exceptional historical and local knowledge. Great selection of the lunch spot. The entire day was informative and leisurely, not a hint of being rushed. I would highly recommend this tour over the more common cape Peninsula tour. I suspect all of African Blue’s offered tours are equally magnificent.10 of 10!

Amazing Tour around Cape Town. We booked 3 days personalized trips around Cape Town with African Blue Tours. Our guide, Duncan, made the trip simply marvelous. Our original 3 day itinerary was changed a little bit to suit the weather conditions which worked completely to our favour. Duncan was very knowledgeable, readily answered all our questions and enriched us with his valuable insights of the neighbourhood. He ensured we were comfortable and planned the trip to our pace and likes. He also put in some extra effort to ensure we experienced the most beautiful sunset along False Bay. Highly recommended by us !

Cape Peninsula Day Tour. We recently did the Cape Peninsula Day Tour with Matt and I can't recommend it highly enough! The pace was perfect with plenty of time for all stops, photos, refreshments, etc. The scenery was amazing and we were really blessed with the warm weather. Matt was a fantastic guide and gave us lots of interesting history and and information...he was also a great photographer! Matt also recommended a restaurant for lunch which was really fabulous. This should be on everyone's to-do list when in Cape Town!

Fab cape point day trip. My husband and I went on the full day cape point your in March. Matt was our guide and he was brilliant. Very knowledgeable, easy going and chatty and really made the day for us. Got to see lots of lovely sights on the day and went for a lovely lunch. Note you need to take cash for some entrance fees and for lunch. A must do if on holiday in Cape Town

Personalised day trip around the Cape. I first made an enquiry about a day trip having checked what was available in Cape Town online. David was very quick to reply and in no time we had agreed for pick-up at the apartments I was staying at, along with an outline itinerary for a private tour. We are a family of 5. We have 3 sons, one disabled and two other 'adults'.The day before the tour, David contacted me as the weather forecast wasn't good for the day of the trip, and offered to reschedule for a day or so later, when the weather may be better. Whilst appreciated, we had other arrangements and needed to keep with the original date.We were picked up by our driver and guide, Karen, and we again agreed loosely what we wanted to do and where we wanted to go. Of course, no-one controls the weather, and it was pretty awful from 11ish onwards. So, as we were driving, Karen made suggestions of other things which we could do, which were really good. For example, we visited an ostrich farm and had a moment feeding them. We managed to prevent the big birds from eating our hands!We made it to Cape Colony and the lighthouse in the dry and agreed with Karen that we would walk from the lighthouse to the Cape of Good Hope where she would pick us up. When at the top of the hill at the lighthouse, the heavens really opened. We travelled back down on the funicular wondering what we would do about the walk and the rain, but then saw that Karen had waited as she thought the weather looked a lot like rain. What a relief!We went on and had lunch in a really nice restaurant on the sea front and then wanted to go on to see the penguins at Boulders Beach. It was still raining really hard, so Karen drove us as close as she could to the entrance - probably closer than she should have! - so we wouldn't get too wet. Fortunately, the weather eased up enough for us to see the penguins.We next agreed to change a visit to the gardens to a visit to a vineyard, which I was very happy about, and Karen obviously knew the staff there and arranged for us to have a special extra treat which was otherwise not available as a tasting.It also has to be said that Karen was good at informing us about where we were going, what we were looking at, some of the history of the areas we visited, and was very friendly and approachable regarding questions we had.So a great day. Did the weather spoil it? Well, it tried but when you travel somewhere in their winter/wet season, you have to be prepared. Did the tour deliver? Yes, absolutely. Karen went above and beyond to make sure it did.And the key question - would we use African Blue Tours again? Absolutely right we would!

3 wonderful days . We spent 3 wonderful days with Matt. He was an exceptional tour guide with lots of local knowledge. We liked that he involved us in deciding where to go each day. You have basic itineraries for each tour but he made sure we saw everything we wanted to see. One of our tours was of the Langa Township which I would encourage everyone to take. It's great to see the beautiful scenery of the Cape but you must experience all sides of the culture. Our guide was a local gentleman that showed us the positive and uplifting parts of the townships well as their challenges. We paid a bit extra to have the private tour. It's well worth it! The van you travel in is very comfortable and has large windows. We saw other tour groups with tons of people in them and we were so glad we had a guide all to ourselves! The owner is very conscientious and wants to make sure all your needs are met. I'm looking forward to using them again the next time I'm in Cape Town

Cape Peninsula Tour. I went on the Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan, there were only 2 of us on the tour and he really tailored the tour to what we wanted to do and how long we wanted.Duncan was willing to answer any of our questions and helped to make it a really memorable day. I booked the tour last minute and was very grateful that David was able to accommodate us.Through African Blue, I also booked a 6 day garden route and a 4 day Kruger trip, these were with other companies but were both well organized and professional. David responded to my emails quickly and really helped me plan and have an unforgettable holiday in South Africa!

What a day!!. We were only in Cape Town for a couple of days so decided to do a Peninsular Tour with African Blue Tours. Duncan was our guide for the day and really made sure we got to see everything from The Cape of Good Hope, to penguins on Boulder Beach. He even ensured we had a reservation for lunch which was really good. One of the highlights was the trip to the seal Island as the water was beautiful and as the weather was good we had stunning views back to the mainland.Duncan went out of his way to avoid arriving at places which would be busy where possible but made sure we saw everything and we never felt rushed. He is extremely knowledgeable about the local area as well as the history and we had some very interesting discussions!!We even managed to see the elusive Cape Zebra which was a real bonus. A great day and I was really pleased to have booked with them.

Fantastic day. Fantastic day!!We did a Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan. This was an absolutely wonderful tour.The tour was well organized allowing enough time to visit all the hot spots along the coast without feeling rushed.Duncan our guide was Excellent, very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. He made sure we all had a good time and looked after us very well.Thank You Duncan and African Blue for a fantastic tour. Highly recommend!!!

Cape Peninsula Tour with African Blue. We booked a day long Cape Peninsula Tour as part of our honeymoon in August 2016. From the very start, we knew we were onto a winner as the owner, David, took one look at my misguided clothing choices and promptly lent me his African Blue jacket for the tour to prevent me freezing throughout the day! Our guide, Duncan, was friendly and clearly knew Cape Town really well. He was constantly advising us of the key historic points relating to each of the city's attractions and was always volunteering to take photos of us for our scrapbook. Highlights of the tour had to be Boulders Beach for the penguins, Hout Bay for the seal colony boat trip, complete with eccentric locals feeding the seals at the dock, through to the climb to the lighthouse at the top of Cape Point. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend African Blue Day Tours to anyone visiting the city, and want to thank Duncan and David for their hospitality, knowledge and friendliness. Well done boys!
Peninsula Tour. I did the Peninsula tour with Duncan. Duncan is a great guide and the Peninsula is fantastic. Don't miss the penquins and the Cape itself. Recommend

Peninsula Tour and Langa Township Tour. Peninsula Tour: My 3 children (ages 6, 8 and 10) took the full day Peninsula tour with Matthew. It was a fabulous trip! It is difficult to keep this age happy and occupied but they had a ton of fun! We learned a lot of history of the area, saw and learned about many of the communities right outside of Capetown, had lunch at the Cape and saw the penguins. Everything was well planned and executed. I would recommend this tour to families for sure!Langa Township Tour: This was the highlight of our trip to Capetown!!! David was our tour guide and picked us up from the hotel (myself and my 3 kids ages 6, 8 and 10). We visited the District 6 museum and learned a bit of the history of the area. Then we met up with a resident of the Langa Township who took us on a walking tour. This was incredible, eye opening, fabulous...once in a lifetime. My kids are still talking about it. Absolutely a MUST for everyone. I was a little concerned before we went about safety but as I quickly learned the township is incredibly safe, the people are very warm and inviting and our guide made us feel right at home, even teaching us some words in the local language so we could better greet the people. We visited several different types of houses there and is was incredibly impactful. I think this is a MUST do for a trip to Capetown.

Girls Weekend in Cape Town. The tour was amazing... We went to some amazing wine farms...tasted some gorgeous wine and brandy...The tour guide was engaging and very knowledgeable.Lunch at Rocca was absolutely gorgeous...stunning views...stunning tour...a must do when you visit Cape Town...

Amazig experience!. We had booked Cape Winelands and Cape Point Tour with African Blue Tours. The tours turned out to be an amazing experience, with the tour leader Smith (if I correctly remember his name) giving us minute details about every single location (historical background, local specialities). We thoroughly enjoyed these two days...Best wishes to African Blue Tours! :) :)

Fantastic day tours, yet again!. Having previously used African Blue for a couple of private, guided day tours with a group of friends a few years ago, we again booked the Cape Peninsular and Winelands full day tours when revisiting with some friends earlier this year. Our guide for both these trips was Matthew and as with the previous guides, he was excellent. Very knowledgeable and attentive without being over-imposing. He also tailored both trips during the day, based on our discussions and requests and I would have no hesitation recommending both him and the other African Blue tour guides as a great way to explore CT, the Western Cape and beyond in comfort (modern, comfortable and air conditioned fleet of vehicles) and flexibility, designed to each groups individual requests. Coupled with excellent communication and arrangements from David and the office team, the African Blue tours represent great value for money, providing fun-filled, informative and exciting full day tours.

Excellent guided tour. Duncan was extremely knowledgeable about the natural and cultural history of the area, and we very much enjoyed our private tour of the Cape Peninsula. He was able to incorporate our particular interests and advised us on the best way to plan our day to maximise our enjoyment. Highly recommend.

"A Great Day". A last minute decision to book the Cape Peninsular tour and what a good decision it turned out to be! Duncan made our day with his knowledgeable commentary and his willingness to accommodate us. We had originally planned to go by train to Simons Town but now realise how much we would have missed out on. We are looking forward to African Blue looking after us for the next part of our holiday on the Garden Route.

Brilliant , highly recommended! . We booked this before we left on holiday and I would highly recommend it.We were two families of four adults and two 15yr old girls.We are hiring a car tomorrow to travel down the garden route but for out time in Capetown we chose to get a tour. Matt our guide was very prompt and collected ua as arranged at 08.30.The day was misty so he suggested changing the tour a bit so the mist wouldn't affect our viewing.He was very courteous at all times and had the ability to move us on when needed without us ever feeling rushed.His knowledge of the history and geography was unbelievable. He was very sensitive to all the communities we passed through.We had wine tasting , loved Simon Sig and had to buy some wine and bubbles! We went to Boulder to see penguins! Simonstown, Muizenburgh, Cape point for lunch,Hout Bay. It was amazing so much to see and do. Matt was brilliant and I would recommend this company to anyone planning a trip here.We also managed to see Baboons and a very large elk!

Great day!. We did a Cape Peninsula tour with Duncan. We had an elderly man in the group (4 of us, private) and Duncan was extremely accommodating to his needs. We had a great time and would highly recommend the company and Duncan!

Amazing Tour with Matthew! . Matthew took us on 2 private tours, a Wineland and a Cape Peninsula tour. Both days were exciting and full of sights, but at our own pace, which we greatly appreciated. Our guide Matthew anticipated our every need, provided a comfortable and clean van, and made great suggestions on additional sights like the Motor Museum. He reserved great tables at restaurants that provided stunning views. He was extremely knowledgeable in everything from politics to the flora and fauna of South Africa. He showed us the best of South Africa and always made us feel safe. Thank you African Blue and Matthew for the best vacation ever!
Private tour of Sterkfontein and Lesidi. Johan and Bianca were excellent guides. The show at Lesedi was fantastic. Try to book this as a group tour or at least with more than 1 person.

Cape Town - Langa township and Robben Island. We took a half day tour with Duncan to the Langa township and District Six Museum, followed by a trip to Robben Island. We really enjoyed the day and would definitely recommend African Blue Day Tours. The email communication with David was clear and quick. The day was perfectly organized and we learned a lot about the history of apartheid from Duncan and life in the township from our local guide Odwa who introduced us to local people in a natural and non-intrusive way. Afterwards, Duncan took us to the ferry to Robben Island. Thanks guys, for a perfect day! Julie and Michal

very informative and professional done. My wife and i used African Blue to tour Cape Town South Africa, cape of good hope, and the wine country. They did a very nice job of coordinating the picking up from our hotel and showing us the sigjts. Our first schedule day to see cape town was cloudy so we had to reschedule and African Blue was very accomodating. Good choice of wineries. Best of all was the history of South Aftrica our guide Matthew gave us. He was very knowledgeable and that really added to the tour.

Honeymoon in Cape town. Hi, Had a fab tour yesterday with Matt. As nobody else booked we ended up having a private tour of the peninsula of Cape Town. Matt was a great tour guide- really nice and very knowledgeable about the area. He also returned my fleece when I forgot it on the bus. This tour is excellent we seen the African an penguins and had a boat ride to see the seals. Matt also organised a great sea view table for us at two oceans restaurant were the seafood was to die for. All in all a fab day. Thanks Matt. Would highly recommend. Laura and Gavin from Northern Ireland.

Amazing 12 days in South Africa. We have just returned after a 12 day trip to South Africa. Our entire trip- 3day Kruger Safari and Blyde River Canyon tour, Cape Town and 5 day garden route tour was entirely managed by David Smith and how well he managed it. Our tour guide for 7 days was Duncan Petre an excellent gentleman, professional, friendly and very flexible. His knowledge shows his passion for his profession. Travelling extensively with 2 kids is never easy but Duncan made it so and I must mention, David was himself present at the airport to pick us and he himself drove us back to the airport at 5.30 am in the morning for our return journey. I have never come across an owner who does this personally for his clients. Kudos to African Blue.....stay blessed and go miles guys....

Amazing 2 days with David Smith. We did a private tour with David for a group of 4 people. Excellent experience overall and David is very professional, prompt, flexible and very responsive to emails/calls. On day 1, we went to the Cape Peninsula, saw cape penguins on Boulders Beach, and went to Seal Island. Day 2 we went to the shark cage diving adventure. David is very knowledgeable and great tour guide. Pricing is very reasonable for a private tour.

Enjoyable. I have to commend this company for their flexibility and professionalism.Duncan was our guide and he was most knowledgeable (facts and figures on the ready); friendly and quite frankly saved us a lot of time and hassle. We were booked to go to Table Mountain the next day and if it weren't for Duncan we would never have gone, as the weather changed the next day and the mountain cable way closed. He was kind enough to double check for us and organised for us to go that very day... I would recommend this company to anyone going to Cape Town as they will give you the full experience of the city and its sights but with none of the hassle. We where picked up and dropped off on time as well.
Amazing day at the Cape. Just simply put its amazing and well worth the trip. you will not be disappointed. Very informative guide and really great lunch too!! what are you waiting for! Book it now!

Day Tour of Jo'burg. I booked a day tour of Jo'burg for my husband and 18 year old daughter with African Blue Tours. They had one day to see the city and wanted to have a lot of flexibility with the itinerary and length of time at each stop. Henry was their tour guide and both my husband and daughter raved about the day they spent together. Henry was very informative about the history of the city and S.A. The highlights of the day were stops in Soweto, the Apartheid Museum and Constitution Hill. My husband told me that they could never have seen so much of the city on their own. Many thanks to David for arranging the tour and his quick responses via email as we decided what to do in Jo'burg. I highly recommend this tour company.

Fantastic Time at Cape Peninsula. I did a small group tour of the cape peninsula on my last day in capetown. Duncan our tour guide arrived at my hotel on time and was very friendly. He gave us a brief description of our itinerary which included Seal island cruise. Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. This was an absolutely wonderful tour and a great value too. Duncan made sure we all had a good time and was a true professional. He was well prepared for the tour polite and friendly despite us making extra little stops to shop or have some ice cream along the way. We had lunch at Two Oceans, great seafood. I enjoyed seeing the Penguins and the drive along Hout Bay. This tour was one of the highlights of my trip to South Africa. Thank You Ducan and African Blue for a fantastic tour.

Excellent Tour. We booked a private tour to the Aquila safari and Duncan is our tour guide and driver. He's very friendly and careful driver. Throughout the trip we are very satisfied and would definitely choose this tour again for the next visit.

Wonderful Peninsula and Garden Route Tour. I had the pleasure of traveling with African Blue in April 2016 for 5 days- 1 day Peninsula Tour and 4 day Garden Route Tour.All my email queries were dutifully and promptly answered by David giving me peace of mind whilst planning the trip. During the trip, Duncan (our guide) impressed us with his attention to detail, willingness to go the extra mile, his knowledge, and his eagerness to pick up new knowledge and experiences. He even soldiered on through a bout of gastroenteritis which we both picked up from a restaurant. We really appreciated Duncan's careful driving, given the long distances we covered during this trip. All in, a great experience with African Blue. Highly Recommended!

Excelent 2 days with Duncan. Perfect way to enjoy Cape Town and outstanding customer service. We booked a private Cape Peninsula tour and private transport to the Aquila safari. Based on the weather David switched the tours so we would have the best possible weather on the Cape tour - turned out perfectly. Duncan was an excellent guide - friendly and informative yet didn't feel the need to talk the whole time which I appreciated. He offered suggestions along the way that we could decide what to do: extra wine tour stop on the way back from the Safari, making lunch reservations for us at Cape Point. Highly recommend this company!

The best way to see the Cape!. We loved our private all day Cape Peninsula tour with Matthew. He added a few personal favorite stops and routes that we wouldn't have gotten to see with another tour. The stop at Llandudno Beach was especially enjoyable. Matthew even helped move along the chaotic photo line at the Cape of Good Hope. He also told good stories about the history of the South Africa and the current state of affairs. African Blue also offers wine tours. Matthew would have been a great host for that too, but we'd already put a deposit down with another company by the time we found this out. Perhaps next time!

Two excellent trips. I booked a half day peninsula tour and a one day wine tasting tour with African Blue whilst recently in Cape Town with my wife. I had no problems with arranging and paying for the trips through email and all correspondence was promptly dealt with. The tours, both with Matthew were excellent and he took the time to find out which wines we liked and so tailored our wine trip to include Simonsig known for its sparkly wines which was greatly appreciated. Matthew was punctual,friendly and informative - more like travelling with a friend!

Fantastic experience - very prompt service. I used African Blue to book Shark Cage Diving at Gansbaai, Cape Peninsula tour and Cape Town city tour in the last week of Feb 2016. My wife and I really had an amazing experience of all the activities. Reasons - 1) Competitive pricing. 2) Safe. 3) Very prompt responses over phone and e-mail. I always felt that I got the response I needed at my level of urgency whenever I specified this in my e-mail / phone call. 4) Very courteous and knowledgeable staff - always going the extra mile to provide information and flexibility. I strongly recommend using African Blue for travel needs in Cape Town area :)

Cape Peninsula Tour with Duncan. We had amazing Cape Peninsula Tour with African Blue Day Tours, we would recommend them to anyone. It was only a small group which was fantastic and really got to see another side of Cape Town and its surrounding towns. Its a must when visiting Cape Town. We loved it.

Blue Tours in the Winelands. My wife and I toured a full day in the Winelands with Duncan as our guide. It was a beautiful day tasting the various wines, cheeses and olive oil. Duncan showed an excellent knowledge of the region and provided inside stories which made the trip fun and interesting. He knew staff at the various locations which helped make the stops smooth and timely. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Excellent and professional services = Good memories. First of all I must thank David for always swift response to any request/questions with positive and good input and solutions. Also and not least to Matt taking us around the Peninsula tour , the wine tour and to Aquila private game/safari.His local knowledge and friendly/calm attitude was really a good experience matching us perfect.So whoever is asking me how to plan, to do, to contact for a stay in CT I give them the same answer NO PROBLEM call David and African Blue Tour.

Perfect Choice. My friend and I had only a few days in South Africa and the choice of African Blue Tours was perfect! Our driver, Duncan, was a delight - so knowledgeable, friendly, easy going and informative. He stopped off wherever we asked and was always offering up interesting facts, cultural insights and answered all of our questions. Most importantly, he was very patient with our frequent requests to stop and take pictures! Our world needs more Duncans and he will forever be our personal ambassador to South Africa. Thank You!

Professional, informative and super friendly!. I highly recommend the Cape Peninsula Day Tour with African Blue Day Tours. They were prompt in responding to my emails from the outset. The tour was well organised allowing enough time to visit all the hot spots along the coast without feeling rushed along the way. The guide Mathew was very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. I would highly recommend African Blue and their tours.

Cape Peninsula Tour with Matt from Africa Blue Tours - superb!. This is the second tour which we booked through Africa Blue having already enjoyed a trip out to the winelands around Stellenbosch and Franchhook. It was really easy to book, David the manager is prompt to get in touch and very helpful and the trips are great value for money. Having already spent a week in Cape Town and enjoyed many of the sights, this Peninsula tour was the icing on the cake. The landscape and views were stunning, lunch at the Two Oceans restaurant was delicious and our guide, Matt Bloomberg was fantastic. He was friendly, knowledgeable and it was a pleasure to spend the day with him. A great end to our holiday. Thank you!

Wonderful Tour with Professional Guide. Went on the full day Cape Point tour, our guide Duncan was professional and knowledgeable as well as very helpful and friendly, going above and beyond expectations. We saw all the major sights, Duncan provided lots of helpful information about the history and the natural beauty of the cape area. The small bus was in very good condition. Highly recommend African Blue!

Cape Peninsula Tour with Matt - excellent!. Great day out on the Cape Peninsula! Easy to book, quick responses to email. Matt was an excellent guide, very knowledgeable and great sense of humour. Very accommodating with scheduling, we were picked up at our hotel in the morning, then dropped at the airport for our evening flight home.

Cape Point Peninsula Tour. Awesome experience with tour guide Matt!Very patient even when some of us wondered of to do some curios shopping...Excellent driving and quite knowledgeable of all our stops :-)
Cape Peninsula Tour. Wonderful day out visiting Hout Bay, Simons Town, Chapmans Peak and Cape Point. Duncan our tour guide was both very informative and kind.

Day tour to the Cape Peninsula and Cape Point.. We booked an all day tour to Cape Point. Our driver/ tour guide Duncan arrived early. He was very polite, very professional and always willing to answer our questions. He knew the history of the places we went through. We drove passed the CBD, the Castle of Good Hope, the Waterfront. On the way to Cape Point, we made several stops to take pictures of the beaches and the mountains, the penguins the seals and the ostriches. We'll definitely be using African Blue Tour on our next tour.Stafford.

Great Service and Top Local Knowledge. I booked the day tour to Cape of Good Hope on a scheduled day (Sunday) everything worked like clockwork - pre contact to confirm my pick up - patience with all my to and fro-ing about the date (I had other shifting appointments) and a great value tour full of history, local tips and excellent guide Matthew.Our small bunch Euro(4) / US (1) Aust (1)could all contribute to decisions along the way and comfortable mini coach gave us all room to stretch out and relax.The pace, information and opportunity to stretch our legs were perfect - I'll be back and tell all my friends to go with and trust African Blue Tours, top rate company and personable professional people.

Must do tour of cape coast . We booked a day tour from Cape Town of the Cape coast to Cape Point. Our tour guide Duncan was excellent, v knowledgeable, laid back and looked after us very well. The tour takes in lots of stops including seal watching off Hout Bay, penguins at Bolders, delicious lunch, Cape Point and Good Hope then a final stop at Kirstenbosch Gardens. Duncan planned the route so we missed any large queues for pictures etc by arriving ahead of large bus tours at Cape Point. Lovely group, only 6 of us in the mini bus. Brilliant day, thoroughly recommend.

Simply amazing. We travelled as a mixed age group of 12 family and friends, pre booking airport transfers, shark diving, cape duet tour and a transfer to our next accommodation via David at African Blue Tours in Cape Town. From the planning stages to our stay in Cape Town the service could not be faulted, even helping us do a shopping trip when we first arrived! We were met by David and Matt at the airport in Cape Town and were lucky enough to have Matt for the rest of our tours and travel. His knowledge and passion for the area and South Africa was amazing and he was so keen we see everything possible in our short time in Cape Town. They thought of absolutely everything, even bringing a car to the airport purely for our luggage!The Shark Diving was such an incredible experience, seeing a total of 5-6 different sharks. I would advise to definitely take sea sickness tablets, even if not normally seasick! Although you definitely feel better when in the cage...with your mind on other things!The Cape Duet Tour was also incredible, although obviously a lot to do in a day we fitted everything in, including a lovely lunch in Simons Town.I would recommend African Blue Tours to everyone and will definitely use them again when we return!

Cape Town Peninsula and Winelands Tours. I had a great experience with this travel company on the two excursions I took with them. Everything ran on time and was well planned. Duncan was very knowledgeable and very patient. We were also given options to serve our interests and there was a very relaxed feel to the day despite packing a lot of things in. The van was comfortable and his driving was safe. I highly recommend this tour company.

Cape Point and Stellenbosch day tour. We had a tight schedule whilst we were in Cape Town and looked for a company that would pack Cape Point and Stellenbosch in the one day. And African Blue provided this. We had Duncan as our guide for the day and he was great. His knowledge was exceptional - from the history, to the animals and fauna in the areas we visited. And he was a nice guy - easy to converse with and accommodating to our requests/needs, etc. We would have no hesitation in recommending this company again!

The top tour company in cape Town. We used African Blue Tours for our whole stay in Cape Town. We cant praise them enough. They were brilliant from start to finish. From picking us up from the airport and even taking us over to George at the end of our Cape Town stay. Our tour guide Matt was brilliant, very friendly, helpful and a top guy. He looked after us on all our day tours through out the week, shark cage diving which he picked us up at 3am! our cape point, chapman's peak and wine route trip, where we saw sea lions, penguins at boulder beach, the cape of good hope, cape point and wine tasting in the many vineyards. Matt was very informative and talked about all the history of place we drove through, stopped for photos at the best spots and showed us all the hidden gems Cape Town has to offer. We were very pleased with the service offered by African Blue.

Cape Town Pennisular I day Tour. Booked this tour a few days before we arrived in Cape Town and it was excellent with our knowledgeable guide, Duncan suggesting a negotiable itinerary with approximate timings. We saw seals, penguins, baboons, antelope, dassies, Cape Hope, much flora with scenic stops to suit and a huge range of questions answered. Duncan drove well in a comfortable mini-van and collected from hotel promptly.David Green..Gloucestershire ,UK

The best tours in Cape Town. I'm so glad that we chose David and his team to help us see the best that the Cape has to offer. We booked three tours through David and all were faultless. The starting point for any Cape Town adventure is a tour of the Peninsula. Matthew was our guide, a really friendly knowledgeable guy who was clearly very experienced and knew how best to avoid the crowds on the busiest day of the year. We then followed this up with a day trip to one of the safari reserves, which David transferred us to and from himself - an unforgettable experience and a great introduction for anyone wondering if they would like a safari or not... this will definitely make your mind up for you. It was great to chat to David on the drive there and back and find out lots about the culture and history of the region and the future of tourism in the region. Finally, David arranged a shark dive experience for us which was something I will never forget. This is arranged through an external company that David deals with, but the day was perfect. All three experiences were magical and I couldn't recommend David and his team enough. Even if you are not sure what you would like to do in Cape Town (or other parts of the country) i'd recommend getting in touch. David clearly knows both the country and the tourism industry inside out and i'd trust him to plan the vacation for you.

Cape Peninsula Tour. The Cape Peninsula tour was scenic, picturesque and simply beautiful. We were a small of group of five, and set off in a comfortable passenger van with AC. Stops included Hout Bay (for seal watching), Chapman's Peak, Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope, Boulder'S Beach (for penguin watching). We had a superb time with our guide/driver, Duncan, who is by far the friendliest guides I have met in all my travels so far. I would recommend this tour to anyone who has a day to spend taking in the breathtaking vistas of the Cape Peninsula. Right from booking to execution of our tour, we were pleased with the service offered by African Blue.

Arranged Sanbona Wildlife Reserve. I found African Blue Tours on the internet while searching for safaris out of Cape Town. David Smith recommended Sanbona Wildlife Reserve, which we enjoy very much. He took us there in person and arranged to have us picked up and take on a short tour of the area south of Table Mountain. I cannot recommend him too highly for personal service and advice.

A great partner to any South African holiday. Being limited to ten days' vacation, we had a short time to visit as much as possible in South Africa. We consulted a number of TripAdvisor's recommended guides to gather information and benchmark prices. African Blue stood out for two reasons: first, because of the affable David Smith, whose email responses to our initial queries were prompt and helpful; and second, because the company is able to offer airport pickups and tours in both Joburg and Cape Town (enabling us to cover all of our needs with one provider).Having booked African Blue, we were assigned Duncan as our guide. Duncan was extremely knowledgeable, a safe driver, and an energetic guide. He was flexible in his plans and great with our young kids. He was a great representative of the company and I am pleased to recommend him.

Perfect Tour of the Cape. We travelled with Cheryse in December whilst in Cape Town. We were collected from our Hotel on time and we collected a few more guests on the way. We headed off to the Cape Point and missed all the other tourist traffic due to our knowledgeable hostess. The tour was very comprehensive and fun and we saw lots of wildlife and got some great photos. We had a lovely lunch overlooking the bay. We were a small group and had the choice of direction/ending of the tour. The days was long enough and felt we had covered a lot of ground without being too rushed. Cheryse gave us a lot of background information on South Africa and its people, flora and fauna. She was very proud of her country and rightly so. It's beautiful.

Cape Peninsula and Constantia Wine Tour. Our time in Cape Town was limited so we booked a tour with African Blue so that we could make the most of our time. The service was very good and our guide was very informational. As we were there in the middle of summer, he planned the tour such that we would minimize the wait time. We visited the cape, stopping for pictures along the way, and then visited the penguins as well as a couple of wineries. Lunch and wine tastings were great.Since we are a family of five and wanted to have control of what we did and the pace, we booked the private tour. I highly recommend it. We were able to spend longer where we wanted to, while still being able to see our top attractions.

Cape Peninsula Tour. We used Africa Blue Day Tours in our recent trip to Cape Town. We were booked on a cruise that included a 3 day pre-cruise tour. However this pre cruise tour did not give us the opportunity to visit the beautiful Cape Peninsula. I contacted Blue Day Tours ( David) to book a day tour to the Cape. . David was extremely helpful in helping us plan our time to include the sites of Cape Town that our pre-cruise tour did not include.Duncan our guide arrived punctually at our hotel and a group of 6 of us boarded one of the best tour vans I have been in. There was enough space for all our luggage and lots of leg room for all of us. It was clean and water was provided. Duncan was very knowledgeable, pleasant and handled our itinerary well. He got us to the main sites just before many of the large buses and even pointed out to us a better viewing platform to view the penguins. At the end of the day he took us and our luggage to our ship. As our boat was docked in port for the night the following day with detailed instructions from David we walked, bought our tickets and boarded our ferry to visit Robben Island. Thank you David and Duncan, your tour and help allowed us to maximize our time in Cape Town. I would recommend and suggest to any one who may be on one of the cruise pre-cruise tours to contact Africa Blue. Our experience was first rate.

Great Tour Guide. My recent trip to Cape Town was wonderful and Mathew our tour guide was very helpful in making our experience pleasant. He took us to all the places we wanted to see and even went out his way to show us some other places that he thought we would be interested in just by talking and listening to our personal interest. Thanks African Blue!

Table Mountain w/ Highlights of Cape Town (city tour + table mountain). This is the tour to see the jaw dropping landscapes of Cape Town!! Matt was our guide, and he went above and beyond to make the tour a smashing success. When there were technical issues with the Table Mountain cable car, Matt adopted the tour and took us to other highlights, then brought us back for the stunning sunset atop Table Mountain once the cable car was fixed. If you do just one tour, do this one as it gives you a taste of what the city has to offer in one day.

Cape Peninsula Tour. Really good day tour, plenty of good view points for those crucial photos to be taken. The tour guide Matthew was brillant, adding some useful information and able to answer questions. Highlights were Cape Point and Cape of good hope.

Great Cape Point tour with sociable, knowledgeable guide Matthew. We had a wonderful day driving from Cape Town to Cape Point with our guide Matthew Bloomberg. He really added to the whole tour with his knowledge of the places we went, the history, and even gave us tips on a few of his hidden local gems you won't find in any of the guide books/sites (like going to Llandudno beach instead of some of the other tourist traps). He picked us up at 930a (we're late risers) and we headed down. He was willing to stop along the way for us to take pictures and knew when to push us along when we were spending too much time in one place. We need that some times.Warning - if traveling to Cape Town in general, but specifically Cape Point during the summer seasons, it WILL be windy. We're from the U.S. so we think Chicago is "the windy city" but Cape Town brings it to a whole new level. My wife and I agree we've never in our lives experienced anything like it. So be prepared, and don't wear lose fitting sunglasses or hats because they'll be gone before you know it. We stopped at the old and new lighthouses at Cape of Good Hope (previously "Cape of Storms" which is more accurate given the wind) and be sure to walk up the hill instead of the cable car because there are additional spots along the way to take pictures you won't get via the cable car. And exercise never hurt anybody :)We saw a fire along the way which have been happening at higher rates because of the drought so our drive went on a bit of a detour but we were fine with it. We stopped to visit the penguins (one of the windiest spots so wear long sleeves even if it's hot if you want to avoid getting pelted by the sand). The R65 per Adult admission was a bit high for a few minutes of looking at penguins, you basically pay that much to get good close up pictures. And on the way back, stopping at Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens is an absolute must! We could've spent all day there. Amazing foliage and views of the mountainside one way, and the city and beaches the other. All in all, a wonderful day. Thanks Matthew!

Fine, a few improvements perhaps required. Had an enjoyable trip with Ian around the Cape Peninsula. Highlights were the penguins at Boulders Bay, relaxed lunch at Simon's Town, and Cape Point.Although the trip was enjoyable, there were a few things that could have been improved: the vehicle's suspension was poor and air con unit's generator pumped out warm air, rendering it useless. We opened a window so no big deal, but I'd have preferred air con to wind blowing in my face. Also, instructions to other members of our group were seemingly either unclear or not adhered to, so we ended up having lunch after 3pm. Again no big deal for us but you expect things on such a packed trip to run like clockwork and have lunch earlier than 3pm.A good trip and hopefully the few negatives can be improved for others in future.

Day Cape peninsula tour. Had a fantastic day tour round the cape peninsula with Matt. He was a very knowledgeable guide,not only on the local sights, but gave us tips on all the places to visit up and down the coasts, that foreign tourists aren't aware of. It was well organised and extremely friendly, definitely book with this company.

Superb full day tour of Cape Point. I did this tour at the end of November 2015. It was quite outstanding. The tour guide Duncan was among my best guides, extremely knowledgeable and also managed the day very well. We saw everything including the seal colony, the penguin colony, ate at an outstanding restaurant, saw the magnificent scenery of the Cape Point itself, and ended the day with a full tour of the very beautiful Kirstenbosch Gardens. The vehicle we traveled in was extremely comfortable and high quality. Also very reasonable cost. I highly recommend this tour.

Peninsula Tour. We had a fantastic day out with our guide - Redaa. I think that if he is the standard of Davids guides then ABT will be the tour of choice as he was excellent - the vehicle clean and plenty of water - the choice of restaurant was fantastic and he was so flexible - no set agenda just a damn good guide....We were relaxed at the end of the day and had so many great pictures that a very inquisitive 9 year old took full advantage of the knowledge on display!Thanks also to Hazel at ToEscapeTo for arranging!

A great South African experience. We did 4 private tours with African Blue Tours organized by David Smith and his team:1) City tour of Cape Town and Table Mountain2) Wineland Tour3) Addo Elephant Park (to/from Port Elizabeth)4) Johannesburg, including Apartheid MuseumAll tours and guides were excellent. David was very responsive and knowledgable when we planned the tours beforehand. We had a wonderful experience and we do appreciate the excellent job David`s Team did. Well done & Thank you.

Cape Peninsula Tour 1st Jan 2016. First compliment must to Matt, our tour guide. Very knowledgeable, friendly and extremely interesting. Fantastic trip to Cape of Good Hope, Cape Point, penguin colony in Simons Town, stop for lunch at Bertha in Simons Town, overlooking the harbour. Then onto the seal colony in Hout Bay and fabulous scenery with many stops to capture the stunning surroundings. I don't think our day could have been any better. Thanks Matt - would definitely recommend this tour and tour guide.

Matthew was brilliant.. I booked the pensinsual tour, visiting Cape Point, Cape of Good Hope and the heart-warming penguins on Boulders Beach. For our guide, Matthew, this is more than a job. He is a tour guide with a passion, who fulfills every guest's wish. He told us the most wonderful and interesting stories about every place we visited. I can really recommend this tour, you won't be disappointed. Penguins!

Amazing Cape Peninsula Tour! . David is super efficient with the tours and is very helpful in answering questions. Our guide Duncan showed us many sights through the cape peninsula and is really accommodating to our family of 6 with two elderly folks!Thanks African Blue team for a wonderful day trip :)

fascinating experience. the whole day cape peninsula tour from African Blue Tours was very good and our guide David was friendly and knowledgeable. the entire sightseeing tour from camps bay to cape point and along the way boat ride to see cape fur seals and then visit to boulders beach to see penguins was incredible to say the least. we enjoyed every bit of the tour including having lunch at 'two ocean restaurant' in cape point. no doubt the restaurant is little expensive but given the option to choose by David, we felt it is worth paying and eating fresh seafood at this place which indeed was good.

Great tours.. Booked two tours with David. Cape Town and Table Mountain, Cape Penisular.Our tour guide was Matt. Nice chap, very knowledgeable. Good vehicle. There was only the Two of us on the first tour, and four on the second, so loads of room and very unhurried. We were given choices on where to eat and time to enjoy ourselves.Would not hesitate to recommend them.Very punctual. Full of information for our onwards journey.

Fantastic Full Day Cape Peninsula Tour. Excellent tour in every way. David was wonderful in being able to accommodate me when I emailed him to make a last minute booking. He was very professional and organized. Matthew was my tour guide and he was the best guide I have ever had. He was knowledgeable about a diverse array of subjects and there was a constant narrative throughout the day. I really like how he personalized the tour for the people in the van that day, even making an extra stop when we wanted to see the ostriches up close. It was a day that I will never forget!

Grea privat tour. We booked a privat tour to cape point for the day. I have been there so many times and for me its kind of boring. But WOW! Not with Matt, he knew so much and it was so interessting! He toldus loads of old stories and it was a great day for me. Not again a boring trip to cape point... I would go and bookthe straight away again!!!

Matthew was a star. Booked for two excersions - one to Langa Township. African Blue have a relationship with one of the local residents who took is around on foot. Fascinating and a must when visiting Cape Town. Matthew also took us to District Six and Museum to explain the history.Second day was a trip to the wineries of Frankchuch and Stellenbosch - the most amazing day. Matt was brilliant, chatty, knowledgeable - felt like he was a friend he was very easy to talk to and spend the day with! Thank you Matt for one of our holiday highlights.

Great day out. We booked a full day excursion to the Cape of Good Hope and were picked up on time from our hotel by our guide, Duncan. After skilfully negotiating his way through the Cape Town traffic he then drove us on a fascinating and most enjoyable tour all the way down to Cape Point, stopping along the way to take a boat trip out to see the seals on Seal Island, Simon's Town and the African Penguins on Boulders Beach. Lunch had been booked for us at a great restaurant and after spending some time at the bottom of the world, we were taken to stroll around the beautiful botanical gardens at Kirstenbosch. Duncan's knowledge of the history, politics, geography and nature of the Cape is extensive and we certainly learned a lot about South Africa in general and the Cape area in particular. It was a wonderful day and I would thoroughly recommend African Blue.
Visited Craddle of Mankind and Lesedi. Was picked up by David, your was great he was on time for pickup and helped us through the two sites which were stunning, well worth the money spent.

Who needs GPS when there's Matthew!. To set the scene...our GPS was down and we were lost in Camps Bay, trying to find our guest house. Having spotted an African Blue tours mini bus we asked if the driver had heard of the street name and if he could help us.Matthew was super friendly, he quickly checked Waze for us and not only did he give us directions he then went on to offer to drive to the street we were looking for, and we followed him!Thanks again Matthew!Jonny & Tash

Wonderful Cape Peninsula Tour with Matthew!!. My husband and I reserved this tour online and their communication was on point. Matthew, our tour guide picked us up at 8.30pm just like they mentioned in the email. He made us feel comfortable right from the get go and was very knowledgeable of Cape Town and its history and we learnt a lot about the city!! He never once sounded rehearsed although I can imagine how many times he must have repeated the same lines to countless tourists. He was very accommodating and never made us feel rushed. Matthew also pre-booked our lunch at a very nice restaurant (Bertha's) in Simon's Town. We felt like a friend was showing us around rather than a typical tour guide. I would strongly recommend this tour company and especially Matthew to anyone looking to have a fun and relaxed day as well as learning a lot about Cape Town and Cape Peninsula region. This was truly a highlight of our vacation!!

Private Tour. We were treated to a private peninsula tour with our guide Duncan, he was an amazing guide and very accommodating. The whole day was alot of fun and Duncan provided us with many photo opportunities while also giving us intresting insight on south african history.

Aquila Day Safari and Wine Farms: A Full and Fun Day!. My husband and I spent a very full day with Matthew as our guide. He picked us up at the guest house where we were staying at 7 a.m. and drove us to Aquila. We had a nice breakfast there and then boarded our safari truck with about ten other people. Had a super time and were able to see lions, rhinos, zebras, elephants, springboks up close! Our three hour safari was perfect for us as we did not want to do an overnight or multiple night safari. After lunch at Aquila, Matthew drove us to two wine farms, Warwick and Muratie, each very nice, and very different from each other. We did tastings at both and enjoyed the drive through the Stellenbosch area. Saw several baboons sitting on the guard rail of the road, watching us pass by! Matthew is a very fun guy, a safe driver and incredibly knowledgeable. Throughout the ride he pointed out sites of interest and enlightened us with his knowledge of South Africa, its history, culture and current events. Thank you, Matthew, for a terrific day! And thank you, David, for suggesting we combine the two tours! It was great!

Cape peninsula group tour!. Contacted the company in July, expressing my interest and asking for ideas whilst I was in cape town.-David was prompt with his responses-Informative, with good advice and suggestions.The tour itself was amazing, had Duncan for the day, what a gentle soul. Every photograph has a story because the depth of knowledge he holds, is phenomenal. I was very impressed.Enjoy

Wine tasting tour in Stellenbosch and Franschhoek. Took the wine tasting tour the day after the trip to Township. Big contrast, with many questions regarding South African history and the situation today on our minds. But our guide Matthew not only provided us with an relaxing tour in exact right tempo and duration, but also helped us get some answers to those questions. Balanced, knowledgeable and and with reflections we could follow and that answered many of our questions.Not to much, not to little! It felt just right and very pleasant to invite our guide to join us for lunch. Would recommend him for anyone who wants to take the same tour. Trude & Asgeir

Two days with Matt. My wife and I decided to take a couple of day tours, one to the wine area and the other to Cape of Good Hope. We were extremely fortunate to end up being the only people on tour so it was like having our own private tour and time was efficiently utilized. Matt was very informative and new a lot about the Capetown area. I was able to book online and the owner responded very quickly suggested we change the tours around because of the weather forecast. Excellent company

"Best experience of my life". Great job to tour guides! They really took a good care of us. My wife and I really had a good time in Hluhluwe Imfolozi game reserve. And Cape Town tour was a breath taking. Thank you very much Dave Smith! For getting eventhing lineup us

First class all the way. From the start African Blue were simply first class. The liaison, correspondence prior to arrival from David spot on and always prompt. Our guide Duncan was superb, knowledgable, professional , courteous, helpful, caouldnt ask for more. We spent 4 days touring . Trips were all individual and made to measure. We saw everything from whales, ostrich, penguins to baboons . Amazing views. Superb horse riding on Noordhoek beach. Cape point stunning. Would love to come back with the whole family and children. So much to see . Recommend African Blue for your trips , you won't get any better . Thanks David and Duncan

An Amazing tour. We had an amazing time in South Africa. All was greatly planned and booked (including the weather :-)). We really enjoyed the time with Matthew he was balancing very well his guidance with providing us family time as well, and he also managed to catch quickly on the thing we enjoyed doing and adapt the plan accordingly. We enjoyed his companion and pleasant personality. It was a great trip

Cape Peninsula full day tour. Superb full day tour with Matthew as our guide. I was picked up directly from my hotel in Cape Town. This was really memorable day with a highly knowledgeable local who really brought the area to life. A beautiful drive down one side of the peninsula with lots of opportunities to take photographs. There was a stop to take a boat trip to Seal Island which was a great experience. The highlight was the trip to Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope (learned these are different). A bit of a climb to the lighthouse, but well worthwhile. Lovely trip back with lunch near to the Penguin Colony at Boulders. Great guide, great company and a great day out.

100 Percent Perfect Wineland tour. We booked this tour online about a week and a half ago with no problems. That may be partly due to this not being the height of the tourist season. Our guide (Mathew) always had a smile and a nice comment. He was able to walk two novice wine tasters through the day without fail. Also, being that he provides many different tours, he was able to answer all of our wide-ranging questions. Mathew took us to many wonderful places including several vineyards of varying types, a beautiful lunch overlooking a valley of vineyards, and a couple of small towns where we could buy gifts for back home. While there was so much to see and do, Mathew never had us in a rush and we always seem to have more time. While I'm sure a group setting would be pretty fun, our private tour was catered perfectly for us (and we had no clue what we wanted to do when we set out in the morning).

Look no further. Our group of 4 engaged African Blue for two separate day tours when in Cape Town last week. The tours were pre-arranged via email with David. Payment was easily settled online via credit card. It was our first trip to Cape Town (except for one) and we were very much impressed with the general service standards in the city’s tourism industry. This is very much so in the case of African Blue and the lodge we stayed (that’s another story). We opted for the scheduled full day Cape Peninsula on Day 1 and a private Table mountain /City/ Kirstenbosch private tour on Day 2. Duncan, our guide for both days, was excellent. He was patient, professional and very knowledgeable in the areas of history, geography and nature. Places we visited offered both magnificent views & enriching experiences. Thanks again, Duncan, for the well conducted tours, the exciting ride up to Signal Hill to catch the noon gun and the beautiful sunset captured during the scenic ride back to Cape Town Central from Kirstenbosch. Kudos to David, who, having checked the weather forecasts, took the initiative and efforts (by mail & phone) to contact us to swap the date for our private tour from Wed to Tue to avoid missing the Table Mountain given the rainy forecast for Wed. Proven to be a wise decision and we were blessed with beautiful sunshine. If you are searching for a tour operator in Cape Town, look no further! On a side note, I would recommend to devote a full day to enjoy the sights and sounds of Table Mountain.

Amazing. Greatest service and gratest people. I booked the Cape duet private tour, pick up service and cape town city private tour afternoon with Duncan. Cape Point and the tast in stellenbosch there was fantastic, the african blue tour staff was avaible anytime for any ours request.The last day we known David Smith, the boss .We are very happy for the choice and if we will comeback to sudafrica we will comeback to african blue tours.Thank you
Cape Peninusular Tour. Had a great day touring the cape peninsular, Matthew our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. Full day tour was great value.

Private Cape Winelands Tour. My wife and I signed up for a private tour of the Winelands. Our tour guide, Duncan, was extremely knowledgeable and thoroughly professional, in addition to being very pleasant and personable. He took us to three wineries that we enjoyed very much--the surroundings as much as the lovely wine. This tour was one of the highlights of a very pleasant trip to South Africa. We definitely plan to come back to South Africa, and hope to do another tour with Duncan and African Blue.

Cape Peninsula Drive. Our tour guide Duncan was on point arriving shortly before the scheduled start time. The drive along the coast was brilliant with mountains on one side and an expanse ocean on the other. My wife and I were the only tourists but Duncan acted professionally and exhaustively in terms of information provided for the entire journey. Visit to seal island was splendid and I particularly enjoyed the cozy lunch in Simons Town during our stopover to see the penguins. Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope were tremendous giving you that feeling you are at the worlds edge!!! Then to piece all together, botanic Kirstenbosch with its lush green. Awesome trip and surely will return to Cape Town.

Amazing tour!. We had a very short time in Cape Town and African Blue Tours made sure to accommodate everything we wanted to do for a morning tour. Matt our guide was extremely knowledgeable about South African History and was such a friendly guy. I would request him as a guide any day of the week.
