An awesome trip with some awesome people! 6 Day Garden Route Tour. The whole experience was an amazing one and incredible value for money! The hostels were hidden gems, each having their own individuality and feel but all comfortable and the food was incredible with real emphasis on traditional South African cuisine. The tour guide Charlene was exceptional. She was professional, welcoming and had a great deal of knowledge and love for her country and wasn't afraid to answer the harder questions on South Africa's history, politics and culture. She managed to keep the trip going smoothly with out us feeling rushed and I now like to consider her a good friend I met whilst traveling. The trainee guide who was also with us, Rochelle, was equally as good and will make an incredible guide herself and I wish her luck with her training. The trip included a variety of optional extras as well and we visited some amazing place, Addo National Park being a personal favourite. I Strongly recommend this tour as me and my friends had the most amazing time.

Amazing 6-day Garden Route tour experience!. Such an amazing experience! I had originally had planned on traveling without an organized tour with a good friend, but after purchasing my flights, my friend bailed so I was stuck to figure things out on my own. I came across Earthstompers during my research and they were the only garden route trip that offered an affordable, high value, off-the-beaten-path experience. Charlene, our tour guide, was excellent and felt more like a friend than a tour guide. The trip was very well organized and had a good mix of activities and down time to enjoy the backpackers (hostels), a few drinks, and each other's company. I also felt like I gained a deeper understanding of South African culture and politics than I ever could have if I had done the trip on my own or with another standard tour company. I also loved the emphasis on high quality, delicious South African food. I would highly recommend this tour company to anyone looking to travel alone or with friends!

Garden Route and ADDO. This was actually our 3rd trip to south africa and we already fell in love with the country. We decided to also go a bit further and see the garden route and more of the breathtaking scenery. Our guide stephanie picked us up in cape town and we met the group. As it was monday morning we were not talkin to much but soon the people start to talk and we got to know each other. I must say i could not ask for a better group, we had an awesome time together and are still in contact now. Guys remember the reunion :) Our guide was a perfect mix between guide, driver and buddy to hang out with. You can manage to see a lot in this short time and do a lot of activities if you want to. You have to know that it is a bit of driving but take some naps and its totally fine :) Plus Addo is not a safari for the big 5 but it was still awesome to see the animals that close. Please guys do youself a favour and book this cool adventure! thanks steph for this amazing week and also thanks to my group i miss you guys!

6-Day Garden Route Tour. The 6-Day tour takes you from Cape Town, along the South Coast and Garden Route and back (see the Earthstompers website for a detailed itinerary). I did it in January 2015 and had a great experience. Our guide Stephanie was fantastic - as a source of information, a driver and a friend. I was also lucky to share the tour with a good group of travellers (11 others in total) - couldn't have asked for a better bunch.The itinerary is packed - it's the perfect way to experience some of the beauty of South Africa if you're pressed for time, as I was. Activities can be tailored to your preference, with plenty on offer for adrenalin junkies. Be aware that the tour is fast-paced, and a significant amount of time is spent in the van (to cover all that distance). I would also recommend taking the option of a private room at the hostels, rather than the dorm.Overall, the trip was incredibly fun. It left me with lasting memories, new friends and even more love for South Africa. Big thank you again to Steph.

Great tour with very professionnal and friendly and always helpful guide Steph. I did the 6 day Garden Route Tour & Addo Elephant Parc with this company. We have seen a lot in these 6 days, but if you can, do it perhaps in 7 days. There might be a bit more time to enjoy this beautiful part of South Africa. Sometimes you have to choose between suggested activities, no time to do them all, but was ok for me as I did not wantto do everything anyway. The Backpackers where we stayed were phantastic and very comfortable. Sometimes situated just above the beach and once we stayed in a wonderful lodge which was an orange farm too. Amazing trip and lasting memories! Thank you!

6-day Garden Route and Addo Tour - Highly Recommended. What a great tour! We were a bit skeptical about taking a 6 day tour in a van - lots of driving, unknown co-travellers, etc. We were very pleasantly surprised and had a great time with Earthstompers and our guide Stephanie. The whole trip was well organized, we got to see so many things that it would be difficult to see if you were on your own and we always had a great guide with us – explaining everything to us along the way. The 6-day Garden Route and Addo trip does entail a lot of driving but we made many stops along the way and Stephanie was always a great driver as well as a fantastic guide. All of the guesthouses along the route were of very high quality and service was always at its best. Many optional activities provided – don’t miss out on the skydiving – pure adrenalin boost! Even some South Africans we met in Cape Town after the tour were amazed how much we saw in so little time. Highly recommended and thanks again to Stephanie for the great trip!

garden tours. It was a amazing tour charlene is a great guide she knows a lot and explain everything very good. we where with a great group from 13 people. and it went super. i love the whale spotting and the canopy zip lining was great. the ostrich farm was very nice to do and we stay in a guest house every evening you can also pick the backpackers what was also great what i here from the author guest. i love the pard Addo it was and the elephant sanctuary was awesome.special thnx to charlene it was awesomethnxLinda

Amazing tour. I went on the 5/6 day tour for the garden route and it was amazing! Charlene our tour guide was the best! We all made such good friends on the tour and charlene made sure we all did what we wanted to do making sure we got everywhere on time.The best activities was the Conagoe caves (adventure tour - although not if you are claustrophobic) , canoeing and the safari were also awesome! The wine tour was great and I really enjoyed the Sandboarding. The only thing I didn't enjoy is the Ostrich farm, its good fun except for when people try to ride them, they have to catch the ostrich by the neck and then hood them, its just unkind. The beaches we went to were beautiful and Titskamma is really beautiful. The canopy zip-lining was also great fun. It was just non stop gogogo (but you can catch up on sleep in the bus). You could also do whale watching, Elephant sanctuary and shark cage diving which they add onto the tour if you want to :)We stayed in the Backpackers which I strongly recommend over the guest houses. Every single back packers we stayed at had the best atmosphere, all very friendly, clean and comfortable. Also, the tour always ate at the back packers, I think people staying in the guest houses got annoyed that they had to get driven home every night after dinner rather than staying on and drinking. You do not have to stay in a dorm (although we did) you can ask for private rooms. I went with my friend but we also had to honeymoon couples on our tour who I know loved every minute of it also :)Earthstompers sort everything out for you so all you have to do is enjoy yourself :)Chloe

Unforgettable trip along the Garden Route. I took a 6 day Garden Route tour in September/October, and it was the highlight of my trip to South Africa. Charlene was such a knowledgeable and friendly guide, and went out of her way to make sure everyone had a fun, safe experience. As a solo traveller, I was slightly concerned about joining a group where I didn't know anyone, but as there were only 7 people in total we gelled instantly, and I made friends from a diverse selection of countries including Singapore, Switzerland and Germany. The scenery on the Garden Route is spectacular, and the mix of activities Earthstompers include caters for everyone, from canoeing to bungee jumping and everything in between. All the backpackers we stayed in were clean and comfortable, and we had some delicious braai in the evenings. There is a lot packed in to this tour, so the pace may not suit everyone, but it is great value for money, with attentive guides and some of the most breathtaking countryside you will ever witness. I highly recommend it. And if you have the courage, do the bungee jump!

Absolutely amazing tour. Earthstompers has such a wonderful garden route tour. They prepare a great a itinerary with a balance of sightseeing, adventure, fun, and culture. The accommodations were all very impressive - clean, vibrant, special, unique and always a great staff. Everything was great and well-thought -- the food, the beaches, the markets and places we visited. Our tour leader Steph is extremely knowledgeable on all things South African. She was a wonderful host, very well-organized, went above and beyond and showed us all a really good time. Thank you Earthstopmers!

All you could want and then some more. I have just returned from a fabulous trip along the Garden Route with Stephanie. As a single traveller I decided to book the backpackers en-suite accommodation and I was not disappointed. Each and every place we stayed was extremely clean, friendly, and fantastic value for money. I even had a four poster bed for my last nights stay!! From the initial pick up until the moment I was dropped off everything was well organised and efficient. The activities offered were ideal and offered a wide variety of choice for both young and old. As ever with these trips the make or break can be with your group and I was lucky to spend six days with such a great group of people....I think this tour must attract like minding individuals! One person who must get a special mention is our tour leader Stephanie. She put in so much effort to making our trip hassle free and enjoyable, she is extremely knowledgeable about all things Africa and certainly knows how to manoeuvre a Toyota mini van + trailer!! Cannot recommend highly enough, just wish more tours were on offer for my next trip to South Africa.

Breath Taking Experience. Really loved this trip good mix of activities hiking canoeing and sightseeing. Our guide Charlene was excellent very relaxed well organised and passionate about the countryside. Loved some of the places we stayed at only wish we could have had a few days longer at some of the places. Good value and enjoyed our time immensely.

A very memorable & enjoyable week along the Garden Route. We were so impressed with this trip by Earthstompers. Every day was something new and different, our group of 12 was a great mix of interesting people, and having the option of being able to choose from multiple different options for our "extra" activities made it almost like a custom-designed trip. Stephanie was so knowledgeable, nice, and accommodating for all our needs. Our vacations have typically been more "do-it-ourselves" type affairs, but it was so nice to have someone else do all driving, have all the great lodging and much of the dining arrangements already taken care of, and not have to concern ourselves with those decisions. One of the highlights for us was all the up-close encounters with multiple kinds of wildlife during the early-morning Ranger-led wildlife viewing trip at Addo Elephant National Park. We have already highly recommended this trip to our friends.

Awesome trip along the Garden Route. We had such an awesome trip lead by the masterful guide and owner, Hendrick Human. First, we couldn't have been more lucky with the composition of our 12 person group. Our ages ranged from 17 to 57 (but everyone was ageless in their interactions), and we represented five different nationalities (but everyone was able to communicate and relate as if we were all neighbors). Every where we toured and stayed was really spectacular. The only negative was that we didn't get to spend enough time at each stop. I wish we could have had a longer trip... (our fault). Hendrick was incredibly informative, accommodating, and willing to cater to our unique needs. He also did a remarkable job of offering a wide variety of activities that kept everyone entertained.

The PERFECT Choice!. We hired a private guide, Nicolene, through Earth Stompers. We were specific as to our needs and the sights we wanted to see. Earth Stompers was able to set us up with the perfect itinerary to meet each and every need with the greatest level of comfort and confidence along the way. Nicolene was beyond professional and caring. We felt safe and taken care of in her hands even though we were thousands of miles away from home. Nicolene went above and beyond what should have been expected of her as a tour guide. She anticipated our needs and usually had them taken care of before we even had to ask. She respected our privacy yet was happy to join us for meals, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The communication between myself and Earth Stompers as to payments was smooth and professional. We have nothing negative to report...only to recommend this company with the highest of regards for a trip of a lifetime you will never forget.

Lovely experience in the Cape. Earthstompers definitely comes highly recommended. The staff are so courteous, helpful and knowledgeable and their choices about the food, accommodation, sights to be seen and adventure in Cape Town are certain to make the whole experience enjoyable. I really had a great time. It's very nice when a personal touch and flavour is added to these tours and that is what Hendrik and Chrissy seem to have perfected.Thank you for a great time and will look forward to more in the future.

Great Experience. Me and my boyfriend visited South Africa in August and made the 6 day Garden Route tour. We experienced a lot of great things we would have never seen if we would have organised the tour by ourselves.Our Tourguide Nicole gave us so much information about the country that we could not only learn a lot but understand the people and the way of living in South Africa better.Because we were only 5 people she could cater to our wishes and make it individually special for all of us. The included meals were very good, we could experience typical south african dishes and special places. The accommodations were all comfortable We stayed in the guest houses and were very satistfied with all the places.Also the activity level is fine and you can organise the tour by your own wishes with all the special trips. You just should be prepared to get up early in the morings to manage all the activities.I would defently recommend trips with earthstrompers adventures because I could have not imagined the trip being any better!

Fantastic!. From the beginning of the tour at pick up to revisiting the areas at the end of the tour (with slightly more fatigue) this is one not to be forgotton. The trip via the vast and stunning, diverse countryside was exceptional, only topped by Henrik's(our guide) soothing and educational narrative as we cruised through. The accommodation was of a really high standard for the bag packers so if you really want a luxury treat...you can go with the guest houses. We went with the private bagpackers room and found the room very clean (sometimes quite spacious/luxurious) with amazing character...often a chic bohemian style. Meals are provided for every day at the bagpackers digs and is absolutely delicious regardless of your diet. I'm fussy and was never disappointed!There are lots of adventures for thrill seekers and for those of us that are slightly faint at heart, a beer and an ocean are never too far away. A must do if time permits in Cape Town, was definitely the highlight of my visit. I must also say that Hendrik went above and beyond to ensure everyone had a good time, so there's no need to be shy for lone travellers!

An exciting, fun and professional experience. This was the first tour type experience I've done. If they are all like this, it certainly won't be my last. The trip has a fantastic mix of seeing SA's best and most beautiful sites/locations, along with a range of unique, exciting activities, but packaged as something personable and professional. I wasn't expecting to partake in half of the activities I did, but the week carried me away and I had a fantastic time. The accommodation is very good, the additional costs very well priced (for a British tourist) and the tour caters for a range of personalities. A must do.

The unforgettable Garden Route!. It's been almost 2 months since my friend and I took the Garden Route with Earthstompers Adventures and we are still remembering the great moments we had in our six day trip: From the fantastic and beautiful scenery to the wonderful activities that were organized such as the Game Drive in the Addo Elephant Park, the treetop Canopy Tour, the Canoeing and Hiking in the Wilderness National Park, the Ostrich Farm Tour or the Whale Watching Boat Trip!! Everything was so well-prepared, we loved the constant contact with the environment (we were very lucky with the weather) and the meals were great too. Special mention to our guide Stephanie, she was so nice, gave us lots of information and you could tell that she loved what she's doing as she was always so pleased and patient to answer all our questions!! :)

Absolutely outstanding!!!!! Best tour on our whole Africa holiday. Earthstompers were outstanding from when I first dealt with Chrissy at the office to arrange the trip, through to our awesome holiday and guide Hendrick. Chrissy was always prompt to respond to my emails and worked with me to tailor a custom tour for our group of 7 along the Garden route. When we arrived we were so lucky to get Hendrick as our guide. He was so much fun and ensured we all had a fabulous time. The accommodation that they picked for our group was perfect. We stayed in the most amazing farmhouse for our last night and Hendrick even arranged for the owner to cook us a traditional brie on the outdoor fire. He even bought along 4 bottles of red wine for us as a surprise!! Hendrick took us to all the best local restaurants and eateries and went out of his way to ensure our experience was the best it could be and that every little detail was covered. Hendrick was well and truly the best guide we had on our whole 4 1/2 week vacation through Africa. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending him and can't wait to go back to South Africa and do another tour with him and Earthstompers along the amazing Garden route.

Fantastic Garden Route Tour. What a FANTASTIC experience!!!! Chrissy was amazing from the word go. Prompt replies and great help organising out tour, while Hendrick just made the whole experience that much better with his professional and friendly manner. We all can't thank you enough and can't wait to come back and see you again. We will definitely be recommending you to any of our friends and family travelling your way!

Great South Africa Experience. It was a pleasure to meet exciting people on an exciting trip along the Garden Route. Would definitely recommend the tour to everyone (solo travelers, couples, groups). Thanks Stephanie for an unforgettable experience, excellent accommodation, food and trips.

Amazing. Thanks Hendrik for the fantastic time along the garden route. The tour that you Chrissy and Tania organised couldn't have been better. You made the trip so enjoyable and it was a great way to start our African adventure. Can't wait to come back and see more!!Thanks again.Christine

I'm already saving to go back. The Garden Route is beautiful. Had great weather - even for their winter! - and our tour guide Nicole was amazing. She really looked after us all for the week and encouraged us to make the most of the trip. I would recommend taking part in all of the activities offered. Accommodation and food was excellent. Great value for your money!

Best trip yet.. Everything was excellent and well beyond what we were expecting. The guides were friendly, knowledgeable and made the experience even better. The sights were amazing, as were our accommodations, and the activities were very entertaining.

Awesome. The tour was great, packed with many things you could do (or not do if you prefer to relax and opt out for the selective activities). I was never bored and tried a number of things I've never done. The guide, Nicole, will encourage you when you need it and also make you feel comfortable in doing what you want despite it not being the consensus! Nicole will also help you with anything that's within her power I think! We also stayed at lovely places. Would definitely recommend it :)

Great tour!. I had only a few days to spend and I definitely chose the right tour to enjoy South Africa and the garden route! The places you get to visit and to stay at are perfectly chosen, every recommendation by our tour guide Nicole was 100% great and reliable. She really knows what she's talking about :-)I would immediately join the tour again if I could!

Had a great guide named Nicole and a great trip up the Garden Route. You get to do a lot of stuff and it is a good value for the money. The trip had great breakfasts and dinners provided. Every day was a new adventure from bungee jumping the highest bungee bridge in the world (Bloukrans Bridge), to seeing beautiful beaches in Tsitsikamma and Wilderness, to even seeing a lion eat a kudu in Addo National Park.  Nicole, our guide, wanted to make sure everyone on the trip had a good time. She was very knowledgeable and accommodating. Therefore, if one person didn't want to do an activity she would arrange for that person to do something else - dropping them off and picking them up. E.g. some people didn't want to visit the ostrich farm and ride ostriches so she arranged to take them to an animal park in the area and pet lions. Nicole also has a sweet disposition that made the trip that much more enjoyable. We travelled quite a long distance in the bus but the ride was comfortable, conversation amiable, and the view beautiful. She also dropped me off at the airport and helped me pick up some supplies for my next trip through Botswana to Vic Falls. I would highly recommend this trip.

Earthstompers Adventures. We took a 6 day trip along Garden Route in the Cape Town Province of Soouth Africa. Arranged ahead of time smoothly. We were picked up from the hotel and driven back. This was the trip for all tastes and ages - the group was small counting 5 people - 3 young ad 2 in sixties. But there was a place and activitity for all. The places visited were well choosen, accomodations well planned. The hostels offered a different tastes. All of them were good, reliable, safe, provided various experiences. The guide/driver Stephanie Harris of highest competence and very knowlegable. It was she who e.g. in Addoo Game Reserve was spotting easily wild life. All in all the trip is to be recommended to everyone and experience - landscapes, wildlife, culture one encounters is worth the effort.

6 day garden route - awsome!. my boyfriend and i only had a short time to spare and the 6 day tour fit our schedule perfectly. Everyday was a new amazing adventure. Great value for price. amazing accommodations, great food. good people 25-35 age average. Our tour guide Nicole was THE BEST. So warm friendly knowledgable helpful flexible and sweet. The optionals are wicked! The only thing i will say is be prepared if you are travelling in the winter it is COLD. Many accommodations do not have any heating. Bring more than the recommended 'hat & gloves for the addo elephant park'. you need a proper winter jacket and boots! But totally worth it!!

Best tour experience. We were the lucky ones as we had a "private" tour with Hendrik on a 6D Garden Route tour as there was only the two of us and tourguide (being winter I guess when it was a quieter season), however, this didn't stop Hendrik's enthusiasm during the whole trip. We had such a great experience especially the FOOD. Truly unforgettable, we had the best ostrich steak, pies, bobotie, koeksister, kudu, vetkoek and the list goes on.. We learnt a lot about SA's history, geography, cultural, and more importantly had heaps of FUN. The caves was beautiful, did canoeing, bush walking, bungee jump (1st time ever), safari in Addo, stayed at different guest houses, had a bit of wine (beautiful, should have bought more).I would not hesitate to recommend Earthstompers to anyone thinking of doing the Garden Route tour, you will not regret it. Me and partner have been travelling pretty extensively (5 continents done) in the last 4 years with different tour groups and this was no doubt the best. SA is an amazing place, and if you want to get the best memories & experience, this is it.

Outstanding experience!. I cannot sing enough praises for Nicole and the rest of the Earthstompers team!! I joined the 6-day Garden Route tour which was absolutely amazing. I'm just sorry it took me such a long while to write this review (I travelled in Feb 2014) - and sorry for those people who may have made a crazy decision to go with other operators!!From the start I experienced nothing but professionalism and attention to detail. I got a response to my out of hours email within 6 hours and the booking process and costs were transparent and secure. I opted for a hostel ensuite private room for the week and I didn't regret this for a second. We stayed in a variety of individually styled hostels. All were clean and vibrant with very friendly and accommodating hosts. Earthstompers check out each one and know the people who run them. The range of experiences themselves were amazing. Nicole has such a breadth of knowledge and a really good feel for the group and our likes that we really got the best out of every tour stop. We were such a varied group with ages 20s to 50s but we all got on so well which was great! I opted for the tandem skydive and the bungee jump - and I felt the organisations that ran these activities were very focused on safety and on making sure I had fun! Additionally, Nicole went out of her way to make us each feel comfortable - she accommodated my weird food dislikes and even helped arrange for me to get an "emergency" manicure! I will never forget my time in South Africa. It is an awesome country with such amazing people and so much natural beauty, and Earthstompers were key to making it truly a holiday of a lifetime.

The best experience (and a guide to) of South Africa. I booked a 6-day Addo & Garden Route tour through a travel agency. Stephanie, our guide, was very knowledgeable. She could tell us so many fascinating stories and details about her country. She knew everything about animals, plants and geography wherever went. She was very enthusiastic and one could feel she genuinely loves what she does which made the Earthstompers experience unforgettable. She was also very caring and thoughtful - me and another tour participant fell ill, and she arranged it for us to see the doctor within 24hours. The accommodation was well-selected - we had a variety of hostels and hotels, and the choice of stops en route was well-planned. Thank you for a great experience of South Africa, Stephanie!

6-day Garden Route Tour. I stumbled upon this tour through a travel agency and could have not been happier with the experience. Everything went smoothly, from hostels to attractions. Our tour guide, Nicole, was amazing - wonderfully positive and excited to share her knowledge of South Africa. This is really a gem and will recommend it to anyone that goes to South Africa and wants to explore the Garden Route with some adventure!
Garden Route Tour. We had a fantabulous time with Harris along the garden route tour. The tour included option activities such as the bungee jumping and sky diving which was exhilarating.

We had a wonderful time in Cape Town. We had a wonderful time in Cape Town and surroundings with Earthstompers. We can´t thank you enough for a well put together itinerary, we really got the most out of our trip :-) Our guide Hendrik was fantastic, his knowledge, flexibility and wounderful humour made our tour the best.

10 days of Garden Route joy. Earthstompers was previously unknown to me but following several clear email exchanges with Hendrik the 10 day itinerary was sorted and we awaited collection from the first guest house in Cape Town. Our guide Erica was superb, ready at all times during the trip and full of South African knowledge on the culture, food, wine, animals and geography. The days each had their own character, be it wildlife, wine tours, sights, river canoeing or a mixture with each leaving us delighted at the end of the day with plenty to talk about over excellent food and wine (great value too!). All of the places stayed in offered all that could be wanted for cleanliness, friendliness and facilities. All of the places visited offered great value and experiences, even if 10 days is not really long enough to explore this area properly! As far as we were concerned their was nothing missing and the personal touches from Hendrik and Erica were very much appreciated. A great break with great organisation and well worth talking too. Definitely recommended to anyone wanting to do something similar. Email Hendrik now!

Garden Route and ADDO Tours. Our vacation (Monday, May 26 to Friday, May 30, 2014) with Earthstompers Adventures was one of the best ever. Our guide Stephanie and Byron provide great commentary and information.They knew where to look for landscapes and wildlife and we could stop for photos whenever we wanted.The bus was very comfortable, Accommodation and food was up to standart and general organising went without a hitch. We absolutely loved our tour and seeing all of the amazing sights from Cape Town to Port Elizabeth.We highly recommend this company for vacation you will never forget! :) Beata, Klaudia and Thomas from Poland

Garden Route Tour. Had a wonderful time on the Garden Route tour with guide Stephanie. We had a great group with 3 twenty somethings, a middle age person, and myself (a retiree). I was concerned that as a "senior" on the trip I might not fit in - but I was absolutely wrong. It was a wonderful experience, we all enjoyed the trip. I would strongly recommend the company, the tour, and the guide whether you are young or just young at heart. I will definitely be back to South Africa in the future. Thank you!
Garden route and Addo adventure. An action packed tour, taking in some stunning scenery, with some excellent guides. Two thumbs up from me!

The most fun and amazing tour!!!. The tour was over the top. Tour guide was amazing and very accommodating. The best way to see South Africa's coast line in my eyes. Would highly recommend to anyone going there for the first time and seeking a great adventure!!

A wonderful garden route tour. I cannnot express how much we loved this tour. The hotels were 5 stars (we stayed in the hostels) and the food was amazing (seriously there was a huge variety of food and we still debate which meal was the best). Stephanie, the tour guide, was awesome and full of great ideas (like watching the sunset with beers). The price was very reasonable and the tour had lots of flexibility for the adventurous to the shopper to the history lover. I would recommend this to everyone who wants to do the Garden Route.

A fantastic week, would go again in a heartbeat!. An awesome way to make the most of the Garden Route! The itinerary is well put together and packed with activities/experiences that ensure you make the most of your trip. The backpacker accomodation is really comfortable and provides excellent South African food. Our guide Hendrik was brilliant, his knowledge, passion and sense of humour helped us to get the most out of every destination! We just wish we could have stayed longer! Take this trip!

An excellent Garden Route tour during second half of May. Even if you passed your midlife crisis already and if you don´t mind to travel with youngsters half of your age, I can fully recommend this venture. This tour is well organized, the atmosphere relaxed and personal and accomodations hand-selected. Our driver and guide Stephanie was always good-humored, helpful, knowledgeable and an excellent driver. This well over 2,000 km roundtrip is a comfortable way to explore part of the coastal region of South Africa within 6 days. Pick-up from our hotel was on the minute (as all the others during the trip). While bungee-jumping and shark-diving was not the challenge we needed, we loved the alternative hiking options and strolls along lonely beaches or rocky coasts (a pair of sturdy shoes recommended; hiking boots not required). Instead of the atmospheric hostels we had chosen guesthouse accomodations, which we always found very satisfying up to really luxurious. The same applies to breakfast and dinner (on most days included; dinner was always together with the group). We were lucky with the weather, mostly warm and sunny but not really hot, at times good to wear a jacket. Sunset is already around 6.p.m. Although the days were therefore relatively short we found this time of the year with the big crowds gone and amenable temperatures the perfect time to go on such a trip and enjoyed the evenings sitting around the fireside savoring a bottle of local beer or a glass of wine. Seeing elephants, zebras and other wilds beasts (e.g. in Addo N.P.) is a very different experience than going to a zoo. All in all a very diverse, worthwhile tour with a company that fully deserves its good reputation.

A wonderful 6 day garden route trip. I recently finished an amazing trip on the Garden Route with Earthstompers Adventures. We were lucky to be a little group of 5 people, and the atmosphere was excellent.Hendrik is an extremely thoughtful guide: he would do his best, or more, to be sure you're enjoying your trip :)Everything was very well organized, and even if the sun was not always there, it was a beautiful week. Thank you for everything Hendrik! And thank you Marieke, Suzanne, Sara and Mike for this nice week spent together :)

The best decision I made in SouthAfrcia. I am from Germany and wanted to see a bit of this amazing country. It was the best decision ever to go on the 6 Day Garden Route Tour! Our tourguide Steph was awesome! We had so much fun together! We were a really mixed group which I first thought could become really weird.Almost all of us came from different countries and weren't in the same age group! But in the end I made friends forever even if being 40 years apart. That is something I will never forget about this tour! Really if you are thinking of doing this tour or not, just do it! You will have such a good time! As a local Steph showed us so beautiful places you wouldn't have seen without going on this tour. The Backpackers we stayed in were great! Everyone was very special on their one way. All very clean and oooh I can't forget that! The FOOD! Yes the food was great. I am staying in Cape Town for half a year and haven't tried any local food. On this tour I had the opportnity to actually get to know this country better than I did after a few months in Cape Town! So for every type of personality there is always something to do: if you are the ADVENTURE type you can go bunjy jumping, skydiving or shark cage diving - if you are more interested in animals you can go on an Ostrich Farm tour, go to Knysna Elefant Park and actually touch the Elefants or go on an extra gamedrive in Addo Elefant Park-or if you're just the one that wants to chill you can just walk around the towns like Hermanus, Knysna and Mossel Bay, go to the woderful beaches on the way or go shopping Yay! So there is like a little something for everyone! I hope you actually just decided to go for this tour cause you won't regret it! Have a great time :)Oh yes Steph if you're reading this: Thank you for this wonderful time! I enjoyed it so much and I hope you are enjoying your Little White rabbit :) No no it's okay ;) Hope seeing you soon!!

A great time down the Garden Route.. We recently took the 6-day Garden Route tour and it was fantastic. Our tour guide, Hendrik, was incredibly knowledgeable, professional and, most importantly, fun. He was always open to stopping for pictures, he would routinely buy us food and drinks so that we can enjoy authentic South African treats and he was constantly providing us with interesting information about the country's history. One thing to note is that much of the trip is weather permitting so, if you had bad weather like we did, you'll be spending a lot of time driving and not so much time doing. Some constructive feedback for Earthstompers in this regard is to consider finding alternative activities that may not be so affected by bad weather, such as wine tasting or various other sheltered attractions - even if these attractions may not be otherwise ideal - so that tour-goers have a bit more to do than just drive around and pout about the rain when the weather is bad. Notwithstanding, Hendrik did a great job of making things lively, wishing away the rain and keeping us entertained and having fun. I would recommend anyone to take this trip if they want to have a great time with great company.

Gardenroute. It was a really nice tour. I´m from Germany and wanted to improve my Englisch. I get a group with six native englisch speaker - they are all realy nice. Nicole, the tour-guide, helped me and sometimes she translate in German. She is a very good tour-guide - i learned a lot about southafrica - we talked about the people, work and live in southafrika, the government, the nature, animals....

Garden Route. Hello,We have just finished a 6 day tour around the garden route. It was a great experience. Our tour guide Stephanie did a great job. As a local she provided us with insights to this beautiful country and looked after the group really well. Special thanks to her game drive at Addo Elephant Park, which was brilliant and the lovely picnic at the waterfall. Very special!The route was well thought out and full of highlights like Hermanus, Tsitsikamma, Addo Elephant Park and Mossel Bay. The group was a small, mixed age group and made us feel very welcome as a middle aged couple. The program is well designed for the more adventurous mind if you want to do shark cage diving or a 216m bungee jump, but you can also opt out and just relax and enjoy the scenery.We have done the tree canopy tour at Tsitsikamma, which is real fun and then I guess the highlight was the sky dive in Mossel Bay. The instructors are fabulous, very knowledgable and also very funny. It is well worth getting the video as it includes heaps of photos as well.We stayed at guest houses along the way, but now having seen the backpackers we could have easily stayed there. Brilliant locations!Earth stompers provide an exceptional service with this very well organized tour. We would like to thank Stephanie for showing us a glimpse of this beautiful country and we will be back for sure.

Unforgettable 6 day garden route trip - thank you Nicole from Earth Stompers!!!. I choose that route and Earthstompers as an organizer, as i was a solo traveller and was looking for a mixed age (younger crowd) to travel with. This trip has by far excelled my expectations, we have travelled in a lovely mixed age group (20 upwards) and i can recommend anyone to utilize Earthstompers.Tour route and accomodationThe entire tour is designed to give you an overview on all major stops along the garden route tour. Each day was fabuluous and the accomodations choosen with knowledge of the nice spots, yet, still within budget e.g. hostels or b&b's You can choose which category you want to be in, the hostels are really with lots of charme and nice. Highlights of the trip were Hermanus, Tsitsikamma, Addo Elephant Park, Mossel Bay with beautiful sceneries, food and activities. Be aware that this trip gives you an insight, ideas on destinations you definitely should go back toOrganization via Earthstompers (tour guide Nicole)Earthstompers gives an exceptional service and feeling to the entire trip. Pick-up is arranged from your location within Capetown and drop-off as well. The tour includes a dedicated driver, in our case Nicole, who, with wit, charm and loving heart will give you all her positive energy and details about this beautiful country. I would like to thank Nicole for this amazing and unforgettable tour, i certainly will come back to South Africa.
6 day Garden Route Tour. great tour, the best guide and very easy way to see the part of most beautiful coast line in the world during one week :)

6 day Garden Route Tour. We chose this tour for its attractions. We felt that if we tried to do this trip ourselves, that we would most likely miss out on something. Nicole did an excellent job of showing us everything that Earthstompers promised and more. My wife and I were dropped at B & B's every night, all of which we highly recommend.

Brilliant Garden Route tour. We chose this tour for the scenic route and interesting places to be visited. We are an older couple and found the backpacker private en-suite accommodation comfortable with good food. The 7 young people in our group were a great bunch and we really enjoyed their company. Nicole was an excellent tour leader and went out of her way to make sure everyone in the group could do the optional activities of their choice. The tour had a good mix of included and optional activities.We would recommend this tour to people of any age who want to see great places without hiring a car and organising their own accommodation.Elaine and Gary, England
Excellent. Very nice crew, amazing activities, very well organized. There is no better way to experience the beauty of the garden route.

Great experience, highly recommend it.. I did this tour with 4 other friends in March 2014 and we had the best time ever! One of us even booked last minute and the team managed to fit her in with no problems. Met a great bunch of people on the tour so that by the end I felt we were saying goodbye to old friends. Steph our guide and driver was an absolute treasure trove of information (Nicole who was with another group also joined us for dinner and drinks and we really enjoyed that too). I found Steph to be very informative and enthusiastic, her pride in her work and her country is evident. The highlight of the tour was the drive in Addo where we saw around 4/5 elephant herds rock up to the watering hole. The accommodation was excellent on each night as was the food. 2 of us were vegetarian and we were catered for at every dinner with a vegetarian version of the dish the meat eaters got. I really appreciated this as it helped me to get a taste of African cuisine (and I loved it). Lunch was a challenge as it wasn't always easy to get a vegetarian sandwich, however bread cheese and a juice were easily available. The optional activities were also a lot of fun and allow for a lot of flexibility. So even if you don't do any there are other things to do that are equally enjoyable. My only regret is that I did not book my Kruger trip with Earthstompers.I would recommend them to everybody, a must do if you want to see South Africa and have some fun at a reasonable price.
Best trip ever !. Nicole you are awesome ! Stay how you are and keep it on. I highly recommend earthstompers ! Just perfect :)

Great trip!. We had a wonderful time on the garden route tour and Addo Elephant park. The van was comfortable and Nicole, our tour guide, was so conscientious and interested in making sure that everything we wanted or needed was available, it was wonderful. She really was our advocate during the trip, looking out for us, and making sure to give us all the good tips that would make the tour the best it could be. We upgraded and did not stay in the backpacker lodges, and all of the B&Bs that we stayed in were BEAUTIFUL and the breakfasts were delicious. The activities were great. The only one that we were somewhat disappointed in was the black-river tubing on the Storm's River which was more rock climbing than we anticipated. The water was very low and therefore we had less time in the water and more climbing over the boulders and the exit into the Indian Ocean was very dangerous because of the incoming tide which was super strong that day. I would not recommend this activity unless the river was higher, and you are prepared for a lot of rowing in your tubes. Again, Nicole was the BEST host we could have asked for....super knowledgeable and very interested in making our trip the best is could be. She even scheduled a massage for me the day after the river trip, which I REALLY needed. It was wonderful!

Fantastic trip!. What an amazing tour!!! Our guide, Nicole, was incredibly knowledgable about EVERYTHING and was more than happy to go the extra mile to ensure we had the best experience possible. As for the actual tour content, it was such great value for money and we packed so much into such a short period of time, I could not fault it in any way. I would definitely recommend Earthstompers as the company of choice to see the incredibly beautiful Garden Route.

Great Price, Great Trip. I'm a college student studying in Cape Town for the semester and wanted a (comparatively) low cost trip for my spring break. The Garden Route seemed perfect and I was inclined to book with Earthstompers because of the great reviews I saw. This tour provided many more activities than other Garden Route trips I came across that are targeted toward college students. I chose to stay in the backpacker dorm accommodations and they were great, some locations went above and beyond what I imagined for a backpacker lodge/hostel. I believe all dinners were included except one, and those were all great meals as well. Allowed me to taste a lot of traditional South African dishes that I may not have had otherwise and they were all delicious. If you have a group that you would want to travel with this would be a great trip for you to book together. It was really a great way to see the Cape. Our guide, Nicole, was also super upbeat, friendly, and knowledgeable. She did an amazing job!All around great trip. I would recommend it to anyone interested in hitting the road to see the southern coast of Africa.
Great Trip. Our tour was phenomenal. Hendrik has a lot of experience which shows in the places he took us to. A memorable experience.

Garden Route - Perfect Week with Earthstompers. Thanks to Hendrik (and the whole group) it was a perfect week at the Garden Route! Every day was special because of the very diverse and adventurous iternarery. It was amazing to do an open game drive through the national park in the early morning hours and to watch the animals in sunset. Beyond that we did a canoeing and hiking tour to an idyllic waterfall for example! Everything was well planned, the driving was excellent and the guesthouses as well as the backpackers were fantastic (the backpackers even more ;) )! As we had regional dinner every day, it was perfect to get to know the fantastic Southafrican food! I would recommend a travel with Earthstompers to everybody!

Excellent Garden Route Tour. The tour was fascinating. Hendrik was an excellent guide with very good knowledge. Every night we had the chance to try different south african meals in stunning locations. The activities were lots of fun, driving was never too long and the whole route was perfectly choosen. Thanks for an amazing time!

Couldn't have enjoyed it more!. This trip was exceptional! When I researched a Garden Route trip I found plenty of others that were a lot more expensive but seemed to offer far less. The Earthstompers tour packs in so much yet it is done in such a well planned way that you are never rushed.Our tour guide was Nicole who was excellent. Nicole was hugely knowledgable, she catered for everyone's needs and added in activities as and when the group asked. She went so far above and beyond what could have been asked of her - one of our fellow traveller's camera battery died so Nicole lent her new camera to them for the duration of the trip, another traveller was yet to organise accommodation for when they got back to Cape Town so Nicole organised it for them, and another traveller wanted a map so Nicole bought one for them. She is an excellent tour guide.The itinerary is fun and packed with beautiful spots and great accommodation. We covered so much ground and saw things that will stay with me forever. This trip is priced extremely low, whatever your budget, regardless of whether you can afford something more, this is still the trip for you if you really want to see the Garden Route and get the most out of it.Thank you Nicole, wish I could do it all again!

Garden Route Earthstompers. We are family aged 22,23 and 60 The tour was great fun We all did sharkcage diving bungy jumping sand dune boarding kayaking and adventure caving and had a great time Stepanie our guide wa s so great and is local so she knew the best places to eat and see and usually had a local story or two She went to no end of trouble to coordinate everybodies activities so a good time was had by all She is quite a connoiseur and took us to a winery where the food and wine was amazing We opted for the chalets which were great esp at Cape Alghas but visited the backpackers for the some of meals and found them to be fun with bars drinking games etc Good for the younger ones I think a small company was good because it gave us flexibility We all want to do it again

A week I will never forget. The Garden route tour is tailored to perfection. It was such a great way to see such a beautiful place, the selection of places we visited were just what I wanted to see for such a reasonable price. Nicole, the tour guide was super sweet and went out of her way to make sure everyone on the tour was having a good time.

Totally worth it!. The tour is very well planned and includes activities for different tastes. The places we visited were stunning and the hostels where we stayed all very nice. Food was excellent throughout the whole trip!

The Best of the Best of the Best!. I feel like I am going to repeat all of these fabulous comments...But I have to because this tour deserves all the praise it can get!This 6-day, 5-night Garden Route tour had a choice between guest houses or backpackers. I was hesitant to choose backpackers, but was pleased that I could pay a bit extra and get a private room with en-suite. Perfect. On top of that, I couldn't believe there was no extra charge for being SINGLE!! No single supplement!! This is a perfect tour if you are traveling solo, as a couple, or a family. It suits all! In our tour there were two single ladies and a family of 4. This is another advantage of Earthstompers, small groups up to a max of 12 or 13. We had 6. Chrissy and Hendrick (owners) of Earthstompers were very quick in responding to emails/questions I had prior to leaving and were genuine in welcoming me on board this tour.This was my second time visiting the Garden Route. I had done it solo two years ago but wanted to see more and go further. This tour touched on a lot of highlights I missed my first time around (or had no idea even existed) and also travelled further to Addo National Elephant Park. I can honestly say I have truly visited the Garden Route thanks to Earthstompers.Pick up was on time (although I made the mistake of giving the wrong pick up hotel address)...and this is where the WoW factor began with our tour guide, Nicole. Nicole made this tour. She was flexible, understanding, knowledgeable, accommodating, and fun. She is engaging and interesting, with a wealth of knowledge and passion about her country. We had great conversations during our drives... and a lot of laughs. We have become friends and I am writing this review for that reason, that's how good it was that I know I have made a lifelong friend with Nicole in the 6 days we spent together.All the backpackers hostels had special features; steps to the beach, practically on the beach, amongst citrus groves, amazing meals, and great hosts.The itinerary was fantastic and so flexible. There was absolutely no pressure to do anything and Nicole gave her honest but objective opinions about all excursions offered and it was up to us to decide what we wanted to do. I just can't say enough about this tour, the company and Nicole. If you are looking for clean, comfortable accommodation with amazing locations, exciting and beautiful excursions and experiences, fun, relaxed, down to earth atmosphere with an enthusiastic and passionate tour guide, AND affordable, then Earthstompers is the tour for you!I promise!!

Very varied tour. The 6 day Garden Route tour was excellent. From the start, Hendrik helped with all my queries, and our guide Steph provided excellent local knowledge and insight as well as being awesome company. The trip is eclectic, with various high adrenaline options on offer, or cultural options too. I did kayaking, tree top ziplining, a museum and elephant feeding as well as the standard activities and tours like Addo elephant park, the Cango caves, ostrich farm and wine tasting.The standard of accommodation was better than any backpackers I have ever stayed in before- the private rooms were more like 3/4* guesthouses. The food was also way above usual backpacker fare - home cooked meals and braii and stews at the various backpackers/guesthouses.So glad I booked this tour. Well done and thanks Earthstompers!

It should be Earthstompers or no one!. Choosing to do the 6 day Garden Route Tour with Earthstompers was probably the best decisions I made throughout my holiday. I have done many organised group tours, some short some long, and this was by far the best. It was brilliantly organised, the accommodation was all comfortable, clean and in superb locations and the transport and logistics were all comfortable and smooth. There's so much to do on the Garden Route and in 6 days we managed to fit the best of the Garden Route.Our tour leader, Nicole, was 2nd to none. She was friendly, knew her stuff and she even took us to some local favourites off the 'beaten track' that most tours would never go to. The group was all around the same age (average mid to late 20s) but anyone young at heart would have loved every second of tour.If you're thinking of doing the Garden Route I highly recommend doing it with Earthstompers. You definitely won't be sorry you did.

Wow - This was fantastic. The 6 days, 5 nights Garden Route from Earthstompers with our guide Nicole is one of the best tours I have done so far in my travel life. All the good things mentioned in the other reviews are true! The way, Hendrik, Chrissy, Nicole and Steph organize those 6 adventurous days is well organized, with great accommodation and a trulely rewarding itenary but with lots of flexibility, too. I was a solo traveller this time and have booked the guesthouse, which is a great option if you want to have a bit more privacy and you are already done in your life with the backpacking/ hostel thing. The guesthouses are amazing, each one is different and the hosts are all very accomodating. The hostels also looked very nice and travellers like me (or couples) could easily book a private room there as well to stay with the group. The food (dinner) was excellent as well!What makes this tour so special however are the people! Nicole is one of the most interesting people I have met with a great passion for her country, an endless patience and a flexibility that is stunning! I am amazed how Nicole "understands" people and makes them happy!Not sure which of the "highlights" to mention as I loved it all but what I will never forget is the feeling when half of the group went bungeejumping and some of us joined the bridge to encourage them and feel the vibe - goose bumps guarantee!!!Thank you Nicole for such a great time and for the surprise from back home! Thank you Hendrik for running such a great tour, that is different to what the others offer just by the way you organize it!

Great tour !. I was on the 5-day Garden Route Tour from November 4 - 8, with Nicole. And I really enjoyed it. So much more than sightseeing but really feeling and experiencing the beauty of the Garden Route. And Nicole is a fantastic guide. Unfortunately I had to leave the group on friday and fly back from PE to Cape Town, as I had to fly back to Belgium on saturday. But whenever I have the chance to come back to South Africa, and enjoy another tour. Earthstompers will be first choice. And I hope I can stay much longer at that time.Thanks, it was great !

Fun tour with lots of variety. I really enjoyed the 6 day Garden Route tour as we were able to see so much in such a short period of time. I liked that the tour had so much variety as each day was very different with new adventure. The tour also offered flexibility so you could select options to tailer the trip to your own personal preference by offering a range of optional activities and different accomodation options. Our guide Stephanie was a lot of fun and we had a great group of people to travel with. Not only was I impressed with the tour itself but we also had a lot of help from Hendrik before we arrived. He not only booked the tour for us but our accomodation and airport transfer prior to the tour and helped book our two week volunteer trip after. I would definetly recommend this trip to anyone who wants to explore the Garden Route. Great job Earthstompers and Thanks for showing us such a great time.

Great time in Garden Route. I did the 6 day Garden Route Tour with Nicole this last October and I had a great time. Nicole was very good at her job and I was lucky to travel with a nice group. Everything was pretty with good accommodations (backpackers option). The places that we visited were fabulous. I really had a great time in Garden Route.

The best company I've traveled with. Last year in November I had the pleasure to travel with earthstompers in South Africa.Everything was perfectly organized from the booking to the tour from Cape Town to Addo National Park and back.I was lucky to travel with some very nice people, our tour guide Nicole was the best I ever had inall the places of the world I had been before.We had great natural adventures in one of the nicest landscapes I've ever been.We stayed in lovely lodges, we had great food.I' m sure to come back soon.Congratulations to Hendrik and his Team Ps. Thank you for helping me too book me Holiday this November.GreetingsKlaus

Out of this world. Amazing tour of the Garden Route. Visited some fabulous places and stayed in some very nice accommodation ( backpackers option). Lucky enough to be with a bunch of really nice people and made some good friends.Hendrik is very good at his job and I would recommend this tour to everyone.You don't know what you're missing out on. Gutted to be back home in England!

Fabulous Garden Route Tour. My husband and I did the 6 day Garden Route Tour with Hendrik & 9 other fun loving travellers. We certainly lucked out with our group dynamics. It was our first group tour in many years and being a mid 50's couple with a majority 30's group wasn't a problem. We have no regrets....just great memories & many new friends worldwide. Hendrik was superb, knowledgeable, funny, patient and nothing was ever too much trouble. We saw & did many more activities then would ever be possible on our own. The tour was well organized and there was something for everyone. We upgraded to the guesthouse option and were thrilled with the high quality & beautiful views from the guesthouses. Every meal was an adventure in South African cuisine and the food was superb from breakfast to braais and everything in between.

Excellent. I did the 5 day Garden Route from CT to PE and it was fabulous. Beautifully organized, the friendliest tour guide, great transport and well thought through destinations and overnight stays. I went with the backpackers option (single room) and it was a much higher standard than I thought it would be. Of course, you have to have a certain element of luck with the strangers you tour with being a personality fit, but I would highly recommend this company. Money definitely well spent.

I could not have asked for more. This trip had it all! If you want to see and do it all along the garden route I'd highly recommend this trip. It took the hassle out of organizing and driving. There was no way I'd be able to plan all of this in the and know how to see all the sights: national parks, canoeing, elephant parks, safiri, whale watching, shark cage diving, bungee if you want to, ostrich farm,caving and more. There are tons of options and something for evryone of every adventure level. The price was very good for all the activities and most days had two meals included- the food was excellent and the accomidation was very nice as well. I preferred the private rooms and was very happy with the lodging and facilities everywhere I went. I met some great people in the tour that I spent time with in cape town after the tour which was great for a solo traveler. The guide/owner Henrick was so pleasant, patient and informative. I loved the tour and would do it again in a heartbeat.

Amazing. Been back for about two months and just wanted to write and say I had a wonderful time on the Garden Route tour. The tour that we went on happened to be very small and honestly felt like we were on a family vacation. Both tour guides made the trip enjoyable and made everyone feel included. Not only that, but Henrick went above and beyond in tracking down my luggage and getting it delivered to where we were staying three days into the trip. The places we stayed at exceeded expectations and were not what I would generally think of when booking hostels. The meals were absolutely wonderful ... I don't think that I have eaten so well on a vacation before. I would say that if you are looking for a tour to book of the Garden Route then this would definitely be the one that you would want to book. Thank you!

A Fantastic Experience. The Garden Route tour by Earthstompers was fantastic. Stephanie was our guide & nothing was too much hassle for her - she is just the nicest person & very knowledgeable. We stayed in the guest house accommodation and could not have been happier - a VERY high standard. Those in the group who stayed at the backpackers were also impressed with their accommodation. There were a couple of long days in the van which could maybe rescheduled somehow, but on the whole we were pleased with the itinerary. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see the Garden Route & have some adventure as well.

Wished it would never end!. Wow... where to begin? South African Airways had a 2-day sale last fall so on a whim I bought tickets and then had only a couple weeks to plan our trip. Somebody had mentioned Earthstompers on one of the SA forums here, and that set our plans in motion! Booking through their website was easy, and we received a confirmation immediately as well as some additoinal forms to fill out and send back to Henrik. The entire registration process was very smooth and we found the prices ot be quite reasonable.We opted to start our tour off with the great white shark diving (awesome, by the way!) so we were picked up from our Cape Town hotel very early in the morning to head to the outfitter. We also picked up 2 other people in Cape Town, who turned out to be on our Earthstompers tour as well. It gave us some extra time to get to know each other and a fun way to begin the adventure! After shark diving, our guide Nicole and the rest of our tour group picked us up at the shark dive place. The only snag was that the little trailer attached to the van didn't quite fit everybody's luggage (many of us were ending our tour in Port Elizabeth, therefore we couldn't leave anything behind in Cape Town). With a little shuffling and shoving, and using some extra space in the van, Nicole was able to get everything in its place and get us on the road - clearly she's done this before!The itinerary was amazing and the places we stayed at were very cool. You have several choices for accommodations; most of us stayed in the hostels but one person chose the guest houses (a little nicer). Don't let the word "hostel" fool you though - some of the places we stayed at felt more like a comfy homestay and the accommodations were far from spartan. Every location was clean, safe, and walking distance to good restaurants and/or scenic views. And the food that some of the hostals provided was incredible!As with anything, what really makes a trip enjoyable are the people. We had an amazing tour group, 11 people (mostly from Europe) ranging from their 20's to a solo traveler in his 60's, and Nicole as our guide. Nicole did a wonderful job driving, narrating, translating, and answering our sometimes strange questions. She is wise beyond her years and also an excellent ambassador for South Africa - we came away from that trip knowing so much more about the country and its people. But most importantly, Nicole was just as much a part of the group as any of us - joining us at meals, making great recommendations on how to spend our free time, and just being an all out awesome person to hang out with. If my husband and I had planned out our own garden route tour, we never would have met such fantastic people nor learned so much aboutt his beautifuland diverse country.Thank you, Earthstompers, for making it such an easy choice for us on how to spend our precious vacation time, and introducing us to people with whom we hope to have a lifetime connection!

Exellent tour. This is the exellent tour I ever had. Everyday got a surprise and above the expectation. The guest house we stayed is so nice and clean. The adventures are very fun. Thanks Hendrik and the owners of the guest house!

Excellent Service!. We were two couples visiting Tanzania and then South Africa. While in Capetown, we decided to tour the Western Cape, and had originally decided to rent a car. Basedon the driving on the left side of the road thing, at the last minute, we decided to seek a tour guide who could take us from place to place. On one day's notice, Earthstompers developed a sight seeing plan for the Garden Route which included stops and lodging on the Indian Ocean and wine country. We were extremely grateful for the quality of their planning and the flexibility shown as we made our way across the country. The best part was our guide, Roelf, who was superb in every respect. He was extremely knowledgeable on a broad range of subjects and was able to do complex planning on the fly in order to maximize our time. Sometimes on travel you meet an individual who is so special that you know : "no one could do this better." Such was the experience we had with Roelf. This phase of our vacation, thanks to Earthsompers, was a tremendous experience, and we are very grateful!

Just do it!. As a solo traveler in her 70s I was somewhat apprehensive about traveling alone.No worry - be happy! Earthstompers came out tops. Nicole was wonderful, herenthusiasm, vigour, knowledge, organisation, her love of her country and it'speople and her hope for it's future were inspirational. Lots of activities but notrushed, great meals and accommodation and being stuck in an "elephant jam" inAddo (traffic jam caused by elephants) were just a few of the highlights. Many thanksto Nicole and Earthstompers. Go on, just do it!

Thank you for the amazing experience.. We are not speaking only about the fantastic landscape or the marvelous places you show us, we are speaking about the entire experience that would be impossible to live without the two fantastic guides Chrissy & Hendrik that provide us an unforgetable vacations. We recomend to everyone to do this trip because it worth every single $€.Once again, Thank you for the amazing experience!!!

Simply the best. Earthstompers is an excellent tour company! I organised and booked my trip all the way from Australia and I did not once have any problems. From the smooth behind the scene admin to the lovely guide there is nothing about this tour that I could really fault. My garden route tour kicked off on the 10th of January with Nicole as our guide and from that day to the very last on tour the fun and excitement never stopped. From beautiful scenery to the down right crazy activities (i.e. bungy jumping), this tour has it all. We opted to stay in Guesthouses on the tour and their location and standards were great; clean, beautifully decorated and quite spacious. Although the tour involves a lot of activities during the day, we didn’t feel rushed to get through anything and even had time in the afternoon and evenings to meet some of the locals and experience the best the towns we were staying in had to offer. Nicole our guide was like a fountain of knowledge and really went out of her way to accommodate any of our needs. If you like meeting new people, like having a little adventure in your life and you’re prepared to be entertained by an absolutely outstanding guide look no further; you have found your tour! I highly recommend this tour to anyone who would like to see the best South Africa has to offer in a limited time frame. I was born and raised in South Africa for 11 years and I never knew as much as I do now, and it’s all thanks to Earthstompers :)

Memories for a Lifetime. Memories for a LifetimeWe spent the most amazing week in South Africa and big part is due to the efforts and the program put together by Earthstompers. The Garden Route is beautiful but with a great group and guide we just loved it!Nicole was amazing and made the whole experience so much special. She was helpful, flexible and always tried to accommodate our requests. She knew the route very well and all the best places to go and even if we were tired there was always a big smile from Nicole.I strongly recommend Earthstompers Garden Group trip and make sure you get Nicole as your guide.

Fantastic Tour. I enjoyed my Earthstompers tour tremedously. Never have I seen so many penguins, whales, elephants and other wildlife in their nature environment, and the scenery was just unbelievable! The tour is very well organized, and very comfortable. The accommondations are very clean, and most have wi-fi access too. Hendrik went extra miles to send me right back to the airport for my departing flight. Thanks Hendrik! The tour is highly highly recommended.

Greatest experience of our lives. We had an awesome tour with Hendrik very well organized. We had lots of fun saw the Garden Route in depth from Cape Town all the way up to Addo Safari Park. Stayed in wonderful guest houses and had delicious meals including the one Henrick cooked us a typical South African braai. Hendrik was a mine of information and had lots of patience with all our questions about the places we were in. Thank you for making our honeymoon so special we will carry those memories always.

Highly recommended, very flexible, amazing guide, good prices!. Hendrik was a great guide and a genuine warm hearted person who knew the answer to every question, he also did so well to accommodate everyone's needs, he is very organised and if you ever needed anything he wouldn't hesitate to help you! Hendrik is also a great help when it comes to asking him advice about other things to do in South Africa, i asked him who he would recommend for a Kruger park tour and he helped me organise that easily.He is also an amazing cook so we always had a great dinner every night! For the prices we paid i would definitely recommend this company, you get your moneys worth and much much more! We stayed in the backpackers accommodation which to be honest was much nicer than the guest houses because they were all situated on the beach, so that was perfect! all the accommodations were clean, the people were extremely friendly and we had a great time!The groups are really small so this makes it much better to get to know people, and more possibility for Hendrik to be flexible with the timings and do whatever you want to do.This tour provides the best of the Garden Route tour and when you finish you will be amazed at how much you manged to cover in just 6 days!The least thing i liked was the fact that i didn't have more time in my travels to do a longer tour! :-)Thanks for an amazing time!!Nand

Enjoying an unforgettable Garden Route and Addo Adventure Tour. Hendrik, the owner of the business, did a great job! He is a dedicated guide, driver and cook. He loves his country, its nature and animals and is more than happy to share all his knowledge withhis guests. He chose nice backpackers, offered selected activities and provided beyond that enough time for hiking and enjoying. The tour offers a great combination of culture, adventure,wildlife and spectacular nature scenes.Very well organised but flexible, small groups and fair prices. We saw the most beautiful places along the Garden Route and on top Addo Elephant Park. This tour was my personal highlight in South Africa. Thank you Hendrik for this marvellous time!Monika

recommended!. I loved the tour and Hendrik did his best to accommodate to everyone' s wishes, eg he dropped me off for a hike while the rest of the goup went skydiving. Accomodation was great and food excellent. Nice bus, small group. The only thing I didn't like is that is one doesn't really have much time sometimes - but I guess thats just the nature of the trip, where you get to see so much in such a short time. I would definitely recommend this to friends.

Perfect kick-off to explore South Africa. I´ve been on the Garden Route Tour end of may and it was the perfect start for exploring South Africa. What I really loved was, that the tour was as “slow or fast paced” as we (me and the other group members) wanted to have it. Another positive point to mention: Groups are really small, so that gives possibility for individuality. There were several optional activities we could add. Hendrik, our guide, put a lot of effort in arranging and getting us on the desired activities. He was great to travel with. You could feel the passion and enthusiasm for his job and showing us “his” southafrica.Accomodation: I chose the backpacker accommodation. I was positively surprised. Locations were great, clean, staff friendly….and all of them do have barbecue facilities. So Hendrik himself made “braai” for us several times…a great experience.I think the tour is perfect if you want to have the comfort of a small and guided tour taking care of individual travellers wishes.I can really recommend the tour to everyone.

Garden Route and Capetown...EARTHSTOMPERS made the difference!. EARTHSTOMPERS!!! We just finished the Garden Route Tour with Earthstompers. Hendrix Human, the owner was willing to work with our family of 6 and adjust the trip according to our wishes. Hendrix was unable to be our guide and provided us with Nicole. Nicole was young, vivacious and more than anything, she was knowledgable. We enjoyed the Garden Tour with Nicole so much that we enlisted her services on our return to Capetown. She entertained us virtually 12 hours a day and because of her flexibility, she made our every wish come true. We stayed in up scaled backpackers, traveled in a Mercedes van and were able to go from a picnic in the park to eating in the finest restaurants with only a phone call by our guide. She even juggled activities, when part of the group wanted to split. She was willing to drop off and pick up each of us at different times and locations. Just as a side note, we found Earthstompers by searching overland tours. We hired them on blind trust and they were honest, reasonable and the service was incredible. Would I recommend EARTHSTOMPERS? ABSOLUTELY!!! (⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Nicole showed us real SA hospitality and I hope one day to do the same for her in the good ol' USA!⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Thanks to Hendrix and Nicole, we have had the vacation of a lifetime. Sandra LandrySeptember 2012

Fantastic!. The itinerary was varied. The accommodations more than adequate. Our guide Maudi was just the best! really- he was just awesome- so patient, so helpful, so much fun, he even cooked for us - we really couldn't have asked for a better guide and companion. Thank you Hendrick for that very organized tour...and of course - Maudi H. - you made all the difference!

Meomories you will never forget!!!. From start to finish this tour was amazing a great way to see the Garden Route. The Guide Hendrick was amazing sharing all his knowledge and love for the Garden Routeand South Africa. You can do as much or as little as you want and caters for those who want full on adventure or those that want a little adventure. The accomodation and activities are well planned and organised to a very high standard.Hendrick spent time getting to know us all and what we wanted from the tour. I have very fond memories of the tour which will stay with me forever. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to explore the Garden route with a friendly, professional well organised company. You will have a fabulous time as I did.Thank you Hendrick!!

Excellent!!!. This tour is very well organised with great activities, lovely accommodation and amazing guide Hendrik who will look after all your needs. Whether with family, friends or on a solo trip, you will be leaving with memories that will stay with you forever. Great way to see and experience the Garden Route!

Fantastic way to see the Garden Route on a budget. I had done this tour with Hendrik in 2008 and came back with such amazing pictures and stories that it inspired my friend from Australia to visit the country and check out the tour. When I booked our tickets, I thought it would be the same kind of trip that I had done previously - boy was I wrong! The tour has been refined and while the"good 'ol favourites" were there, a few new options were also added. There was so much more to do and see on this trip and Hendrik actually joined us on a few of the activities too :) Hendrik was so committed to ensuring that we really enjoyed our trip that he even adjusted the schedule slightly to accommodate changes for two people in our tour AND tried to get us booked in for paragliding (not on the itinerary at all). We didn't end up doing the paragliding because the weather refused to cooperate - no wind one day and then it decided to rain buckets the next day.My friend and I opted to stay at guesthouses but I never dreamed that we'd staying four star guest lodges (that's the highest rating possible). Believe me when I say that the guest house option is well worth the extra payment! The backpacker places were also really fun and we half regretted not choosing the backpacker accommodation (well, until we went back to our rooms and enjoyed the amazing views and extra comforts). Oh and those with specific dietary needs, you can rest easy.
